Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights before a cruise, and really enjoyed it. Our room had a small balcony with two chairs and a small table, overlooking the swimming pool, and we could also see some of the beach and the ocean. We had paid attention to the reviews and asked to be in a room away from the street side. The room was very nice, with everything we expected from a Marriott Resort, with small safe in the closet, comfortable bed, and a small table and two armchairs, as well as a desk. Our room was quiet, the beach was beautiful, and the pool area was clean and well maintained. Lots of shade in the pool area, which we liked, but there were lots of beach chairs available on the beach if we had wanted to sit in the sun. The service we experienced was very good, including housekeeping, everyone we encountered was polite and helpful. We don't gamble, so avoided the casino. It was loud in the lobby during the evening, as other reviews mentioned, but we did not need to do more than walk through to get to the elevator. We had dinner in the hotel the first night and were somewhat disappointed in the food for the price. Breakfast the next morning - the buffet - again was pricey, but it was very good. As other reviews state, the Condado area is safe, and very convenient with several restaurants and shops within comfortable walking distance. The day we checked out, we asked at the bellstand for the best place to shop for wine to take on the ship, and the bellman gave us directions to a small liquor store a couple of blocks away with prices lower than the Walgreen's, which is also a short walk from the hotel. We wanted to tour Old Town San Juan, and the concierge was very helpful in explaining the best way to get to the area, and how to get around without having to take taxis everywhere. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not 4 diamond”
Reviews.Author: Rob P
Reviews.Content: When looking for a hotel in Puerto Rico I found that there were not many recommended hotels to choose from. I didn't plan on getting a rental car, so I was looking for a hotel that was close to several restaurants and a decent exercise facility. This hotel is about a 15 minute ride/$20 cab fare from the airport and is located in what is considered the "tourist" area. Upon arrival the bell hops and other people working the arrival were very attentive and as I found out the hardest working people at the hotel. They kept the cars moving and the entrance organized while cars continually tried to use the small entrance as a parking area. The room was nice, and contained a LCD TV and mini fridge. Several people said that it was safe to drink the water from the tap, but the hotel provides four complimentary bottles of water each day, so I wasn't sure if that was a hint. The bed was standard Marriott comfortable and the bathroom was larger than the typical closet size. The negatives about the room would be the carpet and the door. I don't recommend walking barefoot around the hotel room, since I found out that the bottom of your feet can get quite dirty. When entering the room I found the door to be extremely fussy. I would swipe the key card, hear the door unlock, press the handle down to open the door and the door wouldn't open. It took about 10 times on average to open the door, until I figured out that I had to hold the door handle up, swipe the card and then push the handle to open it. Breakfast is served in the morning starting at 7am, but that time usually doesn't work well for business travelers. I found that the coffee shop had pastries, yogurt, fresh fruit, oatmeal, and other breakfast items readily available. Plan on spending about $8 on a beverage, muffin and fruit. The oatmeal is not a daily offering. It is prepared with vanilla and cinnamon, if those are flavors that you enjoy then you'll find the oatmeal very good. There are a couple of restaurants on site and plenty of restaurants in the area. Across street there is a classic burger and fries restaurant. The Cherry Blossom restaurant is a couple of doors down and serves Japanese/Asian themed food. There is also an Italian themed restaurant on the opposite side of the road across from The Cherry Blossom. I never entered the premises of the casino. Upon room check in the desk clerk will give you a hand full of $5 certificates that you can use to increase your $5 bet by another $5. This wasn't a good enough offer for me to feel like I had to gamble. The hotel has an outdoor pool and play area for kids, however the kids section was closed when I was there. The beach area looked to be well kept and there were plenty of chairs stacked in piles for guests to use. The on site exercise facility was very good and better equipped than a lot of hotels that I have been to. Marriott rates this hotel as a 4 diamond property, most likely due to the services offered. The ranking is probably given based on other hotels in the area and when the hotel opened, but for $200+ a night the property shouldn't be rated that high.

Reviews.Title: “boo terp02 is right on the money with his/her review”
Reviews.Author: nametab1
Reviews.Content: ditto everything booterp02 says-great location, beautiful beach, walk to great venues for dining. very young and fun atmosphere and location-perfect for taking a young adult to vacay with mom or dad. spin classes across the street. go right out of street side of hotel, makes a great jog. No immigration makes it a convenient choice for U.S. vacationers. preset taxi rates for transfers from hotel - excellent idea-know before you go! trip was more expensive than others i have taken to all inclusives but, the no immigration and predominately english speaking crowd make it a certain "return trip" destination. loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location, and best beach.”
Reviews.Author: Saifhaddad
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with great food, great salsa live music on Friday and Saturday nights, and sits on one of the best beaches Puerto Rico has to offer. I stayed at la concha but the beach there is not as nice as this one at all. So this is only place I would stay if in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lebonnot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one nite pre cruise. The check-in and check-out process quick and easy. The casino was ok. Did not eat in any of the restaurants, but plenty of places with in walking distance. We had 2 rooms one with 4 adults and one with 3 adults. The rooms were spacious enough with small refrigerator to get beverages cold, each has a small balcony where we could sit outside and enjoy the evening. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice.......but pricey”
Reviews.Author: BooTerp02
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Marriott. Outstanding hotel, and there is not a better location in all of San Juan to stay. The Condado neighborhood is very unique; charming, upscale, walkable, and loaded with stores and places to eat to meet a variety of budgets. The hotel has a beautiful stretch of beach. The grounds were perfectly manicured, landscaped, and tidy. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast included with the price was excellent. So many hard working employees keep this place shining. Lots of nice perks that came along with the hotel, two concierge desks, rental car desk, beach umbrella and chair station (where they will set it up for you), etc. One drawback is price. Everything is really expensive. Two frozen mixed drinks were $21.00, $25 after tip. Parking was pretty salty as well. Restaurants (breakfast, for example, was $25 if you were not on the plan.....hot dog and fries $13, burger and fries $15) were up there too. Pretty high daily resort fee which, as far as I could tell, covered free wi-fi and that's it. Like others have said, take advantage of the places nearby to eat and get some local P.R. flavor/dishes. Also, go to Walgreens and stock up on drinks and snacks. The prices there were cheaper than they are back in the states. A great stay, would love to go back, and would definitely suggest staying here to anyone looking for a relaxing stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Kids”
Reviews.Author: Susanlynn53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our cruise and the kids had a blast. Water slide, great ocean beach but waves are big, friendly staff. Restaurant pool side where there was a buffett. Very crowded for spring break and the staff did ok. Casino closed for Easter. Room size adequate, they could not accomodate us for turn down service, just said no.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Everything”
Reviews.Author: MsVerde
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Excellent view from my balcony! Excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for a relaxing family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Jon C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 night with our 2 young boys. The hotel has quite a few amenities and was very kid friendly. 2 restaurants, a beach bar and a coffee bar on premises. The pool was great and the water slide made our kids' day. Still plenty of adult activities and a very nice beach. Never went to the casino, but neither my wife or I are interested in gaming. The hotel's location is very central to a lot of things in San Juan and not far from Old San Juan. About a 20 minute drive from the airport. Staff was always friendly, courteous and helpful. A very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for young children”
Reviews.Author: Bluedevil11
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Great children's pool 2) Free toys for use in the pool and the beach 3) Nice staff who are not uptight about bringing your own soda/snacks to pool area 4) Plenty of dining options nearby--highly recommend Jam--they have excellent cerviche and a children's playroom. Monday is 1/2 price food. 2 blocks from hotel 5) Walgreen's nearby for supplies 6) Very good gym with both cardio and very good weights 7) Gym includes a nice shower which you can utilize to clean up on your last day if you have late flight 8) Nice beach chairs and umbrella included Cons: 1) Atlantic ocean part of island not Carribean-- so expect waves comparable to US east coast 2) Overpriced food--$15 hamburger 3) Resort fee plus taxes add $50 a day to a $200 day rate

Reviews.Title: “One night in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Nukemann
Reviews.Content: We spent one night after our cruise at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino, we had a corner duel balcony room on the seventh floor, with an amazing view of the beautiful beach. It was a great way to finish our cruise and prepare to come back to reality. The room was clean and spacious, the bed was extremely comfortable, the staff was polite and helpful. I won $10 in their casino and was able to view my cruise photos on the flat screen tv with the interface they provided from my laptop. It was a fantastic visit!

Reviews.Title: “It was extraordinary how rude the management was.”
Reviews.Author: curlsgirl
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel, the front desk denied the fact that we made a reservation, although we had the conformation papers with us. When they finally saw that we had the reservations, they said due to the trouble they had finding the reservation they can only give us one room, instead of two. We got two eventually, but it cost 30 percent more then the other room. The restaurant was bad, and the waitress made a fuss when we asked for more water. The view of the ocean was good, however the water is so rough that people always drown in them. It is horrible, do not go there.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2012”
Reviews.Author: C G
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was beautiful, especially the Penthouse Concierge Lounge with stunning views of the city and well staffed. Our first day we waited 1 1/2 hrs for our food and we ended up walking out. We received a beautiful cheese tower in our room as an apolgy but we never ate there again. We enjoyed the casino and the Starbucks across the street daily. the fitness center was awesome and my son played basketball on the courts. The pool area is small and families park themselves in the hot tub all day so we never got near it. Good for young kids, not ours. Also very shaded and cold. The beach was beautiful although people were slobs leaving their food and cups on the sand which wasn't cleaned up until days end. The water was beautful and contrary to reviews, very swimable if you're used to rough surf. We body surfed and on days 3-6 the water calmed and we floated around no problem. The area beyond the hotel is in shambles, hit hard by the economy...a bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Will definetely be back”
Reviews.Author: travelingblue
Reviews.Content: Well my wife and I always wanted to go to Puerto Rico. Since I had researched this hotel through their website and tripadvisor, we decided to stay here. Ok, let me start with our arrival. We were arriving from a southern caribbean cruise, so we kinda got to the hotel early. Obviously our room was not available, which is understandable. However, the hotel allowed us to do a pre-check-in. They securely stored our bags, and offered to call me at my cell phone when our room was ready. We then went for a walk inside, and outside the hotel so we could get to know the area. Before I continue to the next topic, I must say that the front desk girl who completed our pre-check-in was ridiculously unpleasant. I don't recall her name, but she was very young looking (like 19), thin, with long black hair. She did not demonstrate any care, or interest, or sympathy. Did not smile, did not say "welcome," and gave me dry responses to my questions. I mean, It was so bad I felt like cancelling my reservation right then and there, and going elsewhere. But of course, I did not want to pay the penalty so I stayed. However, a couple of hours later when our room was ready, we were helped by another girl who was extremely the opposite of the previous. It's incredible how this is possible. I mean, this other girl was the sweetest, most interested, kind, welcoming person I have ever encountered at ANY HOTEL! I Don't remember her name either, but she was about 30, brown hair, and had a great smile. Anyways, we had booked an oceanfront room with a balcony on a high floor. The room was spacious, clean, and we had absolutely no issues with it. It had a small refrigirator, where I kept my Medallas (Puerto Rican Brand Beer). The view from the room was obviously great. You could see the people down below, sunbathing, swimming, and surfing. You could also see the other hotels along the coastline, and of course the great ocean views. The hotel in itself, we though was great. The lobby was just recently re-done. It has a nice bar area right in the center of the lobby. They also have a cafe-bar to the right as you enter, and towards the rear right they have a casino. I had read here before someone saying the casino was small, but I don't know what they were talking about cause it seemed huge to me. The pool area was nicely kept, but in my opinion was somewhat small. The beach area was good, and the hotel has attendants that can offer you a beach chair/umbrella. Even though I stayed here for 4 days, I did not eat or drink at the hotel; therefore, I cannot comment. Down the street from the hotel you have many dining options. And for people who live in the states, there are alot of American Businesses in the area. Just north of the hotel there is a Burger King, and further up a Fuddrockers. Just south you have a Subway, a Wendy's, and also a Walgreens. We found all of this very convenient. All in all, the hotel looks great. You are greeted as you arrive, your bags are taken if you wish, the front lobby door is opened for you. The entrance, and the interior of the hotel looks new, clean, and in great shape. We enjoyed it, and will definetely be back.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FOR FAMILIES AND RIGHT ON THE BEACH!”
Reviews.Author: KGIRL02
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we stayed at this resort. The pros are the great location, right on the beach and also a big pool area, kiddie pool + larger pool with slide was great for my 9 year old. Room was clean and spacious, and the fold out sleeper chair worked great for 1 child. We had a partial Ocean Front, but really you overlook a cement lot and do not get much Ocean feel. So if you want the Ocean View get a full Ocean Room. The Marriott is very expensive for all amenities, snacks, and dining. The conceriege was very helpful and called several places to get us reservations for snorkeling and kayaking for bio luminescence. Also, sent directions and maps to our room to get to the locations. GREAT SERVICE ON THE CONCIERGE DEPT! My main complaint would be the resort fee, you get hardly anything for the large fee, just free Internet, a couple small bottles of water. Other listed 'perks' I would consider standard for a hotel, such as chairs for the pool, coffee maker in room, local phone calls, and music/entertainment at the bar, so very limited. I would say this needs to be upgraded quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “25th Wedding Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: tshuler66
Reviews.Content: From the time we walked into the hotel we felt we made the best decision by cancelling our previous resort in San Juan and changing it to the Marriott. We watched the Tripadvisor reviews constantly and decided that we would feel better about staying at the Marriott. Thank God We Did! We checked in at 10:30am, Monday April 2 and was told by David that he upgraded our room and that our room was ready! I felt we hit the jackpot and we hadn't even went into the casino yet :) Every worker we came in contact with was wonderful always pleasant and asking how our trip was going. Getting beach chairs and umbrellas at the beach was never a problem they have guys set them up for you. Lounge chairs at the pool were plenty but did fill up at the busy times. Food and drinks were expensive however we did walk to Walgreen's to get snacks and drinks to bring back to our mini fridge (which is awesome to have) and the resort gave us 4 comp. water bottles each day. I totally would recommend the Marriott San Juan Resort and Stellaris Casino!

Reviews.Title: “corner room is great”
Reviews.Author: Bob21782
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel whenever I visit the island on business - 5 or 6 times over the past couple of years. I have stayed in all sorts of rooms. One, facing the parking lot was nothing special at all. The rooms facing the ocean are very nice, but I had a corner room that was really exceptional - with a double balcony. Strongly recommended. I did not even pay extra for the corner - they just gave it to me. The location of the hotel is great, right on the beach, nice pool area, pretty good beach bar. You can walk to a few pretty good restaurants in the neighborhood. Walking on the beach is good - with some limitations due to rock outcroppings. The check in is always a bit slow, somewhat disorganized, and not particularly convenient - access to most of the hotel right cuts across the check in line - why?? I have dealt with all sorts of desk staff - from barely average to excellent, but never really unsatisfactory. I stay because of the location on the beach. More attentive staff would raise my rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: suzie h
Reviews.Content: We have been staying for several weeks at the Marriott in Condado, San Juan. The hotel has excellent service particularly exemplified by Emmanuel who works at the reception desk. Emmanuel went out of his way to make sure our stay in San Juan is smooth and enjoyable. We will like to provide him with the kudos that he deserves. This hotel also has an excellent executive lounge with a very competent and gracious staff led by Lani. John and Suzie Hen

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: 357JenniferB
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay here. The rooms were so nice! I have also stayed at the Ritz Carlton San Juan and I think I enjoyed my stay here MUCH better! Not to mention it was much cheaper. The outdoor area was nice. The beach area was nice, a bit crowded, but still enjoyed it. They have waitresses on the beach which is a must!

Reviews.Title: “great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: angnkvn
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week stay at marriott stellaris resort. Great experience! I had an ocean view room overlooking ocean and pool. room size was fine and had a decent sized bathroom also. enjoyed the buffet breakfast daily that was included in the room rate. Pool bar was fun but service there was a bit slow. Drink prices were ridiculous....so we walked just a lil ways down the beach to Atlantic beach resort and got beer for $3.00 and mixed drinks for 3.50. much better than the $7 per beach at the marriott. Enjoyed the lobby bar with the music on the weekend nights. Many restaurants within walking distance. Especially enjoyed Tiajuanas. good mexican food and good margaritas!

Reviews.Title: “San Juan family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, the beach and hotel pool are well maintained and the staff are friendly and accomodating, especially Emily Vallejo.My grandson, age 6, spent at least 10 hours a day playing in the pool and ocean. Jeff Roethe

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good for family with kids.”
Reviews.Author: Houssam10
Reviews.Content: We traveled with a 3 year old. He loved it. Clean spacious rooms Great ocean views Fast, courteous service. Good shallow (2 1/2 feet) pool with fountains, and a slide for kids. Large, clean beach area with chairs and umbrellas. plenty of restaurants/bars outside the hotel. Included breakfast was delicious and had lots of options.

Reviews.Title: “Torn between overall rating”
Reviews.Author: essenceofshe
Reviews.Content: I tussled between average and very good for my overall rating because there was nothing that wowed me about my stay at the San Juan Marriott Resort - in fact there were more things that pushed my stay toward average than very good. Let me explain... CHECK-IN: We arrived early (well before 4:00 PM check-in) on Monday, April 2nd. I was very happy the front desk was able to accomodate us early but not so happy that the front desk clerk seemed a little robotic and a tad bit unfriendly. I'm never expecting cartwheels but actually looking up at me as you're speaking to me and a smile would be nice. ROOM: We get to our room and it's typical full-service Marriott - comfy bed, too soft pillows, typical amenities, the usual. On the upside, the room was airy and clean (except for the hair left behind on the bathroom floor), there was a fridge and the partial ocean view from our "city view" room was a definite plus! HOTEL AREA: If you're visiting Puerto Rico looking for a rich, historical and cultural experience be sure to rent a car and venture far from the Condado area and this San Juan Marriott. This area of San Juan felt more like South Beach Miami to me. It wasn't until I ventured out of the area that I felt like was in Puerto Rico. High-rise condominiums, Starbucks, Walgreens, Fuddruckers, Pizzeria Uno's, Wendy's, Chili's are all within walking distance from the hotel (all of which I can get at home) -which brings me to my review... FOOD: We ate breakfast at La Vista in the hotel and honestly, the best thing about this restaurant was our server Senora Clarimar and perhaps the view (running a distant second). Clarimar was genuinely friendly, she was sweet and extremely helpful with guiding us on what to see in Old San Juan and other parts of Puerto Rico. The ONLY reason we chose to eat there a second time was because of her and the wonderful service she provided. Otherwise, skip it!!! La Vista is drastically overpriced (buffet 24.95 pp) and the food was edible but not great. As we took an early morning walk around the neighborhood one day, we noticed a few local spots serving breakfast for much less. Take the walk and save a bunch! GETTING AROUND: We rented a car which I definitely suggest. I bought my GPS along which I HIGHLY recommend. GPS may not be as reliable in PR since road changes accur so often but it's good to have and a general guide. One morning before heading off to the rainforest (which I'll review seperately) we stopped to ask the concierge for directions. Without looking up, she handed me a pre-printed direction card and sent me on my way. ***SIGH*** HOTEL ACTIVITIES: We didn't spend a great deal of time at the pool so a review wouldn't be fair. I can say that there's an activity board posted daily so check that for what's happening around the pool. Included as "justification" for your hefty 16% resort fee is a one hour two bike rental. Use it! The pre-printed resort fee "justification" card says one bike, two hours but Senora Rita at the activities desk quickly made the correction for us. One note of caution, when biking on the streets in the area BE CAREFUL - drivers in PR are unforgiving! CHECK-OUT: I didn't wait long to check out and was disappointed I had to wait at all. The in-room express check-out wasn't working. I stay at Marriott properties because, for the most part, I know what to expect. Some stays I am wowed and that's because of the people and service. This Marriott did not WOW me and I'm not sure I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “meh.”
Reviews.Author: ckwcraig
Reviews.Content: I travel to the Caribbean at least once per year and usually stay in Iberostar, Hilton, or private brand hotels. This was my first trip to Puerto Rico, went with my bf and 2 kids, ages 5 and 9, and we went Mon-Fri in April. Upon arrival I was glad not to deal with customs but unhappy with the rude lady at the cab stand in the airport- I said San Juan Marriott Resort and Casino. She informed me in a snappy voice there are 4 of those and I better stop wasting her time and tell her which one. (Searched later and there sure aren't 4. There is a Courtyard. That's about it.) She allowed 3 people behind us to proceed before I was able to finish calling the hotel and specify it's located in the Candado region of San Juan. At the hotel, the lobby area is very pretty with a large bar area and lounge. No one was ever really in there, though. We had requested early check in a week prior but it wasn't an option and we had to wait until 4pm. They allow you to store your bags and change in the spa so you can go to the pool right away. Room We reserved a suite with king bed and fold out couch, got two doubles. By the time we were finally in there, I didn't feel like switching. It had a living room with the couch, kitchenette, large bedroom, and 1.5 baths which was nice with four people in the rooms. TV in bedroom worked, TV in living room had a terrible picture on the same channels that worked fine in the bedroom. Didn't use TV much so wasn't too concerned. Two robes and a hairdryer were nice to have. Toiletries were nice and plentiful. Bed had a cushioned topper but was pretty firm. Pillows were fantastic. Excellent hangers. Turn down with mini Hershey bars never actually was a turn down of the sheets whether we were in the room or not, just a drop off of the candy. Not sure why. Sometimes we got 3 candies, sometimes 10. Room was clean-ish. Major surfaces clean but attention not paid often to light fixtures and mirror. That may be because of their cleaning tools, though. I requested to have the long mirror cleaned because it was filthy and not useful. After cleaning it wasn't much better- very streaky and hazy. Two balconies, also nice to have. The one door wouldn't lock, though. Apparently people with ocean front rooms and Marriott priority customers get access to a penthouse club room. That was worth it according to a few guests because it included a continental breakfast and nightly appetizers. Our rate included full breakfast buffet so we didn't worry about it. Latest we could get checkout was noon so same drill as check in for bags and changing area. Pool The pool is on two levels and is small and crowded. The water slide is only open 11a-4p most days and you can count on the staff to arrive a few minutes late and close up a few minutes early. The one guy couldn't be bothered to take out his headphones and let the kids do whatever they want, others enforced rules like not going headfirst, etc.. Water was fairly warm and pool was clean. Deck chairs were plentiful Mon-Th. By Friday they were tough to get and staff explained that people check in Fri-Sat before departing for cruises on Sun-Mon. Beach The beach is white sand and clear blue water. The kids could swim in there Mon-Wed, by Thur the waves got big and it wasn't ok for little kids without help. The attendants will get you set up with chairs and umbrellas. You can walk a short way up and down the beach. No shells. Lots of trash and seaweed washes up that they endeavor to clean up quickly each morning. Restaurants * Breakfast Buffet had typical breakfast items but didn't change at all from day to day. Would be nice if they had one different thing each day. Scrambled eggs were REALLY wet. Omelettes were the best bet. Breakfast waiters are great and friendly, especially Sonny and one guy who does magic tricks for the kids. I knew I had breakfast included but didn't assume the tip was included. However, when I got my bill no tips showed up all week so I don't know if they got an automatic gratuity or what. Seems like that wouldn't inspire staff to go out of their way for you so I don't understand that policy but I guess I saved money. If you bought buffet without it being included it was about $24.95 per adult. I would not have been happy to pay that amount so go a la carte if yours isn't included. * Lunch Lunch is the absolute worst. The first day we waited so long for service and then so long for food (without complaining) that the Food & Beverage Director noticed while dining near us and comped our meal. Too bad he wasn't around later in the week because it happened every time. The only lunch restaurant during the week is the bar area and the menu is full of greasy American style sandwiches and fries, and very limited. Would've preferred local cuisine. There is a coffee shop to go counter in the lobby you could use up til 3p for wraps and salads, too, but if you are in a swimsuit it's not easy to take 2 kids all the way to the very cold (Air conditioned) lobby for lunch. As a vegetarian I don't have many choices usually and here they were very limited at lunch. The veggie sandwich at the bar restaurant is absolutely terrible. Mushy gray eggplant on one side, piece of red bell pepper on the other side. Each piece of veggie was covered in mozzarella, I believe, on a bun that had the texture of cotton. The salads were ok but not filling and there wasn't an option for rice and beans, for instance. There are many restaurants off property within a minute or two walking distance but with kids in the pool/beach, that isn't the easiest option. We tried to move to the Wyndham Rio Mar the 2nd day of our trip but it was sold out (they have nine restaurants and we were dreading a week of that lunch.) Costs about $15 per person for lunch. * Dinner Italian restaurant is closed Monday, Puerto Rican restaurant is closed Tuesday. Both have very good food for the most part. For kids you are limited to pizza and pasta and chicken fingers, mostly. They have mac and cheese but it comes in a bowl with a spoon and looks like soup. No kidding. Chef is really friendly and you can tell he cares about his job and his customers. Humberto in the Italian restaurant is an outstanding waiter. Staff at these restaurants is most friendly and most expert in resort. Costs about $25-50 pp for dinner plus alcohol. * Bar Don't get the pina colada, so chalky. Very expensive drinks at $11 + tip a pop and $8 for non alcoholic smoothies for the kids. Cocktail waitresses are really great and will come down the beach to get your order. Pool service not as consistent, some days you would see a waiter come by and other days not at all. I didn't use the lobby bar. Spa & Gym Didn't have the chance to use spa other than to change and shower. Awkward shower because there are no towel hooks and the bar is too close to the door to get the towel over it. Can't put towel over door because it goes to the ceiling. Fitness center had plenty of machines and free weights and cardio and a punching bag. Nothing fancy. Activities The kids did a couple things like hula hoop contest, cookie decorating, scavenger hunt. I think they could do a lot more with this. No kids center or activities (tennis, crafts, snorkeling, etc..) so kids get a little bored, especially when the slide is closed. The Activity Center has books, board games, some beach toys when available, and towels. They ran out of towels one day, which was a little inconvenient. Overall Not as clean as Iberostar. Lots of families with kids. Staff had some standout employees but most of them don't seem that happy about their jobs. You can tip well or not, no one seemed to care. I find the staff in Jamaican and Mexican resorts to seem a lot happier to have you there spending money. Ground floor almost every day, all day, had a housekeeping cart parked outside the restrooms for no apparent reason (no attendant nearby). Elevators are bizarre. You can get on at the lobby level with the light lit going down, get in and press ground level to go to the beach, and all of a sudden you go up 20 floors to the penthouse before it will go down. They stop on many floors where no one is waiting, too. Many people expressed confusion or frustration w/elevators during our stay. I didn't use the casino but did get a letter that all island casinos were closed from Thurs midnight to Sat noon, presumably for Good Friday (though it didn't seem to be closing on Easter Sunday?) Also I didn't think about it when booking but we had planned to sight see Friday and then couldn't since so many things were closed on Good Friday. Not the hotel's fault, just noting for anyone planning a Spring Break trip in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Worldlyknowledge4you
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful, beyond their paid call of duty (would tell me honest accounts of tours, food, and more). Besides that,the hotel room was awesome (if you save up, get the corner room with the ocean view double balcony). It is a great location! The Ritz may have a nicer beach but not by much at all. This place has a great neighborhood around it (shopping and restaurants and its amazing beach) and its closer to Old San Juan. Would stay here again. No arm twisting involved.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort we have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Melanie C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 4 nights march 28th thru April 1st. It was an amazing experience. Beautiful room with an ocean view,complimentary breakfast buffet(thru cheap caribbean package deal). The front desk staff was top notch, especially Santos Sanchez and Janine Capdevilla. Super friendly and helpful, they held onto our bags and gave access to spa utilities after we checked out so we could enjoy our last day. The concierge, Carlos, was very helpful in telling us where to go and things to do. The bar area was very fun w bands or djs every night. We had the best time! We recommend to anyone traveling to Puerto Rico to stay at this Marriott!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent location”
Reviews.Author: essenundtrinken_22
Reviews.Content: Noisy lobby due to Casino and loud music, lobby new, pool large, beach dirty (cigarette butts), good towel service, musty smell in rooms, rooms clean, bathrooms clean. 2 Margaritas on pool 25$.

Reviews.Title: “Please have a staff member pick up the trash on the beach daily.”
Reviews.Author: SharonHerrera
Reviews.Content: We had a really lovely time. Please do have your staff pick up the garbage on the beach that drifts in, there was a lot of it. If they could do that it would be great and environmentally sensitive. It would be nice to walk a clean beach and having a staff person clean it daily would be great. The hotel grounds were very pretty though.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to not like about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LJH17
Reviews.Content: I have found that everyone is wonderful and helpful. The room is great, we have a corner large room with 2 balconies and you can lie in bed and have an awesome view up the coast at the ocean! Our rate included the all American breakfast that is more food then you can eat. The maid staff is so wonderful the room is cleaned in a very good time frame and they not just clean around your stuff but also straighten everything up and at night they come back to leave chocolates and refresh. As far as the beach and the pool go we had no problem with getting chairs and the shade on the pool in the afternoon is a nice break from the all day beach sun. The gym is very nice also with a nice amount of equipment and very clean with a sauna and great shower area. This is also a nice area to stay in, you can walk to ocean park via the beach, there are plenty of restaurants in walking distance and old San juan is only a cab ride away. Can would stay here again when I come to San Juan again. My only advise is to buy your beer, wine and mixers else where as they sell it everywhere including the Walgreens as the drinks are stupid expensive at the bar and pool bar, just bring a stay cold cup and a small fold up cooler it will save you a lot of money!!!

Reviews.Title: “My second visit was as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: captainmcd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year booking by priceline bid. We enjoyed our stay because we were upgraded to the "bungalos", which is a side building behind their garage. All rooms have a balcony with a view of the ocean over a beautiful pool area. The place is busy, but the staff is friendly. The restaurants are expensive, but there are many places to eat within a block or two of the hotel. There was a business center downstairs near the balroom that has a friendly staff and you can use their computers and printers, and the "free" wi-fi was fast and included in the "resort fee" added to all hotel bills in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect get away!”
Reviews.Author: panzees
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned yesterday from a 6 night stay at this resort. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. If we had one slight critique, it would be for more staffing at the front desk. Our room was beautiful, housekeeping services excellent. We had a package that included breakfast. In a resort that seems to so graciously serve twenty somethings as well as young families like ours, I was still so impressed with the restaurant service. Our children are young, aged 2 and 6, so they can be needy. We were seated with Sonny as our server on the first or second morning and then asked for him each morning there after. He somehow seemed to remember the silly things that let us enjoy our breakfast, yet get started with the fun in our day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly locals”
Reviews.Author: davestat
Reviews.Content: We decided to add on a stay in San Juan to our main holiday - what a fantastic place to stay. We had read the guide book, but found PR a great mix of Spanish, Latin and American cultures - everyone went out of their way to be so friendly and helpful. We didn't have the best of weather but at least the rain was warm ! The beach isn't suitable if you want to go swimming but there is always the pool for that. PR isn't a cheap place to stay or do anything in, but there is plenty on offer. My tip is that the guide books aren't always the No 1 source of where to eat out - pick up the in room phone directory and search out names you know as well as listening to the suggestions of others. The hotel food was pretty good for the price, especially on buffet night with free wine vouchers on the Saturday night. Go out of the hotel and turn left for the better restuarants. Free water in the rooms and a free to use fridge - drinks are pricey at the hotel. Great Lounge at the front of the hotel. Red Coral Lounge. Check in is pretty much a real push to get into your room before 4.00 pm. Be prepared to wait - we had to wait for over 5 hours as our connecting flight time was brought forward. But free Champagne on offer to bide you over. Because PR is a hot country - they sell SPF 110 sun tan cream, pretty much all shops, restaurants and bars have heat films on their windows so until it gets dark and you can see into them, your initial impression might be that some places look a little seedy but nighttime gives you a proper view. Taxis are abundant for trips to old San Juan - great shopping, monuments, sites, etc. Best bars and restaurants are nearer to the cruise terminal. Best bit of all being a Brit, was that we hardly heard any other Brit accents all week - in some way, a real shame as SJ is a hidden secret. Hopefully if more Brits visit, then BA Will fly to SJ more frequently,

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dr__dawggy
Reviews.Content: We spent three days pre-cruise here in Feb. 2012 using Marriott Points. Overall, a very good choice. The hotel lobby is beautiful, the sandy beach behind the hotel is wonderful, the manicured and landscaped grounds around the pool were fabulous, the room and bath were comfortably sized and recently renovated with traditional furniture, and out the front door Condado offers a plethora of restaurant options within easy walking distance. There was a short line at check in but our wait was no longer than 10 minutes. Express check out was even more painless, with our bill placed under our door. Staff were uniformly pleasant and helpful with tips for restaurants, assistance with arranging a cab to the dock for our cruise, and with suggestions from the in-house restaurant menu. We ordered soup and a sandwich one evening from room service and our food arrived promptly and the soup was piping hot. One minor gripe. As is common at Marriott, Hilton and the like, wifi connections were expensive. But as free wifi was available in the spacious and comfortable lobby, this did not pose a major problem. Overall, we were very happy with our points stay and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: ninglot
Reviews.Content: Where to begin...? Located in the heart of Condado with easy walking distance of numerous delicious restaurants (I can gladly recommend some). Some nice little shops too. One day we even walked to Escumbron beach--didn't take too long and was a very pleasant walk. Can't really speak for the nightlife, as that was not an intention for our trip, but I can say that when we arrived at the hotel around 11:30pm on a Friday night, there was plenty of action going on in the lobby. As for breakfast, we found that grabbing a small pastry or bagel or such from the Coffee Merchant in the lobby was perfect for starting our day. Yes, the beach here isn't ideal for swimming, but the beach itself is very nice, and you can take a nice stroll all the way past La Concha. The pool area is wonderful as well. Plenty of shady spots if that's what you want. The pool never seemed overly crowded, and there wasn't ever trouble finding chairs. Nice poolside bar/grill too. Staff was always pleasant and helpful. My only issue was that one day housekeeping left us a note saying they would come to clean our room at 9am because we had put up our "Do Not Disturb" sign two days in a row. Anyways, I highly recommend you check out the Tour Desk. We always went when Rosanne was there, and she's such a sweetie. She helped us book a tour of Old San Juan, ziplining in La Marquesa Forest, and a trail walk in El Yunque. We loved them all! Very convenient--a van picks you up in the morning and it's all fun from there! Our guides were all nice and charismatic as well. It was wonderful to do an activity in the morning and lounge around the pool/beach in the afternoon (then walk to one of the many excellent dinner choices!). Our room itself was lovely. We had partial ocean view, so we could see the ocean and the pool which was a nice touch without having to pay more for the oceanfront view. The beds were super comfortable (one thing I find very consistent with Marriotts!). Bathroom stocked with all the essentials. We even got 4 complimentary water bottles a day, which was great. There's also a mini-fridge that we used quite a bit. The TV had more channels that I've seen at many other hotels (for that spare moment when you're not out enjoying San Juan or the pool!). So really, all factors considered, I think the Marriott was the best place we could have stayed in San Juan and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisCookie
Reviews.Content: We stay here for three days before our cruise. We were excited to be back at this hotel but to our surprise we were very disappointed. The grounds were not like they were when we stayed here before. The food quality wasn't superb like before. The room we stayed in on the 5th floor, ocean front had many red ants that bit us up. It was horrible. We complained about this situation and the management didn't even care. What happened to this wonderful place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: teddybee1
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel for three days after our cruise. The rooms are nice as is the grounds. Check in was quick and painless, and we even got an early check in, which was very nice. The grounds and hotel are clean and well maintained, although the hotel is starting to show it's age. Our room, an ocean front/view, was clean, with the bedding and linen comfortable, and the amenities well stock (free bottle water, lotions, soaps). The only compliant about the room is the bathroom size (I though I was still on the cruise ship due to its smallness). However, the balcony and the view made up for the bathroom short fall. The hotel is also in a great location, with the casino directly attached to the resort. The staff are friendly too. However, the pools need to be warmer. The only negative issue is the beach and immediate area - it could be clean (or people could be less of slops and pick up their trash). Overall, this is a nice hotel and a good value for price (note: nothing is cheap in Puerto Rico). We would recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Donna F
Reviews.Content: Wow, it couldn't have been a better vacation. This property is perfectly located on Condado beach within walking distance to many great local eateries and boutiques. The beach and hotel pools are steps away from each other and the scenery is incredible. The hotel was impeccable and the staff went out of there way to make sure all our needs were attended to. Jason, one of the beach staff employees went out his way each day to make sure our chairs and umbrellas were ready and waiting for our arrival. Umberto, one of the wait staff in the italian eatery, Tuscany was superb tending our every wish. Jose another member of the wait staff made sure our breakfast each morning was perfect. As you can see we were quite pleased with our accommodations and the staff. We will be going back here again and again. You won't be disappointed, this is a great place to relax and enjoy while being pampered by friendly and very attentive staff!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: amandaurbaneck
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I are getting married this weekend and were planning on staying here for our honeymoon. BIG MISTAKE! I booked the reservation over the phone mid January. During the phone conversation with the representative I mention multiple times that we would be coming for our honeymoon and how excited we were and also that we would need only one bed, a king size bed. (Obviously.) About two weeks ago, I just had a feeling to look at our confirmation email to make sure times and dates were correct. All of that info was infact correct, but on the side bar of the confirmation email I notices a statement that said: "No king size beds are offered at this property." To say I was livid is an undertatement. Why would he not mention that to us? As much money as this room was going to cost (around $2000.00 for the week) I would expect that to be told to me in the conversation at some point. I was so excited to stay at the property, so I decided to call the Marriott's 1-800 number to see if anything could be done. I called and was promptly connected with a rep. She fumbled around and told me in fact there were no king size bed available. I asked her what I could do from that point to help ensure that we could get one since it was never mentioned to us that it wouldn't be available from the get go. To sum it up she basically said "If you'd like I can cancel your reservation and you could find another hotel that could accomidate you." WERE TWO WEEKS OUT FROM OUR HONEYMOON. I declined in fear that we wouldnt be able to find somewhere else. (Oh so naive!) So, at that point I hung up with that rep and called back and asked for a supervisor. The supervisor made me feel so stupid. She told me that it was clearly stated in the confirmation email that there would be no king available. At that point, I was about in tears and explained to her about mentioning to the original rep that we booked with that it was our honeymoon multiple times. She then proceeded to tell me "In that case, it is half your fault and half his fault. His for not mentioning it and yours for not reading." Needless to say we have canceled but I have to tell you this has left such an awful taste in my mouth. I really worried that if there was to be a bigger issue during our stay this would be the same treatment we would recieve. I will take responsibility that I didnt read the confirmation email, but I am just sick to my stomach at the lack of compassion we have recieved from their main office. A couple of days after canceling the confirmation online I got an email from the actual hotel's secretary apologizing for the misunderstanding and saying she was sorry that we chose to cancel. That really was a nice gesture from her, but a little too late.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot was great”
Reviews.Author: Mottamopsie_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Marriot. Everyone was extremely polite and friendly, friom the door man to the housekeepers. The lobby is beautiful and "hopping", especially in the evening. The room was clean and we had a great view of the pools and the ocean. The pools were a little cold, since it was very windy at times, but the beach was beautiful and the ocean water was warm. The breakfast buffet was awesome....the best waffles!! Nice touch to have robes in the room as well as 2 bottles of water daily. Starbucks is directly across the street as well as a Walgreens down the block. The casino was fun and had a variety of slots and table games. The little Chinese restaurant in the casino is a hidden gem..great food at a reasonable price. We would definitely return..

Reviews.Title: “marriott in condado”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte347
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Perfect beach. $$ drinks/food on site. Breakfast included was way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel and the location, but I was extremely disappointed when I returned to find out they wouldn't give me credit for my Marriott rewards because it was booked through Expedia. At the prices they charged you think they would treat their rewards members to their points. Airlines give frequent flyer miles when booked through a 3rd party. No reason to stay at Marriott anymore.

Reviews.Title: “nice getaway spot in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: dlmmm5
Reviews.Content: we spent a few days getting away from the hussle of work. we picked this marriott because of the reviews and the location of this hotel. cab fare from the airport was 18.50 one way. we experience a great room and has great service from the door man to the front desk to the maid service. both the tuscany restaurant and their La vista restaurant both offered good food. Tuscany was more expensive but still affordable. we paid 72.00 for two meals.... the casino was small but served the purpose.. nice hotel if you like being in or near town and close to old san juan.

Reviews.Title: “great getaway”
Reviews.Author: tmini2010
Reviews.Content: We went for a long weekend with our 2 teenagers to attend a nearby wedding. The beach was fantastic and easy..not reserving chairs and fighting for umbrellas. The beach staff arranged chairs and shade for us no matter what time we arrived. The resort is nearby to all of the restaurants in Condado so there is plenty to do. Our room was clean and comfortable...no complaints about our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought I paid for!”
Reviews.Author: Natosha M
Reviews.Content: So we decided to hold a destination wedding and selected this Marriott resort because of Marriott's superb reputation. All of the details were taken care of via email and contracts were signed in the same way. I am an extremely, extremely detailed oriented person so I thought I was clear and descriptive in exactly what I wanted and I paid accordingly. The whole idea was for them to take what I wanted and make it happen, after all thats what I paid them for. So we get there and had trouble with the room as we tried to check-in. No discount on the room either. Strike one! Then, we make it all the way to the wedding day with high expectations of what should happen. The ceremony was beautiful and they nailed it. Each and every detail we discussed was present at our seaside beach ceremony. Then we get to the reception. First, we were supposed to have a bar, it was a table set up in the corner. I can let that go. Our signature drink was the mojito. They served the drinks to us in plastic cups!! Strike two! It was a wedding reception and not a bbq. I was fuming and trying not to get upset but thats not what I paid for. Then, we had heavy appetizers for our wedding. Heavy enough to where we needed plates but there were none!! The butler kept handing out napkins as if it would hold the food. We had roughly 30 guests seated at one long table and the butler was walking around to each person and serving them. It took him nearly 20 minutes to make it around the table for each type of appetizer and we had 5 choices! So finally my mom spoke up and requested plates so that we could serve ourselves, which would have been much more efficient. The event planner at the Marriott told her no, essentially, because thats not what I asked for. Strike three!! After going back and forth, which is a discussion I should not have had on my wedding day, they brought the plates for the cold food. Not happy at all. I am very very disappointed in the Marriott and I don't plan to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Going Back”
Reviews.Author: jajburg
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon stayed at the Conrad Hilton..laptop stolen and no compensation - service stunk..anyway..went to the Marriott for our engagement. Top notch..that in fact..we left the Hilton to visit the Marriott because of their excellent service and attention to those on their property. We have booked to go back for 7 days!! Can't wait to see Rita, Richard, etc. They treated us like family. Stellaris Marriott Rocks!! The music at the casino is awesome!! Had to leave my boyfriend in the room to PARTY!! LOL!! Be careful of the sun..We are hispanics from NYC and he got a terrible sunburn!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Allen H
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and spacious and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: notyohit
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a pretty standard "Western Hotel Chain" 4 star. Everything was good, so I'll just mention the problems/suggestions. When my girlfriend and I arrived Tuesday night at 7pm our room wasn't ready, so in response they offered us "free drinks at the bar while we wait", so we thought that was appropriate given check-in is 4pm. Finally at 8:30pm, our room was ready. Our room had a partial Ocean view, facing east 15th floor. The balcony view was great but the problem was that the bathroom was sooo small! I mean I have stayed at hotels with closets bigger than that! We learned to live with it though. The room itself was small too - I have stayed at hotels with bathrooms larger than that room, lol. We booked a deal for $150/night while the published rate was $300/night. I'd be pretty pissed if I'd have paid that for the room that we had. The other problem was with housekeeping. We stayed 9 nights, and they didn't change our sheets the entire time! I knew this because the first night my girlfriend's makeup smudged on the sheets and it was still there when we checked out. We only ate at the beach bar and the food was pretty good, maybe a little overpriced, but not by much. In the end, we found that it was actually a great hotel for just relaxing by the beach all day, which caused us to simply forgive the hotel for its obvious issues.

Reviews.Title: “The Best hotel I have ever has the pleasure of staying in!!”
Reviews.Author: joshua m
Reviews.Content: I do not say that lightly!! I have never thought about writing a review for a hotel previous to this one. My family and i had just left a cruise, and decided to stay a few days extra. The staff in a word...AMAZING!!! The hotel Is a very nice hotel, great amenities, great pool, great beach access on Atlantic side. Close to Old San Juan and restaraunts. Cool bar in hotel with awesome Mojito's. While playing in the pool one evening my daughter scraped her knee, the hotel staff patched her up, and with in 15 minutes there was a knock at the door . The staff sent milk and cookies for my girls on a fancy(princess like) silver tray with a note from the manager!!! im here to tell you, next time i might just skip the cruise and go to this hotel( cruise is another story) i can't say enough about this hotel. I did forget to mention the room up grade because it was the first to be cleaned and ready for us!!! AWESOME HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good service”
Reviews.Author: Bubbaj44
Reviews.Content: This trip was for business and I am a platinum elite with Marriott. However, the status didn't matter. I could not check into my room until after 4 PM which created a situation considering I had business meetings in the afternoon and needed to freshen up. The front desk was jammed with spring breakers/vacationers and very difficult to have the typical quick Marriott service. By the time I did get a room. it was not have the type of room I reserved. My guess is that since they were probably fully booked, I got the first room available, which was not my usual request at this hotel. I am not trying to be a snob, but with all of the business travel, the small comforts add up. I have stayed here many, many times in the past, but I would have to say, their customer service was not up to par this time! Otherwise, this is a great hotel in a good location with a lot of good restaurants in the area off property. Great for a long weekend if you can get away.

Reviews.Title: “An auspicious end”
Reviews.Author: davidrothnc
Reviews.Content: Several phone calls to the hotel advising them of our 30th anniversary was intended, as I specifically requested, to simply obtain for us a worthy ocean front room. When checking in I asked about the location and quality of the room and the clerk indicated that the room was lovely but on the small size. I happily upgraded to a corner room on a high floor which was not yet ready at 2 PM which was fine for us, being told the room would be ready for check-in at the regular 4 PM time. At 4:30 PM I went to the front desk and was told the room was not yet ready. Having spent the 2 1/2 hours in our clothes by the pool, I half jokingly said that maybe my cooperation is worth a 1/2 bottle of champagne so my wife and I could begin our celebration. The clerk said, "It shouldn't be a problem", except when she returned she told me that whoever was in the back didn't feel compelled to offer this to us because, "you said you would wait". I indicated that even if that were so, the room is now past due according to their own timeline and that although I might have been reaching requesting a little 'perk', now I was peaked at the response by whoever in the backroom was in charge and turning me away. I said, "Do you mean to tell me you don't have the ability to comp me two drinks at the bar?" She said, "I think I can make that happen" This time the clerk returned embarrassed, handing me one complimentary drink card. I was really taken back. But it was the start of our vacation and my wife was still waiting pool side, so to the beach bar I went to order a drink. The drink was made and delivered, but when I handed him the drink card the bartender indicated that the card was only good for a "Rum Punch Drink". I now was startled and started going to my wallet when he waved me off for the shared embarrassment we felt. Finally, (within twenty minutes of my visit to the front desk) our room was ready and we received a call asking us to come to the front desk. We went to our room which was quite nice, a bit dated in the fashion that many beach resort facilities get, yet still clean and airy and oversize with two doors to small balconies. We waited for the luggage which didn't arrive within 1/2 hour and needed to call the front desk again. The next morning I requested to speak with the hotel manager and spoke with the assistant manager Olga. I, in great detail, went through the prior days mishaps and saw how visibly appalled she was at the hotel's performance. I did not detect the slightest bit of pandering or insincerity. Indeed, following that chat the vacation kind of fell into place. Olga was first class, a level or two above the overall hotel impression but nonetheless a true professional who made sure our time at the hotel was first rate. She graciously extended herself and provided to us some expressions of her appreciation for staying at the hotel. It is directly because of her efforts that our eight day stay was a complete delight. Many of the previous reviewers comments are accurate. The lobby is simply blaring...loud is inadequate to describe the experience in walking into the hotel...it is a noise bomb. And the music is akin to an after hours twenty something darkly lit dance club having no association with its being in San Juan where some of the finest salsa and Latin music is available. The room was a little musty but seemed to air out. The buffet in the morning is nothing special for its being a four star hotel, but after learning the ropes we discovered you could order freshly made omelets and pancakes which all were included in the additional price we paid for breakfast. Our waitress, Dianna, was also a gem. For Dianna, no request was too great. She had a vibrancy, intelligence and desire to serve that each morning we looked forward too. At the front desk, kudos to Raysa who was patient and determined to find us the right room. Another call out to Eric at the Concierge desk who simply enjoyed and relished in talking about his island and gave detailed directions by auto on the day we chose to go exploring. And, again, every hotel should have someone like Olga who knew how to listen and more importantly knew how to act. The hotel, located in the Condado is in the right location. The Condado is where you want to be. You can go to a 'higher class' of hotel in San Juan proper, like the El San Juan, and be no place. Going outside the resort of the downtown hotels leaves you on highway and by streets that are creepy and not where you want to be. The Candado, and in particular right by the SJM, has within its proximity terrific restaurants, bars, and opportunities for music and dancing. Puerto Peru is a small restaurant that is not particularly distinguishable by its appearance but has absolutely delicious ceviches, bright and fresh with just the right amount of kick. Bar Gitaeno is a lively haunt where locals and tourists mix to have great drinks, terrific tapas and on Thursdays and Sundays incredible music and dance including Flamenco on Sundays. We were privileged to see a great dancer/teacher, a young women of such passion, technique and power that she brought the house to its feet. A great experience. Yerba Buena is a more authentic restaurant with quite good food but the real attraction is the Latin Big Band every Monday night. Here too, this was no amateur group. These are musicians of the top order who play tightly and improvise with the best. The arrangements and selection of numbers ran from romantic and sultry to full out, complex and lush Latin rhythms. In summary, San Juan Marriott is not all that you may want in a hotel, still when it faltered management was more than willing to fess up to recompense; and, staff was always pleasant, knowledgeable and accommodating. What I thought would be a disaster turned into a very delightful, fun and rewarding anniversary. That ability to turn a situation around is notable and to be acknowledged.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought”
Reviews.Author: L0ri55
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this resort. From 3/14/12 It was nice and the people were very nice. Like in other reviews the bell steward opened the door. They took care of all our needs. Everything you would think a hotel should do. The rooms were costly and have a resort fee. The resort is for the beach I guess. The first thing that struck me was the cost of food there. Hotel is very old and smells a lot. Very musty and mold smelling. We had breakfast at the hotel one morning and never ate there again. Cost was $15 and up for the worst breakfast I have ever had. Best thing to eat at the hotel was the coffee bar. We gave the hotel food one last shot. Had a lunch thing. I had 4 coconut shrimp and my husband had a wrap. Both came with fries. About $16 and up. We couldn't even eat it. They need a new chef. We went to relax and there was a ton of kids in there very small hot tub. There was always up to10 people in it. Wind was blowing a bit and the water from the shell waterfall blew water in our eyes. Between kids and the blowing water the hot tub wasn't much fun. I have stayed at many Marriott's and I would say this is one I didn't like. I guess I should look at it as being San Juan. I think if that is the best they can do then it shouldn't cost like you were staying in a high cost Beverly hill hotel. Oh one more thing. Our room dripped water all night. ;(

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff!”
Reviews.Author: jabjcb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to our cruise out of San Juan. As soon as we got out of the taxi it was great! We were greeted with a glass of champagne. Checked into the hotel and even took the upgrade to the ocean view room which was WELL worth the extra $50. The rooms were very nice and beds were comfy. The town around the hotel was very safe and again everyone was so nice! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino-March 2-3, 2012”
Reviews.Author: cemoosemama
Reviews.Content: From the time of our arrival, early Saturday morning after a very long flight we were greeted by a friendly bell steward who OPENED the door of our taxi and then another very friendly bell captain placed our luggage on a cart to be stored while we headed off on our schedule Tour of the beautiful Rain Forest. We headed over to the Registration desk to let the young lady at the front desk know that we had arrived and that our luggage was being stored while we were on our scheduled tour for the day. It was a very pleasant experience all the way around. We would HIGHLY recommend staying at this facility. Every Marriott's that we have stayed in has ALWAYS treated us like Royalty.

Reviews.Title: “ok resort”
Reviews.Author: kg22
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 nights through 3/15/12 as a jet blue package. The resort is somewhat dated but has many good features. Pros: location: walking distance to some really good restaurants (Yerba Buena is great). There is a great spinning studio directly across the street. Staff: very, very nice. Plenty of towels for ocean and beach,etc. Best kept secret is the yoga class on monday/wed/ fri am at 8 am. The front desk people knew nothing about this so it was initially difficult to find the location, etc. but the fitness room attendant was able to provide the necessary details. $5.00 per class and the instructor was excellent. Cons: We had an ocean front room on the 9th floor. It had a musty smell that would not quit. The front desk let me check out a couple of other rooms (7th and 9th floor) and they all had the same musty smell. The carpets in the rooms I saw was very worn. Not sure where the musty smell came from but it was annoying and gives the impression of not so clean (although the room, and the resort, did appear to be clean). The beach was ok. Water too rough for swimming and a stiff wind most of the time. Lots of little kids in the hot tub was very annoying but given the wind, it was hard not to blame them for jumping in.

Reviews.Title: “Buen Proveche!”
Reviews.Author: Rosa C
Reviews.Content: This was top rate - Jose Maderes the server, at "la vista" was polite and accomodating. Had the breafkfast buffet waS was delicious - a great start to any day.

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent at the pool bar made are vacation most fun jeannette rivera and leira fuentes..”
Reviews.Author: Dkatz924
Reviews.Content: We will be back to this wonderfull hotel. They sugested nice restaurants for us to have dinner. They enhance our vacation experience & we will recomend it to all our friends. And we will come back to see Jeanette & Leira.

Reviews.Title: “Great views in a nice hotel with a real beach”
Reviews.Author: sometrip
Reviews.Content: Six nights in a corner room and higher floor with great views of the ocean. Corner room made a big difference in space and provided two balconies. Comfortable bed and good bathroom space (not huge but adequate). Balconies are unusual in that there are two levels on the balcony so be careful walking out on the balcony. Otherwise enough space to enjoy sitting on the balcony. Used the self-park and that worked fine. Easy access to your care in a safe location. Did not use hotel for food except breakfast and that was at the lobby coffee shop. Limited choices but ok for on the go. The food arrives at 7 AM. The location felt safe and it was fine walking up and down the street. The Walgreens is two blocks area and very useful with a small grocery. Another small grocery about two blocks in the other direction past Ummo's restaurant. The real plus here if you like to have a beach you can enjoy is that there really is a beach. The beach is much wider than other adjacent properties. Even with the high moon tides and some storms that made surfing waves it remained adequate while others the water was covering the tiny beach area. Some only had rocks for a beach so make sure the oceanfront property you pick really has a beach. The Marriott has a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful....great stop before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Kakipants
Reviews.Content: We stayed hear the night before a cruise. It was such a great way to start off our vacation and get us in the relaxation mode. The room was beautiful with gorgeous ocean views. The pool was so relaxing, especially with the swim up pool bar. We would definately come back. Unfortunetly, since we only stayed a night, I can't really comment on how close it was to all of the attractions of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Vacation”
Reviews.Author: elizabethtt
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was a great place to stay in Puerto Rico, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and the facilities were lovely. My only disappointments were that the room was musty and nothing would dry, even when the AC was on. It is unpleasant to have to put on a damp bathing suit the next morning! Also, the spa facilities were a disappointment - I tried to schedule a pedicure, but there was very limited availability for services, so I had to go without. I also wish the hot tub was bigger - it was often full of folks, and so unavailable to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: saber14
Reviews.Content: We were a family with two older teenagers. Our room wasn't in the tower, it was a corner room on the top 9th floor and it was beautiful. We could leave our door open with the ocean breeze coming in. No bugs at all. We could walk to a different restaurant every night. We went and got water and snacks at walgreens, but ended up bringing the snacks home as the dinners were always fabulous and we were full! The waves were rough and both our teenagers loved it as they spent many hours in the water! The casino was fun. Our son won $113.00 on the slots! The employees were awesome! Everyone was so friendly. We went on a campo rico ziplining adventure and a tour of old san juan on segeways! Both were well worth the money. We didn't rent a car as we were there for only four days and didn't need it. We had breakfast at Orozcos one morning instead of the hotel for a change. We got two free breakfast with our room which was nice. I think the location of this hotel was great. Pool area was very nice. We were there first week of March and it wasn't over crowded.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is what makes this hotel great!”
Reviews.Author: DIANE S
Reviews.Content: I want to thank everyone -- from our kind house keeper Ramona to our wonderful breakfast waiters, Sonny and Angelo, for making us feel as if we were the only people you had to work with. There was not one person we dealt with at this property who was not kind and did not go the extra mile to make us feel special. The beach was impeccable, as was the pool - one of the nicest pools I have seen. Our room was kept incredibly clean, both restaurants that we ate at on the property were excellent. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: topaz1100
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving we were please that te surroundings seemed decent unlike the hotel we stayed in before out cruise. We arrived about 10a but the hotel kept our luggage until check-in (4pm) and this allowed us to walk around unrestricted. So we were able to get a cab t Old San Juan and walk around to really see the city and the old forts. It was great. One of the front desk women called me as soon as my room was ready which was early around 2pm. I was greatful for the call. The door men would always open the door as you walk in and out which was a nice touch. We recieved some coupons to the Haagan Dags ice cream shop across the street (which we used). We recieved half off the 2nd order. That was nice. The location was good becuase either way right or left of the hotel there were shops and resteraunts that we visited. People were very nice! Please be aware that I booked with priceline (name your own price) and when we checked in we had to pay a $23 resort fee. The hotel is on the beach. It has a very pretty pool area with a swim up bar and slide. It has a cabanna areas and a restaraunt. We did not eat here so I can't comment on the food. The decor of the hotel was modern. I liked it. The decor of hotel room itself was modern and cozy.m It had a flat screen tv and plenty of towels in the bathroom which is a plus for me; I never have to ask for more! There is a n excursion desk near the front. Let me tell you, there is an excursion that costs approximately $100 for 2 people that will take you to old san juan and explain the sights and allow you to shop for up to 3 hours...or the total excursion is 3 hours...i'm not sure. But what we did was catch a cab to old san jaun for $15 (2 people), walked around and visited 2 fortes, many shops at our leisure, ate lunch, and then caught another cab back when we were ready to go to the hotel...all for $30 in cab rides plus tips! So, your choice. 1 day was really not enough to enjoy the Marriott and not enough time to enjoy San Juan. I hated to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by its cover”
Reviews.Author: Neilio1022
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, location is ideal and 15 minutes from airport. Watch out for the casino since it doesn't paid out much. Beach and pol area are nice. I liked that non all-inclusive hotel since its not over crowded and full of drunks peeing in the pool. I would go back again for sure but at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beach in Condado”
Reviews.Author: Kristin E
Reviews.Content: I would highly recomend this motel. After spending a week here, we would not change anything. The beach, just steps out the gate, is the best in the Condado area. The street out front is safe and filled with great places to eat, a Walgreen's, and a small grocery store. We walked to a different restaurant every night and most mornings and never felt unsafe. The staff at the motel were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was great and we loved our ocean view balcony. It's a short taxi ride to both the airport and Old San Juan. We were also able to book all of our activities right in our motel lobby. My only complant is the hot tub was too small. Most evenings we wanted to use it, it was full of other people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Marriott. The beach is beautiful and you have the free use of chairs, towels, and umbrellas. There are two swimming pools; one for adults only and the other for children. The staff was very helpful and our room was beautiful with a view of the water. The location is very convenient with easy bus connection to Old San Juan. Many restaurants close by and a Starbucks right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Stellari with Infant and Toddler”
Reviews.Author: LauraB46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to PR with our toddler (2+) and infant (3 months) and had a great experience. The Marriott was great, although we had to ask for a different room several times. When we first arrived they put us in a city view room on the 4th floor right in front of the elevators. It was dingy and smelled bad and we quickly asked to be changed. They tried to get us to upgrade to an ocean view room which was more expensive, but we declined. When we finally settled on another double city-view room on the 6th floor it was great. This hotel might have a range of rooms, so don't settle for the first room offered. The pool and water slide were perfect for our toddler. The beach was quite rough, so we spent almost the entire time at the pool, which was nice. Our room included breakfast, which was a very mediocre buffet. I couldn't imagine paying $25/person for little more than continental breakfast. At that price, I would have expected shrimp cocktail or smoked salmon. The breakfast was the exact same every single day. It got a little boring. Within a few blocks of the hotel, there were many family friendly restaurants. Also, there were two Walgreens on either side of the hotel, which was very convenient. All in all, it was a great trip with an easy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: HoF66
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice hotel to stay at for one night before our cruise. We have been to San Juan several times before and had quality issues with some of the hotels we stayed at. The Marriott San Juan had the quality we were lookign for.
