The front desk staff was very polite and professional. We had a small issue with our reservation. The front desk did a great job making it right (I now believe it was our misunderstanding, not theirs). They offered Champagne in the lobby at check in and gave us some rum and Pepsi for our room. There is a nice sized casino just off the lobby. It felt a little crowded for me. I was surprised that we actaully won a little money. We were given a ocean view room. It was nice sized, bright, and clean. We had a balcony and overlooked the pool and ocean. The pools looked nice, but I did not use them. There is a bar next to the pool area and just in front of the beach. I did visit this area. It was very nice to sit by the beach and have a drink. A little pricy, but I am on vacation. The hotel is in a great area. There are quite a few restaurants and shops within walking distance. It is about a $20 taxi ride from the airport (maybe $18 plus $1/bag) and about the same charge to Old San Juan or the cruise ports. We had 6 people, so we paid $3 per person. It would have been a little less than $18 with 1-5 people. I would stay here again. It is a little expensive, but much nicer than other places we have stayed. I wish I would have stayed longer so I could have used the pools or beach area more. I think the staff made the difference for me. They handled the issue I had at check-in with complete professionalism. Everyone that worked there seemed very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: SunnyMojito
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival, we were given a free upgrade by Marriott because the hotel was overbooked. When the lady at the front desk mentioned an upgrade, I thought they had booked us in a slightly bigger room. Boy were we in for a big surprise...they gave us the vice-presidential suite!! The room was on the penthouse floor and was huge with 2 washrooms, a living room, a dining room and a closed bedroom.....The nicest part was surely the huge balcony which ran along the whole lenght of the room, on both sides of the building. Huge, amazing! And what a view! Unfortunately, we had booked only one night because we were boarding a cruise ship the next day...but it definitely started our trip on the right foot. The hotel itself is on a very busy street with a lot of stores and restaurants. It's directly on the beach and the beach chairs and towels are free for hotel guests. The beach bar is very expensive but my legs got weak after only one drink...so I guess they're worth their price! We walked in the casino at night and it was very nice and friendly but we're not gamblers so we did not end up playing. If everything else I wrote didn't convince you on this hotel, perhaps the fact that there is a Starbucks right across the street may seal the deal for you, or the Haagen Dazs store right next to it....mmmmm..... Clean, conventient,...the hotel was being renovated at the time of our stay, but besides having a temporary front desk, we did not see / hear the renovations going on at all. The water is a bit rough to swim but the beach is nice and you can still catch some sun and enjoy their beautiful pool and swim-up bar. I didn't use the gym but I did use their facilities to get ready after check out hours, and it was very clean and convenient. Thanks Marriott Stellaris for our wonderful but short stay in P.R. !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Karlota_19
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this Marriott. The beach is very nice and big. All the staff at this hotel were very helpful.Tthe cleaning staff also did a great job of cleaning our room. We loved this hotel. It also was in a great safe area where there are many restraunts to walk to. We would stay here again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VKGK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 2/21 to 2/28. These rooms go for 279, but I won it for $140 on priceline bidding. (If you ask me, i think its worth $140, and the $279 is overpriced. Taxi from Airport to Marriott should be no more than $20 and very straight forward. Check In was good for me, I had to wait, but so does everyone on these reviews...Just presented my priceline paperwork at the front desk and all was good to go. They asked for my Amex for incidentals and you sign a paper saying you authroize them to charge for incidentals. There is a mandatory 16% Resort Fee that you cant get out of. But ask them for the print out of the resort fee during check in so you are on the same page and there are no surprises at check out (or so they cant jack it up later). 16% on $140 was only about $22/day or $149 for the entire stay...even still it would have been nice if it were rolled into the priceline schematic...although im not complaining because my rate was only $140/night. What does it include? A whole bunch of stuff from towels and beach chairs to free wifi to 2 bottles of water a day placed in your room...so dont be scared to open up the waters or store it in the freezer in the room so that you can bring it with you next day to the beach. When you log into WiFi, it scares you with $18.95 fee per day, but click accept, dont worry about the $18.95, it gets cancelled later since its part of the Resort Fee that is mandatory. Also, you cant ask for preferences through priceline auctions, but i still called and asked for a high floor with a nice city view balcony with King Bed, and they hooked me up with it even though I was a priceliner....The view is awesome from the city view, you can see all of Condado region and lights and night life right from your balcony. We loaded up on Walgreens cereals and snacks so we could have breakfast on our own in our balcony and save the $$$. Shower is weak...lcould have been stronger, but thats ok, you learn to live with it. Cable was good but some channels had weak resolution. Starbux accross the street..but wicked expensive..like over $3 for iced coffee.....they have wifi too, but you have to go through a signup procedure (no $) but create a login and password....its called "Centennial Blue" I liked the Starbux to cool off from the beach, i would bring my iPad and read..I never bought my iPad to the beach or pool because i cant stand the idea of sand and water on it..although lot of spoiled bratty small kids were playing with iToys near sand and water???? The starbux i liked also because locals would come in too so you get o see some Puerto Ricans. The lobby was great place to cool off too, your wifi works there too...(oh by the way, AT&T also works in all of San Juan, and its not Roaming, so you have that opion too) House/Latin/American Classic music would be piped in starting around 6 pm, and tha back of the lobby bar opens up into a night club....Casino was there but never went in as not gamblers....also a Starbux wannabe coffee in the lobby as well. After checking out, i used the business center to print my boarding passes. I never ate in the hotel restaurants, because there are so many options outside in Condado in 5 block radius. Cross the street and Starbux in front of you, walk right, and you hit HagenDaz ice cream, Zuchero, Green House (great Turkey Club sandwich for like $10), Latin Star (great Mofongo for $10. Ali Baba was Turkish and overpriced forshish kebabs. Walk to the left instead and you hit Tijuana's mexican, some Argentinian grill, further down, a BK, then Rao's Italian, and even Fudrukkers....so as you can see, no need to be bonded to hotel restaurants...Teh only time i could see hotel food being convenient is if your in the pool and beach area, and dont feel like going out onto the street. Excursions were great there is a desk in the lobby. Sign up for the Rain Forest (make sure you ask for Hime tour guide..he is awewsom and funny, and on the way back from the forest, he stops at a local barbeque stand for pork and chicken:)))) The rain forest tour was $50. We did old san juan on our own .....just 75 cents bus 23 goes right into Old San Juan, we visited the Cristobal fortress, and they charg $5 just to see it....its cool though, they have alike a small video too...On the way back, just ask for the bus station, and bus 23 will be lined up there to take you back to Condado (dont quote me on Bus 23, my memory is failing me, but ask the conciereg, I believe its bus 23). I dont have any thing negative except the little kiddies....the Hot Tub clearly has rules about no kiddies, but all the spoiled kids go in with groups of 5 or 6 and hog the thing for like hours while their obnoxious parents chat and look at them... Thats all my 2 cents....I will try to post some pics soon.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott San Juan Jewel”
Reviews.Author: michael k
Reviews.Content: Hotel location excellent for eating, shopping,and short taxi ride to Old San Juan. The hotel staff was the most accommodating, helpful group of personnel I have ever seen in 1 hotel at the same time. Friendly "good mornings" like we were old friends. Definite return trip in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, beach and pool”
Reviews.Author: viaje4fun
Reviews.Content: Great location in town, walk to drug store and restaurants, rooms are small but clean and comfortable with small refrigerator. Beach is nice and chairs and umbrellas are available, as is bar and waitress service. Pool is fun for smaller kids. Late checkout for Marriott gold members was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Michele C
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel are the most pleasant on every level. Everyone is helpful and accommodating. They are very personable and make your vacation an enjoyable one. The location of the hotel is in walking distance to some of the best local restaurants on the Island. Or a short taxi ride takes you to many other delicious restaurants. The wait staff at La Vista are all sweet, pleasant and anxious to please. The staff at the ocean are also very nice and are always there to set you up wherever you desire. We have been coming to this hotel at least once or twice a year for the past 8 years. Every year we enjoy our stay more and more. My husband is very friendly and the staff all remember him when we come back. It is like coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Spa and grounds review only.”
Reviews.Author: Lilalu814
Reviews.Content: We only came here to get massages and use pool and beach area while we had time to kill flying in from Vieques in the morning before our 2nd flight left from San Juan later that night. The spa was nice enough and the couples massage was a good deal and they let us keep our luggage in their locker room so we could shower and stuff later which was excellent. However if I booked a full vacation here I would be unhappy as it's full of kids and super crowded!! Like sardines around the the pool, beach and the hot tub was packed too! No seats in there lol. This is not the place for a couple vacation. It's a family place only. It reminds me of any too touristy beach town USA- too crowded and full of families and seniors and a very vanilla experience. If u like Disney world u may like this too. If a couple though go to a boutique hotel and enjoy the peace and quiet away from crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Stellaris - Good use of Marriott points”
Reviews.Author: FENTON64
Reviews.Content: I used points to book 2 rooms at this hotel. The Marriott required a lot less points than the Hilton. If you have to pay for your stay, the hotel is rather pricey, but so are the majority of hotels in San Juan. We only stayed one night prior to our cruise. The check in process was very quick. Our rooms had a balcony which over-looked the pools and the ocean . We arrived late in the day so we did not use the pools although they looked very nice. The rooms had a refrigerator and the beds were very comfortable. They did have a lounge for Marriott members only, but there wasn't anything up there when we stopped in. We did spend some time in the casino and actually won. The casino is on the small side and was very crowded on Saturday night. There are multiple restaurants within walking distance of the hotel as well as a couple of fast food restaurants. The hotel has a restaurant, but we did not eat there. They have a bar in the hotel and the pool area. I would stay here again and would recommend it. It seemed like a lot of people stay here prior to cruising.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: neo36
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week of 2/13 for 6 days and had a great time. The pool and beach are awesome. Kids loved the water slide and my wife and I enjoyed the beach. Hotel is very nice and room was good. Only issue we had was with the shower - hardly any water pressure - most you could get was a dribble. Otherwise the Marriott is a great place to stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Long, relaxing, weekend”
Reviews.Author: northofthecape
Reviews.Content: At the last minute we decided to book a flight and trip to San Juan Puerto Rico. Although relatively expensive due to school vacation week, this destination and this hotel seemed to be a significantly better value than other islands and other hotels in Puerto Rico. The hotel was obviously very full with demanding families, like ours, but we ran into almost no problems, with the possible exception of a very crowded beach (as the weather was perfect). We ordered room service a few times, had lunch at the pool/beach bar twice, and had breakfast in the restaurant twice...all good experiences. We booked two local tours through the hotel activity desk (bio bay and horseback), and both these experiences were positive as well. Returned home feeling relaxed and not broke.

Reviews.Title: “Great first time Trip To Puerto Rico-SVC. Excellent”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: 2/16-20/2012---Svcs. were great when we arrived early a.m. and were great throughout the trip. Questions answered, smiles all around, special deal with free breakfast (buffet) which was fantastic and hardly any early morning wait to eat. We also had a choice of eating outside or inside. The beach was a hop and a skip from our room---plenty of room and all room guests got free chairs and an umbrella if wanted. I just can't say more for our first trip there---eating places were easy to get to (u can walk most places), and the local bus was close enough to catch to visit old San Juan (only 75c). The casino was fun to go to at nite and if u got bored with that one there were several only a block or so away which u could walk to. There was also a "trip" desk where u could sign up for different excursions--recommend the rain forest. David and Judy

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: russian33
Reviews.Content: We booked a 5 day winter getaway, using my wife's points. We got a great huge corner room (room 843) with beautiful oceanview. The staff was very friendly. Room was always clean. The location is fantastic! Pool and beach easily available. On the beach, they get you chairs and umbrellas, as soon as you come out. Beach bar has great service. Basically, would recommend this Marriott and definitely stay there if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: yurgis
Reviews.Content: This hotel and vacation was great. The Marriott was lovely and the people (employees) went out of their way to make sure everything was done the way you wanted. The room was a little on the small size but adequate as we were out more than in. Had an ocean front room that had a great view. We ate at one of the hotel resturants (not the Tuscany) and the lunch we had was very good but we also tried it for dinner and was not pleased. Service was good but not happy with the food. There are several resturants within walking distance and enjoyed that more. We also traveled to the rain forrest with Rico Sun Tours (1/2 day) and that was well worth the money. The tour guide was great and very informative. We plan to go back but not sure if we will rent a place for a month or stay at a hotel but if it is a hotel I will definently book it at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Clarzemanchamp
Reviews.Content: Although this is a fairly large high rise hotel, it maintained a great resort feel. I had 2 rooms (a suite and an additional room-both oceanfront). Both rooms were great. The suite was a nice set up with a wrap around balcony and a separate master BR. I thought the beach was great. Even though it was a crowded holiday weekend, we were always able to get a good beach spot. (but try to get there early. It gets crowded). The pool area is shady, so actually not a bad thing if you want a break from the sun. Condado seems to be a good hot spot for night life and new restaurants. Defineately get out of the hotel for your meals. (tripadvisor can guide you where to eat)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loveinthesun
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. The room was adequate, the staff was helpful. Wifi was slow. Great location. I did not eat at the hotel as there are several great restaurants near by serving good Puerto Rican food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort with great service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Travler088
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days prior to going out on a cruise. I booked the room at a relatively cheap rate, but when we arrived, they upgraded us to an oceanview room in the Cabana building. It was nicer then what I expected. The service was great from the time we pulled up in the taxi, until the time we left. The resort does charge an exorbitant service fee, but it includes free internet, beach towels, chairs, and unbrellas, phone calls, and they give you $20 in match play coupons for the Casino, which we actually used to get back most of our resort fee. Parking at the hotel is at a premium, but unless you want to take a taxi and get ripped off by the drivers who have no meters, you don't have much of a choice. We waited for a bus by the hotel to go into Old San Juan, but one didn't come in 30 minutes. The beach and pool areas are very nice and fairly well maintained. They have activities, and food and drink at the pools. We didn't eat in the restaurants, but heard they are pretty good, we did have a sandwich at the pool which was pretty good. They do have drink specials, just ask. This is a nice resort, although we have stayed at the El San Juan Hilton and the Caribe Hilton and would probably stay at one of those resorts if the price was the same (I generally stay at Hiltons), but we would go back here if the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “Back for a second time!”
Reviews.Author: LTAN72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over President's Day weekend. Like our previous stay, we booked a corner room, double balcony, ocean view room. The views were great and the room was spacious enough for 2 people. The rooms were cleaned everyday around mid- morning. The hotel is walking distance to many shops, restaurants and drug stores, and the beach is right outside (very convenient). I guess the only gripe would be the beach chairs become pretty scarce by noon - claim your spot early.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: GoodeCT
Reviews.Content: Looks like the ocean front strip is undergoing a bit of a Renaissance..some run down buildings and some beautiful properties. Oceanfront corner room with two balconies had an amazing view and was worth the upgrade. We were on the 8th floor also overlooking the pool and noise was never an issue. Overall the property felt a bit tired but you could not beat the location. It was in walking distance to many restaurants and Walgreen's. We ate at the hotel twice(breakfast for two-$42 and lunch on the beach for two-$43) and found it pricey for the quality. The "beach boys" were wonderful. We offered a tip which was appreciated. Other than beach lounges and wifi we could not figure out why there was a resort fee...I would really work at getting this negociated into the cost of the room.We did have a security issue where our room was left open twice- once immediately after we checked in and a second time in the afternoon. Lock up your valuables. The beach was clean with great waves. It is a public beach so the occasional peddler travels by but there was no harassing at all. The undertow can be challenging and is not ideal for little ones. Very few if any seashells for those hunting. One morning after a storm we found handfuls of sea glass. Watch your chair placement if you are spending the day because the hotel does cast a shadow later in the afternoon. Stay left as you look at the water. The coastline is jagged with coral reef in the distance in both directions so you cannot go for a long run on the beach unless you want to go back and forth. We began to run on the street mostly headed towards the bridge to Old San Juan(to the right as you exit) and around the bay. It worked out fine and helped us do some local exploring. Restaurant choices are great. We went to Perla( 10 minute walk) in the Concha Hotel. It looks like a clam shell and overlooks the ocean. It was pricey but we enjoyed the food and ambiance. We tried to go twice but it was booked. Beware there can be private parties and loud music below so be sure to inquire. Definitely need a reservation. Ropa Veja was a 5 minute walk. Traditional Puerto Rican food. Delicious. Loud, so make sure you are in the mood. Buda Tai, also a 10 minute walk, sit outside if it is a beautiful night. We never got past the appetizers...delicious, more cosmopolitan, romantic. We went twice just so we could continue exploring the menu. Tijuana is traditional Mexican food. Five minute walk. Delicious. Sat outside both times. Denny's definitely had the best breakfast. Solid 15 minute walk. Inside the Conrad Hotel just before the bridge. So reasonable. Local fare is just okay in the many small spots along the way and inexpensive. We went into Old San Juan one evening by cab and ate at La Dente. We felt rushed and it was just okay. Probably would have been better for lunch. Wished we had made it there during the day to poke around and really wanted to try Aqua Viva for dinner but ran out of time. About $15 cab each way. Seventy five cents by bus which picks up across from Walgreen's...never tried it. From New England you can't beat the direct flight, normal cell service and great sun! We would return....

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not Stellar”
Reviews.Author: private1965
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous review from Feb 17, 2011. This property has a great location but feels small. That can be good. Very little foot travel around the property and just steps to the beach. Resraurants had limited hours. Our plan was all-inclusive. One choice for breakfast, two for lunch and two for dinner. My picky eaters had a little trouble with the menus. That said, the waiters and service were excellent and we easily ordered plain rice, mac and cheese and plain breaded chicken breast with no problems. My daughter loved her chocolate chip pancakes. I would have found the food and drinks to be above-resort pricey if we would have not been all-inclusive, Pina Coladas and Margaritas were $10, smoothies were $5. A cheese quesadilla was $11, dinner for three at the Tuscany ran $186 (2 tomato soups, chicken with alfredo noodles, lobster canneloni, steak dinner and two desserts, one beer, one soda, one tea) One of the hidden food services was the lobby coffee bar that served deli foods not on the menu at the beach bar. Found this the last day there. Also I would have liked to try the "chicken and rice" found on the room serivce menu, Was told I couldn't have it in the restaurants. Again, I loved the poolside and beach service - very attentive. Food and drinks on the beach and at the pool and the wait staff were very much present to take an order. We were on the 15th floor (out of 20) and we had the side view of the ocean and the city looking to the northwest. We could watch the ships and cruisers go in and out of the harbor and we looked staight down on the pool. The sound of the ocean was clear and fabulous. The Walgreens is maybe 400 feet from the entrance. There are several nice places to eat within one block. StarBucks and Hagen Daz are across the street. Our room had a great mini frig but no microwave to reheat takeout. Conciege desk was very efficent with our reservations. Tip - rent a car for a day. Fairly easy to get around - most drive thrus have someone speak English. Important tip!!- The El Yugetan (sp) National Rain Forest road is seasonal, only open May to September. This is NOT disclosed on any map or tourist book. We drove up the southern entrance only to find the road gated about half way up the mountain. Still a great way to see the REAL Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “An easy way to enjoy a short vacation”
Reviews.Author: Seneca66
Reviews.Content: I spent three days in this resort hotel. It is already very easy to fly to Puerto Rico from the North East of the US. It was another quick cab drive to get to the hotel. Although the building doesn't look anything special from the outside, it has a very nice and well maintained interior. We loved the ocean view room on the 18th floor. Besides the view, it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The beach is great, nobody bothered us there, it was very relaxing. The pool area is a bit small, and the water was very cold. We only had breakfast at the hotel, the buffet breakfast is a good start of the day. Expect high prices for the food and drinks, but it is not a surprise considering the location and the quality of the hotel. A very nice thing is to have access to the roof top lounge. The view is spectacular and you can have breakfast and snacks there. It is easy to walk around the resort, there are a few okay restaurants. Old San Juan is pretty close and for me it was the highlight of my stay on the island. I will definitely return to this resort to enjoy the summer during the winter months. It is effortless to do things around while enjoying the stay at a comfortable, clean resort.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't feel it was up to Marriotts standards”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugsforlife
Reviews.Content: We booked an oceanfront room with a balcony for 6 nights. We had requested a king bed but upon check in we were told we were getting 2 queen beds, yet the beds seemed like full size to us. I felt the front desk service was sub par for what we expect from a Marriott. The concierge desk was wonderful though and that sort of made up for the other missing service. Because there is so much to review I have broken it into sections. Location: We loved the location, it was far enough from the airport that you didn't have to hear and see planes. It was close enough to old san juan that it was a quick cab ride away. But the best part was that there were a lot of restaurants within walking distance, there was also a walgreens, some shops and another casino within walking distance. The Beach: Lots of nice sand, plenty of space for their guests. The waves were always great for body surfing, not sure if it would be calm enough for really little kids. However we loved it. From the start of the beach all the way out it is fine sand, and just sand, no rocks or patches of seaweed to make your way through. They will put out chairs for you and an umbrella at your request. I felt this was a highlight of their property. Pools and Hot tub: there were two pools and a slide. One was a wading pool perfect for kids, the other one was good for all ages with a swim up bar. Unfortunately the pina coladas at the bar were $10. Neither pool was very large but there is a lot of beautiful landscaping, the only downside to that is it causes a lot of shade in the pool area, although sometimes that is nice. The hot tub was small but clean and very relaxing. Tuscany Restaurant: Service was wonderful, decor was nice, food was average, wine selection was great and dessert was out of this world. I felt this restaurant was reasonably priced. We got an amazing bottle of Chianti for $30. La Vista Restaurant: We ate dinner here and really enjoyed it. Miluz was our waitress and she was great. The food was delicious, although I did think it was a bit overpriced given the casual atmosphere. An Ice tea was $3.50. We also ate breakfast here everyday, it was part of our room rate, and we really enjoyed it. The fresh orange juice was a nice treat. I also really enjoyed that there was some local food on the menu such as Mofongo and Platain. Although we didn't pay for the breakfast we saw how much it was everyday and it was expensive. Meals ranged from $13-$16 and the full buffet was $25. Resort Fee: Make sure this is included in the rate you are quoted because they do have a high resort fee and it would be terrible to find out about this after you book. Also I had a few notes about this. It includes a 1 hour bicycle rental, although they don't mention that when you check in, but the hotel is on a main street and with the crazy cab driving I wouldn't want to ride a bike there. It is suppose to include entertainment with live music, but in the week we were there I never saw live music. They also state they have beach volleyball but again this didn't seem to be the case. One day we saw them set up a net but it was very short and seemed to only be set up at the request of two guests, after they finished playing, they took their ball and left. This was frustrating because it showed up on the activities board. Rooms: The rooms are basic, nothing spectacular. Based on the rooms I would say it would be more in the Marriott courtyard range. However the views make up for the lackluster rooms. Casino: Small but nice. The first night we were there all the tables were full that were open, the next day the only blackjack table open was a $25 table. However the rest of the times we stopped by we were able to find good tables. Drink service was a bit faster than other casinos we have been in. Gift shop: Had a great selection of souvenirs and necessities. Prices are ok, but the drinks are pricey, bottles of water were on sale for $2.50. Lobby: Very cool. literally, the always have the AC cranked, but it is really nice to look at too. Unfortunately drinks at this bar were not cheap either, aprox $10 per drink. There is also an excursion desk in the lobby and a Hertz rental car agent, both nice to have close.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Southernfolk
Reviews.Content: The service suck no one would wait on you by the beach and not a allinclusive resort you can only drink what the have what they want you to drink and most time they run out of beer but if you want crown and coke you have to pay for it and if you want miller lite you buy it or any other kind of beer you buy it everywhereive went all inclusive you don't pay for anything so it services sucks !!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: FireMar21
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7 day stay at our favorite hotel on the Island. We visit this place twice a year, The stay was great and a so was the weather. The positives for this hotel are the location and the staff. When you go ask for Sonny in La Vista best server and most entertaining one there bar none. He is the reason we return there every year. If you stop at the pool bar ask for Leonel or Hector you will be greatly pleased with the service from these guys. These 3 guys are why we have returned every year for about 10 years now they make this place shine. The new look to the lobby was great back the only negative thing was the change in the music. My wife and I travel to this hotel to enjoy the music in the lobby but for some reason beyond me the music change from Salsa and Merengue to Techno. Whoever was responsible for this decision should be imediately fired. The music should be with an island flavor at the lobby and the pool and beach bar. Hopefully the powers that be will listen to countless guest that complained and go back to the old format. Still the best place to stay and remember ask for Sonny at La Vista restaurant for breakfast you will be treated as if you were the only one there.

Reviews.Title: “Not very trendy but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: horses_and_dogs
Reviews.Content: We booked an Oceanfront room for 5 days (Spl Sand Dollar promotion) and the room we got on the first night was 410 - its small and so is the bathroom but the view is standard like all the others. When we requested a room change, we got one on a higher floor, about 30% bigger - so note that all Oceanfront rooms, even though at the same rate, are not the same size. The bed was comfortable and the air-conditioning good but the room is not very plush aside from that. The TV is standard flat screen - as one would see at most 4 and 5 star hotels these days, but the reception was snowy and unclear - we didn't bother complaining. The beach is a public beach but very clean without any crabs etc - great with the kids but the undertow is very strong and can unbalance one standing at the edge easily - need to be careful with children. Great service by the beach staff and bar staff for catering drinks and snacks while you're enjoying the beach. Location is good for a walk around the neighbourhood - the hotel a couple of blocks to the right is Renaissance - same hotel family but much trendier and attractive. The reception of the Marriott is more modern and the casino is not that big though we didnt have time to play in the casino. Depends on which concierge you speak to, they could give you varying guidance! There is a Starbucks and a Hagen Dazs parlour right across the hotel's main entrance - conveniently located. The breakfast served is good, nice spread - great service - but they only open the outdoor breakfast area on the weekend which is a shame. Overall the hotel staff is very helpful, warm and welcoming. I think the hotel could improve by modernizing the rooms a bit and having more tie-ups with their own member hotels in other parts of the island so that guests can enjoy watersports in different locations of the same group.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation :)”
Reviews.Author: Londonblues
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this Marriot Resort last August for a week. We enjoyed our stay, the room was clean and beautiful. The balcony view was blocked by the building. It was still nice to have a balcony. The room size did start to bother us after about the third night. It was a little small. Beach was very nice and we swam at night which was fun! I loved the pool with the swim up bar, the best part was that it was open 24 hours! Staff were freindly and accommodating. The even sent someone up with a microwave when I asked if there was somewhere I could heat my food! Bar area was nice! We arrived Friday night and there was a party with people dancing all through the lobby having a great time. The casino was small and not typical. The area was walking distance from local restaurants and shops. Overall had a great Anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here several times and will again”
Reviews.Author: KWVI
Reviews.Content: We are in PR afew times a year and usually stay here or LaConcha. Last visit, we thought we'd save a little money and stayed in a courtyard in Isla Verde. No comparison. Stellar is worth the expense for room, view, service, food, beach, pool, casino. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Ira B
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a six night stay at the Marriott San Juan. Our experience was top-notch! The Marriott is well appointed and extremely well maintained. The entire staff is friendly and genuinely cares about the comfort of their guests. Angelo and Sonny are certainly an asset to the La Vista Restaurant breakfast. They know what you need before you do. The management should be commended on the cleanliness of the entire establishment. We would not hesitate and look forward to returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just GRAND!”
Reviews.Author: JuJuBeans
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful pleasure of staying at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino Feb.12,2012. We had a great time. The place is quite beautiful and very clean. Everyone there is very nice and most helpful. It is close to wonderful places to eat and explore. We wish we could have stayed longer. We stayed only one night because of extending our time from a RC Cruise. Love this place and we are truly going to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Just what we needed..”
Reviews.Author: luvcubaeverytime
Reviews.Content: My husband just returned from Puerto Rico last Sunday. We were traveling home from sailing in the BVI for two weeks and had a 30 hour layover in San Juan. I booked this hotel after trying to book two other ones but they were full but, let me tell you, are we ever glad they were! This was the perfect place. The lobby was booming with activity, the beach was picturesque, the restaurant choices were fantastic and the location was perfect. The rooms were simply tasteful and the spa was just what we needed! If we ever get back to San Juan, we will be staying here again for sure. Beautiful hotel, beautiful city, beautiful people.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Jerry S
Reviews.Content: Although we've been to Puerto Rico many times, this was our first stay at the Marriott. We will return. The Condado is filled with good restaurants and luxury hotels, although the luxury is mixed with the occasional abandoned property. The Marriott is in a great location on the beach, and we had no problems getting prime beach chairs at any time of day. Rooms are very clean and well appointed. The staff was universaly friendly and helpful. We had breakfast daily and several dinners at the hotel during our week's stay. TIP: At breakfast, ask for Sonny as your server for a unique and fun experience. He does a great job and remembers your preferences from day to day. The breakfast itself was well worth the package cost. The 'special menu' at Tuscany restaurant is also a great deal, at $20 for a 3-course dinner. ( Only between 6 and 7pm, though) Try the Chicken Parmigiano! All in all, this is a great location for a San Juan vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat customers”
Reviews.Author: kiki t
Reviews.Content: This is our 6th time staying at the San Juan Marriott. The location and customer service are stellar. We will return next year. Richard at the beach always attending to our needs. Hector at the Ocean bar is a star employee. I have to also say that the newly renovated lobby is lovely.....but....the dancing girls at night have to go. This is not Las Vegas. It was cheesy and the girls had to make sure they didn't hit the low hanging chandeliers. It really turned us off to the night time atmosphere of this lovely bar.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: TravelsOffen
Reviews.Content: Nicest Marriott in the chain. Beautiful rooms, great pool area and beach. Convenient location, 5 minutes from the airport. The Concierge was a little inexperienced but very helpful. The couple traveling with us had up on their room twice, being issued keys to rooms already occupied. After a little back and forth while the hotel worked to straighten it out, they were upgraded to Concierge level with a corner room. We're planning to go back. Be sure to visit Old Town (during the day) and the Fort.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: flossem4life
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the flag up, but it didn't keep anyone out of the water. We rented a boogie board and had a blast. There were guys on the beach who would bring you chairs and set up your umbrella for no charge (except tip). The pool was fun and had a small water slide my kids enjoyed. The staff was attentive. The rooms were clean and well taken care of. The casino was small (nothing compared to Vegas) but we weren't there to gamble so it wasn't a problem. There was your choice of restaurants within walking distance both fast food and sit down. We really enjoyed the pizza place just down the street. We walked the beach for quite a ways. Another fun thing we did besides old town, was go to the rainforest. They had great family hikes, and especially one to a waterfall. So make sure you don't miss it. We just rented a car for the day and had a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service- Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoltED
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last in November 2009. I was working and brought my wife. We had a great time. The rooms are comfortable. Breakfast buffet is nice. The beach is fantastic, maybe the best in San Juan. There is a bus stop just outside the hotel that takes you into Old San Juan. There is not much of a schedule for the bus, but it is cheap and not difficult to figure out. This place is expensive, so if you can find a good deal spoil yourself and stay here. For me the higher nightly rate is justified with the service and great location. The Casio is typical and sometimes the lounge features live music. There are dining options within walking distance of the hotel that are reasonable and even a Walgreens nearby. I would not want to stay anywhere else when visiting San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Week's best kept secret for families”
Reviews.Author: happyg0luckyday
Reviews.Content: When we stayed at the SJ Resort & Stellaris Casino, they were still finishing up the work on the lobby... so even with the construction we had an outstanding time. Let me tell you why: during the Thanksgiving week it seems that families from all over take advantage of the discounted rates to fly in - super for families of children that want to play with others! They highly touted slide and pools are fantastic. Staff is more than amazing. We were able to use the club on the top floor (Marriott gold) and have free breakfast daily. We could also return for happy hour snacks. The view is outstanding. Everything is very clean. Service is outstanding. You have to ask if you are not satisfied or if you want something. Pool side is a little slow, but we didn't use it much. You know we didn't get beach side rooms and didn't miss it. We had a view of the Starbucks side of the street. I liked looking at the city - didn't mind looking at the rooftops. We weren't there often. Saved our money for souvenirs and other things. Despite crime stats and warnings, we had no problems walking around - even at night. But we didn't go out late it's true. Stocked up on Walgreen's water. The two Puerto Rican restaurants down the street are amazing, and very friendly. We ate local entirely. Wow, I miss Puerto Rico! When we return you bet we are staying at the Stellaris! I'm glad that we didn't book a lot of stuff before we left - you can go to El Junque and get in for free without the guided tour. I wanted the tour but my child would never had made it. Plan for 4 hours. We also had to skip a few other things because of car sickness. I have heard now there is a less twisty path to take by rental, for our return, but I have to look it up. The one thing I bought first was off site airport parking and that paid off. It was faster than long-term parking at the airport, and much less expensive. We'll do that again.

Reviews.Title: “super bowl wkend”
Reviews.Author: wpaul1234
Reviews.Content: we had ocean view wonderfull;rms baths clean;mgt cked twice all okk;it was greatl;free drinks ;munchies avail;1st;night;;;sat pm dancing fun;carbi music;felt special;;recommend eat out often great options on street;never be out after midnight;;;pools good but jacci soso;temps/ crowded;;overall highly recommend;;alot other bad comments from some highly picky people assuming;;rate 8.5 out 10 scorcing;;;most bang for a buck;great location;;staff friendly -helpfull;;go sailing snokling fajado-marinas-best day on island;;paul-boston

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: gman48
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently for business and sometimes over weekends. The hotel is right on the beach and has it's own large pool and well equipped gym. There is a casino attached to the hotel that I tend to stay clear of. There are 2 restraunts an upscale Italian and a more relaxed meditteranian/american with views of the beach. Both are just OK but offer a really good choice. Going to the beach is a nice experience as the hotel supplies beds, unbrellas, and towels and will even bring them to you preferred spot. There is live music most nights in the lobby, The rooms are clean and very typical of the Marriott group and the staff are friendly and do their best to look after you. All in all not a bad place it's just missing the 'wow' factor but then I expect it would not be such good value!

Reviews.Title: “the employees”
Reviews.Author: roy v
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to let you know that Sunny in the Vista restaurant was very accommodating and made our breakfast most enjoyable. Richard at the pool/beach was absolutely fabulous. He anticipated our needs before us.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: laslototh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott San Juan Resort and Casino last month for one night prior to a cruise. Although the rates were a bit high, we were pleased with the experience. The hotel was very clean and our standard room was large enough for our needs. The bathroom was modern and well-appointed. Although we were located close to the elevators and the hotel was fully booked we didn't hear much noise from the corridor or adjacent rooms. The casino is small but had the games we were interested in. We found all the staff to be friendly and helpful. The beach and pool areas were clean and comfortable, although the ocean in January was a bit too rough for us to try. Our only complaint was with the drinks at the pool bar -extremely weak, especially for the prices they charge! The hotel is in an excellent location, with many choices for dining and entertainment nearby. All-in-all we enjoyed our brief stay at the Marriott and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, good location, positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Lauren M
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the San Juan Marriott was pleasant. The hotel is on the beach and there are plenty of restaurant options within walking distance. It's a quick cab ride to Old San Juan and there is also decent bus service near the hotel. The room we stayed in was clean, well equipped with amenities, and fairly quiet. We could hear the girls in the room next door who were a little boisterous, but that may have just been because we had a room with an adjoining door. Overall, we had a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot on Condado Beach”
Reviews.Author: gordielewis
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm not giving this resort five stars is because of the prices. Other than that, this is the place to stay in Condado, central to everything. The accommodations are excellent, and the staff is very attentive. The beach is right out back, and when my wife wants to sit in the sun for hours, I can always leave and go back to the casino. Sometimes there are a LOT of children at the pool, so be aware of that if you don't like a lot of children running around. However, I don't recommend eating here unless you want to spend a lot of money. There are less expensive places up and down the street, and there are great Mexican and Argentinian restaurants to the left of the Marriott as you walk out the door.

Reviews.Title: “Options, all at your fingertips makes it overall a good spot.”
Reviews.Author: SunSoakers2009
Reviews.Content: We went over Christmas weekend and didn't have a lot in the way of expectations except a good time at a nice hotel and getting some much needed sun. Overall, the Marriott Stellaris has all the options you need to have a good time without having to go far from the hotel: Beach, pool, hot tub, spa, casino, restaurants, and proximity to restaurants and nightlife in Condado. Rooms were nice, pretty standard Marriott quality. The best things about the hotel: Breakfast buffet at the grill downstairs, the fried grouper sandwich on the lunch menu at the beach/pool, proximity to local restaurants. The watch-outs: Drinks in the casino are awful. You need to get lounges on the beach early to get a good spot and be aware of where the sun/shade will be throughout the day. Too many kids in the hot tub and messing around at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Ocean front room is truly ocean front!!”
Reviews.Author: JG1001
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our two night stay at the Marriott. The ocean front room was amazing. You could hear the sound of the waves even though we were 12 floors up. The Latin Grille provided a great meal that was flavorful, light and refreshing. The service was outstanding. At checkout our bill was exactly correct. No hidden fees, no funny business. We would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Privacy and Security Issues”
Reviews.Author: MT P
Reviews.Content: I wanted to share a HUGE concern from my most recent stay at the San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino. The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean, but I each time I went to the front desk to inquire about getting a new room key or ask a question which required my room information, the front desk staff asked me for my room number out loud, followed immediately with requesting my last name out loud, and finally asking for a photo id. All of this information could and SHOULD be kept quiet and a photo id is the only information the staff should need. As I started my career in hotel group sales I know this is NOT good! This is a very important security and privacy issue that you need to address ASAP. In addition, I had a friend visit me for cocktails and when I refused to allow her to pay for drinks, she went to the front desk and asked for a print out of my incidentals and was given a copy!!! She was NOT asked for photo id and was given a copy of my room charges. They staff addressed her as Mrs. (my last name), but never confirmed who she was. She was then allowed to pay toward my bill, but also had in hand when she returned to me the copy of my room charges to that point in my stay. Shocked and very disappointed by all of this!

Reviews.Title: “Get you drinks early”
Reviews.Author: Marcus C
Reviews.Content: We arrived the around 10pm or so. had a very nice room, it was on the 7th floor looking over the ocean! BEAUTIFUL! We went down stairs to the bar in the lobby. The bartender told us they just did last call, before 11pm i think it was a thursday. We had time for one drink, We when outside to find a place to drink..NO WHERE!! There were a lot of bars but they all close around 11.. We asked a police man walking around if there were any places around there.. he told us this one place that ended up being closed. We stayed there for a week and had a blast.. there are some great places to eat around there.. I suggest Latin Star! GREAT FOOD.. the bar across the street was pretty amazing as well, as long as it was open.. The hotel offered so much to do! We went horse back riding, hiking in the rain forrest. (which was the coolest thing ever, not a hard walk at all and you get to go swimming under the waterfall), zip lining, Biobay tour (which was awful, it took 3 hours go get there, and 3 hours back, not worth the money). Both my girlfriend and I won $100 at the casino, which is always exciting, Drinks at the hotel are expencive ($10 pre mojito)

Reviews.Title: “Try not to stay here if possible - not a quality Marriott property”
Reviews.Author: JosephSloboda
Reviews.Content: Where do we begin - they canceled my reservation and then when I called back they told me there were no more JR suites available and that they could put me in a smaller room for the same price an dthat I should call back in a few days to see if they could put me back into a Suite. When I called back they were able to put me back into a JR Suite but at $125 mroe per night then I had before. We were travelign with another family and we booked both rooms at the same time and my friend had none of these problems. I was then told by the local resrvation rep that I could get this adjusted when we arrived. Upon arrival I was of course told there was nothign that could be done with the rate and that this was because "I canceled" my original reservation and then rebooked 2 weeks later at the higher rate but that he would do me a favor and give me $50 F&B credit per night to make me feel better. My wife blew a gasket and then he offered to put us in a larger JR Suite however as we are in the process of moving our bags he then tells me "sorry we already sold that suite to another guest so you have to stay in the smaller room" . . . are you kidding me ?!?!? The following day as we all returned from the beach and started to shower for dinner the hot water is turned off and then all water is turned off - this is at 4pm on a Saturday ! ! When we call the desk to complain we ar told that they are doing "routine maintenance" and that they will give me another $100 F&B credit to compensate. This is after my son is standing around with shampoo in his hair for 20 minutes Later that night when we return from dinner we are then greeted with an ant infestation in our 21st floor room. They send exterminators and spray however the following morning we yet again have thousands of ants all over the mini bar area and bathroom. Sorry - folks no further comps or credits but we can move you across the hall Then at the end when we go to check out the F&B credits are half of what we were promised and I have to fight again to get what was promised Not to mention the "resort fee" is not a flat fee but is a % of the room rate so when I was paying a higher rate than my friend and a higher rate than I was originally booked at they then collected a resort fee of almost $75 per night BTW - the breakfast buffet is tired and greasy and the pool has more trees providing shade than most I have ever seen, not a great place to sun bath as there is pretty much very little opportunity to get sun in a very small and cramped pool area On the bright side - just about every server, house keeper, bartender and hotel staff memebr was extremely friendly and did a pretty good job (with the exception of the Front desk MGR who in my opinion should have been comping at least one night off my bill)

Reviews.Title: “Well Located Beachfront Resort”
Reviews.Author: Tomtravel23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights before our Caribbean cruise (as did quite a few other folks). It served our purposes very well. It is right on the beach, has two large, well-maintained pools to relax and enjoy a beverage or two, and is in easy walking distance of several very nice restaurants. Our room was in good condition and very clean. The lobby can be, as others have commented, very noisy in the evening when the bar takes over with loud music and lights. In the day, it has a much more relaxed atmosphere. We had no problem getting good service at the front desk or getting a taxi to our ship on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “THE Best”
Reviews.Author: tedelbear
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week ago. Arrived late because of a nightmare delay by US Air. All of the frustration was wiped out when we arrived at the Marriot and were upgraded. The place is awesome. It is clean, in a wonderful spot on the water and the staff is very attentive. It is within an easy taxi ride to Old San Juan or to the cruise ships. Stay there and you will see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel casino is weak”
Reviews.Author: buddha0404
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the hotel and the beach. also, the food in the hotel and within walking distance of this hotel is amazing. we got a cornerwuite with two ocean view balconies. we had a very nice 4 night stay. we cant wait to go back. the only downside is the casino. it is tiny, lacks good games, and the people who worked in the casino were rude.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: utahfamilytravellers
Reviews.Content: I will say this about Marriott Hotels, I generally can't fault the hotel if my stay isn't exactly what I was looking for. Example, Marriott San Juan. I'm not going to give a hotel a bad review because the lobby was loud or the hotel was large. The building has been built. It's not the staff or management's fault if a hotel doesn't "wow" you, after all, I'm the one who booked it. The service was great. The rooms were clean. The beds were comfortable. That said, I don't think I'd go out of my way to stay in this hotel again because it wasn't what we look for when we travel. It was in a busy urban area, the beach was packed and the casino was loud. Again, things I can't fault the hotel for. We wrote more about our stay on our blog: www.worldfamilytravellers.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Only average”
Reviews.Author: MainePeter
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this hotel. It was nice, but nothing special. The lobby is mostly bar, as well as a moderate sized sitting area. The casino adjoins the lobby. The rooms were typical Marriott (a good thing), clean, up to date and local decor. We came in late December for a break from the cold, and planned to spend lots of time on the beach and by the pool. This is where we were disappointed. The pool area received little sun (at least at this time of year), was crowded and somewhat dirty. The beach was also shrouded in shade from the hotel itself (again, this may only be at this time of year). There were hundreds upon hundreds of beach chairs making it very difficult to navigate. The beach itself was littered with cigarette butts, plastic cups, cans, etc. The food and beverage service on the beach was extremely slow and sporadic; completely unreliable. On a more positive note, both of the hotel restaurants were very good, particularly Tuscany (dinner only). Both the outside bar and the lobby bar provided reasonably fast service for both drinks and a light menu. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, but found the property to be below Marriott standards, and, on the whole, only average.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to marriot quality”
Reviews.Author: Heidi S
Reviews.Content: Where to begin--- we stay a lot in Marriots-- hubby is platinum--- this is one of my least favorites. The room smelled - was oceanfront and smelled like mildew. Was handicap accessible - not sure why we were put here as we do not require or ask for handicap rooms - fortunately, as this room would be a nightmare if you were wheelchair bound. The handle for the water in the showe is falling off the wall and it's difficult to get the shower spray to come out of only one shower head or the tub faucet--- trying to take a bath resulted in a really wet bathroom. Housekeeping not great -- the first day we left the room about 10am and returned at 2:00 p -- still hadn't been cleaned. Put the do not disturb sign up at 205-- of course that's when housekeeping left a card stating if we were not ready by three there would be no cleaning. Called at 2:40 to say we were ready--- didn't come until well after 4 ! I had requested linen change- not done. Toiletries in bathroom not refreshed/replaced. 2 nd day came at a more reasonable time in am but left pile of dirty sheets on floor- had to ask housekeeper to remove. Beach area -- there isn't any signage indicating how chair concession works.... I stood by the piles of chairs for several minutes trying to fugure out if I was supposed to just take one and drag it or what--- was there a charge--- after several minutes I gave up- and left the beach. Went to the pool are which is mostly shady--- never was approached by any staff to place order for beverage or food- never saw staff except at towel booth. We were not offered concierge access in spite of platinum status and paying for room. Our last night-- sitting in the bar--- they have dancing girls on top of the bar gyrating to a choreographed routine--- I understand there is a casino attached, but this was the hotel lobby --on a Thursday night at about 10p --- really? And what do they do for the women business travelers???? I don't care to see scantily clad young women dancing on top of the bar unless I have chosen to go to a strip club. And I really don't want to see it at the marriot. Ever. Food- really overpriced and not great. San Juan surprised me with how cutting edge their gourmet scene is -- even the moderately priced restaurants seem to make an effort with plating and presentation-- but the Marriot has done neither, and the food is what you would have found in a typical hotel chain in the 80's Bland,overpriced and steam table worthy. Let's talk about the resort fee-- hmmmm-18% for --- nothing . 20.00 in casino bucks --- oh,except you have to match that with your money so it actually costs 20.00 to use-- and you each are allowed 1 5.00 play bill per day -- we were given 4 playbills total for a three night stay for two of us. Other amenities with the resort fee--- complimentary beach chairs and umbrellas--- hmmmm only if you can lift them and carry them yourself, apparently. 2 daily bottles of water--- well, only if housekeeper leaves, and we've already covered that issue--- entertainment with live music--- never heard the live music and I think I've made my opinion clear about the live entertainment. In room coffee or tea-- yep, the little pot to make your own. High speed Internet access -- oh, except the resort fee doesnt cover the 18.95 per day fee for this - and if you are platinum you get it anyway -1 hour bicycle rental. You can ride in the busy street, I guess. No bike path that I know of. So essentially we are getting charged 16% for nothing. You can bet I'll be lobbying hard to change hotel brands if this is the Marriot way.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service !”
Reviews.Author: rubyred5
Reviews.Content: Breakfast, lunch and dinner were delicious. My husband "forgot" his bag with his wallet at the computer center. It was returned with everything intact! So despite it being a very busy hotel, I was very happy needless to say, about the attentiveness and honesty of the staff. Rooms are comfortable and extremely quiet. Bathroom was big and had lots of room for toiletries. The beds are always great the the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl60763
Reviews.Content: After having a terrible vacation just days before, we walked into the Marriott and were treated like royalty! Everything was perfect. We had a hotel room with Ocean View/Pool View. The bed was so comfortable! The room was super clean. Down at the pool and beach there was always walking around looking to take your order for drinks and or food. There were plenty of lounges for all at the beach and pool. The food in the restaurants were very good. Also reasonable. They had happy hour for drinks every day! The employees were very friendly and always willing to help you find whatever it was that you wanted. This hotel was also in walking distance of all the restaurants. We didn't need a car for the entire time! The hotel had a desk to help you find your excursions. We took a catamaran ride, snorkeling and visited the Rain forest! All lots of fun! I would defiantly go back and stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Remodeling of Lobby & Service”
Reviews.Author: Zebrust
Reviews.Content: I just completed my 10th or 12th stay at this hotel from 01/08/2012 until 01/14/2012. The newly remodeled lobby is beautiful. Instead of the vast open cocktail lounge/lobby, the new one has a new bar over to the side and smaller semi-walled off conversation areas and small lounges. The staff, as usual, went out of their way to be of assistance and always did so with a smile. The place still maintains a high level of service and cleanliness. The view from the 20th floor ocean front room was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: makaly
Reviews.Content: Our view was amazing - Oceanfront, top floor. That was the highlight. I feel this property is dated and some updates are much needed. The service was SLOW!!!! It was a holiday weekend and pretty active but not enough staff. They only had 1 poker table open and the dealer working had less of a personality than the floor she was standing on. Pretty disappointed...

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: faxdoctor
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great Location Nice Rooms Decent Service Friendly Employees Party atmosphere on the lobby lounge and casino Terrific Pools Beach location is #1 Service on the beach is very good Casino has very friendly dealers Cons: Basically just the food. They have two restaurants. The breakfast is just a step above Hampton Inn Quality but in general it is lousy. This hotel really needs to update their culinary staff and make a big improvement in food. (the servers are very nice though). The Italian restaurant got horrible reviews from our kids. They wouldn't even eat the pizza and it took 2 hours from sit down to check. This hotel could be 4+ stars if they improve the food. I will gladly go back but hope to see better dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: geejay123
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Marriott. We stayed there right after Christmas so it was very busy, as expected nice things about the hotel: Great location, close to restaurants, a Walgreens, and close enough to the old city. The beach is really lovely, great for playing in the sand and jumping wave. The rooms are nice, clean, bright and were kept quite clean by the staff. The service is good, to get drinks or food is easy and the wait time was acceptable. Fantastic pool for the kids, with a great water slide and a in-pool bar for the adults. Service was pretty good - when our son locked us out of our safe with passports and all, the security man arrived very promptly to help us out. Thank you! Some less than nice experiences to expect: We tried to check in to the hotel at 6 pm and our room was not ready. Disappointing when you have 2 kids aged 6 & 8 to entertain and feed. The lobby is beautiful but overwhelmingly bright and loud at night. I wished they would have kept the loud music in the casino. The pool and beach area were nice, but people really are all on top of each other, there is no personal space in these areas. Very limited food choices at the pool/beach. Overall average, a very decent place to stay in SJ

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to airport, plus a nice beach”
Reviews.Author: MokuleiaHi
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great for a long weekend. Clean and well maintained, and within walking distance of several very good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “not for older visitors”
Reviews.Author: benellyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, an older couple, stayed for 6 nights, January l0th to January l6, 2012. We found the entry to the hotel noisy and garish with loud music and flashing videos in the evening, the grounds of the hotel not attractively landscaped or designed, the pool furniture basic, the beach too crowded. It's a very large, commercial hotel, its grounds and beach not expansive enough to acomodate the number of guests. We stayed at the Marriott in Phoenix last year and found this Marriott sadly disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and inefficient”
Reviews.Author: idesign65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this "resort" for two days before we left for our cruise. We wanted something right on the beach so we could get our vacation started right away... We check in and wait for about 25 minutes. There were only two people ahead of us. I still cannot figure out for the life of me, what took so long. We get to our room, and it is furnished nicely. What you would expect from a marriott. Our room had a great view, we were on the corner, so we had a view of the city and the beach. We check out the restaurant for dinner. I have always enjoyed Marriott's amenities. $50 for a buffet. No thank you, we had dinner at a local restaurant, which was pretty good. We wake the next morning to find out that breakfast is also grossly overpriced, at $25 a person...we went down the street and had a great breakfast for about $25 total. We asked for a late check out so we could enjoy the beach before we had to arrive at port...they would not accomodate us. Luckily we could leave our bags at the bell desk. The beach is nice, the water is warm. If you are looking for somewhere to put your head down for a night or two, this is fine for that. But don't expect much more.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: cathym1035
Reviews.Content: This was the third time we stayed here. Great location. Easy to walk to shops and restaurants. Every issue was addressed quickly and professionally. Safe wont open - security was there within 10 -15 minutes. Even got a call from the front desk while we waited to assure us security would be there shortly. Room key stopped working. I was dreading going downstairs to get a new key then come back up again. I used the hallway phone to call front desk -they immediately sent security with my new key. Always had enough fresh towels and room was clean. They say it is a public beach but it feels like a private beach. Hotel employees set up your chair and umbrella where ever you chose no matter what time you get to the beach. No reason to run down early to reserve a chair like other resorts. Pool had plenty of seating but staying in the sun was a challenge. ( being our 3rd time here we knew this) The lobby is recently update . One thing I did miss is live music. If I remember correctly they had a steel band by the pool on weekends one of the other times we were there. Now they have piped in music it is OK but some live music would have been nicer at least on weekends. Also the lobby now has only a DJ. Service is efficient and professional. We had a corner room and told the front desk we were celebrating my husband's birthday and wanted a room with a great view. We were even willing to wait. We also told them we have been here a few times in the past. The room was overlooking a roof top on one side and ocean front on the other. We didn't bother to try to change it was fine, but next time I would make sure to have the other corner with a view of the pool on one side and ocean front on the other. They did send us a nice cheese platter and bottle of wine for my husband's birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, nice beach and kind fun loving staff.”
Reviews.Author: Balddutchguy
Reviews.Content: Good experience with lots of good restaurants and within a quick can rider just about anything San Juan. Would recommend for all. We were here 1/12-1/16

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paco M
Reviews.Content: Ok, we came here mainly because of the barnd and we were not disappointed. The bonus of having the casino is a big plus (although I never met one person who won a dim in the casino in my one weeks stay)! Food is good and a little over priced but service was fantastic. We would go back for sure but next time will stay for 4 or 5 nights as 7 is maybe too much.

Reviews.Title: “LOBBY BAR LOVE TI”
Reviews.Author: VERONICA S
Reviews.Content: MY HUSBAND AND I VISITED THE HOTEL ON 14 JANUARY 2012. THIS DAY WAS THE OPENING OF THE LOBBY BAR. The hotel had FREE FOOD AND DRINK FOR CUSTOMERS THAT WAS A GOOD surprises for us. I must mention that the biggest surprise was the service offered by YADIRA the lobby bar bartender. she smile all the time and was very friendly even thought they had a rush. VERY GOOD MUSIC BUT NOT LIVE LATIN MUSIC. We recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Hidden Resort Fees”
Reviews.Author: Andy J
Reviews.Content: I realized after getting my bill that this hotel adds "resort fees" for things such as internet and pool towels that are not included in the daily rate or local taxes. My room rate was $270/night. The resort fees added another $43 per day, whether I used the resort facilities that day or not. These daily fees can really add up if you stay for several days. Why does Marriott not just include these fees in the daily rate to avoid sticker shock at checkout? Otherwise, I found the hotel to be comfortable and in a safe area. The beach and pool areas are also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: LuieLuie
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this resort. We got in at 2AM and there was a LOUD party going on at the lobby. We were worried because we were here for a relaxing vacation so the guy at the reception put us on the 18th floor. I just forgot to ask for a room away from the elevator. But at this height, you won't hear the party downstairs. The room is large and the bathroom is nice. You have to pay a resort fee of about $70 for the entire stay and that covers internet as well. I like that it is right by the beach. There are also 2 shallow pools but they were ice cold to me - maybe because it was December. We walked around the casino jut to check it out but we didn't play. We also did not try the breakfast at the hotel nor the restaurant downstairs. The location of this hotel is great since there are a lot of restaurants that you could walk to. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: ritchie70
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from late Dec 2011 to early Jan 2012. We had one of the corner rooms with two balconies. The smaller balcony overlooked the beach and ocean. The larger overlooked another building and a rooftop. The corner rooms on the other side of the hotel would have overlooked the pool instead of a rooftop. The smaller balcony had a side table and two chairs. No furniture on the bigger balcony, which does have an angled view of the ocean. I don't think we would stay here again. There wasn't anything seriously wrong, just a lot of minor things. It's a nice enough hotel in general. Here's a bunch of just general thoughts. 1. When we checked in, there were hairs on the bathroom floor and a q-tip in the toilet. 2. Room photos show a chair with ottoman, but there was only a chair. Because of the layout of the corner rooms there isn't really room for either one, but my pregnant wife has been sleeping in chairs a lot so we really needed it. I called "at your service" and they sent one. 3. The only place on or near the beach or pool with anything except chaise lounges was the oceanfront bar. Usually in our experience a pool will have some tables with chair-height chairs, and we would have really appreciated that. I don't think she would have had fun getting off the chaise if she'd gotten on one. 4. Internet access is included in the hefty resort fee, but nobody told us that until checkout. The landing page when you use the internet says it's $18.95 a day and will be billed to your room, so we only used it two days of our week-long stay. I bought the data plan for my iPad and used that. When we complained that we weren't told, they did take $25 off the bill. ($25 is the price of the iPad data plan.) 5. Hefty resort fee. On our highest days it was around $50 a day. It appears to be a percentage of the room rate, which is just wrong. If you're going to have a resort fee it should either be per person or per room, not a percentage of room rate. That's just blatantly hiding a rate increase. 6. I was served under-cooked chicken at the Italian restaurant. When I complained, they took it away and made me another dinner that appeared to be properly cooked, and made my wife a new meal as well. I wish they would have asked what I wanted them to do instead; I would have been happy with another order of the side veggies and some soup or something. After the first uncooked chicken I wasn't really excited about the second one. 7. As always, hotel food and drink prices were absurdly high. $40 at the oceanfront bar for a quesadilla, turkey wrap, fruit and 2 sodas. 8. The Latin restaurant was pretty good. We had dinner there once and the food was excellent. We tried another night, but were told (after our drink order was taken) that they had a buffet that night. 9. The beach was pretty nice. If you're about beach, it's much nicer than the one at the Renaissance La Concha resort, which is in easy walking distance. It's a public beach, but the hotels are built so it's kind of hard to actually get to except through a hotel. 10. The maid service was kind of uneven. They did a better or worse job from day to day, and did more or less. They always made the bed and left fresh towels, and the rest doesn't really matter that much. I think the hotel was pretty full, so they were probably moving fast. 11. Bottled water in the bathrooms every day. Two bottles. Nice touch, probably for people concerned about drinking the tap water or using it for brushing their teeth. I used tap water based on information before i traveled that the tap water would be fine in tourist areas and suffered no ill effects. 12. If you need to gamble, the casino is adequate but it seemed really small. Keep in mind that we were in Vegas in August. 13. Resort fee was not included in prepaid amount. We booked online at Marriott.com and took the lowest, prepaid amount. They told the total price with resort fee, but didn't charge my card for that amount; they charged the base rate and taxes without the resort fee. It wasn't a problem for us but I could see scenarios (like someone giving a gift) where it could have been a real problem. Just be aware. 14. The bed was really soft and felt old to me. We are used to a really firm bed, so we were sore and didn't sleep very well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Nick L
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel hoping for an easy, enjoyable family getaway during the cold winter months in the Northeast U.S. The San Juan Marriott was exactly what we had hoped. A 15-minute cab ride from the airport ($20 including tip), direct access to the beach and a great pool with waterslide. Our kids (3 and 5) loved the waterslide - our oldest must have gone down 300 times - and the beach with its umbrella and chair service was ideal. Food was good and reasonably priced, though I would recommend venturing a little off the hotel grounds to enjoy a better variety of food. The staff was courteous and helpful. If you're looking for a place to hang by the beach and/or pool with your kids, this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway in San Juan!!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie K
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Marriott January 6 through January 9th. Check-in was seamless, our reservation was for an oceanfront room, we upgraded to a corner oceanfront room for a mere $25 per night, room 1917, and were allowed to check in early. Thrilled we upgraded, much more space, views of ocean and city amazing, the room layout was a bit awkward, and the city side balcony could benefit with a few chairs. Our room was extremely clean, and housekeeping kept it that way. The staff from the front desk to the beach boys was friendly. Enjoyed the lobby lounge, though a bit high end price wise for drinks, people watching made for some great entertainment one particular evening. Wouldn't suggest dining in the hotel, the only misstep we made was having the buffet the first day since we were a bit travel weary, spent $100 for two buffets and two margaritas, food wasn't deserving of the $35 price. That was the only downside of the trip. We opted out of renting a car, best decision. Driving looked challenging from a pedestrian perspective, the taxi ride from the aiport to the hotel added a few gray hairs. Taxi was $18 to the aiport, $15 to Old San Juan. Walked tons, bring comfy shoes. Old San Juan is a must, just spectacular sites to see, food to enjoy, culture, architecture, people, just everything, wish we could have spent more time exploring ... we will another trip.
