There are plenty of places to eat close to the hotel, the Walgreens like the other reviews prior to ours, is close for miscellaneous items one may have forgotten. San Juan has much to offer: fine dining, music, abundant history, friendly people, amazing scenery, that gorgeous ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort In a Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: OahuHawaii
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and have always enjoyed it. My husband is Platinum level w/Marriott, so we have been upgraded to a first class room always. Wonderful view of The Caribbean Sea in each of the rooms. Parking is in a large garage on site. Rooms are not that large, but never the less, very clean and well done...AND comfy. It did not matter to us that the room was not that large, as the only thing we are in the room for is to sleep, shower, get dressed and leave. Others, spend a bit of time in their room...so these rooms might not be optimum. One room had a balcony w/chairs & tables...others did not. Easy check-in. Hotel lobby is always full of action...which we LOVE. Side cafe to get a coffee/tea/pastry. In the evenings, the lobby lounge is quite alive...with vibrant salsa music & the such. Many folks dancing to the beat. Music is a bit loud, but very nice. The casino on site is a very busy one with alot of locals. A really nice feel, even though it is not that big. They come around with cocktails, sandwiches, ice cream, soups on a large tray every so often, by one of the waitresses. Take what you want & tip. Very nice. Pool is good size, not huge. There is a pool bar, but is rather nasty and has never been open anytime we have been there. Outside restaurant as well. SOMETIMES, there is music entertainment. Beach is a few steps down. We have sat out there one time, it just did not have a good feel. BUT, walking the strip of beach on the Condado is very nice and quite long, in either direction. It is pleasant. Marriott members can go upstairs to the lounge...for breakfast, drinks, snacks. They check keys for level. Wonderful view. Good service thru out the complex. Resort is in a wonderful location...so easy to walk to other bars, shops, casinos and restaurants. It is also a short cab ride away to the Old Town(say, 12 minutes...$15.00 or so). We have always felt safe on property. We really like this resort and would return anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, some should-expects”
Reviews.Author: Mellie0463
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 12/27/12 to 1/1/12. Overall, the resort was great, offering everything you needed on-site (bars, tour desk, gift shop, coffee shop, restaurants, pool and beach access). Although my comments seem negative, our experience was actually pleasant and I do think we got the best of the best in San Juan. These are all things that would have been good-to-knows or should-expects before we traveled. With the exception of one great bartender and coffee shop barista, the overall service at the resort was not fabulous. Waiters and beach attendants did not go out of their way to service you (if you wanted something, you found them) and you inevitably would find groups standing around eating or counting their tips (while working) and in one instance two gentlemen yelling at each other at the beachside grille while customers dined. The tour desk offered a little bit of everything daily, but plan ahead because the tours book quickly and the two tour desk attendants we encountered were nothing short of rude and nasty and asking questions of them was unthinkable. The resort does a great job at offering a wide array of food and drink choices (for someone who watches their sugars, I was extremely thankful for the array of sugar free flavors in the coffee shop). Typical resort prices - we ate at the buffet restaurant one time and although it was great, we opted for local dining and fast food restaurants (Wendyâ€™s, Subway, Dunkin Donuts, Starbucks) for breakfast, snacking and dinner. We ate off the poolside/beachside grille menu for lunches daily because the food was PHENOMENAL, the prices were reasonable for the portion sizes, and who doesnâ€™t love to eat poolside surrounded by palm trees. The pool and beach were gorgeous but the high tides made sitting at the beach impossible and since the hotel towered over the pool, it was hard to find a sunny place to sit and the water was ice cold. The pool bar was open from above ground but the actual pool bar stool side of the bar wasnâ€™t and getting a bartender to service you from above was also nearly impossible. The resort offered â€œactivitiesâ€� but nothing you would expect, childrenâ€™s cookie decorating was standing in line while the lady at the towel desk squeezed bagged frosting on your cookie and salsa lessons was a loud speaker with an instructor squeezing the group in between beach chairs at the pool. The rooms were clean and in a good location, our partial oceanview room was actually perfect and sitting on the balcony every morning was a relaxing highlight of the trip. As in most Marriott hotels, the walls are paper thin and we could hear the neighbors loud and clear. The rooms did offer the essentials (hair dryer, coffee pot, safe) including the added bonus of complimentary bottled water daily. I canâ€™t attest to the nightlife or the spa but the casino was great and the only evening entertainment we needed. The most disappointing part of our trip was NYE. I called the hotel before I booked and asked again when we arrived and were promised a traditional New Years Eve party open to all hotel guests. The party and lobby bar were actually closed to ticket holders only (sold out before we new the gig) and the conference room they set up for the remainder of the guests was mostly teenagers and the only bar offering beverages was limited in choices and high in prices. As a side note, the hotel is also in walking distance to local gift shops/boutiques which was nice for a quick relief from the sun.

Reviews.Title: “All the Comforts of Home Conveniently Located Abroad.”
Reviews.Author: JessicaYork
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico is a great destination for American's because it's a US territory. To a US tourist it means that you don't need your passport, change currency or change your cell plan (check with your carrier just in case). If you like a clean and classy room, good food, killer views and a great location - then you'll LOVE the Marriott in San Juan, Puerto Rico. And although it has some conveniences of home, Puerto Rico has all the wonders of an exotic tropical destination. First, when traveling abroad sometimes it's nice to go with a chain because the level of service and quality is usually high. Very true in this case. Secondly, they are literally on the sand. A gorgeous beach with lounge chairs free to all guests. My room had floor to ceiling windows that faced the ocean - nothing but water as far as the eye could sea ... or ocean in this case. The deck facing said amazing scenery was as wide as my room (which was quite wide). Some other reasons you might choose this hotel - the lounge band has a fantastic local vibe and draws a fun and friendly local crowd ... in fact, this is where many locals go to get their groove on. And even though this hotel lobby lounge turns into the it-spot on the island - I never heard a beat of it in my room. It's a great way to vacation like a local without leaving your hotel. But you can leave your hotel. I felt very safe around the hotel. There are great restaurants close by and even a Walgreens (hate to say it - but sometimes it's nice to see one when you forget something). Although it's not IN Old San Juan proper - the picturesque port is very close. Just a short taxi ride away - or for the more adventurous - a bike tour into Old San Juan (that I highly recommend) which leaves right from the hotel. The hotel food is surprisingly good (hey - it's hotel food). Once discovered, I ordered the coconut shrimp ceviche almost every night and the breakfast buffet is not-to-be-missed. The pool is nice - but why waste your time when that beautiful beach is two steps away. Overall - if you want a guaranteed great experience - with a bit of local flavor - the San Juan Marriott (with Casino) is a good bet!

Reviews.Title: “Ist time to San Juan PR”
Reviews.Author: trapper0613
Reviews.Content: Dec.19 thru 23 2011. My first time in San Jaun. I was impressed with the Marriot. High end accomodations. The resort was fabulous and the service and cleanliness was first rate. I found the prices for food and drinks were quite high. $8.50 for mixed drink, $6.00 for 6oz of draft beer..... I am used to Orlando and the Disney prices so my comment is no small thing. The area around the resort (walking distance) was nice, clean and there were shops and restaurants. I ate in the nearby restaurants due to the high prices of the resort. this is in the new San Juan area, taxi is required to visit old San Juan. I came for the purpose of seing as much of the island as I could. Road trips were my plan. Visited Fagardo on the east end....nice marina.....did not get to take the ferry to Culebra...maybe next time. Visited the rain forest....highly reccomend!....alot cheaper with rental car. Getting around is fairly easy but be careful to get really good directions and pay attention to them!....Hertz got me lost on my way to the hotel! Leson learned. Do Not jump on just any guided tour....do your homework...talk to the other guests. rainforest is expensive when you take the tour...I followed the advice of other guests and saved alot. And got to see more. PR is very much like the US...if youve never been there. The people are friendly even if you are a gringo. Most people speak english even in the smaller towns. road trip to salinas, south shore.....wonderful drive...good highway. Plan to travel back again as soon as I can...I really liked the island and the people. Greg

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time December 27th to January 3rd. 2012”
Reviews.Author: noemi54
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel two years ago with our daughter's family and found it to be a good place to stay so we decided to go back this year, with our son and his family. We arrived December 27 and stayed through January 3rd. The lobby has been renovated and we loved it. It was perfect for just relaxing, listening to music. No pressure to buy drinks, but enough friendly staff to get drinks if we wanted them. I will start with the only negative issue: pool is very cold since it is mostly in the shade, but why go to a pool in the Caribbean when you can relax by the ocean, right? Positives: I will start by saying that all the staff in this hotel is very friendly. I have to specially mention JESSICA HERNANDEZ, Concierge Manager. This lady is tops, she was helpful, honest in guiding us to good restaurants, always smiling, remembering our names which made us feel important!!! Also I have to mention CARLOS, also at Concierge desk...what a great guy! Next, the buffet breakfast.... SONIA, our first server was right on top of everything, juice for the kids, coffee, omelets, etc. SONNY, now he is something else. I asked for warm milk and he prepared us cups of Puerto Rican coffee, with the boiled milk which was to die for. He really made our day... On our previous trip we had enjoyed the cream of corn that was served for breakfast. This year they only had oatmeal, which was unbelievably creamy and good. On the day previous to our leaving, one of the cooks was replenishing the oatmeal and I asked her about the corn meal. She asked me when we were leaving so she would tell LUIS to prepare it for us. Next day, not expecting to get it, I asked for LUIS. Sure enough, SONNY came out with two bowls of the most delicous corn meal ever. I was shocked, and soo happy. I gave SONNY a tip to give to LUIS and two minutes later LUIS came to our table to return the tip and say that he was only doing his job and what happy to be able to please us... WOW.... that is service! We must also thank JEFFREY who set up our lounge chairs and umbrellas at the beach every day. Nice helpful guy. And by the way, umbrellas and lounge chairs are free (I dont know why other people complain of having to pay). Our housekeeper, MARIA, was great. She kept our room clean, left us enough bottles of water every day in our room, and always had a big smile. And to cap it all, on the day we were leaving, the bell boy had loaded the suitcases in our taxi so my husband went to tip him and he told him "your son already tipped me". Now that is an honest person. Unfortunately we did not get his name. So if you want a fun filled, amazing vacation, surrounded by great help from hotel employees, this is no doubt the place to go. We will be returning as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great pool! Beautiful beach! Great spa!”
Reviews.Author: Stacie01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a girls weekend and we rate this hotel as top notch! The rooms were spotless, fantastic food, reasonable spa prices, etc. The hotel is on the beach and yields spectacular views!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: hrme17
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights with a young (2.5yo) child, and were pretty satisfied with the experience. We'd also stayed at the Caribe Hilton this trip - Marriott was more to our liking. The location on the main drag in Condado was a plus. San Juan is not your typical island resort town, so you won't find a lot of tourist shopping etc., but what you will find is an upscale residential neighborhood with some great food options within a stone's throw of the hotel. The hot restaurants and cultural areas of Santurce are all within a short walk. The room itself (we were in the tower) had nice yellow and red Spanish style decor and was pretty. The A/C was a bit of a disappointment, not because of the temperature, but it was a little "windy" every time we turned it on, and the air had a slight odor. Not a big deal. There are a couple of pools; the shallower one is great for toddlers and younger children b/c they can stand in it and run around. The fountains are great to play in. The water slide is fun although it has limited hours. My one complaint: we got a little tired of the piped-in club music. Overall we found the Marriott a little pricey for what we got, but it was San Juan in the holiday season.

Reviews.Title: “December in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Darla N
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino was great. The property was very well maintained and clean. The room was very nice and balcony overlooked both the pool area and ocean. Front desk and bell boy service was excellent, and we felt very safe walking up and down streets in the near vicinity. You will need to take a cab to Old San Juan, but about $20 will get you there. Once you're in Old San Juan you can hop the trollies laced through the streets of Old San Juan, (which are free and run about every 15 minutes). Don't miss out on a tour of the fort in Old San Juan. It was amazing. Having the beach right at the hotel, and the ocean view was wonderful. The view at night was equally beautiful. We did visit the restaurant/bar outside near the beach at arrival, and was disappointed in it, for lack of service, quality of food, and price. An $80 bill for chicken wings, burger, pop & a couple beers, but in lieu of getting to see the ocean, it was a tolerable grievance. Finally, upon check out we had several hours until boarding our ship but the Marriott kept our luggage in storage until we needed it. There was no cost for the service, and it was very much needed and appreciated..... We will definitely visit this hotel when we return to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: kdub73
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Puerto Rico for his 40th birthday. It was a surprise trip to a destination we had never visited. I chose this resort based on Trip Advisor reviews. The staff was amazing!!! Check-in was slow, but our 18th floor corner room was well worth the wait! We opened both balcony doors and never once touched the thermostat! The elevator got stuck on the first venture to our room, not a great start, but when my husband mentioned our (less than 5min) delay to the front desk, they sent a cheese tray and bottle of wine with a sincere apology note! Everyone we encountered was nice and very helpful. My only caution would be that cash is not accepted for the beach bar and we normally prefer cash to credit cards. We will definitely return to this Marriott...very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Area still needs improvement - Condado”
Reviews.Author: pattiboston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott San Juan on Christmas Day for 5 nights. The property is well-kept and the rooms are very nice. We upgraded to ocean view and this is a MUST. We were on the 11th floor and the rooms were large with a good size bathrooms. The rooms were what you expect at a Marriott. The casino was fine for a hotel casino, but the bar/lobby was odd. Bad music at night and bright as can be. Not an intimate setting. They should have live music, there was none while we were there. The beach is beautiful but beware, the hotel blocks the sun so you have to sit in either the left or right side of the beach, not directly in front of the hotel if you want to sun-bathe. Also - the surf was so bad that the waves would come up and cover at least half of the beach - like a mini tsunami. Also very odd. The area around the hotel, well, let's just say, this is no carribean island. While sitting al fresco in a nearby restaurant across from the the hotel, we would routinely see at least 8 police cars come up the street. I never felt very safe in this area. If you go one block past the Walgreens, there are abandoned buildings and not a friendly clientele. We needed to be buzzed into Baskin Robbins for security. There are some good restaurants on Ashford - no need to make reservations -

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual Marriott standards, but still pleasant”
Reviews.Author: careertutor
Reviews.Content: 30 family members came to this Marriott for a week for a destination wedding, so one comes pre-programmed to have a good time despite shortfalls in service: this is the first time I've been disappointed in Marriott service, and ironically two of our party were management staff, one from a mainland Marriott and one from corporate HQ. No matter: promised pickups from the airport did not occur, and several responsibilities of the wedding planner were executed badly (gift distribution to guests' rooms) or not at all (wedding day schedule, location). Daily cleaning was spotty and used shampoos etc. were not replenished. A lush bath rug (not the skimpy mat) mysteriously disappeared and was not replaced until I called, two days in a row. Counters were not well cleaned, coffee tray left a mess. Wine glasses had to be called for, disappeared every morning and not replaced, policy I was told but that was unnecessarily inconvenient. Light outside closet was broken, had to make a call to repair it. A gaping hole in balcony where railing attached to concrete was just plain scary. That said, service staff always delivered with a smile, and one took 5 minutes to identify restaurants where locals eat. Overall, a big shock after the standards of service I've experienced in other Marriotts over three decades, for a Marriott just updated to make its lobby more upscale. City location part of the problem: to the right off the balcony was a great ocean view, but in front and to the left: miles of ugly grey concrete, fancy condos juxtaposed between unfinished and abandoned buildings and tourist memento stores. Why this location? And why so little local flavor? My biggest gripe about chain anything is they all might as well be in Bayonne, NJ. No attempt to provide atmosphere or local cuisine, even the hot sauce was standard tabasco, not the rich concoction with red pepper flakes and other flavors served in more authentic establishments. My cousin was the groom, in the vice presidential suite on the top floor, and yes, the executive lounge was closed half the time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: reynoldsBA
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the Marriott San Juan.... Great staff, excellent service, fabulous location. Easy access to tourist sites. Good restaurants close by. Safe neighborhood. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “And loving It!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladeep0110
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino one night prior to boarding for our cruise. I have traveled to PR several times and stayed in various properties, but this one takes the cake! The ride from the airport to the hotel via taxi was quite inexpensive ($16+$1 per bag) and while the scenic route to the hotel is not very scenic at all with all the grafitti, abandoned buildings and tiny roads, it was all worth it to arrive at this property. Keep in mind this is PR, not Beverly Hills so the neighborhood in which it sits looks run down, but don't let that distract you unless your that much of a stuffed shirt. We arrived and were greeted by the friendly doormen and security officers. We had to wait in line about ten minutes, but while we waited we sipped on some nice bubbly, yum. We had a brief encounter with a rude check in agent, but that wasn't going to distract our trip. The room was a city view and huge by PR standards. It had a nice crisp, clean look and the view was great. I am an extreme germaphobe and I have stayed in five star PR properties that don't hold a match to this room. I inspected the room thoroughly and I was pleasantly surprised by just how clean it was. The balcony was a nice touch to the room. The only issue we had was that our toilet was leaking and water was all over our floor in the bathroom, but within minutes maintenance was up to resolve this issue and apologized for the inconvenience. The property grounds were lush, the casino was small but nice and entertainment was loud and fun. The business center is a bit challenging to find, but they are opened 24 hours a day with employee at the desk to assist you. We slept like babies in our large queen/queen beds with comfortable pillows atop. There aren't many television stations, but who wants to watch tv in San Juan right? The next morning we ate the breakfast buffet and I am still dreaming about how delicious the food was. We sat out on the patio area so that we could look out to the private beach attached to the back of the hotel. Our waiter was very nice and the fruit was so fresh and delicious. The croissants and french toast required a second trip and the breakfast potatoes and sausage couldn't have been better. We were super sad that we didn't stay an additional night, but next time we will. There is a delicious burger spot across the street and cap it off with a scoop of ice cream from Haagen Dazs next door. If your going on a cruise, you may want to take a quick walk a block or so down from the property to the Walgreens to purchase those last minute items and it wasn't the average "tourist" Walgreen prices, it was aligned right with our average prices here in Chicago. Taxi from the hotel to Royal Caribbean cruise pier was around $20. Can't wait to return to the Marriott San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: Jenks58
Reviews.Content: This hotel was undergoing renovation of the lobby bar when I was there, which made it a building site. It will be much improved when completed. However, it's a tired, beaten up hotel with the feel of a cheap South Lake Tahoe casino about it - there's a small downmarket casino in the lobby area. The pool area is small, but the hotel is on the beach. I was seated by a wall in the breakfast restaurant and noticed food spattered on the wall - nice - reminiscent of a dirty burger bar. The room smelt musty and is somewhat motel in style. Generally not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to hang out - even with young kids”
Reviews.Author: K K
Reviews.Content: When we were looking for places to stay, we looked for kid friendly places. This hotel popped up. After reading up on all the reviews, decided to book the hotel. We went through orbitz and found a great deal. Orbits gave us the option to book a city view room or beach view room. We opted to upgrade and get the ocean view room. It was amazing and worth the $25/day extra to be able to get up and look at the ocean. It is located in a very safe area with good number of restaurants walking distance. There is a bus stop that will take you to Old San Juan just on the right of the hotel. The restaurant that we enjoyed the most was Pure and Natural. Really good fruit/vegetable juices. Very nice overall food. The kids had a blast going to the beach (right behind the hotel) and a nice swimming pool with a hot spa right off of that swimming pool. Even though I don't enjoy the water a whole lot, I was in the hot tub every chance I got. I would go to that hotel again and recommend it to anybody who is planning to be in Puerto Rico. The other two hotels that I heard good things about are : Hilton and Caribe Hilton (both next to each other). It does have a Casino, but the way the hotel is set up, you don't even see it from the entrance to your rooms. This way, it is not a distraction for the kids :-).

Reviews.Title: “not impressed by the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: hurwitza
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at both the Marriott and Caribe Hilton before and after a cruise, respectively. I will include the same review for both, since it seems appropriate for comparison purposes. The Marriott is closer to Condado and the central action therein. This includes restaurants, Walgreens, and Starbucks. The Hilton, on the other hand, is at the outer limits of Condado and requires a good walk to get to Old San Juan or the rest of Condado. This said, as a hotel/resort, the Caribe Hilton is head and shoulder above the Marriott. The latter is worn and dated, with the exception of the lobby. The casino at the Marriott is not particularly niceâ€”more like a low-grade Vegas joint. The Hilton feels more like a tropical resort with itâ€™s open-air lobby, large pools, developed beach area, and multitude of dining options. The Hilton does not have a casino. I truly believe that the Marriott is WAY over-priced for what it currently offers. The Hilton is closer to a reasonable value. The staff at both properties are only partially helpful. We found most of the service in San Juan to be mediocre at best this trip. People were very disinterested in helping visitors. That was disappointing overall. Late checkout was a challenge at both hotelsâ€”Hilton charged me $75 to leave one of our 2 rooms at 3 PM, yet the other room was not cleaned until 2:30 PM. Itâ€™s a game with them. Be warnedâ€”if you are coming for New Yearâ€™s Eve, the Hilton hosts many parties and the restaurants are booked well-ahead. There is considerable hubbub from local residents attending the parties, so be preparedâ€¦.itâ€™s not really a family atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Worst elite member treatment and poor holiday service”
Reviews.Author: IanWK
Reviews.Content: Nice facilities and location BUT... - despite thet fact that they market the hotel as having an executive lounge they shut it down during my stay and do so routinely during peak season and on weekends. The provide to other benefit to offset this inconvenience and are brash in letting you know they are not required to provide this since they are a resort This is basically spitting on elite members. - they actually did not even provide newspapers during the peak holiday weeks. My stay started during the week of new years but extended past. Right after the peak crowd left they reopened the resort and started putting out newspapers. This is purely BAD management and bad customer service. - low quality towels are an annoyance. Somehow the afternoon batch seems to stink everyday as well which makes one question how they do the mid day wash. +'s: - location is great. Excellent restaurants And easy access to old san juan - great beach however they could keep it cleaner - hotel facilities in good shape overall - room was virtually soundproof

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Psusan1212
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at this beautiful Hotel in November and we loved everything about it! the location was perfect 10 min to airport & 15min to Old San Juan .. we felt very safe due to police detail outside of the hotel at all time .. we booked a package that included this hotel so I don't know how much it usually costs to stay there but trust me its work the money .. everyone one at this hotel was helpfull .. polite and most importantly welcoming!!! we had a great time & thank you to Nicole Concierge for booking our snorkeling trip!!! we had an amazing time and we cant wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Condado”
Reviews.Author: WoohooBeach
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was a good choice for a family staying at Condado beach. We got our rooms at 5:30 PM because housekeeping was delayed but the staff was great, we got a credit for both rooms and drink coupons. Even though the hotel was sold out, they were able to put us in connecting rooms which made our stay even better. The beach chairs, umbrellas and towels were all free and the service was great. There are great restaurants and shops walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Expensive essentials”
Reviews.Author: Virag J
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort with a wonderful location. It is situated on the very busy and happening Ashford Avenue in the Condado area of San Juan and is a few hundred feet from La Concha hotel and a walgreens. Ashford Avenue has plenty of restaurants and a walgreens, subway, chili's - are all within walking distance. This resort has a couple of pools though they are not heated and a hot tub. It also has 2 restaurants and an oceanfront cafe. Food is average but on the expensive side. Internet is around $19/day, parking is another $15 for self park and $20 for valet. If you want the internet, paying a resort fee MAY be more economical alternative which also gets you beach chairs which are not free. We booked via priceline and paid $145/night plus valet. We also paid $25/night to upgrade to a upper level (14th floor) pool facing room in the main tower which is really an ocean view as well without the extra $75/night upgrade fee. My advice is to book via priceline and pay $25 extra to upgrade. You MUST take a higher level in the main tower for it to be worthwhile. Breakfast is not usually included and is roughly another $20/person. We were on a cruise after our stay and when we returned, we had the bell captain hold our luggage for free for a few hours (another bell captain had asked for $3/bag - go figure.) Overall a GREAT resort and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and in convenient area but dated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Parsippany1986
Reviews.Content: Party of 10, all with corner rooms. Ones ending with 09 have the best views of ocean and beach areas. Choose hotel based on tripadvisor reviews so knew what to expect. Pros: Excellent area if you want to go outside the hotel and walk around although it was disconcerting to see so many police. Many good and diverse restaurants within walking distance Local market a couple blocks on left and you can buy water, snacks, etc - cheaper than Walgreens Walgreens down the street, and Starbucks and Hagen daz across the street Food in hotel restaurants very good, not cheap, but good Casino was well equipped with many different types of slots and tables Staff friendly and accommodating, usually came to clean rooms earlier in the day Staff on beach very helpful with umbrellas and chairs Close to airport, taxi are about $30 Taxi to old San Juan $15 Cons: Rooms could use updating; one of our table lamp had broken on/off switch. A/c in 817, vent right over bathroom so it was freezing sitting at the desk but warmer by the bed. We had it cranked down low so clothes, paper all felt damp Disappointing pool area. Looked much larger in pictures. Small kiddie pool and right below larger deeper pool but still small. Both pools mostly in the shade and water very cold! Hot tub by deeper pool. No pool service for drinks or food. Good hotel and well located but read the reviews and be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great views”
Reviews.Author: shellyleyva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August. My husband and I and our 13 year old daughter. The lobby was under construction at the time so all we saw of it was sheetrock and plastic tarps. the rest of the hotel was beautiful. The rooms were good sized and the amenities were great. We paid less for a pool view room but we had a full view of the ocean. I can not comment on the restaurants as we did not use them, but the location was fantastic. We were only there for two days after a cruise and it really met our needs. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation with kids”
Reviews.Author: cutemomoftwocutekids
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great option if you are vacationing with children. There are many restaurants on site and the pool (& hot tub) is very family-friendly. The service is excellent as well. We had a problem with our shower head and after we called the front desk an engineer arrived within 5 minutes to fix it. The hotel is a bit tired and dated, even with the newly remodeled reception area, but the service makes up for it. The bartenders at the pool bar are very friendly and give lots of advice on where to dine in the area, especially if you want to try Puerto Rican cuisine. I'm glad we didn't spend a lot more money to stay elsewhere because our kids really enjoyed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Beach”
Reviews.Author: Gus S
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 6 night stay at Marriot. Beautiful Ocean Beach..clean. Pool is ony 4 feet deep and covered with shade most of the day. Beach food is excellent. We tried the onsite buffet for Christmas Day Buffet. The food was OK but we felt it was way over priced for what was offered. Lots of surrounding resturants to choose from. We especially liked Alibaba ( Turkish, Middleastern). Our room phones did not work after day 2 of 6 of our stay. Asked Front desk to fix. They said they would but never did..We did not call again. Had some nice bath robes but those were taken with used towels and not returned. Again, requested repleacement on day 2...promised that shoudlnot be a problem..never happened!!! We checked out at 9:15..only to realize tht if we had checked out by 9:00 Am, we would have had $50 credit for breakfast that morning. That info was on the checkout papers they slide under your door the night before you leave..well we never read the second page till later. Asked the Hotel if thye can still honor the offer but they said no!!

Reviews.Title: “Best service on the island with diana Fernandez at the breakfast restAurant.”
Reviews.Author: Ab32102
Reviews.Content: Diana Fernandez was the BEST server we had on the whole island. She was so attentive, polite, And went above and beyond to make our time perfect. She made sure the chef made food to our specific dietary restrictions and we were in a hurry and she got us our food quickly, something very rare in puerto Rico! We cant thank her enough. She made our trip!

Reviews.Title: “return trip to marriott”
Reviews.Author: couturecorgi
Reviews.Content: overall this spot has a lot to offer. its right on the beach and in a pretty good location too. the casino is not very nice the machines are antiquated didnt notice any new slot machines since i went there 2 years ago. i am a casino goer and i play slots and blackjack and thought the casino itself is a joke. the other thing is the towels in the rooms are not very plush for the price. the woman at the tour desk was very slow and i waited to find out that the tour i wanted to do was not available after waiting approx 45 mins. back to the casino they offer these cheesy coupons for table games they match your bet so for every 5 bux you bet you get 5 bux free also a joke how bout 50 bux in free slot play ?? sheets in the beds are nice and the beds are very comfortable. i booked rather last minute for xmas eve checking out xmas day and still feel like i got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, friendly staff, excellent tour desk!”
Reviews.Author: ddsnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot Resort & Casino in December, 2011. It was prior to the busy rush season which starts in late December. We were very impressed by the newly renovated lobby, which includes ample seating and a very modern bar. In the evening there is music and a small dance area near the bar. The beach is very clean and well maintained! There is a bus that runs to and from Old San Juan from the hotel, however it runs every 30-45 minutes but not on a set schedule (We were told "The buses come when they arrive!"). We opted for taxis to take us to/from Old San Juan, which was about $15 each way. We were most impressed by the travel desk in the hotel (which is run by a private/separate company). When we planned our trip to PR, we had anticipated to rent a car to visit the biobay, caves and the rainforest. However the travel desk in the hotel arranges group tours to all of these sites. The tour includes a tour guide driver, transfers, and stops at local restaurants on the way to/from the destination. We arranged zip-lining, a tour of the rainforest, a tour of the caves and kayaking through the tour desk and were very happy!! The tours were great! The concierge was helpful in terms of making our dinner reservations. Our only disappointment was the spa, which had good service however our reservation was mixed up TWICE.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business, nice beach”
Reviews.Author: wirelessbob
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino for five days in December 2011. I attended a conference held at the conference on the ground floor. In addition to attending the conference I spent some time at the beach, pool, and a little time around the area. The checkin was easy enough, though a bit disorganized with no obvious line. The area between the checkin and the bar is a bit narrow, but it would still be nice to have some signage on where to queue when there is a line. I upgraded to the direct ocean front room and did not regret it. The room was forward facing directly on the ocean. The furnishings in the room were typical for a Marriott. The beach was very nice in December with plenty of space, chairs, and umbrellas. The surf was rough but great for body surfing and boogie boarding. There was a rather strong current so you need to be mindful to avoid the rocks or cement wall on either side of their beach. The pool has a great water slide. It could be a bit deeper to facilitate swimming laps. There is a poolside bar. It would be nice if the hotel rented beach equipment like boogie boards. The bar is very modern with dancing on the bar by attractive women a few nights a week. There was a dance floor there but the music was far too loud for anyone to actually dance. Standard drinks were crazy expensive. The quality of the mixed drinks was average and the variety of different alcohols was not extensive (more kinds of rum, more kinds of tequila needed). In terms of the meeting facilities, they seemed to be adequate for our workshop of about 120 people. There were a number of large meeting rooms and at least two workshops in parallel when we were there. For our meeting we had a reception, continental breakfast every day, private lunch in one of the restaurants, and a banquet one evening. The signage was not good so we had some people not attending our workshop at these events as well. The reception was especially overrun by other people at the hotel. It would be good for the hotel to be a bit more diligent about making sure random people don't show up at our events (having signs at a minimum indicating this is a private function). The food we had was average but perhaps was not the most expensive. The area around the hotel consists of other hotels, some older restaurants, and some newer restaurants. The area does not seem especially nice but did seem reasonably safe. I did not feel there were many authentic restaurants around. There were several restaurants for walking but not much night-life with only a few bars. The concierge was well meaning but not very informed. Tried to get the names of local places for dancing. The concierge even called to confirm the music that places were playing. We visited one place and found that indeed they were playing dancing music but there was no dance floor! Overall, the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino made for a good stay at least for business. The ocean front-view was outstanding and the beach very nice. A bit more organization and attention to detail would make it better. No major complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: TerryM27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night prior to our cruise. I have never been a big fan of San Juan, but the friendly staff, beautiful resort, and excellent location definitely changed my mind. I actually wish that we had been able to stay a couple of more nights! There are plenty of great places to eat within walking distance of the hotel. There is a Starbucks right across the street, and a Walgreens close by for those forgotten items. We had a balcony room, the view was absolutely beautiful. The pool area was very tropical, the beach area was well kept and clean. I look forward to the chance to return there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - recent renovation”
Reviews.Author: Papo_del_wikend
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family for 4 nights in December 2011. Hotel has been renovated since we last stayed there 2 years ago. Lobby is more modern, but appears less open than before the renovation. The check-in process was sort of clunky. You wait in line for the next available clerk, but a couple of people just walked up to clerks and started talking, etc. Those of us in line were not happy. The check-in process itself was quick and relatively painless. The room we had was a corner room with a bit more space - good as there were 4 of us. The room was very clean and all was in working order. The hotel is in the Condado area of San Juan, The area is undergoing a needed revitalization. We felt very safe walking around. Back to the hotel. The breakfast buffet in my opinion is not worth the money. The food is good, but for the buffet (no special orders), the cost is $15 / person. If you want the all inclusive (special orders and juices included) then the cost jumps to $24 / per person. If the variety of fruits, cheeses, breads, meats, and so forth was huge, then I would be happy paying the $$$, but it is not. Service was very good (Sonny) which made up for the mediocre food. The pool area is on the smaller side, but it is well maintained. The two pools are clean and nice. The beach by the hotel was fun. In the wintertime, the surf can be rough - so no young kids or inexperienced swimmers. But if you like to body surf or bogey board surf, you will have tons of fun. Overall, nice place to stay. The food is not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice surprise.”
Reviews.Author: twip
Reviews.Content: Won this on priceline, not what i was aiming for but we were very pleasantly surprised. Lobby is large and open with casino off to the side. The weekend we were there they had live band each night and the place was very full. [didnt hear them in our room either.] Pool area is very large with swim up bar. Lots of chairs to pick from. Or you can sit on the beach that is right on the doorstep. Walgreen's across the street for anything you forgot to pack. many restaurants to pick from within walking distance. Old San Juan just a short taxi to. Nice large clean room with a small balcony that overlooked the surrounding buildings. Bathroom was very big, loved the bath and body works amenities. Will add this to our list of hotels to try for on priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JudyLynneR
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another 6 day vacation at this resort hotel. We enjoyed it enough last year that we returned again. We find the hotel to be clean, comfortable, and pretty, and the staff to be friendly and accommodating. We like it that it's right on the beach. We stay in an ocean view room, and find that to be well worth the extra money. The view of the ocean is beautiful, and when we leave our balcony door open, the sound of the ocean is fantastic. Although we were told that the hotel was fully booked, there were always chaise lounges at the pool, and the pool towels were plentiful. The pool area is pretty, not exquisite,and has areas of both sun and shade. We arrange to have breakfast as part of the package, and find that to be worthwhile since breakfast is quite expensive. For those who prefer a more continental breakfast, there's a Starbucks across the street. The room size was fine, the bed was comfortable, and there were lots of luxurious pillows. There's a mini refrigerator in the room that was nice for snacks. The reason we're not giving 5 stars is because check-in was not smooth. A number of our requests were not met, and mostly, our room was not ready by the promised 4:00 pm, nor were we phoned when the room was ready as had been promised. Otherwise, we enjoyed the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, terrible events department”
Reviews.Author: Kevin K
Reviews.Content: My new wife and our families had our wedding at this hotel the 2nd week of December. The hotel staff, rooms, food and location were spectacular. We made that week a perfect week. When I say we I mean my wife and I. We booked and prepaid for a wedding at the hotel 3 months prior to the date. The events dept, specifically our planner, were as unprofessional and unprepared as any group of people as I have ever been involved with. I dont have enough time or space to write about how poor their service and attitutude was prior to and upon our arrival. If you want to get married in Puerto Rico, DON'T USE THIS HOTEL PLANNER!

Reviews.Title: “Marroit San Juan”
Reviews.Author: JayRL_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days at this resort location and found it quite good. We had ocean front rooms that had great views, balconies, and were very nicely done. Room and bath we're very clean and comfortable. The hotel has good restaurants, good beach, and casino. The The location is good, short walks to Condado restaurants, $15 cab ride to old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrganizedTourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights with a group of friends in between our cruise. The hotel is located right by a beach and is along a street with some restaurants and stores. There is a Walgreens nearby which helps with buying bottled water or other items that you might need for your vacation. It is a little far from Old Town which is about a 10 minute drive. There are two pools as well as a small casino inside. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. There is a bus stop nearby as well as taxis that are available to any guest staying at the hotel. The taxis are also contracted by the hotel so you pay a set fee to wherever you need to go within Puerto Rico. It helps having to avoid negotiating for payment while getting into a taxi. And the taxi drivers are very nice. The hotel was still undergoing some construction when we were there as they were upgrading their lobby/bar area. It is a pretty crowded hotel with a waiting line for checking in but they do offer you free rum punch or champagne as you wait in line. The staff was nice and courteous. Great place to stay if you're staying in Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Bruce B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Dec 2-9, 2011. This is our second stay at this Marriott. Everything was perfect just like our first stay. The hotel is close to everything including old San Juan. We like playing in the waves and beach so this hotel was perfect for our family. The first night we had a room by the elevator and the neighbors were very loud. The next morning the front desk moved us to a new room and everything was quite and perfect from then on. We booked the room package that included breakfast. That is how we will book all future stays at this hotel. The breakfast was always perfect and the wait staff was nothing less than perfect every day. One particular waiter (Sonny) was beyond exceptional. He made every breakfast feel like you were meeting an old friend. THANK YOU SONNY!!! All of the staff was friendly and very accomodating. WE WILL BE BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KarenMA26
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location - very close to restaurants and limited shopping on the same street. There is a bus stop just a half block from the hotel and taxis are immediately available at the hotel. There are 2 pools - one shallow pool and one deeper, though no diving is permitted. The somewhat deeper pool has a swim-up bar and a water slide. The sandy beach is nice for relaxing, though the rough Atlantic Ocean leaves a lot to be desired. The sand is constantly churned up and it would be a miracle not to end up with a pound of sand in your swim suit! The hotel's employees are all very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again, with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Hotel, P.R.”
Reviews.Author: mpolikoff
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very accommodating and helpful. The breakfast buffet was sensational and so was our waiter, Sonny, whom we requested every day. Well located and lots of things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Good Marriott, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: pikapp8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stellaris November 15-22 and found the property quite nice despite the renovation of its lobby. As a platinum Marriott member, we got access to the platinum lounge which had free breakfast, evening appetizers, dessert, and honor bar. We got an upgrade at $75 per night to the Cosmopolitan Suite on the 20th Foor. The room was huge. The living room was at least 15 by 20' with a full size dining room and private balcony overlooking the ocean. The master bedroom had a very large bathroom with oversized soaking tub and separate glass enclosed shower. We stayed on Marriott Points for 4 nights and paid $179 for the remaining 3 nights. There were two pools. The upper pool and one often in pictures at the hotel is actually a kiddie pool. The adult pool is located lower level and has a swim up bar. The property was beach front and the overall very pretty. We did not eat at the hotel because there were many decent places nearby. My Favorites were: JAMS Bistro which has everything half off on Mondays and Sundays. This place was trendy and very nice. Orozco's is an unassuming place next to the typical tourist traps (Latin Star) but is very good. Check out Yelp for more details. Overall the property is well maintained, staff is friendly, and room was large. I would come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ocean view”
Reviews.Author: joanne060
Reviews.Content: Wish we had picked this Hotel first time ! We booked out of one Hotel due to sleepless nights and moved into this one . Although not quite as grand as the first hotel we loved it, on the 14th floor with ocean view balcony --beautiful beach area as well, fantastic ! And the staff were very friendly and helpful . So all ended up well ! The pool area was closed at 11 pm every night which was great by us .. Loved being able to walk and window shop, also sitting at the pavement restaurants eating , drinking and people watching , one of my favourite pastimes ! We had a wonderful time .. We did make a mistake in hiring a car for the week, the driving there can be so freaky, not too bad on the highways and even armed with maps and google directions still so easy to get lost as alot of the streets do not appear to have sign posts , names or numbers !!....

Reviews.Title: “Nice location. Perfect for babies.”
Reviews.Author: Randajeur
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Condado, nice and safe area close to Old San Juan. The area is full of restaurants, hotels, Casinos and some boutiques and face the ocean. Few minutes drive to Old San Juan. The hotel is a big building facing the ocean. We went there (my wife, our 1 year old daughter at that time and myself) in August, just before Irene Hurricane. Although probably that was the worst season we enjoyed our holiday: the weather was warm and it rained a couple of times for half an hour. What I particularly loved was that everything was concentrated in one area: pools, restaurants and beach access. This was particularly enjoyable having a baby. I have also to say that the food at the restaurants was good on average, but I had a bad experience with the room service: the paella I ordered was horrible. What found a bit disappointing is that everything was "extra", giving you the feeling to be in a shopping mall. Overall, we had a good time, relax and a lot of fun with our baby constantly in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Latin Beach Getaway”
Reviews.Author: noamahser
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time at the Marriott San Juan. The previous three visits were romantic getaways. This time we were with our children and grandchildren. And it was as much fun as ever, albeit quite a different experience. The hotel is located on Condado Beach, a marvelous sandy shore ten minutes drive from Old San Juan. Lounge chairs, umbrellas are all included in the resort fee. The staff is as always cordial and accomodating in the hotel and on the beach. One is continually made to feel welcome. The oceanfront views are magnificent, and corner rooms have large balconies on two sides (Ocean front and Ocean and pool). The rooms are very well maintained, and towels replaced twice a day. The pools are immaculate, and the children's pool is unusually large with fountaints in the center. We never paid attention to it before, but with little grandchildren having a ball, we fell in love with it too. The hotel has a first-rate northern Italian restaurant and a very good Latin grill. Again, even in the fancy, upscale Italian restaurant, the staff is very welcoming to families with little ones, even as they are to adult couples. The Marriott has by far the best Latin dance bands of any hotel, and we have in the past stayed at three of what are considered the most luxurious in Puerto Rico. Friday-Sunday evening, many locals come in to dance -- a true indication of how really good the musicians are. Even when we stayed at other hotels (usually because the Marriott was booked solid, we went on weekend to dance there.) During our recent stay over American Thanksgiving, the lobby, including its bar (there are five others) and dance floor were undergoing major renovations which were nearly complete, so the dancing was moved into a small corner near the casino entrance, not as nice, but just a temporary solution till December 5. We were allowed to go behind the curtains to see the almost fully renovated dance floor and lobby, and they look gorgeous. The hotel is on Ashford, the main street of Condado, and is flanked by excellent restaurants for Asian, Italian and other cuisines. This is unlike the luxury hotels on Isla Verde or the golf resort hotels where one has to eat primarily in the hotel restaurants (although some of them are very good). In the outdoor park just two blocks down the street, there is a free jazz concert on the last Sunday evening of every month. Oh yes, and no less important, the prices at the hotel are quite reasonable for the high quality. The Marriott San Juan and Stellaris Casino remains our favorite vacation spot in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Resort: it's not all business shmidness”
Reviews.Author: chachi69
Reviews.Content: I usually donâ€™t stay at worldwide hotel chains such as Marriott because I equate them with convention centers and business conferences, and I travel almost exclusively for pleasure. Furthermore, large chains usually have entire corporate divisions dedicated to ensuring that the experience is close to identical in each location, so whatâ€™s the point of reviewing a â€œseen one, seen â€˜em allâ€� hotel? Well, after myâ€¦uh, rustic experience in Culebra I was never so happy to land in a corporate hotel. I was surprised by the resort format, which I never associated with Marriott before this trip. Our room wasnâ€™t ready when we arrived so Reception sent us off to the pool with two mini-bottles of rum and a can of Coke. The pool is huge but the deck is organically sectioned off into discrete, more private spaces. We passed right through it though, opting for the beach instead. Hotel employees set you up with complimentary lounge chairs and towels, and in no time at all a server approached us to see if we wanted cocktails or lunch. By the way, it is completely legal to drink alcoholic beverages on the beach in Puerto Rico. Any beach, anywhere, any time. Hey! We paid extra for an oceanfront corner king and it was worth it. The room was ginormous, with two terraces, floor to ceiling windows, and a bathroom with hot and cold running water! (Youâ€™ll have to read my review of Tamarindo Estates in Culebra, PR to understand why the Marriott bathroom was a revelation.) The dÃ©cor is traditional, but not dated. In terms of amenities the hotel has a casino, restaurant, bar, concierge, and tour concession. We booked a tour of the El Yunque rain forest through the hotel and were very satisfied. The hotel is centrally-located relative to old San Juan, Ocean Park, and Isla Verde. Youâ€™ll need a taxi to travel to and from old San Juan, which costs $15 +tip. The only negative I can think of is this: Condado beaches are somewhat narrow and all the hotel towers abut them tightly, casting long shadows on the very beaches theyâ€™re trying to promote. All day long people are dragging their chairs this way and that to stay in the sun. If youâ€™re a shade person, this is good news for you. We walked down to the residential Ocean Park neighborhood beaches in order to get a full dayâ€™s worth of sun. Only houses front the beach and theyâ€™re set back from the beach a little farther than the hotels are. On the down side, there are no concessions on the beach so youâ€™ll need to think ahead and bring your own food and drink with you. Bottom line: you wonâ€™t mistake Marriott for a boutique hotel (the buildingâ€™s boxy exterior wonâ€™t win any architectural awards) but you really canâ€™t go wrong here, and you will be comfortable. If large-scale boutique chic is more your thing though, the new hotel on the block is La Concha, a few blocks away. Itâ€™s definitely the hip choice for the well-heeled 35 and under crowd.

Reviews.Title: “An Update on Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris”
Reviews.Author: loeby41
Reviews.Content: It's that time of the year to update our review of the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris. Happily, nothing has changed since our previous review of Thanksgiving 2010..The staff - still very accommodating, the room - still spotlessly clean with plenty of towels, the pool - still well maintained, and the beach - clean & beautiful. It is difficult to find anything to complain about. Lobby renovations are just about complete. We were given a sneak preview and it is awesome. Already planning our 5th visit for Thanksgiving 2012. If you find anything untrue about our review, meet us at the Marriott San Juan Resort to discuss. We highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Tired, needs a room renovation”
Reviews.Author: dsugar
Reviews.Content: Good location, beachfront and within walking distance to restaurants. Lobby was under renovations but the rooms need new carpeting and a new paint job. Got charged $25 for amenities fee -- did not quite know what that was about...ok, would prefer to stay on the top floor, where the views are spectacular...probably a good family place for vacation...saw alot of kids and beach goers..

Reviews.Title: “It's the people that make the difference!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineMF
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying that I have stayed at this property about seven times over the past 14 years. It has a great location, being at the half way point between the airport and Old San Juan, and is also close to some very fine restaurants in Condado. The hotel itself is right on the beach and has a lovely pool so you have the best of both worlds. The on site restaurants are terrific and the rooms are all well decorated and most importantly, sparkiling clean! The #1 reason we keep coming back to this hotel however, is not the location or the ammenities. It is the workers, in particular 3 of the wait staff at La Vista restaurant located in the hotel. Their names are Diana Ferenandez, Anthony Oquendo (Sonny) and Angelo Torres. These 3 particular individuals have been working at La Vista since our first visit in 1997, and although we can't afford to come back every year, all 3 employees remember us each time we visit and welcome us as if we were family with hugs and smiles and updates on all the goings on not only in the hotel and surrounding areas, but also in their personal lives. Because the hotel offers the buffet breakfast free with your stay every morning, we get to see Diana, Sonny and Angelo every day of our stay and they make sure that we are comfortable in every way. They go out of their way to seat us facing the ocean, (which my Mom loves), and to make sure we have anything we want made special by the chef. They also remember our individual preferences such as juice choice, who drinks decaf tea, who likes their coffee black, etc. They are EXCELLENT at their jobs and literally bend over backwards for you. More importantly, they take the time to talk with you, ask how you are doing, how the vacation is going and what you have done and seen so far. They are a pure delight and I believe that each one should be promoted to some position of management as they are exemplarary employees and fantastic role models.At this hotel, it is definitely the people that make the difference. On the downside, this time around we were disappointed with the lobby renovations not being completed on time as scheduled. At this particular hotel, the lobby is the lifeblood of the property. When the lobby was open in years past, every night was electrified with rotating live bands and dancing until the wee hours of the morning. Their beautiful bar was always packed and it was always great to just sit and relax and be entertained. Unfortunately, this time, the lobby was not only not done by their advertised completion date, but also didn't seem like it was anywhere near completion as you never heard workmen during the day and maybe you would see one or two workers at night. There is a "quiet lobby" that could have been converted to a bar and "night club" while renovations are being done (for the past few months!) but this was not the case. It seems amazing to me that the hotel would accept losing the nightly income that was generated by the dancing and bar service, but maybe I am thinking too profit mindedly. The only other complaint that I would voice about this property is that when something breaks in the pool area, like the hot tub, the accepted method of repair is to throw up some CAUTION TAPE and forget about it. This is what happened during our recent stay. After 4 days of being patient, we insisted on having our resort fee refunded, as my mother, who is in a wheel chair, really can only take advantage of the hot tub as opposed to the gym and the beach. We were initially refused the refund after being told that the resort fee included the use of other ammenities, But once I replied, "like the lobby and live nightly music?" we were refunded the resort fee and the hot tub was miraculously fixed within 20 minutes of that. I must say that the nice woman at the front desk was the unfortunate "in between" person as her manager never came out to speak with us directly, but she was very sweet and apologetic and did a great job at trying to keep us happy. I would also suggest that they paint their pool bar in more vibrant colors, especiallu "under the roof" where people tend to stare up and look while they are sitting at the bar. The bartenders shoudl also keep the fruit COVERED that they put into the tropical drinks as the uncovered fruit is not only unsanitary but also attracts a large amount of bees making it very dangerous for those of us who are allergic to bees and want to sit around the pool! Overall, I would highly recommend this property once their lobby is completed. And because of Diana, Sonny and Angelo we will return again!

Reviews.Title: “'mixing business and pleasure'”
Reviews.Author: rain8660
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 7 days and 6 nights at the Marriot San Juan and Stellaris Casino. My husband had a conference so we decided to arrive early to have some time for ourselves. On arrival, our "city view" room was ready but we decided to upgrade to an "ocean view room. We were given a pager and went out to lunch at the beach bar. Hector, the bartender, was friendly and informative and made some tasty rum drinks, After a few hours we were getting tired and still hadn't been paged-turns out the pager did not work and it was 5 o'clock before we checked in. The room had a beautiful view and the king sized bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. Susana, our friendly chambermaid, kept the room clean, neat and tidy during our stay, The weather was pleasant during our stay with a constant breeze. The beach was clean with attendants ready to provide chairs, umbrellas, food and drink. The prices were expensive-it is a resort. We enjoyed lunch a couple of days down to left of the hotel at Tijuana's Bar and Grill, sitting ouside on their patio. A tour from the hotel to the rainforest was a memorable way to spend one of our days and I would recommend it. Our guide was friendly and informative. While my husband was at his conference I enjoyed the hotel pool and beach and made a trip into Old San Juan. Exploring one of the forts on a self guided tour was interesting, and shopping and lunching at an oudoor cafe, while soaking up the local flavor, was a nice way to spend a morning. The Marriot is in a good location and we both enjoyed our trip to San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: ellaviaja
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent overall, with the same consistency of service Iâ€™ve come to expect from Marriotts. I forgot to ask for an oceanfront room + high floor when I booked but thankfully upon arrival they were able to accommodate my requests. In fact the whole time we were there, every staff member was exceedingly accommodating. Nobody missed a beatâ€”from the aforementioned check-in staff, room service, pool & beach staff and valetâ€”even with our sometimes detailed requests. The atmosphere of Condado is a little corporate with lots of hi-rises surrounding but this had its advantages: for instance thereâ€™s a Walgreens nearby which we made good use of for beach supplies and snacks and also a Starbucks. I donâ€™t â€œdoâ€� coffee but my husband, who was wiped out the whole time from his shift the night before we arrived, burned a hole in his pocket there rather quickly :) The location also meant that we werenâ€™t far from lots of things to do. San Juan in general has lots of family-friendly activities- in particular Iâ€™d recommend El Morro, the pigeon park/Parque de las palomas (not for the faint of heart-- the birds are aggressive!) & walking around Old San Juan. These things are about 10-15 min drive from the hotel in our rental car- something Iâ€™d also recommend because you can explore other parts of the island if you have time. We didnâ€™t really because we were looking for more of a restful vacation but thereâ€™s no shortage of things to do on the island. I had forgotten how interesting & varied Puerto Rico is since the previous time I had been there, and the island is pretty amazing if you have the chance to step outside of San Juan a bit. Back to the Stellaris- one thing to note is the beach isnâ€™t spectacular, itâ€™s a little rough. But if you do decide to spend time at the beach, the staff is quite attentive. (One man in fact came by to fix my umbrella not one minute after I noticed how much it was leaning) Finally, the less than perfect beach is definately made up for by the pool. The pool was beautiful, big & relaxing, especially at nighttime. In fact this was my favorite part of the hotel & definately makes the Stellaris worth a visit. If I return to PR, I would stay here again for sure. On the whole, the setting was nice, the service was top-notch & the Stellaris left me with everything I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: lps773
Reviews.Content: Jeanette Rivera at the bar is the best! She makes all my visits to the Marriott special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but annoying charges”
Reviews.Author: CookinTeacher
Reviews.Content: The Marriott San Juan Resort and Stellaris Casino had the usual Marriott amenities - great location, comfortable sized room, cleanliness, good beds and attentive staff (for the most part). Marriott's however, are not inexpensive. We were quite annoyed the night we arrived. It was about 10 PM and we asked where we could get something to eat. We were told everything was closed except for the Marriott Chinese restaurant. We decided to pass on their $20. lo mein and went to sleep. The next morning we learned there are at least 10 nice restaurants and cafe's within 3 blocks of the hotel. I resent being guided to a mediocre, high priced hotel restaurant. The same goes for breakfast. 2 breakfast's were included so we had to pay $20. for the buffet breakfast for my daughter and the food was not great. The French toast was hardened and the eggs were cold. They ran out of croissants. They gave us a bill for $65. and said the 2 complimentary breakfasts would be deducted from our bill. The bill also "recommended" numerical amounts for your tip of 15, 20 or 25% (on the entire $65.) - for a BUFFET! I do not mind tipping generously but the waiter only brought us coffee and water!!!! We also ordered burgers and chicken sandwiches at the pool. What an expensive mistake that was! The burgers were cold. If you wanted fries, it was $5. extra per sandwich. Who wants to spend $15. for cold fries? On top of $10 for a burger? I also really RESENT the charge of $19. for 12 hours of Internet. A nice hotel experience is spoiled by nickle and dime greed.

Reviews.Title: “Relax with Your Oceanfront View”
Reviews.Author: Marplon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in mid-November. We got an oceanfront room that had a balcony with a table and two chairs. Spacious room, very comfortable and clean. Bathroom is nicely sized with a great shower. Hotel staff were all very friendly except for the concierge folks who weren't as helpful as we'd like. Front desk staff were very pleasant and accommodating. The property sits right on the shore with a nice sandy beach. Hotel staff will set you up with chaise lounges and umbrella. Tips are appreciated but not necessary. We gave him $2 and he seemed happy with that. The water can be rough, with strong tides and currents so it may not be appropriate for the little ones, or anyone who is afraid of the water. There are two pools, one equipped with a small waterslide. There is a swim-up bar as well. The hotel has several restaurants that have local flavor and Italian. They also serve a buffet breakfast. The hotel is convenient to restaurants and shopping in the area (Condado). Area felt safe and there was a police presence on the street. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overprices for what it is”
Reviews.Author: ygontchar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice decent place to relax, but for $240 a night we expected more then that. They don't really have any activities and their spa is terrible - my shoulders are aching two days after their combination massage. I paid $80 for a 20 minutes massage expecting something special, and it was literary the worst one I ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - wished we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: MiouMiou
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Marriott in Amsterdam for two weeks, and loving it, when it was time for our next vacation, we wanted to try a Marriott property somewhere else. We took a two day "mini vacation" prior to our cruise out of San Juan, and had the most wonderful stay at this hotel. Everything about it was first class. From the friendly and helpful desk clerks, to the maids, wait staff and door man, everyone was polite and made us feel welcome. Our room was simply gorgeous, with a lovely balcony where we could overlook the city. The room was spotless, the bed so comfy that we ended up napping after our arrival rather than explore, and the bathroom elegantly appointed with a marble sink, and top drawer toiletries. The pool - just beautiful. So many different places to enjoy, the pool swim up bar, the fountains.. The beach was clean, and there were guards at the entrance to make sure that only people that were staying at the hotel could enter the hotel premises from the beach. It was very pleasant to sit outside having a drink sitting on comfortable couches around the fire pit. There was a small convenience store inside the hotel where you could buy various sundries as well as souvenirs. There is also a casino attached to the hotel. This was our first trip to San Juan, but it will not be our last. This Marriott is first class all the way, and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbie V
Reviews.Content: We spent 11/21 - 11/25/11 at this Marriott. It was clean, located right on the beautiful beach (with plenty of umbrellas for all the guests), a very helpful staff, and a good location to many restaurants, etc, We booked two rooms thru Expedia for our 5 family members. Our favorite "find" of the trip (as far as restaurants) is the Uno Restaurant located on the same street (Ashford Avenue) within walking distance from the hotel. If you are walking out of the lobby facing Ashford, take a left and walk less than 1/4 mile and you will see Uno on the left. They offer fabulous lunch specials daily, and were even open on Thanksgiving (check the back of the menu for the specials, all around 6.99-7.99, including the drink.). They have pizzas, burgers, pastas, salads, soups, etc. My son could only eat half his lunch portion, and we asked the Marriott staff to warm up his left overs that evening, which they gladly did...even putting it in a "fancy" plate, complete with silverware. Our favorite excursions of the trip...Spread Eagle II Catamaran snorkeling trip (check their website...they will pick you up from this hotel for about 12 dollars pp) which is located in Fajardo. EXCELLENT snorkeling...boat leaves daily from marina in Fajardo @10 and returns around 3:30. This Marriott has a friendly casino (the staff took the time to kindly tutor my son in the skills of Blackjack..offering helpful advice...he won $15 on his first (and only) try. Our Expedia deal had two free breakfasts (called the Sand Dollar package) included in the cost of the stay, per room, and the breakfast was exceptional (it's served in teh beautiful La Vista Restaurant located on the ground floor with windows overlooking the beach. There is a huge selection of food, which will keep you full for hrs. They do charge the gratuity to the room. Our Expedia deal also included internet charges. They explained to us when we checked in that the fee would be charged to the room (as was the price for the breakfasts) but would be removed at the time of checkout. Sure enough, on the last day, they slid a bill under our door in the morning and the only charges we had to our room were the gratuities for the breakfasts (around $6 for each of the 2 rooms) and the $20 charge per day for the valet parking. Trust me, if you rent a car like we did, it pays to spend $4 extra dollars a day for the valet parking as opposed to the self parking. You simply call down for your car to be delivered, and by the time you get down there, the car is ready. One word of advice...driving in Puerto Rico is really crazy. You need nerves of steel. The streets are narrow, and the bridge in and out of the Condado area includes an intersection (Ashford and 26) that is dangerous..not to mention the fact that every night the lights did not work at this intersection. 3 more tidbits: Try to take the WOW Jetski tour operating in the marina near the Sizzler Steak House (not more than a couple miles from this hotel...but you'll have to go thru this intersection I was telling you about)....also the WOW surfing lessons that operate from Isla Verde (my son and nephew did this...it was $50 for 1/2 hr lesson and 1 hr board rental) and you MUST see Old San Juan, especially El Morrow and the cobblestone streets. This Marriott is great. The pools are spectacular, and there are tons of lounge chairs around each of them, and plenty of room for every one. There is a relaxing hot tub, water slide, and access right to the beach. The beach is incredible, although the current is strong. However, you can still get in the water if you exercise caution...just don't go out too far. The lobby was under constuction and we were told that it would be completed in about 2 weeks. Our first trip to Puerto Rico, and we do want to go back. If so, we will stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: E A
Reviews.Content: Nice beach,clean. Lots of surf at beach,so can be rough. Pool area great. The restaurants are overpriced but ok. The family activities shown on website aren't really available. Beautiful views.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time but the lobby was under construction :-(”
Reviews.Author: Sila226
Reviews.Content: We went for a long weekend recently and had a very nice stay. The room was clean and not cramped. The bathroom is spacious and updated. The TV reception is poor but we shouldn't be watching tv anyway! The pool area is nice but awkwardly arranged. The beach was clean and the second you step down off of the patio they run to set you up with chairs/umbrellas. (Ricardo also asked if we were coming the next day and he would have us set up prior to our arrival...towels too). The pool/beach food and drinks were a little pricey but tasty! The casino is average. Plenty of shops/restaurants in walking distance. We didn't take advantage of the spa. There is also an ocean-side bar/restaurant area that offers the same food as the pool/beach. We had breakfast at LaVista and highly recommend the buffet. We did not eat at Tuscany. Only a 10 min $20 cab ride to Old San Juan. CON: The lobby was under construction which greatly reduces the amount of common space for the hotel. It leaves 1 lounging area & a very small bar/coffee service area on the lobby level. Which makes it difficult to hang out or meet up before heading out. Still a very nice place in a centrally located area.

Reviews.Title: “Great long week-end getaway”
Reviews.Author: NYfamilytravelers4
Reviews.Content: We did not have any complaints about the hotel. We booked a package that included breakfast and it was a nice buffet.
