I had requested early arrival and our room was ready about 1 1/2 hrs before the check-in time and we got a phone call while we were sunning ourselves on the beach (you can change in the spa and check your bags with the bellman). They also gave us a later check out than the 11 AM which worked great for us. The beach is nice and while it is a public beach, we only saw hotel guests sitting on it. There is plenty of security around the hotel and we felt perfectly safe. There were some locals walking by selling ices and jewelry and a few on Saturday who were swimming but it wasn't crowded. Towels were plentiful, no towel cards or giving a room number was necessary as we find at all of the other island hotels we have stayed at in the Caribbean. We went in to Old San Juan by bus which stopped a block down from the hotel. We had to take a cab home at night because the bus (must have 75 cents exact change) had stopped running by the time we were done with dinner ($15 for cab). The next day we took the bus back and when we were ready to leave, we sat for 45 minutes at the bus depot with many others waiting for the same bus. A local resident who had retired there from the mainland gave us a tip about a different bus (she said you could wait up to 2 hrs for the bus we took there). We took the M3 which was only 50 cents and it stopped about 4 blocks away from the hotel (nice walk back she was with us returning to her apt so she walked us in the right direction although would have been easy to figure out). She told us the bus was on a different contract and runs more frequently than the other bus so keep that in mind for the return trip. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: d29melissa007
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for the price. It is about 15 minute ride from the airport and the check in was pretty quick. You get a nice rum drink upon check in too. The room was nice, but had a little mold problem around the cracks and corners. Bedding was very comfortable and the sheets were clean and soft. They also offer down alternative pillows. Bathroom had nice orange scented products and a rainfall shower head and GREAT hot water. Housekeeping was excellent and brought fresh towels, water and products every day. The free All-American breakfast was the best ever! Made to order omelets, bacon, fruit and pastries. The casino looked a little shady, so we did not go play there. Was very close to Wal-greens-that sells alcohol and Starbucks across the street. The concierge desk was great to find out locations like El Morro and places to eat. Skip Miro across the street and go to Bar Gitmo for the meat paella- Sooooo good! Ask for Ronald, he was great and told us a lot about the island. All around everyone at the hotel was VERY nice and everything we asked we got a prompt good response. I loved when the guys upfront would say "Welcome Back" and hold the door for you, great service you really do not see anymore. Also, they have a travel desk where you can book a tour to the La Mina falls in the El Yunque rain forest. Very close to Old San Juan and El Morro and the mall Las Plaza Americanas. Definitely would stay here again for the price and options.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for short stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: lr2522
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights prior to a cruise ship departure out of San Juan. We were looking for something nice that had a resort-style pool and beach but was not too far out of the way from the airport, cruise ship terminals, and tourist attractions. Overall, we were pleased with our selection and didn't notice any other hotel properties that we wished we'd selected instead. We had one meal in the Tuscany restaurant in the hotel. The restaurant was not very busy while we were there, and the service was slow and part of our order was forgotten, but the entrees were delicious. Our reservation Included breakfast for two, which was a full buffet and also very good. The beach was just a few steps from the hotel, clean, with chairs and umbrellas. We were a little disappointed in the pool area - it was small and had a run-down feeling so we settled on the beach instead. Taxis were always readily available and there was a handy pavillion across the street that included a Starbucks, Ben & Jerrys, and a couple of restaurants. There was construction going on in the lobby, which resulted in a little confusion when we arrived but will be resolved when it is completed. Overall, we were pleased with our stay and will definitely consider this hotel on our next trip to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property, service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: whyersc
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Condado is this Marriott. From the moment we were greeted with a warm smile and cold champagne, everything was fantastic. A nicely decorated, clean corner room with floor to ceiling windows with one side overlooking the city and the other side overlooking the ocean and balconies on both sides to enjoy - I was ecstatic. Room 923. The room was very large and the bed, pillows and linens were unbelievably comfortable. The property is well maintained, clean and great service and food, The pools are wonderful with waterfalls in both and lounge chairs everywhere. One is clearly for children by not being any deeper than I'd guess 3'. A cool slide winds around and lands in the other pool where there's a swim-up bar and built in plasma TV for football games! The area is beautifully landscaped too. There are fresh, warm towels at your disposal any time and there never was any shortage of them - even on the busy weekends. The moment my feet touched the sand, I was immediately greeted by an employee asking where I'd like to sit so he could set up lounge chairs exactly where I wanted. He also asked if I wanted an umbrella and dug a location in the sand for that too.There are tons of chairs and plenty of beach so no need to claim your spot early in the morning. There was always someone working the beach to provide drinks and food and they were prompt and friendly. If you are waited on by Pedro, you will enjoy a great smile and friendly conversation. The beach was clean and security at the hotel was always present - not that we ever had any incidences - but they were there to make sure of it, Police roam the beach, too, on an ATV to ensure everyone's safe and having a good time. The outdoors showers were handy for a quick rinse and steps away from the outdoor bar and several seating vignettes to enjoy the view of the ocean in the comfort of colorful couches and chairs. The only downside to the wonderful outdoor bar is the drinks are $10.50 in a medium sized Solo-style cup. And they weren't always generous with the liquor. It does add up quickly so we walked the 200ft to Walgreen's, bought our own booze and thermos/cooler and made our own drinks on the beach too. We also walked to the local market and bought some snacks and stuff which was convenient. The rooms have a fridge in them so we kept our goodies cold. The main restaurant, La Vista, had great buffets for each meal or we could order off the menu. The wait staff was really attentive and if you sit in Sonny's area, you're in great hands. There's another hotel restaurant that we didn't go to but looked nice and there's also a Starbucks in the lobby area for quick breakfasts or sandwiches. Restaurants directly across the street, an Italian one, is outrageously good and one to the right of it (and on the corner from Walgreen's) with yellow umbrellas has good food too. Walk further towards the Old San Juan direction and Casa Lola has fantastic food or across from Chili's is a restaurant called Ocean Hacienda Don something - which is a must. Walk all the way to the back and you're sitting at the ocean's edge and if the surf is up and strong trade winds blowing, don't be surprised if you catch a slight mist from the open windows. The food here is more Mexican than PR and it's good enough and the prices are very reasonable. The view is priceless. We hung out there long after our meal was over, just enjoying the tranquility. They have strong spotlights at night so the view is not lost when the sun goes down. My husband and I received a couples massage and the facility is nice but I will say we both had the same opinion of the quality of the massage. It wasn't bad, but we both felt their experience was mediocre. I'd get a massage there again but I'd go in knowing it won't be one of the best ones I've ever had. But hey, it was our 2nd day there and it helped take the edge of stress off from being over-worked! I travel for business typically 9 -12 days a month so I'm well acquainted with what I want from a hotel. We spent 8 wonderful days at this property and would return to it IN A HEARTBEAT!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful property in San Juan (Condado)”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorBluenose
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is undergoing some renovations in the lobby area and the exterior is a little tired looking, the rooms are spacious and well appointed, and the pool/beach areas are extremely nice. I was happy with my decision to stay in Condado rather than in Old San Juan, which was kind of grimy and lacking easy access to the water. There is a wide range of restaurants on or close to Ashford Ave, in addition to liquor shops, pharmacy, post office etc. I got the "buy two nights get the third for free" deal, which made the visit very reasonably priced compared to other San Juan hotels.

Reviews.Title: “I love San Juan and Marriott”
Reviews.Author: EricaB60
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Marriott and we had a wonderful time as usual. The staff are very helpful and the location couldnt be better. Large rooms.( we are staying 4 persons in a double room with 2 king beds!) I prefer the cabana wing nice vieu over the garden and pool. Great breakfast overlooking the ocean.I love the homemade granola. The beach is great and there are lots of sunbeds the staff on the beach will help you with everything. This time we stayed 3 nights pro cruising. San Juan is a paradise very friendly and have everything you can wisch for. Good food and prices for exampel go to Puerto Rico Cafe in Old San Juan and eat Baby back ribs. We are from Sweden 24 hours travelling so PR is really worth travelling that time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach...just for sunning!”
Reviews.Author: atrin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort for a long weekend, just my husband and I. We stayed on the concierge level and ate breakfast in that lounge everyday. It's worth it for what you will save on just breakfast alone. The views from the decks are incredible! We'd drink at the pool bar and ordered lunch once from there and ate on the beach. The drinks at the pool/beach bar can get expensive but it's a resort. We travel often so weren't surprised at the prices... Another reason we stayed in the club level, it winds up being a savings. We'd also go to the club level after the beach for a snack...to off set dinner. We ate in the italian restaurant located in the hotel one night, not many people around, the food was good and we had a bottle of wine, which was priced well. One night we ate at Morton's (caribe hilton) which yes, we have back in Baltimore... but it was wonderful and the grounds of the Hilton looked amazing. The casino here was full each night, we aren't big gamblers.. I went in, played until $20 was lost and then we left. The lobby bar is iffy, not many people there and the service was so-so. Only 1 of the 4 nights there did we stay for any length of time ( more then 30 mins) because we'd met a nice man traveling for work and sat with him. There didn't seem to be a lot of night life here... and we weren't looking for it so it was great. The room we had was quite small... we had a chair, desk and king sized bed. Small but very nice and clean... I'd say cozy. The beach is wonderful, great breeze and we enjoyed it. The beach is very very rocky and I only went in un to my thighs for fear of being hit by the forceful waves and hitting a rock. The waves are constant. We walked down to the La Concha ( short walk on beach) hotel one afternoon and had lunch there. It was a nice walk down the beach and we went in the ocean there. They have a cove that was much better for swimming. It was only about 4-5 buildings down and we enjoyed the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Pure relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: HHH_Honeymoon
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Marriott was great despite the fact they are remodeling the lobby - the great quality of service you expect from a Marriott, great ocean views, beach access (chairs and umbrellas included), and a fun pool for kids and adults. The location is perfect - variety of restaurants and bars walking distance, and just a $10 cab from other main touristic spots.

Reviews.Title: “Construction but nice casino”
Reviews.Author: MommyLinda
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just okay. The rooms were clean, but the construction in the lobby does interfere with the vacation experience. The casino is nice and small and very well laid out. The restaurants are dreadful and way over priced. Puerto Rico is a poor version of Hawaii. Spend the money and go to a really beautiful tropical paradise. Old San Juan is nothing but a tourist trap selling cheap junk.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful/Clean/Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: opal91086
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for eight nights, arriving right as the hurricane left San Juan and luckily just before it hit New England. We were reluctant to stay here once we saw another reviewer post the lobby was under construction. Our fears were quickly put aside upon our arrival. Check in staff was wonderful. Our room was not ready but we were offered another of equivalent quality facing the ocean. The room was larger than anticipated. The bathroom had Bath and Body shampoo, conditioner and lotion, which I love. Water pressure in the shower was strong. Towels were large and soft. The pool is beautiful. Two sections - one better for families with a slide. The other side a nice swim up bar! The beach is wide with soft sand and chairs and umbrellas. Options for everyone! Food is pretty good as are the drinks. The excursion desk offers variety. Unfortunately for us, the rainforest never opended because of he hurricane. Try the kayaking, ziplining and horseback riding. The biolumenescece bay is worth the experience. I was afraid it would be cold at night but was pleasantly surprised. The area is more city than we would have liked but if you are looking for night life this is certainly the place. Staff was always helpful and cheerful. Eight days and we never encountered a single cranky person. We would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon hotel after our cruise.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelAdamGreen
Reviews.Content: So, we were disputing between this hotel, the Ritz and the El San Juan. We ultimately picked the Marriott because we got an ocean front balcony for the same price as a city or pool view at either of the other hotels. This Marriott is a solid 4 and I'll break it down for you. We're in our 20's and we were definitely missing some more evening activities/clubs/etc. within the hotel. The casino felt very separated from the hotel and was 95% slots and a few table games. 2 blackjack tables, 1 roulette, 1 craps, and maybe 2 poker tables. Yes, the lobby was under construction and they said it would be opened around 11/18/11... I'm not in construction, but that seemed ambitious. The hotel could very well get a five star rating once the lobby is done because right now there is huge void in the hotel. Cleanliness was spot on... No pun intended. Very clean, I didn't feel grossed out at any point and the room servicing was quick and consistent. The bathrooms are typical for any commercial hotel and have a few spots of concern, but I'm not overly sensitive to those things. The room... Was great. The bathroom was entirely too small. We had an oceanfront balcony so I was expecting a slightly nicer bathroom for $200+/night. It was one of those bathrooms that you can't open and close the door and do anything else at the same time. The room was typical and a nice size. The room also lacked drawer storage... Yes. Only two drawers! There was a TV console but it had a fridge and k-kup coffee maker in it. The location was great for beach front access and it was close to a Walgreens and plenty of restaurants around. You can walk up and down the streets with minimal threats/worries and most of the restaurants are very welcoming to tourists. The service was ok for what we used. The concierge sent us to a restaurant called Bar Gitano which was "reasonable" but we found very expensive. We booked a tour through the hotel and they were accommodating but also slightly pressuring us into doing it. Every tour was "almost sold out" and when we did the tour, there were plenty of spaces available. Pool leaves some things to be desired. There are way too many trees around and the hotel and the sun set quickly so there was minimal sun bathing. The pool in the picture with all of the fountains is extremely misleading; that pool is about 1 1/2 feet deep all around and is an oversized kiddie pool. The lower pool was nice, but the waterslide drew a lot of kids in. We didn't eat at the hotel, but can recommend and offer guidance towards places to eat off the resort. 1. Bar Gitano - authentic, but overpriced and spent $120+ on dinner and left hungry; however live flamenco dancing on Sundays. 2. Green House restaurant - good, quick, cheap. 3. Raices - got the mufungo as we were told to, and it was good, but overrated and again expensive ($40 for lunch). 4. Latin Star - awful, disgusting, terrible...5. Pinky's - great breakfast for reasonable money... In hindsight we should have eaten there a few more times. FYI - Walgreens down the street had your typical goodies, so load up on beer, water, and soda to take to the beach. Would I recommend it? I would for the value of the oceanfront balcony, but I personally wouldn't stay there again. If you are ok with a non-oceanfront room, I heard from friends on the cruise that the El San Juan was awesome despite the reviews which turned us away from it. Also, the ocean at the Marriott had very rough waters and the El San Juan had, much calmer waters (so we heard). Different strokes for different folks. I hope you find this review helpful in booking your next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mannyb02
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located in the middle of Condado. The staff is friendly. Lots of dining options within walking distance. Minutes away from Old San Juan. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a weekend get away.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome view”
Reviews.Author: Broonaldo
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel that is situated right on the beach area of Condado. The room was very big and spacious, we had a King Size bed and there was a sofa sitting area also. We also had a balcony with a table and 2 chairs. We arrived, off our cruise ship, around 10.30am and obviously our room wasn' ready, check in was 3pm (i think). They gave us a buzzer though and said ithey would alert us when a room becomes available. We were told we could use all of the facilities at the spa, swimming pool and the beach in the meantime. Amazingly the buzzer went off 45 minutes later, this was around 11.15am and our room was ready - fantastic, they certainly didnt have to give us a room so early but it was very much appreciated. After we briefly unpacked (only were the staying the 1 night unfortunately) we heaed down to the baech - it is classed as a local beach but the Marriott had most of it right in front of their hotel. There were 4 beach attendants greeting you and getting you your free sunbeds and umbrella - they situated them anywhere you wanted, which was fantastic. There is also a beach waiter from the hotel that comes around asking if you want any drinks or food - what a great service. The sea is rather choppy (some moderate waves) but the sand is glorious and very clean. There is very good hotel security on the beach and at the hotel entrance to the beach ensuring no non guests try to get into the hotel resort and use the facilities. The pool area is fantastic also with plenty of sun loungers spread put the whole area. All of the pool and beach towels were free too and you could replensish as often as you wanted. There are probably around 6 or 7 eating places around the area of the hotel, a Walgreens and a Starbucks. All in all, a very enjoyable end to our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “My iCelebrate Birthday San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino X-Perience!”
Reviews.Author: Xquizit
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino in San Juan, Puerto Rico. This is my third time staying at this wonderful resort. My girlfriend & I went to celebrate my birthday (10/27). My second year in a row, celebrating my birthday (10/27). Each x-perience was memorable. My last stay was less than a week ago, and it was fantastic. I enjoyed every moment at this hotel. The rooms, restaurants, pool, spa & ocean views. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking to get away from it all, but be close enough to the action if you want to have FUN. Pluses: -Ask for an Upgrade to an Suite (Oceanview) -Open the balcony door to hear the ocean put you to sleep -Drink a Frozen Virgin Mojito in the Latin Restaurant -Eat the Whole Fried Red Snapper in the Latin Restaurant (delicious) -Take to bus to the â€œFREEâ€� shuttle to Old San Juan -Do the Canopy Tour - Ziplining

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lives up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: WOF8
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Friday, 10/28, and out on Friday 11/4. We are platinum members but did not receive any upgrades, drinks , etc. We paid extra for our oceanfront room and had access to the lounge. The lounge was great. Lots of choices and the view was awesome! Pools were good. Beach was small but adequate. Lots of local surfers come everyday. Sat and sunday are very crowded. Just like going to new jersey. But the remainder of the week was fine. Housekeeping was very good. The lobby was under construction so all you viewed was drywall It will be much nicer once completed. Drinks here are $9.50+. Food by the pool is expensive too ($35+ tip for lunch, 2 sandwiches). Some marriotts really try to make their guests feel special. This was not one of them. But overall it met my expectations. The guests ranged from honeymooners to retired.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: KianTony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Juan Marriott October 27th - 31st. We arrived at the hotel around 11:30 am. Our room wasn't ready until 4 pm on the dot (kind of disappointing but we got over it). We hung out at the beach bar and got the party started. You must try a hurricane. It has 151 and some other types of rum and juice in it.....The hotel is in a great location. It was very clean, staff was very friendly and accomodating. The bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel offers free beach chairs, umbrellas and towels. The beach and pool area was nice and clean. We booked a city view room but used my Marriott reward points to upgrade to an ocean view room. I highly advise you reserve or upgrade to an ocean view room. There is nothing like waking up to a view of the ocean. The lobby was still under renovation but that didn't ruin the trip or cause any problems. I highly recommend the following restaurants, Monas, Greenhouse, The Ambassador, Di Parma Trattoria (my favorite) and Mike's pizza. There is also a Wendys, Starbucks (directly across the street) and Dunkin Donuts within walking distance of the hotel. Venture out and try the food at the local restaurants versus eating at the hotel restaurants. There was a high police presence on Ashford Avenue so we always felt safe except for one morning while eating breakfast at the Latin Star, a lady had her purse snatched in the parking lot across the street.....There is a Walgreens one block away from the hotel. You can save money by buying your snacks, liquor and beer from there. Here goes the cons...you cannot use cash at the pool or beach bars. You have to charge everything to your room. The hotel puts a $250 hold on your credit card per room. We had a leaky toilet but maintenance came to the room within 5 minutes and fixed it. Besides these minor things, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpfull staff!”
Reviews.Author: alwayshappyinct
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10/30-11-1 after a cruise. Arrived very early a.m. on Saturday and checked in and requested a corner room. The front desk clerk was very pleasant and told me we could use the Spa to change our clothes and would call me when the room was ready. In less than 2 hours we were in our room. We ate at all locations and the food was great. There was a special at their Italian resturant for $20.00 , with a limited menu for a full dinner with soup or salad , 4-5 dinner choices, coffee and dessert. The staff was friendly, helpful and dinner was great! The beach was clean and lots of available help! It was a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ChagoNaz
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, we had an ocean view room on the 10th floor which was breathtaking. people were very friendly as well as the workers. Restaurant was great as well as the pool bar. Very fun and lively. Excellent location in the heart of Condado, easily accesible to many areas. Starbucks right across the street... Highlyrecommend for service and price.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Excellent Marriott Service”
Reviews.Author: migrant10
Reviews.Content: My first time here at this property. I ususally stay at the Hilton El Caribe when in town for conference/buisness but since they were sold out I stayed here. I traveled with my college aged daughter for this biz trip. I found the service excellent, just what you expect from a marriott anywhere you go. On time, courteous and always willing to negotiate upgrades, late check outs and complimentary drink coupons. This is an older hotel that has been a Marriott upgrade. I was in the West (on the left looking at the ocean) smaller tower. The rooms were very nice,and spacious (I got a $25 upgrade to a corner room- well worth it). The beach was fine and the pool was actually big enough to do laps when it wasn't crowded...how often does that happen? There'sa swim up bar, lush landscaping, music and very cool lights that illuminate the grounds and buildings after dark. The only negative was there was only one hot tub which was always crowded. The lobby is currently under construction, but no big inconvience. I received 1,000 extra points because of it. There is a starbucks across the street and some good resturants within a block or two. I asked for some free drink coupons at check in and that gladly give me a few. There is security 24/7 on the beach and in the hotel...not that PR is a dengerous place, but with my daughter there and me working, it made me feel a little better. We had a great sushi tuna wrap at "LOST" 2 blocks down from the hotel (if you don't mind some loud music) and 'Ocean" looked like a good place to eat. A cab ride to Old San juan was 15 each way. My advice is to get out of San Juan as soon as you can if you have the time and explore the island. This trip we went to Rincon and loved every minute. See my reviews there for more info. Overall, a great place to spend a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay there while in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: ray k
Reviews.Content: Great place..best oceanfront view...staff very nice...home of the 2 dollar casino bet. Needs minibar in room. Best for value and view..Pool at El San Juan Better but room view arent as good as mariott. In great part of twon..Ashford ave. Breakfast buffet ubbeatabe o the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay- would recommend”
Reviews.Author: TorontoFanula
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place, friendly staff, Good food. It's not cheap to order room service, or get drinks by the pool bar, but if you definately just want to go chill on a beach, this is a great place. Beach is clean and safe. The only thing is, do NOT expect a wake up call. Three times we asked, and three times they 'forgot', but with numerous excuses. Just set an alarm and it's all good. I really liked this place and would go again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the Marriott, but bring your wallet”
Reviews.Author: dRobke
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week at this resort and enjoyed my stay. The hotel is welcoming an the check-in went smooth. The lobby has a lively atmosphere with the bar being right at the check in area. The room are clean and decorated tastefully, like what you would expect from the marriott branch. I had a room with view on, the ocean, which is a plus to wake up with that view. The hotrel in itself is nicely located with restaurants and bars closeby, and the ocean is right at the hotel. There is a casino in the hotel as well, for those who feel lucky. I had breakfast at the hotel restaurant, which was ok, but overpriced. The staff in the restaurant and hotel was very friendly. The pool area is nicely done, I only enjoyed the pool in the evening, when it was quiet, but the pools were nicely lit in the evening to create a special setting The hotelbar is nice and lively, and on some days there is live music. I enjoyed the ambiance, but there are also other nice places to visit within walking distance. Overall I enjoyed my stay, but I've stayed in other marriot resort where I got more value for my money. In all fairness, the entire set of hotels on the island are in the same price category for this level of service and quality. Overall I had a very nice experience and would definitely recommend the hotel to other travellers both for business as leisure

Reviews.Title: “San Juan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GAHJAJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days/4 nights in September. The entire staff (especially the restaurant staff-Diana and service agent-Waldo) were excellent. The hotel is very busy due to the casino and convention room but these occur in the lobby. We would definitely stay at this place again. We got a package that included a continental breakfast. The breakfast included a lot of food. Did not eat at the hotel at night so cannot say anything about the food/prices. Great location. A few small things. 1) did not like paying for the parking at the hotel. 2) we had an ocean view room but the sliding door lock was broken.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! No worries at all!”
Reviews.Author: JanandAudrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and had a wonderful time. Susana our housekeeper, Jay our travel desk person and George our bellman were all exceptional. When we got there, our room was not ready - we waited for over an hour, but were compensated fairly by the front desk. Everything else was great - the beach, the restaurants, the pools, the balconies, the waiters and every person we encountered was gracious and hospitable. Everyone we interacted with smiled and greeted us warmly. Thank you Marriott employees for making this trip so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding and Hotel stay October 2011”
Reviews.Author: magnolia57
Reviews.Content: I'll start out by saying this is a beautiful, very elegant hotel. It is very clean and well maintained inside and out. Our room was beautiful with a gorgeous view of the pool and beach. We booked this hotel as wedding guests and also, as a pre and post cruise respite . Check in is a little hectic and confusing. The main lobby is under construction and the check-in area is very cramped with a very narrow traffic area. We were offered a welcome drink, but it never arrived. The front desk staff was very polite and professional and directed us to the bellhop to store our luggage while our room was being readied. If you plan to arrive at this hotel early, make sure your swimsuit is easily accessible, as you can enjoy the beach or pool as you wait for your room to be ready or you can relax and have a drink outside. We were supposed to receive a call when our room was ready, but that never came either, so we checked in at the front desk again around 4pm and our room was ready and the bags were delivered promptly. The elevators are fast! We loved this as the hotel is over 20 stories and the wedding party and guests were all staying on different floors. The location of the hotel is so convenient; a Starbucks is across the street, a Walgreens is about 1 block away, and a Dunkin Donuts is about 3 blocks away. Just make a right when you exit the hotel. The area felt relatively safe, although there were some people sleeping on cardboard. The area is heavily patrolled by bilingual police, who are also very helpful with directions. The room safes are large enough for a large laptop. Room amenities include an iron, ironing board, hair dryer, mini fridge and coffee maker. The bed was extremely comfortable. The public transportation was not available when we were there; due to a strike. A cab ride to Old San Juan and the Cruise Ship Port varied from $16-$19 one way. The wedding had to be held indoors due to a violent thunderstorm accompanied by torrid rain. I was very disappointed in the arrangements for the indoor contingency plan. Although nothing can mar a beautiful couple on their most important day, the hotel had prepared the room for the ceremony by sectioning off a portion of a conference room and draped what appeared to be a big sheet as a backdrop. Contrast this next to the bride's elegant 4 feet tall vases with pink submerged orchids and you can envision how tacky this looked. Surely this was not the first time this hotel had to arrange an alternative to the outdoors. However, the reception was beautiful, the staff was very accommodating and the food was delicious. If you decide to use this hotel for your wedding, make sure they have a more attractive setting for your wedding in case of bad weather. I wood recommend this hotel for families and businesses and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great seaside location!”
Reviews.Author: Georges O
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Marriott in Condado earlier this month. This is a very nice hotel, the rooms are super confortable. They have a great view of the sea and the beach is very pleasant. Only disappointement: I would expect free wi-fi. To me, it should be the norm in all modern and luxury hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Service at Affordable Prices”
Reviews.Author: jms31880
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic! I was in awe of the ocean front view and the esthetics of the pool area. The private access to the beach is what made the location of this hotel phenomenal, not to mention the high quality food offered on the hotel premises that was served by request in the pool area. I reveled in the comforts of the room and looked forward to my naps on the plush, fresh mattresses! This hotel's cleanliness is worth noting as well as the friendliness of the staff. Aside from having a view of paradise right outside our window, this Marriot is in an ideal location across the street from authentic restaurants, dance clubs, Walgreens and even a Starbucks which is a guilty pleasure of mine. Oh, and although I'm not a gambler, there is a casino downstairs as well, and with a $5 voucher, I was able to play a game. Also, all drinks in the casino are complimentary which was an added bonus, in addition to the unique gift shop! I was so happy with the service here, and somehow, we received a third night free! Can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in San Juan!!”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveling_Texan3
Reviews.Content: We arrived late due to our flight and upon arrival we were upgraded to a corner suite! The staff was amazing and the beach was fantastic! Can get very loud in the lobby at night...youre in a casino and its San Juan!!!! We enjoyed our stay and cannot wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Oceanfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: #1METSFAN
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel on Condado beach. Great customer service and bustling bar scene. I would definately stay here again. Very large rooms with balconies. I booked a standard city view room and was upgraded to an oceanview room upon check-in as I am a Marriots reward member. Great restaurants within walking distance and Old San Juan only 2 miles away......

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: messin44
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Marriott San Juan September 23rd, and 24th before leaving for a cruise. We had a hard time picking which hotel to stay in. I will say I am 100% happy we chose the Marriott. Although this is an older hotel, It is so well taken care of, Clean, and a perfect spot on the beach. The only thing not so good was the lobby was under construction. But honestly, it never was an issue with noise or anything else. We were upgraded to a 15th floor corner room ocean view as soon as we got there, we had a free Breakfast buffet both mornings, free Wi-Fi and it is in walking distance to any other place to eat. I would recommend anyone to stay here. The staff was amazing. and close to the airport. Our room was perfectly clean. We had a King size bed that I wish I could have brought home. If you are looking to stay at some 5 star modern hotel, then this may not be for you, but I would go back there tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Kateek
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in PR and wasn't sure what to expect, but was extremely happy with out decision to come to PR and stay at the Marriott. We were greeted with Rum Punches upon waiting to check-in which set the trip off perfectly. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The pool was very nice, pool slide was a lot of fun, and the pool bar was incredibly convenient. We also spent some time on the beach and there were some people trying to sell things, but were not pushy or over bearing whatsoever. The bartenders were very friendly, and so was all of the wait staff we had in the restaurants. We ate at both the latin grill and Tuscany and both were good. We also had dinner at the italian pizza place down the road, next to Tijuanas, and that was shockingly delicious (and we are 2 New Yorkers that know good pizza!). We were supposed to go to Tijuanas but did not want to wait so we decided to go there. The location was very convenient being right across from Starbucks and Walgreens. Housekeeping also re-stocked your room each day with bottles of water which I thought was a great addition. You can also pick up bottles of water for free at the front desk. This was without a doubt the best hotel experience I have ever had and will most definitely return here when I come back to San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sintia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel back in January and wasn't really impressed with the hotel. The furnitures and carpets look very worn out for a four star resort. But when I stayed over this time, I had more positive experiences in overall b/c I got to stay there little longer than the last time. The friendly staffs were a big positive and if u don't mind getting up early in the morning( around 6am) go for a walk or run in the front of the hotel b/c the view is just breathtaking! The surround area offer good restaurants( go to Danny's for breakfast) and nightlife. There are two Walgreen's around the hotel, which can save u lots of money.

Reviews.Title: “great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rh-chi
Reviews.Content: The staff here was very friendly and helpful in helping us decide what to do. This was my first trip to Puerto Rico. We especially liked the man at the travel services desk who helped us book our tours to El Yunque and the biobay tour. Great location, and the nicest looking hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Decision is made!”
Reviews.Author: marisol m
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days and had a wonderful experience. Every employee greets you, answers questions and is completely courteous. You are very well situated. 15 min. from O.S.J. 45 min. to El Yunque and 1Hr. 15M from Camuy caves. There is private beach outside your hotel steps. Bar with a view. 2 restaurants with in the hotel and lets not forget about the casino right downstairs. Live music on Fri. & Sat. Robert from the Hertz on site was extremely helpful. Sonny at La vista rest. made us laugh each morning. The hotel its staff and location made our 1st trip to P.R. a magnificent one. I can say without hesitation that I will be back and I will stay here again. oh! and eat at Bebos! Excellent food!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Laura L
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice and clean, staff was friendly and very attentive. My discontent with the hotel is with their policy with the resort fees and room deposits. I was traveling with as a family of 4 and reserved 2 rooms. At check in they pulled out a $250 security deposit per room. In addition to that they charged a $69 resort fee per room that was allegedly going to be charged upon check out but appeared on my account the second night of our stay. The security deposits were eventually credited to my account but it wasn't until 3 days after we got back from our vacation. Additionally, there were various miscellaneous "pending" transactions that kept appearing in my account for mysterious amounts. Again, this was all credited back to my account but it was inconvenient to have funds tied up while they sorted out the confusion.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: DoriM821
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott San Juan during our recent visit to Puerto Rico as my siblings and I went for the burial services of our mother. We could have easily stayed with family but wanted to stay somewhere we could be centrally located and would be able to relax after this stressful and sad experience of losing our mother. The Marriott Hotel was perfect for us, as I live in New York, my brother came from Texas and my sister recently moved to Florida. So staying together gave our families a chance to bond and grieve together under one roof. The hotel is presently under some form of expansion though we were not aware of any type of construction noise and we were told they would be completed by November 2011. All the staff were friendly and helpful. And our rooms were a nice size and immaculately cleaned. My sister and brother in law stayed in one of the beautiful penthouse suites with a beautiful ocean view balcony. Truly luxury and we did get to enjoy it as well though we stayed in a more moderately priced room. The swimming pool and jacuzzi was open early and closed at 11PM which was great to be able to stop by after a late evening for a swim or a soak. Also the beach was right there. The restaurants were enjoyable and if you wanted to step away from the hotel there were plenty of places to have a coffee or a great meal. DiZucchero right accross the street was a wonderful restaurant where we enjoyed two of our late meals. Accross from the hotel is Starbucks and a few streets down we found this little restaurant called Orozco that offered a wonderful breakfast from 8AM to 3PM with delicious spanish coffee as well as other great dishes. All and all The Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris was a great choice to stay at and we couldn't help but enjoy our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: bostock22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for 8 nights and overall had an excellent experience. The rooms are typical Marriott, nothing special, but clean and updated. The pool area is very nice with plenty of seating and a great pool bar. The beach area is fantastic and that's where we spent most of our time. The hotel provides nice beach chairs and umbrellas and there is food/drink service on the beach as well. The beach itself is considered public, but I didn't see any non-hotel guests, and if there were any, it wasn't a problem. A few times jewelry and ice-cream vendors came by, but they weren't intrusive or rude. We had the buffet bkfst inclued in our room. A good deal since the buffet for 2 is $40. If you are paying for it separately, not sure it's a great deal unless you are a huge eater. The lobby is currently being renovated, but honestly, I didn't pay much attention and don't consider it a drawback. I never heard any noise and everything is covered up. I'm not paying to stay in the lobby anyways. The beach bar is a good place to sit back and have drink. The bar menu is very average, but in the evenings, they will serve off the menu from the inside restaurant, which is much much better. We tried all the ceviches on that menu and they were all delish. The empanadas and tostones were also tasty, we had them several times throughout our stay. One thing we noted was the amount of security on the property as well as the surrounding area. Twice daily a police heli flew over along the beach, a police vessel sailed along the coast and Police ATV's patrolled the beach. Additionally, police presence was very strong along Ashford Ave. We heard that there had been muggings but to be honest, we felt safe each time we went out (maybe due to the police presence?)

Reviews.Title: “Overvalued price”
Reviews.Author: DiamondSuave
Reviews.Content: Our first room from an older section in the hotel and smells that way. We changed to a better room but our 'beachside' view was of the neighboring condo with a slight view of the beach. Not worth the money. The restaurants were good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: titibalou
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel my last 2 night due to it's proximity to the airport. Â  When I arrived in the lobby it was filled with teenagers (some sporting event), and very crowded. Â It is also a bit small so I thought to myself, 'party hotel...'. Â Quite the opposite. Â  In short, rooms are nice, the hotel in general is too,Â as well as the beach. Â Beach staff is very attentive and quick to set you up with chairs an umbrella. Â Pool is nice too. Â Only stayed 2 nights so didn't really see much of the hotel (only had food at beach bar), but overall no complaints - nice hotel. One tip: there are really nice restaurants walking distance from hotel. Â Try 'La Concha' for dinner. Â Expensive and dress code enforced, but worth it. Â There are also numerous cheaper and excellent restaurants that were quite good. Â When you exit hotel lobby, hang a right (Ave Dr. Ashford) for a few blocks until you hit a Y intersection (Ashford and Magdanela) . Â Go left on Magdanela; several really good restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time at the Marriott San Juan Resort”
Reviews.Author: Civilwarbuff54
Reviews.Content: This review will be written from a differing perspective of two handicapped ladies traveling. From our perspective, it is all about how resorts treat those of us who are indeed physically challenged. One can glean helpful tips from our experience for if we are treated well and with helpful compassion, one can bet the average healthy traveler will be as well. Our travel dates to San Juan where September 19-25th. We used Delta Airlines to fly, and, they were fantastic! Flights were on time, handicap wheelchair assistance was provided with a smile, and, we were indeed pre-boarded. Thank you Delta, we could not fly any other way! Your gate staff were marvelous, and, the flight crews very accommodating and supportive. Once we arrived, we hired a taxi from the airport to the hotel. You will be given a slip of paper with the prices for the fare listed. The driver spoke no English, and, we spoke no Spanish! Yet somehow, we managed to communicate and had a nice drive. Check in at the Marriott was with a smile, very quick, the hotel amentities were explained, our keys given and boom, up to the room we went! The Bellman took our luggage, gave us a ticket and quickly brought our bags and gave us a room indoctrination. We had an oceanfront room, on the 19th floor (Room 1914) and the views were gorgeous. Housekeeping did a spectacular job daily to keep our room tidy and well supplied. Thank you Joiceylyn, your efforts made our stay memorable. Please folks, remember to tip the staff for jobs well done!! There was no request that we made on the housekeeping level that was not met. The room had two double beds, very nice linens, plenty of towels, a small fridge, a room safe, large bathroom, a working desk, bath robes, and, patio. Every day, you are left two bottles of water in the bathroom. Should you desire more, they are quick to bring them to you! Yes, the carpet was a bit worn in places, but, I would notice only because we walk with canes, and, tend to look at the flooring. In my book, it was just a few "love foot prints" left behind by travelers of the past! Get ready to exercise your arm muscles, for the doors are heavy to open and push! Good security feature. Now to the beach...yes, you do pay for the umbrellas, beach chairs, towels. It is pro-rated daily. We only used the service on Wednesday, so I was a bit concerned about paying $84 dollars. Frankly, it would behoove the Marriott just to put such a bill in with the room rate and be done with it all. Saves a lot of barking by clients and frayed nerves by other clients! The men who carry out the chairs and dig the sand around the umbrella were prompt and courteous. One can imagine the flack and fire they hear about this charge daily! I was merely happy that my umbrella did not blow over on top of us! This is not your typical Caribbean beach. It is Atlantic Ocean waters, with the surf line taking a small dip down, as the waves come crashing into shore. As we say in SCUBA diving, a lot of "white water". For stronger swimmers, or surfers, or those who have had a few to many cocktails, the effortt seemed to be worth it for the clients who ventured out. Everyone there seemed to be very happy! The beach area was immaculate, being cleaned daily. We navigated down the steps with our canes and on to the beach. I did not see a ramp for wheelchair access, but, perhaps I missed the same. The pool is divided into two areas: one for sunning and a quick dip and one for swimming/splashing about near the pool slide and bar. The water was crystal clear and clean. Plenty of towels that you can exchange for dry ones. The pool bar was active and there was a young lady taking orders for food and drinks. While there are no umbrellas about the pool, you can find shade at any time of the day. Temps were about 90-92 degrees during our stay. Needless to say, we stayed by the pool for most of the trip, venturing in with our canes to the amusement of the other guests! There is music playing, but, not so blaring that it interrupts a good book or a nap on the chair. There is easy access to the pool area for folks utilizing wheelchairs or canes. Money exchange in Puerto Rico is of course, our USA dollar. Meaning, things are a bit pricey. Food in particular, alcohol as well. There are several dining options offered at the hotel: pool snack shack, the daily buffett for breakfast which switches to sit down dinners, and, the gorgeous Italian restaurant. Outside of the casino there is the coffee bar, which offeres light fare, donuts etc. Inside the casino, beginning at six at night is a "Noodle Bar." Imagine my surprise when they brought out this soup toureen size bowl just for me!! No way could just one person finish it! I recommend trying the noodle bar, and, sharing the choices between two people! My Mother ordered the sweet and sour shrimp, and, out came fried rice, brocolli, and 12 huge shrimp! You will not leave hungry. Since it is inside of the casino, the noise level is a bit higher for dining. Stop by the Concierge Desk, on the computer are listed the menus for the restaurants. It gives you a quick look at what is offered and the prices. I would like to commend the wait staff and Chef Cesare Biancalana of the Ristorante Tuscany. It is a dining experience not to be missed during your stay! There is a difference between eating and fine dining, and, you will experience a masterful display of culinary artwork should you book a reservation! Have you ever seen such wonderful combination on a plate that actually mimick artwork? If not, they go and see what Chef Cesare has in store for you!! His personal touches are seen everywhere, and, this is a gentleman who not only is a rare talent, but, is very available to the clients in the dining area. There was no request to small or to large that was not tended to with smiles and expediency. The dessert coffees are decadent, the cakes sinfully guilty!! Thank you one and all for making these two ladies feel so pampered and special! We remain, truly grateful. Yes, we did order up room service twice. And twice were not disappointed with our selections. There are times when ladies just do not want to dine out, rather we girls prefer our nighties and a lighter evening meal! The Staff took our orders quickly, and, the food arrived within about a half an hour. Stellar service! Again, we remain so grateful. Nothing like feeling right at home with a good meal, and, a tv until it was time to dress to visit the casino for the evening! The Casino was open 24 hours a day. There are slot machines, don't forget to check out the back room on the left hand side for the nickel and penny slots, there are the "tables", and, very capable dealers. I did see ID's being checked, and obnoxious folks being politely escorted out. Drinks are offered, and the Cashiers are quick with your cash outs. Since we do not stay up late, we were usually out of the casino by ten at night. Local people come to play, guests from other hotels arrive as well. It can be "cheek to cheek" if you get my meaning! We never felt threatened, for there is the Security prescence that is prominent and active. Speaking of Security, we did have a small incident that arose. I reported it to the Evening Front Desk Manager who quickly sent up Carlos Nay and Lorraine Smith to take our deposition and calm our nerves. Their level of professionalism and capacity to navigate the situation was quickly apparent. The incident was resolved and the conflict quickly tended to by the Marriott and Staff. Having traveled now to 59 countries over my many years of traveling, I have always felt that it is not the problem that ruins a vacation/holiday, but, rather how the hotel management and staff handle the same. The Marriott San Juan Team was well prepared, knew precisely what was required by whom, and, resolved the incident to our satisfaction. Mr. Nay and Ms. Smith checked on us several times afterwards, always with great compassion and concern for our needs. Truly a remarkable pair of employes who deserve nothing but the best that life could offer them. Thank you again Carolos and Lorraine, you and your families remain in our hearts and prayers. The Security Team does their job to the utmost, and, tries to remain inconspicuous as possible. Trust the Marriott Security Team, they are on the job 24/7! There is a car rental desk, which, we did not utilize during our stay. Don't think my nerves could handle San Juan traffic and the highways! There is also a very knowledgeable and helpful Tour Desk, right around the corner from the Front Desk. We booked the combination tour of Baccardi Rum Factory, Fort of San Cristobel, and, Old San Juan. Not to high a price, $69 for about five and a half hours out on tour. The desk is most helpful, stop by and have your tour needs met. Lots to choose from! Our Tour Driver was "Harry" and we could not have asked for a better guide! Humerous, knowledgeable, courteous, and prompt. While out and about, we took note of a high Police prescence, crime seems to be a problem, perhaps more so around tourist areas. My advice is simple: use common sense, do not travel alone, and, be mindful of which area you are finding yourself. We did some shopping in Old San Juan. History and beautiful archieture abounds, so go and see what is out there! If you are physically challenged, the Fort does have handicap access and an elevator. Now, we did not make it to the higher levels, but, were quiet content to stroll about the plaza area, the gift shop, the tunnel. The Tour Desk can advise you which tours are more arduous for the elderly/handicapped. There is time to eat a lunch downtown, and, we enjoyed our fare! We were pooped upon our return! Job well done Harry, you are the best! The Tour Desk does offer brochures and maps for the more adventurous. If you run out of something, or have little time to shop at the Plaza Las Americanas Mall or in Old San Juan, there is a small gift shop next to the Front Desk. Also, tucked away, out of sight, down a bit from the elevators, before the banquet hall, is a young lady selling local crafts off a cart in a small anteroom! Stop by and see her, she is lovely and has such wonderful items for sale! We did indeed walk down the block to the Walgreens for some snacks and Coke, all I can say is it is not the Walgreen's back home! But, you can save a few bucks over resort prices. I toss a few snack items into my suitcase that I check, and, then have them for the beach or pool area. Some people have complained about the elevators. There were four elevators that ran all the time, so I cannot way that I understand their complaint. They were all in working order during our stay, complete with new carpeting! Yes, they are indeed redoing the Lobby area. But the noises was not that offensive. I believe they hope to complete the work before the end of November. The Bell Hop/Doormen staff were informative, knowledgeable, courteous, and on the ball. Good job guys keep up the good work! I did take note of the parking garage for those of you who desire to rent a car for the week. Sadly, I have no knowledge of the parking fees. With regard to "Local Restaurants" there are several in the area that are reasonable, and, offer a myriad of cuisine choices. Check the taxi fares prior to getting into the cab. The "Check Out" process is painless at the Marriott San Juan. You can keep a tally by viewing your folio on the tv. We did the express check out, left our keys on the table in the room and were on our way at six in the morning. My bill was complete and accurate. Well done Accounting/Billing Department! My recommendation is to keep all of your receipts for the rare incidents that you may have to question a charge on your bill. If there is a problem with your bill, upon arrival home you are accorded a phone number to use to resolve the same. To date, my credit card was only charged with what we ordered for meals and the beach/umbrells service. We left San Juan on an early Delta flight, at night in the morning. The Taxi Driver who carried us to the airport was on the ball, getting us to the Delta check in area. They do require you to stop, and, proceed to the USDA area where your bags are scanned PRIOR to you going to your airline gate check in!! This was a new experience for us, and, once your bags are scanned they are tagged as such. We played by "the rules" and were at the gate two and a half hours prior to take off. Since we are pre-boarded, we wanted to be where we needed to be and not hold up the other passengers. To those who are considering the Marriott San Juan Resort as a possible destination, you will not be disappointed. Should you encounter any problems during your stay, please, give the Staff an opportunity to assist you and resolve the situation. So many travelers return home dissatisfied or angry about issues that could have easily been resolved by the Staff if they were given a chance!! So, go, have a fantastic time at the Marriott and come home with many endearing memories. We certainly did! Thank you to the Marriott Staff for making our stay one for the memory books! See you all again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: trfdar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid September 2011. This hotel was perfect for us! They were accommodating after our trip was delayed by a day due to a missed airline connection. They gave us our same package rate, extended the trip by a day at the same rate, and even comped our breakfast! It was wonderful having a tour desk in the lobby, which was very helpful in booking our zip line adventure (highly recommended). My husband enjoyed the casino. We've never been to a casino where they will let you eat at the card tables! On Friday night, they had the best live musical trio - puerto rican music to makes you want to dance! I do agree with a previous poster that it would have been nice to have that kind of music at the pool, rather than zen music, but that is a personal preference. Everyone that we had contact with was so helpful, polite, and friendly. One instance I wanted to mention, our granddaughter misplaced her cell phone. We called the front desk to ask if anyone had turned one in, but no luck. We immediately went down to the pool area to check if it was there, and security was already there looking for it! The security guard even helped me look thru the dirty towel bin to see if it had been mistakenly thrown in there. I call that above and beyond!! The only complaint I can think of, is that there is a "wet, musty" smell in the room, but that is to be expected in a beach front hotel in a humid climate. Simple solution...there is a Walgreens one block down the street, and we purchased a can of scented Lysol, and sprayed the room down a couple of times a day. Problem solved!! The food was traditional hotel food, on the expensive side, but the tropical atmosphere made it worthwhile. We did the breakfast buffet every morning, and our last night splurged on a good meal at La Vista. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to San Juan. We had a fantastic time and hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Marriott's Service”
Reviews.Author: Gussy
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sept 19 - 24 and was upgraded to ocean view/balcony. Room was in good shape for a beach resort. Didn't go to the casino but heard it was crowded. The work out room was very good. Equipment was in great shape and there is another area for floor exercises. The pool areas were in great shape as well with plenty of seating. One day I requested a lounge/shading for the beach area. I saw people with dogs running the beach and there were lots of birds so I preferred the pool area. Also, there is a run off from the street on the left side of the beach. Husband was on business so we would go to PH floor for breakfast and munchies in the evening. One night there was a gathering for frequent Marriott customers which was nice. I had a couple of glasses of red wine and when I went back to the room I discovered my mouth was purple. Ha. One afternoon I was sitting under the shaded pool bar and discovered that they have activities throughout the day. Staff began bingo sessions so I joined in a won a free drink. Drinks are around $10.00 and they aren't that great. Happy Hour is between 4 - 6. It's cheaper to drink on the PH floor if you have access and drinks are better. On a side note we ate room service most nights which was OK. There is a Wal-Greens across the street for snacks and I'd suggest buying beer/drinks there. Met a couple in the lobby that paid a cab $60.00 roundtrip to Old San Juan. There is a bus stop on the right exit of the Marriott so for three quarters you can save yourself some money and it took us less than 20 minutes for a whopping $3.00 roundtrip. There is a free trolley in OSJ and don't forget to stop by Don Q for some free rum samples. The forts are in walking range if you don't want to wait for the trolley. Can attend both for $5.00 or $3.00 for one and don't step in the poop (it's not dog and I'll let you figure that one out). There are lots of police in OSJ especially on the streets between the forts where La Perla is located. Didn't make it to the rain forest this time. We really enjoyed the service at the Marriott and will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: Casino, entertainment, good restaurants, and a wonderful clean beach hotel at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: LTAN72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot over the 4th of July weekend. Though busy, we were miraculously able to check-in 3 hours early. However, others weren't so lucky and had to wait (they were given free drinks in the bar area while they did). The room was pretty cool - we had a double balcony, ocean view room. It was very spacious with a large, comfy bed. Going to bed at night with the sound of waves crashing outside was very relaxing. The location of the hotel was perfect - the beach is just outside. Across the street there were tons of restaurants, drug stores (e.g. Walgreens) and even a Starbucks. The only down sides were: 1) The pool area did tend to get busy and loud w/ kids (maybe the 4th of July weekend had something to do with this?). Additionally, if the weather was good, beach chairs became scarce fast. 2) The spa was less than stellar. I had a manicure done and before my nails could even dry, they were handing me a pen to sign the credit card slip. Why they didn't have me do this before, I don't know. Also, no one helped me open the door on the way out, so my nails ended up getting ruined anyway. I was too frustrated to fight it, so I just ended up buying polish at the aforementioned drug store and re-did my nails.

Reviews.Title: “ATL to P.R. and back again”
Reviews.Author: Dee H
Reviews.Content: Definitely did'nt want to leave. It was the type of place you really feel comfortable at. All the staff was helpful and all of them speak english. It wasnt all inclusive but there was alot of restaurants all walking distance from the hotel. For breakfast you HAVE to go to Pinkys (make left out of hotel, 3 or 4 blocks down on the left next to starbucks). For lunch try anything and for dinner you MUST have Buena Verde (I think). Its real close to the hotel, make left out of hotel, accross the street one block down. Kinda pricy but you wont be disappointed. Back to the hotel; it was clean, recently renovated, modern, NICE pool and jaccuzi, real clean beach and nice staff. What more do you need. You gotta go to Old San Juan. Oh yeah, the drinks at the hotel were real expensive. make sure you get wasted during happy hour or buy your liquor outside and bring back to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great unexpected stay”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel the night before a cruise. We stayed on the 4th floor overlooking the pool. Room was clean and quite spacious for us (2 adults & 2 kids). Nice balcony and large bathroom. A 10 minute wait to check in was made very comfortable with complimentary rum punches for adults and plain punches for kids.We enjoyed the pool, beach and fitness club. Both were very clean and well kept. I loved it. My husband was quite satisfied but not wowed (as he has stayed in many upscale hotels on business). Upon returning from the cruise, all flights were cancelled and so we rebooked this hotel. They did wow my husband this time! The staff was so pleasant and understanding to our situation. We got a room upgrade- 19th floor overlooking the ocean and free wi-fi. We also got a late checkout which allowed us extra time to swim and clean up before our flight. Mike's pizza delivered and we ate in the temporary lobby while wating to checkout. The beach has chairs and umbrellas free of charge- they set up where you choose. A pleasant security guard monitors the beach what appears to be 24 hours (children are only allowed on beach with adults). Only one man walked along the beach selling necklaces but was non intrusive. The women at the desk were not only courteous but helpful in their restaurant and siteseeing recommendations. Had the best calzone at Mike's Pizza but there are so many good restaurants along the strip. We felt safe walking along with our children, day or evening. There were many police officers standing along and driving the strip. There is a Walgreens, Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts and at least 10 restaurants within several blocks. The bus is 75 cents per person to Old San Juan so we took a day trip in there and had an excellent meal at EL Dente, a recommendation of the hotel staff. We only ate one dinner at hotel, good but not excellent. There were so many other choices. We did not use the casino, tours or garage so cannot rate. I would stay here again and recommend it. Pool,beach and hotel were as represented on website, which isn't always the case. This hotel resulted in a 4 day pleasant surprise instead of a travel nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Good and not so good”
Reviews.Author: Jack S
Reviews.Content: The concierge lounge is the place to be during the construction which will last until December, 2011. Lani, the hostess, could not have been more accomodating to our group of six who needed an occasional document printed and a place to meet to discuss business over outstanding hors d'oeuvres and mojitos after working all day. The general manager went to some effort to see that we were comfortable and that his staff were attentive. The entire first floor lounge area is under renovation which makes for an unattractive entrance and some noise. Be careful if you drive a van or high overheat vehicle as there is an overheat pipe that can be hit by the top of your vehicle when crossing a speed bump; merely fitting under the overhead barrier will not give you notice of potential overhead obstacles in the garage when crossing the speed bump!

Reviews.Title: “great value, great views, great times.”
Reviews.Author: carlosymarce
Reviews.Content: Stayed here september 2009, and had a blast. The casino was great my wife and I won a few bucks. Very high end decor and feel. Friendly staff, clean rooms and great staff. Must book a day trip to el yunque national forest. well worth the money. Bring sneakers, NO SANDDLES. Also head downtown and eat at raices. Best place in San Juan. Overall, our experience at the hotel was very good and would recomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: paul007bondjr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located on the beach and had a pretty relaxing time. Staff were friendly and always helpful. The lady at the travel desk was extremely pleasant. Since i was travelling alone, she went the extra mile to ensure that i got into the best tours and true to her words, did not have any complaints whatsoever with what she booked! The only negative thingthat i had was the food through Room Service, which was just about ok and a bit over priced, however, there are some great eating places within walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice Possible!”
Reviews.Author: tessa_derfner
Reviews.Content: My partner and I took our first vacation in six years this summer -- we stayed at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino and could not have been happier. The location in the Condado, right along a stretch of high-end shops and restaurants, was great. The resort facilities were gorgeous and there truly was a location for every mood, from the beach bar (our daily afternoon hang-out), to the wading pool (perfect for pre-dinner relaxing and watching the sunset), the sizable 24-hour hotel casino (excellent when Tropical Storm Emily forced us indoors), the nightclub entertained us with DJs and a great live band (with plenty of locals and tourists who came to dance), and the beach was AMAZING, so clean and pristine. Security was very present, so we always felt safe. The restaurants were good and there was plenty to choose from. Many people we met were visiting from nearby hotels because the Marriott was so much nicer. But most of all it was the incredibly professional staff who made our stay so special. From our arrival, we were always greeted with such warmth and hospitality, we soon felt we had a home away from home. When I got a bad sunburn and needed the hotel doctor, I got well-wishes from so many staff members, I felt instantly better. I cannot recommend this resort highly enough. We have already planned to return within the year.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: alb387
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Mariott for Labor Day Weekend. It was a last minute getaway and we enjoyed every minute of it. We landed early and we were crossing our fingers that we would be able to check in as we were quite tired from the trip. Check in was a breeze and they had a room available for us so it was good. They gave us free champagne while we were checking in. The hotel was pretty good, there is construction going on but you never hear it or see it as they covered the section with a curtain. They have a kiddie pool and another one for bigger kids/grownups. That pool isn't too deep so no diving was allowed. There is a slide which was fun for both kids and grownups. They also have a swimup bar which was good. The pool service was super slow, though, as well as at the beach. However there were some exceptional staff members I need to mention (and you should ask for them!): Richard at the beach who always greets us with a friendly smile every morning and will bring our umbrella and chairs no matter how far we want and Angelo at breakfast who is the best server! The beach is amazing in the morning, and you should definitely go and grab a good spot by the water. The waves were pretty crazy but the water is warm and blue and beautiful. The hotel is in a very good location: starbucks across the street, walgreens 2 blocks away, loads of restaurants within walking distance. Definitely try Perla restaurant inside La Concha Hotel. Amazing ambience and views and the food is delicious! Worth the splurge. The hotel is also only 10 mins away from Old San Juan and only 75 cents via bus. Try the restuarant Bura if you do make it to Old San Juan, the food is delicious and the mojitos are the best. Also there is a cool store called Pina Colada that is walking distance from the hotel-- very cool stuff. All in all the hotel was enjoyable, and clean-- and kid friendly. The music wasn't obnoxious all day but they do have a DJ around 5pm or 6pm. Only complaint would be the resort fee and they don't have free wi-fi so you'd have to pay $19 for wifi! Just go to Starbucks and avail of their free wifi. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Felt safe. Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: zimmazimm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely nice. There was complimentary champaigne given to us as we waited to check in. The lobby was under remodeling construction at the time, so soon it will be even better. The pool is AMAZING! The casino is decent, but not too much different from a crusie ship casino. The room we stayed in was on the 10th floor, and the view was amazing. It was a very nice and clean room. There was a jazz club across the street from this hotel, as well as a Mexican restaurant, an Italian restaurant and a Japanese restaurant (that served sushi). There is a drug store a couple blocks away that we went to frequently. I recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: arnaldor21
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Clean rooms. Pool a little small but hotel is right on the beach. Across the street are some nice restaurants where we had breakfast and dinner - cheaper than hotel restaurants. Won't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mjackLivoniaMi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott San Juan & Stellaris Casino prior to leaving on a cruise. The hotel was beautiful! We didn't eat at the hotel but it is the middle of many restaurants and bars, . Felt very safe walking down the street at 11pm . The rooms were spacious and the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on. Th pool was nice and the beach was clean. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: mary615
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 5 nights here. Would love to return. Excellent location: right on the ocean, walking distance to Starbucks, Walgreens, lot of shops and restaurants. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would like to see a microwave and a larger coffee maker than the one cup. Should have strips in tub to prevent slipping.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite Marriott”
Reviews.Author: josh1231
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived here for one night on a layover of our flight home. We were at the hotel for about 18 hours. We made the most out of our 18 hours though, and got to experience the Tuscany restaurant for dinner, La Vista Restaurant for breakfast, Casino, business center, and walked the entire property, including pool area. We arrived to the hotel at about 8:00. I had just booked the room about 3 hours earlier because we were leaving St. Thomas a day early because of an approaching storm. Upon checkin, I asked if we could get the Escape Package rate which was $20 more than our current rate, but included breakfast for 2 people daily. Because I had literally just booked the hotel 3 hours before arriving, I figured it would be no problem. I was wrong. The person checking us in said he would need to check with his manager, who told him they could not do it. I pressed a little bit as to why, at which time he blatantly lied and said it required a two night stay. I of course had to call him on this, because how would I have known about the package if it hadn't come up during my attempting to book my one night stay. He went back into his managers office, came back out about 3 minutes later and said they were working on it, then came back out again a couple minutes later and said they could do it. This was not the best start to my time here, because I stay at Marriott's relatively frequently, as far as vacationers go, and had never had one of their employee's flat out lie to me. We then went to dinner at Tuscany's, and had a wonderful meal with a great server, great food, and great wine. It wasn't the cheapest meal ever at $109 before tip, however it was absolutely worth it. We then went to the casino where we dumped all of our allotted gambling money in about 15 minutes and went upstairs to go to bed. We ate breakfast at La Vista's the next morning, and they had a pretty good buffet. they had an omelet station, but instead of standing there and waiting for your omelet to get done, your waitress brought it to you when completed. This was a nice touch. We asked for late check out because we really didn't have to leave until 2:00, and were given 1:00 pm checkout instead of 12:00 checkout, which was a little disappointing. We went to the casino again that morning at which time I was a little surprised to be asked to remove my hat. It was 11:00 in the morning, and other people in the place were allowed to wear the proverbial "do rag", but I had to remove my St. Thomas hat. Now mind you I wasn't dressed "gangster", and was sporting my best tourist outfit of the Tommy Bahama island shirt, short's and sandals. We then called the bell service to get our luggage, who was truly incredible. They were incredibly nice, talkative, and very informative about the island and helping us with any questions we had.
