The Marriott gave me mixed emotions. The tipped employees were very good, ready to serve, and understood their salary was based on their ability to be service oriented. Unfortunately the rest of the staff didn't share this attitude, and seemed to not really care whether we were happy with our stay or not. If I return to San Juan, and I plan to, I will not stay here. It wouldn't be a terrible choice if you did, but I think you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Avarage Stay”
Reviews.Author: tosbaga
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel just for one night and didn't have a good experience. Check-in process was pretty slow but it was OK. We stayed in a ocean view room. Our room was clean and had a balcony with full ocean view. Hotel is very busy, so it is hard to spend time in pool if you want. Pool was full of children, and did not look like clean. Beach was beautiful if you like ocean with big waves. Hotel is very close to public transportation; you can reach Old San Juan by bus if you are interested in. After staying in Vieques and experiencing its beautiful beaches, this stay was not a good experience as per what we paid for. We liked Old San Juan; I would prefer staying a hotel there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wandafts
Reviews.Content: The place was beautiful service was great even though the lobby was under construction. Rooms are beautiful pool is awesome didn't really like the fact had to pay for parking $15 per day. Pricey restaurant but I really enjoyed my stay and its central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent, Unique.”
Reviews.Author: Orlando G
Reviews.Content: I found nothing wrong with this hotel. The staff was very helpful and went out of their way to help. The restaurant waiters are the best I've seen. The pool area is safe, ample and comfortable. The only thing I did not like is that they play pool volleyball all the time and you can't swim....that's the only minus. From the moment you check in into this hotel, the service, attention and care is second to none. There is security everywhere and the food is fantastic. The rooms were extremely clean and luxurious. I play around no more. Marriott is the hotel for us regardlessof where we go. I hate bad surprises, Marriott have none everywhere we go. I dropped Holiday Inn and Days Inn as they turned into truckers and farm workers paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a safe central location”
Reviews.Author: Atlglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: We are in our early 30's and prefer hotels like J.W. Marriott, but unfortunately we couldn't find one in San Juan. I almost booked the Hilton Laguna Villas, before i read in a review that it was essentially condos transformed as a room. Also, the view there was of a Lagoon villa, which is an entirely different view. We got the Ocean front room - and believe me, you DO NOT want to go cheap on this, because the view is really amazing. I got a better price on Expedia rather than the Marriott website itself even though I am a rewards club member. The room is adequate, with a giant clean king size bed, and great cleaning staff. Now for the Cons: 1. Concierge is NEVER available on the phone. 2. Some of the customer service people are rude - it could also be a language barrier. 3. Pool area is pitiful. No infinity pool here. 4. Breakfast is the WORST that you will ever eat. DO NOT, I Repeat, DO NOT opt for the all inclusive breakfast. When you come out of the resort, there are literally 2-3 dozen restaurants in walking distance and you could get fantastic food at a fraction of the price. Lastly, most people always think of the -ve's, so let me end with some of the PROS again 1. Good casino inside. There is a 5-10 limit poker table in the evenings. 2. Fantastic Italian restaurant - Tuscany within 3. Modern rooms with a flat screen TV 4. Central location - You are in the middle of the city. 5. Car rental - Hertz on-site Now go on and enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Nice Beach, EXCELLENT Service.”
Reviews.Author: judyb_ATL
Reviews.Content: We went for a short trip over Labor Day weekend, expecting it to be a business centric hotel (since it was located in the business section), with out a lot of amenities. It was a nice surprise to find that the pictures on the internet actually match to what is reality. We had a very nice ocean front room - the favorite part was the balcony... big enough for two to enjoy the view, each other and all those sunrises. The service was very good. True customer service, on-time, polite and professional yet fun. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, rude service!”
Reviews.Author: Liza1881
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience in the casino, which made us NEVER want to stay or associate with Marriott. We had a small dispute about a few bucks while playing at one of the tables. As the dispute continued with the dealer, the manager came over and quickly and professionally resolved the issue. The dealer, Iris, was rude, barely spoke English and continued barking rude remarks at us. If it wasn't for her big loud mouth we would have continued playing, instead, one lousy employee ruined Marriott for us.

Reviews.Title: “the BEST place to stay in puerto rico,”
Reviews.Author: BARBIE D
Reviews.Content: After visiting the Island over 35 times in the last 20 years, I have stayed at every hotel, on this island from the el conqiustador to the el san juan hotel and everywhere in between... The marriott staff always has a smile, they are always pleasant and easy to work with. They made my stay incredible.. my four children feel at home here and run around like its there 2nd home away from home. The housekeepers arealways going over and beyond, making it that much more of a comfortable stay. the bar staff espacially liara and jeanette at the outside bar are wonderful, and make outstanding drinks, and even on the beach the waiters and waitress are so fast with bringing waters and food and drinks with in minutes.... now let me tell you how greatt this place is besides having live music in the lobby allowing you to be close to your family while hanging out and having a blast , the water slides at the pool , and great food.... i lost my phone the last day i was here which was yesterday,,,, at the beach and they found it James Lipsett head of security was a pleasure to work with as he confirmed it was mine and is sending it to me over night ..... hats off to the entire staff at the Marriott Stellaris ... ill see u soon oh and a special thanks to the satff in the executive llounge tooo...xoxoxoxoxoxooxoxoxoxoox

Reviews.Title: “One person really does make a difference”
Reviews.Author: PrivateJoy13
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel at about 11:30 a.m. after a 7 day cruise. Had the unfortunate luck of having Ileana be the person to check us in. We knew we were several hours early for the official 4:00 p.m. check in time, but while we were waiting another couple from our boat, who could not have gotten there more than 15 minutes before us, came back to the desk with their handheld buzzer because their room was ready so we were hopeful our turnaround time could be just as speedy. No such luck. After getting our handheld buzzer we languished in their outside restaurant until AFTER check in time, despite checking in with Ileana at 3:30 about our room. When asked about our room she made a grand show of "looking" on her computer and claimed she would call housekeeping but yet 40 minutes later at 4:10 we were STILL waiting outside to be buzzed for our room. While waiting for our room we tried to visit the casino but were rudely turned away b/c of our bags and told to check them before we could enter the Casinovdespite the fact that they were not luggage. I had a medium sized shoulder bag and my husband had a small backpack. Neither bag was large nor were they used to store clothes, they only held our personal items that we would rather not leave with the bellhop. The brash way in which we were turned away as if we were "riff raff" and not guests of the hotel made our decision not to spend any of our money in the casino quite easy. What were we going to do with our bags, stuff a slot machine in them? I have never received such poor treatment in any casino. As long as your bag is unobtrusive, which ours were, I don't see why any Casino should turn you away. When we finally got to the front of the check in line at 4:15 the manager was there so I voiced my displeasure to him. He apologized and gave us a $25 room credit but by then the day and our view of this hotel was ruined. It's a nice looking place with decent amenities but their lack of customer service, at least two people's lack of customer service skills, make me never want to stay here again. We stayed at the La Concha Renaissance before our cruise and even though they are both under the Marriott umbrella, the difference in service is like night and day. Next time we'll stay there where they not only accommodate people arriving early but go out of their way to make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff was HORRIBLE - Esp. the concierge! Stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: ashleyn1023
Reviews.Content: My mother and I go on an annual July 4th trip and this was a bigger one for the two of us as we ventured out of the states for a great trip to San Juan. The Marriott was located in a great area of San Juan, the beach was beautiful and the hotel was what you expect when you go to stay at a Marriott. It was clean and well taken care of. However, the hotel staff entirely was terrible, unprofessional and at the end of the day had the "I do not care" attitude that should NEVER be had at a hotel. The worst part was the Concierge who we spoke to regarding going out to an island on the west side of Puerto Rico, we were willing to drive or take the puddle jumper flight out there, we did not care and had done our research enough to know that this was where we wanted to take a day trip to. The concierge "highly" recommended that we not go as was incredibly touristy and had long lines. He instead recommended that we go to a beach on the east side of PR where the waters had 7 different colors and was just "spectacular" and much easier to get to. Unfortunately we arrived at a trash filled, overrun dump of a beach in an unsafe part of PR (which we later found out) after wasting a total of 4 hours in the car, 2 hours on the phone with a number of unhelpful, uncaring Marriott staff members we arrived back at the hotel. When we asked to speak with the manager, we were directed from person to person, yet again. At the end of the day, we wound up talking with a woman who said she was the manager, we had wasted an entire day and then found out on the next day, that she was actually just a front desk associate and not the manager after all. It is this lack of care, couth and decent customer service that makes me never want to go back to the Marriott again. And the kicker, we went on a rain forest tour with 20+ other people from our hotel and almost each of them had the same complaint about the hotel staff. It's surprising that with such a strong company, they would allow such poor employees to run their properties. Stay elsewhere ....

Reviews.Title: “"We enjoyed it and may go back"”
Reviews.Author: lovefun42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mariott San Juan & Stellaris Casino. The hotel was lovely as I expected and our room was very nice also. The service was kind and friendly and the location of the Hotel was great. The hotels amenities were a bit pricy. Sometimes it was difficult to get a reservation for a meal when you wanted, but food was good. The pool was beautiful and the pool decore was inviting. Our room was with a city view, one some may not have chosen, but we enjoyed the city view. It was like a picture of the city during the day and we enjoyed the lite up night life of bands across the street entertaining nearly every night. We would sit on the deck and enjoy the warmth of the air and the music til late at night. We looked forward to each night. As much as we liked our room, my husband did experience a bedbug bite. And over our time staying there, I got where I could not stand the wet/meldew smell in the room. I suppose it was all over. Over time it made me cough. A dehumidifier would have been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Help when needed”
Reviews.Author: Kglowery
Reviews.Content: The hotel is currently renovating the lobby which despite their best efforts makes getting around the lobby very awkward. A first for me at my last business meeting of the day I ripped the leg on my pants. I called the concierge and despite it being the evening they immeddiatetly sent a lady to my room who took the pants away and repaired them. She even gave me a little sewing kit in case I had any other problems. As far as I can tell the hotel never charged me for the repair. Can't fault the service they were great when I needed them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, won't be back though”
Reviews.Author: JuliaTravels404
Reviews.Content: I was shocked at the level of mismanagement at this hotel. I was traveling with a Platinum Rewards member, we have traveled to other Mariotts and never had to deal with this kind of sloppy management. When we checked-in we wanted to pay for the some of the room rate with cash and use a card for the rest plus incidentals. The guy swiped my friends card several times, saying that the first swipes didn't go through. Turns out he charge $1500 to my friend's card and AmEx put a hold on the account. It took forever to resolve with the hotel, they charged her card and didn't want to give her all of the cash back (the front desk guy didn't write a receipt or note on the account that we put cash on the room). When we first walked into the room and it smelled a little moldy, but we figured we just needed to turn on the air conditioning and everything would be fine. We were placed in a handicapped room, which wouldn't have been a problem had the plumbing been okay. Anytime one of us took a shower water would go everywhere; there was no incline in the shower to have the water run towards the drain. The next day we called the front desk about this and we were forwarded to about 4 different people until we finally landed with one of the "managers". Long story short it turns out the water was leaking onto the carpet, got some of our luggage wet (because there were no luggage racks) and "management" was extremely slow to do anything. We had to deal with several different people that called themselves managers but couldn't do anything. What really bothered us was that this was the level of service they gave to a Platinum rewards member, afraid of what would have happened had we not had any status. I will not return and would not recommend this hotel, unless you like being frustrated with staff. The only upside was that this hotel is right on the beach and it has several pools.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking Management Intervention”
Reviews.Author: Nicelio
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hotel the same night as tropical storm Irene. Overall, things were okay. The problems with the Hotel are related to the basic operations of it. You can sense that the philosophy of the corporation is not translated to the daily operations. All it takes is to walk around are see how departments are poorly run. The first day, the rooms were not made. The Hotel stated that the employees were not able to make it due to the storm. The Casino employees were there at 13:00. At the bar, we asked the waitress for sugar. She stated that her "station" didn't have any sugar. The waiter next to her took two step to the other side of the coffee maker, were a box full of sugar bags was located. One night, we and other customers waited literately 10 minutes for the elevators. We were told they were "rebooting" the system..what does it means? At the Tuscany Restaurant, another disaster (see review). The hallways in the room floors are not vacuum frequently. They are people walking around and talking, like "hiding" in different places. You get the sense that they should be doing something. It took for ever to clean the pool area from the storm. The damage was not horrible. It was the slowness to get it done. I been in Hawaii during rain and tropical storms. You can see the difference in attitude to get the overall operations back to normal. Marriott has accustomed us to a level of perfection and quality in their operations. I must say that the personnel at the parking services, were actually very nice and helpful. Do they work for the Hotel? The General Manager at this facility needs to be re-trained. The Hotel location is good and the beach is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico!!”
Reviews.Author: Anabell O
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel several time and i absolutely love it. The people are very nice, has its own private beach, pool is nice too. La Plaza San Francisco its a "must see" along with EL MORRO...

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Kristy_DC
Reviews.Content: My husband, our two 13 year olds and I stayed here in August 2011. I was scared off from the negative reviews I had read here, but we had a very positive experience from start to finish. Upon check-in, only one room was available. We were given two gift bags, each containing a can of Pepsi and 2 small bottles of rum, for our inconvenience, but we were early for check-in anyway, and were happy to get at least one room. The pool slide kept my kids entertained, the wait staff around the pool area were friendly and attentive, and the food and drink prices were reasonable for a resort. One afternoon we were struggling to blow up cheap rafts we had brought with us, and Rita from the Activities Desk came over with a foot pump to make the job easier. She even offered my daughter a free drink coupon for her efforts. Her manager then came around with ice cream sandwiches for us. One morning my son and I went out for a run and got caught in a downpour. Upon our return, one of the bellhops gave us towels to dry off. The next morning, we were given cold water bottles because it was obvious how hot and sweaty we were after a run. The rooms were clean, no sign of bedbugs, no smell of mildew or mold. The lobby was being renovated, but even that didn't detract from a wonderful visit. We would return to this property in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, nice location, poor service probably won't be back”
Reviews.Author: meekmeek627
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and could have scored higher if more of the staff was friendlier. We had a partial view room that overlooked the pool and the ocean. This was great because we had a larger balcony and room. Much of the staff is in desperate need of some good ol' customer service training. The staff tended to be short and abrupt. The first night of our stay the hotel had a live band. AMAZING. This was the best night of them all. We attempted to salsa dance with the locals. It was a blast. Too bad they started construction later that night and no more band.. sad face. The only nightly entertainment remaining was the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for post cruise”
Reviews.Author: Megan O
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Walking distance to food options which was very nice. The hotel had a great pool and on a very nice beach. Very clean lobby and rooms with helpful staff. Wish we would have stayed here piror to our cruise too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax and have Family Fun!!!!”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the nicest hotels we have stayed at. The kids loved it. With many different activities and things to do. We enjoyed this hotel, accessible to near by attractions. Service was great, the rooms were complimentary with a beach feel. This hotel is a must stay at hotel when coming to this area. The location of this hotel is in a safe area and a tourist location. This hotel was loved by the whole family. Definitely Recommend this hotel attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Typically Marriott with an island people's influence”
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a nice stay. I would probably not stay here again and would not recommend it to my friends who ask. When we brooked w were not told about lobby construction. This was though nicely hidden, a major issue with crowdwing around the front desk and what there was of a lobby waiting for cabs etc. Casino dealers are a hit and miss as far as entertainment goes. Often were treated like some uninvited guests would not go away. We had a group of twelve who luckily did not need entertaining as we had our own plans for our visit to PR. I will say the other areas of the hotel were delightful, front desk, beachside and pool staff, concierge, executive club room. Food service was a little slow in the reastaurante so if you are in a hurry to get anywhere, eat out. the italian restaurant s a treat though as far as food is concerned. I would visit but doubt I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the biggest rooms ever BUT...”
Reviews.Author: Alexa8776
Reviews.Content: Except for two other hotels, our room at the Marriott was the biggest - very nice. On the down side, it was facing the street and not the beach. They were very crowded with holiday parties and guests so we could not get a change to oceanview. Very nice overall service BUT, I think this is where my CD case with movies went "missing". I did not realize it until I got home. Who knows... That would not hinder my return at all - very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott!!”
Reviews.Author: oldham
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the Marriott and we really enjoyed the stay. The hotel is in a great location on "restaurant row." We had an ocean front room on the 9th floor (916). The room was on the corner, so it felt very secluded and quiet. The bed was so comfortable we slep really well. The room was spotless and housekeeping was there every morning with clean towels and fresh sheets. We had a few problems with the pay-per-view channels, but concierge was really helpful and they gave us the movie for free. Also, accessing the internet from our room was a little difficult, but once again the staff were very helpful and apologetic. The location is great....Starbucks is right across the street and a 24hr Walgreens is right next door. Also, a good diner called "Danny's" is on the left as you come out of the hotel....it serves a really good breakfast. The pool and beach area is wonderful.......the swim up bar is great. We will definitely go back to the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, customer service and very nice property - would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Michele G
Reviews.Content: We loved our 3 night stay at the Marriott (a complete contrast to the 3 night stay we just finished at the El Conquistador Hotel). We were immediately greeted by friendly bell hops as we pulled. The lobby was under construction and a good portion was curtained off, but it didn't detracted from quality of the property. Check-in was efficient, staff was friendly. They even offered all guests a welcome rum punch (non alcoholic for the kids!) and they also gave a bag with 2 small bottles of Bacardi and a Pepsi with instructions on how to make a drink. We had used Marriott points to get a corner room which was very large and perfect for our family of 5 - 2 double beds, foldout couch and patio. The room had a bathroom with 2 sinks, a shower and separate bath. Just outside of the bathroom was a vanity/dressing table with mirror. The pool area was very nice, pool was well-maintained. Plenty of towels available and staff is constantly cleaning up used towels to make chairs available. The swim up bar was fun for the kids and they could eat lunch there (which was moderately priced). The beach is easily accessible and there are chairs available (umbrellas were supposed to be included, but because we used Marriott points we didn't have to pay the 14% resort fee so we were allowed to get the chairs for free, but not an umbrella. The umbrella would cost us $12.50 per day. It seemed odd that the hotel would distinguish between chairs, umbrellas and people that used points, but they did). If you want internet access in your room, that is an extra charge of $19.95 per day. If you are a Marriott Rewards Gold member you are supposed to get it for free. Overall this hotel exceeded expectations. The location in Condado Beach area was great for walking to a number of good restaurants. There is a Starbucks and Hagen Daaz across the street. The Walgreens is at the end of the block (2 minute walk); it has a food market, so it is perfect for getting some things for the kids to snack on. It is a $15 taxi ride to Old San Juan and about the same to the airport. All of us thoroughly enjoyed this Marriott and will plan to stay there on another visit to PR.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Condado”
Reviews.Author: elcoqui13
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel since it's grand opening in 1995 and have yet to be disappointed. The San Juan Marriott has an exceptional staff and an unbeatable location. The best shops and restaurants are all within walking distance and you are only a 5 minute taxi ride away from Old San Juan. The Condado strip is full of hotels, but this one always delivers with live bands on Friday and Saturday nights and comfortable rooms. I highly recommend staying in the Condado section of San Juan since there is always something you can do at any time of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Check-in and Poor Handling of Final Bill”
Reviews.Author: lil_damie
Reviews.Content: I was less than impresssed with the check-in experience. The front-desk associate seemed like she would have rather been doing anything than checking me in. As a Marriott Platinum member, I generally experience a warm welcome during my check-in experience. As part of my original booking, I purchased the daily continental breakfast for 2, and was supposed to receive a coupon book upon check-in; however, I received no coupon book, and I ultimately was charged for the continental breakfast for 2 people on each day of my stay. During my stay, I was told that the continental breakfast would display as part of my bill, but that the Final bill would credit these charges back to me. When I returned home, I asked that a final bill be sent to me with all adjusted credits and charges displayed. I received my final bill with an additional charge, but no credit given for the nearly $50/day continental breakfast. I asked that this be credited back to my account and that someone contact me explaining the reason for the discrepancy, as I had noted this same issues on other travellers' posts. I received a credit for the continental breakfast each day, bu have yet to receive any follow-up from Hotel management, Overall, I enjoyed my stay. I especially enjoyed the wait/bar staff; however, the front desk staff members that I encountered were less than helpful. I had a much better experience at the Courtard Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable until our room was robbed”
Reviews.Author: librarygin
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review to write because we did truly enjoy ourselves for the first 4days of our stay but due to our room being robbed on the last day and managementâ€™s lack of concern and follow up, it is impossible to feel good about our experience at this hotel and Marriott as a whole. On August 4, we went down to the pool for a drink, leaving our iphones and an ipod behind since we figured that they would be safer there than unattended on a lounge chair. I do realize that the safe would have been the best option, but how many of us really think that our room will be robbed when we step out to the pool for 45 minutes? Upon return, I was unable to get into the room and a security officer sent to assist me was unable to open the door, even after replacing the batteries in the lock. The lock mechanism had to be removed from the door in order to open it. I realized that our phones were gone shortly after going in. We called more security & the police, filed reports, etc. and spoke with the front desk manager before our departure the next day. We heard the â€œrightâ€� things about how they would be sure to make sure that the claim was handled quickly, they understood how we felt, and that someone would get back to us quickly etc. After leaving messages for the director of security and the front desk manager, we have yet to receive a return call or any further contact, nor did we receive any sort of gesture as an apology, not even a comped drink. I understand that thefts can and do happen anywhere but the lack of concern on their part has completely soured me on staying at any Marriott at this point. I donâ€™t think this review will deter anyone from staying at this hotel, but will hopefully serve as a reminder to use the safe no matter how short a time you are out of the room, no matter where you are staying. Iâ€™m just relieved that we did put our wallets in the safe!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for pre-cruise night”
Reviews.Author: ArubaHeathie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect location for a pre-cruise stay! PROS -Convenience. It was on the way from the airport to the cruise terminal. -Priceline $$$. Can't beat the deals off priceline. We scored 3 rooms for about 50% off. -Ocean. We all agreed that it was the nicest ocean swim we have ever had. The weather for the day was perfect, and the water was so warm, calm with relaxing waves, and crystal clear. Note, we did hear that it is usually not that calm, but my goodness it was spectacular! -Rooms. The rooms were clean, spacious and really beautiful. The furnishings were tasteful, and again most importantly they were clean. The bathrooms were great, too. -Layout. Easy to figure out where you are going, and close to everything while still having space. -Great strip of restaurants and bars right outside the hotel. The police presence was pretty clear outside the resort, so not sure if there is usually some trouble out there, but I thought the location was a ideal for restaurants, bars, and a Walgreens. CONS -As all resorts, the prices of food and drinks are quite expensive. The drinks themselves were quite yummy, but at about $15/drink it really adds up. -Pool. The pool was beautiful, but it was mobbed with so many people, and the water was too warm... just sayin'. -Front desk. There was always a decent size line at the front desk. Check in took quite a while... we are talking 20min or so. I never understand what on earth they could be punching so much into the computer... sigh... I digress. Anyway, the front desk could def use some more help.

Reviews.Title: “Our passports expired, so we went to San Juan Instead!”
Reviews.Author: Bigger32
Reviews.Content: We have been to San Juan several times over the years. I was dissappointed to see how the city was being affected by the economy. There were many closed down shops, and it looked as though there were many many people out of work. That actually put a damper on the trip. The hotel was nice. We made a budget trip to San Juan--cheap flight, cheap room--and you get what you pay for!!! We got a very good rate on our room, which was probably on the 3rd floor. I believe there were conference rooms on the same level as our room. But, we were directly over the main entrance of the hotel, with absolutely no view whatever--except a/c units, etc. They had bands and dances in the lobby of the hotel, along with the casino. Our room was located in such a way that it seems we were right in the mix of the bands and the partiers one or two levels below. On the other hand, the room was clean and well appointed--as you would expect. There were Purelle dispensers everywhere! The pool area was very nice--we really enjoyed sitting around the pool everyday. The cocktails were easy to come by with bars strategically located throughout. We also spent time on the beach which was very nice, as well. There were plenty of towels and beach services. The restaurant was good. We had the buffet several days, which was very pleasing--not over the top. We walked to several restuarants / cafes around the hotel for other meals. We never did the Barcardi tour on any other trips, but, we did this time...it was ok. We caught public transportation down to the Condado--it was very easy and cheap. We did not spend a lot on this trip, and were pleased with what we got for our money.

Reviews.Title: “pretty great time but a few thoughts”
Reviews.Author: simkomd
Reviews.Content: Just got back from PR with my two daughters, ages 18 & 19. Overall we had a really great time. The hotel was what I call a generic Marriott, nothing special but nice. Check in was easy and the staff was pleasant. Had booked a double room but only had a king available at check in. Offered to move us to a double room the next day, but no interest in moving all our stuff so just dealt with the 3 of us in a king size bed. Two free breakfast buffets included in our rate and the food was good but overpriced at $23 pp. We had trouble being charged for the "free" breakfast but was adjusted off at checkout. Be sure and check your bill! Just as previously reviewed the hotel food and drinks were decent but overpriced ($10 a drink). Poor service at the bars at times. Two evenings we were at the pool, the swim up bar was closed and even on Sunday night by 8pm the main pool bar was closed. No fun at all having to go through the hotel in swimwear to get drinks. The restaurants around the hotel were just ok. Most had so-so service but decent food. We did find an excellent pizza place, Danny's, very close and in easy walking distance, although not very puerto rican I know. The lobby was being boarded up the day before checkout for major renovations and I was told this would go on into Nov 2011 so just beware. The casino was fun but very small and very crowded. We were told of one incident during our stay. Apparantly a stabbing one night on the beach but not sure of the details. There was a police presence along the beach and on the streets at all times and I never felt uncomfortable or threatened in any way, even with my two daughters walking around in the evening. Overall we had a good time. Weather was perfect and aside from the expensive food and drinks it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Family”
Reviews.Author: Hey_ney
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay with your family. It has many great features like a super fun slide at the pool. Also it is located close to lots of family spots like ice cream parlor, and family restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott San Juan Stellaris Resort - We loved it”
Reviews.Author: lone6star
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the hotel. Prior comments mentioned that construction would be present in the lobby, but we saw nothing. Honestly, the lobby is very nice, so unsure why they would update/change it. Pools were good, plenty of free towels. They have charter tours to the various tourist sites. They are expensive. It's cheaper to take a cab or we used the local bus (75 cents each way). One time I rented a car to go to the El Yunque rain Forest. Hotel casino is active during the day and night. If going to the hotel, do not reserve a low floor, as during the night, the hotel is open to all and it turns into a very loud disco like club. Hotel restaurant is also expensive. Good restaurants across the street. The back of the hotel faces the beach. Water has a significant rip tide, so don't go too far out.. Lounge Chairs are free, and umbrellas are also if you paid for the resort fee---we did not as it's 11 percent of your total hotel bill. Instead we were charged $12 to rent the umbrella for the day---still cheaper than paying the resort fee. Also an umbrella is definitely needed on the beach, if the sun is out. Concierge lounge was great, staff very amicable. Food was great and free! Business center was free and internet speed was quite fast.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to our next visit”
Reviews.Author: AngelicaReyes
Reviews.Content: Our trip was great. We had planned the entire year.This is our forth time at the same hotel. We really enjoyed it. The service is superb. We are very familiar with the area. We even have the restaurant of our preference at Condado " Orosco's.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: NanceyH
Reviews.Content: The resort was nothing to brag about, but the location was great and breakfast was decent and one of the things my husband and I looked forward to. The beach was also good. However, the room we stayed in was small and though they describe it as City View, our room sat directly in front of a condominium. We couldn't see the city if we tried! Also, the room had bed bugs. I woke up with tons and tons of bites. Initially I thought they were mosquito bites, but the bites were in clusters and I was wearing mosquito repellant each day. Additionally, we brought them home and now have to have our home fumigated. And for the record, we never had bed bugs. I didnt have any bites until this trip. This trip has ended up costing us more in the long run due to the fact that we now have to pay for fumigation. The staff was okay and when we asked to change rooms they were not able to accomodate us, because the rooms were booked. I don't know if the entire hotel is infested, but the room we stayed in definitely is. A positive is that the cleaning personnel came around like clock work, but managment needs to seriously have the hotel fumigated.

Reviews.Title: “La Vista: Not Your Typical Lunch Buffet.”
Reviews.Author: Papachote
Reviews.Content: "La Vista" (The View) is a popular restaurant on the lobby level of the San Juan Marriott. The intended View behind the name is obviously the ocean, a deep blue band just a few yards outside the glass wall that runs the entire length of the restaurant. But the View that caught my gaze was the splendid lunch buffet, a seemingly endless array of serving bowls and plates gleaming against a modern, sophisticated decor of bright tiles whose colors alone are sufficient to stimulate the appetite. Disclosure: I was part of a group of bloggers invited by the San Juan Marriott to a complimentary lunch. Even though it was via invitation by the La Vista Grill and the San Juan Marriott, we do not feel that this influenced the writing of this post in any way. As we got settled at our large table in a separate room (available for group activities), we were offered refreshments. I opted for a mojito but our waitress tempted me with other variations of the mojito such as mango, passionfruit and raspberry. Daring to live on the wild side, I chose the passionfruit mojito, and I loved it! The tart passionfruit complemented the mint very well. The salad section consisted of countless bowls of different salads; I didn't count them but there must have been at least a dozen. I served myself a little of almost everything, knowing well that many small servings can still add up to a lot of food. A dish that Looked somewhat like a German potato salad turned outâ€”to my delightâ€”to be yuca en escabeche with crumbled bacon. There were other salads with a delicious light curry sauce, but I wasn't able to find out what it was. I sampled a couscous salad, and a yummy quinoa salad with tangy feta. There were two green mixed salads with various dressings and eight or more toppings. And chewy whole-grain dinner rolls topped with sunflower seeds; I would have been capable of making a meal out of these alone! I enjoyed a plaintain soup that had several layers of complex flavor that usually aren't in a sopa de plÃ¡tano; I thought I could identify beef stock and Worchestershire sauce. The main courses included a flavorful eggplant lasagna, chicken breasts with caper sauce, swordfish en escabeche, and pork loin with chimichurri sauce. The meats and the fish were a little dry but flavorful. Pacing myself was imperative. The lively conversation was a welcome respite from overfilling. The topics were social media, technology and the social dynamics of cyberspace, they were as good a match as a dry wine to complement the high-protein main dishes. Dessert beckoned. "Try meeeeee!" pleaded each one of the fifteen to twenty desserts laid out in two tiers. While many call, few are chosen, by necessity. I reluctantly passed up several cakes, cookies and tarts, rice pudding, tembleque, casquitos de guayaba, dulce de papaya. Opting for a thin slice of berry pie, half a slice of chocolate cheesecake and a tiny tartlet, I made my way back to the table. The berry pie was rich and fruity, and the crust was thoughtfully thin. "Un cortadito," a cup of delicious, freshly-brewed top-quality Puerto Rican coffee with just a little hot milk, gave the perfect final touch. The bottom line: La Vista has one of the more complete lunch buffets that you will find in San Juan. A sure bet.

Reviews.Title: “great for family, room rservations a unsate”
Reviews.Author: Platt93405
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before sevaral times. I use to live in P.R. Classic resort type hotel with the best body surfing in S.J. ( we had three teenager's in tow) 1) Flat rate from hotel on taxi (about $15.00), first time we didn't rent a car (cost is too high+ overnight parking fee's excesive). 2) Flat rate cab to old san juan (about $15.00) 3) two tennis courts with basketball hoops 4) laundry facility (3 washer's/3 dryers) $3.00 per wash, $3.00 per dry, bring qtr's/soap 5) Multiple resturants withing 2 blocks either direction/walgeens 6) had fridge in room, all rooms have a balcony + LED room safe (perfect) 7) safe area, the "slums" > 5 miles from hotel that other thread mentioned, no problem 8) Room was nice, clean, and quiet. You set the thermostat temp 9) The "red flag" on the beach for the surf is almost always red (a liability issue) 10) expect multiple weddings/parties on weekends ( that's typical) 11) we never ate in the hotel (except breakfast cereal/milk/fruit we had purchased 12) The reservation/check in system- very "third world." What is this? we booked a biz/superior room, corner. (I think $269.00 on the marriott res web site + I called to confirm). Upon checking in it was whatever was left. They stuck us in the 5 story annex to the west. Wrong! So is this just a first come first serve method? Very poor management and leadership marriott. This isn't "let's make a deal." When you book a room you do not book a "room." You book your name on a list. It doesn't matter if you request ocean side, street, or corner. We booked a corner room- and paid for it. I discussed this with the manager and he did concur. we were moved the next day. Also, Please don't tell me your full when it appeared 30% of the rooms were vacant. So, loose the "lottery" mind set and comply with your web site/booking process. My rate was dropped down to the $189.00 rate (thank you for that). In the future, I suggest your customer's book the the $189.00 rate thence "wheel and deal" upon arrival. conclusion- Nice hotel and i enjoyed the stay. I will stay there again. I was very impressed with the grounds keeper's/cleaner's. It's tough keeping up with "stuff" in the tropical environment- nice job. thanks

Reviews.Title: “This resort is just OK”
Reviews.Author: Dolphin1023
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for six nights based on the great reviews on tripadvisor, but were disappointed from the moment we checked in. We arrived at noon and were told our room wasn't ready. They told us that we could change into our swimsuits and have the hotel hold our luggage while we waited, but we thought that was ridiculous. We ended up waiting for an hour and a half before our room was finally ready. I informed the reception desk that we waited for over an hour for our room and her response was just, "Check-in is at 4". We met other hotel guests who told us they waited for 5 hours before there room was ready! Not good busniess. Our room was nice, although very small. We were disappointed by the Condado beach, which is the beach this hotel is on. The water was very rough and there were people walking their dogs there, which is not hygienic. We ended up taking a cab to Isla Verde Beach, which had better water. The live band in the evenings was nice. The pool area was just ok; at 3ft with a water slide, it attracted many children, which was fine but there weren't enough lounge chairs; it was just a small pool area, which was made into an "adult" pool because of the swim-up bar. I wouldn't recommend this hotel. It's in a good location, but a major part of the hotel experience is checking in upon arrival, and having great beach and pool areas, which this property doesn't have.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
Reviews.Title: “Loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: lizzievia
Reviews.Content: First time to Puerto Rico and had a wonderful, relaxing time. It was a surpise birthday trip for my mother and we both had a blast. First of all the hotel is absolutely beautiful, besides the location being AWESOME everyone was so helpful and kind . Just a few blocks from Old San Juan and just walking distance to several delicious restauarants. The hotel is surrounded by hotels and there is even a Starbucks across the street where there is free internet access. So don't purchase it from the hotel!!! You can walk around late at night to the many restaurants and feel safe. The staff is wonderful and are always there to answer any questions. If you want to try some local food like monfongo go to "Latin Star" . Food is delicious and besides the staff being great the cost of the food is reasonably priced. I totally do not recommend Ropa Vieja. :( Everyone kept raving about this restaurant and after walking six blocks, it was totally not worth it. Service was awful!!!!! :P The staff just hanged around and the food wasn't worth it. Can you even believe that the server even tried to slip 2 plates of food on our plate and when asked about it; he said that he didn't think we would notice. AWFULLLLLL!!! So if you go and stay at the Marriott enjoy and make sure you look at the activity board for the day that is located at the pool. They have some great activities for kids as well for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, nice rooms, okay property”
Reviews.Author: snshn3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before boarding on a cruise. The first impression of the hotel is the lobby which seems rather dark and small. Not as tropical and airy as you would expect from a hotel in an island. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable but the walls very thin, you can hear everything from the other rooms. Did not get to enjoy much of the property but did stroll around it a bit. The pool was not very big but adequate enough during low season. The beach was really rough but it was nice. The main convenience of this hotel is the location as it is central to all of the restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Second time was better than the first time”
Reviews.Author: Colleen4646
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again before our cruise and had a much better experience this year than last. The pool was relaxing, people were friendlier and the poolside bar was finished with music from a DJ so you could eat lunch and dance ! Our kids enjoyed the waterside and just swimming in the pool. We tried to have beach time but the weather didn't cooperate . We had a mini suite in the older tower and liked it better than our corner room we had last year. Just a little big bigger and were able to close the door to our room and not be disturbed by the Disney Channel on the other TV. If were to go back to Puerto Rico , we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Overall Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: prgirl73
Reviews.Content: I don't have anything amazingly great or super bad to say about this hotel. Check-in was super easy, and the staff in general is very pleasant and helpful. The restaurant staff at La Vista was very slow, but that seems to be the norm with restaurant service on the island. The rooms were clean, but the carpets weren't vacuumed everyday. The shower heads were great, as were the Bath & Body Works toiletries. It was also nice having a coffeemaker and small refrigerator in the room, as was having a chair that converted to a small sofabed. I do not gamble, but the casino seemed on the small side. Food and parking were pricey, but I expected that. Parking was $16 per night. I paid a resort fee through Travelocity when I booked my room, so I didn't have to pay the $18.95 for internet access or to utilize the beach umbrellas. So when it comes to those things, be aware. We stayed from weekend to weekend, and unfortunately, the hotel gets super crowded on the weekends. The crowds were pretty obnoxious and "rushed", so it was nice having the resort, pool, and beach to ourselves during the week. Things were much, much calmed and relaxed then. We loved the beach and pool area. The beach was clean and gorgeous, and my children loved the water slide at the pool. The hotel is also super convenient, in it took us literally 10 minutes by car to get to Old San Juan, and there were a ton of places to eat and shop in the neighborhood. It was also safe, as there was always a friendly police officer patrolling the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience and won't be back”
Reviews.Author: islandbreezey
Reviews.Content: We were waking up with bites and when we brought it up with the front desk and manager they just denied any bug problem existed and just offered to change the sheets. We wanted a room change but since they were fully booked, they asked us if we would like free breakfast instead!?#@ Seriously? breakfast? They didnt even have any bug sprays or anything that they could give us for the problem. They didn't even offer to have us switch rooms the next day...so we kept bringing up the issue with them and then they said they would bring specialist to come in to inspect the bed but when i asked for the report no one knew of anything so we just gave up! Honestly, it was a frustrating experience. To add to that the room was really damp (the bedding, chair, and carpet were damp) and the AC in our room was not working properly. I think we just had bad luck and got a horrible room. Im sure others have a better experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: cathead123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott San Juan Stellaris Casino this past July (2011) for our anniversary, and we had an absolutely wonderful time. The hotel staff was accommodating from the moment we walked in the door - when we were handed a complimentary drink from the bar! We had an ocean view room and were upgraded to a higher floor upon request. The room was safe and the cleaning staff took great care of the room. For a couple that normally travels "off the beaten path", we were hesitant to stay at a resort hotel. However, we couldn't have asked for a better time. Very clean, wonderful friendly staff, and a nice casino for some late night fun. Also, the live music in the lobby with the dance floor was also a great addition to the hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - will not return”
Reviews.Author: dreaming*of*a*beach
Reviews.Content: As soon as you enter this property, the smell of moldy carpet and cigarette smoke hit you. Not a welcoming aroma! The location is on the beach and near some decent restaurants. This is an average property at best. The only redeeming quality is that I got frequent stay points for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK for post cruise but very expensive wifi”
Reviews.Author: snorkel4u2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights after a cruise so that we could drive to see some sights around Puerto Rico (the rain forest, Old San Juan forts, Aricebo, etc.). It is really surprising to me that Marriott does not offer free wifi in this day & age! In fact, they said if we wanted to pay for wifi, we would have to pay a daily charge for EACH device (laptop, smartphone, etc.) and as a family, this made no sense. It has been YEARS since we have been charged a fee for wifi in a hotel, and we have stayed in many for work and pleasure. I had to check my email for work, so I crossed the street every evening to Starbucks for a drink of coffee and FREE wifi. Starbucks is the solution for Marriottâ€™s crazy internet charges. It is right across the street from the hotel entrance. Self parking is $13/ day in their garage. We got the room via Priceline for $110/night, but Priceline does not guarantee 2 beds. We have 2 kids, and there was no problem when we said we needed a room with 2 beds. They did ask if we wanted to pay an upcharge for ocean view and we declined. The first room they sent us to was occupied, but our key opened the door. Thankfully, no one was in the room at the time! We trudged back to the front desk, hubby talked to the manager, and he gave us a new ocean view room at no additional charge for our trouble. The room was clean, and the beds were comfortable. We also had a small fridge which was nice to keep drinks cold. One big safety issue is that our patio had a steep step down and there is NO light on the balcony. Our boy went out one night to look at the pool (lovely, by the way) and fell down the steep step onto the concrete below. We looked all over for a light and then realized there is NO light out there on the balcony, which is crazy considering the step down and the fact that people will obviously use it at night! If you go out on the balcony at night, please open your curtains to get some light from the room and save yourself from breaking a hip. The pools were really pretty and the towel hut was open until late in the evening. We enjoyed taking a swim in the evenings after a day of touring and sitting in the very hot hottub. The property is pretty and we felt safe. They have constant security at the pool, and close the gate to the beach at night. We also felt very safe walking at night in the general area of the hotel. The hotel was focused primarily on business travelers rather than tourists, and the neighborhood felt more like a local neighborhood than a tourist area. There is a Walgreens in walking distance that has most of what you might need. We enjoyed our stay in Puerto Rico, but I would choose a different hotel if I returned with family. I would certainly not pay retail price for this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach location, short taxi ride to Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Blockrockinbeats
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typical of Marriott. Clean rooms, well stocked with good facilities. The check in process was a little slow, and the elevator areas do become crowded at busy times. There is an outside staircase leading down to the pool area which was closed for cleaning/polishing more often than it was open, causing huge problems with everyone have to get the elevator to the ground floor. Not a brilliant process! The breakfasts were excellent, and the service was actually very good. The concierge really are good, they couldn't do enough for me. I would recommend this place, as its facilities are great and it's in a decent location. The sea On this side of the island is rough though, and we had to get a cab to the other side for watersport activities. Generally though a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort on the beach for the price!”
Reviews.Author: ElitePhotoPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night pre cruise. Our room was nice and clean with a great view. proerty is real nice. great pools and its right on the beach. There are night clubs, food, bars and a grocery store all within a couple of mins walk of the resort. Pros...on the beach. good food at the resort. Good food within walking distance of the resort. nice pools. clean rooms. great service. good value. cons...beach access closes at sunset. when we were there the hot tub wasnt working and the pools were freezing COLD. Food was costly at the resort. casino is real small. It was about a 10-15 min cab ride to the Carnival cruise terminal. lots of places to walk to outside of the resort Overall experience...we were happy with the deal we got on the hotel and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: chips2481
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved it!! the hotel is right on the beach. they set up the umbrellas and chairs and give out towels.. the room included breakfast buffet. excellent spread and they make hot pancakes, waffles, omlettes, etc... very lively street and a really fun lobby bar with live music.. room was exactly how it looks in the pictures! very spacious. can't go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: WNCButterfly
Reviews.Content: The employees were all friendly upon arrival (Emmanuel at the front desk) and during our 7 day, 6 night stay. The hotel is very beautiful. The pictures on this website are spot on. The restaraunt (La Vista) was very expensive and there wasn't a lot of kid friendly items to choose. It cost $50 for myself and two kids to eat breakfast one morning! Our room was very clean and we had hot water at all times. Housekeeping stopped by everyday to check on our room and make sure we didn't need anything and/or to exchange our towels and replenish the free water bottles. The gentleman at the tour desk was very helpful although the older woman was not (the only downside). The beach is right behind the hotel. i had to pay to use an umbrella but the chairs were free. The pool is small and great for kids as well. The police presence is very apparent in the area, felt safe at all times. Overall, the hotel is very nice and I'm glad I chose to stay here for my first visit to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Location, beach and great pool Bar”
Reviews.Author: marylandtraveler1B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of everything great restaurants wihhin walking distance. Short bus or taxi ride to old San Juan. Most important best Tropical drinks ever at pool bar

Reviews.Title: “NOT FOR FAMILIES”
Reviews.Author: momlexijack
Reviews.Content: Nice place -clean-more of a local place -Would not bring my children there again. If you are older it would be fine-casino was nice-I would recommend the Hilton Caribe-better nice beach HIlton is always out to please -if something is wrong they will fix it!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK. Will stay at the Marriott Isla Verde next time.”
Reviews.Author: BuenViajeMyFriends
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but the service was average. Arrived at 3:30, waited in line to check in to find out that the room was not ready. Was told it was going to be ready at 4. Got the call at 4:35 but the line was very long so it was 5:10 when I got the keys. The room that I got was not what I was promised, no view of the pool/beach. My family was OK with it so we didn't complain. The room was clean and nice, the bathroom was big. The beach was fine, got an umbrella and chairs. Only one person working on Saturday morning so we had to wait to get them. Later went to the pool and it was very crowded. Didn't stay long. Too many people. Took my daughter to the "s'mores and movie" one evening and that was disappointing. Tried one restaurant, good. Overall, nice facilities but service was less than average. Last year we stayed at the Marriott Courtyard Isla Verde. It's a smaller hotel and not as nice and big but we got great service and it has a beautiful beach. If we go back to PR, we will go to Marriott Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific vacation in Condado section of San Juan”
Reviews.Author: casavartist
Reviews.Content: We love Puerto Rico and got to stay in the Condado neighborhood that is both for tourists and local,s at the Marriott resort. It was so easy to walk from the beach to local eateries, including the Starbucks directly across the street. Evening were even more fun going to local resturants frequented by the doctors and others who live and work in the hospital a few blocks away. The hotel is large, but the services were fine and friendly. The beach area was safe and clean, and chairs and umbrellas are placed for you to follow the sun or shade throughout the day. This hotel is located a $15 cab ride from the airport. We stayed 6 days in the middle of the winter and vowed to return next January to get away from cold NJ days.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, beautiful views, awesome pool area and beach”
Reviews.Author: Sassymomma69
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel everything was great. Some restaurants on site and near by, bars, casino. Great pool area and beach. Would stay here again for sure. Only stayed a few days before our cruise. Wish our visit was longer. Enjoyed San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: TDouble
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all expecations. The beach was incredible. The rooms were very nice. Even the city view vs. the pool or beach view, didn't fall short. The only shortcoming I experienced was the ability to access the elevators in a timely manner. They were often slow and/or overcrowded. Overall, I would give a very high recommendation for those seeking a nice hotel with a great location that happens to be budget friendly. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “A ridiculously Bad Experience So Far For Marriott Rewards Member”
Reviews.Author: Lucky1inVA
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Rewards member and booked my trip for 2 rooms through CheapCaribbean.com. When booking we requested an early check-in as our plane was arriving at lunch. After arrival and a short taxi ride, we approached the front desk and they said no rooms were available and gave us a beeper to alert us to when they would have them ready for us. About 3 hours later after watching them issue keys to other guests that arrived after us, we approached the desk about why our rooms weren't ready. They said they were trying to get 2 ready at the same time. We told them we would take the first room when available so that we would not waste the afternoon and could make plans. After an hour went by, we went to complain and they said, oh, the room has been ready for about an hour. We will beep you when the other room is available and give you a $50 room credit for wasting your afternoon but won't upgrade you to a room that is available now becaue you are not a platinum or gold member. 2 hours later I went back to complain and they said, Oh, your room has been ready for about an hour. They gave me a key and took their pager which never did alert me. I stayed at Marriott because of the Rewards but given the extermely poor treatment I am beginning to wish I stayed somewhere else since we wasted the entire afternoon and were not able to make the dinner plans we originally intended. We will see how the rest of the trip goes

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic with 4 caveats, but will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: bethesda41003
Reviews.Content: Clean quiet rooms, especially the ocean view rooms. Limited hours from 11-3 for use of water slide, slow pool side service (up to 45 minutes). Fantastic beach! Watch out for charges on the breakfast if your room includes a breakfast deal. Otherwise will stay at this hotel again, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: denisi11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a pretty relaxed area, there are restaurants on the same street as the hotel. The bus stop is a short walk away from the entrance, very convenient for sightseeing. The biggest draw is the beach, and it is lovely! We had an oceanfront room and it was just blissful to wake up to the sounds of the ocean every morning. The pool facilities as well as the hotel in general were great. The hotel lobby featured a casino as well as a bar which was pretty crowded in the evenings. The people at the concierge and front desk were very helpful. If you want to be in the middle of the party, this may not be the hotel for you; but if you are looking for a relaxing stay that is a short drive from Old San Juan or Isla Verde, I say do it!

Reviews.Title: “My New favorite location”
Reviews.Author: deeleeny
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was terrific and quite helpful throughout my stay. The pool was amazing and well kept. There was no one hounding you go buy things;everyone was quite professional. We at breakfast at LaVista daily and enjoyed every bit of it. The hotel is in a great safe location with A great beach to boot. Take a taxi to Bacardi Factory for $30 roundtrip, the tour is free and so are the drinks. Take the bus to Old San Juan for .75 cents to get to the forts(wear light clothes and flats) Last but not least Ignore the negative comments; this hotel is great across the board.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AandM2005
Reviews.Content: Our ocean front KING room was perfect for my husband and myself. The pool was very nice with plenty of chairs available even when we arrived after 10. The beach was great too...we had chairs included with our package (although we weren't aware of it). Service was a little slow at check in, the bar, and at breakfast. Although this seemed to be the same everywhere on the island. The lobby bar was very lively in the evenings with music and lots of people. There was a mix of nice hotels and vacant buildings in the area, but most of the vacant buildings had ads on them to improve the appearance of them. There were many places to eat nearby with a variety of cuisine and price. It was a short drive/ride to Old San Juan. We would recommend this hotel to a friend and would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “By far this is the best Marriott I have stayed at on the planet!”
Reviews.Author: kcookejr
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and so I usually stay at places that give me good rates. I usually end up in the corner room facing a dumpster but not this time. We (thanks to following this hotel on Facebook/Twitter) got a wonderful upgrade to an oceanfront balcony room. The room was large, clean and very comfy. I couldn't have been more pleased. The service at this property is above and beyond all other properties I have been to recently. The staff is very polite and quick to act if you need anything. We were even given a bottle of wine with cheese and crackers in our room for Liking them on Facebook. It was a really nice treat. Also, upon check in we were offered some yummy Rum Punch. :D This entire resort was well maintained and very clean as well. The casino was nice and I liked the $5 tables but sometimes they were full and it was hard to get a seat. Lots of slots to choose from too. The location was great, the shops and restaurants in the area are great. I found them a bit pricey but I guess that is to be expected in resort areas. Like most resort areas there were a few "seedy characters" around but you just need to aware of your surroundings. I cannot express enough how much my husband and I loved this resort. To me, there is none better. You can't go wrong. :D

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: ezduzit3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott San Juan Resort for 7 days. I could have stayed another 7 days, it was just a great place for a great vacation. From the moment I arrived from the moment I left EVERYONE at the resort was just very professional and courteous and extremely helpful. The location of the resort was a big plus very chic restaurants as well as very affordable ones. Needless to say the beach was great and the staff on the beach was great. I would highly recommend this resort for anyone who is looking for a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel. I highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: herewegoonvacation
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The pool is a tropical paradise. The rooms are spacious and modern. My recommendation is that you request a room on a high floor because the regular live music in the lounge can be a very festive and loud atmosphere. The only issue we encountered was an exceptionally long wait for a room. We arrived at the resort at 11a.m. after disembarking from a cruise ship on a Sunday. Upon reception we were given a pager and told that a room would be available shortly. We were not given a room for FIVE hours. This was ridiculous!! Once we were in the room, it was smoothe sailing from there. Fitness center was great as were all of the other hotel amenities. Overall, I would vehemently recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “it was like south beach miami only better”
Reviews.Author: pauliewallnuts39
Reviews.Content: we stayed frm july 8 to july 12th..we checked the 10 day forecast and it said rain every day it only rained once for about 15mins..things to like about puerto rico they speak english,no passport,american money its a great choice.the marriott was fine like the other reviews ashford ave is a nice strip with everything you need..we had a ocean front rm the A.C. was nice and cold the view was postcard perfect.the waves were a little rough but hey its the ocean if you dont like it go to some lake in N.H. the room was clean no hair no soap scum.no bad odors.we are from boston so to us the service was a little slow..no big deal.they are much more laid back than what we are used to.when i was there i checked out the hilton just to see if i made the correct choice..after seeing both hotels it was a no brainer marriott was the right pick hands down..

Reviews.Title: “Did a Destination wedding and loved staying here!”
Reviews.Author: felicity1402
Reviews.Content: We just got married at the Marriott at the end of June and loved our stay there! We got the wedding ceremony and reception package and pretty much everything was taken care of for us! We worked with Eunice Vargas who was great! She kept in contact with us throughout the whole process of getting out wedding planned and was there throughout our wedding day getting things worked on for us. The hotel was wonderful as well. They were very helpful and accomodating. We really enjoyed staying here. Our room overlooked the pool on one side and the ocean on the other and it was great to sit out on the balcony at night or in the morning. Great views!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!! And if I fet the same deal will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: fatulita10
Reviews.Content: After 2 months of looking, searching and reading reviews we decided to stay at the Marriot Stelleris, it was my first time in San juan and it was my birthday weekend so I wanted a nice hotel closed to everything and thats what I got. Check in was nice and smooth, room was ready got our welcome room puch at the lobby. Room was nice and clean got partial ocean view wasnt expecting it, only complaint about the room was the AC vent. We got the sand dollar deal 4th night free and breakfast included. Breakfast buffet was nice a lot of to choose from. The pool was a joke don't understand how such a big hotel have such a small pool and is only like 3ft deep. The beach was okay our whole stay ocean was rough great for surfing. The location was great, $18 taxi ride fom airport, $15 to old san juan walgreens acrooss street bunch of restaurants to the left and right. Staff super friendly and helpfull!! Will definaly return!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kimtn2009
Reviews.Content: The concierge was wonderful. I had an ocean front/pool view room. I was able to relax and really enjoyed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great but the Casino service was terrible”
Reviews.Author: jcain04
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was great, had nice views (we stayed in an oceanfront) and good friendly service. However, the Casino was terrible every time we went in there. I almost felt discriminated against because the wait staff there only took care of their locals and were very slow getting around. I was in the Casino for over 2-3 hours one night and was served 3 drinks. My wife asked for food from 3 different wait staff and never got what she asked for. One time I gave a waitress my order and a tip, she never returned with my drink. I gave another waiter in there a tip and asked that he come see me more often, never saw him again either. Another time I was in the middle of asking for a drink, had to turn around to place a bet and the waitress walked off without my order. I was on the craps table, It was my turn to roll the dice so I placed my bet and they gave the dice to someone else, I tried to take my bet off the table and they told me no. The person they gave the dice to threw a 12 on his first roll, causing me to lose a fair amount of money. After I shared my frustrations with a few of the dealers there, a few of them would make comments in Spanish and would laugh; I found this to be very disrespectful. This Casino is by far the worst I have ever been in, had the hotel not been good, this place would have received no stars instead of 3. I plan to write Marriott about my disgust with their so-called Casino. I would go back to the hotel, but never again will I step foot in their Casino.

Reviews.Title: “First and best experience”
Reviews.Author: Tossanchi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the best place in can be. The beach is great, clean and a lot of fun. The hotel staff are amazing. The front desk manager, Santos Sanchez is the the most professional and courtious Marriott employee I have ever met. (Take it from me, I am a seasoned traveler). The rest of the staff like Adria, and et al, are amazing as well since they have a great leader. The bottom line, you won't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: DeniseTT
Reviews.Content: The staff was fantastic. Special thanks to our housekeeper, Susana, who was incrediably friendly and nice. Had a room in the tower with a beautiful view of the pool and beach. We had a perfect view of the 4th of July fireworks from our balcony. Room had mini-refrigerator so we could purchase sodas and snacks from the Walgreens across the street. The hotel also provided bottled water each day. We choice the package with breakfast included and the breakfast buffet was great. Perfect location to walk to restaurants, and a short cab ride to Old San Juan. I would highly recommend this hotel, and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarshaDavid
Reviews.Content: After researching several resort type hotels in San Juan we decided on the San Juan Marriott. The location is about halfway between the airport and Old San Juan, located in the trendy, boutique area of Condado. The Marriott staff checked us in quickly; while we waited we were offered Pina Coladas - Yum. We were on the 17th floor in a corner room with a fabulous view. The room was very nice with lots of walking room. It gets dark about 7:30pm and the sun comes up around 5:30am - the heavy drapery kept out the morning light. The pool is very nice, unlike most US resort where you need to be at the pool by 8am to get a lounge chair, the pool area doesn't get rolling until around 10:30am. The only thing that needs improvement is the room service doorknob hanger for breakfast, and that wasn't a big deal. Just be specific in your request. We rented a car for one day from the Hertz desk at the hotel. We also set up our excursions at the tour desk at the hotel. Everything from check-in, restaurants, pool, bar, doormen and checkout was very good service. My AT&T cell phone service worked very well all over the island. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “First Time visit to San Juan”
Reviews.Author: two-rights19
Reviews.Content: My husband had been to San Juan on business before but this was my first time visit and we went to celebrate our fifth anniversary. We used a lot of the information from trip advisor to select this hotel. We had great service from the staff and we stayed in an oceanfront room and the view was worth the price. The package we purchased thru Marriott included the breakfast buffet and our beach chairs/umbrellas were included. We had read about the prices of the food, drinks, etc so we took the advice from others. We got some supplies from the Walgreens (across the street) beers, snacks and we ate the buffet each morning and stayed full until dinner. Jose (our bellman) was great! He gave us the names of several good restaurants near by and also one in Old San Juan for Puerto Rican food. We had the best mojito's at the beach bar (get Joel to make them!! Awesome!). They were ten dollars but definitely a treat for us after a day in the sun. We would recommend Tijuana's Bar and Grill. They are a block or two down from the hotel. Turn left out of the hotel and an easy walk. They have Mexican food with a twist and it was great! My husband went to the Casino and enjoyed it. He did have some problems at times getting on a table for blackjack due to not enough tables opened but he had signed up for a players card upon arrival and we earned some credit on our hotel stay. The location was great, taxi ride from airport was $15.00. Same cost for going into Old San Juan. We did not have a car and except for going to Old San Juan for a day we just came to relax and rest. In Old San Juan I would definitely recommend seeing the El Morro fort! Great History and super views! We also enjoyed the Cristo Chapel and Pigeon Park next door. We ate dinner at Raices. This was great Puerto Rican food and lot's of locals eat here. We had a hour wait but it was worth it. We would like to come back again and would definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “we hosted our wedding here, no regrets!”
Reviews.Author: cbear0623
Reviews.Content: My family, friends, husband, and i stayed at the Marriot for a week. It was our first time visiting Puerto Rico. The staff here was very friendly. Service was a bit slow but still very good. I had been dealing with the staff for a few months due to the fact that my hubby and i were planning our wedding at this hotel. Eunice Vargas was our event coordinator and provided us with top notch service from day one until our wedding day. If you are planning a destination wedding, you will be in good hands with Eunice. Two thumbs up for Eunice and the san juan,marriot!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: linglingma
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick long weekend getaway. This Marriot is in a great location in the heart of the Condado district, walking distance to many restaurants,bars and shops.Old San Juan is a quick 10 minute cab ride away. Rooms are clean and comfortable (we stayed in partial ocean view in cabana building). Beach was nice and clean. Staff were pleasant and very polite, conceirge very helpful. Lobby is quite lively at night packed with people dancing and obviously having a good time, just as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: angellibra81
Reviews.Content: One of the cheaper hotels we could find through online booking. Great service. Friendly staff and incredibly accomodating. Room service was running five minutes late and ended up comping our meal. Only ate breakfast buffet which was average. Beautiful beach; probably best on the island. Especially friendly for families and children. Even though we were two single gals we didn't mind the kids because there were a lot of adult activities to do. The location is prime with a strip of restaurants and quite bars nearby. A Walgrens is only one block away and is open 24 hours. Pool was slightly above average. Casino was small. Main lobby includes a bar, small cafe, restaurant, small gift shop. Entertainment was there each night but not that entertaining. Well worth the stay if you are looking for a slightly above average hotel and are on a budget. I would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice beach experience!”
