Reviews.Author: lbindc73
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. This was the second time I have stayed here and it was great. We spent all day in the ocean, playing in the waves. The beach is clean and groomed, and the waves are perfect for body surfing and swimming. The hotel provides really nice lawn chairs and towels for guests, and there is wait staff bringing guests food and cocktails. My only gripe is that there werent enough wait staff to accommodate all of us Out there on the beach (but the bar is close by and we easily got drinks anyway). The room was spacious and had a big beautiful balcony. Very clean and comfortable bathrooms (with GREAT shower heads and water pressure). This hot is totally convenient and I will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “My family loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mommitry
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1130 am for a one night pre cruise stay, we had three small children who had just been on a Seven hour overnight flight and we met an angel, daven He got us a room immediately , he never asked us to pay anything extra or any resort fees or upgrade fees we had booked through price line and we received a room with a pool and ocean view. The room was clean and had no bad smells like I had read on other reviews. The pool was great for kids and families the water slide was a big hit, the beach was clean and safe. We were sad to leave and I'm sure we will be back again in the future.there are plenty of restraunts, walgreens , dunkin donuts and Starbucks all within walking distance if you don't want to eat at the hotel and the concierge has a list of recommended restraunts according to your tastes and desires. Staff was always friendly and courteous and activities throughout the day for adults and kids .

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JorgeNews
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from another tremendous vacation at the San Juan Marriott. After an initial hiccup on the day we arrived - seems the Marriott was hosting a local day camp, a high school prom and a couple of weddings on our first day there. This combination of increased visitors to the pool made the normally enjoyable pool area very unpleasant. The pool area more resembled an over-crowded public city pool than that of an expensive resort. We packed up and made our way to the ocean. However, this only affected our first day. After that the Marriott quickly became the resort that we remembered from our previous 3 visits. The beyond friendly staff goes out of their way to make you comfortable. They all seem to remember little things about you and your preferences as your stay continues. You can tell that they really seem to enjoy their jobs. The pool water slide is great for kids and adults and setting right on the ocean can't be beat. Whether it's a scavenger hunt or hula hoop contest he optional activities help gives the kids extra little diversions during the day. Plus the Salsa lessons, water aerobics classes and Happy Hours were great for the adults. While I mentioned that the entire staff was great, we did want to take a moment to personally call out a few extra special folks that made our stay great - La Vista staff members Aixa, Dahilia and Angelo were awesome. In fact our kids just mentioned today that Angelo from Puerto Rico was "pretty cool"! From the Beach Bar - Samuel, Joel and Carlos were great. Our room was spotless after every day that Alejandro was done with it. The pool recreation staff with Noelia, Fidel and of course RITA made sure we had fun. Rita in particular we specifically remembered from our previous stay is a key member of their staff. She is friendly and went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect for us. In Old San Juan we recommend restaurants La Bombanera and Cafe Mallorca for great local food, as well Parrot Club for a little more family friendly upscale setting. Be sure to have the Plantain Chip Nachos. To the left of the resort Argentinian steakhouse UMMO was great. Also our trip to El Yunque Rainforest and water fall were amazing and well worth the trip. Thank you Marriott staff for helping to make our vacation a memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: JeanT13
Reviews.Content: The San Juan Marriott was in a perfect location to access some of the best restaurants in San Juan and shopping. It was close to the highway making it easy to get to our tour destinations. The rooms are very nice and clean. The housekeeping service couldn't be any better, especially Susana Miller, who made sure we had a clean room to return to every day, was extremely friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. Would stay there again. The beach is also great in front of the hotel and the pool is very nice. The beds were very comfortable and we slept like babies!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Establishment...will be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: vaw30080
Reviews.Content: My friend and I lodged at this hotel from June 23rd - 27th for a girls' trip. We initially had reservations at the Conrad, but after reading reviews decided to cancel and book at the Marriott instead. This Marriott is the best hotel establishment in San Juan. We arrived around 2:30p and was allowed to check in early. They served rum punch to guests as we checked in. The bell hops gather your backs as soon as you arrive and deliver them up to your room. The lobby area was beautiful. The hotel has two pools and a hot tub which all were very clean. Hot breakfast was included with our room rates and quite tasty. The service staff was always pleasant and friendly. The room was very clean and the bed really comfy. Our room had an ocean view which was just spectacular. The conceirge had many recommendations and guides to suggest things to do while in San Juan. Many thanks to the waiters and waitresses at La Vista hotel restaurant, especially Aixa and Angelo. Their service was excellent. I will definitely vacation here again and will always lodge at the Marriott when in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for- Definitely NOT a 4 star resort”
Reviews.Author: tripgril15
Reviews.Content: Most reviews I read were for 4 stars and so I expected more than I got. The building itself needs a fresh layer of paint, stat. The lobby is alright, and they give you a free drink if you are waiting to check in. At night, they have live music and a dance floor which is really nice actually. The casino is directly across from the lobby and depending on your view of casinos, it can class up a place or not. To me, there was nothing glamorous about it and it kind of lowered the class of the hotel a little. The pool and the pool chairs and pool bar were not as nice as they are in the pictures (of course) and they need some renovation as well. You cannot swim up to the pool bar and there's no adult pool. The beach is beautiful and sandy and wasn't too rough (we went in June). They also provide free lounge chairs and umbrellas. You can buy food and drinks on the beach but they run about $10/drink. We had an ocean-front room and I cannot imagine anything else especially since the room itself was so crowded (we had a kind-size bed) so you need a balcony to get some breathing room. We couldn't hear our neighbors and the room was fairly clean without too much of the 'ick' factor (although the curtains were so dusty they looked like they were never washed). There also wasn't a coffee machine in the room but there was free bottled water. We went for our friends' destination wedding and they did a pretty good job. The pastor was very well organized and nice, the wedding coordinator was efficient, and the music was corrent (chosen by bride and groom) the flowers were great, the cake was pink fondant and the food was delicious. And it was all in a timely manner. It was a budget wedding and it ended up being nicer than a lot of the weddings in the states that cost more. We were just there for the weekend and the location was great for a day at the beach, a day into San Juan and an excurision if you want to. It's also great for walking around the beach area of San Juan and going to clubs and restaurants within walking distance that a lot of locals actually go to. Don't eat at the hotel, there's plently of local food just down the street. If the Ritz is 5 stars and this is reviewed as 4 stars, you will be dissapointed but it's a fine 3 star choice. It is busy and crowded so if you want a relaxing vacation this isn't the right hotel, and if you want to spend most of your time in Old San Juan, you can probably find a closer and more interesting place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, great staff and then my dress was stolen :(”
Reviews.Author: toastybev
Reviews.Content: The Stellaris is located in the Condado district so you will see many tourists. Not much to do in this area. The beach is dirty overall along this strip and the water is rough. As far as the hotel, very clean, staff was friendly and they have low key security everywhere. Casino was ok. They have a happy hour for and older crowd...I would say 45 and up. We had breakfast included which was great. Breakfast is served until 12 pm. Didn't eat at the resort otherwise. The pool is ok. Lots of families. I couldn't the jacuzzi for more than 10 minutes at a time because of the strong odor of jacuzzi. My dress was stolen from poolside. My fav dress :( that put me in a funky mood after 4 days in a resort that I feel didn't offer what I was looking for which was more of a fun, party and carribbean feel. I told my boyfriend I had considered booking La Concha and we should go walk by. La Concha looked like what I was looking for all along. People laughing, drinking, dancing, music.... We got upgraded for $25 p/night. We had a great view from the 18th floor. We ordered pizza from Mike's and they deliver even though the front lobby told us nobody delivers in the area due to the traffic. I guess they wanted us to order room service. We also had dinner at Cafe Puerto Rico in Old San Juan and that was delicious...make room for dessert. I would recommend the resort in general. The Marriott was nice but not if you're looking for a fun time

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: 3mw
Reviews.Content: In June we were trying to make a last minute reservation for a anniversary trip. We checked tripadvisor for the best place to stay. The Marriott San Juan had a great review and a pop up said they were offering 20% off the weekend stay. When we clicked on in it took us directly to the Marriott.com website. We called a customer representative and they said we were eligible for that rate and all we had to do was show our printed out coupon, so we booked our reservation. When we got to the hotel they would not honor our coupon. It was such a quick trip that we did not have time to argue or try to find a different place to stay. I have been trying to resolve the issue with Marriott for over two weeks and they only reply to me with stock emails that they are sorry and will look into it. I would be very careful of any discounted rate because they might not honor it once they have you at the hotel. This hotel is lacking in many areas and for the price we paid I would have rather stayed at many other hotels. It is not convenient to anything. It is a $15 cab ride to Old San Juan and the neighborhood around the hotel is sketchy to say the least. The cab driver showed us the largest slum in the world (his words) which is just down the street. Plus they have a convention center in the hotel and every night there were HUGE parties that we could hear in our room. The rooms were not especially nice, our view was horrible, and we could not get the room to cool down. Also as other people have mentioned they must sell access to their pool because there were a TON of kids running around with wristbands on. It made the pool VERY crowded. The only positives to this place is that the beach and pool were nice and the restaurants were actually very good. The Italian restaurant was one of the best I have ever eaten in.

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahp29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for our 5 year anniversary and babymoon vacation. It has been a great trip and we would highly recommend this hotel. We have both traveled extensively and usually stay in nice resorts. Some great things about this property are : 1) cleanliness - the rooms were always clean , and the pool bathrooms were being cleaned constantly - never got gross 2) free breakfast buffet - very very good - lots of options and stays open till 11:30 am. We ate a big breakfast and didn't eat again till dinner. 3) location - right outside the hotel are several fun restaurants to eat at ( we liked tiajuanas and Yerba bueno) and a few shops. Also a Starbucks and hagendas ice cream 4) weather - was great, always a sting breeze at the pool. 5) pools - clean, not too crowded, always enough chairs, swim up bar and waterslide. Note: the pic on the websit of the pool w 4 lighted up pillars is actually the kiddie pool and is only 2 feet deep If you stay here brig a portable cooler and get drinks at the walgreens down the street - you can bring them into the pool and save lots of money! Be sure to check out old San Juan and if you can, eat at marmalade restaurant one night - soooo worth the money! It's a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation Spot, We'll Return”
Reviews.Author: bethblue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 fabulous days at the Marriott Stellaris. The hotel is a 15 minute ride from the airport in San Juan, and sits right on the beach. The hotel staff were highly competent and very friendly, from the front desk, to the door men, restaurant waiters, pool workers, and housekeeping. We asked for a high up room overlooking the sea and had a perfect room on the 20th floor. Noise was almost nonexistent. We also had access to the executive lounge on the 21st floor and stopped by a couple of times for appetizers and dessert. Our room was spacious and clean, the breakfast each day (included in our room) had plenty of options for eggs, fresh fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, etc. The pool was pleasant and when we went, in June, not at all crowded. We hope to return and bring our teenage children, they would love the place. It's a short ride to Old San Juan, and we also rented a car to visit El Junque National Park. So much to do from a great home-base! Congrats to Marriott on this one!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place & have returned 3 times”
Reviews.Author: alligalli
Reviews.Content: Hotel, security, beach are all top notch. Resturants great but personally we did not like the remoldel off one of them. Liked the food & atmosphere of brfore redo beter. Have recomended to all freinds & family. Oldest son just stayed last week & called every night to tell how much fun he was having. Can get to every where on the island by either walking, taxi or rental car. Would recomend walk or taxi Especialy in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Cazzy2girls
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort! We took our two teenage daughters. We all enjoyed playing in the huge ocean waves. The beach and pool areas were beautiful! We ate incredible food and enjoyed the live music in the lounge every evening. My husband and I even won a few dollars on the slots one night! Great memories were made in San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: RJP33498
Reviews.Content: Our honeymoon trip to San Juan was highlighted by our stay at the Marriott San Juan. The entire staff was A-1, especially Dennisse Concepcion, Pablo Yamamoto, and Carlos Ney. I would name each and every person with whom we came in contact, but there is simply not enough room. Notwithstanding my wife's injury, the entire staff at the hotel made our honeymoon a most memorable experience. We've found our "home" in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: aandbgoforth
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the San Juan Marriott and I highly recommend it to others. Check in was quick and easy. All of the employees went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. I paid a little bit extra for a "partial ocean view room." It had a pretty full ocean view (partially blocked in a few places by trees), and I definitely recommend paying the little bit extra to have an ocean view rather than a city view. We had a nice room and all of the rooms have balconies. The hotel is within walking distance of tons of restaurants and shops of all types. The concierge was very helpful in recommending restaurants based on distance, price, or type of food. We did not eat at the hotel restaurants with the exception of the pool bar. Drinks and food were good but very expensive. There is a Walgreens across the street which was helpful for basic needs. The hotel has a nice pool area with a swim up bar. The beach is beautiful and there are employees on hand to set up your chairs and umbrella. We went in June and the beach was not very crowded. For those of you who like to walk up and down the beach, you can do this a little (about one or two blocks to the right of the hotel and three or four blocks to the left) but beyond that there are walls of rocks. We had a great time on our first visit to Puerto Rico and very much enjoyed the San Juan Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Love it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: jfzorn
Reviews.Content: Had a great time on vacation, 1 day in San Juan, 7 day cruise and 5 days in San Juan, Puerto Rico. We have been staying at the Marriott Stellaris Beach Resort in San Juan. I highly recommended this resort for their service and everything. The Concierge Marcos and Lani are the best. Ask for them if you ever stay at this resort and tell them that Judy from Atlanta sent you!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly right!”
Reviews.Author: Julia R
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 5 women who are spread out across the eastern seacoast of the US. We all met up at the hotel and had fun from there! This hotel had every amenity, excellent staff, and we had a wonderful time. I can't think of a single negative. The location was well within walking distance of great activities and restaurants, and for those of us accustomed to walking around Manhattan, we could easily take an enjoyable walk to Old San Juan for some sightseeing! (The non-New Yorkers walked it too, but not as easily!) We didn't spend much time in the rooms, but when the power went out in the rest of the city for an hour or two, this Marriott had a generator that kicked in immediately and we weren't affected. In fact, the views from our balcony were awesome! Bathrobes, slippers, and towels provided. Full service beach with "butlers" to bring out chairs, umbrella, and take drink and food orders... right there in the perfect weather!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: Nick48
Reviews.Content: We stay for a couple of days in this hotel. The location is excellent and a few steps from the beach. The hotel service is excellent, fast check in and automatic check out.Our room was very clean, confortabel beds, nice and clean bath and the best ocean view you ever imagine, specially in the morning hours. The hotel is located in the heart of "condado" a very upscale residential area and also a tourist area with a lot of bars, restaurants, cafes, shops, and very close to Old San Juan. There is a parking lot for $20 a day. For those who like to play there is a casino in the hotel main lobby. There is also a coffeshop, souvenirs store, gym and a swimingpool. The rooms have a internet access, but not free.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Nomad0921
Reviews.Content: This Marriott has a terrific location on the beach in San Juan with easy access to the features that San Juan has to offer. For those travellers interested in nightlife, the casino is attached to the hotel lobby, and nightlife looked promising. Beach access was easy !

Reviews.Title: “We will never return....Nasty for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: lv11399_11
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this was not what I expected from a Marriott.1st thing, we stand in a huge line that takes forever because there is only two staff at the front desk and then to be told our room is not ready they give us a pager to let us know when it's ready. After sometime has passed my pager goes off I go up to the desk thinking I could get my room key but no I'm told I need to get back in that line and wait...very rude staff...We get our room I pay an extra $100 plus tax to get a room that smells like a wet dog, I go and change rooms this time I go into the bathroom of the new room and there is pubic hair all over the floor. I quit I had no where else to go or I would have left this hotel. Then to be charged $16.00 a day for parking, we parked our own car and it never moved til we left thats a joke...We had breakfast both mornings at LaVista very pricey but it was ok... second day I ate became very sick needless to say we flew home that night and I was admitted to the hospital for 8 days...As an Elite member believe me you are treated no different if you had walked in off the street. One last thing,my husband is in the military and getting ready to go overseasfor 1 yr this was our little get away(nightmare) before his departure...I read how they give military discounts well everytime I put in Military the price was higher...I will be putting that in our monthly military newspaper it's a joke...I always stayed at Hampton Inn and believe me I will be returning. Another thing roomservice was terrible we waited til 6:00pm to get service.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding of our Dreams”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaLandlocked
Reviews.Content: I have been following TripAdvisor religiously for the past 2 years to plan our wedding. We chose Puerto Rico because of our 30 guests and chose San Juan because of all the action. We had never been to PR and this website was central to our decision. The Marrtott delivered. In order to appeal to all our guests we could not have made a better choice. Perfect location: On the beach, fabulous pool, great bars and restaurants in walking distance, the safest place to be in San Juan. This is a residential area where locals feel safe to jog (during one meal we counted 50 + people jogging!!) Transportation: We took cabs from the airport. They are white vans and SUV's and they are highly regulated, clean, efficient, and downright reasonable for transportation from the airport $18 bucks...they will get you to Old San Juan for $15. If you want to save $14 bucks take the bus.The bus system is UNBELIEVABLE!! 75 cents (change only, no dollars or plastic) a person will get you from the hotel to Old San Juan. The buses are clean, safe, and air-conditioned!!! The hotel is around 2.5 miles from OSJ and makes for a great walk for active folks. The hotel rooms were great. We sat on our 16th story balcony ocean view for hours!! The beach was great. The staff was great and there are some awesome nightly events (Salsa, ladies night, 80's music, etc). It is loud in the evenings and is an event hotel so you can expect proms, weddings, conventions, etc. It makes for alot of fun and the people are great. I would not recommend the 2 restaurants in the hotel: over-priced. There are so many great restaurants nearby (Yerba Buena, Miro, Ummo, Latin Star) and American chains (Starbucks, Dunkin donuts, Wendys) don't waste your money on the hotel restaurants. There is a Walgreens and liquor stores across the street too. We made our own drinks and brought them to the beach. We stayed 7 nights and it wasn't enough. We can't wait to go back. After 2 years of planning (all online, to a place we'd never been!) my husband and I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!!! Tips: Take the bus to Old San Juan Bacardi Rum Factory!! Free and a fun ferry ride away! and the rum is super cheap Eat at Cafe Mallorca instead of La Bombanera Have brunch at Miro across the street (Cheese Bikini Sandwich!!) Go to San Cristobal and marvel at how old it is. Walk along th Paseo de la Princesa.... so beautiful! Places we ate and loved: Raices, Pirilo Pizza Rustica, Cafe la Princesa The main tower is better than the cabana suites for a view Wi-Fi in the rooms is $19 a day. Go across the street to Starbucks for internet

Reviews.Title: “nice vacation”
Reviews.Author: KAMCG
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the marriott from june 4th-8th if your looking for sun though you might want to go somewhere else as it rained everyday!!! at first we had an ocean front room very small so we moved to a corner room bigger and nice view with 2 balconies. The marriott had great food and drinks and the staff was really nice and so were all the people there. My husband and I paid the resort fee so we got breakfast and chairs and umbrellas included which helped with the cost at the end of the trip we had a cab driver who picked us up and drove us all the time i have his cell number if anyone is interested he was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and pleasant staff!”
Reviews.Author: RicardoMaxwell
Reviews.Content: Recently, we had the opportunity to participate in an inaugural flight to San Juan from our home city. The hotel of choice for all of us was the Marriott Resort and Stellaris Casino. The hotel staff was waiting for us upon check-in and my wife and received an excellent room, even as part of a group with discounted rates. The rooms are clean and comfortable and I cannot think of any amenity that we lacked. The staff was friendly, responsive to our needs, and showed genuine empathy, something we did not experience our last time in Puerto Rico. The concierge was extremely helpful in assisting us in finding a restaurant for dinner. And if Condado is where you want to be, this location is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Don't recommend won't being going back!”
Reviews.Author: Sunflower1954
Reviews.Content: $15 taxi cab charge from the airport +$1 for each additional bag. Arrived on May 25th for a 5 night stay, ask for an upgrade to ocean view room and was told that it would be an additional $50 a night (read in tripadvisor only $25 for upgrade a night which I mention however I was told "as long as I've worked here it has always been $50"). On the 8th floor ocean view, room very small and bed was lumpy. I recommend if you take a trip to Puerto Rico that you NOT take it in May it rained everyday we were there (don't forget to take your umbrella). Very, very few locals spoke English and were at times very rude. We went to the beach 1 day and were charged resort fees (chairs/umbrella) for 5 days which we got removed. Walked to Walgreens on the corner and got snacks and water. We had breakfast at the hotel 1 day which wasn't worth $40. Also ate Chinese in the casino at the Marriott not good! There are other restaurants in walking distance however, who wants to go on vacation and eat at Wendy and Chester's Chicken. There were a couple of other restaurants in the area Tijuana's and Danny's not bad however don't go to Latin Star unless you like burnt eggs horrible! Wednesday and Thursday were quiet and Friday, Saturday and Sunday in the hotel lobby there was very loud music and definitely a party going on. In our room watching the Bulls and Miami game, Bulls had 10 point lead television went out and when it came back on and Bulls had lost WOW! Had luck at other casinos LaConcha and Radisson not the Marriott machine way too tight! We caught the bus to San Juan .75 cents each way and then a free trolley took us around San Juan very nice historical sites. Ate at Senor Frog's in San Juan ok, again to pricey. Ask a couple of locals where to catch the bus back to hotel and nobody spoke English and just totally ignored us. We made a second trip back to San Juan this time took a taxi to go to Racine and there was a 2 hour wait. Also took the taxi cab to the Premium Mall. It would have been nice to see the sunset one day! The good thing was we were able to printout our boarding pass! I will take Aruba any day of the week!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel- great service and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: msilverman2007
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the San Juan Marriott. I would give the hotel a 4.5 rating out of 5! We had a beautiful ocean view room with balcony and the sounds of the waves were music to our ears. Bed was terrific- very comfortable. All the staff at the hotel, from concierge to the bellman were helpful and friendly. Great location near many restaurants so one can walk and seek different culinary options. Gym was well run and offered maniy workout options. Walgreens is almost across the street and it was convenient for several items that we needed. The executive lounge operation was well run and we enjoyed the healthy breakfasts. All in all the hotel met all of our expectations. We also enjoyed visiting old San Juan and the well managed historic sites. We ate lunch at Barrachina's where it is said the pina colada was developed. Great food and wonderful service. If there was any complaint it would be a hotel of this quality should have shuttle service from the airport. With the rates that are charged by the hotel one shouldn't have to spend , almost $20 each to go from airport to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For a Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: BrockportFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short resort type vacation. We thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. The Beach and Pool were both excellent. We recommend spending the extra dollars to upgrade to an ocean view room. It is awesome to sit on the small balcony and watch the ocean. The casino was pretty good. While it's not Las Vegas, the Blackjack tables were fun and there are a variety of slot machines. Don't miss Happy Hour at the pool bar. Lastly the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great but some service issues”
Reviews.Author: wearetheworld84
Reviews.Content: We are a fairly well traveled couple who went to celebrate our 27th anniversary--first time in Puerto Rico. This Marriott was highly recommended by many of our friends, who stay here annually. HOTEL: All was fine, including the restaurants, except for the following --Hubby had planned to surprise me with "honeymoon" package on arrival, which never happened despite a confirmation email. When he complained to the concierge, she had quite the attitude. Eventually, he complained to a manager, who gave us a complimentary later check out and a $100 credit, which we were appreciative of. --We had upgraded to an oceanfront on arrival-- advised that it would be an extra $25/night, but our itemized bill charged us $50/night-- they fixed it once brought to their attention. --Casino did not have enough 3 card poker tables open on weekend--when asked about it, they stated they didn't have enough staff. Better on week days. --Beach is gorgeous and meticulously maintained; however, the recession mustve hit hard because all of the adjacent beachfront properties appeared to be closed with graffiti on the beachfront facades. Very sad. FOOD: The best was Budatai-- absolutely superior. We regreted never getting to the expensive, but highly recommended Perla restaurant at The Conch hotel. ATTRACTIONS: We crammed so much into our 5 night stay! We did the San Juan w/ art museum excursion-- spent too much time at the Fort, though it did pour buckets that day! Next time would get a private tour or go by ourselves (see below). Bioluminescent bay with the highlight of the trip, even if we did fall out of our kayak! A must=see! Rainforest was a nice trip, though didn't see much flora/fauna that day. Did dip into the waterhole the base of the large waterfall. Met Sammy (787 7026821) who also does private tours-- wish we had met him sooner as our friends had recommended that we do some of the tours privately. Cost is comparable, but you get a personalized itinerary. Salsa bands at the hotel were so much fun..we finally tried to join in on our last night, which was a blast! We had missed the Sat 1:30p lessons by the pool, unfortunately. Also, must see the Old San Juan at night in addition to the day-- we had a great meal at The Parrot Cafe and also heard that Dragonfly and Racias (something like that) are also good.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid weekends due to "day passers"”
Reviews.Author: Trisheee
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Marriott. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The facilities are well maintained and there was always a staff/security member available to ask questions. The first room we went to had an odd odor and no real view of the water, though we paid for ocean view. Don't stay in the small building because your view is blocked by palm trees for the first 3 levels. They upgraded us at no charge and we stayed in the tower with a much larger balcony and clear view of pool and city. The downside is that this hotel sells "day passes" to individuals not staying at the hotel. On a typical Saturday or Sunday the pool becomes over ridden with local families. There are not many beach chairs and they consume the pool. Once Monday came and the kids were back in school, the pool area and beach are wonderful. To avoid this, perhaps do some sightseeing on the weekend and lounging during the week. As others have noted, housekeeping needs something to be desired. One afternoon we went back to the room and found housekeeping had left our room open by using the door latch between door and frame. Other days we would receive a note under our door at 8:30am stating if we wanted our room cleaned we would need to call by 2. Another day we left early and came back around 3:00 and our room still was not cleaned. The restaurants are very good at the hotel and a little pricey. We ventured out within walking distance and found Danny's International had a cheap breakfast and pizza for dinner. Also, there is Tijuana's for fairly good Mexican food. My favorite which is a little pricier was Ropo Veija. Stay away from Latin Star which had a terrible breakfast and overhead other guests stating dinner was just as bad.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ginamarina
Reviews.Content: Child friendly, nice clean rooms, great food at the restaurants. Steps away from the beautiful beach

Reviews.Title: “Great facility & location”
Reviews.Author: brandnewman
Reviews.Content: The room was fantastic with ocean view, great bed and nice bathroom. The beach, pools and bars and restaurants give you everything you need. They have guys right there to set up your beach umbrella and loungers. The Condado neighborhood is great. We were able to walk to restaurants for dinner every night. We hope to go back to San Juan again, if so we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, excellant accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: beaver201
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 5/16/2001 at 11am and immediately got our room which was a upgrade we didn't expected or ask for. Had a full ocean view room plus a view of the pool area. Had originally booked a partial ocean view. We also got complimentary breakfast also unexpected. The room was very nice, very comfortable bed, nice bathroom and had ample room. The beach area was fanastic. The waves were large. In fact, we got knocked over by one large wave but it was great. Service personnel on the beach were very cordially, friendly and provided good service. There is a nice outside lounge area and bar. Many restaurants close to hotel and a good variety. We took public transportation( abus) to "old San Juan" it was inexpensive and fast. Old San Juan is great. Many things to see and do. Although it rained everyday were in San Juan it was mostly in the afternoon and early evenings. Had plenty of sun time before noon. Went on the Rain Forest tour. Had a great time despite the rain. The tour guide was very friendly, informative and accomodating. Booked tour through the Marriott. Planning to go next year but will book in April to avoid the early rainy season.

Reviews.Title: “What can we do for you?”
Reviews.Author: dariensolis
Reviews.Content: When we arrived (at 8:30 p.m.) a mistake had been made on our accomodations, but within 30 minutes everything was corrected, apologies had been received and we ended up with a beautiful oceanside room w/balcony. Of course we were starving so we headed down to LaVista. Magnificient food and service. Tuscany is good Italian food, not so good service. A little Spanish goes a long way here. Even if you're not great at it the effort is rewarded 100 fold! Everyone is ready to assist you. The spa is beyond wonderful with excellent masseuse's. If you're going to eat out, ask the concierge for "Local" eateries, you won't be disappointed. Reasonably priced with food to die for, NOT TOURIST TRAPPED!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stuff.”
Reviews.Author: TJISAKA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice! It's a mini-resort. Includes multiple restaurants, bars, access to the beach, fabulous pool with activities daily. The locals will tell you the story about how this hotel was involved in a fire that was set by (who knows who) but blamed on the maitre d. So its kinda not the popular spot from what I hear. I loved it though. It's very modern in look an feel. The lobby is full of action at all times. There's a bar that greets you upon entry, a mini coffee shop and bakery, concierge and tour desks fill the lobby. There's also the entrance to the casino off the lobby. What I liked about this place is the LOCATION! It's a quick walk to some excellent restaurants (Yerba Buena, Ropa Vieja, Bebos, Santurce District) We had a beautiful ocean front view from our room, and when we didn't feel like leaving the hotel- there was plenty of people watching to be done. Between the beach, the casino, the pool, the fitness center, the mini-arcade, the bars- we had fun within our fingertips. The public bus picks up on the corner making for a cheap and easy trip over to Old (Vieja) San Juan. The staff was also pretty awesome. I had a bad experience upon check-in where my reservation didn't show that breakfast was to be included. It was very annoying and an inconvenience, but frankly- that's my only complaint. Well, that and that Wifi isn't free! Its like $18/day! Nuts! You can go to the local Burger King or Pizza Hut for FREE. The rooms were cleaned daily, the air conditioning WORKED, and there were plenty of fluent english speaking staff. I went with my brother and when I didn't feel like hanging out with him- I felt very comfortable going out to the local bars/clubs myself. The front desk staff will definitely tell you not to do this- as San Juan has its share of violence, but I felt comfortable and just stayed alert while walking to and from. What else can I tell you.... the tour desk offers packages to Ponce, El Yunque (the rainforest), Bacardi, Snorkeling... you name it! It's actually not a bad package deals in terms of offerings or price. While its not terribly hard to get around in San Juan, they drive kind of ... CRAZY! No turn signals and extremely AGGRESSIVE. So if you can stand paying the premium to have someone drive you around, go for it. On Friday and Saturday night by the pool, there is a movie projected. Pretty cool. Daily there are free fitness classes, dance lessons, gaming (ie gambling) lessons and even options to rent bikes (~$25/day).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Angelcry
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on other reviews that stated that the beds were "heavenly". Well, the beds were very nice, but not nearly as soft or "heavenly" as I expected (I have fibromyalgia, so need something really soft). That being said, the room was beautiful and the amenities were excellent. The service from the staff cannot be faulted! The beach is beautiful, the pool and swimup bar are awesome. The food at the restaurants in the hotel is wonderful, but so is the price! Luckily, there are several great places to eat within walking distance. You will not be disappointed if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Girl Trip! Great Spot to begin a vacation. Great service!”
Reviews.Author: kris2747
Reviews.Content: My two girlfriends and I stayed at the Marriott Stellaris Hotel from 04/28 - 05/02 for some fun and sun. We used Marriott points for our stay and were on the 10th floor with an ocean view. It was a beautiful hotel with a great location. Yes, the carpet is not the best in the rooms, which I expected from a hotel right on the beach, but every other part of this hotel is clean and inviting. We had extremely good service from every area of the hotel. The only issue we had was our room service order was wrong but we were too hungry to care. The food and drinks at the hotel are really good but are a little higher priced. We hit the Walgreen's (out front door two blks to right) for snacks, water, and soda and the mini mart (two blks out front door to left) for a Styrofoam cooler and alcohol. You are allowed to take a cooler on the beach but not in the pool area. This worked really well for us and saved us quite a bit of money on drinks. We ate at a couple restaurants around hotel and were disappointed with the food. Mira, across the street from hotel was suggested our first night and was too salty too finish. Buenos Ayres on same block as Walgreen's is not worth the walk. There were several others that we wish we would of tried instead. The food in Old San Juan is amazing. Lupis in San Juan was amazing! We had the burrito with chili verde and the nachos and would suggest to go there. Oh, and definitely try the Chicken Quesadilla from the beach bar. We rented a car for one day from Charlie's, which is a small booth next to Starbucks for some exploring. Rental was inexpensive but deposit is hefty; it is returned however. We used GPS app on phone and had no problems getting around. I went on the zip lining adventure which was awesome! It is a workout getting up the hill but well worth it. Bring a bottle water or they have some available for $2. They tell you its for 9 zip lines but if you do good with the braking they will let you go on three different lines after the 8th line. It was fantastic! We also went snorkeling at Luquillo and Los Cabros near Fajardo on the way to ride the electric boat into the bio bay. *You can not snorkel at the hotel beach. The waves are too rough. The hotel beach is great for body surfing and jumping waves.* Luquillo has a reef with pretty fish for snorkeling. Los Carbros had sea grass where we saw lots of wildlife while snorkeling including; sea stars, sea cucumbers, conch shells, and even a sea snake. The bio bays are a MUST see while there. We really wanted to do the full day excursion where they pick you up at hotel and you can swim in the bio bay, but the tour had been booked for about a week and a half before we got there. The kayak tour was available but not a good choice for our group so we decided to go with Captain Suarez on the electric boat. This is a totally natural wonder and is super cool. I would suggest booking this as soon as you know you are going. It is truly magical.

Reviews.Title: “Aweeeeeesome Place”
Reviews.Author: MzJaytoo
Reviews.Content: We arrived 4/15 @ 11am , The check- in was short & sweet, two rooms - One King Suite- both nice, clean, fresh, and beach front with patio!!! Free beach chairs & towels, great food at the resort too. The kids ran free, while we relaxed beachside & sipped tropical drinks!!! We are young parents with a 21, 19, & 10 year old!! They loved every moment of the trip.....Best food we had was in Old San Juan - "Fatty's" West Indian, Carribean Soul Food..........its awesome. We ordered Curry Chicken & Shrimp, Jerk Chicken, for our little 'tree-hugger" vegetarian - Jerk Veggies all with rice & cabbage!!! The best food the whole trip!! Beats any upscale place we ate at all weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view, fantastic location, great room!”
Reviews.Author: tbaiocco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Stellaris with my boyfriend and we had a wonderful time! It's right on the beach and our room was on the 11th floor so we had an awesome view of the ocean. The rooms have little balconies, so we had a bottle of wine during sunset several nights during our stay. The Marriott has 2 restaurants on site, but there are several more within walking distance. The pool was nice and swanky with a swim up bar. There a couple of nice extra touches, as well, such as bath & body works shampoo/conditioner (which I love!) and a recycle bin in the rooms. Overall, the Marriott was very romantic, classy, comfortable, and I'd highly recommend it to anyone visiting San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Breakfast, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Patar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights with my college aged daughter and her two friends. The front desk staff were friendly and efficient at check in. A hostess brought us face towels and rum punch to welcome us. AREA: Starbuck's and Haagen Dazs across the street. Walgreen's open 24 hours just up the block. Several small restaurants and tourist shops nearby. A $15 cab ride took us to Old San Juan. Well worth going for the forts as well as the restaurants and shops! ROOM: We had a partial ocean view room, well worth it! We could see up the coast and hear the waves from our balcony. The room was comfortable, if a little cramped, for four people. No matter, we hardly spent time in it! Room was clean and everything in working order. Housekeeping were great! I left a note the first morning asking for extra towels and after that they kept everything (towels, toiletries) stocked to overflowing! BREAKFAST: There are two tiers to paying for breakfast: 1. $11.95 gets you overflowing buffet of fruits, oatmeal, breads/pastries, cheese, and hot table items. Drinks cost extra. 2. $21.95 adds breakfast drinks and choice of made to order waffle, pancakes or omelet. Breakfast for two (even though we had four in the room) was part of our room rate (and this includes the more expensive option!) so we ate there most mornings. The buffet is amazing. We found it well worth the $11.95 price(we still had to pay for two people each day and chose not to do the made to order for those.) Breakfast area staff were great:-) Sunny and Angelo were full of personality! AMENITIES: Fitness Center has a good variety of cardio machines and free weights. It's a shame they hide it in the basement instead of putting it where we could have a view of the beach while working out! Swimming pools are nice sized and there is a hot tub. Unfortunately, even though a sign is posted that limits hot tub use to those over age 12, several times people brought babies in swim diapers into it...yuck! So I chose not to use it much of the time. Beach is wonderful for sunning, wading and playing! Not the best for swimming - waves are kind of rough here and you have to be careful to stay away from a group of large rocks in one area. Marriott provides lounge chairs and umbrellas to guests who have paid the daily resort fee. Pool bar and restaurant have servers on the beach so we ordered lunch here one day. Our server (Angelina?) was very efficient and friendly, going out of her way to custom order a salad for me (I am vegan). A couple of remarks about cleanliness: 1. The treadmill I used in the fitness room had a fan on it. The fan grill had dirt caked on the airvent grills, so I didn't turn it on. I didn't want to breathe filthy air while working out. 2. The swimming pool area had quite a bit of green algae growing around on decking. The hotel should pay more attention to keeping this down, as it gives the impression that things aren't really clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, slower service than expected.”
Reviews.Author: ddugal
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel early after a red-eye flight from LA around 10am. Rooms were not ready so we hung out. They gave us comp wifi access thru the business center to use in the lobby to hold us thru. Only issue was slow service at the outside bar overlooking the beach. Once checked in, rooms were clean to Marriott's standard. Location central to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but wouldn't rush back”
Reviews.Author: mrsherby
Reviews.Content: In order to form an opinion from these reviews you have to know who's writing them. We are a family of 4 from Massachusetts (2 daughters, age 12 and 15). I am fairly particular about cleanliness, service, and a relaxing atmosphere when I go on vacation. We are also a pretty active, health conscious family that likes to swim, snorkel, and eat good healthy meals. So here's the deal........... If I went back to the Condado area of San Juan I would stay at the Marriott again. It has everything you need and seemed more geared towards families than La Concha down the street. The pools are very nice though it was tough to find chairs since the hotel was nearly full. The beach was pretty and clean but is also a public beach so on the weekends there are a lot of locals with loud music and trinkets for sale. Just be cautious to pick the right spot before getting settled. There are plenty of chairs and umbrellas that the staff sets up for you. Not sure what the other reviews were referring to when complaining about the hotel shading the pool and beach. We had full sunshine every day, all day. It was a very easy hotel to get around - everything is within steps. The staff was great - never a problem. Very, very friendly bartenders and wait staff. Check in took a little while but mostly due to guests using the front desk clerk as the concierge and asking a million questions. The rooms were spacious and clean. We stayed on the 10th floor of the tower and had a partial ocean view - very nice to sit on the balcony and read every morning. Being right there in the city was both good and bad. You had every convenience you needed (Walgreen's, Starbucks, etc.) as well as many, many Puerto Rican restaurants. After a few nights, however, it got old. The food is the same everywhere and most of it is VERY heavy (plantains, rice, beans, mufongo). Honestly, there wasn't a night that we all loved our meals. I didn't see a vegetable for days!! We're pretty healthy eaters so it started to get to us. The best meal of the day was the breakfast buffet at the hotel! Overall, I would recommend this hotel but just realize you ARE in the city when you go out the front door - interesting at first, but just kind of dirty and old after a while. Old San Juan is a little nicer and worth going to both during the day and at night. It's a $15 cab ride. Not sure I'd hurry back to Puerto Rico but if I did I would try another area of the island that is more remote. Overall a great vacation - 5 nights was plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Pure relaxation at the Mariott!”
Reviews.Author: callieq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (early 30â€™s) arrived from Boston to San Juan (Marriott Stellaris) in the early, early morning -4 a.m. Our room was ready upon arrival, but I canâ€™t say the same for many people who we saw throughout the week. The check in line was always bustling during the day and people were talking about how their rooms were not ready. Ready or not, it seemed that the Marriott reimbursed (casino coupon, drink couponâ€¦etc.) those people in some sort of fashion for their room not being ready. It really depends on how one feels about his/her room not being ready upon check in. We received a room on the 9th floor overlooking the front of the hotel. At first we were a little bummed about not receiving an ocean view, but I really enjoyed our room, and would definitely request it again. Even though the view was the street, you could see the vegetation and mountains in the background. Our balcony was also double the size of the ocean view ones. It was also very quiet, but I am not sure about the sounds over by the ocean/pool area. The room was tastefully decorated, many yellow hues in the curtains, rug and bed spread. There was a King bed, small upholstered chair, large desk, bed stands, dresser/refrigerator, flat screen television, safe, marble countertop bathroom, waffle shower curtain, tub/shower- rain like stream and bath amenities (shampoo, condition, hand lotion, hair dryerâ€¦etc.) The pool area was very large. There were two pools, one quite shallow and the other around 4 feet perhaps which led into a pool bar. There was also a waterslide and a couple of waterfalls. The pool area was very, very busy due to the school vacation week. You definitely had to seek out your pool side chairs bright and early. I used the fitness center also during the week, which was well equipped! The beach was my favorite part. The waves were rough and furious, but it was so much fun to play in. I would advise beginning swimmers to be quite cautious. You do receive chairs and umbrellas upon request. I would question the umbrellas though. One day we were charged $12.00 for one and the next, nothing? We did tip the beach employees very well, due to their hard work and boy it was hot. So hot, that people were running on the steaminâ€™ sand when they headed to and from the beach. Again, if you want a prime front and center spot, definitely seek one out early. There are employees taking drink orders, but in my opinion the beach was understaffed. I also think that there should be a more organized system for taking drink orders. Perhaps a flag on the back of your chair that you could raise so that the employee knows youâ€™d like to order something. I know that I wouldâ€™ve ordered more if there were more employees available and it didnâ€™t seem forever to get a drink/ food. This was a different story at the pool area. It seems more staffed and I was asked each day if I needed something. Food: We ordered room service once and ate lunch pool side a couple of times. The food is decent for what you are ordering â€¦ chicken fingers, fries, sandwichesâ€¦ etc. Pure salty beach food! As far as the restaurants on site, we were hinted by many to try elsewhere. We did try a couple of the walk able restaurants on Ashford Ave. Miro, which is right across the street from the Marriott was really good. It has mixed reviews, but we enjoyed it. Tijuanaâ€™s â€“ Mexican, which is to the left when you walk out of the Marriott. We really loved this low key place. The food was good and we enjoyed the margaritas. We did try Lucky Star for a quick lunch, but I would prefer elsewhere next time. We also heard that the pizza place next to Tijuanaâ€™s was a good pick too! Area: We took a couple of walks in the morning. My favorite was around the lagoon. To do this, walk right out of the Marriott, left at Walgreens (1 block away) and before you hit the express way turn right (itâ€™s after a school). Head up and round the lagoon and then hook right back to the hotel along the ocean on Ashford. If you want, you can even walk into Old San Juan, which we did one morning- of course getting a coffee and mallorca at La Bombonera along the way. In Old San Juan, we walked El Morro, which was free due to history week and then jumped on the boat to Cantano and headed to Bacardi for the rum tour. Once back, we caught a cab back to the Marriott. Tours: Funny storyâ€¦ we did have the Bio Bay tour booked, which we booked through the Marriott concierge upon our arrival. When the day came to head out via car rental to El Yunque , Farjado and Luquillo, we decided to turn in our bio bay tour for pure relaxation. The concierge couldnâ€™t believe it when we went to tell them that we didnâ€™t want a refund, but we wanted to release the spot for anyone who wanted it. The concierge was also shocked when we wanted to turn in the tour since all tours for the week were booked solid. We ended up getting our money back, which was great, because the concierge sold it to someone else within a couple of hours. The funny part is that when we decided to play our luck in the casino that night, my husband won $1000.00. So in the end, we gave up the beautiful forest, beach and bio bay for a little pocket change. Overall impression: The Marriott is a great hotel in a stellar location. If you want to head to Isle Verde or Old San Juan, you are smack in the middle. You can walk down Ashford Drive which holds tons of shops, boutiques and restaurants. The staff at the Marriott was very kind and helpful. San Juan is a great getaway for anyone seeking history, beach, fun and exploration. We already have our next tripped booked and we hope you enjoy yours!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea3011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for around 2 nights. The hotel is not as new as I thought it would be. Decor inside and outside hotel is a bit drab. I had a balcony room overlooking the beach. Very nice views. Very helpful hotel - reception were exceptionally helpful especially Jonathan who helped me with a telephone problem I had. Hotel suffices for a couple of days or pre-/post-cruise. Balcony was not clean. Toothpick of previous room occupiers still on table. Room needs a good lick of paint and some good maintenance. Overall, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: lizzysher
Reviews.Content: I went with my 3 older kids. The beach was amazing! The water is a little rough but we love to play and dive into the waves. The beach is probably not safe for small toddlers who can't swim. The pool is great for little kids because it is shallow. The overall feel of the resort is clean and friendly. The ocean view room was amazing. I was able to get up before my kids and sit on the balcony and read while everyone slept. . My only complaint is the double sized beds. If you are used to sleeping in a queen or king, it's an adjustment. The rooms are just standard smallish hotel rooms- nothing special. The bedding was the nice down comforters but the pillows were saggy and cheap. I would still stay here again because of convenience to beach and overall experience. was truly great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: rwethereyet60
Reviews.Content: All in all, this is a nice hotel with good amenities. It will not knock your socks off. It is set right on the beach with a great staff at the ready to set up chairs, umbrellas and bring you a beverage. What more could you ask for? The pool appeals to the kids with fountains and a big slide in the middle. The restaurants are your usual hotel fare but the Marriott is located within walking distance of lots restaurants and shops. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My only real complaint was the room. It was spacious and clean but damp! No matter if we ran the AC or opened the balcony door nothing dried unless we hung it outside. The hotel is planning a much needed update to the lobby in June 2011. The project is expected to be completed in September 2011. According to the pictures and designs posted in the lobby, it should be really fabulous when it is done.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beach and pool”
Reviews.Author: arbin
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a very good quality hotel in a fantastic location...this is the place to go. We rented a car and the hotel location was close to Old San Juan, airport and main highways. The room we had was an ocean view on the 16th floor, quiet and a great view. We arrived at 11am, and was pleasantly surprised that our room was ready and check in early. The room was good size, and clean and maid service superb. The elevators ran quickly and often, never had to wait more that several seconds. The food was good, and not too expensive, although we only ate in the at the hotel 2 times....we enjoyed the local fare. During our stay we racked up over 450 miles on the rental. Visited Vieques (2 boat dives), visited family in San Germaine, El Yunkque rain forest, El Morro, and San CristÃ³bal forts. Old San Juan, and zip line. We worked hard at having fun, and this hotel was a good home base for our vacation....

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Old-Line Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wslawrence
Reviews.Content: This is the classic hotel from a few decades ago. Sweeping front circular drive to a tall imposing hotel. Inside is a traveler's bar, made for a quick drink with friends. To the right is the casino, just as in every other large hotel in San Juan. This casino is fairly large and could easily accomodate hundreds of gamblers with almost every game available. Check in was easy and pleasant, leading to a couple of keys and some free play chits for the casino. The room had obviously been completely redone, and very well at that. It had the feel of an old-line hotel with heavy furniture, large proportions, and a lot of care for details. The shower was large with marble walls and an impressive shower head. The granite was beautiful, the fixtures were very nice. The bathroom was large. The bedroom was very nice also with an HD flat-screen TV, very nice duvet and 8 assorted pillows on the bed. Opening a very well-insulated door led to a balcony overlooking the pool area (I know other balconies might have overlooked the ocean or the front of the hotel). The air conditioning system worked flawlessly. Breakfast in the dining area allowed seating either inside or outside in the breeze. The breakfast was served hot, fast, and was excellent. The hotel is right on the beach, one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. What's not to like? This hotel was like a step back in time, only with the best in technology taken back with you. Go ... and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected!”
Reviews.Author: calentada
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived the service was wonderful. We were very well treated the entire trip and nothing was left out. The room over looked the beautiful ocean with a balcony for us to sit and soak in the ocean air every morning and night. It was very clean and well serviced daily with all the ammenities needed for a most relaxing stay. Gift shops, Starbucks, restaurants, bar & lounge and a casino just in case we wanted to stay in for the evening! Close to Old San Juan for sight seeing and some of the most amazing shopping and also great shopping within walking distance! Great little restaurants close by and if you just want to stay in the room service is wonderful as well! I took my 20 year old daughter for her birthday and we had a blast! Good job Marriott!!!

Reviews.Title: “a little pricey with cranky staff”
Reviews.Author: sklnurse2
Reviews.Content: Wanting to garner Marriott reward points led us to stay a day here at the beginning and end of our cruise. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a hostess offering a free alcoholic fruity drink (non alcoholic for our teenager). Yummy. There was a problem with our room- even tho we booked for 3 people, they gave us a room with one king bed. The alternative was an ocean front room with a balcony- very nice! Until they hassled us by calling, leaving voice mail, AND leaving a note under the door that we were to contact the front desk IMMEDIATELY! Hey, we were out having dinner and exploring the neighborhood. When they finally called and reached us, it was confrontational- stating how they had been trying to get ahold of us, etc.,demanding to know what rate our reservation was, and they told us "there were 2 guests with the same name." Someone on their end must have screwed up. At least they let us stay in the room.... We had breakfast at Starbucks right across the street in the morning. Our return stay was in a room facing the street, but we didn't mind. It was a problem getting there so early- right off the ship- and our room wasn't ready until 4 pm(and the snarky front desk staff told us they were going to be very busy, so don't come back to check on our room!) We couldn't get room credit without a room to charge it to, so we walked down the street to the Walgreens and used the ATM for more cash, cold water, snacks, etc. We ate at their outside restaraunt both times and loved the food. We wanted to try the casino, but they have a "no shorts" policy in the hotel after 7pm, and we didn't feel like getting dressed up just to go down there and play some slot machines..... Next time? Unless I have points, I will try someplace new......

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: wanderingchick2011
Reviews.Content: From talking to the locals, the Condando area is the place to be. It does feel like South Beach, but, a little more low key. Lots of restaurants, a few open 24/7. We ate at the Latin Club many a night after partying to the wee hours of the morning. The beach and pool area are gorgeous. We paid the upgrage to stay in an Ocean view room and it was worth it. We left our slider door open and listenend to the ocean every night. We had the best bartender, Suki, ever. She was always eager to tell us the "places to go" and every night would check in and see how our day was. Drinks and food are pricey, but, there is happy hour from 4-6 pm and both pool bars, then drink specials after that in the lobby bar. Thurs nite is ladies night, $2 well drinks from 8-11pm, awesome deal. The service was excellent in the pool area, someone was always walking around to take drink or food orders. Walgreens is a block away, so we stocked up on bottled water, and other drinks and snacks for the beach. If you can pack a soft cooler to keep these items cool at the beach, otherwise we bought one at Walgreens for $7 and it was well worth it. There is a fridge in the room as well. Wifi is not included. It is almost $10 a day per wireless device. But, Starbucks is literally across the street and Dunkin Donuts is about 2 blocks away, so you can access their free WiFi. The service was great. Havier the bell man was sweet. We booked 3 tours from Ms. Fergueson in the lobby. It was convient (as we were picked up there) and she was very helpful. Maid service was awesome. There were activities plannend at the pool, or at least listed on the board, but, I never saw them happen, except the water slide (I think I went down it 50 times) and beach volleyball. The last day our flight didn't leave till 5pm and we were allowed to shower in the spa area, which was a nice ammenity. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. Great beach and pool, great location and only 75 cent bus ride (with exact change) to OSJ (Old San Juan).

Reviews.Title: “A mixed review”
Reviews.Author: DaveDutton
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Marriott with a family group of nine; ages 5 to 60. The Candado area provided a nice choice of nearby restaurants and felt safe. Our breakfasts were included in our package. The casino as well as a Hertz rental are on site; all these conveniences are a plus. The pool is great for kids with a water slide; but the beach was too rough for any swimming. The hotel has been updating their lobby and restaurants, but needs to take a serious look at their rooms. Our corner ocean view room was large and had ample deck area. The beds were comfortable, but the carpeting in the room was old, patched and dingy.. A lot of island resorts disdain carpeting. If the Marriott wants to be a 4 or 5 star hotel they need to update their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing location”
Reviews.Author: 17_Rob_E
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 very relaxing days at the San Juan Marriott. The Condado location is great, right in the middle of a mixed residential & commercial neighborhood where you can walk to everything including great restaurants. There is a 24-hour Walgreens right across the street which really came in handy. This was a good home base for our trips to El Yunque and the Fajardo area. The entire hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The facilities are well maintained. The room was a little small but comfortable and we had a nice ocean view. Be aware that the lobby is a hot spot with loud music and dancing most evenings. However the hotel must have pretty thick walls because our room itself was pretty quiet. Overall we had a great time and recommend the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely LOVED the Marriott! Best Vacation EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Carriec40
Reviews.Content: As a birthday get-away, my husband and I spent 4 nights at the Marriott in San Juan. From the start, this hotel exceeded all of our expectations. We got to the hotel early, noonish, our room was not ready. They gave us a beeper, checked our bags, and gave us a complimentary drink as we sat on the beach and relaxed until our room was ready. Our room once we checked in was BEAUTIFUL! I would recommend requesting the smaller Marriott building - not the high rise - we had a partial ocean view on the 2nd floor right off the lobby overlooking the pool. We were right in the mix of things! I did not find it loud and loved how close we were to the lobby, pool, beach, gym ,etc. The room was clean, bright and sunny and our balcony was really nice. From the first night on, we had exceptionally friendly staff who accomodated everything! On the first morning, we asked at teh breakfast buffet if they had any newspapers laying around - the waiter searched around and even went to the lobby to find us one!! I highly recommend the breakfast buffet for 11.95 every morning - absolutely delicious and filling. We also got excellent recommendations from the concierge on dinner and for my birthday, the concierge made us a reservation at PAMELAS - which was a cab ride but an ABSOLUTELY delicious restaurant right on the beach. She made our reservation at 645 p.m. so we could capture a perfect sunset. The gym at the hotel was awesome as well. Open 24 hours, there were plenty of towels, tvs on all the machines, yoga overlooking the beach, and even scented cold towels for after your workout. There was complimentary water, towels, and nice private showers for after the work out. VERY Friendly staff and not too busy. The beach was lovely - the guys who worked there put the loungers out where you wanted them and I did not think the water was that rough. I loved the landscape - the urban feel of this hotel. We walked through Condado and up towards old San Juan in the mornings - and it just was really neat to walk through this interesting area of San Juan. Lastly, the bed was SO comfortable!!! Unbelievably comfortable!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Sue1296
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a beautiful beach with a spectacular view of the Atlantic Ocean and the pool area. Off street parking is available in the garage for guests staying in the hotel on a per day baisis. One right turn from the hotel drive way and you can go straight to Old San Juan. We ate lunch/dinner on our first day in Puerto Rico and the food and service were good. The last day we were at the hotel we had the breakfast buffet. There was something for everyone whether you wanted a light breakfast or a healthy breakfast there was plenty to pick from. The hotel helped us with directions and travel to event for day trips. We arranged for some of the day trips in the hotel lobby and transportation was provided. (Like snorkeling on a sail boat for the day). A trip worth taking. Very convenient. Location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: italyrs
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks exactly like the photo's on their website, which was a huge relief upon arrival. The beach was very clean and comfortable with complementary chairs and umbrella's. Great food and services everywhere you go. The poolbar and breakfast buffet were amazing as well. Overall, I really enjoyed this hotel "resort". Across the street there is an excellent restaurant for tappas and for those of you not on a budget I would also reccommend the restaurant Perla a few hotels down. They have an excellent surf and turf. Cons: the lobby can get a bit loud, which was not an issue for us on the 8th floor but I could see how light sleepers and people on lower floors would complain. Dining in the hotel can be pricey. Especially the breakfast buffet, its about $30 a person if you dont buy ahead. Other than that, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Puerto Rico Stay”
Reviews.Author: monkeytrip
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my first trip to Puerto Rico. Went with a girlfriend, but am a Mom of two. Went with this hotel based solely on the recommendations from Trip Advisor. Great recommendation. There were a few complaints on Trip Advisor about food price and shaded pool and they made me nervous. Was shocked that someone could find something to complain about. The pool area was gorgeous with plenty of sun and shade. Great for kids, but fine for adults too. Drinks were big, potent and in the $10-12 range, which seem right in line with most resorts, if not cheaper. Lunch was not expensive, either, and they have the best grilled veggie sandwich. Beach was beautiful and a few steps from the pool. Service was friendly and attentive. Hotel lobby is not the swankiest in the area, but very nice with good live music. Location was perfect. Right near great shops (with Starbucks across the street) and restuarants, but a quick cab to either Isla Verde for nightlife and Old San Juan. Rooms were clean and comfortable with great balconies and comfy beds. Could see returning with my friend or bringing the whole family. Accommodated both. Breakfast was included in our package and buffet would have been a tad expensive if we had purchased it seperately, but buffet was great. Not phenomenal food, but very good with a huge selection of fruit and breakfast goods. Really nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service”
Reviews.Author: beachgal04
Reviews.Content: Just got back & miss the beautiful weather already! Had a a great stay thanks to Carlos Ramos-he works in concierge/operator dept. We had booked a last minute trip and were researching restaurants and activities online in the business center when we stumbled upon him. He gave us some great info and the next morning left us a detailed packet with maps and guidebooks with pages marked up. He even gave us a typed out letter with directions to the rain forest & specific restaurants along the way. He was great! Anytime we had a question we just asked Carlos. He even brought us cheese flan on our last day. The hotel was big and clean and I liked the pool area. The rooms were spacious enough and clean. We booked on priceline for an ocean view and so that was what I got. It's also a good central location. We took the bus into old San juan (75cents but ony runs every 1/2 hour) and rented a car to the rain forest & fajardo which is on the northeast part of the island. I highly recommend & asking for Carlos to help you!

Reviews.Title: “absolute pleasure”
Reviews.Author: sunfun2011
Reviews.Content: We had the breakfast included with our rate, and how delightful to consume every morning ! Only one day out of 5 days not up to par - but still delicious. Other restaurants in the hotel were welcoming and although we only had dinner at one - it was superb - prices appropriate. The layout of the hotel was perfect with the pools, outside bar areas and leading out to the magnificant beach - towels, chaise lounges, umbrellas plentiful - everyone very helpful and courteous. Outside bar would only let you charge to room which was not what I wanted but worked out - rooms gorgeous with the balcony - pay for the extra- so nice in the morning with coffee or wine at night!! Would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Over crowded, Overwhelmed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle2013
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after our cruise. Although this hotel has many positive features, I do not recommend it. The positives are a good location to the airport, the cruise ports, and many restaurants in Condado. The rooms are nice and the pool and beach are nice. The negatives of this hotel, for me and my family, over shadow the positives. The check-in both times we stayed here was a disaster. There were long lines of people and everyone had their luggage stored with the bell captain. It didn't matter if you arrived morning or afternoon, the reception was mobbed all day. The rooms were not ready on time. We did not get rooms we wanted but we took them for fear of not getting a room. I cannot overstate the problems at the reception desk. When we got the rooms, they were still dirty. The cleaning people couldnt turn the rooms around fast enough for the guests, and the rooms were not cleaned properly. The pool is nice, but way over crowded. It is not a big enough pool or pool area for the number of guests. Similarly the beach is nice but over crowded with guests. The lobby is loud and unappealing. The music drifts up to the hotel rooms late at night. We stayed in two different areas of the hotel and on two different floors. It was noisy in both rooms. The hotel restaurant is expensive and not good. Eat at any of the near by restaurants. Given that we were only staying for a night or two before and after the cruise, the reception problems made this hotel too inconvenient for a short stay. If we wanted to stay longer, I would be even less inclined to stay here since it was so noisy at night and so overcrowded during the day at the pool and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay before/after a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Suenos1
Reviews.Content: Good: - free Internet - perfect, central beach location with a lot of restaurants nearby - nice pool and beach, free sunbeds Bad: - quiet old room, smelled old too - expensive breakfast buffet (24,-) which is just standard and not enough for 4 stars - maid wakes you up between 8:30-8:45 even on Check Out day (Check Out is at 11am), so better use the Do-Not-Disturb sign If you book a normal Marriot rate, I think it is not worth the money - we had a Expedia special (3 for 2) which was reasonable. I would go there again before or after a criuse for one or eo nights, but not longer. In November I will go for 5 nights to San Juan and booked the Coral Tree Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brandon1523
Reviews.Content: I decided to surprise my fiancÃ© with a trip to Puerto Rico for her birthday because that's where she was born and it turned out to be simply AMAZING! This hotels location was minutes away from everything! Shopping center was a 5 minute drive Old San Juan was about 10 minutes away and food was always walking distance. We had a rental car and we did pay for the vallet service which was $20 a day but was well worth it, they got the car, parked the car, took care of our luggage and they didn't expect a tip! We did tip by the way! Also the hotel was like a night club every night if you like live bands and great drinks then the bar is the place to be! The pool area was a bit crowded but hotel is right on the beach so went there instead and at night used the pool and jacuzzi which was great idea! The only bad thing we seen about the hotel is the big shadow the hotel cast on the beach so if u would like to tan your gonna have to take a walk down the beach a bit or get in the slits or the hotels! Now to the hotel itself room was very clean and room services was very good at this Marriott! They never needed to be called and they also seem to never bother us when in the room. Hotel balcony was decent not great but from weather over time what do u expect! Food her was great but the food court at Mall of America was second to none! Hotel over all got a 10-10 from me! I'm not picky but I am a traveler and I know a good hotel when I see one.... This was a great hotel and we absolutely will stay here again! Brandon From Rochester NY

Reviews.Title: “Easy & Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: jullesbeara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for 2 nights - February 25th & 26th, prior to a 7 night cruise. Evening check-in on Friday, 2/25 was good.
