We had 2 separate reservations thru Priceline.com which the clerk combined with a little effort so we didn't need to change rooms on the 2nd night. We also received a free upgrade to a Cabana Room facing the pool and ocean. We had a a late dinner in one of the hotel restaurants after getting settled into the room. The Paella we ordered was fresh made and delicious. Settled into bed after dinner in our very comfortable king size bed. After room service waffles late morning we walked 1 block to the Walgreens to pick up a few last minute items. I had heard it was nearby and it worked out great. We spent the afternoon lounging on our balcony enjoying the view waiting for our friends to arrive. Late afternoon we grabbed sandwiches from Starbucks across the street and headed out on a tour to the bioluminescent bay on the other side of the island. The ride to the bio bay was about 1 1/2 hours. It was an amazing once in the life time event. The lights created by touching & moving the water we unreal. Upon return we showered quickly and walk out of the hotel to left and down one block. Ate at the outdoor restaurant on the corner whle sitting in a rocking style bench table set-up. The drinks & authentic Puerto Rican food were excellent. Back to another restful night at the hotel. We grabbed quick breakfast at Starbucks on Sunday morning and used express check out. We will definitely stay at the Marriott the next time we visit Puerto Rico. The area was very safe with shopping, dining & entertainment nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location excellent service. We would come here again.”
Reviews.Author: Vacationlover1449
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day winter thaw out from the cold Chicago winter. The location was perfect for a family with young children. Ice cream shops, retail shopping and pizzerias were within walking distance. The pool is a bit chilly and shaded by trees and the building and relativley shallow with a water slide. While we were there the hot tub was VERY hot, almost scorching. Although the ocean was beautiful and the beach was clean the water was extremely rough with strong rip currents. Making this mom a bit nervous at times. The cabana service was great and attentive. House keeping was terrific. Internet was slow in the AM, if you could get on at all. Consierge was very helpful with setting up external activities. Breakfast in the Hotel was great! Something for everyone. $15.00 taxi ride to Old San Juan. Although there were a few negatives, I feel the positives were what put of over the top on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness and Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Guinness5294
Reviews.Content: Susana Miller was our housekeeper and her daily attention to detail and thorough cleaning was greatly appreciated. She is enthusiastic, happy and obviously cares about her quality of work. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: dkw197
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 6-day stay and had a terrific time at the Marriott resort in San Juan. We had some reservations about staying at the here based on some of the reviews we read, but didn't find many of the problems that some others encountered. We tried to check in when we arrived at 2pm, but our room wasn't ready so we just relaxed, ate lunch, and looked around. We were able to check in a 4pm, but didn't get the high room that we requested and were placed in an oceanfront front (we upgraded) on the 5th floor of the Tower and were told that that was all there was. The tax rate and resort fee added almost 25% to our bill--so take that into account. The room was nothing really special, but it was nice and comfortable. It was very clean and had plenty of towels, refridgerator, hair dryer, robes to use while there, and they left two bottles of water everyday. The entire staff at the Marriott was extremely friendly and very helpful. The casino was also nice however I agree with some of the other write ups about not getting drinks while you gambled. Someone at one of the gaming tables got so frustrated by it that they finally called the Pit Boss over and asked him to get a waitress to come by the table. It was a constant struggle every night we were there. The most wonderful thing about the hotel was the close location to local restaurants and because it is somewhat residential, it is also a safe walking street at night. There was a police presence everywhere. We highly recommend Yuba Buena up the street for authentic Puerto Rican food at a decent price. Via Appia, also close, was excellent as well. We were glad that someone mentioned the little grocery store up the street to get drinks and snacks because we did just that. Drinks are very high at the hotel ($8 and up) so it was nice to have something to keep in our room. The hotel lobby turns into a night club on Wednesdays through Sundays when the hotel brings in local bands and has dancing. The bands were really great and we enjoyed just sitting there listening to them and watching everyone Salsa--one night we even gave it a go. Lots of locals came in to dance so it was very fun to be a part of that. I'd recommend trying to get a higher room than we were on, because you can sometimes hear the music late at night. We ate at the hotel Italian restaurant and our food and service was excellent. The breakfast buffet is quite expensive, but we made it brunch and didn't eat lunch when we ate there. It was really delicious and had everything you could possibly want to eat. Our waiters there were very friendly and attentive. The outdoor bar and eating area was convenient, but the food was not very good and was also expensive. If you go to the beach area and want chairs and umbrellas, there are very friendly staff there to help set up everything where ever you want. They do expect a tip however, but it was worth it. Even though the beach was red flagged everyday there were still people swimming. The pools were quite nice but crowded so we never went there. There were lots of activities for kids and adults posted on a sign everyday--everything from learning to Salsa to kids crafts. There is a tour desk in the lobby that can arrange any tours you want. Many people suggested that you could see old San Juan in half a day and honestly I don't see how that is possible--there is just too many things--shops, forts and historic sites. It's quite a hike around so wear comfortable shoes. I encourage everyone to visit the old forts. You can buy a ticket to see both forts at a discount or just to see one. Don't miss the free movie that both forts have. I'd recommend you see the movie before you look around the forts because it really helped us understand more about what we were seeing. The movie is the same at each fort, so you only have to see it once. We always took the bus that picked us up a block from the hotel (75 cents per person and must be exact change) rather than spend the $14 for a cab ride. It's a little tricky figuring out the transportation system, but once we did it was great--as long as you are not in a hurry. Briefly, the bus B21 will take to Old San Juan and you have the option of walking from the drop off spot or picking up a trolley. I would recommend getting both a bus and a trolley map from the hotel before going to Old San Juan because they all go on certain routes depending on the bus and the color trolley. When you are ready to return to your hotel, you need to go to the bus station (close to the pier) and once inside locate the bus number you want from the hanging signs. The signs list the places the bus goes to like Condado, Isle Verdi, etc. and you have to wait on the benches until yours arrives. We waited anywhere from an hour to 10 minutes although the buses are supposed to leave every 30 minutes. If you can't wait, taxis are everywhere. Overall we were impressed by the friendliness of the local people we met--everyone smiled at you and said hello wherever we went. We had a fabulous time and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: DAC
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 6 nights with my wife, two children and their grandparents. We booked way in advance and selected the Marriott from reputation, past experience and trip advisor reviews. We needed this headache free as my parents were coming and this was a trip after a serious family illness. The Marriott let us down: Upon check in we did not get adjoining rooms as requested. We where told they overbooked and some people would not even have rooms on March 17,2011. He then told us a manager would call us about changing rooms but that never happened. All this was crucial so I could help made dad with my mom and her wheelchair but they did not care. We ended up 4 floors apart! Next upon check in our patio door would not latch, the room was dirty in the bathroom which had hair on the floor and walls. They did come fix these items but it still started us out poorly. Rooms: ok but older and not worth $350 a night. Service: people are friendly all over except restaurants. Restaurants: over priced and poor quality. At least the breakfast buffet and pool food. They really need to improve so you can enjoy your day at the beach. Pool: nice Beach: clean and plenty of chairs. Enjoyed this a lot. Casino: small but nice. Friendly people. Overall there are better places due to our experience! I understand this is not a jW Marriott but I still expect much more than received.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a view”
Reviews.Author: captainmcd
Reviews.Content: We booked with priceline for 5 stars and got a cabana king room overlooking the pool and beach for$ 165 plus tax. We came early after a cruise and got into our room at at 10 am. It was clean and spacious with a small sofabed. It was twice the room at half the price of La Concha Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend the Marriott if you are considering a visit to San Juan. THE place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SusanV007
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Marriott for spring break. Absolutely loved it! I read through many reviews and talked to friends who had also visited the area and I agree this is the best place to stay. We had breakfast at the hotel every day and it was well worth it. For dinner, there are some great restaurants in the resort area, just more pricy than Old San Juan but you dont have to spend money on taxi to get there. If you are looking for more to do before or after dinner then I would recommend going into Old San Juan. 4 nights was perfect for a relaxing beach getaway. I do hope to plan another trip to the area and spend more time. I will definitely be staying at the Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: NYCRonnie
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casiono Hotel for an extended weekend. We had a wonderful time. The hotel is immaculate and the service is excellent. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The beach and pool are great. The hotel offers activities for all guests. I really enjoyed playing bingo for drink vouchers, it made playing quite interesting and afforded you to meet other guests. The live performances on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday were great. I found the food and the gift shop prices to be quite reasonable. The best part of staying at this hotel is the close proximity to restaurants and public transportation. You do not need a tour guide you can explore on your own. Overall I really enjoyed my stay here and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We were very impressed and pleased with our experience.”
Reviews.Author: nchamps
Reviews.Content: Just returned from five nights at the San Juan Marriott and Stellaris Casino. Overall we were very impressed and pleased with this property. The location in Condado is ideal with numerous great restaurants and boutique shops all within walking distance. The facilities at the Marriott were clean and well maintained. The service was impressive. Everyone we talked to was helpful and friendly from the representative at the check in desk to the valet parking and the bellhops. Our room in the cabana wing on the seventh floor was ideal. It was clean and had a great balcony with a view over the pool directly toward the beach. The beach area at this hotel is the best of all the hotels in Condado. The pool area is beautiful with lush tropical landscaping and plenty of seating. The water was a bit cold but it did not stop most people from swimming. We ate lunch at the La Vista restaurant one day because it was convenient to the beach and had good food at a reasonable price for a hotel restaurant. Most of the time however we ate at the restaurants on Asheford Avenue which is a lively street with a broad selection of good restaurants. On Friday night, in the hotel lobby bar, they had a live samba band playing. There was a dance floor and a big turnout including not only hotel guests but a number of locals as well. I had booked this reservation through Priceline and won the bid at less than two thirds the rack rate. (There are only a couple of four star resorts on Condado beach so my odds of getting this property were good.) When I got there they had no problems with the reservation and even negotiated an upgrade to the beachfront Cabana wing for a few dollars more. The whole experience was excellent. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for great location, comfort, convenience and first rate service.

Reviews.Title: “A standout employee at the Marriott Stellar”
Reviews.Author: Kari08
Reviews.Content: We booked our 4 night stay through Expedia. Buy 3 nights get one free, breakfast and resort fee included. It is between DT San Juan and 10 minutes from the airport. The Condado Beach area has many great places to eat within walking distance and the hotel has an amazing restaurant called Tuscany. We walked down to the little market and bought rum and beer for our stay. Included in our package was breakfast, lounge chairs, an umbrella, internet and an ocean front room with a patio, a fridge, safe and coffee pot. They have plenty of chairs on the beach and so in the morning we never had to rush out to save one. Breakfast was offered from 7-11 am, so we never had to rush down to eat. Everything was very relaxing. The pools were a nice option, but the did fill up fast. We checked out of the Marriott to attend the business portion of our trip at a different hotel about 45 minutes away. We later realized we had left our car key in our room safe. We called the Marriott and Miguel from Lost and Found called us right back. Miguel had found it. He offered to personally deliver the keys to us because he was going to be in the area the next day. We couldn't believe it. Sure enough the very next day - Miguel called to say he was on his way. Miguel did not expect anything for his good deed and was just happy to help out. The Marriott is very fortunate to have such a topnotch, standout person on their staff. Thanks again Miguel and the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel and service with an attitude - not rushing back.”
Reviews.Author: tomsophie
Reviews.Content: After all the great reviews for this hotel, I was really surprised/disappointed with my recent stay at this Marriott. To start, the pool area and hotel in general do not look like they do in the pictures - the pool area was especially disappointing. The only part of the hotel that I thought lived up to the standards I was expecting from reviews/photos was the actual room we stayed in, which admittedly was very nice/clean. The beach was also fine, you can't really go wrong with a beach since all they had to do is set up the chairs/umbrella. I wasn't sure which I was more disappointed with - the overpriced for what it was food (which was blah) or the service and attitude of the staff. Food - the only lunch options is the grill outside, or the $25 buffet indoors (you can also order off the menu). The grill outside has a very limited menu, and I don't think you could get any wrap or sandwich for less than $12. We ate there the day we arrived and never went back. The morning buffet was not included in our room, and this also we found to be very overpriced. It was $12.00 for the buffet, not including coffee or OJ. If you wanted coffee or juice, the price went up to $17 dollars, and if you wanted an omelette the price went up to $19. While I understand the difference between a breakfast with eggs, I've never heard of a breakfast buffet that didn't include coffee and juice. That being said, we ordered omeletes off the menu for 11.95 which were fine, but again we decided to not go back after that. Service - this was some of the rudest service I've experienced in a long time. Every person at the hotel acted like you were really putting them out if you asked a simple question. The concierge was especially unhelpful when we asked for dinner recommendations and seemed annoyed that we would even be asking. On top of that, the only help she gave us for restaurants was a map they have of the restaurants immediately surrounding the hotel - this list included Chili's - not really a restaurant I plan to go to while on vacation. She didn't even mention Old San Juan, where a lot of the best restaurants are located. Good thing we had done our own research on dining before. The service at the beach was rude for the most part as well. The first day we got there and asked for an umbrella, they told it would be $12. I'm not sure where they came up with this fee, since umbrellas are included in the price of your room (we checked our packet we had gotten when we checked in). After pointing this out to them, they then set up our umbrella at no cost. I'm not sure if this is just a way they try to rip-off hotel guests who don't realize it's included. Again, they seemed very annoyed that we would think of disturbing them to help set up our chairs. Overall I would not recommend this hotel. While the hotel room and location were nice, such bad service really made me think of this hotel very negatively.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: scanmike
Reviews.Content: Just got back today from a 4 night stay. Booked through Travelocity, so there were no hidden costs (11%, 12% hotel resort service charge that some mentioned). Initially, Travelocity screwed up and did not book the room for our first night of travel. We were arriving 4AM and wanted our room ready as it was 3 nights, 4th night free promotion.. They made good by booking another night just in case our room wasn't ready. When we arrived we were told that the reservation expired because they weren't aware we would be arriving late. I was pleasant and eventually after some power play on their part, they gave us our room early for no charge. The room was beautiful and very clean with an amazing ocean view and balcony, despite that we opted and paid for a partial ocean view. Really nice bathroom and beddings. We were on the top floor so we were in awe of the view. It's not an enormous hotel, but still very lovely pool area (with slide) and enough seating. They set us up on the beach with complimentary umbrellas and lounge chairs. The water was rough, but nothing we aren't used to on the east coast. Weather was a bit iffy in the early hours, but soon cleared to crystal clear, blue skies after that. No humidity, but warm...a welcome treat for us north easterners who suffered through this past winter. I didn't find the prices of drinks any more expensive than at other resorts in other places. Service was very good. Yes, the lobby does get loud at night, but nothing crazy. My husband loved the gym and sauna. I enjoyed reading on the beach. Two things that were free of service and we highly appreciate were the free use of computers for 1 hour daily and the ability to check in and print out boarding passes. We didn't try the food. Instead, we walked out to the right and had some really good sandwiches for lunch, which we brought back. About 2 blocks to the right when leaving the hotel is a small surfboard store/restaurant. Very good eggs benedict, french toast, sandwiches. I found all things take time in PR. So don't get antsy waiting for food. The staff here is so nice and accomodating. Try the humus wrap or chicken, bacon and avocado sandwich. There is also a Starbucks right across the street from the hotel. This was a great, safe area to stay in. Close to Old San Juan (we ate dinners here) with many stores nearby. You could walk...it's 3 miles, take a taxi or the very slow to come bus. No problem getting a bus going, but at the depot coming back, we waited over 1 hr one night. Old San Juan is a beautiful mix of culture, history and modern conveniences (restaurants and shops). We hadn't been to San Juan in 29 years and was very pleased to see it again in even better shape. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: momof3crazykids
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights prior to a cruise. I booked the hotel on priceline for and excellent price. The hotel is beautiful and grounds are really lovely. I appreciate that the lobby is air conditioned. The staff were friendly and the concierge is very helpful in deciding where to eat etc. The pool and beach are very nice! I would recommend a higher level floor especially on the weekends. Right in the lobby near the casino is quite a party place. They are certainly not rude or rowdy, but I can't imagine staying above this on the weekend. I would not hesitate to stay here again. We have also stayed at another very nice hotel around the corner and it really couldn't touch the Marriott. The service is excellent and they allowed us to check out a bit late. Take a cab to Old San Juan and eat some mofongo. It is yummy! Don't take the bus. You will waste over an hour. We tried that. Cab ride to the ship is about 15 minutes at most. If we stay in San Juan again prior to a cruise (hope we do!) we will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ssfg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after our cruise for 3 nights and we were so happy we chose this place! With 2 small children (6 and 3), this hotel has the best of both worlds. Not only does it have a great pool for little people but it also has a beautiful pool with a water slide for the older ones. The swim up bar gave the parents some place to sit for a bit as well. Then as if that was not enough, there is the beach too. We never had a problem finding chairs or umbrellas even though the hotel was very busy. The only downfall was the rooms are a bit smallish when you get the 2 queen room and the kids were not allowed in the hot tub (we have one at home so they were very disappointed that they were excluded from using it there). Service was excellent! Front desk could not help us enough to find restaurants, buses, information on our flights etc. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: jillpingacruz
Reviews.Content: We love staying at Marriott in San Juan Puerto Rico. Aside from the great views, wonderful places and yummy food, the service is superb. I have to specially mention our housekeeper MIGDALIA (who asked for this review :))... She was really friendly, gave in to all our requests plus the room was always clean!

Reviews.Title: “Ask about room location/Priceline”
Reviews.Author: double-d1225
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at this hotel. I received a good rate from Priceline and when checking in was asked to upgrade our room by the very courteous front desk person. I declined. Our room was on the 3rd floor, quite large, overlooking the pool and ocean. Who could ask for more? The only problem was Friday night and the band started playing right below our room. Next time I'll ask about the room location before declining an upgrade or room change. This is the first time I was not satisfied with a room purchased thru Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel, beautiful beach -- eat and drink somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: MassWalker
Reviews.Content: Great location. Outstanding beach -- beautiful and clean -- not hectored by people hawking junk. Plenty of restaurants etc on the street side. Our room was very nice -- paid 150./night on Priceline. Big room with two balconies -- not oceanside but could see ocean on side balcony (room 1023) because a corner room. Pools are shallow -- not great for swimming but good to hang out and read. Extras are expensive -- a couple mojitos (which were good!) by the water will run you $25 with tip. 2 small coffees and a pastry in the morning -- in the lobby -- $9. In-house Tuscany restaurant just OK -- and a glass of house wine is $12. You can avoid these expenses. Out and to the right is a Dunkin' Donuts for coffee and breakfast. Try Orozco's for dinner (also to right) -- feels very authentic (I had mofungo) and you can have dinner and enough sangria for 2 for $50. Out and to left you'll find Subway, BK, and a little market where you can buy beer and wine and put a lunch together for the beach (and stock your little fridge in the room). The hotel will supply a corkscrew. I bought a cheap styro cooler (in Old San Juan -- our first stop) and had it by the beach. If you do these things, you can get a premium experience for very reasonable $; if you stick to the hotel restaurants and drinks, it'll be expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service - no complaints here.”
Reviews.Author: hessismyname
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico as a destination is a perfect choice if you want to experience a warm, friendly, fun culture - and know/will take the time to learn a little Spanish. You do not have to be fluent, but learning phrases such as gracias, por favor, de nada, etc, you will show that you care and you are attempting to speak their language. The Marriott was a perfect choice for us. We loved the location, beach, the staff is very friendly - all in all a great stay. The drinks are on the expensive side - you are in a hotel in a city - this is normal. BYOB and store some in your mini-fridge to offset the cost. We spent time in San Juan, Old San Juan, El Yunque and snorkeling in Culebra - all wonderful experiences where we met friendly people and took in the beautiful site that is Puerto Rico. I fell in love with this island, and I hope to return again - I would recommend staying at the Marriott for sure.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sweetthang33
Reviews.Content: loved the hotel--traveled with our daughters 5 and 7---was perfect for the kiddie pool--huge with beautiful fountains within it...a waterslide for them (and us adults went too and had a blast)..plus there is the adult pool (swim up bar) :) and also a jacuzzi---the beach was gorgeous--perfect place to lay out and get the best tan--was tons of area to bring your sunchair and we ordered drinks/food on the beach ==jorge was our waiter so nice! it was a dream of a vay-kay! :) the rooms were gorgeous and everything was perfect and clean! would totally return--my daughters loved it there!! Make sure you go to Senor Frogs in San Juan for dinner--perfect for young kids too--they do all these balloon things and have music in the evening--we went on a wed. night and we couldn't believe how busy it was! :) oh and the beds at the hotel were awesome too! :) soooo comfy! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For Price Paid”
Reviews.Author: UIGrad02
Reviews.Content: I think that your satisfaction with a hotel will be greatly influenced by the price that is paid. I purchased my stay from a website at $160/night from an outside source. On the hotels website rooms were at $280/night. I thought the service was good for most things. I showed up at the hotel a half hour before check in and was promptly given a room. I worried that since the package was purchased at a discount this could be an issue. We stayed on the 12th floor so the lobby noise was not an issue. The room wasn't fantastic, but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. Staff greeted you 90% of the time you came in contact with them. The beech is nice and chairs were always available. The sun does set around 4:00 behind the buildings but this is true with all the hotels in the ares. The concierge Ruth did have a poor attitude and acted if she was being bothered when I was booking excursions. The bar also attempted to overcharge on drinks until I caught them on it and the bartender acted as if she was unaware of the correct prices. The location is really ideal with many dinning options in the area. Taxi's to OSJ run 15 dollars. If I had paid full price I would have been underwhelmed. For the price that I did pay it seemed to be a great value.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL!!! only hotel with an open room and it turned out to be perfect”
Reviews.Author: wetraveli10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a random choice but I could not be happier! The room was great! king size bed, pull out mini sofa, desk, tv, safe, and patio :) our view was impeccable! The sounds of the ocean put me to sleep every night. There was a casino downstairs and 3 different restaurants. The latin style one had a great server... I think by the name Maria. Well she was fashionable and very personable. The food was too great for words!! The pool has pool towels available and there is a ramp so you could just walk right into the pool. To top it off there was a pool side bar! You don't have to get out to get a drink..... I have always wanted to do that. Coming back to the hotel at night really made my trip. And on some nights there was some music and partying in the lobby but up on the 9th floor you can't hear any of it. Oh yeah there is a parking garage for parking, you can valet or self park but there is a charge for both.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: maggiemarlajack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the night before our cruise with RCCL. We were so surprised. I wish we could have stayed there all week. the room was large and spacious and modern and clean. the View of the ocean was outstanding. The pool was fun and the chairs were plentiful and they had great bar outside by the pool. I will definitely stay here again. A bit pricey but there are a ton of restaurants in walking distance that are all affordable. we always felt safe and never weary.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: SSaril
Reviews.Content: This winter has been crazy in N.Y., so I took my family to Puerto Rico. The hotel facilities and the service provided were really nice. We spend most of the time by the pool and the beach and even though the hotel was full, the waitress that took care of us, Mayra, was very friendly and professional. Everybody was very courteous. Also Luis D. from the pool was very funny and witty. I'm looking forward to come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Watch the rip tides on beach, pool and hot tub dangerously crowded”
Reviews.Author: Charmagne88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights, Feb 21 and 22. We were going to stay for 6 nights but after witnessing the rip current I wanted out. Plus the pool and hot tub were filled with whining kids and drunk adults. The breakfast buffet was good and reasonably priced. The coffee in the hotel lobby was EXCELLENT! The beds were comfortable. The room was extremely small. Bathroom nice. Easy taxi ride from airport. But we ended up renting a car from Avis down the street and switching hotels to the Gran Melia in Rio grande for better beach and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ,but watch the fees”
Reviews.Author: pickymom66
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel until we went to check out earlier today. As the reviews stated...It is clean, easy to navigate the pools and beach and there is easy access to restaurants and shopping. They do charge a resort fee that is a percentage of your room rate. You have to pay this even though I was told that I could decline it by the folks on the 800 number. The resort fee is an absolute scam because it is based on your room rate. They claim it is for the gym - no one EVER checks your id when you go there, 2 bottles of water in your room - how would I stop housekeeping from giving this to me and towels and umbrellas the beach. Again - no one ever checks whether you are staying there when you take towels. To charge one room over 40 dollars a day because they want an ocean view vs. someone with 4 -5 people in a room is nuts. If they want to charge this - then it should be stated at check in and it was not on the slip even though we checked in with the manager Sam. I tried to have this removed today and the front desk staff person wouldn't budge and to be honest most of the front desk staff is really unhelpful excpet for Polaris (sp??) Glenda and others at the concierge are actually rude and unhelpful when you ask simple questions about restaurants, The housekeeping, front door, beach staff, Vista staff are excellent, but the front desk - just really not nice. the experience with the fees will make me hesitant to recommend this place until they develop an open, honest policy.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: bostonjane0001999
Reviews.Content: Definitely stay somewhere else and you will get better service and better value. The staff just doesnt care.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pre and post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: MassIS300
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and after a cruise out of San Juan. Would definitely recommend this location. My kids, ages 7 and 10, loved the pool, hot tub, waterslide, and beach. Wife and I loved the swim-up pool bar. Drinks and food were a bit pricey, but there were plenty of restaurants right near by. Room was typical of what is to be expected, although our room after the cruise was very musty smelling. We didn't mind it as much because we left the balcony door open all day and night listening to the ocean. All in all - a very good spot.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: rickloum
Reviews.Content: great service at this hotel . at the pool area mayra the waitress took great care of us.she did everything to make us happy. good job from her

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Raybird99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights with our small children over Presidentâ€™s Day weekend. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and happily recommend the Marriott as a place to stay in San Juan. Check-in: Cab from airport was $15 for I think up to 6 passengers and $1 per bag. We arrived around 1 and check-in was easy for us, but we did have to wait until 4 to get our room. There is a sign by the check-in area indicating check-in time isnâ€™t until 4, which to me implies they generally donâ€™t make rooms available until close to that time. They held our luggage and we went out for a walk and to lunch, so worked out fine for us. Seems like there were certain times of the day, especially in the evening, when the check-in line got long. Room: We were in 837 in the shorter tower. The room was just fine and the balcony was great. We had a beautiful view of the ocean and pool area. Room was referred to as partial ocean view, only because the taller tower blocks part of your view to the right and there is a condominium complex that blocks part of your view to the left. But we were still able to see plenty of the beach and ocean. Definitely worth the $25 per night upgrade fee over the city view. Casino: Like others have said it gets crowded in the evening but is dead in the morning/afternoon. Had $5/$10 blackjack tables, $5 craps tables, and a gazillion slot machines. The big negative for me was my difficulty in getting a drink. After about 30 minutes of playing BJ and not getting a sniff of the cocktail waitress, I asked the dealer and then the pit boss if there was one making rounds. I was ignored by both. This boggles my mind as a couple of watered down gin & tonics would have satisfied me and kept me throwing my precious money away. Finally I flagged a waitress down and she retrieved me a drink quickly. But in 90 minutes I never saw one at my table. Location/Restaurants: Location was great. Starbucks across the street was surprisingly quiet. Walgreens doesnâ€™t sell beer but there is a mini-super market about three blocks to the east of the hotel that does. There is a Catholic Church two blocks away. There are numerous restaurants close by. The Argentinean steakhouse was pricey, food was ok, and nice outdoor eating area. Zuccheroâ€™s across the street had good pizza and nice atmosphere, though no outdoor eating area. Tijuanaâ€™s food was good but drinks were terrible and overpriced. I was charged $12 for a mojito/margarita mixed drink that I could barely finish. And service was painfully slow. If you eat there sit outside and order beers or something cheap. Beach/Pool: The beach was nice and the water was warmer than I expected. Felt at least 80 degrees. I actually enjoyed the shadows cast by the hotel tower onto the beach as I prefer to minimize my sun exposure and not die of skin cancer when Iâ€™m 55. Plenty of chairs and space. It seems like the beach is gradually eroding, which hasnâ€™t affected the Marriott beach much yet, but has had a significant impact on La Conchaâ€™s beach a few hundred yards to the west as well as beaches to the east. They take away all chairs by 6 pm or so and close the beach entrance shortly thereafter. I think this is more to keep the rift raft out than Marriott patrons in, as the beach is publically accessible. Waves are rough and only for those like myself who donâ€™t mind getting smacked around by the surf. Pool area was nice, though water seems colder than ocean. Pool and slide were great for young children and there were plenty of space and lounge chairs. Hotel Restaurants/Nightlife: Ate at Tuscany one night, which was quite good. Not cheap but not exorbitant. Dropped a C-note before tip on appetizer, bottle of merlot, and entrees of Lamb and Osso Bucco. Especially enjoyed the lamb. In the lobby there was a DJ on Thursday night, live music Friday through Sunday nights, and nothing on Monday night. Itâ€™s loud, festive, and enjoyable for a couple looking for a post dinner drink and maybe a dance or two. La Concha, situated a block to west, has a beautiful lobby/pool area that is worth checking out. My wife & I wandered over there on a Thursday night and the club facing the pool was packed and seemed to have a good vibe for those looking to kick it up a notch. Weather: The weather.com forecast called for showers every day during our stay. We were pleasantly surprised that weather ranged from variably cloudy to mostly sunny with just a few isolated rain showers. It seems like we had a sprinkle every day, and a couple days we had a 15 minute downpour, but that was it. The winds push in from time to time but seem to subside after a couple of hours. Temps were pleasant, ranging from low 80s during the day to low 70s at night. Overall a great hotel. We rented a car and did a day trip to El Yunque and Luquillo on northeast corner of island. Beautiful beach with calm water and great views, only about an hour drive from San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Sevice”
Reviews.Author: tennisnut
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to put in a good word for Sonny our waiter each morning at the excellent breakfast buffet. Also Emmanuel did a great job checking us in and finding us excellent oceanfront rooms. Overall great service from the beach workers, the folks who do the maintenance and cleaning..... A well cared for older resort... Nice to see. As for the area, there seems to be a renaissance in the area with much rebuilding going on. That being said, construction noise was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Marriott Hotel on a great beach”
Reviews.Author: johnsmith47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott San Juan for 4 days before and after our cruise. The service was up to Marriott's usual standards from the bell stand, to check in and the bar. We had no trouble checking in or getting to our room, even thought we arrived a few hours before check in time. We did see some lines later in the day and as others have noted, airline personnel do cut to the head of the line. The hotel is in a great location. The place has cops everywhere, so it's very safe. There are many places to eat on the same street and you're close to old San Juan, the cruise terminal and the airport. The surf is rough, and there are warnings about it. The beach is public, the chaises and an umbrella are free for guests. We like this hotel very much and would like to return some day. The fitness center is free and is very nicely equipped with aerobic machines and weight machines, plus some free weights. When we checked out, they suggested we use their lockers and shower to spend some time on the beach before we went home. That's a first for us at a resort hotel. You have 1 hour of free business internet. We had an Iphone, so we didn't use it much and they didn't seem to track our use.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great food and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RitaBug
Reviews.Content: We vacation somewhere warm for one week every February to shorten our long Wisconsin winters. The San Juan Marriott was a nice break from the frenzied chase for beach chairs and umbrellas by 6:00 A.M. every day that we've experience in many of the all inclusive Mexico resort locations we've been recently. The Marriott had a beautiful beach with plenty of chairs and umbrellas no matter what time of day you arrived. And no keeping track of towels either. The only draw back may have been the high winds and waves here every day. We were entertained daily by the new people running into the ocean only to be flattened immediately by the first wave, some loosing their suits in the process!! Our booking included the breakfast buffet each morning which is served until noon. Delicious meal every day that lasted us until dinner. We also ate in the Italian restaurant there which was very good. Plenty of good restaurants within walking distance along with a 24 hr Walgreens right across the street that has a mini mart grocery store. Drinks are expensive at the hotel so while you're at the beach take a small soft sided cooler filled with your own refreshments and enjoy a frosted mug in the lobby bar at night while you listen to some really good live music!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Slow but Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: CCtravel7
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for a conference for my dad for two days and leisure for the rest of the time. We stayed in a city view room, but it also had a view of the ocean, which was gorgeous! At night, the lobby is very loud. We loved the beach, although the ocean was rough. I don't recommend going more than waist-high at most if you don't want to take the chance of getting pummeled by the waves. I went out a little and, while being fun for the most part, I got pushed back and knocked down a lot. If you like to lay out at the beach, I recommend placing your chairs near the big rocks on the left. Be careful if you put your belongings on the ground if you are near the ocean! My flip flops got washed over to a chair a few feet away! My mom and I ate at La Vista for breakfast two days in a row. It is very good and casual. You can get the buffet or order a la carte. The omelets are good, as are the banana pancakes. The two waiters we had were very nice, but on the second day we ate there the service was very slow. That was fine since all we had to do that day was go to the beach, but if you have somewhere to go, I would either get to the restaurant earlier in order to have enough time, or go to the Starbucks right across the street. We ate at the beach bar one day, and it wasn't amazing. The food was just okay, not somewhere I want to eat again; however, the serving staff was nice. We never ate at Tuscany. The rooms are nice. They are standard hotel rooms, but impeccably clean. They are bright and cheerful. Ours was yellow. The balconies are very nice and a great perk to the otherwise standard rooms. the bathroom in the room is nice. The water pressure in the shower is very good, and you get free Bath & Body Works shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and lotion, which I appreciated. There is a Walgreens down the street, which we visited more than I thought. It's great for those "Oh I had no idea I would use this much sunscreen!" moments. The restaurant Tijuana's is right down the street and is nice, but busy. It is a Tex-Mex restaurant, I thought, but good for what it is. If you have time, I would recommend going to Old San Juan and going on a guided Segway tour (either 45 minutes or 2 hours; I recommend the two hours). Go to Pier 2 and it is the last office on the left. It is a good idea to make a reservation. Afterwards, go to Al Dente restaurant, which is located on Calle Recinto Sur. Then go to Del Cristo Street and go to all of the outlets! I highly recommend this hotel for its location and ease!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BBH17
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 days at this hotel. We had a city view room which i preferred as there was less wind on the balcony versus beachside rooms. it was also 25 dollars per night cheaper. Breakfast was included and was good but after 8 days I was sick of it as they did not vary much from the standards. There is a bus service to Old San Juan on Ashcroft St out side of the Hotel. No 53 & 21 takes you to Old Juan and runs about every 20-30 minutes. The schedule is a bit varied but the bus comes eventually. It is 75 cents and exact change is required. There are free trams in Old San Juan that will take you to the main areas. To return to the hotel you catch the bus at the bus station. There are great restaurants in Old San Juan and along Ashcroft St near the hotel. The beach in front of the hotel is rough and for the 8 days we were there the red warning sign; swim at your own risk was out. however, the beach was great for sitting in a deck chair and walking. About a 20 -25 min walk from the hotel in front of the defunct Hotel Normandie near the Hilton Hotel there a wonderful small beach in front of a concession stand that was like pond great for swimming . If you love art the 3 museums in San Juan are worth a trip and one in Ponce is a must . From the Hotel (10 minute walk) is a SuperMax a grocery store that was much better for wine then the Walgreens that was nearer to the Hotel on Ashcroft Street.

Reviews.Title: “Too Much Money”
Reviews.Author: Deepmar
Reviews.Content: If you're on a budget I would definitely not recommend this place. Meals are pricey and not that good. A long island iced tea at the bar cost about 12 bucks with a tip and if you rent a car you have to pay 16 dollars a day to park it there. The gift shop is also over priced but enough about all that because if you're not on a budget then none of this probably matters to you. But if you're not on a budget I would say go all out and stay somewhere that is much nicer. The location of the hotel is good and not far from the hot spots and the airport (18 dollar cab ride). Plenty of places to eat but you'll have to venture out of the area if you want authentic Puerto Rican food at a good price. Casino action is probably the weakest out of all the casinos I have been to but it's the whole island not just this hotel. If you're a serious gambler go somewhere else like Vegas or Biloxi. If you just want to play a few hands of blackjack for fun then this is the place. The tables do get crowded though. I was there during Valentines day weekend so I saw a lot of couples and not too many singles. Good place to go with a partner or if you don't want to be hassled. If you want action hit another destination. The beach is decent and the staff were pretty nice. The gym seemed ok as well but I didn't try out the spa. If you forget to bring toiletries or anything else there is a Walgreens down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: hzd100
Reviews.Content: We were in San Juan for my husbands business trip so we picked the Marriott due to its accommodation to business travelers. But WOW it is truly a resort hotel, wonderful pool area with swim up bar as well perfect beach access complete with complementary lounge chair and umbrella service. We stayed on the city side and still had an amazing view of San Juan. The tour desk arranged a perfect scuba dive for me that was out of this world. They also offered a full gym with yoga classes. But beware, they due tack on a resort fee of $25 a night stay no matter if you use the amenities or not and parking is $16 a might.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for low key beach vacation”
Reviews.Author: fishbowl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in early February...The hotel from the outside isn't anything spectacular but the rooms are nice and we had a great ocean view. The selling point is the pool area and the fairly nice beach. Umbrellas and chairs were set up for you and included. I didn't go to the casino. The staff was friendly and helpful. Check-in took a bit of time but the staff brought out free cocktails for us waiting in line. The hotel room itself was clean and nicely decorated. We did have our breakfast included at "La Vista". The buffet runs 19.95 per person but with Traveolcity you can purchase this for about 10 bucks per room which was worth it. The buffet had eggs, meat, cereal, fresh fruit, and will make omlettes and eggs as ordered. It costs about 15 bucks to get to the airport and back, and the same to get to downtown San Juan. Restaurant recommendations: Parrot Club, Marmalade ($$$ but worth it), Dragon fly was "OK".

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JPattersonF
Reviews.Content: We stayed last week looking for an escape from the torrential snow and we were so happy that we did. The hotel was comfortable (although quite noisy at times due to some construction). Service is fantastic in every department. We spent most of our days enjoying the generally spectacular weather at the pool where our waitress, Sookie, seemed to take a genuine interest in our enjoyment of our vacation and no matter where we were always made sure we were taken care of. The hotel itself is very well located within walking distance of several great restaurants. Zuccero (I think that is how you spell it) was right in front of the hotel and it was good ( I would say an 8 out of 10) Haagen Daze (also in front) has kind of slow service. No matter where you go coffee seems to be expensive (ironic). We made a trip to Old San Juan (careful with the Cab drivers who seemes to charge us whatever they pleased) Overall we came back with the sence that Puerto Rico has some of the warmest and friendliest people we have encountered. Can't wait to go back, and when we do, it will be to the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: cathy_pdx
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed stay, the hotel was comfortable and service throughout the resort was fantastic. San Juan has a lot of charm and we found locals to be warm and friendly. This was the perfect spot to completely relax, started each day sunbathing on the beach, moving to the pool in the afternoons. Don't miss the segway tour in Old San Juan, it was informative and a great way to see some of the historical sites in a short amoun time. Wished we would have seen more of the island, but we were simply too relaxed enjoying the beach and stolling Old San Juan. Would have given the hotel a 5-rating except for the very loud construction noise that we had on the 11th floor, which started at 8am each morning - we finally had to move to another tower to gain some quietness in the room! Wished the hotel would have been more proactive about the noise, when we called the hotel operating first time, they claimed to not even know of the activities. Other than that, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “People that make a difference”
Reviews.Author: StrawAlb
Reviews.Content: During my most recent stay at the San Juan Marriott there were 2 individuals hat went above and beyond..these were Iris Fernandez (Ocean Club) and Marcos (Executive lounge). I have never had a mani/pedi before and now I am hooked. Iris made me feel very comfortable, explained what she was doing and created a very relaxing atmosphere. I have already recommended her to my colleagues that travel to San Juan. Marcos is in a class by himself. I needed help coordinating a meeting at a different location and he made phone calls and set it all up. Incredible service. These are 2 of the people that make a difference at the San Jaun Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Review of San Juan Marriott”
Reviews.Author: jojoski1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott from Feb 1 to Feb 6. We got in at 6am on Feb 1 and we got into our room by 8am...so thankful for that! Able to take a nap and be on the beach by noon time. The beach was nice. Waves are rough but fun. Plenty of chairs and umbrellas. We had breakfast included with our stay so we would have a big breakfast and skip lunch and then hit a local resturant for dinner. We went into Old San Juan and toured the Barcardi Distillary. We had a great time, but may check out Isla Verde next time around.

Reviews.Title: “This is the must stay place in San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: Traveloften-gonow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel extensively for business. We made some down time between our schedules. We checked other online reviews and asked around. When we vacation, we look for relaxation and quality all around. We originally booked at the El San Juan. If you read around, all the sites say this and the Ritz Carlton are top places in San Juan. Don't believe the hype! The Ritz is a fantastic place, but you can have the El San Juan and the area around these properties is a ghetto. When we got to the El San Juan, this is what we found. 1. A lobby that resembled a gangster rap video 2. A pool that looked and sounded like an episode of the Jersey Shore 3. A room that we afraid to sit down in or touch anything If this is what you are looking for while on vacation, then this is the place for you. We went downstairs to request a room change. After four hours of run-around and listening to three other guests with similar dissatisfaction, we had enough. We went to the Ritz and they could not accommodate us for the entire time we would be in town. We looked online and found that the Marriott San Juan & Stellaris Casino had a special on corner Ocean View rooms. We jumped in a cab to check out the rooms. We were in no mood to take any more chances. Upon arrival, the hotel was very busy. The place is beautiful, very clean and current. We went up to the front desk and met Poliris. She listened attentively and truly understood our dilemma. She requested to have someone show us a room, but it was so busy no one was currently available. She actually received OK to break away from her Front Desk duties and show us a corner room. It was amazing! Ocean view with two balconies. Very roomy, clean and updated. Without hesitation, we took the room. We found out that their onsite pricing was only $10 more per night than the online internet specials. My wife and I were commenting to each other how it worked out in our favor that we didn't stay at the Ritz, because the Marriott had so much to offer and you can actually enjoy the neighborhood outside the property. Considering our situation, the room price really didn't matter. As it turns out, the room prices were very reasonable, considering the quality and value. Poliris is a true professional. Her attention to detail and willingness to accommodate us even during a very busy time truly won us over. My wife and I were discussing how rare it is to find such professionalism in the hospitality business these days. We have traveled extensively for 20 years and really never bothered to write reviews. It was the professionalism of Poliris and her commitment to take care of us that inspired us to share this story. The Marriott is lucky to have her onboard. If this is the Marriott's standard of hire, you will have a fantastic experience. We are still here and the place and people have consistently delivered. The location is great. The area is very trendy with great restaurants and high-end shopping. Right up the street is Gucci, Ferragamo and Cartier. We stumbled on the Marriott San Juan & Stellaris by chance. Considering our travel background, we were embarrassed but pleasantly surprised that we weren't aware of this gem in San Juan. We don't do online commercials, but these folks are truly deserving of your business. Book your trip now with the Marriott San Juan Resort and enjoy some quality down time with your significant other. Thank you for taking the time to read this review.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Erin_Chicago
Reviews.Content: We were here 1 night, 1/31/11. Beautiful beach, fantastic service and the views from our corner room in the tower were amazing. I had heard that the beach here was not as calm as Isla Verda, but even though there was a red-flag swim advisory both days and the waves were a bit rough, people were in the water. We left the balcony door open & listened to the waves all night. We ate at La Vista Latin Grill for lunch and dinner, and the service was great but food was nothing special. We were also considering staying at La Concha, which is just up the street from the Marriott, so we looked around that property and it reminded me of a W or more trendy hotel--very nice, but not our style. It cost $14 for 2 ppl to get from the Marriott to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Nan061
Reviews.Content: This hotel in the Condado area of San Juan is a great location. Room was attractive with both ocean and city view. Service is very nice, very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Had an excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: JGen_11
Reviews.Content: Marcos Tiru was a great host. I am frequent traveler to San Juan and I will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW -- how great!”
Reviews.Author: red1259
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Stayed pre and post cruise in January. Got room through discount bidding site and paid great rates for each stay. The city view rooms were wonderful (had a corner on the first stay - could see the ocean from the side). view of San juan lites was very romantic. Front Desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Had written the marketing mgr ahead of time with a special request -- was take care of beyond my expectations! Great location, quick to everything in the area. Concierge helped me get a car at the last minute when I goofed up the day of my reservation. Could not ask for more! Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Too Bad it was only for One Night”
Reviews.Author: RocketJDawg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Jan 15th, 2011 as an over night prior to boarding a cruise the next day. The grounds are beautiful. Very clean pool and beach area. Our room was just fine for the one night. Quite spacious and super clean. The drinks are a bit pricy but the hotel is located within walking distance of all kinds of different restaurants and bars. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: amynlarr
Reviews.Content: The staff is wonderful. The pool area is great! If your looking for the beach or pool, both are great here! Location is also good. Stayed at Windchimes and was very dissapointed. This is by far a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast, room was very musty”
Reviews.Author: tednugent_10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor ratings back in Oct. 2010. It was number 1 at the time so I selected the Marriott over the Ritz. The hotel is very well located. The Walgreens across the street is convenient for drinks and snacks. Restaurants are nearby: stick to the food at Tijuana's, and the drinks (mojitos) at Yerba Buena. We had a rental car for the entire visit so it was easy to get around to Rincon and the El Yunque rainforest as well as other beaches on the island. Our package included breakfast for the adults; however for the price of our package, breakfast for our elementary aged children should have been included. Also had a problem where they tried to charge us for the included breakfasts which had to be addressed prior to check out. The lobby/check in area is small and set up to accommodate bar patrons rather than quick check in for guests. Also the live music is too loud and very disruptive during late night check-in. The pool and beach area was inviting and clean. We actually liked the shade provided by the palm trees in the pool area since the sun is very strong. Our biggest complaint was that the room had a very strong musty/mildew odor. The carpet had completely absorbed the odor and needed to be replaced. We asked for a new room, but the hotel was full for the holiday weekend. I also smelled the musty odor at the elevator bank so I don't think it was just our room. We recently spent time at a Marriott Resort in Marbella, Spain and I was expecting the accommodations to be as first class and clean as the one in Spain. Unfortunately, it was not.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Resort”
Reviews.Author: tigerfoods
Reviews.Content: Three days here in 1/2011. Positives: Starbucks across street great beach front location nice pool area good breakfast buffet Negatives: noise from connecting rooms/hallways messed up lobby difficult check in tired/small rooms Overall, not what I expected from a Marriott resort location. Great location, lobby is difficult to navigate. Check in staff let pilots check in front of 10 other guest by cutting line. Lots of noise from adjoining room/can hear guy next to me talking on phone as if I am in his room. La Concha has issues too, but nicer than here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay- convenient to airport, restaurants, etc.”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveler24
Reviews.Content: I go to the Marriott every January with my girlfriends (we are in our 30's) to get away from the New England winters. We love it because it is a 10-min, $15 cab ride from the airport, and unlike many Caribbean "resorts", it's not in the middle of nowhere. The room is a typical Marriott room, but I have to say that this is one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in! The bathroom near the pool is immaculate, which is pretty amazing with everyone trekking in from the pool/beach. Before you book via third-party sites, check the Marriott's page for specials. We had a buy 3 get 1 day free plan with free breakfast for 2. As the other reviewers have said, it's great that you can simply walk out the door to go to Subway, Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts (no bagels, FYI), Walgreens and other restaurants. It's super convenient! We like the Mexican place out to the left called Tijuana's. It's very casual, and pretty noisy, but the food is good. We didn't like the Italian place to the left of it, but loved the one across the street from Tijuana's. They have great pizza. It's definitely worth it to take a cab ($15 each way) or the bus into Old San Juan. It's very quaint, but also very lively. I highly recommend Al Dente restaurant at 309 Calle Recinto Sur. The Vista restaurant in the hotel has a great breakfast buffet. You can order omelettes and pancakes via the waiter. It's $20, but with all of the taxes it can be quite pricy. It's worth it if you can get free breakfast with your room. As everyone else has commented, the pool is in the shade, and a good portion of it is just a wading pool, so we don't waste any time there! The beach is lovely. You never have to worry about them running out of chairs, or "staking your claim" at 8 in the morning like other places. Ask the guys to put your chairs to the left (near the rocks) if you don't want to keep moving them due to shade. The ocean is a little rough, but if you know how to go out a little past where the waves break, you'll be fine. The Marriott is totally rockin at night. It's definitely the place to be for the locals, and they tend to have live music almost every night. Definitely request a room that is high up, so you don't hear the music all evening. The casino is small, but it gets pretty crowded at night. The gym is pretty good, and the machines are current. If you can't get late check-out, you can always take a shower at the gym before your flight. They have all of the necessary amenities since there is also a spa there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Christmas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: hsdirector
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. Our only issue was the room in the corner. It was SMALL and the bathroom was TINY. Make sure you don't have a room back in the corner with about 3 other rooms. We loved the live music in the lobby at night. Did quite well in the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: darc2323
Reviews.Content: I looked at reviews prior to the trip which made me kind of disappointed in our choice but when we got here I forgot the poor reviews altogether. The service was good, check in was fast, and beach was great. We had 80-83 degree weather and sunny skies the whole time. We loved the tour of old sand juan and the bacardi factory. A few pointers: Go to a grocery store and buy alcohol because buying it at the bar the whole time will get very expensive, the tour of the caves and the satellite was not worth the money ($236 for two people), I heard the trip to snorkel on the catamarran was fantastic and well worth the money which is about $100 for two people. We played at the casino and ended up leaving with $600 more than what we came in with playing black jack at the $5 tables. I loved our trip and had such a good time at the marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Beach, Excellent Pool, Excellent Restaurant, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: chelseasly
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. It has excellent restaurants which we ate at often because we had a resort credit. The Vista restaurant is reasonably priced and offers local favorites. The drinks are pricey so we didn't have many drinks at the hotel. There are tons of security guards which makes one feel super safe in the hotel. The pool areas are clean and not very crowded. There is a swim up bar with a tv. We had an issue with the air conditioning and it was fixed promptly. The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful with directions to the airport and bus and local attractions like El Yunque and Arecibo. Downside is that you aren't allowed on the beach at night for your safety. This would be true of many areas. The reason I gave the location a 4 is that the area Condado is not perfect there are empty buildings and hotels. It has good places to eat but we didn't venture out at night mostly because we did a lot of hiking and did not have the energy to do anything more than swim in the pool and relax in the hot tub. The car rental across the street is excellent (Charlie Car).

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3-star hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: terinay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Stellaris for 8 days during our honeymoon. Overall I'd give this particular hotel a solid 3-star rating which isn't necessarily a bad thing, but just based on our experiences with other hotels and for comparison purposes, Marriott Stellaris gets a solid 3-star. Marriott Stellaris is a reasonably good option for a visit to San Juan. First of all, the location is fantastic and it's a beachfront hotel. Right outside the hotel are numerous restaurants and bars. You wont go hungry when you get tired of hotel food. Starbucks is literally across the street and Walgreens is on the next block. It's on Ashford Ave which has multiple bus stops where you can hop on the #21 bus for a 20-min ride to Old San Juan which is the historic district filled with restaurants, bars, souvenir shops, etc. Cabs are also not lacking. Check-in, however, took awhile. Given that it was holiday season, it would be nice if the hotel had more employees stationed at the check-in counters to speed up the process. The check-in staff were cordial; not over the top courteous but just fine. We found the concierge and restaurant staff to be more pleasant. The decor of this hotel is classic. Perhaps one would even say that the Marriott Stellaris' decor is a little dated. It's not abstract or contemporary. Our room was smaller than expected. The nice thing is that beach chairs are provided for hotel guests. The hotel employees stationed at the beachfront will gladly help carry and set your chairs exactly where you want them to be on the beach. Overall the experience was good but not a 4 or 5 star type of great.

Reviews.Title: “Average. Good location, unfriendly service, bad pool, nice beach, OK room”
Reviews.Author: CDavis74
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in January 2011. The Good: - Quick check-in; room ready when we arrived at 1:30pm - Location in Condado on Ashford Ave and a short cab ride to Old San Juan and other areas of interest - Large enough beach for numerous guests (other hotel's beach fronts in Condado have washed away considerably) - Plenty of sundries available for purchase if you forgot something. There is also a Walgreens across the street. The Bad: - Upcharge for an ocean view room - not an issue normally but the rooms smell very bad. Quite musty. - Unfriendly service professionals. This was a theme in Puerto Rico, but when you're paying to stay at a hotel it's bad form to have staff that act bored, annoyed, and like you are a bother to them. - The pool is surrounded by shade due to all of the plam trees put in there to look pretty. It is also not a swimming pool - it's a wading pool that is 2 feet deep all around with fountains in the middle. - The hotel is tall, so there is always a large slice of shade covering the beach and you have to move your chair(s) around to follow the sun and avoid the shade from the hotel tower. - There is always someone screaming at you on the beach: either the guy doing "massages" yelling "Best massage now! Chiropractic! Best massage!" (this goes on all day) or the ice cream guy who rolls his cart around the beach ringing insanely loud bells to alert you of ice cream availability. - The drinks at the casino are virtually undrinkable. Sure, they're free but really, stay away. (Also, you are not allowed to bring in a nicer glass of wine from the hotel bar). Not that anyone in the casino will offer you a drink anyway - we had to beg to find someone to wait on us after I was told I could not go up to the bar myself to order a drink. - The food at the beach side bar is subpar. I usually ventured off premises to get lunch. - There is a very loud live band that plays every night in the lobby. Since we were on the 3rd floor (one up from the lobby) we heard hte band until they stopped after midnight. The place is OK. If you're looking for luxury, peace, a nice pool, or good food, don't stay here. If you're looking for a good location, don't care much about the room/pool/food, and are not expecting great service, by all means stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: easternmb
Reviews.Content: The check in was very fast and the staff was excellent and friendly. We had the upgraded beachfront room in the high rise and I would definitely recommend the upgrade. The room was not large but the bed was very comfortable and it was very quiet despite us beinng on the floor (3rd) right above the lobby and the weekend band. The pools are small and don't get much sun. The beach is fair but again you have to move around to get afternoon sun if that is what you want. The casino is small but nice. The limits are low on table games and there is NO Smoking which makes it great in my book. We only ate breakfast at La Vista and it was good. Tuscany, the Italian restaurant is more upscale and the food and service were both good. The wine list was not extensive but more than adequate. All in all a good place for a 3-4 day stay> We stayed 5 and were getting a bit antsy. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and a cab to old San Juan is $15 if you want more variety. The hotel has a band on the weekend and seems to be popular with the locals who like salsa and meringue.

Reviews.Title: “To relax in the Sun with the comfort of home stay here”
Reviews.Author: num1invest
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived we received excellent service. We booked through Price-line at a very affordable rate. This did not allow us to select a room ahead of arrival. The clerk first assigned us to a lower level with no ocean view but was very pleasant when we requested a higher level with an ocean view. The clerk said it would be $50 or $25 extra per night but we could have a partial view free...which we accepted. I had read but forgotten to request the annex with a view of the pool and the ocean. These are excellent rooms but I would request floor seven and above because of the palm trees. Our room was great with a balcony on both the city side and the ocean side. Room service was great though it was often in late afternoon before it arrived... no problem for us. We were very comfortable in walking up and down the street in front of the hotel. The people are great: friendly and very helpful. In looking for a place to eat we met Mike next to his jewelry store Signature 1374 Ashford; we stopped in later in the week but we did not buy anything. He directed us to a fine Italian restaurant next to Tijuana. We ate there three times and loved it. We also ate a Burger King about five blocks from the hotel. The beach was great; a guy will put out chairs for you. The hotel has a laundromat which we used. The restaurant is too pricy; the hot tub not hot but filled with kids. We found you can take the bus from the Hotel to Old San Juan: bus number 21 or 53. The cost is 75 cents-- runs whenever it wants to but it does not take too long to catch a ride. You come back on the same bus by catching it at the terminal station. Relax and take your time; it may not leave for an hour. While in Old San Juan if you want local cuisine we found Manolin Cafe to be the best. It is at 251 San Justo just down from Radio Shack. If you ride the free trolley get off at stop 7. By the way the Fort and Film are well worth the trip to Old San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Our Hotel of Choice for San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Onlyonevelvet
Reviews.Content: This was me and my BFF second time at the hotel. We also stayed there in October 2009. In 2009 we visited the Bacardi Factory and we we enjoyed the festival that took place on Ashford Ave. In 2010 we took a hopper to St. Thomas and spent the day at Magen's Bay Beach (We had a FABULOUS time) and we did the tour of Old San Juan (Our tour guide was the BEST). We have decided to try to make this an annual trip. Even though I have saw deals at other hotels we decided why fix something that is not broken. The location of the hotel is great!!! The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to Old San Juan and nice beach area”
Reviews.Author: nuclearsun
Reviews.Content: Hotel is decent, rooms are noisy, a lot of hallway noise. Casino slots are tight small amount of table games. Resturant is good with decent breakfast buffet. Avg. price to value for the area. Nice pool and beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & location .....but....(some advice)”
Reviews.Author: RRanella
Reviews.Content: Overallâ€¦.we enjoyed our stay at the Marriottâ€¦â€¦â€¦..the beach was nice / clean & the pools were very nice. The grounds are well kept. A few changes by the Marriott management could make this resort outstandingâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.. At the coffee cafÃ© in the lobbyâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.the coffee could make your hair stand upâ€¦â€¦..Itâ€™s like drinking instant coffee. My wife & I sat at the lobby bar around 7pm one night and asked for a cup of hot tea. We didnâ€™t know the cafÃ© closes at 3pmâ€¦ We were lucky to get the teaâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.BUTâ€¦â€¦â€¦..had to pay a price for It, $4.00 a cup. The Dunkin Doughnuts about three blocks to the right was the best coffee. The drinks & breakfast buffet are overpricedâ€¦â€¦$6.75 for a bottle of Coors Light & around $10.00 for a mix drink. To the left of the hotel on Ashford Ave approx. two blocks Is Eros Food Market, we bought a six pack of Coors Light & Sol for $9.95 each with other food Items which we stocked up in our room refrigerator. Expect to pay $19.95 per person for the breakfast buffet. Dannyâ€™s restaurants, one block to the left will cost you less than half. Believe me, we saved a bundle. We were disappointed In the entertainmentâ€¦â€¦â€¦Monday & Tuesday had no entertainment, Wednesday had a 80â€™s-90â€™s band with nice music , very relaxing, Thursday a DJâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.OMG SO LOUD â€¦â€¦..Friday a Jazz bandâ€¦â€¦.againâ€¦â€¦..OMG SO LOADâ€¦â€¦the music was so load you couldnâ€™t understand any of the words they were singingâ€¦â€¦â€¦.we even sat the furthest away too. It ended up we left to go across the street to a nice relaxing, friendly cafÃ©, Zucchero. We ate lunch here once, had drinks & personal mozzarella pizzaâ€™s here twiceâ€¦â€¦â€¦ The location of the Marriott was excellentâ€¦â€¦â€¦ You could catch a bus to Old San Juan (B-21) right outside the hotel to the right for 75 cents per personâ€¦â€¦â€¦.. Exact change onlyâ€¦â€¦..the driver took a fit when I gave him two dollar billsâ€¦â€¦.twice while waiting at the bus stop a cab driver took us to Old San Juan for two dollars each along with another couple. A cab to Old San Juan costs $14.00â€¦â€¦â€¦.from the Marriott to the airport $15.00 plus one dollar additional per luggage bag The resort is located within walking distance to: Starbuckâ€™s & Hagen Daz ice cream across the street Walgreenâ€™s, two blocks to the right, Dunkin Doughnuts three blocks to the right with many restaurants. For breakfast, we ate at Dannyâ€™s restaurant twice one block to the left & twice at La Patisserie CafÃ© about four blocks to the left, on 1504 Ashford Avenue. The thin crust tomato / chesse pizza at Dannyâ€™s was our favorite. We had pizza across the street from Dannyâ€™s at Via Appia onceâ€¦â€¦â€¦It was just ok.... For supper, just to the right we ate at Cherry Blossom hibachi restaurantâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.excellentâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.get there before 6:30 pm for an early bird special and save $9.00 per entrÃ©e, $18.00 vs. $27.00. If you like veal scaloppini, chicken marsala or chicken francheseâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦..located on 1106 Magdalena Avenue, behind Walgreenâ€™s, Is Il Postino Italian restaurantâ€¦â€¦we ate supper here two nightâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦outstandingâ€¦â€¦â€¦One night we ate supper at the Marriott Tuscany grillâ€¦â€¦â€¦..Itâ€™s a little priceyâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦but we enjoyed our mealsâ€¦â€¦â€¦..they totally screwed up our dinners thouâ€¦â€¦â€¦I must sayâ€¦.the head waited was very apologetic, corrected our meals In a timely fashion & gave us a dessert on the houseâ€¦â€¦â€¦. Again, with so many places to the left & right of hotel within walking distance, we enjoyed our stayâ€¦â€¦â€¦ I must say, all the Marriot staff was â€¦..very â€¦. very friendly & helpful. We would definitely go back if the Marriott management would price food & drinks more reasonably & have entertainment every day with a more relaxing atmosphere, â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦TURN DOWN THE VOLUMEâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦. Ronnie R. Clarks Green, PA 5 days (2011)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly people”
Reviews.Author: arnbeach
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great. Right on the beach and across the street from a Starbucks and Haagen Daz.
