It was walking distance from great restaurants, a short ride from the airport and to Old San Juan. They have organized trips to El Yunque, the rain forest and other places. The gym was great. They have cold towels to refresh you after you workout. The gym got a little crowded, but it was Christmas week and the weather was not great. The beach was beautiful, but the water was a little rough. There were kids swimming though. The people were really friendly. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms vary, service excellent”
Reviews.Author: janet48603
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel both before an after a cruise, using points both times. The first visit I had requested a quiet room; we arrived at midnight and were given a quiet room that faced the street, low floor, rather unpleasant view, but it was quiet! On this subject, I should mention that checking in was difficult because of the extreme noise level from the band performing in the lobby. The reception person had either shout or wait for us to lipread. Normal conversation was impossible. Plus side....the place is jumping for those looking for late nite activities. For our second stay, I requested a room overlooking the pool, and got this. The room was delightful. We could view not only the pool, but also the ocean, and hear the ocean, which was actually quite loud, with the patio door open. The room was spacious and pool rooms evidently include access to the executive lounge, which was a very nice perk. They put out evening snacks and a light breakfast as well. This hotel met our needs well for flying and out for a cruise, but I'd certainly recommend a pool view room, if available.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip in a long time!”
Reviews.Author: 1beachie
Reviews.Content: I was nt sure about going to San Juan, but I have to say I had the best time!! The hotel was awesome, the people were friendly and so helpful. Took a kayak tour that was so much fun, we snorkled had a great time, food and staff were wonderful. Went to litt le resteraunts around the Marriott and met great people. Going to downtown San Juan was very fun and educational as well as great shopping. I would definetly go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beach, lots of activity, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mhjett
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the property after our 5-day stay. We had a city view room with the best, absolutely silent AC unit, unlike the other recent review - I often can't stand the traditional under-window units but we had a normal in-wall duct and thermostat. Room was spacious and very clean/updated, great bathroom, great bed, nice city view from the private balcony. The beach was outstanding - well over a couple hundred feet long, nice soft sand, and cleaned every morning. Condado beach gets some strong winds and big waves, but that makes for a fun time swimming. The Italian restaurant (Tuscany) was outstanding and could hold its own as a free-standing restaurant. The Island Bar had decent food but is overpriced. Drinks on the beach were surprisingly cheap. Service throughout the hotel was good and prompt. Great place to stay if you want a big name-brand hotel in a central location in San Juan with a great beach.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Fun”
Reviews.Author: MHaave
Reviews.Content: For those of you looking for a great time, in a great spot in San Juan, look no further. This place is perfect from start to finish. First let me explain my trip. I visited with my extended family (8 people) and we had 4 rooms all in the tower building. We stayed on the 11th floor and each room was different in size and view. My particular room was partial ocean facing the opposite side of the pool and was very large. Other rooms were ocean view which was a bit smaller, and two city views which were similar in size. Our rooms were ready when we arrived (around 1 pm on Dec 26). We also took advantage of the free buffet every morning which was included in our package. The buffet was your typical hotel breakfast buffet but let me tell you I miss having an omelet prepared for me every morning. Due to its location, we were able to go to the numerous liquor spots/stores and purchase beer (Medella is a great beer), and liquor for our week long trip. We then would use our mini fridge as a holding ground for beer/mixers and bring them down to the lobby bar or the casino to avoid the cost of the drinks in the lobby bar/pool/beach. It did not appear that the staff had any problem with this at all as we were never asked to stop. TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THIS OR DONâ€™T COMPLAIN OF THE COST OF YOUR LIQUOR BILL. The lobby bar is very loud with the band playing almost every night. We tried to stay away from the lobby bar due to the noise however it was not considered a major issue as we avoided it. We sat at the couches near the entrance to the beach almost every night and played games, or enjoyed casual conversation. The casino is nice in size but the staff could be a little friendlier. All depends on the person you get. We had both good and bad experiences in the casino. Other than the casino, the staff was great. All very nice people and ready to help you in any way. We stayed for 7 days and for the first 5 the weather was so-so. This gave us a chance to visit the rainforest, Old San Juan, the Bacardi Factory, and partake in a zip line excursion. The last 2 days were when the weather turned sunny, and we hung out by the pool and the beach. The drinks around the pool are strong and good but can be seen as pricy. The food is just ok but you canâ€™t expect much from a pool bar. The building does block the sun and you will have to move if not in the right spot. We learned that the hard way and the second sunny day we stayed in a spot that saw sun majority of the day. Stay by the black rocks on the side of the beach and you should not have to move at all during the day. But again, you are on vacation so go with the flow and enjoy yourself. Donâ€™t make it a bigger problem than it really is. I would recommend this hotel to anyone I talk to thinking about a trip to Puerto Rico. The three major things that I would tell them are to find a liquor store, get in the tower building, and donâ€™t let the little things ruin a great trip. Other than that, sit back and enjoy your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: we3liketotravel
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Marriott San Juan Resort. Weather was not great, however being in such a good neighborhood allowed us to enjoy time away from beach. The hotel itself is quite nice, and we did have free upgrade to full ocean view which was a pleasant suprise. Service was good and hotel staff always pleasant. Check in was smooth despite hotel being busy. THE POSITIVES: a great sand beach with big waves (if you like to body surf or bogey board); great location in Condado so you can walk safely to many restaurants and stores; rooms spacious, airey and very quiet at night (we were on an upper floor); large, bright and clean bathroom with strong shower; refrigerator in room and Walgren's 1 block away so easy to keep snacks/drinks handy; extra towels brought and room cleaned promply when we called; very helpful business center that "bent" the rules to help us; elevators fast so no waiting which is great for a 20 storey hotel. THE NEGATIVES: surf was rough with strong undertow (only in part due to inclement weather) so small children might have trouble enjoying the ocean here; hotel restaurants not very good (although the coffee shop in lobby has good sandwiches at reasonable price); beds soft; pool fair; few activities other than beach (and one outdoor ping-pong table during constantly windy week); position of tall hotel relative to beach blocks sun for several hours per day, so during a generally overcast days people were moving their beachchairs to different parts of beach to try to get a little sun. Overall we might stay here again if we returned, however would strongly consider La Concha 3 blocks away which has a better lobby/bar, a much better pool area, and part of the beach is sheltered from the waves so calmer waters.

Reviews.Title: “BORING CORPORATE RIP-OFF, WATCH YOUR WALLET”
Reviews.Author: SimonWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth day at the hotel and I am hating every moment of it. The room is clean and comfortable, on a par with a Super-8 Motel. The food and drinks are ridiculously expensive and the place has no local character at all, aside from ear-slitting salsa music in the lobby. 80% of the pool area is in shade during the day, and the ugly concrete monolith of a hotel casts a shadow over the beach. I spent 40 minutes at the unheated, freezing cold pool today waiting for service before I gave up,. A 12oz glass of watery American beer served in a plastic cup costs $8. There are mean-looking security guards everywhere. The neighborhood is boring and not within walking distance of Old San Juan. All of the restuarants are absurdly expensive, and I have lived in Manhattan, East Hanmpton and Santa Barbara. Nothing justifies the ridiculous prices around here, both at the hotel and the local restaurants. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy. I spent my 20s and 30s backpacking around cheap hotels that had character. This is the first and last time I will stay at a Marriott. I am a sophisticated world traveller. Believe me, THIS PLACE SUCKS.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: bebemm2001
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location right on the beach in Condado. They have chairs and umbrellas you can use for free for guests. The breakfast is good, not expensive but not cheap either. Tthe room was clean and well maintained. The beds were comfortable. We had a wonderful view from our room with a balcony. Three sides of the hotel have great views.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: marcyshops
Reviews.Content: Our room wasn't ready when we arrived or by the 4pm guarantee. Food by pool was awful! Beach and Pool were very windy and there were a ton of pigeons. Beach area is small and wet! Tide comes up high and will get your stuff wet if you leave anything on the sand. (Ocean is great for anyone who wants to surf! Very high tide!) Although the casino has free cocktails, it is very hard to find a waiter or waitress and they only offer a very limited selection. If you want to buy a drink, there is no bar in the casino (and no potty either). Elevators seem to stop on almost every floor! We had 2 ups packages delivered to hotel and the hotel staff NEVER called us to tell us they were there! Worst part of trip......no sun the entire time! A better hotel would have helped that!

Reviews.Title: “Great location....Not a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BethSmall717
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property December 19-24. Let me start by saying the location was PERFECT!!!!! walking distance to many GREAT restaurants. Starbucks, Hagen Daz and Walgreens across the street. The big problem was with the hotel itself. Most of the staff is friendly, although it can be spotty. We had a corner room that was very spacious, with a lovely balcony facing the pool/beach. However, if you look to your left you see the top of some very old bulidings and an alley. We stayed in the cabana building, I would suggest staying in the tower (much nicer). The room itself was nothing special. I didnt think it was up to Marriot standards or woth the money. The pool area is horrible. There are 2 pools (If Thats what you want to call them). 1 pool has fountains in the middle and is only about 1foot deep. The other is a little deeper with a water slide ( not much deeper). There is no sun by the pool becasue of the palm trees. The pool isnt heated and it was freezing. They have 1 hot tub that was pretty gross. THe beach area is not what i expected. You can't really swim on Condando beach. Its way to rough and unsafe. They had the red flag flying the whole time we were there. There is no lifeguard. There are beach chairs if you can get get somebody to get one for you. They are all pretty old and full of sand. Not much in the way of poolside/beach service. We had to walk up to the bar and order our own drinks. Which btw are very over priced unless you hit happy hour. This is not a resort, other than the casino which is just OK there isnt much to do at the hotel. No activities pretty dead. Do not come here with teenagers they will be bored out of there mind. They show a schedule of activities at the pool, volleyball,yoga, beach bingo. but they never actually had anything. The lobby is made up of a bar with high tops . What a waste of space. The place was dead the whole week we were there. The food is horrible and way over priced.. The tour desk was helpful and we went on some fun excursions. We loved Puerto Rico. When I return I would not stay at the San Juan Marriot. Don't purchase anything in there gift shop. They charged my husband $4.00 for a $1.00 USA today Newspaper. There are so many better choices. Skip this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.. Right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: missharrop
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Condado instead of Old San Juan so we could be at a beach front property. This hotel couldn't have been any better, steps away from the pool was the beach with the beach chairs and staff ready to help you if you needed anything. Lots of restaurants in the area with a 24H walgreens. The casino at the hotel seemed really popular! We went down on a Friday night and the band was playing, people were dancing, the bar was packed and the gaming tables were full!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel (except for the pool bar/restaurant)”
Reviews.Author: bryan7007
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly nice, clean hotel. The pool is beautiful and there is great beach access. The casino is a lot of fun and it is a pretty good crowd. Everything is very overpriced, but whatever, it is a Marriott. If you are staying here, I would have one major piece of advice. AVOID THE POOL/BAR RESTAURANT AT ALL COSTS. We went for lunch as it was Christmas and this was our only eating option. After ordering, we got drinks fairly promptly, but the food took way to long. After our parties food was brought, I was told my food was going to take an extra few minutes (I ordered a Veggie Wrap), the rest of the group order meat (Which should take longer to cook). I said it was fine and it didn't come for 20 minutes. He offered me a free beer, and I asked if I could just have some potato chips or fries instead. He said no, but that the food would be out in a few minutes. After an HOUR of not being present, I didnt get my food and the waiter brought a check. I have been to many restaurants in my life, but this is the WORST service I have EVER experienced. DO NOT EAT HERE AT ALL COSTS!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, spotty service”
Reviews.Author: Nameless64
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a nice neighborhood (the guy who said it is in the middle of a slum was either ticked off and blowing off steam or he has never been in a bad neighborhood in his life). The beach is lovely. Even on a sunny weekend there were plenty of chairs, and the beach staff, including bar staff, is friendly and prompt. Breakfast Buffet is good, though bizarrely priced (you pay extra for an omelet--never seen that before). Ate in the Exec lounge this morning--good fruit, yogurt, pastries, and we ate outside and saw only one pigeon. Lots of decent restaurants in the area, though they are pretty dear--but in a winter resort in December that's hardly a surprise. The front desk operation leaves a lot to be desired. We were arriving ver late, so I called the hotel in late afternoon to confirm our reservation for a high-floor room. When we arrives at 2:00 AM the only room left was on the sixth floor. It can get noisy, with the bass from the bar band penetrating the floor until late. Concierge told us twice that there was no winter league baseball in San Juan. When a second concierge said the same thing I pulled the info up on my phone--at which point the first concierge came by and told her colleague (in Spanish) that she had told me there was no baseball. The second person told her SHE was wrong, and she walked off with no apology. What a jerk. Housekeeping is prompt. Drinks are good and not outrageously priced, especially by resort standards. Overall it's a three-star spot. If all you care about is a spot on the beach, this fits the bill. If you are looking for a luxury resort experience, this isn't the spot. We are here for two more days, but unless we got a phenomenal rate I don't think we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: vacationerinPR
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights here with family...there is construction outside hotel which makes it very unappetizing the moment I saw it. Certainly they left that out on the website. Also, at the beach bar restaurant, there are hundreds of pidgeons flying around and walking on the tables, under your chair and everywhere you eat. If you lounge by the pool, they are under the lounge chair......always lurking around. All they do is put up a sign that says, "Please don't feed the pidgeons!" However, they are everywhere. Also, on the 21st floor executive lounge, if you want to eat breakfast outside......pidgeons are walking on the tables outside! Every meal at the La Vista or Tuscany is $50 plus for 2 people. They charged $6 for a glass of orange juice and $6 for a pot of coffee. Imagine....it wasn't included in buffet. The surrounding area is slum like. The worst restaurant in New York would be considered the best restaurant over there in this area of Puerto Rico. Three different people gave 3 different directions to golf & I got lost. Don't rent a car....the people drive insane and are horn happy all the time.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad, and the Bug-ly”
Reviews.Author: KenF88
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights and had a mostly great time at this Marriott. The good: great beach, nice waves, fantastic weather, great location. The bad: paper thin room walls, bad news when your next door neighbor comes crashing in blitzed at 2 AM, rooms are a little run down for what you are paying. The bug-ly: We went down to the beach on our last day, and forgot to lock up the digital camera in the safe like we usually did. When we got back to the room it was gone, probably from a thieving housekeeper. That was our bad. Next time we will lock any and all valubles up, but I was really bugged about it. So no pictures for back home. Anyway, still a good time overall!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and atomosphere”
Reviews.Author: brownieLuv2trvl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of good restaurants and a great beach in the Condado section San Juan. Nice beach bar, pool, and lobby. A resort hotel but with the local Puerto Rican style right a the doorstep. The Tiuana's restaurant across the street is great too. It was nice to get FREE internet too. We upgraded to an oceanfront corner room for $25 per night-totally worth it-the view was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “great service and staff”
Reviews.Author: karenrobbins
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at the Marriott....Not the most stylish or updated hotel I've visited, but overall a very nice experience. Got a great deal off of priceline for a package deal w/flight ($490 for roundtrip and 4 nights..), no extra charges or taxes by the Marriott (which I was halfway expecting..) The rooms were clean and spacious, with flatscreens although the decor was not flashy or trendy, it wasn't too hard on the eyes either. Beds were pretty comfortable, and showers had decent water pressure. We had a 'city view' room, but still had a nice view of the ocean....19th floor, with great views in all directions and the sound of the waves to enjoy. Small porch with chairs that we didn't spend much time on. Free bottled water in the room and a decent selection of american TV stations when you crash at night. Free internet in the 'business center' (they initially stated it was for a fee, but the staff always logged me on for free.. What stood out most about this hotel was the wonderful staff....very courteous, helpful...at checkout, we asked about using the bathroom to change from bathing suits before our flight, and then told us to go use the spa bathroom (with showers and sauna), for example. Didn't use the pool, but went to the beach every day....staff very helpful setting up chairs and umbrellas. Also have beach/poolside food service, a bit overpriced but decent food (non-descript, hotdogs/hamburger type stuff, and drinks..) Cab ride is ~$15 from airport, and ~$15 to Old San Juan (both about 15 minutes away) Lots of nice stuff within walking distance. Didn't really do much with the casino, though it is right in the lobby. Lobby bar was surprisingly happening most nights. Would stay here again for the value and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice beach.”
Reviews.Author: roughneck784
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel about 10:00 pm. The hotel is short taxi ride from airport ($15). We were the only one in line when we arrived, so the check in process was relatively short. They didn't have a king that we booked available and told us one would be available in the next couple of days. Our double still had the great ocean view. We stay first on the 15th floor and then the 16th. Both had ocean view balconies and the view was great. Our king was ready as promised in a couple days and they moved our packed up stuff to our new room. The rooms are clean and pretty average. Seemed like any average chain hotel in the us. We spent some time in the lobby lounge and the service was always good. Same could be said for the pool area bar. The pool was way colder that the ocean so we would usually hop in the hot tub for a bit every day before getting ready for dinner. The hot tub didn't look like it got cleaned very often and even was a little gross to me. It wasn't very hot either. The beach and surf is awesome. There is always enough chairs and a waiter/waitress came around once in awhile for drink or food orders. There were only a couple people trying to sell stuff on the beach and they left you alone. All in all, the lobby, pool, and beach area were clean and well taken care of. The motel is located in a great spot for dining. Our favorite was a Japanese steak house down the street called the Cherry Blossom. There was something different for every night from sea food to Italian. We always felt safe walking around the hotel. Rarely did you even go 10 minutes without seeing some sort of law enforcement. While in San Juan, we spent a day touring old San Juan. It's a interesting piece of history and the old stone forts are fun to walk through. We also did two tours through the hotel. We did the BioBay tour which is amazing and the El Yunque rain forest tour. I would recommend both and both went off without a hitch. Pickup and delivery from the hotel made it very simple. Not a bad starting point for our first trip to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great getaway.”
Reviews.Author: loeby41
Reviews.Content: Attentive, helpful staff. All eager to please - whether asking for driving directions, suggestions of things to do or help in finding the appropriate restaurant to suit our needs. The staff goes out of its way whether you are checking in or asking any miscellaneous questions. The rooms are spacious, clean and well cared for.Most rooms have a terrace. The pool is spacious, more than ample seating and well maintained. The beach area is clean and lounges always available. The hotel is in an excellent location - local restaurants, Starbucks, etc. The only suggestion we have - there ought to be umbrellas at the pool and at the beach (without a fee). This will not keep us from returning to this wonderful hotel. We recommend it to anyone looking for a few days of leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!!!...Beautiful and clean Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kikanyc
Reviews.Content: I was reviewing hotels for weeks as to where to stay in Puerto Rico. I am so happy that I went with the Marriott Stellaris. It was clean, the beach was beautiful (although crazy waves). It was the perfect location, not to far from Old San Juan. Hop on the 21 or 53 bus for $0.75 and you are in San Juan in 15 min. We had an amazing time and would definitely book this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Mini Vacation Ever"”
Reviews.Author: GatHark
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 5 night stay at the Marriot Stellaris- From the time my Husband and myself arrived we where given Red Carpet Treatment- The management is doing an amazing job with the staff everyone is professional and one thing and we have traveled all over the world we noticed is everyone is happy- From the check in to the absolutely beautifull room (oceanfront) we where treated as family. This property is an oceanfront gem the beach is absolutely gorgeous and very very clean. My husband surprised me and had a bottle of champagne waiting for us in the room, we spent everyday at the beach my husband being a Surfer just loved it! The great thing about the beach is that the guests and locals co-mingle together and I just cant say what it did for my husband (more on that in a sec) being our 2 year anniversary the celebration started as soon as we landed. The food at the restaraunts phenomenal, the room service food great (and delivered fast) There is a starbucks walgreens and a ton of local restaraunts within a block of the resort we had Empanadas and Beer for breakfast on Sunday my husband said it really reminded him of his mom (more on that in a sec) and a full casino had a blast playing roullette and blackjack, no real reason to look for nightlife as the Lobby Bar has great music going everynight we danced we laughed and really reconnected- My husband wanted me to give a shout out to Stephan the front desk manager all the staff at the beach The doormen concierge and Lucy the bartender- Suggestion to anyone going Tip the staff have a great time and enjoy we did and will definately be back. back to what I was saying my husbands mom passed away last month she was spanish and used to make empanadas for him, this trip really brought him back to life again Thank you everyone at the Marriot Stellar we will see you soon! D Gatlin

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for pre or post cruise”
Reviews.Author: BVI17
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for post-cruise. We arrived very early to the hotel so naturally our room wasn't ready. The hotel looks very nice, modern, and clean. We decided to go across the street to Starbucks for breakfast - don't go at 9 a.m. we waited in line for 25 minutes (we decided we were nuts to do so). Next we hopped into a cab to head into Old San Juan - just as we arrived the hotel called to let us know that our room was ready. When we got back to the hotel we picked up our room cards and headed to the 12th floor. Our room was large, high ceilings, clean, large bathroom, bath and body works products, and a city view. The hotel is also in a nice area we walked around a bit and found the walgreens, restaurants, other hotels, luxury shopping, and even found a nice farmers market. The staff from the reception, to the casino, to the housekeeping were friendly and always smiling. We also found that the coffee bar in the hotel offered nice beverages and breakfast treats. The pool and beach area are nice but small when we compare it to the large resorts in Rio Grande.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Eat in Old San Juan, anything near Resort too expensive”
Reviews.Author: JoelovesSanjuan
Reviews.Content: If you choose to go to San Juan Puerto Rico I highly recommend you stay at the Marriott Resort. It has the fastest elevator I've ever seen in my life. When you get there you have to get an ocean view hotel room, it's a little more but well worth it, trust me. We slept with the patio door open the entire time and hearing the waves was money. Don't eat near the resort, it's tempting but it's not worth the price or quality. Yu can save money by going to the Walgreen's to the right of the hotel and grabbing some food, the water is great so you don't have to worry about getting bottled. Room Service is a little slow that is the only complaint. At night go down to the hot tub and enjoy the view. This is be a great vacation, go to Old San Juan to eat, but going during the day. Alot of armed cops around with bullet proof vest, but they are there for your protection. You can walk around, I do recommend not renting a car.. You don't need it, you can get around on the bus, it's just not the best with time..This is a layed back culture. One last thing, The bed is the best I've ever slept on. I slept for hours, I can't wait to go back to the resort. Go to the Rainforest, the tour is about 100 for two people...and buy your alcohol from down the street you will save so much money instead of buying drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: skellygrl99
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice time in San Juan. It took me a couple of days to warm up to the city and hotel. I am used to a more quiet/rural resort atmosphere. In the end, did not want to leave! The hotel was very clean, our room was very clean. Plenty of towels,hot water,amenities provided daily. We were in room 1010 and had a beautiful view of the beach. The beach water was warm, but a bit rough. Had sun every day and 84 degrees. We saw a lot of kids surfing with boards and jumping waves. Having a great time. Had breakfast buffet one morning and a dinner one evening in Tuscany. Breakfast buffet was fine and dinner was also very good. We also had lunch at the beach bar and that was fine as well. The pool bar was a bit to be desired though.. Needs a bit of updating. Coolers were old and rusty looking. Could use a revamp. Can tell they just recently built the beach bar/restaurant but should not ignore the pool bar. There was music at the pool bar, but it was from the bartenders IPOD station...and one TV. You could not see the tv if you were sitting at the swim up bar. The bartender made good drinks though...Oh, and one note: They take no cash at the beach restaurant and pool bar. Have credit card with you or charge every drink/food to your room. The hot tub was clearly posted with a sign that stated no children allowed in hot tub. That was completely ignored and every day there were at least 15 children and adults in the hot tub. Some children so young they were in swim diapers! We opted to stay out of the hot tub! Too bad they don't adhere to the rules. Or have a relaxing adult only hot tub, minus the diapers! The pool was very nice and was very clean and enjoyable. Great waitstaff at the pool and the beach. Could have used some live music at the pool to make it a bit more festive. Just for a few hours in the afternoon for happy hour and maybe some activities going on throughout the day. It was a bit quiet. They have activities posted, but didn't see a coordinator going around to get things started. The Lobby bar and bands in the lobby in the evening were the best. A lot of activity and people coming to dance and listen to the band in the evenings. Great Fun! Offered dance lessons earlier in the evening. That was nice. Great atmosphere. The casino was small but offered enough slots/tables to keep you happy.We saw a few jackpots hit. Later, that night we hit a jackpot ourselves, So that made it all the more fun. So you do see people winning in their casino.. Overall, this is a great family hotel, also nice for couples as well. We had a very nice four night getaway . Everyone was so pleasant and took very good care of us during our stay. We enjoyed this hotel very much and will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A first-class experience!”
Reviews.Author: summerlove
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 25th wedding anniversary at this resort Nov. 20-24. We were pampered with friendliness and professionalism from Day 1. We had a corner room with two private balconies on the 7th floor of the main tower. The room was very large; the bed extremely comfort and the view breathtaking. We watched cruise ships arrive into port from our bed. Our package included a daily breakfast buffet. The food was delicious and the service excellent. We plan to return!

Reviews.Title: “OK BUT NOT WHAT I EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: nichole_shields81
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to PR and we were celebrating our 1yr anniversary and I must say it wasnâ€™t what I expected, especially compared to other places I have been but I kind of got the hint that it wasnâ€™t going to be what I expected before we went, just by doing research but since we never been before, I figured it canâ€™t hurt to go for the experience and it was a good deal. I expected to be further away from the city then what we were and to my surprise we were smack dead in the city and it was very poor looking, plus cops were on every corner. The hotel is mainly for older crowds; not geared toward younger crowds at all. No hip hop or R&B in sight. It did seem to have the best and largest beach on the strip, from what I saw. The beach was nice, as well as the free chairs and umbrellas. The room was nice and a decent size. Due to my research in advance, I requested the main tower, since the reviews stated that the main tower was updated. We received the end unit, which included 2 huge balconies on each side. One for the city view and one for the partial beach view and this was a great view and there was no need to pay the extra daily fee for the beach view. The city view wasnâ€™t something to look at in awe, it was all poor and nothing to brag about. The one thing we had a complaint about was the uncomfortable beds and over used pillows with no cushion or fluff at all. Just flat as soon as you lay on it and we woke up every morning in pain from the bed! There are no TV channels but fortunately we brought our portable DVD player and hooked it up to the TV. Definitely not a party city at all. Mainly a spot to just chill and relax. For transportation we used the public transportation and taxiâ€™s. The bus did take forever but it was only 75 cents. The streets are awful. If you want to rent a vehicle, I would only do so if you are planning to venture out and I would only rent for a day or 2 and rely on public transportation for the rest. Donâ€™t drive to Old San Juan. You will be in traffic on their 1 way narrow streets forever! Save on money from the rental and parking at hotel. Many spots were in a reasonable distance. The streets are so narrow and small and everyone drives like a crazy person; even the bus driver! We mainly stayed on our little strip. Wish we went further out to sightsee so that we could have seen the beautiful part of PR because from what we saw it wasnâ€™t that beautiful. When you have been to Hawaii and Aruba, you expect that all the time but it was still a great trip and it was very relaxing. They donâ€™t really cater to visitors. You need a translator while there because no one speaks English and everything is written in Spanish. Every time you talked to some one, they never understood you. Old San Juan is a good shopping spot but very crowded and the streets are worst there. Over all we had a great time. They did have this Japanese restaurant across from the Walgreens, next to the hotel and it was very good! There are a few good eating spots on the strip as well. The weather was perfect but the waves were very rough. The pool is very small and it think it only goes up to 3ft. That was a bummer. I would visit again, a few years from now and only for the purpose of venturing out to sightsee the beautiful spots that I was told about. Also be prepared to spend because it s very expensive and it shouldnâ€™t be, especially since it isn't the most beautiful location. Fortunately we had a $200.00 credit to use at the hotel. Saved us some money. Also if you are a rewards member, take advantage of the Pent House Executive Lounge. They have great continental breakfast, evening finger foods and desserts( Free) and unfortunately we didnâ€™t find this out until a day before we left. It was very nice in there, with a nice setting and couches, TV's and huge balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Top Spot in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: BermudaDon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location, with many restaurants & bars in walking distance! Pool with water slide & pool bar very nice! I would stay at this hotel the next time I am in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel certaintly not a resort”
Reviews.Author: travelergo
Reviews.Content: Just came back last night from Puerto Rico. 3 of us stayed here for 2 days, one night for business. We only stayed here because the traffic is terrible in PR and it was located near our business meetings. Otherwise we would have stayed at the Hilton or another place. Weather was hot and humid raining both days. This is an average hotel. Negatives: Can't change temperature of AC setting lower than 68 degrees and therefore room was very warm. I stayed on 8th floor of west wing and my boss and other colleague stayed in main tower rooms which were run down and old looking. My room was much better with a mini fridge and 2 free bottles of water and it was not run down. Their room did not have this. I didn't like that there was no cold water in the sink or shower. I don't know why? I took a quick hot shower with it turned all the way to cold but it only came out warm/hot. I was not given any Bath and Body works conditioner. Only shampoo and body lotion. Food was OK nothing special. Positives: bed was comfy with lots of good pillows and towels were soft and fluffy. Drinks at the bar in the lobby were delicious and strong. Margaritas were very good and shots. Don't expect much as I would not stay here on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE...don't get sucked in like us!! Go to Aruba instead!!!”
Reviews.Author: christinejohn5403
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip to Puerto Rico and we must say it was the worst trip we have ever been on! The hotel was absolutely horrible! It was old and dirty. It rained the whole time we were there. There was nothing to do in the hotel. The casino only had slots to play during the day. The one night there was a fight on and the dealers were more interested in the fight then spinning the roulette wheel!! Unreal! There was only ONE restaurant to eat at in the hotel! "Tuscany" Unless of course you wanted to sit in a loud dirty lobby or pool bar to eat. The staff was extrememly unfriendly. I asked two different women, at the activities desk, what there was for us to do and I was basically made to feel that I was annoying them. The resort said there was parasailing, snorkeling, windsurfing, volleyball etc...I didn't see ANY of that at all! The pool was small and completely shaded. Forget trying to get any sun during the 2 minutes that it came out. The beach area was very small. All the lounge chairs are soooo close to each other. Oh...and forget looking out at the water...if you want a tan you need to turn the chairs around, facing the hotel, to get some sun on your face. Be careful...the staff doesn't like to get the chairs for you...eventhough it is their job!!!! The staff there was very laid back and could care less about waiting on us in a timely manner. We needed to order drinks two at a time because who knew when they would get back to get us another one. My husband and I were looking forward to a couple's massage, but forget it. They only had a couple single appointments open. Not too accomodating....guess they are low on staff. It took us a while to save up for this trip and we feel sick that our money and time was wasted on that dump! I will be recommending that all my friends and family go somewhere else if they are planning a trip!

Reviews.Title: “clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: lovetodine76
Reviews.Content: Clean, affordable, nice beach view. Housekeeping was excellent. My only gripe is that the hotel is old and in need of some updating. The plumbing was old and visible .The drapes were faded. The scene is not a young, active group. This hotel is geared towards families and gamblers. We went to other hotels for nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay For The Value”
Reviews.Author: family090
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel while trying to do a last minute trip to san juan. I was shocked at how good a value it was compared to other top hotels. The service was just okay. It seemed to get better as the days went by. There was never really anyone at the concierge desk and they didn't seem to want to answer the phone when you called the front desk, room service or concierge. The pool and beach was great. They even have a slide for children and the adventurous adult. They have a kiddy shallow pool great for young children that was the biggest I had ever seen at a hotel. The service by the pool was good. The beach chair setup help was also good when we wanted to have a seat at the beach and they had plenty of umbrellas. The hotel does seems as though it would be extremely crowded during peak season because of the lack of space by the pool. But the beach was a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Chrisrae1968
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel right on the beach. We traveled with our 5 year old son who loved the pools and the water-slide. A very family-friendly resort. Rooms were large enough for the 3 of us and the beds were very comfy. Safe area to walk around at night with plenty of food places to choose from. Tuscany restaurant at the hotel was delicious. Drinks were a little expensive but if you take advantage of the specials at the pool bar you can get a good deal. Property was very clean and staff always friendly and courteous. We were extremely pleased with this hotel and will certainly stay here again when we return to PR.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was nice, clean, and affordable”
Reviews.Author: kellyvb
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a nice location and great views from the room. The breakfast buffet was too expensive, but it was included in our package. Ladies night was fun and affordable. Overall, the we had a positive stay and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Girls Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Etta231
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Rooms clean, pool fantastic, beach access wonderful. Just a four day weekend, but it couldn't have been better. Flew in from Boston with four other friends, and we all agreed that we couldn't have made a better choice. I've stayed in Isla Verde, but now prefer this location. Easy walking to many stores and restaurants. The water slide at the pool was also a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: olympicoscar
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out everything went smooth. Very professional staff got us checked in quickly and checking out was done over the phone. Room very clean, never a problem. A/C worked perfectly, beds were comfortable, and balcony, we did oceanfront, was a perfect view. Dinner was good at the Tuscany Restaurant. Only did buffet breakfast twice, eggs are powdered eggs. The beach is spectacular, but you really can't swim in it, waves too rough. Pool is excellent. Best hot tub I've ever been in, just the right temperature to make you want to stay all day. Staff was very friendly. Drinks are expensive but were of excellent quality. We arrived on a Saturday night and the hotel was alive. I thought I was in Las Vegas. Enjoyed walking along Ashford Road in the mornings, very safe. Old Town is my favorite part of the city. Wife kept winning at the casino so we took cabs all over the place. Outstanding restaurants we ate at included Marmalade, Pamelas, and Pikayo. All in all we would return to this hotel. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: stefferg
Reviews.Content: Best service and nicest people on the island

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was super, but..”
Reviews.Author: ferrygirl
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms on the same reservation. One room was ready 4 hours before the other and was given to my travel mates and it had a nice view (semi-ocean). My room was not ready until after 4 PM and was not as nice. After some dickering with the front desk staff the manager got involved and we were moved to a better room, but on a different (lower) floor than our friends. No big deal. The hotel itself was clean and the beds were super. I would stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: PattyG12
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel at about noon. We were able to check in right away. The desk clerk was very polite and helpful. We were on the 16th floor. The beach view was amazing. The room was well maintained and clean. There is a nice bar in the lobby. There are several restaurants in the hotel as well. The casino is smaller than I'm used to but I wasn't there to gamble. Only 2 suggestions. First, the hotel restaurant was VERY expensive for breakfast ... but there was a starbucks across the street that we could have gone to. Second, we were meeting some friends in the lobby for drinks in the evening. It was fine until they started the live music. It was so loud that we all gave up and went to our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: shannonziggy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott San Juan for a girls weekend, and would recommend this hotel to anyone! The hotel was so accommodating, they went above and beyond with various requests that we had, and even sent us a wine and cheese basket to congratulate my friend on her upcoming wedding. The pool and beach were beautiful. We took a walk around and the surrounding area (Condado) is a tad run down - a couple empty buildings, etc. but it still felt very safe and was close to San Juan and Isla Verde. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach/pool area nice staff willing to help busy street”
Reviews.Author: medtravel
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, got a great deal on priceline using highest star option and low bid. The pool and beach area are fantastic. I did'nt realize there would be a gtreat beach here. The chairs are provided by the hotel too. Casino on premisis, didn't use it. I stayed one night before taking a cruise out of the port there.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing trip to San Juan”
Reviews.Author: mrs_flats
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a girls' weekend in San Juan and we stayed at the Marriott Resort & Casino. We booked the hotel online after reading lots of reviews and were happy with our choice. We checked in early - very quick - and got upgraded to a partial oceanview room. Our had a nice view and was a recent size - we had comfortable beds, but didn't spend much time in the room. The breakfast buffet (only time eating in hotel) was totally overpriced, and only okay, but it was part of our package. The pools are nice, but the pool bars close on the early side (4 or 5pm and the pool is open until 11pm). It rained every day, which is typical for Puerto Rico, but we still had a great time. Lots of fun in the casino and ladies' night on Thursday with $1 drinks was awesome. Though in an okay spot on the beach and near a street with lots of touristy restaurants and shops, my one complaint is that we had to take a cab everywhere. We did know that ahead of time and rented a car for a couple of days to go across the island. All in all, we had a good stay and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jam145
Reviews.Content: I researched through trip advisor for our stay at San Juan for my husbands birthday. We had never been to san juan and I was a little leary about what the hotel would be like. I have to say the hotel is beautiful and being in the hotel industry myself I couldn't find anything I didn't like about this property. The check in was fast and efficient, and every employee was as kind as they could be. We really wanted for nothing. We had a breakfast package with our stay and also had dinner there a few times. All the meals were hot and delicious. The grounds and interior of the hotel were impecable and it was run like a fine machine. I truly cannot say enough about our stay. What a great place!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: MisstheDogs
Reviews.Content: After a somewhat disastrous stay at another San Juan hotel, I was looking for an uncomplicated visit -- one without problems -- and got it. I had a city view room on the 20th floor that, if I craned my neck, allowed me to see the beach. (As a platinum member, I was supposed to have an upgrade but the hotel was fairly full and I can't complain given that I had a high floor). The room was good-sized, with a chaise lounge, flat screen TV with many channels, and a nice-sized bathroom. Nothing special but also nothing to complain about. Room amenities include a mini-fridge (no mini-bar) and free bottled water daily. Room was very quiet and elevators were generally prompt. The concierge lounge is large but not as "personal" as I've found lounges at other Marriott hotels. Still, there is a nice breakfast, evening desserts, and a cash bar as well as a computer where you can print out your boarding pass. The main lobby bar is bustling in the evening. I ate at Tuscany -- prices were OK, service was attentive, but the food was only average. However, there are many and varied restaurants a very short walk from the hotel, so lots of choices. The location of the Marriott is a big plus as compared to other luxury hotels in San Juan which are a bit more isolated. The lobby store (sundries) is supposed to be open until 10 p.m. but was routinely closed around 8. There is on-site parking and valet service was extremely prompt. The concierge desk was always crowded, so never stuck around to use it. Because I was here on business, I didn't use the beach, pool, or other amenities. Overall, the Marriott is a "safe" choice. I can't say it's exceptional in any area, but I also experienced zero problems. If you're coming as a business traveler, it's a good choice. If you're on a vacation, I'd check out reviews from those who had that as their purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: tripgirl09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott at the end of our 7 day cruise out of San Juan. We arrived at the Marriott at 9:30 am for check in. We asked for early check in but did not know we would get to the Marriott quite so early. When we walked in, there was a sign saying that check in is at 4:00 pm. My husband and I both were a bit worried that we would have to wait around for a room. The person at the front desk was extremely accommodating allowing us to check in early and even gave us a better room with a pool and ocean view. The room was very nice, spacious, and well decorated. We hung out at the pool and jacuzzi. The beach crew were fabulous as well with setting up our beach chairs and umbrella. I highly recommend the Marriott. My husband and I both wish we could have stayed a few days longer!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, BEAUTIFUL!”
Reviews.Author: PabloJr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SJMaSC for four nights in late September. I read the reviews and was looking forward to my stay. There are hotels with more of a frontside presence like the luxury hotels in Isla Verde, but don't let the entrance to this hotel ( which is still very nice) fool you. Its a SOLID four star hotel. I was greeted upon arrival by the doorman. Check-in was flawless. We were able to check in a couple hours early, no problem. The room I requested was a spotless, 2 queen bed room with plenty of space. The bathroom was a nice size. Common areas we're very clean. The pools were very nice. Plenty of lounge chairs on the beach and by the pool. The lobby seems to be a popular place to party at night. I could hear the music from my room on the fourth floor. It wasn't bothersome because we weren't light sleepers and we were a bit jet lagged. Its definitely something to take into account when I return. Nice cafe in the lobby stocked with local pastries. Thats the only thing I ate but the hotel does offer other options on the premises. Be prepared with your taxi fare... it seems to take $20 each way to get anywhere close by. Overall I gad a great relaxing time and would definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at how nice the staff was and liked the location.”
Reviews.Author: RobertG13
Reviews.Content: I am usually a solo traveler looking for cultural trips not relaxation/spa. I booked here because I got a good deal and I wanted a hotel on the ocean. I was impressed by the attentiveness of the staff. They were all very friendly and helpful. I got a Cabana room on the second floor which faced the two pools and the ocean. The room was basic and clean although it had the usual nicks and dirty spots on the walls which one would expect. The pool stays open until 11:00 pm playing music that seeps into the room so if you are an early sleeper you might want to ask for a room in the tower. I read a review that said the main Lounge attracts locals as well as guests. I've seen many hotels tout this same message only to find an empty bar but not so here. Saturday and Sunday nights were packed with both locals and guests. They had a band playing music and an instructor giving dance lessons early in the evening. Monday night it was empty. The casino was much bigger than expected. 24 tables of various games, all were open and full on the weekend nights. The beach and pool areas were clean and well staffed. There is a tour service booth inside the hotel which you can book trips to the rainforest, Old San Juan or the Bacardi rum tour. I ate in their Tuscany restaurant my last night. It was typical of the higher end hotel restaurants. The food and service were good but pretty much unmemorable for me. I didn't eat at either two of the hotels other restaurants, use the spa or the fitness center so I can't review those. Outside and surrounding area. The hotel is in the Candado tourist area along the northern coast just east of Old San Juan. The taxi trip from the airport was fixed at $14. Stepping out of the lobby brings you onto Ashford street. There are Walgreens both east and west. I would recommend the one east (make a right) of the hotel it was much bigger and cleaner. Either direction on Ashford will bring you to a good selection of restaurants and bars. If local food is for you I would suggest the Latin Star. Open 24 hrs just east of the hotel and next to the Walgreens. It's a dive, the service can be slow but the menu has plenty of local dishes. If you care not for ambiance and time is of no concern I recommend trying it out. I walked to Old SanJuan but it took longer than the 35 minutes they said it would take. Head east and keep the shore on your right. it took about 45 to 50 minutes. Taxi back from Old San Juan cost me $15. I enjoyed my stay and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: nan2370
Reviews.Content: I always look to stay at the Marriotts because my experiences with them are always good. This hotel....was top dog for a Marriott. The restaurants could use some work. But overall, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Even over La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, would go back”
Reviews.Author: montreal_girl13
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was a little concerned about serviceâ€¦ I must say â€“ the entire staff was exceptionally helpful. We got there early (about 2h00pm), got checked in right away with no hassle and got a room upgrade to pool/ocean view. Do try and get the newer tower â€“ thatâ€™s where we were and it was very nice. Clean, spacious, great bathroom, etc. Was very happy to have a minifridge in the room as there is a Walgreenâ€™s across the street. The beach was clean and chairs / umbrellas readily available. Location is perfect â€“ several restaurants in any price range are within easy walking range. Itâ€™s a busy and safe area, we never felt uncomfortable. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful â€“ they directed us to some great restaurants (CafÃ© de Angel in particular) and knew the area quite well. Cleaning staff was also very good as well as friendly. The only staff that seemed â€˜offâ€™ were the casino employees. Table dealers didnâ€™t even look at you and really seemed annoyed to be thereâ€¦ Overall, I would go back to this hotel and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not sure if I'd go back.”
Reviews.Author: hennaeel
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for 5 days. It was sort of an interesting place. I'll break it down: Pros: -Stayed in the new hotel on the 18th floor with an ocean view and a balcony. This was seriously my favorite part of the entire hotel. The view was terrific. Upgrade to an ocean view. -The beach iteself seemed ok. I've never actually done the whole beach vacation thing (this was my first trip ever to an island!) so I went in thinking white sands and miles of it. Condado beach is not huge and it's probably not the best beach on the island. It did serve its purpose though-was usually not that crowded, the water was warm, and there were chairs and umbrellas available -The Italian restaurant was good and reasonably priced for a hotel restaurant. -The bar downstairs in the lobby had some great bartenders. Go down and have a cocktail (the snack mix was kind of strange-it had croutons in it or something) -A nice, big busy gym that's open 24 hours. State of the art machines and a good free weight section. Cons: Housekeepers were adorably sweet and kind, but the room wasn't really as clean as I'd like it. Hairs in the bathroom upon arrival, and a wet facecloth stuck to the shower curtain. There was only one restaurant open that I could tell. The other might have been, but it was under construction and I couldn't find it. Gates to the beach were usually closed by dark and heavily guarded. There were abandoned and ramshackle buildings on both sides. Strange place for a resort, I thought. The pools were tiny, and I thought there would be an adults only pool that had a swim up bar. The pool with the swim up bar was kid friendly. All in all, the stay was good enough, and I'd recommend it but stress my cons. I'm not sure if I'd stay there again, but that might be because I liked Old San Juan a lot, and because I'm planning on spending more time in Fajardo when I return.

Reviews.Title: “I never thought I'd love staying at a Marriott in Puerto Rico but...”
Reviews.Author: ChiRedFlyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel and casino is perfectly located in beautiful Condado. I stay in Marriott' all the time and although they are clean and "nice" rarely do I have the fun in the hotel as I did at this resort/casino. Bands and dancing every night. Casual or dressy acceptable. The casino had low limit tables with very friendly dealers/pit bosses. Free soup and sandwiches @ 4am!!! I was in heaven. The beach is fantastic w/ guys who will help you w/ chairs, drinks, umbrellas. Stunning views. I know this is standard at the resorts but the staff was always friendly w/o seeming fake. Pool was very nice but I would have preffered a little more supervision of the kids doing backflips @9pm off the side of the hot tub. Restaurants not bad, not great. Little cigar, jewelry, craft stands set up during the day are very nice and affordable if you don't want to go back into Old San Juan for last minute shopping. If you do venture downtown, the bus stops right down the sidewalk from the entrance. Did I mention the staff was great? Concierges especially helpful. Carlos knows everything you want to know about PR. Unfortuately, fitness center/spa staff...not so much. I still used the facilites but don't depend on them for anything too complicated down there. Finally, there's a Starbucks, Walgreens and Haggan Daz steps away across the street. Clubs and late night dining nearby, but if you don't feel like leaving, the lounge in the lobby can be quite fun. I would have liked a slightly larger mini fridge in the room and maybe some sort of screen on balcony so you can enjoy the ocean air w/o mosquitos at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, we would go back”
Reviews.Author: lovetooogetaway
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and we would recommend it to anyone travelling to San Juan. We were a little concerned when they gated up the beach at about 6pm but we felt safe walking around the area and it was close to many shop and restaurants. We visited Old San Juan and the rainforest.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Diva-Three
Reviews.Content: Overall: A great hotel. Everyone at the hotel really goes out of their way to make sure that everyone has a nice enjoyable stay. Prior to going, counldn't decide on thise hotel or the Conrad. Both were very close in price, but after reading some not so great reviews about the Conrad, decided to try the Marriott. During the vaca, I decided to walk down to the Conrad to check it out, since it's about a 10 minute walk away. I did a quick walk through of the lobby bar, gift shop and the casino which is located on the second floor. The Conrad was a little too modern for me and felt a little cold. I made a wise decision with the Marriott. Length of Stay: Sunday, September 5 to Wednesday, September 8 Below are short reviews of the things visited at the resort. If I go back, without a doubt I would stay here again. Room Arrived around 12 to find the room not ready. I expected this because check in is not until 4. I was offered the use of the spa to change and told that I could be contacted via cell phone when my room was ready. Took the cab into Old San Juan and did some shopping there. Received a phone call around 4 that the room was ready. Had a room on the 18th floor with a city view. Small fridge and coffee maker. Bathroom with tub and toiletries from Bath and Body Works. All in all a nice clean room. The hotel is about a one minute walk from a 24 hour Walgreens and there are several fast food and regular restaurants nearby. Directly across the street is a Starbucks and ice cream place. To the right of the hotel is a Wendy's, Subway and Dunkin Donuts. To the left is a Burger King, Subway, another Walgreens, Uno (pizza place) and Fuddruckers. Also there are several restaurants nearby. Transportation Be prepared to pay for taxis. Cost from airport to hotel is $16. Cost to Old San Juan is $14 and the cost to the mall, Plaza Los Americas is $15. There is a bus that will take you to downtown San Juan and the bus stop is a few yards from the hotel, but after waiting for close to 30 minutes, gave up and took a taxi. I knew from ready other posts, that there was not a set schedule. Food at Hotel Only ate one meal at the hotel, at La Vista. Wanted something quick to eat before lunch and had a plaintain stuffed with ground beef appetizer. It was $9 and a diet coke was $3. Had a great drink at the huge lobby bar, don't remember the price. And usually the pool bar has some type of drink special between 4-6. Beach/Pool Beach is great with lounge chairs/umbrellas. The pool is also nice with plenty of chairs. Business Center 4-5 computers for use and printing available for a price. If you need to print a boarding pass, you may do so at a printer especially for boarding passes at a small kiosk before you get to the lobby. Fitness Center Used this every day, great treadmills, bikes, free weights. Also fruit and tea available. Added bonus - cold towels for use after a workout. Casino Lots of slots and I recall seeing 1-2 blackjack tables and a few other games.

Reviews.Title: “Before and after cruise”
Reviews.Author: AllenTxCruiser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris one night before our curise (9/4) and one night after our curise (9/12). Overall we thought the cleanliness, location, room, service and value for the money was above average. If we had one complaint it's the price of food and the casino. We used reward points to pay for the hotel and breakfast buffet (menu was not available with reward points) but the cost of the breakfast would have been $42.69 PLUS a 15% automatic tip for the two of us. There was no chef cooking eggs, just metal bins with cold scrambeled eggs, cold bacon, cold grits which looked like cup cakes, and cold sausage links. Sure they had toast and fruit but its way to expensive for the overall quality. If I had to pay cash I would have been really pissed. Also we are gamblers and realize the house is at a great advantage, but this casino is just plain taking your money. Heck, crurise casinos are noted for having tight video poker, etc, but this hotels casino was ten times worse. YOU WILL LOOSE ALL YOUR MONEY. STAY AWAY FROM THIS CASINO, unless you only play table games. Since we disemarked at 9:30 AM at the end of our curise we stopped at the Sheraton in Old San Juan and played in their casino before getting luch. Even though I lost money and my wife won some, we had alot more fun. If I every embark out of San Juan on a curise I will probaly look into staying at a hotel in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Great Hotel,Woderful Vacation,Will Stay Over Again Without a Doubt”
Reviews.Author: NY1PR2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel from August 27 to September 4. This has been out third stay in 4 years. We stood in 2007,2008 and now in 2010 and it just keep getting better and better. I will like to say that I was a little concerned about staying at this hotel again when I was going to book my reservation back in May this year because of some negative reviews that I had been reading back then. I know that it is almost impossible to please every guest that stays at any given hotel because there will always be something that someone will pick on regardless how much the hotel will try to go out of their way to please their guests. I know this for a fact since I work more or less in the same type industry where I have to try to keep happy almost 1,000 tenants in a private owned complex of 21 buildings in Queens, New York and there is always someone who is never happy no matter how much you try to do so. However before making the reservation I decided to place a call to the hotel and speak to the Manager Representative Mr. Julian Cable Treadwell. He was not available at the time so I left him a message and within an hour Mr.Treadwell was nice enough to returned my phone call and we spoke for a few minutes. I expressed to him my concerns about the hotel and he assured that my concerns had been corrected and that I will enjoy once again my stay at the San Juan Marriott Resort. I have to admit that after speaking to Mr. Treadwell I felt so confident that I went ahead and booked my reservation to stay at the hotel for the third time. It has been another great decision to stay here again. The complete hotel staff have always made us feel like family. From Willie and Gilbert (parking attendants) at the front when you arrive who always greet you with a wide smile and right away help you with your luggage. They make you feel as if you have come back to your home away from home. We didn't have to wait to check in. We went straight to the front desk and were met by Stephanie who had such a beautiful smile.She welcomed us to the hotel and helped us get the best room that we were pleased with. She was able to accomodate us on the 18th floor with a pool/ocean view room. She was so helpful and nice to us that we want to say , "thank you Stephanie." We went up to our room #1805 and were so happy with it because first of the spectacular view of the Ocean/Pool and the Condado area and second because of the cleanliness and comfortable beds and spacious rooms that we know that this hotel is cable of providing for their guests. As we expected the bathroom was spotless clean with plenty of towels. First thing we did was to jump on those comfortable beds. They are the most comfortable beds we have ever slept on. We went out for dinner the first night and after returning to our room there was a knock on the door and after opening the door to see who it was, there was a waiter with a wonderful welcoming gift for us from the hotel compliments of the Marketing Administrative Assistant,Miss Melissa Delgado. I had the great pleasure of talking to Miss Melissa Delgado a few days prior to my departure to Puerto Rico just to make sure that everything was in order with my reservation and she assured me that everything was just as schedule with my reservation and that if there was any problems at check in to please contact her right away. I specially want to say, "thank you so much Miss Melissa Delgado" for such a wonderful welcoming gift and having the pleasure of meeting you in person. Your professionalism and dedication to the San Juan Marriott Hotel and their guests is greatly appreciated. The hotel is always looking to be better year after year. Right now they are in the process of finishing remodeling La Vista Restaurant which is located in the ground level next to their other Restaurant,Tuscany Italian Restaurant. We didnt get to eat at Tuscany because of lack of time but I heard from other guests at the hotel that the food was excellent. The Hotel is located in the heart of the Condado area. In front of the hotel accross the street is a Starbucks and Hagen Daz. To the right of the Hotel just a block away is a 24 hours Wallgreens which we went to pack munchies,water,juice and sodas since each room in the hotel is equipped with a mini fridge for your convenience. If you continue to the right of the hotel in another two blocks you will find Wendys,Pure and Natural,and Basking Robbins besides a number of restaurants that serve local Puerto Rican food. To the left of the hotel you will find more restaurant such as Yerbabuena,Danny's International Pizzeria,Burger King,FuddRuckers and many others which I can't remember the names. If you want to wonder off the Condado area an try local food I will suggest to go to Pinones area. It is right behind the airport and an area which its known for its many Kiosks which offer many fried delicacies of Puerto Rico. I highly recommned to go to Mi Casita. There We had the best Fried Red Snapper with Tostones and salad that we had in the many places that we tried this dish. Please do not expect a high end restaurant with Air Conditioning. It is an open Kiosk near the ocean but the food its amazing! If you want go for a ride then travel east to the town of Luquillo via Route #3 and try Pasta Y Pueblo. Right now they have 57 reviews (not counting mine yet)and they are all positives. We are talking about the best Mahi Mahi I have ever tried!! and trust me that I have eaten this fish in New York many times in a lot of high end restaurants and they do not come close! Their coconut rice is to die for. Their pineapple flan was delicious. We wanted to try this shack/kiosk type restaurant after reading so many reviews and they were not wrong. They deserve all the positive reviews!! Do not be fool by the look of the place. This is what we call a hole in the wall place.There is only 5 tables and no ac. It is about half a block of the beach so you always get a breeze.They open from 5pm until 11pm . It is run by the owner Freddy and his wife and they are the most friendliest people you want to come across. Freddy comes out to greet you and to ask you if you were please with the food and to chat with every customer for a few minutes to find out were you are visiting from. In all I have to say that my family and I had a great time in Puerto Rico the 8 days that we were there. As always our stay at the San Juan Marriott Resort and Stellaris Casino has been a wonderful one. On Monday August 30 Hurricane Earl was passing near Puerto Rico and the hotel management handle the situation with the utmost professionalism making sure every guests was secure and at the same time comfortable considering that most of the Condado area that afternoon and night was completely shut down. The dedication,friendliness and professionalism that my family and I I have witnessed from all the employees and staff at this hotel is the best one that I have ever experienced in any other hotel that I have stay in Puerto Rico. I never heard one complaint from any of the guests that were staying at the hotel that I had the opportunity to talk to. I spoke to many guests whether at the pool,beach, bar or at the front of the hotel wating for my car. They were all very happy that they chose this hotel and in fact many of them assured me that they will choose this hotel again when coming to Puerto Rico. I will continue to make the San Juan Marriott Resort and Stellaris Casino my home away from home when traveling to Puerto Rico and I will Highly recommend it to all my family and friends. To all the staff at the hotel and specially to Mr. Treadwell and Melissa Delgado, thank you so much for making us feel at home again. It was a great pleasure staying at your hotel again. We look forward to see you again in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Not great but/and not awfull”
Reviews.Author: vmimartins
Reviews.Content: Sometimes it seems like we aren't talking about the same place. This hotel can get great and lousy comments... so here is my opinion. The Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino is an old 4* hotel. We arrive late (11 PM) so we didn't get any trouble in check in. The lobby is huge as it has a bar in the middle â€¦ Some nights there is a live band on the lobby and is quite noisy... really noisy but, it's the Caribbean and we were in holidays... so no complain as in our room there was no sound at all. We upgraded to a ocean/swimming view room and the room was really big maybe because it was a room for disabled. No bad smell, clean and yes the decor is dated. Didn't try any restaurants in the hotel... there are so much of them outside â€¦ The swimming pool and beach are nice but not overwhelming . There were always chairs available and the service was a bit slow. There was some construction going on a restaurant by the pool but it was almost unnoticed. We didn't try the casino so cant give any info about it. The hotel was in a great location and there are always taxis available outsidel. Can also get the bus to Old San Juan just outside the hotel (21C). We would stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone staying in San Juan for a nice stay. If you are looking for an outstanding luxurious vacation this is not the place......

Reviews.Title: “A unique blend of business and resort makes this a special destination”
Reviews.Author: STLRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Summary: September 2010 was my second stay at this property. My first was this past December 2009. Since the purpose of that December trip was all pleasure and the purpose of this recent September 2010 trip was all business I can give you my thoughts from both perspectives. I'll start off with the December trip and then simply add anything that needs to be said relating to business travel at the end of the review. Consider the comments otherwise to apply to both trips. The short story is that this is a wonderful property. The December 2009 stay was purely for pleasure with my Wife for our annual week of where should we go and where should we stay with the Marriott brand. I'm a Platinum, so I do get to stay at many of Marriott's properties and I can tell you that this property is an excellent choice for either business or pleasure trips. Check in and check out is down to a science at this property and was very friendly and easy. Room: The first room was very nice and was a corner room facing the east and ocean view. We wanted the West and ocean view and we were able to change after the first night. Bathrooms are not as large as some other resort only properties, but are large enough that you shouldn't have any issues when traveling with two in a room. Add two other kids and you might find it tight if everyone wants the bathroom at once. The room itself is very spacious, maybe not as large as some other resort only properties, but still my rooms were very nice and spacious. The balcony gives you enough room to relax and enjoy the view of the beach and ocean. Corner rooms have two balconies which is nice. Plenty of windows for an open spacious feel. Housekeeping was excellent and not one complaint. No musty smell in the room either trip. Elevators were speedy and always working. This property really rocks in the Bar / Casino area of the main lobby starting Thursday evenings through the weekend. To say the lobby / Bar area is alive is an understatement. Not a negative at all, just the place is alive with locals and guests enjoying life and if you want to get away from the activity you can. Reading past reviews I would agree that requesting a room above the 8th floor would be a safe bet to make sure the noise from the lobby doesn't hit your room. Just ask the front desk and they'll know where to put you if a concern. Keep in mind if you have a car there will be a parking fee of $16 per day self park. The parking lot is connected to hotel for easy access. Go to the Quick pay window anytime to have your ticket validated with payment so you can leave when you are ready. Do this early in the morning before any lines, which I didn't experience. You will also be charged a $15.00 +/- resort fee which I believe includes some bottled water in your room, beach chairs, and probably some other stuff which I don't recall. This vacation trip was on points and they didn't charge the resort fee on top of the rewards points which is the right thing to do and so appreciated. Concierge Level: This property has a concierge level and is the Penthouse top floor. This is unusual being that most Marriott Resorts do not offer a concierge level and are usually only offered at their business non resort full service Marriott properties. Check with the hotel for hours of operation. Having access to the concierge level is a bonus when you are on vacation. You should consider getting an upgrade with access to the concierge if you don't qualify for complimentary access as a Marriott rewards member. It's a great place to simply sit out on the terrace for a great view of the city and the beach, read a book, watch the sunset, and enjoy the complimentary food and beverages. The breakfast offers plenty for a quick start breakfast. The evening food service is excellent. Every evening there's a nice selection of heavy horderves, e.g. Beef Wellington, imitation crab pasta salad (imitation, yes, but the best in any case), meat paella, and of course excellent deserts later in the evening. Enough offered if you want to skip going out for a full dinner and just enjoying the sunset from the balcony and relaxing. The automatic espresso machine is available throughout the day. Note: You are not supposed to take food from the concierge level and I can totally understand the practice being that it's primarily a resort hotel vs a business property. No explanation needed!! That said, I've never had anyone stop me when taking my morning latte out for a walk to the beach to watch the sun rise. I think it's either Tuesday or Wednesday night they have a Manager's reception and the food selection is kicked up another notch. Complimentary beer and wine that evening. Beach: The water tends to be a little rough and on both the December stay and most recent September stay you can always see a red flag as you enter the beach.
