Keep in mind a hurricane just pasted Puerto Rico (September 2010) and just be aware of tides, waves, currents, etc. Use your head and pay attention to the local warnings and you shouldn't have anything to worry about. This would apply anywhere you go. on vacation. IMPORTANT: There happens to be a group of large black rocks off to the west side of the beach property. You can't miss them. Don't think you can play around near those rocks and not risk getting severly hurt. During our December stay a women got a bit too close to those rocks and got pounded into the rocks and had to get pulled ashore. An ambulance was needed. I believe she was eventually OK, but the you need to respect those rocks. We noticed lots of body surfing and swimmers throughout the stay and otherwise no problems with the beach and water. The sand is wonderful; very fine, clean, and pleasant to the feet. You can take a nice walk on the beach either going west towards the Renaissance or to the east where you will see more wind surfing and more local beach goers. (Renaissance is another nice Marriott property - very different in look and feel) Casino: What can I tell you, it's a casino. Note that they do deal blackjack a bit differently, but I believe they always have at least one table where they deal more mainland US. It's a nice casio if you feel like making that kind of a donation to the Marriott property. Local Beach Area to get out your snorkeling equipment: There's a very nice small beach about a 20 minute walk from the hotel. The beach is nicely protected from the ocean by breakers and this is where I went to snorkel a few times during the trip. You won't see really large fish species, but there are plenty of different fish to see and is very convenient to the property. You could hop on the bus if you don't want to walk. To get to this beach, just walk outside the hotel and go right on Ashford, that's going west. This is probably not an area where a seasoned snorkler would make an effort to visit, but I enjoyed the snorking at this beach. Take a few beach towels with you for the beach and to dry off. I'm not going to discuss too much about shopping, what you can see and do in Puerto Rico because I'm sure many of the past reviews have lots of info. Here are some quick tips that I think will be of help. There's a Walgreens just down the block and liquor store a few blocks to the east on Ashford and one going west closer to the Renaissance Hotel. Other Tips: 1) Old San Juan: Go to Old San Juan of course. Take the public transportation, the bus just outside of the hotel and take it to the bus depot in Old San Juan. Then I suggest you hop on the FREE trolley system that will take you all over Old San Juan including to El Moro, the fort. What we did was simply ride around on the free trolley to get an idea of what we wanted to do, where to get off and spend time, etc. The fort is worth it, how can you not. There's another fort, Fort San Cristobal, which you can add on to your ticket to see that fort too, but we passed. I'm thinking if you have the time and like forts, you should do it. 2) Check with the hotel if any local art fairs, etc. during your stay: We were lucky to hit a local art fair that was taking place about 1/2 between the hotel and Old San Juan. We actually wound up walking there from the hotel and it's a bit of a walk, but very doable. The fair took place in the Parque Mua Oz Rivera and Sixto Escobar Stadium area. 3) Shopping: There's plenty to shop in Old San Juan. Some of the street vendors will be selling their goods, which will include sterlings silver. Just make sure the silver has the seal that it's real. Not saying anyone is trying to cheat. My wife bought a nice pendant and was very happy with the price and quality. There's a Marshall's in town too. 4) Restaurants: You can get lots of recommendations from past reviews or books, etc. Tip: Cheap tip - there's a Burger King a few clocks east of the hotel on Ashford and if you are looking to save or on a budget, you can order your favorite burger and take to the beach for a cheap eats vs spending a lot at the hotel. Save the bucks for a nice dinner. Lots of local restaurants east and west of the hotel on Ashford. Pizza at Danny's is very reasonable and the pizza was good. We took out one evening and brought back to our room to chill out and relax. Just make sure you check the pizza before you leave the restaurant as they either didn't understand what I wanted or simply gave me the wrong pizza. Can happen anywhere. Here's a wonderful restaurant frequented by locals: If you have a car, which we didn't on this trip, I highly recommend this local restaurant in Guaynabo. The restaurant is Pez Dorado Marisqueria, located in Caparra Shopping Center, Ave Roosevelt, Guaynabo, PR 00968, Phone: -------. I'm fortunate to now have clients in San Juan so I really enjoy going to local places, vs what you see as a tourist. This restaurant is an easy drive from the hotel and is worth the trip if you enjoy excellent seafood, at reasonable prices. This is a restaurant that you'd never think of going to because not in the mainstream of the tourist district. I've been to this restaurant twice and has quickly become a favorite of mine period. Ask at the hotel if you have any questions about the neighborhood, taxi transportation, etc. The owners and servers at this restaurant are fabulous and I feel part of the local family when I go. Business Trip Notes: Simply a wonderful experience to mix business with a little R&R. As a Marriott Platinum you will not be disappointed if you choose to stay at this property. Look for whatever special rates the hotel is offering. Parking and resort fees are extra, but not a show stopper to stay here. Concierge access is a no brainer. Too tired to go eat at the restaurant after a long business day, just spend the evening on the concierge level to relax, munch on the excellent dinner quality food, and maybe take out the laptop or smartphone to get some work done. This property allows you the best of both worlds. Typical concierge hours and says of operation, with access all day for coffee. The GM runs an excellent operation and hospitality is number one with all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Never, Ever Again”
Reviews.Author: laellabella
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was not a good experience. First, they checked us into a room in the older building (heads up -- there are two different buildings to the hotel -- and the older part is not at all a good place to be). The room smelled terrible, it had no view and the phones did not work. After we complained, finally, they moved us to a room in the newer tower (and we are platinum Marriot rewards members, so technically, we should have automatically been put in one of the ocean view rooms in the new tower, but they just neglected to do so for some reason). The newer room was better, but still old and smaller than expected. Bottom line -- the reviews and web site for this place are misleading. It is not at all what it purports to be. Turned out that the pool area was much smaller than anticipated, and only one of the restaurants at the place was open for business. At night, it touted itself as a gourmet Italian restaurant, but the food was Chef-Boyardee caliber at best (but still at gourmet prices). In the morning, it offers an over-priced breakfast buffet, where the food is cold (when it should hot) and overall is sub par. Plus, the staff were, for the most part, rude and difficult to deal with. And there is a sad, depressing casino directly off of the main lobby, This is simply not a resort -- its an old, over-priced hotel. We would not stay there again, even if they gave us the room free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - would stay again !”
Reviews.Author: RobbieB2
Reviews.Content: After reading some bad reviews, I was hesitant to choose this hotel for our stay, but I am glad I did. I found the hotel to be clean, the staff helpful, and we checked in early with no problem. The housekeeping staff did a great job everyday and were super friendly. When we called up for extra towels, someone was right there within minutes. The hotel was right on the beach, and the bar was great. We tried the lounge and the drinks, music, and atmosphere were great there too. I thought our stay here was a great value, and it even included 2 free breakfast bars everyday, which was a great value. I recommend this hotel. It was great for our stay, and we didn't have any problems!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell1168
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4-night stay at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino, and we had a wonderful time! The hotel was easy to get to with a taxi from the airport ($15 each way). The lobby is beautiful. Check in was a breeze and the woman at the reception desk was very helpful. We loved our ocean-front room. We were a little bummed we didn't get a king size bed, we got two double's instead, but it wasn't a big deal. The beds were super comfortable and appreciated other comforts such as in-room robes, coffee and water. We loved the swim-up bar! Drinks are a little expensive. $9 for a Pina Colada. But, we felt that it was worth it to have a fun drink in the pool or at the beach. Staff graciously hands out complimentary towels and bring chairs and umbrellas out on the beach for you. They had a DJ playing in the early evening (during happy hour especially) which could be a little loud. Not ideal for reading a book and relaxing, but can be fun. If you want to relax/read a book, you can do it during the day when the DJ isn't playing. We didn't eat at the hotel because there are a ton of great restaurants on Ashford Avenue. Miro (across the street from the hotel) and recommended by the concierge was our favorite. There was some construction going on during our stay, but that's to be expected since we visited in the "off season." We didn't try the casino. We thought the hotel was in a great location on a beautiful beach! Staff was helpful when we need a restaurant recommendation or reservation. Plenty of taxis are available outside the hotel. We were given a late check out without an additional charge and were able to leave our bags at the bell station while we went out to eat before our flight. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone staying in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont like mold and mildew stay away”
Reviews.Author: ScottandCammie
Reviews.Content: Here is my letter to Marriott about our stay there they decide that 15000 points that is worth about a half a days stay there was fair compensation. â€¢ Confirmation Number: 90169730 â€¢ Check-in: Thursday, August 5, 2010 (04:00 PM) â€¢ Check-out: Thursday, August 12, 2010 (11:00 AM) Dear Marriott, I feel as if I must speak out to you about my most recent stay at the Marriott Stellaris in San Juan, Puerto Rico and the week of our lives we wish we could reclaim. I have only been to two other Marriottâ€™s in worse condition than what this property was in. One has lost its branding and I am not sure of the other's current status; it was the Renaissance in West Chicago. I could not even make it one hour there before having to depart. Let me assure you that I should have departed this San Juan property as quickly as I checked in, even perhaps a bit quicker than that took. I will be doing bullets for the list of issue that I can recall starting from check in. 1. Room not ready at 2:30 PM. Not a problem since check in is at 4:00 PM. Finally received room keys at 5:45 PM. We did finally get lounge access after speaking to three different people; it was definitely not offered to us by the young lady whom checked us in, she was rather short with us and rude. 2. Conciergesâ€™ lounge has an overwhelming smell of mold and mildew that set my allergies off the minute I entered. There was no relief from this all week. I would have to say that they are in need of an extensive air handling systems cleaning, new drapes and carpeting to overcome this issue. I also witnessed the air return cover being opened and the filter being removed directly over all the food items that were out for breakfast one morning. I'm not so sure this is at all sanitary and it was done by William, from their engineering department, as they were trying to make it colder in the lounge. They did seem to do that for them. 3. Keys were brought to us around 5:45, we went to the room it was of decent size and the views were great. However, it had the same moldy mildew smell as the lounge did. I was offered to change rooms but figured the entire property must have an issue with mold and mildew and it did. I requested speaking to the GM and after 4 calls and two days of requesting this I received a call from what seemed like a rushed person whom did not want to listen to anything I had to say Hans something was his entire name I was able to make out. I was finally brought, after three days of asking, a filtration machine for the air quality in the room. Speaking of the air, it was set on the lowest cooling setting the entire week and never really cooled the room to an expectable sleeping temperature. They did come and look at it and gave me some line about the chillers are not being able to cool any better due to the temperature outside but in every other area of the hotel the air temperature was never an issue or was repaired if it were. 4. The room was in need of new drapes, valances, carpet, and a fresh coat of paint. I believe the drapes were a huge part of the odor problem as dust would fall off them when moved and there was a thick layer of dust on the valances as if they have never seen a vacuum or steam cleaner. I have photos of the room condition, so if you would like to provide an email or ftp link Iâ€™d gladly send them along to you. Shower worked in the bathroom but the tub did not, although you were able to fill it with the shower head. One could bathe even though the lever for the spout was not functioning. I told engineering that this needed repaired but that it could wait until I departed. It seems that the daily housekeeping is going to depend on who is working your floor that day; some days were great yet others did not exist. 5. I noticed, also, that the balcony was dilapidated on the ocean side of the room and was too scary to venture out onto since it seemed like it was breaking away from the building. Iâ€™m sure it is most likely sound enough to go out on the balcony, but just looked unsafe. 6. My wife was bitten multiple times by something unseen I cannot confirm it was from bed bugs but it is my speculation. I have photographs of the bits if you wish to see them. 7. I had my laptop plugged into an outlet on the right side of the bed to charge it and when I touched the charger, it was hot enough to slightly burn the tips of my fingers instantly. This had never happened before. The battery was also extremely hotter then normal so I discontinued the use of that plug and notified maintenance. They had multiple people come and examine the outlet and said they didnâ€™t see a problem with it but didnâ€™t want me to use it for my PC any longer which was a no brainer, however now it seems like my PC doesnâ€™t want to hold a charge on the battery so seems like it had somewhat of an adverse effect on the PC. My son charged his using the lamp on the desk and never had a problem. That is where I switched to for my PC after the issue and the charger never got over heated in that outlet. I know of at least one other family that had a similar issue at your property while we were there and their daughter's PC had to get a new battery and charging cord. Not sure what the family's name was, but I just know he was part of the lighting crew for the movie crew of the Fast and the Furious Five. 8. I had very few meals here since the more frustrated I became, the less I wanted to spend a dime here. I had the lunch buffet one day and it was not very appetizing. The hot items were not at any rate but the cold items were enjoyable. The Red Snapper was over cooked and full of bones as if someone never fileted a fish before. The Pork Loin was dry from sitting and not having enough sauce in the dish with it to keep it moist. The chicken breast were the only hot entrÃ©e that was consumable and enjoyable to eat. My wife and son had burgers and fries and they were hot and tasty. I was even charged on my bill for something from the pool bar yet I never even used the pool bar. The $10.60 wasn't a big deal but itâ€™s just the point. Like being billed for internet and having to call and have it removed. Same with the local calls that I was told platinum didnâ€™t pay for. In general, everything here seem like a hassle and work when it should be relaxing and stress-free. 9. I feel I need to comment on the attitude of the employees. Nearly all are very short, some outright rude to speak with or obtain information from and become defensive when you ask them questions. I never, in my life, have seen six people needed to run the Conciergesâ€™ lounge and it, still, having an issue with running out of food. Tables have been left dirty all while they surf the net or talk and eat in the kitchen or take smoke breaks on the balcony. I will say that one attendant seemed to be trying much more so than the others. He was helpful and courteous at all times and that was Johan. I would say he is one of the few employees there that I feel is what I consider Marriott standards. But obviously my view and expectations are much higher than their GMâ€™s and other members of management there, to whom I cannot find many gracious things to say about either. So I say More Training for all of them seems to be in order. I could have sworn this was a franchised property. I would not recommend this property to anyone I know in its current state and wish I had never experienced it either. Perhaps I will try the JW Marriott Coco Beach Resort & Spa, Puerto Rico next time I come there. 10. I could go on and on about the negatives but I think that some positive comments are in order as well. The grounds are well kept and the pool was in decent shape most days. The Bellmen were always friendly and polite and the lobby looks amazing. The wait staff at the restaurants were always friendly, helpful, and courteous. We had a nice early dinner; the seared tuna and skirt steak were both very nice and the property seems to attract a nice mix of people. We always felt safe and secure while there. The bottom line is that you have a serious mold/mildew and electrical issues at this property and both are potential dangerous to your guest and the workers at this facility. There is also structural damage to the facing of the building on the balcony overlooking the ocean and this could potential become a falling concrete hazard to guest below near the bar and beach to pool courtyard. This could be an isolated instance on my balcony or could be a wide spread issue, I would have it inspected regardless if it is just the balcony off room 1909 or many others that are effected as it would only take one large piece of concrete debris spalling off and hitting a guest below that would result in serious injury or perhaps death! Please look into this matter urgently, I can provide pictures of the damage area if need. I feel as if I should be given back my Marriott reward points for this weekâ€™s stay so my family and I can take the vacation were expecting this one to be. http://www.ehow.com/about_5075172_dangers-mold-mildew.html http://www.arfamilies.org/health_nutrition/topics/air.htm http://www.epa.gov/iaq/pubs/insidest.html http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bedbug

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Bunnymay
Reviews.Content: I've read many reviews about this hotel and the comments made me very concern. Before I arrived in Puerto Rico I began to worry if I made the right decision to pick this hotel and to my surprise I am glad I stayed at the San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino. I've heard stories of guest arriving at the hotel and the room was not ready, the room was dirty and the workers were not nice. I totally disagree, the workers of the hotel were wonderful and yes, when I arrived the room was not available but I say don't panic. Remember, you are on vacation mode and give up your microwave mind. Everything is not going to be instant and with that in mind I was able to take advantage of my spare time. My children and I left our luggage supervised with the hotel workers in the lobby; this was suggested by the reservationist and she gave me a pager to let me know when my room was ready. Of course it did not work when we traveled a distance from our hotel but it was good to have when we came back to the hotel. My children and I took a walking tour of the hotel and the area outside of the Marriott. We found many resturants, a Star Bucks and Hazaan Daz across the street, local boutiques and a 24 hour Walgreens to the right of the hotel. When we got back we only stayed in the lobby for 15 mins and the room was ready. I was very nice to the reservationist and requested the best city view room she had. I was very bless she gave us a wonderful view on the 20th floor. I am a picky person when it comes to cleanliness. My room always stayed clean and the housekeeper gave many wash clothes, hand towels, towels and left plenty of complementary water in which I placed in my room's refrigerator. I only had one dislike and that was the beach. I not care for the beach behind the hotel. However, I enjoyed Luquillo Beach. It was wonderful! I will go back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Convienient Beachfront location”
Reviews.Author: rbtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of our Honeymoon, after we had completed a cruise. The Hotel was in very good condition, the rooms werent quite as nice as i had expected. I'd rate the decor 3.5/5 part it was very clean and tidy and the staff were great! We had breakfast included in our rate and the buffet was very substantial. The casino attached is quite small, but it seems to get a lot of customers. The bar in the lobby was fantastic, and they had salsa music and dancing one of the nights we were there. The hotel is located on a street that has lots of restasurants and places to eat. There is a walgreens about 1 monute walk away, which is like a pharmacy/supermarket - very cheap and very handy! We took a taxi to Old San Juan and this only cost us $15USD - the rate was pre-organised once we got in the cab - all taxis in San Juan seem to do this. Old San Juan is lovely! Its colourful and easy to navigate by yourself. I do recomend doing a proper tour for San Christobel and La Fortaliza as you will get so much more out of it than if you just look around yourselves, we combined ours with a tour of the Bacardi factory, which was really interesting! The Hotel is right on the beach, and you can get sunloungers put on the beach for you. Unfortunatley the water was very rough when we were there, and after about 10 mins of being hit by huge waves we didnt go back in the water. The pool is ok - it is very shallow, and the swim up bar was always closed when we were there, which was a little disappointing. However there is a pretty good waterslide which all the kids at the hotel seemed to enjoy greatly. Overall we enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “My 6th stay and we plan to keep coming back!!”
Reviews.Author: Dansladen
Reviews.Content: I had to travel again to San Juan for business and being summer and decided to have the family accompany me once again. The decision to stay at the Marriott San Juan did not take us very long to make as every time I go to San Juan for business, I always pick this hotel. I have to thank Ms. Melissa Delgado from the marketing department who surprised us one evening with a lovely gift that was left in our room. As with previous experiences, check in, rooms, service and amenities are always top notch and we have nothing to complain about. I highly recommend this hotel for any families and visitors to the San Juan area.

Reviews.Title: “Not much of a resort, but a decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: young814
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Stellaris for two nights after a taking a Royal Caribbean cruise. Having left the cruise ship at 10am, we were aiming to stay at this highly rated Marriott so we could get some R&R and spoil ourselves a little bit longer before returning home. We have been to numerous islands and stayed at many fine resorts. This was not a resort by any definition we are accustomed to. Early check in was not available,and the service at the front desk was intolerably slow and unfriendly whenever we asked for a status check. The hotel did not look much at all like the pictures on the internet. It is quite old, the casino is small, but the pool area and the beach area are very nice. We were able to use the facilities while we were waiting fo our room, so we took advanage of that. The hotel bars and restaurants were very expensive. I ordered a diet coke at the pool bar and paid $3 for a 16 oz plastic cup of the fountain drink. A bottled water at the pool will cost you $3 and most of the alcoholic drinks are $8 and up. Fortunately, there are enough dining options and bars within walking distance of the hotel. We also found a grocery store about a block from the hotel, where we bumped into other hotel patrons that were stocking up on milk, water and other staples (there is a mini fridge in the room, a huge plus). We got an ocean view hotel room with a balcony, which was very nice. The bathroom was large, and the beds were comfortable. The concierge that was working while we were there was not very knowledgeable about the surrounding area, restaurants, or attractions. You will learn more from reading the travel magazines in the room. For example, the concierge was not aware that many of the museums in Old San Juan are closed on Mondays and she thanked me for letting her know! I had to re-set my expectations and took the hotel for what it was, a hotel and not a true resort. If you don't go in with your expectations too high, you will have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: AllisonF3
Reviews.Content: this hotel is cab ride away from everything exciting. brava in el san juan is the best club, and bed lounge was also very fun on wednesday. awesome restaurants, shopping, sites, and clubs all close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Very good hotel. O.K. beach.”
Reviews.Author: Clement_the_Foodie
Reviews.Content: We just finished our stay in San Juan. I am 36, and this was my first real luxury hotel beach vacation experience. I will say it was very relaxing. The hotel upgraded us to a corner room with windows facing two sides for $50 + tax/night. We had a large private balcony overlooking the ocean. Very nice. The pool area, location (close to many good restaurants, bars, and other hotels/casinos), and staff were excellent. The beach here is kind of rough and not as pretty as some other places on the island. The hotel set us up on day trips to El Yunque and snorkelling. Both were excellent. The drinks at the bars were excellent and fairly priced given a hotel setting. The room service breakfast was overpriced and underwhelming though. Recommend walking across the street to Starbucks or Camille's sidewalk cafe for quality light fair at a reasonable price. My wife and I enjoy walking through hotels and looking at their facilities. We walked in every hotel on Condado, and concluded that if we return to Condado, this is the hotel. However, we are favoring Isle Verde next trip (maybe the Hotel Intercontinental) because of the better beach.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: VescoFam
Reviews.Content: Loved having the pool and the beach at the same hotel. Although the food, like in any hotel, is pricey - the location and staff were wonderful. Concierge staff were very helpful. The rooms were very nice and beds pretty comfortable. The cleanliness was very much appreciated and I loved seeing the staff clean around the clock regardless of what time I was walking around and where I was walking around the hotel. My favorite highlight of the day was waking up before the whole family and taking my book to the lobby, ordering a cafe con leche (=coffee with milk, which was not on the menu but made friends with the girls at the coffee stand and they made it on request).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Would stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel-a-lot-gal
Reviews.Content: We had the best time. The employees were friendly. The place was clean and had a ton to offer. It rained the week we were there, but had a blast. There was a misunderstanding at check in, but I called after our trip and the Marriott made good on it.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico much nicer than expected”
Reviews.Author: Stan24777
Reviews.Content: We just returned....my wife and two teenage girls. The hotel is very nice and the location is nice. A turn-off was when on the beach seeing an abandonded builing on each side with grafatti. Otherwise nice. Il Verde which is about fifteen minutes away is a nicer beach but the city is not quite as nice as San Juan. Some Tips: Food Shopping: Go to Super Max about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel - best prices and large selection Taxi's - cost $15 plus $1 baggage each to and from airport. Very reliable and we had nice cab drivers each time...you can negotiate with them. They will take you most places on the island. Bus - Although cheap 75 cents each way, come and go sporatically as you can wait an hour or more. If you hit it right, you can pick up a bus with-in 10 minutes. Food - The hotel has great specials. Was not impressed with Tuscany. Dani's international has great pizza...the other items are okay but not impressive, it's about a 5 minute walk. Tiajuanna's, about a 5 minute walk has good mexican food but the resturant next to it was fabulous...great hanger steaks and salmon, also good peene pasta alfredo. Jam and Marmalade are very good but way overpriced as they do not give you much food but charge a premium for it...although the food is really good. The Cordado hotel and casino about a 10 minute walk has a great breakfast. The Radisson hotel and casino serves a reasonable and good lunch. Excursions - The rain forest is nothing special but nice for nature lovers. Alot of walking up and down hills/steps. The water fall is beautiful. We did a snorking trip which was rather impressive. The crew was really nice..lot's of drinks and food...a really beautiful place on the carribean side about an hour away by taxi. One of the most beautiful places you'll ever see! All the snorking companies go there..it's about 25 miles from St Thomas Old San Juan - Beautiful with lot's of shops and resturants. The forts are really nice and El Mirro is on really beautiful grounds with the ocean as a back drop. Old San Juan was very nice. A must visit! Bacardi Rum Tour - nice and genorus with free drinks but it will cost you more than the "free" they talk about. First you pay for a ferry to go there which is cheap. Then when there, you are solicited to take a taxi to the factory as it is about 20 minute driving distance away. you have no choice. That will cost you about $3 per person. Return trip is the same price so multiply it X2. Il Verde Beach - Worth a day trip there. Beautiful beach with some beach bars/resturants right on the beach. Some tables of jewely and crafts also on the beach and they have massage's available on the beach. Marriott Hotel Thursday Night - There's a band or DJ with good old american music..60's, 70's, 80's and 90's. Dollar drinks for the ladies includes wine, mixed drinks but not frozen drinks...A GREAT DEAL! All in all, we travel to many islands and I did not expect much from Puerto Rico...It far exceeded our expectations as we would definetly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Time”
Reviews.Author: MotherHen
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week of July 5th and had a great time. here are some items I wanted to point out for others. Activities: Loved the convenience of having hotel arrange outings for the family. they may not be the highest rated trips on Tripadvisor, but having it all arranged for us was perfect. The activities desk has a daily breakdown of trips. They organize it all including pick-up from and to hotel. Hubby & I did the day sail/snorkeling trip w/ my 16-yr old son and 6 yr old daughter. Make sure you apply sunscreen several times throughout that trip. My daughter tried snorkeling and just loved it. We brought our own lifejacket for her. My daughter and I did the horseback riding trip. It was not bad, but a long trip for a 6-year old. You ride around flat lands with some hills (all privately owned). There was lots of mud and we got real dirty! Definitely wear capris to protect thighs from sun, wear sneakers because of the mud. it's windy too, so if you have long hair, wear ponytail. Toured Morro fort in Old San Juan on our own - took a taxi $14. VERY windy as well, but well-worth the trip. Beautiful views, GREAT history. We walked through the city of Old San Juan. VERY narrow streets and it was hot! Stores are okay. building/architecture really cool. Food: Executive Lounge @ Hotel. We were able to take advantage of the Executive Lounge due to my husband's marriott status. perfect for me as I am an early-riser. Got coffee, a small danish or fresh fruit and read my book. They had juices, oatmeal, cereals, eggs, breads, danish. REALLY GOOD coffee! Hotel also has a in-house coffee shop, but it's expensive. Right across the street is a Starbucks. We also ate in-house at Tuscany. Ricardo took great care of us and was able to make a small plate of food for my young daughter. They didn't have a kids' menu, but catered well to her. Food & service was great. Concierge will provide you local restaurants with walking times. We ate at the mexican restuarant Tijuana's (loved it!), the italian restuarant next to it (loved it) and a small diner across the street from it for breakfast (quick, simple, cheap and good). We ate at Parrot Club in OSJ (meh. Really noisy, wrong order, really slow service). Also ate at Ceviche - GREAT mofongo, great service, amazing menu. My husband and I also had a date night - just the two of us and ate at Ruth's Chris. GREAT service - same food you would find in any Ruth's Chris. Hotel: We did not experience any issues w/ anything at the hotel. The 4th floor ocean-view rooms are right in front of the trees - I loved it for the privacy, but my husband wanted "ocean view". They accommodated our request the next day and we got the same room on 9th floor. Rooms were very spacious, I thought. We had two double beds, the fold-out couch, and the balconies are very roomy. Bathrooms also spacious. They are not generous on shampoo/conditioner, but they will bring extra if asked. Pools were great and fun for both my son and daughter. We spent more time at pool than in the ocean. Pool bar fun, too! Bartenders/servers were wonderful. Food at pool was not great, but did the job. Casino was very clean and they give "lessons" every day. Add'l comments: Puerto Rico is hot. the restaurants are cold. My daughter would be uncomfotably freezing half-way through dinner. We started bringing a long-sleeve light jacket or shirt. Business center has free internet, but all other services will be billed.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel/resort: why all the complaining?”
Reviews.Author: lnktvlr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days in June and July and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. The location is great. You are a .75 cent bus ride from Old San Juan. The beach is nicely maintained, and the waves are big and fun. There are many good restaurants either direction on Ashford. Our favorites were Danny's for the breakfast sandwich on crusty french bread, and Angels for the Mofongo. As for the rooms: we started on the 7th floor in the Cabana tower.. It was great with a pool and ocean view. They seemed newer. The tv didn't work, so we asked for service. When they didn't respond after several days and requests, my partner went a bit ballistic. It could not be fixed, so, they moved us to a corner room on the 11th floor in the main tower. Fabulous view. Two balconys: one overlooking the ocean and the other onto the pool. The moral here: the real assertive and squeaky wheel gets the oil at this hotel. Other than that, the service was great. The employees are incredibly nice and accomodatiing. They truly go out of their way to make your stay pleasant. From the towel person, to the beach /chair umbrella guys, to the housekeeping staff. No complaints. Yes, there were locals on the weekends.at the pool. Probably graduation parties and proms. But it was no big deal and added to the flavor. FYI: you must try the Rumrunner! It was expensive but worh at least a round. Misc: the casino was a decent size, and they serve free drinks and food to the gamblers. Yes, it may take a little while to get your order (this is true of PR in general), but, hey it's free. So ask! The turkey and chicken sandwiches were good. The slots seemed tighter than in the states, though, my partner did hit a royal flush on a quarter poker machine for a thousand. The hotel restaurants are ok, nothing special. Though, both offer specials that are quite good deals. Ask for the "special menu". There is a Walgreens on Ashford and a dry cleaners a couple of blocks down Condado Avenue. You will find all that. There is grocery store within an eight minute walk. SuperMax. Easy to get to for those refrigerator and cooler items. Take a left out the hotel, go two blocks and take a right on Cervantes, walk until it dead ends and take a left on Wilson. It is about five block on your right. You will also pass a nice park to rest in on the way back! The only negative I can think of was the musty smell of the pillows. We asked for foam ones instead, but they smelled too. A little Fabreze and all was well. Last thing. If you can get a good rate at this hotel, you will not be dissapointed. Try the Marriott friends and family rate.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: peaches35
Reviews.Content: We were there for the July 4th week and we had a blast!!! This is our 3rd time at this hotel and we loved every minute of it. The staff at the restaurants, beach, pool, etc. were all wonderful. We always get the pool/ocean view room and as usual the room was immaculate. There are plenty of restaurants in the immediate area to suit everyone's taste. This hotel is centrally located and it is very easy to get around. The lobby bar gets crowded on the weekends but if this is not your "thing" you cannot hear the music and the people from the rooms above. I happen to love it so this hotel is perfect for me. In my opinion, this hotel is PERFECT and we LOVE it!!! We will continue to stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: CarlyAZ
Reviews.Content: My friend and I chose the San Juan Marriott because of the location. It is located in the heart of the condado district and on the beach. The hotel itself is fine, a little older but very clean and well kept. The only thing we weren't very impressed with was the inavailability of suggestions from the staff for anything the hotel wasn't affiliated with or selling. If you asked them about tours, restraunts, or bars that weren't located on the property they didn't seem to know anything. There are tons of awesome things to do in Puerto Rico and the hotel only sells so many tours. The door guys on the other hand are the people to talk to. They gave us pleanty of suggestions/tips for things that we were looking for! If you stay there and would like to know about fun things to do or a good restraunt I would defiantley ask one of the door guys they can point you in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back!”
Reviews.Author: Odalis05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of a wedding I was attending. I went with my fiance but met up with a few friends as well. I was pleased with my stay overall. The staff was friendly and helpful. I wished they had was a hotel shuttle at least for airport runs but they did have quick access to cabs which worked out since we just split the cost between a group of people. I also wished they had more of a variety of food options. Old San Juan was only like 15-20 minutes away and the airport was only about 10 minutes so the location was great. They have access to the beach and a nice pool area. Another perk is that they have an area in which you could check in for your flight and print out youf ticket free of charge. I would go back to this hotel plus the wedding was absolutely amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott San Juan was a refreshing vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: nik5matt57
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about booking a room here because of the bad reviews I read but I did not encounter any serious issues that would prevent me from booking a stay in the future. Many of the positive reviews are fair and I read every review before I traveled to San Juan. Many of the reviews were very helpful so I decided to help other reviewers as well. If I would rate the this hotel I would give it a 7 out of 10. I stayed at the Marriott San Juan from June 22-27.The only issue I had with this hotel is that I booked a double and was placed in a King. I was told that they were fully booked and that was the only room that was available. I highly doubted that but sharing a King bed with my cousin wasn't a big deal and I wanted to enjoy my vacation without being irritated by staff who could care less, so I did not push the issue.The room that we were placed in was nice and comfortable so it wasn't that much of a deal.Unfortunately, two days later my friend checked in and received a double bed room when I was told they were booked for the duration of my stay.This hotel definitely lost points due to unprofessionalism and dishonesty. The front desk staff isn't the most friendliest and should definitely be given more training on customer service (continuing personal conversations as you're waiting to be helped and ignoring you until they're ready to acknowledge you. The rest of the hotel staff was amazing, from the bell workers to bartenders, and pool/beach assistants. I suggest you call to confirm you accommodations before arrival because I noticed that previous guests had this same issue with receiving rooms which accommodated them and their parties. On a brighter note that was the only issue and besides that we had an amazing time. The hotel room is nice but very small. The bathroom is small and only one person can squeeze in there at a time. We had a room on the 7th floor and booked a city view room but it was half city and half ocean, not bad! The view was very beautiful but we didn't spend much time on the balcony. The room was a little humid when we arrived but once we turned on the air conditioner, the smell left. The AC does turn off when you open the doors. The bed was comfortable and we didn't have any issues with our room. The hotel has two pools. One pool is one foot and the other adult pool is deeper. Unfortunately, people play volley ball in the pool so you can forget about having a nice swim or good time in the pool without worrying about getting hit by a ball. The same with the jacuzzi which is really small. The beach is nice but the water in really rough so if you're not a great swimmer, I would recommend not going to deep into the ocean because the waves will easily carry you away. There was plenty of beach chairs and umbrellas. We didn't have to wake up super early to fight the crowd to get a chair or umbrella. The hotel provided you with chairs/umbrella and just just provide your name and room number. Sometimes we arrived around 1pm and had no problem with getting any of those items. The hotel does have a bar and music entertainment area when you first walk in. We enjoyed it and spent a few nights listening to music and having drinks at the bar. The hotel does have a small casino with tables and slots. We gambled out of boredom but nothing special.If you're looking for a resort to just relax at the hotel all day I do not think that the Marriott San Juan is the place. If you're looking for a nice hotel to stay while you tour and visit Puerto Rico, this may be the place. We did not eat at the hotel because of previous reviewers stating that it was too expensive but there are plenty of food places surrounding the hotel. You can make a right or left and there are affordable restaurants. We went to Danny's a pizza place that is really good, Tijuana a Mexican restuarant that was good as well. A 24 hour place called Latin Star that was good too, and Orozco which was also good. The mojitos were really good at all the restaurants including the bar at the hotel. The customer service at some of the restaurants is not that great because the tip is already included on the bill, make sure you pay attention to that so you do not over pay.The customer service at Orozco and Tijuana was great! There is a Wendy's, Baskin Robins, Dunkin Donuts, and Chilli's to the right of the hotel( within 3-5 minutes of walking). There is a Walgreens right across the street with standard prices and its good for snacks and misc items that you may have forgotten to pack. I took some advice from a previous review and rented a car from Charlie's for a day(Rental car place right across from hotel). We drove to El Yunque Rainforest which was really beautiful. It took about 40 minutes from the hotel. The rental car cost about $50.00 including gas and insurance. Its cheaper than the tours because the hotel cost 57.00 per person. If you don't mind driving and want to save some money, I would recommend renting a car.You just have to be very careful because once you exit the expressway. The last highway is a small street which is easy to miss if you don't pay close attention to the upcoming turn. The paths in the rain forest are easy to follow and you can drive up to each destination you want to view if you do not want to do too much walking (that was one of the great things about having a car). You can stop at the visitor center to get information on the rain forest for 7.00 per person or you can just tour the rain forest on your own. We paid the 7.00 but it wasn't necessary.Definitely wear comfortable shoes such as tennis shoes and avoid sandals or flip flops. It can be slippery, especially if you want o climb up to the waterfall. We visited Old San Juan which was really beautiful as well. You can take the bus which is 0.75 cents (exact change or you can catch a taxi for $14.00). There was a couple waiting at the bus stop and we split the cab fare with them which cost us $7.00( it took about 10 minutes to get to Old San Juan. It takes about 20-25 minutes on the bus.The bus stop is a few minutes from the hotel across from Walgreens. The bus runs about every 30 mins. but does not run on an exact schedule so be patience if you choose to catch the bus. All in all, we had a great time in San Juan Puerto Rico. I would return to this hotel but would definitely inform management of any problems or concerns. If you have any questions just ask me and I will be glad to respond.

Reviews.Title: “MUCH NEEDED BREAK”
Reviews.Author: Hebron2138
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott San Juan with my wife and 6 year old daughter June 13 through June 18, 2010. Getting to the hotel from the airport was easy, The flat rate for a taxi is $15 plus $1 for each suitcase. Upon arriving, we checked in immediately and early. I had booked an oceanfront room and requested a center room on a top floor. We were given a room on the 19th floor(The hotel has 21 floors). The view was beautiful. The room was decent. Nothing overly impressive, but not disappointing either. The furnishings were newer and the bathroom had nice finishes. The vent in the room did show some moisture stains around its frame. I will say that I would agree with other reviewers in saying that the rooms were humid. In the summer, I do prefer my hotel room to be cold with no humidity. So this did bother me some. The way the room thermostat works is that it only runs when you manually turn it on while you are in the room. If you open your balcony door or the door to the room, the air automatically shuts off due to sensors and resets to a default setting. So each time you go to the pool, beach, or to eat your room heats up and becomes muggy again. This little ritual did get a little old. The pools were nice. My daughter loved the water slide. The kids pool is very shallow, maybe 2 feet. The adult pool is maybe 4 feet. The adult pool could be bigger in my opinion. The swim up bar did not seem to be open during our stay although I did not attempt to obtain service there. There did seem to be an overabundant number of teenagers at the pool on Wednesday. I believe they were locals that either bought day passes(if that is even something that Marriott offers) or that split the cost of one room so they could swim. Either way it didn't really bother me at all. The wait staff at the pool and beach did give us outstanding service. The lounge chair and umbrella service at the beach was convenient and also very good. The ocean is a little rougher here, but we had a great time in the waves. We even bought a boogie board at the Walgreens which was just one block away from the hotel. My daughter met many great little kids to play with while at the beach and pool. She really did have a great time. The beach was fairly large and by no means overcrowded during our stay. We did eat at the hotel and the food was good and priced the way you should expect. There are many restaurant choices to the left and to the right of the hotel. We ate at Ummo, Via Appia, Danny's, and Tijuanas. All were good. The steaks at Ummo were especially good. We did rent a car for a day while in San Juan from Charlie Car Rental. This was by far the best place at only $30 for each 24 hours. We used the car to drive to Fajardo where we did the kayaking trip to El luguna Grande/BioBay, This was a very cool excursion. We used Enchanted Island Eco Tours and I highly recommend them. All in all, this was a nice trip and a nice change of pace. I would recommend the hotel based on my experience with great service and what I thought was a fair value.

Reviews.Title: “Merry Time at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: KiKiG1234
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino mid June. We had a wonderful time. Our room was trendy and very cozy. The patio was enormous and the housekeeping team did a wonderful job daily. The grounds were well kept and the people very friendly. We enjoyed the lively lobby which had live music Thursday - Sunday. While the food was expensive it did not put a damper on our vacation it is to be expected when on vacation. There were at least a dozen restaurants located to the left and the right of the hotel in walking distance. I highly recommend the Marriott when staying in Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what I expected it to be - relatively nice. The rooms are updated, but ours smelled a little musty. It is in a good part of the city within walking distance of restaurants and nightlife. There are two cheap places to have breakfast and lunch across the street (starbucks and something else). The beach is fine, but it doesn't really feel like a tropical getaway because it is in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Condado”
Reviews.Author: vegetarian66
Reviews.Content: We arrived much earlier than the 4:00pm check in time and was given our room upon check-in. There were no lines and check in took 2 mins, very friendly front desk staff. Our room was on the 11th floor oceanfront, great views. The room was a bit small but very cozy and comfortable. Extremely comfortable beds and bedding, but a little more attention should be placed on cleanliness of bed linens and towels. The beach front space was quite large and there were no crowds, the casino is huge and has quite a variety of penny slot machines. The lobby/ bar area really does turn into a small disco at night with a live band and dancing. It was very entertaining, we saw alot of people enjoying themselves. If it is not what you like then, there are alot of other areas that you can go to escape. The one area I think the Marriott needs to work on is the food. There are the 2 restaurants, but the menu just has little variety and they are a bit expensive. We ate there twice, the food was okay but it would have been better if you didn't have to leave the hotel to search for food choices. The cafe at the front of the hotel had some good breakfast choices, but still when you are on vacation, you don't want to think about searching for food. On exploring, we decided that the Marriott Stellaris was our best option in the Condado area, when you look at the other offerings available. Its setting on the beachfront together with its proximity to local restaurants, shopping and old san juan, cannot be beat. The service on checking out was quick and professional from the front desk girls to the luggage storing room guys as well as the guys organising the airport taxi. They made our stay an even better one!

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately....”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELFREAKONE
Reviews.Content: We were all set to go on vacation, when Marcos, the guest clerk, called and told us that eventhough we had booked two rooms with rollwaway beds a few months earlier, they were not going to honor our request. Marcos, in a very arrogant and condescending tone, told us that our 4 teenagers could sleep on the floor if they wanted to sleep separately... then he chuckled and said he was being funny. We asked for a 3rd room and he said that would be $1500, but unfortunately he couldn't help us since the hotel was full. We called central reservations and spoke to MIchelle, who seemd disinterested in our problem and put me on hold for almost one hour, so she could call Marcos. I refused to hang up and waited. She came back, and as she yawned loudly on the phone, told me the rooms were filled, and she suggested we look elsewhere. And, we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for girls trip”
Reviews.Author: MsWms
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I loved this hotel! We just spent a long weekend here, and it suited our needs perfectly. Our main goal was just to relax at the beach, and this place is perfect for that. The sand is nice and soft, and the sound of the waves is very relaxing. They provide the chairs/umbrellas/towels. There's a waiter coming around to take drink orders. It's great. the water is not that calm, so no snorkeling here. But catching the waves is fun. The pool is also nice, though really shallow. There's a water slide, and a waitress who brought free sliced fruit. Yummy! One of the best features of this place is location. There's several restaurants, shops, ice cream, Starbucks within a block or two. Walgreens is also about a block away. The bus stop is close by in case you feel adventurous! The lobby is apparently the place to be at night. There's a live band playing, and the place was packed. People were dancing. We were pooped, so didn't stick around long. We had an oceanfront room, so a really nice view. Room was clean, and free water replenished each day. Our only complaint was that the room did have a slight humid or mildewy smell. We did keep the door open a lot, so that probably didn't help the situation. But it really wasn't a big deal to us at all. The other thing to keep in mind is that service is slower there. Every restaurant we went to was like that, even the one at the hotel. They don't rush to do everything like we're used to here. If you ask for water, it may be 5-10 mins before it comes. We just had to let go and relax. We would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: DawnT026
Reviews.Content: Just back from San Juan. Stayed 4 nights enjoying a full ocean view upgrade. Everyone was pleasant and helpful with answering any questions. Beffet breakfast was included with our rate, which is good. I wouldn't have paid the price despite it being a good spread. Pool and beach are nice. Spa is not fancy, but they had a great 25 minute spepacial we took advantage of on our last morning. We are new to SCUBA so enjoyed a 30 foot dive nearby. Try Caribe Aquadic Adventures! I am visually impaired and was delighted by the dive master's working with me without hesitation! It was a great "girl's trip."

Reviews.Title: “Our First REAL Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jajburg
Reviews.Content: My Fiance booked this vacation for my Bday present. Then, after seeing the resort he decided to come along. It was the best thing we ever did. From the time we walked in - and we were upgraded to an ocean front room (due to the fact that we just got engaged and my mom passed away two weeks earlier), we could not believe the service that was provided to us. The room was extremely comfortable and immaculate. The food is a bit pricey, but once you leave the hotel, there are restaurants to your left and right where you can get great breakfasts, lunches and dinners at great prices. The people at the pool and beach areas are more than accommodating. We were treated like family. Would and have recommended this hotel to everyone we know. But, PLEASE watch the sun. It is brutal!!! My fiance has a BAD case of sunburn!! My eyes were swollen and had to put cold tea bags on them.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas with Mom - HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: VATraveller2
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my Mom. 2 positives: the fabulous room view from the 6th floor and the beach guys who setup chairs and umbrellas were helpful. The spa was closed. The restaurants are 1 expensive OK one and 1 buffet. The front desk was slow to recognize you standing at the desk. The linens do not qualify for 4star. There were little lizards running about the pool area. About 1 pm every day these green crabs came about an invaded the area. Room service was very slow. Drains in the bathrooms backed up; we called 4 times never fixed. View from the beach is the hotel and 2 bombed out looking buildings. Historic San Juan is NOT nearby. Across the street there are homes with walls topped by razor wire! Go to the Hilton it has a private beach. The Hampton Inn in Shreveport Louisiana is nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rican vacation with spouse”
Reviews.Author: rbsaenz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott on Condado beach 24 - 28 May. It was a nice resort and kept up very nicely. You could definitely see the age though with the rooms, not so much the items in the rooms (bed, tv, etc.), but with cracks in the wells or a couch probably 20 years old. We stayed ina junior suite for more space and with 2 large balconies overlooking the pool area and beach. Food and drinks were very very expensive. The staff were very pleasent.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: a_freq_traveller
Reviews.Content: Rooms (9th floor, facing the ocean) were OK, although nothing fancy. Beach is nice, a little crowded, but clean and ocean is nice. BUT--restaurants are yucky, surprisingly bad, bar was so-so, and we felt sorry for the poor cretins congregating in the casino, none of them who had any money to spare on such entertainment. Good thing there are some good restaurants within walking distance! Old San Juan is quite nice and people by and large were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “This was a wonderful place to relax”
Reviews.Author: CTew
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was somewhat nervous to come to this resort because of all the reviews that I kept reading the week before we were suppose to go. We absolutely loved our stay. We walked in and didn't have to wait for our room. There were 4 of us and (2 couples) with 2 rooms and both rooms were great. They did not have the musty smell that people were talking about. It was humid if you didn't turn the air on, so of course we had the air on the entire time. The balconies were amazing. Sitting outside and listening to the waives and reading a book was so great! The housekeeping was great and came every day without us ever having to contact the front desk. Everyone that worked in the hotel was very helpful. The Concierge service was great and recommended a trip thru Kayaking Puerto Rico -- Kayaking and Snorkeling in Culebra and also Kayaking Bio Bay -- both were amazing. I do have to say that the tour desk is not very helpful unless you want to do the tours that were so expensive. The Casino was not very big, but they had plenty of open tables and open machines...it was so much fun! I can't say anything about the restaurants in the hotel because we were turned off from the reviews, so we went to the restaurants around the resort. The restaurants were within walking distance, and they were all different. We went to Tijuana's two times while we were there, it was great. Mirro's across the street was not impressive and we spent the most money at that restaurant. We also went to Cherry Blossom down the street and it was great. I have to admit that having the 24 hour Walgreen's right down the street was extremely convenient. We took taxi's into Old San Juan, they were always at the hotel. We also rented a car to drive out to Farjardo one day. Overall our trip to Puerto Rico was just amazing. Don't listen to the other reviews...the Marriott was really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Dudee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few days in San Juan. 1 day we tour Old San Juan ( interesting but very congested) and 1 day driving south into the country (I liked this the best). This hotel is a good base. Our room was nice, cool but very, very humid. The staff was not overtly friendly but think this is more cultural than rudeness. We met several people including a maid who became friendly in conversation.

Reviews.Title: “One of San Juan's better options”
Reviews.Author: Andrew030
Reviews.Content: I was rather impressed with this hotel. It is a big property, over 20 floors, with a large number of rooms. With its size come advantages - its 4 restaurants; dedicated activities centre, a good little coffee bar in the lobby, a gift shop and a pool / water area far, far, far the superior of that at the neighbouring La Concha. It lacked the aesthetic wow factor of its neighbour, but the rooms were spotless, the house keeping (how often can you really say this?) was excellent, the beds were roomy and comfortable, all rooms seemed to have balconies and - best of all - despite a noisy and vibrant bar downstairs, nothing of it was heard upstairs in the rooms. The beach - just - had the edge over La Concha, but there wasn't a lot in it. It had pole position, probably at about the middle of the Condado beach strip. My only complaint would be that the internet was disgracefully slow, to the point of being virtually unusable. The gym - again, how often can you really say this of a hotel gym - was very well equipped. There were 6 treadmills, as many cross trainers and other cardio equipment, made up of the latest equipment, complete with TVs fitted above each machine and built in iPod docking stations, along with a large number of free weights and machines. These were all new, with probably a dozen or so such machine. Complimentary bottled water was available. The lobby bar and the restaurants at the Marriott were nothing on those next door, but frankly these were freely available a two minute walk down the road, but with none of the same noise problems. Future stays in PR are likely to involve a choice between El Convento and the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk gives poor service”
Reviews.Author: SadlydisappointedPa
Reviews.Content: Don't plan to get your room if you arrive early!! We took an early flight to have an additional half day in Puerto Rico prior to our cruise in two days. However, we arrived at 12:30 p.m. and were told we would have a room in an hour or so. The "or so" took 4 more hours, even beyond their guaranteed 4:00 p.m. Waiting for our room didn't begin the vacation on the right foot. Watch out for all the room taxes and resort taxes! This place was nice, but not worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great service”
Reviews.Author: ctelly22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of friends for vacation last summer. The hotel was great rooms very nice, quiet with great views of the pool and beach. The rooms were great for relaxing, beds were nice and comfortable and there was a chair and ottoman in the corner. The balcony was also a nice size, great for sitting outside and relaxing. The pool area was nice, relaxing and staff came to take your drink orders. The jacuzzi was ok. It needed a little work as all the jets did not work. Also it would have been great if it was more secluded, as balls from the people playing pool volleyball would sometimes make it over there. The beach area was nice and right off the pool area. While here we dined at the buffet restaurant for breakfast and the Italian restaurant for dinner. They were both nice. The buffet if you came early was definitely worth the money. Lots of variety and food fresh and hot. The Italian restaurant was nice but a little pricey. I used the business center and whikle it was small it definitely served its purpose. The internet was free so It really came in handy to check email or follow up on some things. The only downside to our stay here was the ant problem in our room. I didn't know ants could climb that high. The staff came immediately and tried to get rid of them, when it didn't help they moved us to another room. Staff here was great, very helpful and offered lots of suggestions. The area the hotel in is also nice as it has lots of dining and shopping options. Definitely check out Angel's Cafe and can't remember the name but there's a boutique near the dunkin donuts that has some great stuff. From the window it looks expensive but it's not.

Reviews.Title: “Loved most every minute of my stay!”
Reviews.Author: keeptraveling01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on business and it was a wonderful experience. You would never know a casino was on the first floor or dance clubs. It was very quiet in the rooms and the rooms were exceptionally clean. Greeted with great customer service and all needs were met quickly. However, the rooms are a bit overpriced and you will pay extra for anything beyond the room. I enjoyed an ocean view room and it was nice to look out and see the water at night and wake up to it in the morning. You can walk to a lot of places and taxis are ample. The beds were beyond comfortable. I slept very well!! I would stay here again but only if I could get a discount on the room. A little too pricey for a personal budget.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely AMAZING~”
Reviews.Author: qtxmsred
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. The view from our corner room was amazing. We were high up, and from our balcony, you can see the pool clearly with the palm trees all over. You can see the beach/ocean too from the room. The hotel and staff were amazing...The food there is amazing too...The casino was awesome..Made a lot of money from there playing blackjack and craps...We met all sorts of people there from everywhere..The pool was so amazing..clean and luxurious..there are a good amount of kids there...might not be great for some people, some might not care...it's really up to you..This place is great for couples, as well as family...The restaurant right across from the hotel has AWESOME PAELLA...you have to try it if you stay in Puerto Rico...the seafood paella is amazing...so gooooood...We rented a car which was smart because to get anywhere, you definitely want your own car, instead of taking a taxi...We wanted to go snorkeling and wanted to see the well known FLAMENCO BEACH...omg...white crystal sand beaches...beautiful crystal blue water...snorkeling was ok..not a ton of fish though...Me and my fiance just lounged on the beach for a good while...and then it was time to go...After that trip, we were knocked out...for almost 13 hours after that...it does take a toll on you...Food and shopping were great...definitely wanna go shopping...overall my experience at this hotel was perfect..I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay at...We also visited the historic base...be prepared to walk a long way to get there...dress comfortably...it was beautiful...definitely a piece of history worth seeing..

Reviews.Title: “marvelous week stay”
Reviews.Author: Davienna
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the hotel for a week. We got there early and they checked us in early at no additional charge. The staff were all very friendly from the bell guys, bar tenders, housekeeping. We had breakfast at the hotel every day for about $20 and it was buffet or you could also choose to order which we never did. We had no problems with the air conditioning as the other reviews stated. If you want good cheap food I recommend you go to old san juan there are so many restaurants just walk around or ask they will show you. Bus fair is 75 cents have correct amount of change. You can catch a taxi for $15 one way. The lobby turns into an entertainment spot at night but you only hear the noise on that floor it is very quiet in all the other floors. There are two swimming pools, not crowded at all. The beach is very clean, cleaned daily and plenty of beach chairs. I would stay at this hotel again, I would encourage anybody to stay there and I am looking forward to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and has lost its charm.”
Reviews.Author: Kacee25
Reviews.Content: It had been about 5 years since I had stayed the resort. I remembered it as a fantastic property. Unfortunately what I found on this visit was just a tired old property that is making its money off of cruise ship passengers who fly in the day before or stay an extra day after the cruise. If you are serious about a vacation and staying on the property, look elsewhere. First impressions are everything. Upon walking in you are met by a room full of high top tables that are crammed into the space. Obviously they do not care that it looks like you are entering a big bus station with luggage piled high and tired weary people sitting around waiting for a room. At night they convert the space to a noisy bar. Even though we arrived at approximately 1:00pm, our room was not available until 4:30pm. During the wait time, we went down to the restaurant for lunch. Save your money and go anywhere but here. We were so put off by the poor service and lousy tasting food that we did not eat on property again for the next 5 days. The room was nice as long as you did not look outside. As a Gold Marriott Rewards member, I expected at least a partial view of the ocean. I looked out over the parking garage and was hastily told there were no other rooms available when I vocalized my displeasure. Take a note here...your patronage to Marriott obviously means nothing. On two occasions we had to call downstairs and ask them to send someone up to clean the room. Yes the individual had already been in and made the bed, however, they did not provide clean water glasses. In one instance, they had folded a dirty towel (I know because make-up was on the towel) and put it in with the clean towels. A bright spot...we enjoyed the casino. However, if you want a quality place to drink and dance...go elsewhere. This place is just loud and a bit sleazy as it is something like drinking and dancing at a bus station. All in all, we go regularly (twice a year) to San Juan and stay 4-5 nights each time. There are several other properties that I would recommend over this one. This one is just tired and it is obvious the management does not cater to the guest or support basic requirements like cleanliness and service. They do however run one spectacular bus station waiting room.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, Great beach, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike_StAlbans
Reviews.Content: The staff at reception and in the rest of the hotel were very friendly and helpful. As a busy hotel their sometimes is a little wait at reception. One pool is too shallow to swim in but great for children. The second pool is ok to swim in but I would like a little deeper, has a swim up bar. Jacuzzi very good. Plenty of sunloungers, shade from trees, no umbrellas. The beach is fabulous, sunloungers put out for you one umbrella per room. You need this as very hot. Sea warm but a little rough. Red flag out each day. Great for jumping up and down in surf, which was very enjoyable but could knock you over if not careful. You need to keep a keen watch on children in the sea. Once you got out past the 3rd wave great to swim up and down the beach. A little different to other Caribbean islands. The buffet breakfasts were absolutely magnificent, typically American. So easy to put on weight from a great selection of food. Plenty of fruit, and cerials, great omlettes with crispy bacon and sausages. The waffles were out of this world and some delicious cakes and pastries. The staff very friendly. The Italian restaurant in hotel has delicious, quality food and is served in a very proffesional manner with great ambiance. Never had long to wait for a lift. The gym was excellent. The casino was ok but not my scene. Only thing detrimental about hotel was that the band in the bar on certain nights was far too loud and not what one would expect from an otherwise great hotel. The other thing that was dissapointing was that the hotel did not serve icecreams. Just accross the road was a Hagen Daz and a great Mexican and Itallian restaurant. Also a very good Puerto Rican Restaurant 10 minutes walk away. Too far to walk to the old town of San Juan but always a taxi available from the hotel. The forts and old town are well worth exploring and there are many different restaurants. There is an interesting market in the town square. The people are very friendly. There is a wide mix of culture which makes this Island different to other caribbean ones I have visited. A great trip to the rain forest completed a fantastic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “An Easy Trip to the Tropics”
Reviews.Author: WnnaBTrvlWrtr
Reviews.Content: We wanted an easy, inexpensive weekend in the tropics. San Juan was easy (4 hours, non-stop from Boston on AA); the San Juan Marriott was inexpensive. The downside was that our "city-view" balcony had a lovely view of the roof below and the noise from the air conditioning units made it pointless to sit outside. With no upgrades to beach view available (even though the front desk twice made a diligent effort to help),we quickly realized the value of paying for what you want when you make your reservation. Nevertheless, our room was pretty nice -- recently updated with a large, well-outfitted bathroom --- and we were on the beach with drink in hand by 4 pm. The hotel provides a good base from which to experience the various facets of San Juan. The beach is nice, although you should suggest that the attendant situate your lounge chair and umbrella in a direction other than east so you don't have to look at the abandoned, graffiti-covered building two doors down. And bring fresh, strong sunscreen! The pool tends to get crowded and is not really suited for swimming. Drinks from the bar at the beach are expensive but no one seems to object to BYOB from the liquor store down the street. The Condado neighborhood provides a variety of dining and shopping options within walking distance. The bus to old San Juan leaves from a stop down the block, although the schedule is uncertain. There is a lot to see and do in old San Juan, but wear comfortable shoes and be prepared to duck in for a cool drink every couple of hours. Although food and drinks were generally expensive (Puerto Rico is an island, after all -- and subject to US taxes as well), food and drinks at the hotel were especially expensive. We generally avoided the hotel venues -- the casino is awful and the lobby bar is just a bunch of tables in a lobby with absolutely no ambiance -- in favor of restaurants and bars in Condado or old San Juan. Prices were a bit better and the local atmosphere was much more appealing. There were a few service glitches -- a lost fax, an unhelpful concierge, the door to our room left ajar -- that would be unacceptable in a city hotel. Maybe it was all the rum, maybe it was a sense of diminished expectations that came with being in what at times seemed like a third-world country, but it didn't seem to matter so much. We would come back, just because it's such an easy trip to the tropics.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Mappie
Reviews.Content: We booked an oceanfront room with patio. Nice view of Condado Beach. Room was smaller than expected & more dated in appearance than expected but very clean. Bed was really comfortable. Staff were polite, courteous & helpful. Bar with live entertainment right in the middle of the lobby was a plus. Casino was fun for a while. The rate was $350 including taxes & fees per night. The price in our opinion was excessive considering the room. However, the hotel rates in San Juan in general were high so we went for it because it was on Condado Beach & highly rated.

Reviews.Title: “Totally OVER priced!!!”
Reviews.Author: hotmomma1955
Reviews.Content: First of all I don't know how they rate this as a 4 star hotel, I guess by their high prices on everything. This was the first ( and last) time we paid $40 for breakfast for 2. We had an ocean front room which was nice, but rather small. The bathroom was so small one person could barely fit. It did have a nice makeup mirror though. The connoisseur was not very helpful or friendly. Would love to go back to Puerto Rico again, but would not stay at the San Juan Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel. marriott is always a good choice”
Reviews.Author: kbirdina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel was great. Rooms were a good size and we had a great view from our balcony. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There are good restaurants just down the block from the hotel. There is a bus stop right infront of the hotel which can take you into old san juan. The hotel is in the hotel district so it is safe to walk around the main street at night and very busy. Only down fall is that there is no night life really inside the hotel district. We were told by a taxi driver to stay in san juan for nightlife. But the hotel and beach were great

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChartBuffalo_NY
Reviews.Content: We sailed on a cruise out of Puerto Rico and got back into port on Sunday. It was cheaper to fly back home on a Monday, so we booked a hotel stay here for Sunday night. The lobby alone of this hotel was amazing. We checked our luggage because our room wasn't ready yet (it was only 11:00) and we went to one of the in hotel restaurants and had pizza. It was excellent. I am from Buffalo, NY and know a good pizza when I taste one. When our room was ready (before the normal checkin time), I was pleasantly surprised - it was huge and bright. We went out to the pool area whitch was amazing and spacious. Beyond the pool was a gateway to the beach. Just unvbelieveable. We went out later that evening and a band was playing in the lobby and there were bars and comfortable seats to lounge in and watch the band right in the lobby. The next day we were able to get a cab within minutes right in front of the hotel back to the airport. I am seriously thinking about coming back and spending a week's vacation here.
