This is the first hotel, in all my travels, that I have taken the time to write a review for.

Reviews.Title: “This is our second visit and we love the hotel and area.”
Reviews.Author: cppaso
Reviews.Content: This is a large, older hotel on the beach in Condado, San Juan Puerto Rico. We love this hotel. It is well managed, the pool area is lovely and the beach is excellent. The hotel is just beginning a renovation of the pool bar, restaurant, and lobby. It may take some time as they were jackhammering up tile in the pool bar area the day before we left. The only other real negative is that the food is very expensive if you stay more than a day or two. You do get a lot for your money, but it will cost $50 or more for two people to have a meal. You can lower the cost by going out the front of the hotel, turn right and walk 2 blocks to a Walgreen that has a small grocery attached where you can get breakfast and lunch supplies. If you exit the front of the hotel and turn left, go two blocks to a restaurant called Danny's that has great pizza and ordinary prices for breakfast and other meals. Go see the forts or to Old San Juan by #21C or #53 bus for .75 each way. Go out the front of the hotel and turn right to the bus stop. Take the bus to the terminal and pickup the free trolley that takes you to the forts and then back to the terminal. You can walk from the terminal to Old San Juan for shopping or take a trolley. We look forward to returning to this Marriott in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: awalls675
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Puerto Rico from a week long stay at the Marriot San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino and I already want to go back! The moment you pull up at the front door the amazingly accomodating staff are there to greet you and take care of everything. You don't have to lift a finger! From the very clean accomodations to the great pool and beach area I could not have asked for more! This place is in the perfect spot. You can walk to so many things, from restaurants to nightlife. All you have to do is step out the front door and a taxi is waiting for you to take you wherever you need for a low price. There is a little Italian place called Appia"s just down from the hotel(away from Old San Juan) and it was the best food we had our entire stay there! Great food, nightlife, scenery, beach, and historic sites just minutes away! P.S...... go to the El Yunque Rainforest and Old San Juan! Awesome!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, View and value for your buck...”
Reviews.Author: CricFan76
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical after reading the reviews such as smelly room and stuff like that but went with it just trusting Marriott's name and it was a good decision. We got a beautiful corner room with 2 balconies and and awesome ocean view. Kids had fun even hanging out in the balcony and just listening to the ocean waves. The beach is great, service is good, and they have kids activities by the pool area everyday so while parents are relaxing by the pool the kids are busy with some activities like bingo, art and crafts, scavenger hunt and many such activities. Staff there was very helpful and good location too. 10 mins from and airport and 10 mins to Old San Juan...Really one of the nice place to stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “R&R - great beachfront!”
Reviews.Author: JEO_1973
Reviews.Content: Outstanding beach and great service on the beach - lounge chairs, umbrellas, drink. Poolside food was very good. Hotel staff is very helpful. Great music and bar at night. Rooms are a little dated and a tight bathroom. Only thing average was the restaurant. Recommend the hotel very highly. Recommend you find restaurants offsite. P.S. Hidden gem -- the Haagen Daza store is right across the street !

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids, but not the best customer service or activities.”
Reviews.Author: tiakia1
Reviews.Content: The pro: If you're traveling with a little one, it's a good hotel. My 4-year-old loved the huge kiddie pool. It's definitely a family friendly hotel. The cons: My husband and I booked one of the 2 vice presidential suites on the penthouse level as a way of splurging a bit before the arrival of our second baby. In fact, the only reason why we chose this hotel over the Hilton or El San Juan was because they had such a nice suite available. The others were booked. When we got to the check-in desk, we were told by the not-very-helpful front-desk employee that our reservation was for a standard room not the VP suite. I showed her the confirmation email. She still insisted that the reservation wasn't for the suite. The manager comes up and explains that there was some sort of mix-up and they double-booked the VP suite so we were simply out of luck because they just gave the suite away earlier that day. They gave us $100 off the standard room as a way to make up for it, but that wasn't the point. We wanted the bigger suite that we booked months in advance. Had I known this would happen, I would've chosen El San Juan, which we visited while we were there and is a MUCH more beautiful hotel with much more to do. Another con to the hotel is the lack of waters ports at the beach. My husband and I love jet skiing, parasailing, and all the other water sports. None of that is available at the Marriott, so we had to take a cab to El San Juan hotel to do those things.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Southernmost
Reviews.Content: We had four partial ocean view rooms booked. Arrived early so we checked luggage and headed out for lunch and to explore hotel. We were able to check in a little early which was nice. Although all 4 rooms were supposed to be ocean view, only three were. Our room was considered ocean view but it was on 3rd floor and the view was obstructed by palm trees. Make sure you ask for rooms on the higher levels so you get what you are paying for. Our friendâ€™s rooms on sixth and seventh floor had beautiful views. The rooms were spacious, clean, and nicely equipped. Hotel staff was always extremely friendly. Casino staff was nice and jovial. No problems getting drinks while gambling; waitstaff was always coming by to check if we needed anything. This seems like a no-brainer but at many of the casinos in Vegas, wait staff can be hard to find at the low-money slots. No problem here! Good bands in the bar made it a great night for dancing. Pool and beach were nice. I read that service was awful by the pool and on the beach, however itâ€™s more that you need to flag them down rather than wait to be asked if service was needed. It was a little slow getting drinks once you ordered but it was not a big dealâ€¦island time! Check-out is 11:00, with late check-out at 12:00. If you want a later check-out, you can pay an additional $75. One of our rooms requested to do so, however there was an obvious communication issue at the time of the request that resulted in us being locked out of the room with our bags still inside. The problem was quickly resolved. The bellmen gave us excellent dining advice on good local restaurants (as local as you can get in this tourist area) and were nice enough to take group photos of us on few occasions. Cafe de Angelo was great, as was Miro's across the street. We thoroughly enjoyed our girlâ€™s weekend. Everyone was so friendly to us! Great hotel and great people in San Juan! Thanks to all who made it a fantastic weekend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Bright, lots of fun!”
Reviews.Author: fergus81
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on-line, but grew concerned after reading some reviews... no worries! Very clean hotel, staff for the most part very helpful, ran into one or two who clearly did not enjoy their jobs and did not want to do them. One in particular was the girl at the pool bar who spent 10 minutes with her back to the waiting customers while she texted on her phone. The other girl there working Jeanette, did a nice job covering for her lazy friend and worked efficiently to make sure everyone was served. The restaurants on site are expensive indeed..good options a short walk away, we especially enjoyed Danny's for breakfast. The Latin Star was disgusting..save your time and money. There is a liquor store down the strett to the left as you exitthe hotel, I bought some beer there and brought some to the pool when needed, as the beers at the pool are .$7..not terribly expensive, but gets pricey after a few days... Front service is excellent, a cab is always ready for you to go out and explore. The tour/excursion staff was very helpful and friendly, as was Concierge Desk, lots of great ideas about local restaurants and points of interest. Ocean/beach/pools were excellent..clean, and well staffed. Hit the casino periodically..okay, small but serves its purpose... The lobby is loud... but it shouldn't affect you unless you stay there to have a drink. ( we did not). Overall, a great place for a relaxing family vacation, located in a nice area, felt safe to walk at night..loots of people out and about.. Starbucks, Hagen Dazs, and Walgreens right across the street from resort for those comforts of home. The rooms were clean and well maintained..no complaints at all there...

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay...”
Reviews.Author: cecenick
Reviews.Content: a family of 4 (14 and 5 year old DDs) stayed here for 3 nts, had a wonderful time... like its location, its beach, its pools (particularly water slide), its services and its room definetly will come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it would def go back”
Reviews.Author: KLee1143
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I travelled to PR for the first time in Dec 09. Neither of us had ever been to anywhere outside the US and neither had passports so it was perfect. A coworker had been to PR a bunch of times and loved it. We arent the most well travelled couple and our standards arent too high but we loooooved it. The hotel was very clean and the front desk upgraded our room for free when we got there. The only downside was that my fiance loves to play texas holdem and they only offered no limit, but other than that it was great. The pool bar was our favorite. The staff were all very nice. There is a Walgreens down the street to the right. Like some other people have said you can buy liquor and wine and pregame a little in your room. I think it was Thursday night that was ladies night at the lounge bar and drinks were only a dollar! They opened up a screen and had a dj too. It was great. We NEVER had a problem getting a chair or a spot on the beach. Maybe because it was December. We set up the zipline tour from the lobby and it was fun but a little pricey. We also did scuba for the first time with Caribe Aquatic Adventures and we loved it. We will def go back and would def stay at and recommend the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach, quiet, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Theo23_10
Reviews.Content: What a great stay. Rooms were very nice, and quiet for sleep. The staff was friendly and helpful. The beach was close and our teenagers enjoyed body-surfing the waves. The breakfast buffet was excellent. My only gripe was $16 per day to park the rental car, which really added up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: morex4
Reviews.Content: The beach was great with lots of big waves, plenty of chairs and umbrellas. Two pools were next to the beach. They have kid activities each day. We did not eat at the hotel, but it looked good. The room was really nice, and we had a balcony overlooking the pool and beach. Would totally stay there again! No free internet unless you go to the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott San Juan Resort & Casino”
Reviews.Author: lithlith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before boarding a cruise ship out of the San Juan port the next day. Our flight arrived at 10pm, once we got our luggage, we took a 10 minute taxi ride to the hotel from the airport. The taxi prices were fixed for different zones of the city and it was an additional $1 for each bag. The lobby was hoppin' when we arrived around 10:30pm on a Saturday night. It was extremely loud with a live band and wall to wall people. We had to wait 2-3 minutes for someone to come to the check in desk. It appeared that only one person was working the desk. It was very hard to hear and we had to scream back and forth at each other to get checked in. Our room was nice, nothing special. It appeared to be an older room that had been updated. We had a balcony with a nice view of the pool and beach area. We could also see our cruise ship from our balcony. In the morning we explored the pool and beach area. There were lots of chairs for people to lay out in and a desk at the pool area where you could pick up extra towels. It seems to have a very family atmosphere and there were lots of kids running around. There are a few restaurants across the street, but most of them were closed when we woke up on Sunday (but it was also Easter). There was a Walgreens and small grocery store two blocks from the hotel. It was about a 10 minute taxi ride from the hotel to the cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to burn points, do it here”
Reviews.Author: BienVago
Reviews.Content: Booked a vacation for my wife and I using reward points. We booked a junior suite and they upgraded us to the pent house! The views of the ocean are spectacular. Several restaurants are in walking distance. Ocean breeze on most evenings allowed us to sleep with the windows open and we heard nothing but ocean waves. The pool is a little cold, so skip it and go straight to the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is Alive and Well”
Reviews.Author: lmont830
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at this hotel with our three children for 7 nights over the Easter Holiday this year. I was completely and thoroughly impressed with every single aspect of this hotel. It was maticulously clean, and maintained throughout our entire visit. The staff could not do enough to help or answer questions. There was plenty to do, and the atmosphere was just plain and simply pleasant. I would highly recommend this facility to anyone travelling to this area. The entire exprience was extremely enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay.”
Reviews.Author: funandrelaxation
Reviews.Content: We have been to this property 3 times in the past three years. It is a well run, efficient resort. The location is terrific - Starbucks across the street, plenty of good restaurants to walk to, other resorts/hotels to visit and only a short cab ride to the cruise ship piers and/or Old San Juan. Having stayed multiple times, I would recommend that you request to stay in the Tower section of the hotel rather than the cabana section. There is a musty smell in the rooms on the cabana side (noticed it on two different stays), it certainly is not unbearable - with the humidity it feels a bit moist in the room, not sure why. The rooms are typical Marriott resort rooms, spacious, and are well maintained. The pool area, while crowded at times, is very nice and relaxing and the beach is terrific. Bar/Drink/Food Service at the pool area or on the beach is next to non-exsistent. However, if you walk up to the bar to order food or drinks, the service is outstanding. The people who work there are super. I would definitely recommend the Marriott to anyone visiting San Juan. We have stayed at many properties in San Juan and the Marriott is always very consistent. Oh, if you don't like loud music, don't go to the lobby in the late evenings, there is almost always a very lively band playing.

Reviews.Title: “Rocky Start.....Good Finish”
Reviews.Author: therokk
Reviews.Content: My family and I plan a yearly 10 day trip to a beach destination. We always book at least 6 months in advance. This year we decided to go to Puerto Rico. A place none of us had been. We went online an booked through Marriott.com in Sept 09. Our family consists of 4- mom, dad, son 15 and daughter 11. We booked a junior suite knowing a regular room for 10 days would never work. Being faithful Marriott customers we had accumulated enough Marriott points to cover our stay with a nominal upgrade charge which we were more than happy to pay. Check in.....when we arrived we waited in line for about 15 min. (not bad). We gave our information and the girl informed us that they no longer had our room and were giving us a corner room. We proceeded to tell her there was no way we were going to be able to stay in a regular room for 10 days....she went on to say there was nothing she could do, that the hotel was overbooked and basically we had to take it or leave it. ( we had just flown over night from LA to New York to PR there was no where we could go. We even asked if we could just have 2 regular rooms. Finally, we asked to talk to the manager and they told us he was on break and let us speak to the head bellman. We did not give up.... the head bellman took us up to the room to try to convince us that we could manage in that room. The room was nice and if I would have been there with just my husband it would have been fine. With the kids it just wouldnt work. By the time we got back down Reynaldo the front desk manager was off break. My husband had to talk to him and convince him of the importance of us having a bigger room for a 10 day trip and explained to him that we had booked this trip 6 months prior and it was our big yearly family vacation. Finally they offered this....spend the first night in the smaller room and the next day they would move us to the room we had booked originally. We took the offer considering we really had no other options. They did comp the first night. Which was nice. After that fiasco the vacation was great...the pool was nice and the beach was great. They had guys outside ready to put chairs and umbrellas where ever you wanted. As for the beach being rough....I didnt find it any more rough than the So Cal beaches we are used to. Some of the bartenders had a little attitude but most of them were great and funny and entertaining. The breakfast buffet was good and the waiters were all very nice and accommodating. All in all the vacation was good and we had a great time spending quality time as a family.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan Marriott - Stayed for 3 months and still here.”
Reviews.Author: EyeSawItAll
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve been staying at the San Juan Marriott & Stellaris Casino since January for work. Itâ€™s a nice hotel and I have found very little wrong with it. STAFF: The staff is friendly and for the most part attentive. I rent a vehicle, so the staff when you pull up are quick to respond to your arrival. Sometimes, you have a brief pause, especially on Fridays with crowds arriving and checking out. The desk clerks are a mix of efficiency and cluelessness. Its pretty much pot luck on who you get. Most of them get right to it and get you checked in. I had one though, she appeared to be lost. Must have been a bad day for her. They can be slow in the pool area for service. Instead of waiting for the service to come around, youâ€™re better off going to get a drink. If you want to order food, wait for the service. Really, the closer you are to the pool bar, the better the service. I have also had to pick up packages at the service center, down on the Ground level. A vast improvement in service is highly recommended. They are very slow if you need to pick up a package. I went one time to pick up a package and no one ever came, so I went and called the front desk and had it delivered. Ooops, sorry no tip that time. ROOMS: . The rooms at the SJM are standard size. The are King beds and Double beds available. I personally like the Marriott beds. I find them very comfortable. All the rooms have mini fridges, but no microwave. They have 37â€� LG LCD televisions. There are 20 English language channels and five (5) Spanish language channels. Iâ€™ve stayed in the main tower (21 floors) as well as the Cabanas (9 floor building off to the side). I had a room on three sides of the main tower. Room numbers ending in 01-03 (i.e. 1201-1203) and 23-25 (i.e. 1223 â€“ 1225) face south looking towards the city (its called a city view in the reservation). They have balconies so you can step out and see the harbor with the cruise ships. Rooms ending in 04-10 (i.e. 1204 â€“ 1210) face west and have a mixed view of the city, the harbor, the pool area, and the ocean. This is my favorite. However, there is one downside, is the evening sun is really bright coming into the rooms. If you are looking at a computer monitor, it can make it more difficult to see due to the glare. Since I am here for work, I do have to adjust my view. Rooms ending in 11-16 (i.e. 1211 â€“ 1216) face north have a view of the ocean. I have stayed on this side and itâ€™s a nice view of the ocean the beach. Rooms ending in 17-22 (ie. 1217 â€“ 1222) face east have a partial view of the beach, the ocean and a city view. You are primarily looking east towards Isla Verde. I have never stayed on this side. In the other building, known as the Cabanas, the room numbers go from 31 â€“ 45 (i.e. 231- 245) and have floors 2-9. All the rooms face north and look out over the pool area and then on to the beach and the ocean. I have stayed here and the rooms are very nice as well. The rooms ending in 31 are the handicapped rooms. The bathroom sinks are smaller than the other rooms. If you use a lot of bathroom products, you might want to avoid the rooms ending in 31. There are washing machines and dryers available on the ground floor in the Cabana building. If you need change, the check in desk will provide you with change for the W&D. THE POOLS AND BEACH: The pool area is very nice with three pools and a hot tub. It also has a swim up bar. The service in the pool area is spotty. Sometimes its quick and other times you wonder if anyone showed up for work. The beach, is well, the beach. The beach attendants will pull your chaise lounges out for you. If you want to order a drink, its really better if you go to the bar near the beach entrance and get it. INTERNET ACCESS: All over the hotel, the wireless signal is weak. Iin your room you have to have your laptop by the patio door and have the door open to be able to get a good signal. Iâ€™ve learned to adjust, but they could improve this service. When signing on, you have to select the fee plan of one day or the three day. Select the three day. You will not pay for the amount shown anyway. The wireless service is actually paid for through the resort fee that is charged. My resort fee was $23.40. But, you have to accept the fee in order to get access to the internet. TIME TO EAT: As a Marriott Elite member, I have access to the concierge lounge, so I do not have to pay for breakfast during the week. On the weekends. I usually eat the breakfast buffet. Its $21.95 ( a little pricey, but hey you are in a resort area) and I add enough tip to bring it to $25.00. There are some nearby restaurants that are cheaper. Camillesâ€™s which is directly across Ashford Avenue from the hotel is a fine example. THE CASINO: The Casino is small. It has the table games and slots. All the casinos on the island are small and attached to a hotel. Of all the major hotel chains, only the Caribe Hilton does not have a Casino. OUTSIDE ACTIVITIES: There are outside activities offered as well. The hotel has a very good tour desk with which you can book your tours. My wife and son came down for a couple of weeks and we hit the snorkle trip and a kayaking trip. We had several other walking trips we took as well. The trips will pick you up at the hotel and bring you back. SECURITY: Security is not an issue. in or outside the hotel. The tourist area of Condado is heavily patrolled by the police all along Ashford. Go in groups if possible and stay in the tourist area. On weekends, there is a band in the lobby bar area. They are very loud, so if loud bands bother you, stay away from the lobby bar. If you check in during this period, you will have a hard time hearing the desk clerks. GETTING TO THE OLD CITY: The San Juan city bus service is really slow and not reliable. The buses should come along once an hour, but thatâ€™s not a sure bet. The drivers are all public employees and give the attitude that they really donâ€™t care if you ride the bus or not. I have ridden the bus and it was fine, just the surly attitude of the drivers. If you choose to ride, its 75 cents one way, exact change only! There is a stop on Ashford Ave, just to the right of the hotel. OR TAKE A WALK INSTEAD: Its about a 3 Â½ mile walk to the old City. Just head west along Ashford and keep the beach on your right. Itâ€™s a nice walk and I recommend everyone take it at least once. Do take a bottle of water with you. You can take a taxi or the bus back (Route A43 or B21). There is a 24 hours Walgreens Pharmacy a block away. If you need a medicine refill or some snack items, the Walgreens will have it. And yes, they do sell sunscreen. You will need it!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accommodations and 5-star service at this hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: teachpeach
Reviews.Content: We just cam home from an eventful trip to San Juan. Despite some family setbacks, this hotel went above and beyond to assist my family. When we arrived early evening at this property, we got a reservation for a restaurant that said the dress was "elegantly casual." I learned that this meant men should wear nice pants for dinner. Well, I quickly discovered that my teenage son did not bring ANY long pants, and we were going to Easter service the next day! No problem, a wonderful manager named Arturo found a pair of pants that employees from the hotel use in my son's size! He wore them to dinner and to church the next day. Who displays such kindness?! When my son got a migraine the last day of our trip, our maid Maria tried her best to understand English and gave me several extra bottles of water, towels, shampoo, and even a bottle of rubbing alcohol. She came round the next morning to see how he was feeling. Once while swimming in the ocean, my daughter got a small jelly fish sting and two security guards filled out a report and gave us lotion to use - a suggestion was made to use vinegar on it and the hotel's outdoor cafe gave us some vinegar quickly. It worked. I would also like to thank Maika, the front office asst. mgr., for the excellent restaurant suggestions. We went to two outstanding places - Da Luigi (Homemade pasta) and Fleria (Best Greek food I've tasted yet.) These small, non tourist- trap restaurants were just what we were looking for. Glenda at the concerige desk also helped change plans to accommodate our family. We hope to return to this establishment someday. I appreciate your thoughtfulness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: travelman17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott San Juan for a night after a cruise. We booked the hotel through Priceline and really enjoyed it. The only negative was that we had to wait until approx. 3:00 for the room to be available (even though we were told that we could have an early check-in). The room was very nice (typical hotel room) and clean. The view was great (ocean/pool view). The pools were a bit crowded but not that bad. To get a lounge and umbrella at the beach, you need to get there by 9:00 AM. Otherwise, plan on spending your day at the pool. We would definitely stay here again (especially if we could get the same price).

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted for 6 days of sun...”
Reviews.Author: colorations
Reviews.Content: Despite some poor reviews we were very pleased with this Marriott in San Juan. We were offered an upgrade upon check-in because our room wasn't ready. In fairness it was only noon and check in is at 3PM. We accepted the upgrade but we did have to pay and additional $50 a night. We decided it was worth it because it was an ocean front corner room with a double balcony. (We had booked a city view standard room.) It was worth the price for waking up and going to sleep with the sounds of surf in the room and the view was fantastic. Overall, a very clean, well maintained property. The beach is beautiful for swimming, walking and sunning. Chaise lounges and umbrellas set up for you and bar/food service on the beach - what more do you need? I will say the food leaves a lot to be desired but plenty of choices within walking distance for dinner etc. A neighborhood Walgreens on the corner was great for forgotten flip flops, another paperback novel and snacks for the room. Ask for Pedro around the pool or beach - he was our #1 pick for waiter, made sure our drinks were poured well and took care of us. He even hugged me and thanked me the day we left. Native cuisine is great - venture out and get some. A very friendly easy island to visit.

Reviews.Title: “super stay--for the third time”
Reviews.Author: engkzl2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel three times over the last 10 years, and it's always been just super. This time (March 25-29) was even better. The main restaurant's (the Vista's) food has been vastly improved: used to be o.k., now it's really good, with Puerto Rican options, if you want a flavor of the island; or really good standards, like steak, pasta, etc. It's ambiance and food remind me a lot of a good cruise ship's, including its extensive buffet options at most meals. Tuscany restaurant is also great. Staff are very friendly and helpful, and they all speak English, which eases things. We always get upgraded just by asking nicely. I do understand the frustrations about the air conditioning breakdown, but that's been fixed. Also, I've noticed that a lot of complaints here seem to have more to do with overblown expectations and cultural miscommunications than with the hotel itself. This is a very nice hotel, but it's not the Four Seasons. Because this place is big, there is sometimes some disorganization, particularly with digital things (video folios and checkout, wireless access, Internet reservations, etc.), and I recommend that the hotel do a bit of training of their employees on those things, but if you're on vacation, that shouldn't be a big issue. And it's Latin America, not NY. Puerto Ricans are rather laid back and friendly, but they do not respond well to hypertensive, hollering Americans (being a New Yorker, I'm sometimes guilty of this, too). We have found a smile and a joke go much further than a grouchy remark to get help. I really recommend this place, and we'll certainly go back. If what you want is a relaxing beach resort, this is the best one (the other two, higher ranked hotels are not on the beach).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CSPrince
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent experience at this hotel. My room did not have a musty smell. It was nicely appointed with a pleasing color palette. The staff was courteous and very helpful. We were supplied with maps and driving instructions to places we were interested in that were off the beaten path. There are plenty restaurants within walking distance that are far more reasonable priced than the ones in the hotel. We had only one meal in the hotel (breakfast). It was alright but I suggest Danny's, which is two block away, for a inexpensive breakfast . The hotel beach is adequate. It is not especially luxurious but it was clean with complimentary chairs and umbrellas.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Destin293
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m not sure why people are complaining â€“ if youâ€™re looking for a good, clean hotel in a great location, I highly suggest staying here. I will definitely be staying again â€“ especially after seeing some of the other hotels in the area, this is definitely one of the best (the other â€œbestâ€� being La Concha, which is more expensive). The good: - Location is excellent! You walk out of the hotel and youâ€™re at the beach. They have chairs and umbrellas that they set up for you and people walk around and take your drink and food order. - The bed was so comfortable! I have a hard time sleeping and I slept like a baby in this bed with no tossing and turning. My boyfriend admitted to having to check my breathing to make sure I was still alive because I wasn't moving. - The pool area is very nice. They have the shallow pool mainly for kids then the main area that has the slide and swim up bar (Iâ€™m 26 and my b/f and I both had a lot of fun going down the slide so itâ€™s not just for kids). The area with the swim up bar was shallow, but got deeper (to about 5 feet) toward the slide area. - Staff is extremely friendly. I did not encounter one rude person, room service was fast, and they were all very willing to answer questions and help as needed. - Drinks are decently priced (according to NYC standards) and the pool bars have happy hour from, I believe, 2 - 7 with 2 for 1 on Bacardi/juice drinks so each drink would be about $4. - You can check your bags if you arrive early or have some time after check out before your flight leaves so you can go out and enjoy the pool and beach without dragging your luggage around. - The casino was nice for a hotel casino, definitely not like Vegas. They keep you filled with free drinks. - Weekend entertainment is nice â€“ they have live music in the lobby with a lot of people dancing and drinking. It was a lot of fun. - You can walk on the beach at night. They block it off at the hotel, but if you walk off the resort and walk down Condado st (right next to the hotel), itâ€™s open so you can get on the beach. - There seemed to be a lot of activities for kids. - Balcony at each room is very nice with 2 chairs and a table -- ours was big in the main tower with a city view room, others were a bit smaller. We had a city view room which was nice at night, not so nice in the day. Ask for a pool view room in the cabana building and you will get a nice view of the pool AND ocean without having to pay the oceanfront price. The bad: - We waited about 20 minutes in line then another hour for the room because it wasnâ€™t ready (we arrived at 1pm and were in the room by 2:15pm, still 45 minutes before the actual check-in time). They did pass out free drinks (non-alcoholic) while we were waiting, though. - They put a $200 hold for incidentals at check-in. If youâ€™re using your debit/check card (versus credit card), they charge $200 and refund it at the end OR you can withdraw $200 cash and get that back in cash at the end. That was a little annoying. - Food is very expensive, I wouldnâ€™t rely on it for all meals â€“ but keep in mind you ARE at a resort. The food selection at the pool bar, beach, and room service is limited, but if youâ€™re looking for a quick snack, you could split the $9 quesadilla or $13 chicken sandwich to get you through until you make it to one of the restaurants on Ashford Ave. OR just wait for the woman who walks up and down the beach selling absolutely delicious empanadaâ€™s for $4 (not affiliated with the hotel). - The water is a little rough, but this IS located on the ocean and not the sea (which is calmer than the ocean). The surf died down around 2:30pm so you could actually swim in between waves. If youâ€™re on the beach and your back is to the hotel, walk to the right and there is a little lagoon area blocked off by rocks that has water thatâ€™s about 2 feet deep. Itâ€™s pretty nice. Overall, this hotel is great and I will be back again when I come to the San Juan area.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: wherecanwegonow
Reviews.Content: I would not go back to this hotel, or even this island. It was not what i expected at all. Arriving around 10pm, trying to check in was joke. There is a live band in the lobby, and we could literally not hear the man behind the desk as we tried to check in. He could not speak over the loudness of the band. So our first impression was terrible. The hotel is obviously older, and the rooms are not up to what we expect when we stay at a Marrott Hotel, which is generally where we almost always stay when we travel. The bed was at least the same comfortable bed we are accustomed to with Marriott, but the room in general was in need of upgrading. We should have done our homework before going and we would have known that the beach is not your typical Caribbean Island beautiful beach with white sand and pretty water. It is dark sand, the ocean was so violent that i actually witnessed someone getting in distress on the rocks that jut out and someone had to rescue her. She should not have been out in the water anyway because warnings were issued. There is grafitti on the buildings around the hotel, beachside. They are all rundown buildings, looking very ghetto. The rooftop lounge was nice, with nice views especially at night, of the lights. Restaurants in the hotel are okay. It rained a lot so we did not venture out much to eat outside the hotel, but when we had a 2 hour sunny break we did walk down the street and see some other restaurants that would have been worth trying. Transportation is a problem, traffic a nightmare. We will never go back. Give me Aruba anyday!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect from even a mediocre Marriott”
Reviews.Author: docforfeet
Reviews.Content: Although well located, not performing to the level expected from a Marriott. Waited in line for 45 minutes to check in. Then it took 20 minutes to check in only to hear that the room was not ready. Room very regular but clean, rest of hotel, restaurants- not so clean. Food at pool bar terrible with very few choices. Mixed drinks very regular. Service at beach terrible. Very expensive for the money charged. Cost over $940 for 2 nights. Never had dinner at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: habs07
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in great shape. Very standard Marriott. The rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet. The hotel is a bit far from the attractions in Old San Juan; however, it does have a nice location. Very good spot to stay for business. Would have been a bit of a disappointment for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott's normal level of quality.”
Reviews.Author: margo58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Stellaris March 6-11 and had two oceanfront rooms in the main tower. Rainy weather for two days. The previous reviews regarding air-conditioning problems and a beachy, mildew smell are accurate. Upon arrival, you enter into a beautiful, very active lobby bar area with live music. The casino is off to the right and is a nice size casino with friendly workers. We enjoyed the lobby area and bar service there. All of the employees were very friendly and we felt they went out of their way to assist us whenever needed. Our only complaint was the air quality of the rooms. It was so humid in the room that everything was wet.....clothes, newspapers , book pages etc. The front desk said the air conditioner would get fixed the following morning but it never did. Our first room was Room 816. After spending one night there, we upgraded to a corner room because this room was so tiny and musty. Of course there was a fee to upgrade but the extra space was much needed. The balconies are small but serve their purpose. Usually, I am a very picker traveler and you can trust this review. There are no problems with this hotel except what I have mentioned . The biggest problem is that you expect it to be of Marriott quality and it just doesn't quite measure up to that in the rooms. Old San Juan is a great place to go and dine. Highly recommend a trip there on your visit. We used cabs all the time. The bus required exact change. Great restaurant in walking distance of hotel, Ummo, best steak ever. Beach attendants are helpful in getting chairs. Water was very rough. Pool was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bearcatter
Reviews.Content: _Lousy Internet service (for which they charge 14.95 a day), cold lobby crowded with hard chairs. There are 2 buildings, the lowrise gets NO sun at all in the balconies, the taller one does late in the afternoon. The Pool sunshine is blocked most of the time by the buildings. The beach is so- so. Food at the hotel was bland and ordinary. Waiters were innattentive to all....they gather in groups and "chatted" loudly amongst themselves....annoyed when called. Our mattress on the 10th floor was like sleeping in two holes...requests to turn it were met with "we do not do that". The room rug was barely passable. The area (condado) is full of boarded up stores and tourist trap restaurants. We ate out by the small pool bar one day and were all DELUGED with pigeons flapping and landing on our table to grab food. Talk about disgusting! THE STELLARIS IS NOT MARRIOTT QUALITY and we are Marriott fans. Marriott needs to clean this place up, upgrade or sell it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: curlyjap
Reviews.Content: We had three room in the main building. All of them smelled musty and moldy. Complained and was told by front desk staff, you're by the ocean, off course it smells like that. Our room was the least smelly, but everything felt damp, rugs, bedding, our clothes. The 2 smelliest ones were given dehumidifiers. Imagine being woken up in the middle of the night to empty it. Couldn't change rooms - hotel oversold with people sleeping of sofas in the lobby. Also, hotel's a/c wasn't for at least 24 hours - now you have hot smelly rooms, hot lobby and hot casino. No one we asked seem to know when it would be fixed. Also,was very difficult to get anyone to bring you a menu by the pool or a drink by the beach. Service was definitely lacking and so were their attitudes about it. The other issue - we definitely got ripped off by the cabs. We would tell them where we wanted to go in Old San Juan, and they would drop us off at the square where all the taxis are and tell us "it's right up the hill" or you just "have to walk a little way" That would be okay, except I have health issues and is very difficult for me to walk. I would never ever stay at that hotel again - even if it were free. I'm questioning whether I would stay in any Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “feb march2010”
Reviews.Author: delonnel
Reviews.Content: Pricey but a good pick. large clean cabanna rooms with great views of the city pool and ocean. Use marriott points if you have them

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: exploretheworld7
Reviews.Content: Disappointing hotel. There is a good health club, and a helpful concierge desk. Otherwise, generally poor service, unimpressive employee attitudes. In the executive lounge they run vacuum cleaner 5 feet from where you're eating, and your presence is the inconvenience. No functional internet service. It connects (hotel to computer), but never loads a page. Technical people on the phone couldn't solve the problem. I talked to someone who had a router sent to his room, and he never got it to work either. Other guests reported the same problem. Expensive hotel - resort fee, parking, internet (doesn't work), taxes ADD $100 US to daily room cost. Nightly music in the lobby bar is so loud it would cause hearing damage if you were standing at the front desk for more than a few minutes. I would rate this hotel near the bottom of all upscale hotels I have stayed at in the U.S., much less in other countries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort for first visit to San Juan”
Reviews.Author: WeLovePR
Reviews.Content: The Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino in San Juan is a lovely resort to stay if you are looking for a very trendy and centrally located resort in San Juan in order to visit Old San Juan and all of the nearby sites and attractions. We found the hotel very busy and very touristy but would still highly recommend it for those visiting San Juan for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Average to Very good ratings at the hotel for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: bjorn5555
Reviews.Content: A fair to moderate value in San Juan. It was the best hotel on the beach in my opinion. They were the only Hotel that kept the beach clean and had by far the most customers. They still need to improve on the Marriott customer service. We found a few employees that stood out. They had specials to get 1000 Marriott rewards at the Tuscan Rest. and 500 points at the Breakfast buffet ($20.95 pp) but both were good food. The drinks( high unless you find the happy hours) and the food was pretty fair value as compared to other places to walk to near by. They had a happy hour for women $1.00 all drinks? on Thursday. They didn't do a good job letting guests understand the specials? Maybe by design? We got average to below average information from the front desk-concierge' when they were there to help. Plan on spending $50 - $80++ for two people for dinner in this area. Most places are allacart on Ashford st area. Taxi fairs are about $15 plus bags to airport each way. $17 to go to Old San Juan. They gave us poor information on the Bacardi tour. The ferry is $100 r/t but once you get to the island, the taxi fairs are extra and you don't know what the final price will be. I gave this feedback to the concierge' office. Hopefully they will pass this on. There is a few few spots for breakfast near by for about $8.00 for a basic breakfast. Lunch at the pool is around $15 and drinks can be $10, beer $5.50 for a draft. We found a stop & Go that had beer for $7.50 a six pack. CVS was cheaper. They do provide a good beach service for free- tip the attendants tho. We had great weather 6 out of the 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan”
Reviews.Author: TanyaG2
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel even if you do not enjoy casino's. Situated right on the beach with many outdoor pools and bars. Nightly Salsa dancing with wonderful Mojito's.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and clean place”
Reviews.Author: CaryG1
Reviews.Content: Love the service and the food overall Me and my family will go back

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised.”
Reviews.Author: gofredo
Reviews.Content: Reviows were somewhat mixed so I was pleasantly surprised to find a clean, modern, full amenity hotel with a friendly and helpful staff and a great beach and a clean, fully equiped fitness center. Great security throughout hotel and very visible police presence on the beach and the streets, felt very safe. Bus stop to Old San Juan ($.75 one-way) half a block away. Big Walgreen's with food market one block away. Classy casino. Hotel restaurants are very good but expensive. Our favorite was Orosco's Restaurant, 3 doors past Walgreens. If you like Puerto Rican food, or would like to try it (you will be hooked) meals here are 1/3 of hotel cost and very good. Only complaint is the "walls are thin", can hear conversations in adjacent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location with superior service”
Reviews.Author: Redsxlvr
Reviews.Content: Pros- Beautiful view from the room overlooking the pool and ocean Exceptionally friendly staff Great location $15 cab ride to Old San Juan Lots of choices for restaurants up and down the street Safe location Great pastries and sandwiches at the lobby cafe Decent work out space Best hotel beach by far in the area Cons- $20 "resort fee" charged per day on top of room rate AKA rip off Being charged outrageous price to use the internet unless you pay the "resort fee" Really loud salsa band in the lobby on Thursday nights. If it wasn't as loud you could actually enjoy it more and have a conversation with friends. Forget any conversation. Our second visit to this location. Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money- typical Marriott resort”
Reviews.Author: srcCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Moved here from the terrible El San Juan- Waldorf Astoria and was a huge relief. Typical clean, bright Marriott lobby, with friendly staff. Stayed in a very nice cabana room in front of the pool. No noise at all, once the doors are closed. Was a little disappointed with the pool area. The pools are not as big and nice as most other Marriott resorts, but clean pool area nevertheless. Beach is clean, but the sea is rough here and really not safe for swimming, which was disappointing. Good breakfast buffet, $20 per adult and free for my 5 year daughter, unlike the El San Juan Waldorf Astoria, where I had to pay a ridiculous $15 for my 5 year old and $25 for adults for a minimalistic breakfast spread.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property that caters to every wish!”
Reviews.Author: MartySmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before and the night after our cruise. It was everything we expected and more. Our ocean front room was wonderful. Well appointed and some of the best views we have ever enjoyed. The pools were clean and inviting. We did not use the restaurants, but found excellant family fare within walking distance (2-3 blocks), there was even a Walgreens a block away for those last minute items we forgot. We would definately use this hotel again, and would stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: nancyandlucky
Reviews.Content: Good location, great view, nice beach, nice places to eat around the hotel. People at front desk were really sweet and helpful. I had trouble using my key and they came with me to be sure all was settled. Decent casino, good wine, only okay food. Pool was nice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, has everything”
Reviews.Author: purple8293
Reviews.Content: The hotel had everything we were looking for: on the beach, has two nice pools and a swim up bar! whirlpool, casino, restaurants, fitness club, tour desks, great location to walk to great restaurants, safe. Although the room had 2 double beds, and we prefer Queen, they were more comfortable than expected. Would definitely return. Just wish it was a little cheaper. Starbucks across the street, walgreens a block away for convenience if needed. You must buy the pastries: Myorka and the quesitos in the lobby coffee shop, they are GREAT! $15 fare from the airport.(then $1 a bag extra) $15 to Old San Juan by cab.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Traveleasy
Reviews.Content: Nicest thing about it is that there is no surprise as is typical of most Marriotts. The rooms were very clean, very comfortable bed, and adequate bathroom besides very friendly staff all around. The resort also has a nice stretch of beach attached to it for sunophiles and a casino for the gambling inclined. Negatives include overpricing such as $4 cappuccino at the lobby coffee shop, $4.50 for a copy of the Wall Street Journal and expensive restaurant food including a $18 breakfast buffet that is good but far from exceptional. Room service is not available at night which can be a limitation if you're looking for a late night meal on account of a delayed flight arrival (for us) or for any other reason. WiFi service is poor and contracted out for trouble shooting - not much help when I called resulting in poor connectivity and a $14 charge per day for staring at Google loading up ever so slowly! Other pluses include being located on fashionable Ashford Avenue close to some fancy shops and some very nice restaurants (try Budatai - absolutely exceptional!) and Ajilli Mojilli (Classic Puerto Rican food).

Reviews.Title: “This hotel rejuvenates all the people”
Reviews.Author: krlylox
Reviews.Content: Hello, My Husband and I returned from a week at the Marriott in Condado which is a section of San Juan. The hotel has plenty of beach. We were there from February 14, 2010 to February 20, 2010. This is a very busy time at the hotel because Valentine's Day and President's Day celebrations and vacation time. There are families with children of all ages, empty nestor's ( me and my hubby) singles who are old and young. I can share with you that everyone was enjoying themselves and I did not hear any complaints. The rooms were clean and did not have a musty mildew odor. The building next door is a ultra-expensive condo; therefore there is not a ugly building next to the hotel. I think that the building that some may have talked about could have been the maintance building which can be seen from one side of the hotel. The Condado beach area is a hip trendy area. Food at the hotel has the good days and bad. The area restaurants have service and selection. The taste at each restaurant is special and 5 star. Expensive as in NYC, Chicago, San Francisco. We are foodies and this is some of the best we have tasted. There is site seeing and do-nothing vacation in San Juan. This is your choice. The Spa is outstanding. I did the Massage, Seaweed Wrap, Reflexology, and Facial. I think you can decide for yourself to dance, gamble, swim, surf, shop or visit the art museums. This Marriott is at the perfert location for your wish and desires.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingRox
Reviews.Content: We stay in this hotel prior to going on a cruise for one day and stayed again after the cruise for one day. Both hotel rooms we stayed in were tastefully decorated. Both had balconies, in-room coffeemakers and little refrigerators. Hotel also had a couple restaurants that served breakfast, lunch and dinner including being able to be served food and drinks on the beach. Though cost of food can be pricey. Breakfast for our party of 5 cost about as much as a steak dinner for all of us in the U.S. Internet service is available for a fee. Parking was $16.00 per day for hotel guest. Hertz rental service is available at the hotel. We arrive early prior to normal check-in, bell service was outstanding- stored our luggage and accomodated us in retrieve swimsuits from luggage after storing it. They also helped us with our luggage and aquiring taxis. Casino is also available on site. There is another car rental place across the street and a restaurant that serves seafood on the patio. there are are also two Japanese restaurant down the street from the hotel. Walgreens is about block away where there also have a grocery section that you can get some snacks.Only problem was not being able to have a room before 4 pm. Plan to arrive at the hotel either shortly before that time or afterward that time. At night there is a live band that can be very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but certainly not cheap !”
Reviews.Author: RobCh
Reviews.Content: Had a great 2 night pre-cruise stay at this comfortable and well located hotel. You can book with confidence. Room on the 19th floor facing the beach was large enough and warmly decorated. Large and well appointed balcony: was great to look at the beach from there at night since the beach is partially lit around the hotel. Nice pool and great beach. Waves too strong for young children but OK for us. Great staff except for front desk who are too cold and somewhat amateurish. Waited 45 minutes for a room on a high floor (has reserved a room on the 6th floor despite our calling purposely abt this on the morning of our arrival). Weird and noisy looby, filled with hardwood chairs and tables ... bizarre for a hotel of that standing. Neighborhood in need to be spruced up but felt comfortable walking. Did not care for the restaurants around the hotel (did not look very appealing) so bought gourmet sandwiches, wine and cheese and had lovely dinners in our room. Used the pool one night. It was great. This bagatelle fetched us close to $400/ night (including breakfast). Certainly not cheap but at least we got good value for it. Be sure to tour old San Juan ... it was great and exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “This Property Barely Hanging on as Deserving the Designation of "Marriott Resort"”
Reviews.Author: snowshoedude
Reviews.Content: Marriott Resorts typically have high standards in the way they treat their guests and maintain their properties. The San Juan Marriott in Condado has faded a bit and falters here and there making you feel bad it's losing its stuff. When the things that stand out about a resort is the security and the fitness center, then it means that other resorts in the brand or competitive brands have raised the bar. Here are some random observations: - We had reserved a tower room well in advance. At check in, we were switched to a non tower room. Since front desk personnel at Marriott's have always up front with us, we did not confirm our room type at check in till we go to the room. If we would have gotten an explanation and apology for this, we would have been ok with but it was worse the change was not disclosed to us in a professional manner. While room type in some situatons can't be guaranteed, we found in this case there was no disclaimer for our reservation. - The room looked pretty good for an older hotel and appeared but was showing its wear even though attempts have been made to keep it somewhat updated. The bed was confortable and plumbing worked great. However, there was a moldy smell in the room So yeah, some room might not smell but others do.The couch was broken. - the pool area can be rather cramped when full and at any given time. Around 1/3 of the chairs at any given time seem to be in the shade. Not much can be done on this given the limited space they have available but with other resorts being more spacious and comfortable, it makes this place seem lower in quality - The public areas of this hotel are nothing special...Nothing memorable about them...other than the entire lobby is consumed by a giant bar. - The security from what we could tell was excellent... Hanging out in the lobby, at entrances, by the pool - darm good fitness center with a good number of treadmills and other cardio equipment. Rack and freeweights and at least 13 various weight machines We did encounter some good service-oriented employees at this resort but in other cases, we did not. It is the inconsistency and phyical attributes of this place that earn in an average rating in our book compare to other Marriott Resorts. Nothing great compared to other Marriott Resorts and competitors' resorts where we have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: peace23
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was very clean and comfortable. We had a gorgeous room in the Towers, it came with an ocean/pool view, which was spectacular and incredibly soothing at night. All in all we were very satisfied, the service was excellent (they allowed me to extend my trip for a discounted rate), the drinks strong and the location (Condado) was perfect for us. The hotel is pretty popular among the elderly and young families, so both the pool and the beach can easily feel overcrowded during peak travel times. The casino is a rip off, so I wouldn't waste my time. Also, they should consider providing free shuttle buses to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: MMBarnes
Reviews.Content: Beautiful tell and all of what you expect from a Marriot. The rooms are updated however they are a little small. The resort sits on the beach. It is in a good area of San Juan and not too far from great shopping. It has a beautiful pool although not very large and a decent amount of beach to use but it is a little crowded depending on the day. Make sure to go for the beach view not the city view. The hotel is busy all day and night with lots of stuff to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Traveler4123
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was a great choice for me and a buddy to stay at while visiting PR. It is in the Condado region of the island, which is mainly the touristy area. The beaches in this area are fantastic and you can walk to numerous bars and restaurants. The Marriott has ample chairs, umbrellas, and cocktail servers to make ur beach experience worthwhile. Pool area was large, casino was average, but the outdoor beach bar was surprisingly tiny. Old San Juan is only a $12 cab ride down the road and was worth the day trip to experience some true culture of the city. The Marriott also has a car rental kiosk in the lobby that we utilized one day and took a trip to El Yunque rainforest. Worth the drive to get there. Unbelievable. The staff at the hotel was very accommodating and if you happen to be a Platinum Rewards member, they treat you like gold and offer even additional amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisMN86
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay, with no real complaints. It is exactly what is expected-amazing ocean views, immaculate, beautiful beach and pool, good food, etc. It was very expensive, and we only paid that because it was our honeymoon. Given that, if you are willing to fork over that amount of money, it is a spectacular room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: seeingtheworld22
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, but I've stayed here several times for business and have loved it every time. The lobby is huge and impressive, with live music playing on the weekends. There is a casino that the locals like to go to as well. The rooms are nice and the beds are very comfortable. Always a good night's rest at this Marriott. The two pools are awesome. Very relaxing and there is also a slide that is fun for kids and adults. The beach is fine. It tends to have a lot of sea weed. I guess the only drawback is that this hotel isn't near Old Town San Juan. But there is plenty of nightlife in the lobby and the casino. This is not a dull hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Next time stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Parity
Reviews.Content: There was a lot of staff, but it seemed they just didn't quite 'get-it'. In addition to lots of staff there were a lot of police, which really doesn't make me feel safer, and all the staff and police talking to each other. The room was on the main floor and they gave me a handicap room without any warning, which as a frequent traveler I was not very happy about. They put a large blue handicap sign on the door so I think people thought it was a bathroom and were trying to get into my room all night, lovely. The closet was about 1 foot wide and the bathroom was just a sink with no counter space, which made the use of the room very awkward. Hopefully their other rooms are better, but overall the hotel itself was dark and awkward, so I wouldn't stay again. The Ritz which is only 10 minutes from the airport is a far better hotel and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “I love Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: slmslo
Reviews.Content: Definitely do the activities in Puerto Rico. Make sure you have an idea before you go it gets pretty pricey. We did a tour outside of the hotel where we got to repel down a waterfall and actually hike up through the forest. Best Ever! El Yunque - is pretty but if you are young its kind of boring. Bacardi Tour- Its ok. Also there is something to do every night if you really want to. The taxi's will take you everywhere but must of them don't know where things are!!! Yikes lol The hotel was nice, the view was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, chasing the sun though”
Reviews.Author: jviolante
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with my lovely bride and had a nice time, people are friendly rooms are nice its a Marriott, very loud music every night in lobby..OMG.. The casino is a no win situation... I tell you you the only two negatives are the pricey lunches by the pool and chasing the sun around with all the palm trees around the pool if you don't get there early you will be in the shade most of the time. Tip for you, your first day there you will notice where the sun is at 10am and where the shade is at 12pm etc, you will have to do a shuffle if you want to lay near the pool, most guest know the game already... Game on' all and all a very nice place to stay. 1 More thing, they charge you to use the guest PC's if you dont have your wireless in your room connected. Just tell them you need to check your mail quick, they do keep tabs on you though!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Great”
Reviews.Author: BedelD
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself was kind of confusing when I first walked in and saw a huge bar right in the middle of the lobby, couldn't even determine where the check-in desk was but eventually saw it. The Casino was a little smaller than what I'm used to but offered everything except free drinks. The elevators were freakishly fast but def served it's purpose. Overall it was great.. The Executive Lounge on the PH floor is pretty accommodating and has a pretty sweet view.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: cathy1018
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott for 3 nights in the beginning of January. I was getting a little nervous reading the most recent reviews about the mold, mildew and humidity in the rooms. We found none of that. We had a tower room with a beautiful view and had a wonderful stay. I am a travel agent and use trip advisor alot. This hotel is in a great location. We felt safe everywhere we went and found everyone to be very friendly. If you leave the hotel and take a right, just a 10 minute walk down the street gives you many choices for dining - right on the water. We went to Old San Juan several times and loved it. It's a beautiful old city with great views and restaurants. We went to two restaurants in Old San Juan - The Parrot Club (fabulous!) and Al Dente - which was also very good. The breakfast buffet at the Marriott was very good - the bar area in the lobby is huge and always hopping at night. My husband went into the casino several times while I sat at the bar alone and I felt completely comfortable. I would highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: iove2travel55
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights prior to a cruise. Check in was quick and easy despite it being past 1 AM. The room and bath were spacious. A nice touch was that free bottles of water were provided twice a day. Also bags of chocholate covered pretzels came with the nightly turndown. The resort has a beautiful pool area with 2 pools, 1 with a slide and a hot tub. There were plenty of free lounges at the beach which staff carried to your preferred location. A downfall at the beach was that the sun sets behind the tall buildings so it is mostly shaded from early afternoon. The breakfast buffet was very good but expensive- about $20 before tax and tip. There is a lunch buffet but we never tried it. The italian restaurant on site had an early dinner - $20 for a 3 course meal. Although it said no substitutions they easily subsitiuted a vegatarian main course for our daughter and substituted desserts. There was also a good $32.95 seafood buffet where again they only charged $14.95 for our vegatarian daughter. There is a small asian restaurent located in the casino anbd a coffee shop in the lobby opened for breakfast and lunch. There is a full health club and spa. The concierge was helpful even e mailing information prior to our trip. There was entertainment everynight in the lobby however when tehy tried "American Music" the place was empty. On the nights they did Latin it was jammed with locals who didn't have too much use for the tourists. The casino also seemed more interested in the locals than the tourists staying in the hotel. There is a Walgreens a block away that was very useful for picking up drinks and snacks. Starbucks is across the street and there are numerous restaurants within a few blocks. We rented a car for 2 days to explore and found the roads to be fine- although everything is in spanish. It proved much less costly than taking bus tours. Cabs are expensive- $15-20 to old SAn Juan which is only a couple miles away. If you wait at the bus stops we found that vans came by that took you for $2 per person. The were all licensed so we felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelOnceMonthly
Reviews.Content: I was in San Juan in mid January. The location is great. My check-in took no more than 5 min. My room was in the cabanas building. It was spacious, had a larger balcony than the main tower rooms. The staff are quite helpful and very friendly, except for the beach attendants, who seemed to be rather busy enjoying each other's company instead of paying more attention to the guests on the beach. The beach is wide and clean, but seems to be eroding. The water was very clear, although the surf was quite high. It was fun, though, to do some body-surfing. All-in-all, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel for PR standards”
Reviews.Author: blueBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: I have been to P Rico many times and I can say that the hotels standards are very low compared to other countries. This Marriott is very well located, the rooms are nice, we have a corner room so it was bigger than the average room, Lcd Tv, no mini bar but an empty frigidaire to store what ever you want (threre is a 24hs Walgreen a block away). The hotel has everything you can need, a large gym and nice spa, great beach, nice swimming pools, landromat, etc. The area is full with excellent restaurants (walking distance), some: Miro,Ropa Vieja, Buddatai, Bodegas Compostela.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is just as nice the second time around!”
Reviews.Author: MaltMom
Reviews.Content: There are certianly enough reviews detailing the quality of service at the Marriott San Juan. I won't dplicate other people's efforts. I will simply agree with them when they say that this is a great place to stay in terms of location, quality, and view. I will note that the ocean is not for the frail as the surf is powerful and can knock you down if you aren't careful. During our stay, one woman almost drowned as the waves got the better of her. She was taken by ambulance to the hospital but seemed fine the next day. One thing the beach does have is a really good masseuse! Yup-- right there on the beack is a happy little man who calls out "massage,. THE BEST" to anyone who'll listen. He is darn closee to telling the truth! I asked several people as they walked away from his tent how things went and each person said that this guy was the real deal. I went and had a massage myself and they were right. He hit the tight spots and gave them a great workout. I felt much loser when he was done. We are looking forward to next year's visit already!

Reviews.Title: “satisfied again at the Marriott San Juan”
Reviews.Author: beausmom1
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit at the Marriott San Juan Stellaris. Again we were pleased with out corner room, great views of the ocean and city. In spite of rain we were able to get to Old San Juan for the San Sabastian festival. The hotel staff from the guys at the door to the conceriges were helpful and accommodating of our special requests and questions. We felt very safe walking and taking the city bus.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tempdragon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a business meeting. The service was friendly and efficient. The doorman opened the doors for the guests and the front desk staff was friendly. The rooms were clean and spacious. I had a 3rd floor tower room facing the east (peek a boo ocean view and of the other building). There was a small fridge in the room which was nice for cold drinks. There is a Starbucks right across the street and a Walgreens nearby on the next corner. The location is central in Condado, however there really isn't anything nearby that I would want to visit. It rained during most of our visit and they do have umbrellas in the closet for you to use, which was nice. The gym at the hotel was great. They have new equipment and fresh cold towels for you to use after working out. The restaurants at the hotel were standard Marriott fare. The service was kind of slow, but otherwise okay. The concierge was helpful and provided tips on where to visit. The lobby bar was probably the busiest place at the hotel. Great place to congregate and socialize. The casinos were so so. They have a few table games and some slot machines. Nothing like Vegas, but if you need a quick fix, it will do. If I were to return to San Juan, I would not mind staying at this hotel. It served well for a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to go there again”
Reviews.Author: 123purple
Reviews.Content: The service was great. The rooms were clean. The view was...have no words. The staff was very helpful. We arrived early for checkin, but they were very accomodating. The rooms were clean. The pool are was always clean and the service wonderful. This was a trip that we will not forget. From the minute we walked in, until we left, we were treated as pampered guests. I know the hotel doesnt control the weather, but that was great too. I cannot wait until out next trip to Peurto Rico..because we are definitely going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to ring in the new year!”
Reviews.Author: sunseekerMaine
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to San Juan and we had a wonderful stay at the Marriott. The staff was friendly even with a full hotel. Upon arrival the lobby was lively but the desk staff was very helpful. We a deal on a city view room but wanted a partial ocean view if possible. When we got to our room we were pleasantly surprised. It was nicer than in the pictures and when we went out to the balcony, we had a beautiful side view of the ocean and we could hear the surf. The concierge was helpful with locating restaurants and the bell captain was alway helpful with directions and transportation. The only negatives were that the surf was very rough on Condado beach and there are alot of empty boarded up buildings on Condado beach and in Condado. Based on what we read, we had expected lots of great shopping but found things spread out and the shopping just okay in Condado. The restaurants were good and an easy walk Condado. New Years Eve at the Hotel was very nice but crowded. Everyone dresses up in San Juan and really celebrates until the early morning hours. We could see several fireworks from our balcony. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay but Don't Eat Here”
Reviews.Author: Morgan2281
Reviews.Content: Almost everything about this hotel was amazing. The beach was great, but be prepared for it to be crowded, especially on the weekends. We found the service to be excellent. The concierge was extremely helpful when trying to find other places to eat as well as other places to visit on the island. The casino was great but got very busy at night. We had to wait 10 minutes sometimes to get onto a table. The only thing we really didn't like about the hotel was the price of the food and drinks. Two drinks will easily cost $20, which adds up extremely fast. We ate dinner there twice, and for 2 of us it cost $60 the first night and $130 at Tuscany's. The food wasn't worth that much. I would recommend leaving the hotel and walking east 1 block where you will find many restaurants serving better food at a cheaper price. There is also a small Mexican place about 3 blocks to the west which has really cheap drinks and great food. Finally, if you tend to go to bed earlier and don't like a lot of noise, request that you stay on a higher floor and preferably on the ocean view side. We stayed on the 4th floor in a city view room and we could hear the music from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sound of the Surf”
Reviews.Author: MustLoveTravel99
Reviews.Content: If you are debating between staying in the city of San Juan or on the ocean, stay on the ocean. We spent one day seeing the sights in OSJ and we were satisfied. If you have time for only one of the forts, choose San Cristobal. Do not drive in the city of OSJ unless you can drive in Rome. On the other hand, the buses do not run on schedule. Plan an hour each way if you want to save money with the .75 cent bus fare -- exact change requried. We rented a car from Charlie's right across the street to go to the El Yunque rainforest. It cost $37 for the day and the drive was not difficult. Just watch your back as tailgating seems like a pasttime. Even if you are over 60, you can walk up to La Mina Falls if you have good walking shoes. I would have worn hiking boots had I known the trail was so slick. Don't forget to bring water. This is the best rainforest we have ever experienced in North America. It's a walk we'll always remember. There is some truth to all of the comments on this website, but overall we loved hearing the sound of the surf from our oceanside room. My husband and I don't swim so we enjoyed just watching the surfers and the skill of those trying to swim in the high waves. Unfortunately, the beach is not for walking because of the scum from the surf and the dilapedated buildings on the beachfront --- ugh! We only ate breakfasts at the hotel and they were good. The best meal we had was at Miro's across the street from the hotel, but it was also the most expensive. One night we had the best Margheritas ever at Tiajuana's, but the next night when we ate there, the Margherita was poor and the food mediocre compared to Mexican restuarants in Chicago. My husband liked his meal at YerbaBuena but I thought the chicken was very dry. If you eat at Ummo's, the chicken and skirt steak are very, very good, but avoid the "dinner for two" items on the menu unless you like sweetbreads (calf neck) and fatty short ribs. We thought the service at the hotel was great! Ask for Mica if you have problems. She is the "It" girl there. We didn't find our room humid, but our clothes felt and smelled more damp than usual when we unpacked and everything needed to be washed. The Fitness Center is not to be missed. The equipment is the best we've ever seen at any hotel. Our main disappointment was the lack of live music in walking distance from the hotel. The music in the hotel lobby was so loud we couldn't hear each other talk. Even the Renaissance had no live music during the week, although that very beautiful hotel seemed sterile compared to the Marriott. We did not find any night life in walking distance except for the gambling at La Concha where we had better luck than at the Marriott casino. We were very lucky with the weather and never before experienced what we considered "perfect" weather. No rain, no wind, no bugs, and no humidity. We ate outside each night and felt like we were in a comfortable inside room. The last day it poured and seeing the palm trees sway in the wind was probably more realistic. Still we could sit out on our balcony. We would stay here again were we to return to San Juan. I want to again hear the sound of the surf.

Reviews.Title: “True family place but felt a bit like sardines in a can”
Reviews.Author: RichieRichPhilly
Reviews.Content: We went to Puerto Rico for New Year's with few expecations given the fact that my fiancee and I really needed a vacation. I had researched using tripadvisor and narrowed it down to the Marriott and the Courtyard Marriott in Isle Verde. The pluses at the Marriot were 1. extremely nice cleaning staff who really made the rooms VERY CLEAN 2. Above average work out area for a hotel 3. Good buffet breakfast ( including tax and tip 48 for two people) 4. Nice lobby bar and casino available albeit very small by US standards 5. Walking distance to a very helpful Walgreens where snacks were plentiful and very good restaurants nearby ( loved Budathai just across from the Renaissance and Roberto Trevino was recently on show Next Iron Chef and let us take a pic with him in the kitchen!) 6. Fridge to store drinks in room Minuses 1. Beach was rough and felt like sardines on the beach due to wall to wall people with only fair beach 2. Beach atttendants never carried a lounge chair for me during our stay 3.
