HORRIBLE ROOM SERVICES ( took 50 minutes and three calls to get a beer can opener and 40+ minutes to have two extra bathtowels delivered 4.We were next in line for check in when we got there and waited 15 minutes 5. Tour recommended in the lobby was really a delivery boy who pretty much told us how much time we had to before getting back to bus during three stops 6. Pools were pretty much totally covered with shade due to too many trees 7. Had to negotiate the big shadow created by the hotel 8. Pretty much all the hotels in Candado have below average beaches 9. Ok note taxi was always 15 dollars plus tip everytime we used it and while the bus was quick when it got there was on no particular schedule We took a taxi to Isla Verde and bus back and stayed on the beach at the Courtyard Marriot. It had an excellent beach, very good beach amenities, a more spacious sun coverd pool and no feeling of being overly crowded. Inside we walked in and it felt more like a Hampton Inn. Thus, the balance between the more luxurious Marriot Lobby ( and maybe rooms) vs a far superior beach and outside area at the Courtyard Marriot...btw..the planes overhead there did not seem very significant. Overall, a fun vacation due to the time in Old San Juan, a brief walk to Plaza de Mercado near the marriott, 3/5 sunny days away from snow in the US, and a solid time at the Marriott. IF you have a big family you will fit in well at the Marriot.t If beach is the priority, look at El San Juan, Ritz Carlton or Courtyard Marriott. Overall grade B-

Reviews.Title: “Very nice atmosphere and staff; great central location”
Reviews.Author: Miketheworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Visited last week of December with my wife and 3 kids, aged 19-23. All in all a highly positive stay at this Marriott. Staff was cordial and responsive. Highlights: Beautiful ocean views, strong hotel gym with plenty of machines (to work off the Mai Tais), nice bar atmosphere beachside. Rooms were very clean, not worn out. Great location for the 10 minute ride to Old San Juan or east to Isla Verde area. Also, walking distance to some good, varied restaurants. We were happy with Ajili Mojili, Yerba Buena, Tijuana's and for breakfast, Latin Star (good and cheap). Also ate at Aguaviva in OSJ and Koco (at El San Juan Hotel)...while food was great at both, these higher end places were not as strong on service. As written elsewhere on site, patience a plus here. One of the nice points of emphasis at hotel (also seems to be characteristic of other hotels) is the central lobby location for the hotel bar, with live music on several nights of our stay. Downsides....wave action and undertow make Condado beach a tough place to swim; though beach and water were clean, the waves can really beat you up. And while we loved the atmosphere at bar by beach, food was mediocre and you're battling pigeons. Small grocery store down the street was great assist to reduce costs....especially needed with 3 drinking - legal kids (take a left to walk east on Ashford for 5 minutes) and look for green awning. Also, Starbucks across street was cheaper than hotel coffee stand in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to waste your money and time”
Reviews.Author: Bowdoin79
Reviews.Content: Went for 2 nights..what a mistake. I have just starting using Marriott for travel and thought it would be great. The hotel staff and facilities were simply overwhelmed by the number of guests. There were never any lounges available at the pool or beach... and most people would simply pile their belongings on the chairs and then never use them. The pool area was disgusting... towels strewn everywhere... Marriott point redeemers chomping on cheetos and guzzling soda from the Walgreens across the street. The place looked like Woodstock after the concert was over. Food at the hotel was disgusting.. overpriced and overcooked. Our room had disfunctional air conditioning that would not dehumdify the room .. humidity was 85%. The staff brought a dehumidifier.. but it did not work..so we gave up and wore damp clothes . The manager is sympathetic.. but the other staff look at you with a blank stare knowing you will be checking out soon. Could not wait to leave. In the future.. I will stay at La Concha right down the street... walked around the place... a calm oasis compared to the hell of the Marriott .

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Stay at the Marriott San Juan Resort!”
Reviews.Author: M&CMother
Reviews.Content: I wanted a nice, relaxing, aggravation-free hotel stay in San Juan during the week before Christmas and did extensive research before chosing the Marriott. Every hotel in San Juan except the El Convento seemed to have at least some negative reviews on all the sites, including the Marriott, so I was a bit worried - complaints focused on room size and the neighborhood. Our room was on the small side for four people but it was very comfortable with a nice bathroom and a big lanai with a view of the ocean (even though they told us it was a city view room). The beach area is a bit small and a significant part is shaded during the day, but fine for hanging out. (I had a massage at the place on the beach; view of ocean was pleasant but massage rather mediocre.) Pool area was very nice and in the evening when you walked through the area you could hear the unique chirping of the coqui frogs. Neighborhood was ok too - never felt like we were in any danger. My husband and 10-year-old son went on one of the half day tours to El Yunque rain forest and really enjoyed it, particularly the guide, whom my son bonded with and followed around. We didn't take the bus to Old San Juan; cabs seem to be zoned in the city and I think the ride from Condado to Old SJ is supposed to be $12 but we were charged anywhere from $12-15. Generally speaking, we found the service excellent (with the exception of the girls manning the towel station at the pool area, who had a consistently unhelpful attitude) - front desk, restaurant staff and maid service were friendly and helpful. They have a coin laundry available, which was very convenient by our third night there. All in all, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “service has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: hazysunshineBoston
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel 4 times over the last 3 years and the level of service I receive has consistently declined. While the hotels location in Condado is great and proximity to Old San Juan a plus - the inconsistency of service means that I won't be returning for a 5th time. Three years ago the hotel was very customer focused and did whatever they could to accomodate you. In fact the reason I choose to return a second time rather than try a different hotel was purely the friendliness of the staff and their excellent attitudes. This has for the most part changed. While there is the occasional exceptional staff member - the vast majority simply go through the textbook routine of being inflexible, unaccomodating, and just generally not friendly towards guests. There's nothing major I can point to that brings me to this conclusion - its rather the sum of all the little things (ie. not giving adjoining rooms, no late check out, no friendly small talk). In my mind its the little things that matter and this hotel has lost its touch.

Reviews.Title: “Mildew!!”
Reviews.Author: KBandMB
Reviews.Content: Short version: This is an excellent resort with one major problem-- mildew. It's a shame to give this place 2 stars instead of 5, but the stench of mildew in our damp room(s) was a huge detractor from the friendly service, great location, and otherwise fabulous rooms. If mold/mildew does not bother you or cause you respiratory problems, then definitely stay here. Otherwise, keep looking! Long version: We were given a room on the Cabana side, 7th floor. We noticed the smell immediately and called the front desk. They said there were no other rooms and sent up a kid from housekeeping with a spray bottle of greenish liquid that he said was "to cover the smell." Since the problem was in the air, we did not know where he was supposed to spray, and neither did he. Called down again and suddenly there were other rooms available. A super-nice guy from housekeeping showed us two more rooms. One was two floors below us and had a strong chemical smell. Guy said it was from the freshly cleaned carpets and the smell would dissipate. He was right-- the "carpet cleaner" smell went away in a few hours and was replaced with the same musty, moldy stench. We were placed on a waiting list for a dehumidifier (the hotel has several, and they were all being used by other guests-- red flag!). After a damp, sleepless night we called down again and got the same story. After a day on the beach there was still no dehumidifier. More calls downstairs did not help. Only after we went to the front desk and acted like a couple of jerks did they "find" us a dehumidifier. The machine ran non-stop, filling with water every few hours. The smell got better, but never went away. By the 4th day it had invaded our clothes, too. Marriott needs to do something about the air quality in this hotel before someone gets really sick. As mentioned, the rooms were otherwise great-- nice furniture, fabulous bed/bedding, new flat-screen TV, spacious bathroom (no fan, though). Cabana rooms are definitely bigger than those in the main tower. Everything was clean and housekeeping kept it that way throughout our stay. Everyone on the staff was extremely polite and friendly, even when we were complaining. The beach is good by San Juan standards, and there are plenty of chairs/umbrellas. Drinks/food are at typical resort prices, with acceptable quality. As you walk out of the hotel, there's a liquor store to the left and a Walgreen's to the right, both nearby. You can stock up on drinks/snacks and keep them in your room fridge. Tips: The blackjack tables in the casino are "no peek." So, if the dealer is showing an ace or face card, you should think twice before splitting or doubling down-- the dealer could end up with blackjack and you'll lose more than your original bet. Also, shop around before booking a tour with the hotel. They put us on a rainforest excursion that was basically just a $53 bus ride with a lazy guy who didn't know much about the rainforest. We saw signs in old town for better excursions for cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed, Front desk staff/mgr are completely un-helpful and total gross incompetence”
Reviews.Author: map1294
Reviews.Content: As for the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino, I could say the accommodation is comfortable, but only worth a three-star rating, I have read that the "Cabana" rooms seem bigger and with better AC. Tower rooms is what we were given and told itâ€™s an upgrade â€œso called upgradeâ€� was smaller and more humid. The front staff was non-apologetic, completely un-helpful and total gross incompetence, absolutely pathetic and completely not on a par with many other Marriottâ€™s I have stayed at. Many commented on how nice the staff was, and I totally agree except for the front desk and (lack of conciergeâ€� and as for the bellmen they have to go back and take the training â€˜how to provide customer serviceâ€™, for one they would not open doors are always busy chatting with the locals. Whereâ€™s the housekeeping â€˜Maidsâ€™ are all really exceptional. This hotel is not for families, asthma sufferers or for people that want to relax at a resort. Hands up to you J.W.! I was treated so shabbily that I will pick another hotel when I return to San Juan; the day we left we had to be at the airport at 5pm so I asked if we could keep the room until 2 pm. They point blank refused. If you are looking for a relaxing time and a hassle free check in this is not the resort for you. They had closed off concierge lounge for private functions every day for the locals, from Dec 24th thru Jan 3rd. So they can make extra revenue, which I am ok with that, but they never compensated for this and being a primer platinum never offered anything not even the arrival gift.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected at all! Not your usual Marriott experience!”
Reviews.Author: oceanrefuge
Reviews.Content: Room was small overall with a king size bed. Bathroom was unbelievably small....Drawer pulled out into toilet. Had difficulty closing bathroom door due to such a cramped space. Lots of waiting at the front desk to check in. Pool area too small to accommodate hotel guests. While walking the beach you go by many run down, abandoned hotels/condos. Very run down area in general. MANY fast food restaurants. Very disappointed at the lack of quality food available. Italian restaurant at the hotel was the best choice. Overall a disppointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Cabana Rooms, not Tower”
Reviews.Author: SandyPantsKK
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here two times with different results. "Cabana" rooms seem bigger and with better AC. Try to get a cabana room upon check in. Tower rooms are smaller and more humid. The hotel is convenient to Old San Juan and Isla Verde. Several good restaurants are in walking distance to hotel. Beach is not pristine and the waves are rough here, but friendly waiters serve drinks and food. Chairs, umbrellas and towels are available for all hotel guests. We used the basement fitness center in the hotel, which was adequate with a variety of machines. Also had a good massage at the spa. The guy in the tent on the beach also offers massages and chiropractic alignments - he's good too and quite a character.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for pre-cruise stay in San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: SasaMommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for three nights before our cruise. On the plus side, the hotel is at a great location. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes in the area, a Walgreens, a Starbucks and the bus stop is just steps away (it only costs 75c to go to OSJ). We saw police patrol on bicycles and motorcycles day and night, it felt very safe to walk around at night. The two pools are clean and well-maintained. You get free beach chairs and towels. There are two free bottles of water each day in the room. On the negative side of things, the food at the hotel is very expensive. We got a city-view room, and it's a Very small room. I could say the accommodation is comfortable, but only worth a three-star rating. And the wireless internet is painfully slow. We ended up using the internet connection at the Starbucks across the street instead. If you need to talk to the front desk staff at night, you almost have to shout because the music at the lobby bar is so loud. Overall, we were satisfied with our stay. Could we have picked a better hotel? Of course, like the El Convento, but you have to pay more than double the price! **Tips for travellers. For breakfast or lunch, go to Camile's Cafe instead of Danny's. It's much better quality and value. Try the Cherry Blossom Tepanyaki. But don't order any sushi because for one, they're very expensive, two, you won't be able to finish all the food! Their final bill already includes a 15% tip. Consider taking the bus instead of taxi to OSJ. The buses come every ten minutes. When you are taking a taxi, always agree on the fare before you get on. Sharing a cab is cost-effective.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: mellowY2
Reviews.Content: We got the trip via Cheapcarribean.com and got a great price for a city view room. When we got there we got an offer for an upgrade, which we gladly took, and boy was that the right decision. We got the balcony overlooking the pool and the ocean, and can hear the sound of the waves as we fall asleep at night. The room is nice and clean, there is a refrigerator and a safe in the room. I didn't get to use the high speed internet connection, but the in-room coffee service was great - we made coffee in the morning and sat on our balcony and just sat enjoyed the view. There are many other amenities, including free hour of internet each day of your stay. There is a kiosk where you can print your boarding pass without going to the business/computer center, but it wasnâ€™t working when I tried to use it, so Guest Services printed them for me and send it up to our room. Service was generally excellent. Our bell boy, Pedro, waited patiently for us to check in, then gave us lots of advises on where to eat, what to see, best way to get around, and so forth. The front desk/guest services were equally accommodating. The woman behind the Conciergeâ€™s desk seemed impatient and was annoyed with my questions because she was doing something else. Instead of nice sitting areas, the lobby has a bar right in the center and tables and chairs all around it. My husband said that is how most hotels are set up here. There is a Coffee Merchant that sells coffee, light snacks and ice cream during the day, then the place is turned into Noodle Village at night. We didn't try the Tuscany, which got great review from another travel site, but mixed review from TripAdvisor users. One of the couple we met told us the food was great though; they were from D.C. area so they should know We had breakfast at La Vista every day, and we always get the buffet breakfast, which, at $19.99pp, was the best value. You get made to order eggs/omelets (they do have eggbeaters), assorted fruits, cereals and pastries. We're so full from breakfast we seldom need to stop for lunch. They also have a seafood/prime rib dinner buffet, which we tried the last night we were in Puerto Rico, and it was also very good. There is a bus stop a block from the hotel, bus fare is .75pp. As is in the states, exact change is needed for the bus. Old San Juan is the last stop on most of the buses, but B-21 is the most direct route. From Old San Juan you can catch buses to various parts of the island. If you want to go to Isle Verde from the hotel you may be better off with a cab The hotel has two beautiful pool area, one only a few feet deep (for the families with little kids) and one that goes up to 5 feet deep. As hotel guests, you can get free umbrellas and chairs at the beach right in front of the hotel, and there are staff to help you set them up if you wish. I have read, and the hotel staff confirmed, that due to strong current, it is not a good idea to actually swim there. Most of the guests seem to heed these advises, and stay on the beach. The casino is small compare with those in the states, and the odds of winning are horrible, but I think that is the case for most of the casinos on the island. We visited hotels in Isle Verde, and while there are many nice hotels, including the famous El San Juan, with ornate lobby and great nightlife. But the neighborhood was not as well lit, and has fewer nice restaurants than Condado (thought I think the best restaurants are in Old San Juan) We also visited El Convento hotel. El Convento is quaint, but if you like all the modern convenience, such as a pool and fitness center, it may not be for you. It is located in Old San Juan, which is dark and very quite in some areas so I didnâ€™t feel as safe there. Overall, we were very happy with the choice we made, and would recommend this hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: yellow50
Reviews.Content: This was a trip planned by my husband for my birthday. Our room was a water front view room . The room was clean the view terrific , balcony , refigerator in room was great because we were able to buy cold drinks and keep cold. The people were friendly , it was only a 20.00 charge with tip to go to Old San Juan by cab. We took the local bus for 75 cents , which was right around the corner from the hotel and took the cab back. We would stay here again with no doubt. Book room on the top floor to enjoy the view. oon

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Awesome Awesome”
Reviews.Author: ponchogirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott San Juan Resort for 5 nights and loved every minute of it. The check in process was simple, but you have to talk loud as there is a band playing in the background. We got into our room and had a beautiful view of the city. Pool/Ocean: Definitely plan on spending at least 2 days at the pool/beach. They are absolutely beautiful. The poolside bar is a must to try and the drinks at very good, but expensive. Plan on spending at least $9 on 1 drink. The beach is nice and getting chairs is definitely a plus. If you want to get an umbrella, its $12 (I think) for one. Its very windy on the beach and the waves are pretty rough, but its still fun to swim in the ocean, just be careful. They do have waitstaff on the beach to get you drinks if you want them. Room: Beds are extremely comfortable to sleep in. Balcony is nice with table and chairs to enjoy some pre-dinner cocktails. Having a mini fridge in the room came in handy as we were able to keep milk for cereal in the mornings and sandwich meat for lunches. Digital temperate control in the room is convenient. The room heats up quickly if you leave the patio door open for a prolonged period of time. Facing the city was loud, but the patio doors surprisingly blocked out most of the noise. The walls between the rooms are thinner as we were woken up in the morning by a couple yelling at each other. We definitely enjoyed the time we spent in the room. Atttractions/Restaurants: We spent a day in Old San Juan and LOVED it. El Morro and San Cristobal are worth the $5/person admission. Very beautiful sites and even more beautiful views. Its about 1 mile walk between the two sites, but there is so much to look it at that it goes quick. You cant go wrong with any local restaurant for lunch. Taxis are easy to get too. We were planning on taking the bus for $.75 there, but as we were waiting, a taxi came up and said he would take us to OSJ for $3, so we took advantage of that. Otherwise, it costs $15 one way from the hotel to OSJ. We did the El Yunque rainforest tour ($53/person through the hotel) and we really enjoyed that as well. Shuttle picks you up at 8:30 in the morning and after an informative 50 minute drive you are there. Bring a poncho or umbrella as it rains on and off there. Beautiful sites and landscape. We would recommend this to anyone. The driver stopped off for lunch at a local stop on the side of a road from El Yunque and the food was DELICIOUS! We also ate dinners at Yerba Buena (very good, we recommend the duck, but expensive), Via Appai (slightly above average pizza, poor service), and Wasabi (good sushi, slow service). These restaurants are to the left of the hotel. Starbucks and Haggen-Dazs is right across the street and Walgreens (with groceries) is about 1 block from the hotel. You can purchase liquor about 4-5 blocks away at H&G (just past the Renaissance Hotel). Overall, we loved our 1st trip to San Juan. We will definitely stay at this hotel as everyone is very nice and helpful. It was very clean and you feel safe in the hotel as security is always around. We were disappointed to leave, but cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice in Condado”
Reviews.Author: DaveHMaryland
Reviews.Content: Our family of 7 spent four nights at the Marriott over Thanksgiving weekend. The staff was always pleasant and our three rooms were kept clean and neat. Besides bathrobes, hair dryers and coffee makers in the rooms, umbrellas were provided for loan in case of rain. The hotel has two restaurants; the Tuscany and La Vista. The La Vista, while open for breakfast every day, was only open for buffet dinners on Thursday, Friday and Saturday, even though the Marriott web site implies open for dinner daily. That's not a problem since there are many restaurants with different cuisines within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Another good feature is that Hertz has a car rental facility within the hotel with on-site pick up and drop off. There are plenty of discount deals for the hotel, but make sure the front desk gives you all the benefits you're entitled to. With so many guest packages, they tend to forget some of the perks. Over all, a great place to vacation and unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay, We Will Return”
Reviews.Author: Nursewithkids
Reviews.Content: After reading hundreds of review we decided to book with this hotel and we are happy we did. The hotel is beautifu! The beach is just steps out the back door. The ocean on that side of the island is a little rough but not bad. The beach has chairs and umbrellas all you have to do is walk onto the beach and their is a person to help you, no fee for the chairs. The beach was a little dirty with some trash but people just need to clean up after they finish a drink or food. The food in the hotel was great the breakfast buffet was a little $$ but worth it. The service was great very helpful friendly people. We played tennis and the courts were in good condition. The pools are nice as well. The lobby at night is loud but it is a casino and big bar, I don't understand how people said they could hear the noise because after you turned the corner to go up to the room we could not hear anything....so it was not loud in the rooms. Security is not overwhelming but it does make you feel more comfortable. The area is very nice, the only bad thing was about 1/2 block down the beach was an old building looks as if a storm came through and they just did not fix it back up, NOT a big deal. Starbucks is right across the street and if you take a right as you leave the hotel there is a CVS or RiteAid (can't remember which) but we stocked up on food and water. MY ONLY complaint was the water pressure in the shower. It was like bathing in a sprinkler on low. I did not say anything because again it was NOT that big of a deal I have long hair it just too a little longer to shower, no problem. The room was big lots of room. Must get a balcony was beautiful in the moring, spend the money it will be worth. I will be staying next time we go and it is couple and kid friendly. GREAT PLACE!!!!!! Second ---IMPORTANT ---information!!! DO NOT DRIVE WHILE IN PR. The people can not drive. We rented a car and I have never had my "life flash" before me so many time. People cut you off, people can not park, people walk right out in the middle of the road...please take a cab. Also we could not park in old town. We came back to the hotel parked the car and took a cab. Don't waste the money.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable trip but expensive taxis”
Reviews.Author: Skipper711
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel because we were attending the Puerto Rico Tip-Off at the Coliseum. We're in our mid-thirties, and have been to Grand Cayman, Cancun, Puerto Vallarta, Tulum, Nuevo Vallarta, Belize, Cancun, Florida etc.....so we have something to compare this vacation to. TAXIS It's easy to find a taxi upon arrival to PR. It's not like Mexico where you arrive and people try to trick you into listening to a timeshare in exchange for a trip. It was $17 for 2 passengers w/2 bags. If you intend to travel around the area, plan to spend quite a bit in taxis, or you can take the bus. We ended up spending about $250 in taxis. It adds up quickly. The roads are crazy and people do not drive like they do in the US, so I personally wouldn't risk renting a car. If you are brave, feel free to do so. The HOTEL LOBBY is nice, and there is a bar area and casino upon entry. Not as flashy as some places we've been, but it was nice. Drinks at the bar were very good, some were a bit strong for my taste, but they are expensive. An ATM is on-site, as well as a small GIFT SHOP with t-shirts, drinks, candy, and any essentials you may have forgotten. The EMPLOYEES at the Marriott are there to serve you and do an exceptional job. This is the reason I would recommend this hotel. If you plan to stay in the Condado area, there are several restaurants and some shopping within walking distance, and we always felt very safe. WEATHER This was part of the disappointment of our trip because it rained 2 days of our 5 day trip. When the weather did cooperate, it was absolutely beautiful and in the mid-80's. ATTIRE The Puerto Rican women dress to the nines. If you go out somewhere special, you might want to bring a nice dress or outfit. Otherwise, shirts and shorts seemed to be accepted anywhere. It's not like Florida where people walk around in bikinis all day long. AROUND THE AREA WalGreens is to your right just about a block down the road. Straight ahead out of the hotel is a sandwich shop, and it's very good with reasonable prices. They had sandwiches, pasta, pizza, wraps, etc... It had two names, one being Taco Maker. We tried to go to Tijuana's because it was recommended on Tripadvisor, but they were closed on Sunday. We ate at the place next door, Via Appia's. They offered sandwiches, pasta and pizza. Food was decent, nothing extraordinary. We also tried a Puerto Rican restaurant just before Chili's, and it started with an A, but I cannot recall the specific name. It was good, something different. They offered meals or a buffet. FITNESS CENTER The fitness area at the hotel is very nice, and we found it to be used by many visitors, unlike any other place we have been. They have treadmills, ellipiticals, bikes and stair climber, along with various weight machines. They also offer a personal trainer if you desire. SPA Various facials, massages are offer. Unfortunately, I couldn't get the time slot I needed and you do need to make a reservation for a massage or other service. MASSAGE ON THE BEACH There is a man outside the hotel that offers massages on the beach. He initially wanted $175. We finally agreed on $75, but that was only for about 15-20 minutes. Honestly, I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND HIM. Wait until you can get an appointment with someone at the hotel. I was experiencing horrible neck pain, and needed some relief, and that's the only reason I went. He seems to think he's a doctor and he tried cracking my neck and my back even though I tried resisting him. He then diagnosed me with a pinched nerve. I've been in more pain since I left. DON'T GO. I thought it would be relaxing by the ocean, but I was too tense from worrying he was going to hurt me. BEDS The beds are phenomenal. It was the best sleep I've had, so that was definitely nice. The pillows are incredibly plush and soft. HOTEL RESTAURANTS/FOOD We ate at La Vista and Tuscany in the hotel, and also grabbed coffee and a bagle at the little cafe each morning. Everything we had was well prepared and very tasty. Tuscany can be a bit slow at times, but we were on vacation, so we weren't in a rush. Prices were somewhat high, but not like in the Caymans. ROOMS We had an oceanfront room, and it was nicely appointed with an in-room safe and a mini refrigerator. They provide shampoo, lotion, gel, soap, iron and hair dryer. We felt the room was a bit small, but we normally have a room with a separate living/bed area. It was fine, I just expected it to be a bit larger. The view was spectacular. Spend the extra money to sit out on the patio and listen to the waves crashing. I would suggest keeping the door to the patio closed because the rooms can become extremely muggy. We spoke to other people who noticed the same thing. I do wish there were a fan in the bathroom because when the showers steam up the room, it's hard to keep from getting to hot even with the AC on. Sometimes the walls did seem a bit thin. The carpet also appeared somewhat worn, but the bathrooms were very nice, as was the bedding. ENTERTAINMENT They had entertainment most nights, consisting of very LOUD bands. The music was nice, but it was so loud we simply couldn't enjoy it. We're not old by any means, and even spoke to another couple who were 10 yrs younger, and they said they couldn't stand it that loud either. People must have liked it because many were dancing and enjoying themselves. In all, the people in PR are extremely friendly, and we had an enjoyable trip. The staff at the Marriott were eager to please and always very helpful. Anytime a taxi was needed, they were eager to serve or assist if you needed directions to find something. POOL This was our biggest complaint about the hotel. There are so many trees surrounding the area, it's nearly impossible to find a spot with sun. Some people may prefer that, and if so, this is the place for you. BEACH This is a great, beautiful, beach area. Likely one of the best in the area because it's so wide. They offer beach chairs and towels. OLD SAN JUAN This was the highlight of our trip. We truly enjoyed walking the streets of Old San Juan. It is so quaint and beautiful. Do not miss the Fort San Cristobal. It is a spectacular site and to see the history and enjoy the surroundings and beautiful views was breathtaking. Hope you find this helpful. If you have more specific questions, please advise and I will try to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - bad location”
Reviews.Author: paulandpat
Reviews.Content: Just returned. Hotel was fabulous in every way. Beach is rough with red flags always up and very short. Properties on both sides are in really bad shape but they seem to be trying to upgrade. Wish the hotel was in Isla Verde which is much safer and more built up. Restaurants outside the hotel that were good were Danny's, Umma and our favorite YerbaBuena...all to the left as you leave the hotel. Prices of drinks at the hotel terribly expenisive...Bud Light $8.50 with tip so there is a liquor store right next to Umma where you can stock up and put in your frig in room. Only ate lunch at the hotel once at La Vista and it was good. Everyone said food at Tuscanny was not good so we avoided that. People were just great. Service like you wouldn't get in the States...They are a very warm culture and everyone from front desk to people cleaning the rooms went out of their way to make you feel comfortable and welcome. Had a great deal so we really enjoyed out trip but did feel a little "trapped". Again the surrounding areas are not good at all.

Reviews.Title: “A good location for your first trip to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Jack6dollar6and8
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Puerto Rico and we booked this hotel through Cheapcaribbean.com and we got a very good rate, seeing that the hotel was at the beach we expected what you'd get at the beach at other places we've been, a hotel fronted by a beach road, not here, this hotel is in the midst of the Condado neighborhood with apartment blocks across the street and a very good selection of local restaurants and bars right across the street. The lobby is what you'd expect at a business hotel except on nights when the band is playing, a conversation with the desk staff was completely impossible and we could hear the band through the floor in our 4th floor room so be advised if they try to put you in the front of the hotel on the 3rd, 4th or maybe the 5th floor ask for another room. The Condado area is pretty congested so the foot print of the hotel is small and pool area is limited and shady, the beach is nice but remember this is the Atlantic side of the island and the surf can be rough. There is a resort fee that you can't escape and if you're not going to be using their beach chairs and umbrellas you might want to choose another hotel as a base. Parking in San Juan is a big issue and you have to pay to park everywhere including here for $16 a day. As with all hotels and casinos that rate their customers if you're not a gold level member it's "wait on that line with the other peons" while others walk past you if you check in at peak times. I saw some comments on other reviews about empty buildings in the area and it is true that there are some empty hulks in view but in general the area is growing with several buildings under renovation. As I said at the beginning this was our first trip to San Juan and this hotel was good base for us to go to Old San Juan and it's easy access to 26 made it convenient to get out to see the rest of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 25th anniversary destination, The right choice”
Reviews.Author: kathyanswer
Reviews.Content: We were undecided about where to go for our anniversary, then Puerto Rico came up, so we decided to give it a try. We had no idea about where to stay. After researching on the computer, we decided to stay at the San Juan Marriott. Let me tell you I was very worried, but boy did we make the right choice!! It was just beautiful!!! I will always remember walking into the back lobby and getting that spectacular view of the pool and ocean.!!! We had a short wait for our room after checking in. and when we did get into our room we found that they upgraded us to a ocean front room. It was wonderful walking out and having that wonderful view of the ocean. So beautiful and relaxing, we could have stayed on the balcony for the whole trip (lol). What fun, the beach was great! It was rough, red flag was always up, but not too bad. The pool so relaxing, both when you were in it or just sitting around it. Lots of fun! Food prices were exensive at the hotel, but there are alot of restaurants within walking distance, so you had your choice. The drinks were good, we got to enjoy them at the beach and pool, The hotel was very clean, always a concern of mine, I did worry about that before we went, but all that worry was for nothing. Room was spotless! Althought we had no luck at the casino, it was fun! Small, but fun. In previous reviews people complained about the area. It wasn't bad at all. A couple of buildings under construction, and one that was vacant a couple of buildings away, but that did not distract from the beauty of our resort. It was also very safe. We went to Old San Juan twice, we got the local bus at the corner from the hotel (turn right when leaving the hotel). As you're waiting taxi cabs will stop and ask if you want to go to OSJ for $10 or more, but just wait, the wait for the bus isn't bad and we paid only 75 cents, make sure you have the right change. And they drop you off at the bus station in OSJ and from there you get on the free trolley, which takes you around OSJ or one that takes you to the forts. It was great! Just remember to get a map of the trolley stops, we picked one up at the fort , but there are many places you can pick them up at. Overall it was a wonderful 25th anniversary vacation, we were so lucky to have picked this resort. Just beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rougher ocean (than I expected)”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveler57
Reviews.Content: My room was clean and comfortable. I did feel like there were a lot of rules. Good location. Head to the Walgreen's for supplies. Eat dinner at Yerba Buena. The red flag was up a lot saying that the ocean was too rough. Not Marriott's fault but not great for families with little kids or those looking for calm, clear waters.

Reviews.Title: “Not much around but a nice place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: luckik30
Reviews.Content: Granted, I only stayed here for a night, so this hotel served its purpose. The room had a lovely balcony with a great partial view of the ocean. You could leave the sliding door open and just listen to the waves. Other than a beach two steps away, there isn't much else I can comment on. The pool is nice and there are some great places to dine nearby (we recommend Yerba Buena). But, for the price, there seems to be something lacking. If you can afford it, stay here, but if you're looking for a deal, I'd head somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location lacking”
Reviews.Author: Shlinds
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a good friend who's husband is from Puerto Rico. Upon arrival the hotel looks really nice and the doormen opening the door is not something I am used to. It was beautiful inside and the little barista/cafe was wonderful to see. The check in process was simple but took a while as I waited inline for approx. 15 minutes before being helped. Once it was my turn the check in was seamless. We were given a room on the 18th floor, which was wonderful, we had partial city views and partial beach views. The city views were only of those hotels and businesses around the hotel because the area the hotel is in did not have much going on. I was told there were many restaurants and things to do, however upon checking with the activity desk - nothing was really within walking distance. The beach was wonderful - the water was rough because a hurricane was coming, which made the water extremely rough. We did get rained out one day and the casino was shut down all due to the hurricane that ended up just being a bad rainstorm. I was here over labor day weekend and the hotel must have a deal with local people that they can come and use the pool for the day or something. There was at one point so many kids over ruling the pool I had to leave because I was there for relaxation and I was better served relaxing in my room (not the place I want to be on a beach vacation). The hotel amenities were great although they tried charging $5.00 for a bottle of Figi water in the hotel room - that was not happening. They did give us two water bottles everyday when the room was cleaned and the beds were extremely comfortable. The pillows were a little hard for my liking but they served their purpose. We did go to Old San Juan for a day and walked around the forts, and went to Pigeon Park, that was a fun day we just took the local bus and it dropped us off at the starting point and we chose to walk the rest of the day, we could have taken the trolley but decided against it. Overall I would recommend this hotel and location for a long weekend type vacation. There is not much to do without renting a car or getting a taxi which can make the trip expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Read adpik's review...perfect review of this resort”
Reviews.Author: tjbrown44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Puerto Rico. We used the review by adpik. Please read it if you are considering this resort. I don't want to waste time and rewrite the whole thing. It was the best review I have ever read. Everything she posted about the Marriott and San Juan were right on the spot. The only thing I would recommend is to have the internet included in your package. It is about 15 dollars a day for this service. I would highly recommend the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: toniallday
Reviews.Content: I went to San Juan, PR for Memorial Day weekend. The hotel staff met me and my friends at the cab to grab our bags. They were polite, friendly and professional. When we arrived, our room wasn't ready so they held our bags for us and provided us with recommendations for lunch. Once we returned, they allowed us into our room early. They had our luggage loaded onto a card and met us at the room quickly. The day that we ordered room service, our order was slightly off. When we called to have it fixed, they brought us the correct items, apologized profusely, and brought us free dessert. During one of the day excursions, the concierge was wonderful booking arrangements for zip lining and a snuba adventure. They also gave us a coupon for a piece of free jewelry, and maps for sightseeing. The spa staff were also incredibly awesome. I would recommend this hotel to EVERYONE! They were awesome and the stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Hotel and Nearby Attractions”
Reviews.Author: alnheather
Reviews.Content: The review by adpikt (Richmond, VA) addresses several things we did with similar experiences: Dannyâ€™s International Restaurant, Spread Eagle II tour (overall good experience; not the clearest vision for snorkeling and water was a little choppy when we went) and Walgreens. We too recommend taking a taxi to day tour OSJ, especially the Forts (El Morro $3 and San Cristobal $3 or both $5). We also recommend for those of you who want to eat outside the hotel to take the short walk out the front of the hotel and one block to the left for restaurants. It was a restaurant â€œstripâ€� with at least 5 places to eat and all had outdoor seating. It appeared that this area was a popular hang-out and cruising strip for locals leaving work from the business district. We enjoyed the pizza at Dannyâ€™s International (although I donâ€™t recommend the fried egg on the pizza) and we enjoyed several other restaurants right across the street from Dannyâ€™s: Via Appiaâ€™s Deli (Italian â€“ we had spaghetti and filet mignon â€“ both good); and Tijuanaâ€™s Bar and Grill (Mexican â€“ we had burrito and enchilada â€“ both good). We do recommend HIGHLY the Acampa Toro Negro Rainforest Tour (will review that separately) We do NOT recommend the Old San Juan/Bacardi tour â€“ short trip through OSJ and some time at San Cristobal; does not take you into the actual Bacardi factory/distillery; too much time for too little value Pool and Beach Area Pools and waterslide â€“ good Beach bar staff â€“ very friendly and helpful Beach â€“ nice Water â€“ rough; good for bodysurfing Hotel Restaurants La Vista â€“ B/F -- Buffet was good with plenty of selection, including omelets made to order and pancakes/waffles with ample toppings. Manager took good care of us when we needed an accommodation. Dinner -- Fri and Sat was â€œSeafood and Prime Rib buffet nightâ€� Prime Rib was great; didnâ€™t try seafood but looked good; really enjoyed the pasta station with choice of three sauces and adequate meats and other items from which to choose. Tuscany â€“ took advantage of â€œearly birdâ€� dinner for two first night â€“ great food, good service and great value Ocean Front Room â€“ 11th floor, nice view from balcony, really enjoyed sound of waves; room was simple but clean, b/r was fine; ample closet space with plenty of hangers Staff Front Desk Staff/Concierge â€“ Functional Room Service â€“ Attentive, Was Quick Responding to Requests Beach Bar Staff â€“ Rocked! Bell Hop â€“ Attentive and Friendly Restaurant â€“ All nice and friendly; some excellent Tour Desk â€“ Tolerant of Guests Other Hotel Items Fitness Center â€“ Nice -- Dozen Pieces of Cardio Equip; Sufficient Free Weights (Dumb bells and plates for m/cs); Water and Towels available; Hand Sanitizer Dispensers at entrance to hotel, restaurants and other areas

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: wowneverstoptravel
Reviews.Content: We were able to check-in before 9am and got upgrade to an oceanview room. Great location, helpful staff, spacious room. Absolutely no complaint.

Reviews.Title: “getaway”
Reviews.Author: river6691
Reviews.Content: The corner suites were recently remodled and were very nice. They were large but just one room. The bathrooms were as nice as a spa. We stayed at the 7th floor and the view was great. The fitness center was one of the best I have seen in a hotel. The beach was not the greatest but it was clean. The pool area was very nice

Reviews.Title: “One heck of a GREAT TRIP EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: adpikt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple ventured to this Marriott for a 4 night/ 5 day trip. After the quick $15.00 taxi trip from the Airport to this hotel we were ready for our vacation. We reserved an oceanfront room and our friends reserved a ocean/pool view room. After checking into both our rooms I was dissappointed at the fact our room was actually smaller (30%) and our bathroom was much smaller (50%) than our friends, even though we were paying more for the oceanfront room. We went downstairs and complained and were even going to be willing to pay less and stay in their style room. The guy at the front desk was very accomodating and explained that the ocean front rooms next door the the corner ocean front rooms were smaller. (our room was 610) He moved us in the middle ocean front room on the 10th floor (1012) and it was right in line with the size our friends had paid for but ours was oceanfront. If we hadn't seen the difference in the room we wouldn't know any better and it wouldn't have been a big deal. We just hated the fact we were paying more than they were and their room was much bigger. AFter they moved us it was a non-issue. For those of you not getting the opportunity to see other rooms keep this in mind. Our overall experience after our quick room change was STELLAR! (aside from us loosing a little money in the casino ;-) Recommendations we found helpful: Room service is quite expensive. Walk just one block (leaving the hotel its towards the left) to Danny's (a restaurant) and you can get some GREAT food for a GREAT VALUE. Their pancakes were huge and two of our breakfasts were the price of just one at the hotel, plus the portions were much bigger. They are also known for their pizza! After spending lots on other restaurants our wallet needed a dinner break so we decided to head here for their pizza- it rocked! YUMMY OLD SAN JUAN! Take the taxi- don't wait for the trolley or bus, what should take 10 minutes by cab can take up to 45 minutes waiting for public transportation and then having to stop every few blocks really takes time. You don't need to sign up for a tour to visit the OLD SAN JUAN FORTS, just pay the $3.00 per person and walk it yourself. The hotel said it closed at 5pm. They just recently changed that and it now closes at 6pm (thank goodness for us as we only got there at 4:30 pm) After departing the Old San Juan Forts we walked through the shopping district and got to see all of the old houses and buildings also in "Old San Juan". We went to a TOP-NOTCH restaurant called AgueaViva (Jellyfish in English). They had very Fresh Seafood and unique blends of Rum Drinks that were just a little different but oh so good. Ask for Ronald to be your server- he was very knowledgeable and fun. The Beachfront in front of the Marriott is wonderful. The ocean at this beach (Condado) was a little rough. Being that we vacation yearly at Myrtle Beach that's what I have to compare it to. It was just slightly more rough than a standard Myrtle Beach ocean day. We decided to venture east towards Isla Verde to see the differnce in the beach there. It is way calmer. The Carolina Beach (publich beach) was AWESOME. You could go out 50' and the water only be chest high (I am 5'7"). We then even went further east to check out the beach infront of the Ritz (where we would have stayed if we didn't stay at the Marriott) The water was about the same but for some reason they had a lot of sea grass in the water there, so Carolina beach would be my favorite for the calmness of the water. Snorkeling! ABSOLUTELY Check out SPREAD EAGLE II. It leaves Fjardo (eastern most area of Puerto Rico). It is a sailing catamaran that can hold up to 45 people. They sail about 45 minutes out to a deserted island and anchor feet away from the shore. You can walk the shoreline and snorkel from there. They serve a great lunch buffett, offer you unlimited sodas, water, pina coladas or rum punch all day, and snacks. After lunch they move the boat out to sea a little towards another reef and there at that spot it was unbelieveable the different fish you see. They give you bread to feed to the fish. **buy a cheap underwater camera to capture the unforgettable views** Within a block from the hotel is Walgreens (towards the right as you leave the hotel) They sell groceries so you can stock up on milk, oj, breakfast stuff and snacks for you room. Your room (all of them do) has a mini fridge so you can keep drinks cold in there. Just across the street from the hotel (can't remember the name of it) there is a bar that serves 2-for-1 drink specials during happy hour. You can get two good pina coladas for the price of 1/2 what the marriott charges. They also have a bucket of beers (5) for the price of 2 at the Marriott. Casino: We enjoyed the Casino at the Marriott but there is something you should be aware of if you are a big Black Jack Player. The way the play the dealer's hand. They deal you your 2 cards, but only deal the dealer 1 until after everyone playing decides to hit or stay. (Most places in the US deal the dealer their 2 cards at beginning) This can be bad for two reason- 1 if you think what other players do (like stay on 14 when a dealer has a 7 showing) can mess the table up this is the place it will. Also, if the dealer gets Black Jack you won't know it until the very end, sometimes after you have decided to split 8's and doubled down which means you can loose more money on hands you though were great. We found on the last night we were there another Newer hotel down the street (2 blocks towards right if you are leaving the Marriott) that had a bigger and better Casino that plays Black Jack the normal way. It's called La Conche (my memory is not very good on the name of this one). It's a modern-furnished hotel with tons of water fountains/features on the outside just outside of the lobby. Everything is newer and there are more tables and slots. We were going to go to the Baccardi tour but ran out of time. We spoke with other couples about our age (mid 30's - early 40's) and they all said it wasn't worth the time so we didn't feel to bad about it in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not as clean as other Marriotts”
Reviews.Author: trvlcrzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the end of August 2009. We got 2 adjoining rooms so that our kids could play with each other. While the reception, hotel appearance and amenities are pretty good, the cleanliness details failed. Upon checking in our room, I noticed right away a sewing needle with a thread attached pinned to our bathroom shower curtain. My young daughter got scratched by it while taking a shower. So I took the needle out and laid it on the bathroom counter with a note that I found this in the shower. Nothing was done. A couple of days passed, and we noticed our bathroom floors not being cleaned. Everytime we returned, there's sand, hair, dirt on the floor. I had to clean it myself and I checked with my friend's room next door, same story. So, one day I placed a "Do Not Disturb" sign on our room door. Fine, but they didn't clean my friend's room either and when she called to complain, they mentioned that housekeeping had called to her room and somebody confirmed not to clean her room. How can that be if we were all gone the whole day (in Culebra) and got back in the evening already. OK. At least management sent someone right away when we complained and gave her a wine/cheese and fruit treats. Our room got nothing even with the needle in the shower tub issue...and this is the reason for my "average" rating. Never had this experience at other Marriotts before. I am also a Marriott member. One thing going good for this Marriott though is location and immediate response by management.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: rls7k
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 nights at the Marriott. I am a frequent review reader and realize how difficult it can be to ascertain the validity of differing reviews. As background, we are frequent vactioners, generally stay at 4-5 (and sometimes higher) star hotels, have done both all inclusive and regular resort stays. The Marriott in Condado is a typical, recently renovated Marriott. The rooms are lovely - and look excactly like the pictures on the website. Service was impecible, much quicker than I have found at some other beach resorts (Aruba comes to mind), but it is also a smaller property than those, and that could account for quicker service. Prices are typical Marriott, i.e. $12 for a burger on the beach. But, you are paying for service at your lounge - not a fast food, drive through. They had plenty of drink specials, and served top quality liquors. Nice sized casino, live music in the lobby on weekends. Location was typical city neighborhood, but the property inself was insulated from city noise. The beach was beautiful. Just remember - this is the Atlantic Ocean, not the Caribbean Seas, and therefore it is wavy not calm. Pool area seemed adequate for a resort of this size - but I simply cant understand why you would go to a resort like this and sit at the pool anyway. This is a beach resort and an excellent one, at that. San Juan is a great, easy getaway from the East Coast - no hassle with customs/passports since you are still in the US, lots of direct or at least short flights. Great restaurants. Ate one dinner at the hotel, at Tuscany, and it was fine for a lazy night. But you are missing out if you dont try some of the restaurants in the Condado neighborhood or Old San Juan. Best we ate at were UMMO, Picayo (which is re-opened) and 311. As good as any top restaurant in Boston, NYC, Miami, etc. Great short, relaxing vacation. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, fun amenities, food... not so much.”
Reviews.Author: ChinkB
Reviews.Content: what an amazing staff - very friendly and extremely at your service. you could take yoga classes, and even though i'm an adult - i loved the pool slide! they made it very easy for you lounge by the beach with complimentary beach chairs and umbrellas. i wouldn't recommend the food or drinks. nothing was very good except the hamburger or pasta - things you can't really mess up.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: makingamove
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice it was just unfortunate that our room with bacony was located just above the roof of the main lobby which had an air conditioning system that was noisy. It made it hard to keep the bacony door open during the late night hours and sitting on bacony to watch the stars was impossible. Other than that it was a nice stay. Just be wise when makeing reservations. Please find out and make sure your room is not located just above the roof of the main lobby and things should be very nice during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home base for exploring San Juan & beyond”
Reviews.Author: AdamShalom
Reviews.Content: This is really a great hotel in what is basically the Puerto Rican equivalent of South Beach. The rooms are a bit small but well-appointed; not one could have a bad view. The restaurants are overpriced and lacking quality; we ate every meal in one of the wonderful local places. Our favorite was Yerba Buena, a Cuban place a few blocks away. The Friday night street party at the nearby Plaza del Mercado is not to be missed if you want a true taste of Perto Rican food and culture. The beach is decent: do not expect a typical pristine Caribbean beach with calm waves; this is more like an East Coast beach in the peak of summer. It is nice that they provide umbrellas and chaise lounges. If you're renting a car, your best bet is Charlie's across the street for a good price and selection. And be sure to ask about the free tourist shuttle to Old San Juan. The pools are great for families and kids, and the organized activities seem great. The concierge is always very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location and value”
Reviews.Author: pegsfun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located close to Old San Juan, and easy to get to other areas of the island, too. When we first got there we were assigned a room with a city view in the tower. It was rather sparse, but adequate. But it was a room connected to another room, and we could hear every word being said by the people next door. So we asked for a different room and were offered a room with pool and ocean view for $25 a night extra. Since it was our 25th anniversary, we took it and were much happier. The view was great and the room was larger and nicer. It is an older hotel, but was clean. The beds were deluxe and comfortable. The hotel personnel were very friendly and accomodating. The location was convenient, but if you are wary of big cities, you won't feel comfortable. When walking down the street, panhandlers abound. Graffitti on buildings nearby, make for less than scenic sights. The beach was OK, the water got deep quickly, and the surf was rough, so we never swam in the ocean. The pool was nice, but as others have said, when they put up the volleyball net, it takes up most of the pool. The pool area was really pretty-probably the nicest part of the hotel for us. Would recommend this hotel for the location if you will have a car (parking about $15 a day) and plan to do sight seeing, but if looking for a resort to spend most of your time relaxing, look at other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyNomadLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Liked this hotel a lot, right on beach, had ocean front room which was fantastic, great breakfast at the hotel, great restaurants close by, great lobby bar, visited the casino a couple of times which was great to have in the hotel. Service was great, good pool and great beach. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “A little expensive but worth the splurge”
Reviews.Author: katebig
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean with a good view. The nearby restaurants were a little expensive but worth it for the convenience. Beach was clean and staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Midothian
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. Great location and services. It's right on the ocean and has 2 nice pools. We had an oceanfront corner room with 2 balconies (1 was 25' long and the other was 15' long). There was live music 2 of the 3 nights we were there and volleyball only took up 1 pool on 1 day for approx. 3 hrs. Christina at the front desk was particularly helpful with directions; bus usage; and restaurant suggestions. Some of the outdoor staff, however, was more interested in socializing with each other or texting than serving customers.

Reviews.Title: “The most overrated hotel on the island and certainly not of 4-Star quality.”
Reviews.Author: VCTravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel was dirty. Not very apparent on the surface, but bugs frequented the place. Crawling bugs under the table in the restaurant, 4-5 inch â€œflyingâ€� cockroaches in the guest room, visibly dirty shower curtain and liner. The tables in the restaurant had not been really wiped clean in ???, as the â€œcenterpiecesâ€� which held condiments were stuck to the table. At first I thought that was intentional, until I actually moved one and noticed all the grit and grime underneath. The food was mediocre at best and though the wait staff was friendly enough, language was a real problem as very few spoke English and getting an order right was a real challenge. The other hotel staff was also English challenged, and I thought this was just how it was on the island until I moved to the Hilton and found all staff able to communicate in English. I understand it is said Americans expect everyone to speak English, and though I appreciate and respect other languages of the world, when I go to a 4 Star Resort Hotel that caters to Americans, I expect to be able to communicate. If I wanted the local experience, I would reserve those accommodations â€“ at a much lower price â€“ and work it out! I also might be more tolerant of a big roach in my room, but the 4 Star Resorts I have stayed at in other parts of the Caribbean didnâ€™t have this problem. I suppose they fumigate or have some way of keeping pests away. However, the management here told me that they couldnâ€™t control bugs as it was part of being on the island. I went down the street to a less expensive 4 Star Resort and found the accommodations very clean, the staff exceptionally friendly, and the bugs somewhere else ( I guess at the Marriott). 4 Star hotels are important to me and I am willing to pay for that special ambience and quality. However, the hotel responded to me as though they were doing me a big favor by overcharging me to be there, not as though my business was valued, or that I was a paying guest with other options right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Parking can add up”
Reviews.Author: vitotiv
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and perfectly situated. If you don't have to do much sightseeing, skip the rental car since parking is $16 - $20 per day. Condado is great. You can save a bunch by walking, taking a cab or bus. However, the freedom of a car to go anywhere was great (we went off the beaten path to the southeast, for example as well as the western and northern parts of the island)!

Reviews.Title: “We Had a great time at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: mommie1214
Reviews.Content: Me, husband and 4years old daughter had a wonderful time at the Marriott Stellaris and Casino. The beach was beautiful. The hotel ground gorgous, and the pool was awesome and stayed open late. The hotel always had music playing in the lobby. Staff was extra nice. We will definitely be returning to the hotel soon. Thank you Marriott for making our family vacation so special.

Reviews.Title: “What you'd expect from a Marriott and a few local travel tips”
Reviews.Author: jlshopper
Reviews.Content: We read many reviews and were reluctant to stay based on them. However, Marriott's tend to be very nice so we decided to give it a chance. We also got a "rent for 2 nights, get 2 free" deal so it was a great value for us. It was very clean, very nicely decorated, great (but on the smaller side) pool split into a shallow side (perfect for sitting in) on the upper level and a deeper side on the lower level (also with a swim up bar), with a nice little water slide to connect them. Housekeeping was excellent and the room we had (garden/pool view with king bed) was beautiful. The section of beach was probably the nicest in Condado. Many people commented on the "RED" Flag (indicating the ocean was too dangerous to go in). The flag was always out but I'm not a particularly strong swimmer and had no problems body surfing very safely. The beach attendants were prompt and helpful with chairs and umbrellas. The hotel has 24 hours on site taxi service and hertz car rental if you want to take a road trip. Casino small but $5 tables every night, all night. As with ALL Marriott's, the on site costs for everything from food/drinks to spa treatments are expensive. We went out for all food/drink. People also commented on some abandoned buildings visible from the hotel. The area was apparently hit hard by a hurricane several years back and that, plus the economy being poor, has made rebuilding slow. There are renovations going on to most of the properties in need of it right now, though its not at all noisy or intrusive to your experience. Just a few tips we would have found helpful. ***The taxi cabs are supposed to follow rates set by some governing body but in every one of the cabs we took, the driver tried to rip us off by over quoting. Each tourist area (i.e. airport, old san juan, condado, etc) is is a "zone" and there's a placard in the cab telling you how much it should cost. every driver tried to over charge by at least $2, and when confronted, casually blew it off. if possible, try to get a copy of the rate slip (i think you can at the taxi area in the airport) so they'll be no surprises. ***in some restaurants, a 15% tip (spanish word-"propina") is included in the check. make sure you look before adding in more. ***try the local restaurants. cafe del angel was good. ajili mojili was a bit pricey but very nice and a short walk from the hotel. also-from the marriott, make a left and walk about 2-3 blocks. there's a bunch of restaurants with outdoor seating that make for a great atmosphere. also- we went to a walgreens about 2 blocks away and stocked up on water and snacks for a fraction of the cost of on site prices. ***El Yunque-we rented a car ($40) for the day and drove there. very easy to find it (mostly highway). if you only have a few hours there, suit up and hike to La MIna Falls. We did it from the Big Tree Trail-about 35 minutes (easy to moderate hike)---enough to work up a litle sweat. When you get to the falls, it looks and sounds scary. The water also feels a bit chilly. I can tell you it is neither. Squat so your center of gravity is low and go for it! It made my whole trip to the rain forest perfect. if you have more time, some of the other hikes are okay. all have clearly marked paths to follow. also-there's some roadside grill/cafes for a snack. bring water, a poncho, bathing suit, towels, bug spray (the web site says to bring spray but we never had to use it-apparently october is low season for bugs too) and a camera. overall very nice trip-5 days to explore old san juan, 1 day at el yunque, and lots of beach/pool time was the perfect amount of time

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but watch for the extras”
Reviews.Author: hekesq
Reviews.Content: Just came back from PR and stayed at this hotel. Very nice, however they charge for parking ($20 a day) and internet. The "Resort Fee" was a mystery since there were no resort activities. No live entertainment as advertised. But hotel was on the beach and this was convenient. Pool was nice but often taken up with volleyball game. Water pressure in the shower was dismal. Maid service was inconsistent. We booked some excursions in advance but that was not necessary because there was a desk for this right in the lobby. Concierge was very helpful with restaurant picks. Hotel is in the Candado area full of good restaurants. Loved Ummo and Bebos. Stay away from Yerba Bueno.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and beach”
Reviews.Author: danikarp
Reviews.Content: I had to take off one star for our first night. We were put into room 424, which had a view of the roof and was very noisy because we could hear the DJ in the lobby at night. But after that one bad night, we moved into a different room and it was great. The hotel is right on the beach, and they will put out your chairs and umbrella for you as soon as you got onto the beach. We never had to wait for either, and didn't have to get up early to get a spot. There are loads of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, as well as a Walgreens. You could hop on the bus to get to Old San Juan, but a $15 cab ride got you there a lot quicker. We stayed for four nights, which was the perfect amount of time to check out the surrounding area, spend a lot of time on the beach and get to see Old San Juan. We didn't rent a car and didn't need to do it. We came with a 10-month-old baby, and they gave us a pack-n-play for her. Super easy.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: starsun654
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! I had never been to Puerto Rico so I wasn't sure what to expect. We booked a "city view" room and arrived late Friday night. When we received the room key, they had actually given us a partial ocean view room (see pictures). The view was absolutely amazing. The rooms were immaculate. Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly - always said hi as we were walking around and asked if we needed anything. When we asked for a corkscrew at the front desk, they brought it up immediately. The beach at the hotel was beautiful. Loved being served drinks on the beach. However, it did rain every day for a little bit while we were there. I'm not sure if its because it was September or if its always like this. I would recommend to do the snorkeling adventure - talk to the activities desk that is in the lobby. They take you out on a caterman and take you to two different reefs to snorkel. It was absolutely beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: jrp0629
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here prior to our Honeymoon cruise and did not want to leave for the cruise. The beach, and hotel are amazing and very clean, and the staff is very helpful. When they found out it was our honeymoon they upgraded us to a ocean view king room for free We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The pefect vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Cinmarmac
Reviews.Content: I stayed on at the Marriott San Juan Resort and Stellaris Casino 4 nights. The hotel was great! Staff was friendly and accommodating. To make the most of a trip San Juan... here is my advice: 1. Bring a small (easy to carry) umbrella. (it rains nearly every day for a bit). 2. Definitely sign up for the Snorkeling adventure on the Spread Eagle (http://www.snorkelpr.com). I had never been snorkeling before but the day on the catamaran was the highlight of my trip. 3. Don't pay for a guided tour of Old San Juan... catch the bus and use the free trolley system to explore on your own. 4. Visit the rainforest... it is amazing. 5. In my opinion, the biobay tour was overrated and VERY over priced. Unless you already enjoy kayaking, I would skip it... I wish I had.

Reviews.Title: “You Saved Me!!!”
Reviews.Author: lady_kjrn1
Reviews.Content: After staying one night in a condo at a nearby area, I decided that was enough for me. I was determined to salvage and enjoy the rest of my five day vacation. The SJ Marriott was more than what I could have ever imagined. The reservations agent was so warm and courteous. The front desk staff is totally awesome and superb!!!! Everyone went above and beyond. Excellent customer service. Beautiful, friendly, wonderful staff!!! My city view room was choice and on par!! I could not have asked for anything more. Immaculate room, beautiful beach.....life was good. Great location. What started as a stressed mess turned into a beautiful blessing. I will most definitely be back. This was my best vacation by far.

Reviews.Title: “MORE THAN EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: lovescarribeanlife
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Marriott Stellaris. We were there to celebrate our 6th anniversary so I wanted someplace on the beach and someplace with nice amenities. The Marriott was all that and more! We're gamblers so we really enjoyed having a casino onsite. However, we did notice that the people who gambled during they day weren't really experienced gamblers so we lost more money. At night, the real gamblers came out so it was so much fun. The drinks in their casino are yummy. I fell in love with mojitos after visiting the Bacardi factory so I was pleased to find that the hotel's mojitos were just as good. They also give you free turkey, chicken or ham sandwiches to keep you going while gambling. Regarding the location, there is a Louis Vuitton, Cartier and Gucci store on the same street as the hotel so it's a great place for real shoppers. They're probably a mile down the road. We loved the beauty and quaintness of Old San Juan. We found a little cart right in front of the courthouse that sold some of the local cuisine and it was pretty good. Definitely worth trying. My favorite part was the Bacardi tour. It's free, it's interesting and the drinks are great!!! My husband had no real interest in going to San Juan, but he was very pleasantly surprised and has said that he can't wait to go back. I'd highly recommend the location and the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable,Fantastic,Incredible Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Liana69
Reviews.Content: Just want to say that my husband and i had our honeymoon here we stood for 8 days and seven nights we had ocean front room it was beautiful we dont even have the words to describe it OMG! we loved the beds so wonderful it was the best sleep we ever got. We would leave our sliding door open and just sleep listening to the wonderful waves. The staff was excellent especially the concierge she sent us a bottle of wine and cheese and fruits to our room for our first night there since we were newlyweds it was so nice we had a romantic night Thank you again! The beach was great the location was excellent we were close to alot of restaurants. We would definetely go back. It was the best experience we ever had its all we talk about. Seriously we had the time of our lives in this hotel. Cant wait to be back there. And once last things the pina coladas were excellent and especially the salsa band at night loved them!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Veronica1981
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were great. Unfortunately we didn't have an ocean view, but the view of the city was still pretty amazing. The rooms include 2 free bottles of water daily. Don't touch the Fiji water in the room. It costs about $5. Everyone at the resort were very friendly. Our package came with free breakfast for 2, which was a great buffet with all different types of breakfast items to choose from. The casino is small compared to Vegas standards, but was OK if you like to gamble. The beach was amazing and complimentary lounge chairs are included. A hotel employee brings it out for you. This hotel was in the Condado area which was close to everything. The bus stop is just a few steps from the hotel and can take you to Old San Juan for only $.75. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for families with older kids”
Reviews.Author: cab1118
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott the last week of July and needed two rooms since our party included me, my husband, 18 year old daughter, and 14 year old twin boys. We couldn't get a suite to accommodate 5 people so we had to go with two rooms. Our deal included the 5th night free and 2 free breakfast buffets at La Vista per room along with a $100 debit card per room. All of this was very useful since the hotel and San Juan itself is pricey. The first issue at check-in was that we didn't have adjoining rooms which I requested months in advance. Our rooms started out on different floors which was unacceptable. Finally, they were able to get us two rooms on the fifth floor down the hall from one another. We had booked one room with a king bed for myself and my husband and a room with two double beds for the kids. However, in order to be on the same floor, we had to take two rooms both with king beds so our second room needed a rollaway. I wasn't thrilled with that arrangement for the kids but it was the best they could do. There was no way the hotel was at full occupancy in late July so I was somewhat surprised that they couldn't accommodate us. However, things improved from there. The beach was the main attraction for us. My husband and I had stayed here about 8 years ago for a long weekend and my husband remembered loving the beach. Well, he was right. The kids LOVED the ocean. It must have been 80 degrees with large waves great for body-surfing. We have been to places like Aruba where there is so surf so the kids loved the waves. They stayed in for hours at a time even though the red flags (dangerous surf) were always flying. If my kids were young, I would have been very worried about the waves and the undertow so families with little ones should think about whether they want to be on a beach this rough. As resort guests, we had no problems getting 5 lounge chairs and an umbrella every day - the beach really was not that crowded. We didn't take advantage of the beach-side massage but did indulge in the gelato from a guy who walks the beach every day with a cart. We tended to leave the beach around 3 pm and head to the pool which is very shaded. There were plenty of lounge chairs available but it was hard to get one in the sun. The pool has a large area for younger kids and an area for adults with a swim up pool bar. The drinks are expensive so we would indulge in one fruity cocktail or smoothies for the kids but we brought our own cooler with soda and beer. The buffet breakfast at La Vista is very good but it would have cost about $120 per day for the 5 of us to eat there. With 4 free buffets at $20 per person, it made sense to go and only have to pay for one. The fresh fruit was great, belgian waffles and omelets were delicious and my boys loved the all-you-can-eat bacon and sausage. We basically loaded up at breakfast and then just brought snacks to the beach skipping lunch. There is a Walgreens two blocks away to the right of the hotel so we bought snacks and sodas there.
