For dinner, we walked up and down Ashford Avenue and were very pleased with the choices. We had Japanese hibachi at Cherry Blossom right next door to the hotel (very good but expensive), ate at Cafe del Angel down the road to the right (authentic Puerto Rican food reasonably priced), we did the $20 Toscany menu one night which is available at the Marriott between 5 - 7 pm (for the price, it was very worth it with good Italian food), we also had Mexican food down the road (take a left out of the hotel) and had pizza at Via Appia (I think that's the name). We really did not have bad meal. There is also a Subway a few blocks down the road (take a right out of the hotel) so we let our boys eat there one night since we knew they might not like Cafe del Angel. If you are used to a city, either New York, Boston, even Oahu in Hawaii, you will feel fine walking up and down Ashford Avenue. There are some homeless people, a few boarded up shops but no one ever bothered us and tons of people are out walking at night. The Marriott is in a great, convenient location so we did not need a car at all. One day, we took a cab to Old San Juan (for a Segway tour which was fantastic!!!) and we booked a tour Rainforest/Bio Bay tour through www.kayakingpuertorico.com which I would highly recommend. Other than those two excursions, we hung around at the beach, pool, and around the Marriott. On a couple of nights, all 5 of us crowded into one room to watch a pay per view movie which was fun. All in all, it was a very nice trip for the 5 of us to spend together since we are usually running in different directions. The staff at the Marriott is very nice, efficient, and provided the kind of service you would expect. The rooms were clean but basic. Our only room issue was the small refrigerator in our kids room smelled (like bad cheese!) and I called to have it replaced or cleaned and it was never done. Everyone loved the fitness center and my husband went every day. The main draw for the Marriott is the great location on a great beach with a standard of service you can rely on. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel With Great Rooms and Staff”
Reviews.Author: trooks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, my Mom, my brother's family (wife + 2 young daughters) just returned from a week's vacation at the Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino and would definitely recommend the hotel and San Juan in general!! Room. All of ocean-front rooms were nicely appointed, clean and modern. The bedding was very comfortable and had obviously been recently upgraded. The balconies are private, and had two chairs and a small table. Each room had mini-refrigerator, coffee maker, and central air-conditioning. The bathroom was clean, spacious, modern and featured good quality toiletries. Service/Staff. The staff was all very friendly and professional. Lobby. Upon entering the hotel, the bar & dance floor is immediately ahead while the reception area is to the left, and the guest lounge area is behind it. The problem with this arrangement is that the band or recorded music is so loud that you have to shout at the reception staff to be heard. In addition, we found the lounge areas to be unusable as a meeting place because we could not hear each other. I think Marriott's original intention was to have a festive atmosphere as soon as you enter the building - but they miscalculated on this one Pool & Beach. The pool area is great! There are tons of lounge chairs and a shallow pool for smaller children. The private beach is nice, but although it is raked every morning there is still a ton of discarded cigarette butts in the sand. The water is clean, but the constant wave/tidal action prevents the water from being crystal-clear like a lot of Caribbean beaches. There were no vendors hawking jewelry, or hair-braiding etc. Casino. The casino has many slot machines (pennies thru dollars) and we found them to pay about as well as any in Vegas. Cocktail service is not what youâ€™d expect in Vegas though, but they will bring you a sandwich or pastries if you have ask for them. Food. After reading the Trip Advisor reviews, we skipped eating at the hotel except for RISTORANTE TUSCANY. Where we dined twice and took advantage of their $20 three-course dinner menu. The atmosphere was very nice - but still allowed us to dress casually - the food was good, but nothing special. Nearby dining options: LATIN STAR, open 24 hours, it serves very reasonable breakfast ($4-$6) it also has very good Mofongo ($12) appetizer plates ($10) and Carne Guisada ($9). For great pizza, try DANNY's (Large: $15-19). Across the street is TIJUANAs, which serves very good Mexican food (Prices: $12-18)! Old San Juan: we ate at the CAFE PUERTO RICO several times and really enjoyed it, although we found the Mofongo to be a bit too bland and dry. Groceries. Stock the in-room mini fridges with cokes, milk, juices etc, from the nearby Walgreens (they also have some groceries). Beer, wine and liquor can be found a few blocks in the other direction, but be prepared to pay for it: a 12 pack of 10oz Budweiser costs $16, and Medalla light (a truly awful, but ubiquitous local beer) costs $14. The best place to buy liquor is actually at the airport, as you're allowed to shop there upon arrival. Transportation - Taxi. Fares from the airport are pre-set by attendants that issue tickets stating the fare. It cost $23 for the 15 minute ride from the airport to the hotel. However, if you use a taxi from the hotel, youâ€™ll want to ask the driver in advance how much the fare will be (trust me). Transportation - Bus. Bus fare is only 75 cents. It takes about 25 minutes to reach Old San Juan. However, the wait can be quite long (we waited 45 minutes one day, and 90 minutes the next day). The busses are relatively clean and well maintained though.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Donnmein
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, I didn't know whether to choose Stellaris or the nearby La Concha, both of which were available with my Marriott points. (I'm sure I would've been happy with either, although La Concha appears less kid friendly and the main pool is not by the beach.) I regularly stay at Marriotts and really am never disappointed. Our family had a great time here for three nights after a cruise. No one had any complaints. We were in rooms in the cabana building overlooking the pool and it was beautiful. The rooms were plenty big and well-appointed. The guest staff were always helpful and friendly. There are two pools, both shallow but great for a dip to cool off or when you're tired of the ocean, with beautiful fountains. Beach is vast and clean. I really don't understand the poor reviews that many have posted on this property. My main concern with Marriott was evident here, though: very high food prices. A couple smoothies for the kids and drinks for the adults and you have a big tab. We did not eat in the hotel restaurants (except for breakfast in the concierge lounge), but there are several very good restaurants nearby. The hotel is in a nice resort area. Yes, there are some deteriorating properties along the beach, but this is the Caribbean, not La Jolla....

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: seamonkeee
Reviews.Content: When we were originally looking at hotels, it seemed that some of the other nice hotels were clustered by the airport, so we chose this one because it was farther away. Still, there was the occasional propeller plane that went by the beach, but nothing really distracting. It's located in an area called Condado which is west of the airport and a few miles away from Old San Juan. The area is nice and upscale with hotels and expensive condo developments. On Ashford Ave. (the street in front of the hotel) there are a few boutique shops, banks, a Walgreens (which was nice to have), a Starbucks, a Hertz car rental, and a few restaurants within walking distance. The restaurants have a wide range of cuisine and the food was good (not great, not bad). (I'd suggest eating early, because many of the restaurants fill up fast, which would leave you waiting out in front) The one thing I'd have to mention is that I didn't feel like I got any traditional cuisine, since the restaurants were Italian, Argentinean, Mexican, etc. The hotel was clean, the service excellent and friendly. Everyone speaks English. I'd suggest a balcony facing the ocean. You get two free bottles of water each day, and an empty refrigerator, which came in handy. On the beach you can get towels, umbrellas and chairs (put up for you), and drinks. The beach is nice. There is a big bar in the main lobby with music and entertainment each night and a casino. Nothing too exciting, but maybe easier than taking a taxi somewhere. The breakfast buffet at Vista was good, but we didn't eat at Tuscany (the Italian restaurant) All-in-all, our stay was enjoyable and the hotel was great. We traveled in late July / early Aug. It wasn't as hot as we thought. 85 degrees and 75 percent humidity. At the beach there was always a nice cool wind which can be deceiving, so watch out for the sunburn! Get under that umbrella. The humidity isn't so apparent until you walk outside with your camera and the lens fogs up. We went to El Yunque (rainforest) which was nice. I'd suggest going early and on a weekday. Apparently it really fills up fast and you can get stuck in traffic on a thin mountain road with tour buses going in each direction. Renting a car and driving is easy. You might want to bring something in case it rains, protection for your camera, water, hiking shoes, and swimming gear if you go down to the waterfall to swim. You're mostly shaded among humid, dripping trees in the rainforest. Old San Juan is beautiful. Don't drive there! The streets are very narrow and crowded. A cab costs $14 and bus 75 cents. It's very hilly, so bring practical shoes (sandals were perfect). The fort is very nice and gives you some nice views of the city. Bring water for the heat and the climbing. It will go fast. If you don't, there's plenty of food and drink available. This district has lots of shopping (traditional (hats and cigars), modern (handmade purses), tourist (shot glasses), and retail (Coach, Burberry). We stopped a few times to avoid the heat. As I said in the hotel review, there are a few things on Ashford Ave. within walking distance, but most stuff will require a car, bus or taxi. I would plan on this as a beach vacation with a few side trips thrown in for excitement.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the negative reviews fool you.”
Reviews.Author: MrGelhs204
Reviews.Content: The Marriott San Juan is one of my favorite places in all of San Juan. The live music/DJ/ bar in the lobby is second to none; classy, yet entertaining. The place to be for good, cover free entertainment. Free beach chairs and umbrellas a huge plus. The pool area was adequate; definitely geared for families. Parking was easy. Average sized rooms iwth comfortable beds. One final word: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION.

Reviews.Title: “NICE BUT!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaywes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice, it was clean and the service was awesome. We had a city view room that offered a partial ocean view. In addition we were on the 15th floor so we could leave the slider open and listen to the ocean at night. The rooms are tiny especially the bathroom and everything at the hotel is more expensive for example a beer at the hotel is $7.23, the same beer outside the hotel is $4-4.50; a mojito at the hotel is $10, the same drink outside the hotel is $6-$7. The Marriott should not nickel and dime people like this, they are the big company who buys in bulk and they should be offering reasonably priced items. There were no water sports offered at the beach which was a little disappointing. The area surrounding the hotel was rundown to include several closed hotels; some appeared recently closed others closed for some time and strewn with graffiti. There are numerous homeless subjects around and they will aggressively beg and pander for money. In the stretch by the Marriott you will not find more than 2-3 open properties in a row without encountering a closed/rundown property. There was also poor balance with the live bands in the lobby meaning the band was soooo loud you could not have a drink or conversation at the bar or anywhere else on the main level. You could not talk to the front desk or Concierge because it was soooo loud. Also do not pay for the Bacardi tour $56 a person with a little shopping thrown in; you can do it on your own for approximately $7.50 a person. Take the bus downtown, .75ct walk 2 blks to the ferry terminal and take the .50ct ferry across the harbor then a $3 cab ride to the Bacardi factory for the free tour to include 2 free drinks per person. Miro-- has great garlic shrimp, cherry blossoms has great bankok and curry shrimp. Orazcos has awesome mufongo and seafood paella. ..........overall our trip was very good, 10th anniversary so we would not let anything bother us but Aruba is much better in every aspect, this would not be in my top 5 of places to return to. Not much in San Juan seemed to be designed for tourists most signs in Spanish only, I have been in other countries where I have seen more english than in this U.S. Territory. If you would like a more trendy chic hotel La Concha also a Marriott property a few blocks down is presently renovating but the rooms there are bigger and the place is more contemporary than the Stellaris; they have the right balance musically and a great layout in the lobby area with the lighting and bar. I am interested in knowing what the carribean side of the island is like. Jay and Nic July 19-23, 2009

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ktm1799
Reviews.Content: The stay was decent. The rooms were clean. The staff was exceptional. Restaurants were not very good - Tuscans was just plain bad. Italian food is easy but the Olive Garden would have provided a better meal than Tuscans. Hardly ever eat in hotel restuarants but after a long day of travel and late check-in it was a must. If you like to gamble don't stay at this hotel. Casino staff was bad and the level of play was very weak. Drinks and bars were great, staff was quick and friendly. Close enough to OSJ and the concierge provided plenty of information and great drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let a good thing fool you ...”
Reviews.Author: 14goldie
Reviews.Content: After traveling to San Juan this year ... I will never stay at the Marriot San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino again. When booking the reservation (thru EXPEDIA) the top hotel that pops up is the Marriott. As I titled my review - Don't let a good thing fool you! The hotel is very average ... nothing like they advertise. The rooms are very small and you can hear everything thru the walls --- and I do mean EVERYTHING! Upon check-in, I asked about an upgrade ... only to hear that the hotel was completely booked. Too bad. The hotel pool was very small and uncomfortable. There is a water slide, however when you slide down to the pool you end up in the vollyball game! Not to mention you have no room for actual "swimming". Sorry Marriott ... wish you could have treated us better for a return trip! :-(

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: peshm
Reviews.Content: We just returned from San Juan and I am so glad we chose this hotel. It was perfect in every way! The pool area was a dream for kids and parents, a large pool area for kids with beautiful fountains. Parents could easily watch kids while lying in the sun. The slide was also great. I couldn't imagine another hotel being as good for families! We have a teenager who also loved this hotel! The beach is beautiful with attendants who met you to put your lounge chair and umbrella where ever you wanted (free to guests). A local guy comes by with ice cream on the beach. The weather in Puerto Rico is perfect, nice breeze beautiful sun! Location is great with plenty of small shops and high end shops near by. On weekends, very exciting with activities into the early morning hours. City view is beautiful from balcony and so much fun to watch everyone! Some buildings are older and closed,probably due to economy but minor detail Also, everyone really dresses up for weekend, so much fun to see! Hotel lobby is beautiful and elegant with live bands and a DJ, casino is elegant. Front desk were very accomodating and so nice! We booked with the PR tourism promotion and they took care of every detail down to gift cards to room credit of $200 at check out! Also, suggested we use the ATM at the corner Walgreens for the gift charge thus avoiding charge for use. Front desk sent us to spa to change when we checked in early at 12 to change, shower while waiting for our room. They have shampoo, conditioner, anything you need! We changed and stayed by the pool until our room was ready at 4. Could not have been any nicer! Location is great and just a 5 minute bus or car ride to old San Juan. We took a taxi once and used the bus on the corner after this. Bus runs every 30 minutes, B21 takes you directly to old San Juan, but C53 also goes to the old city and the drivers are very nice and gave us directions to the historical sites when we asked. We caught the bus back from the terminal which is located right beside of the police station, it departs every 30 minutes until 9 oclock. Nice high end shops within walking distance from hotel with some touristy type shops also. Rooms were gorgeous, housekeeping were immaculate, elegant rooms with wonderful showers! AC goes off when patio doors are open, but room cools down quickly! The room had no odor and was very fresh and elegantly decorated! The staff at this hotel were the best. From the bell boys, to the beach/pool attendants, waitress/waiters were great! Everyone went out of their way to be nice and accomodating. Pool side service very laid back, a little slow but this is the Carribean, part of the atmosphere! We purchased the breakfast buffet with our room and I would highly recommend doing this. Breakfast was awesome! Pancakes, waffles and omlettes made to order with a variety of blueberries/ cherries and hot syrup! Fruits were delicious. This would have been very expensive but purchasing with room made it very affordable! Restaurants are very expensive but the same as any high end resort! Again, can not wait to back. Wonderful experience. Will definitely stay here again!! Awesome hotel and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: MDHappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this trip and the hotel. We always stay at the Marriott Hotels when traveling to the islands and this one was great. We particularly liked the wonderful Pre-arrival Vacation Planner, Vivian Cotto. She gave us wonderful advise, was responsive to our emails, and made our trip a delight! The hotel is located within walking distance of a number of great restaurants Miro,Cafe del Angel, Yerba Buena, Via Appia, and Ummo. Some serve breakfast (Danny's) as well! There is a computer with restaurants, and their menus can be printed out at the concierge desk. Ask to use this! There are all sorts of places to buy snacks and soda and wine for the room withing walking distance too. The hotel is on the bus line to Old San Juan and El Morro. Take the tour of El Yunque from the Hotel as well. Lobby is noisy, so ask for a room several floors about it, and get an ocean view if possible--beautiful. Excellent fitness center and nice, small casino on site. We'll be back! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ChantelleSTX
Reviews.Content: We live in the caribbean on st croix and go to san juan at least several times a year for training or pleasure. We enjoy going there for the night life and the shopping. We love Marriott's La Concha, just a few buildings down for their very large rooms by San Juan standards, but I really fell for Stellaris this time and it'll be nice to have options. I loved how nice the staff was. Early the same week we were staying at the Hiltons Caribe, just outside of Old San Juan and every member of that staff acted like I was putting them out when they greeted me so we decided to move to a different hotel our last few nights. I am so glad we moved, it was totally worth the hassle and giving up a little vacation time. Our checkin was incredibly fast and very friendly. We stuck with the city view and am very glad we did. Our balcony was about 20 ft long and had incredible views of San Juan. The room had color! So many of the hotels in san juan are done in shades of beige that depress me. Wonderful pops of yellow throughout the room with a large white pristine bed. Now I'm a bathroom girl, meaning the bathroom makes the room for me. And even though this was a base room it did not let me down. It was of average size (which is roomy for san juan), with a large vanity and a wonderful little tub that turned out to be a really good deep soaking tub. In the caribbean you mostly have showers to save precious water so I love a good tub while on vacation. Lastly I love the Condado area. It feels like a beach town to me even though its in a big city. Isla Verde always feels too crowded to me and Old San Juan (unfortunately) has no nice hotels. So its a nice area you can easily walk around and be fine and maybe even see a free concrete or two. The only negative about the hotel I have is the lobby is very plain. The decor remind me more of a fairfield inn then a full marriott. Especially when most of the hotels in San Juan have beautifully lobbies. It had a great tall ceiling but everything else looked like a cold corporate hotel at first. But everything after my initial impression was great. Also we bid on priceline for this so we had a great rate in my opinion. I don't think I would be willing to pay over $200 to stay here, but our rate was much lower. So I will definitely recommend this hotel and go again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the nearby Condado District”
Reviews.Author: judiebMunster_IN
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel in the changing Condado District - on one side of the hotel there was a new condo building and yet on the other side a deserted complex in which one building hadn't even been completed and was covered in graffiti - it looks like the Condado District had launched a comeback, possibly trying to bring it back to its former glory days, but may have come to a standstill, given the state of the economy. Though within a few blocks walk there was a brand new hotel opening so maybe improvements will continue. Once inside the hotel, the property was beautiful - we had a generously sized king room with a double balcony overlooking the ocean - the pool area was wonderful, with plenty of lounge chairs to accomodate all guests and the beach area was especially beautiful - lounge chairs and umbrellas were provided by the hotel at no charge. The only negative about the hotel was the length of time it took to have lunch served to us on our first day of arrival - over 1 hour to get a salad and a sandwich. On the plus side, the casino was hopping and on the weekends, there's both live music and a DJ playing at the lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, but a little costly.”
Reviews.Author: livforever52
Reviews.Content: We had a beach side view and loved it. We spent a lot of time on our balcony relaxing. (Although, some may say its a small balcony, and the chairs aren't super comfortable) The beach was great (keep in mind the gate closes at 6, so if you want to get to the beach after that you have to sneak around). The pool was nice too because all the plants and nooks made it somewhat private even when there were a lot of people. Everything is super expensive. Drinks on the beach/pool are $8 each. All meals cost about $20 per person.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wzd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well kept and the room is spacious. The restaurants are great. The pools and beach are wonderful. I enjoyed the casino and they have nice lobby. They have live music on Wednesdays and a DJ on Thursdays. It worth staying in here.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: cannon235
Reviews.Content: Marriott Stellaris is not a resort, it is a basic hotel, in the middle of a dirty, crowded, and deteriorating city of San Juan. Adjacent to the hotel property are vacant and decrepit buildings. The beach, skyline on the Jersey shore is more beautiful. The pictures on Marriott.com are incredibly misleading. Hotel staff and service is acceptable. However, resort like amenities are non-existent or require an additional charge (ex/. Tennis). Each of our seven nights, there was high school prom held in the lobby and ballroom of the hotel. Beach access closes at 6:30 PM due to beach crime. If you want to relive Spring Break, come to San Juan. If you want relax and have a peaceful vacation as a RESORT, go elsewhere or just go to your local Fairfield Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Foreverchanged
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 2 pm and immediately we were given a room on the 18th floor - ocean view, based on the reviews I read I was skeptical about size, but again was pleasantly surprised, nothing spectacular but clean and a decent size room, nice balcony and more importantly clean. Staff was really nice and everyone was accommodating even for a late check out. The pool was nice and the getting a chair on the beach was not a problem no matter when we went early or late. On the weekend Fri and Sat pool was crowded with what seemed like locals and it was hard to find a chair or a place in the pool. The lobby is not one of tropical feel, it is cold and loud so we avoided it. Once Monday came the place became deserted which was kind of great! The food was overly priced at hotel as it is at any, so just leave the hotel and walk to the left for restaurants,Fuddruckers, Danny's and Uno's. Starbucks is right across the street was great for fruit and and oatmeal breakfast. There is a Walgreens to the right of hotel (pricey) as well but convenient. The bus ride into Old San Juan was 75 cents each way great treat (drivers drive like maniacs) Lots of shopping and souvenir shops. Searching for authentic Puertorican food was a chore, found a place El Jiberto, was pretty good and good prices as well. If you plan to rent a car do it before you arrive, paid double one day $70. Natives drive like they are insane, almost hit at least 20 times, they use no signals and either they drive twice the speed limit or creep along. If you go to El Yunque you should make sure and plan to leave out early and you will get rained on. All in All a nice 4 day get-a-way.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great service!”
Reviews.Author: suzieq63
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the Marriott Stellaris I was worried we'd have to wait till the real check-in time, sometime in afternoon. It was around 1:3o pm when we arrived and we had no wait at all. The room was beautiful, decorated in yellow, modern baths, granite counter tops, tiled bath & showers, and clean, clean, clean! Room service was spectacular every day. 2 free bottles of bottled water were included in our service. Was glad there was a mini fridge in room as when I called they said only in the suites. This was untrue. Pool was clean, hot tub relaxing, if you like pool volly ball they had that going on every day. Beach chairs also included in resort fees and attendants right there when you needed them. If you like to body surf this was a great beach for it. Consierge always helpful. The lobby bar is always hopping with loud music. I was on an upper floor, above 10, and never heard a thing. Salsa lessons on Friday nights! You can take the city bus just down the street to Old San Juan for .75 but don't be in a hurry. The buses run on Puerto Rico time, that is, whenever they want. There is no schedule. Once we waited at least 30 minutes. Your other option is to take the taxi, about a $10 fee for a 5 minute or less ride. Lots of great restaurants within 1 block area. Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts in immediate area. Go for Charlie Car Rental across the steet from hotel for best rates! Got laid over 1 extra night and put up at the airport hotel. Went to Isla Verde beach next day. BEAUTIFUL! The waves much smaller on this beach and great bead kiosks on beach. The best just outside entrance to The Intercontinental Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Resort is very nice and staff fantastic - Area not too sure”
Reviews.Author: stubbytoes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott on business during the week of May 18th. The day I arrived, I took a walk on the beach but was quite concerned when I saw several abandoned buildings plastered with graffitti. I was traveling by myself so after seeing that, I did not wander down the beach any further and when not at work, pretty much just stayed at the resort. The restaurants at the resort have wonderful food. The wait staff is very attentive. The gym at the resort is state of the art. Nothing lacking there. I just recommend wiping down the equipment before and after your workout since nobody seems to do that and the gym is pretty busy. Each morning I went to the Starbucks right across the street. There is also a Walgreens less than one block away. The resort does have a coffee cafe but was never open when I was leaving for work and was always closed by the time I got back. The room was nice. I had a little friend on my last night there, ran across the counter (roach??) but knowing they are in a tropical environment I guess that is to be expected once in a while. I never saw him again. I did have room service a few times and they were always on time. It seems like a popular hotel, they had prom or something similar there one night but it did not interfere with anything I was doing. If I am down there on business again, I will definitely stay there. However, if I would go to vacation, I think I would stay at a different area on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Fantastic San Juan Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Quincers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mariott for 4 nights with my family - a large and wild group of adults. The hotel was very large with lots going on - a few different restaurants, a large lobby bar with different live music every night, the Stellaris Casino and pool and beach with games. Even during the quiet hours of the afternoon we could always find amusement simply sitting in the lobby or by the pool drinking Pina Coladas and people watching. We really didn't need to find amusement though. The hotel was in walking distance of shopping, restaurants and bars. The pool had activities in the afternoon, a swim up bar and lounger service. I didn't make it to the beach much, but it was very large and would make for a fantastic stroll. The activities desk made all our reccommendations and arrangements for different off site entertainment, which certainly did not disappoint. For our own adventures, taxis were always at the front to take us to Old San Juan or anywhere else. Old San Juan was a quick cab ride away, and never cost our large group more than $20. Very reasonable. The rooms were very comfortable and very clean, I could have slept in that bed forever. My only complaint was the inconsistency of the service. The front desk, concierge and housekeeping staff were all extremely helpful and accommodating. Bar, casino, pool and restaurant - mostly wait staff, not so much They certainly put the "wait" in wait staff. We spent quite a lot of time and money on the first night in the casino and found it nearly impossible to get service. However, after a bit of speaking with the pit boss a couple nights later, they were kind enough to give us our own table AND service. Although it didn't bother me, there was lot of noise and commotion in the lobby and probably not too much to do for small children. All the activities would be brilliant for teenagers and up. Also probably not the best locale for romace and relaxation, unless you are an active and outgoing couple. Not sure on the total value of the room as my dad picked up the tab (thanks!) but I do know that the food and drinks were a bit over the top. I think they do have meal plans available, but in all honesty, there is reasonably priced, excellent food within walking distance of the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a large group whos in it for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Accommodating, I had a wonderful time.”
Reviews.Author: KatEyez90
Reviews.Content: This was the most beautiful and entertaining hotel I have ever stayed in. I went for 4 days and 3 nights with 3 friends and we loved this hotel. The lobby always has something going on at night, there is always music and dancing. The people who work there are accommodating and will do anything to please you and make your stay as enjoyable as possible. The hotel is right on the beach and the beach is just breath taking. The pool is great and even has a water slide. The bartenders prepare great drinks (try the Carribean Martini) and the casino has a lot more machines than i thought it would have. This hotel was a 5 star for me.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Liggowon
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with this Mariott resort! It was in a decent location with a beautiful beach. The room, although smaller than i imagined from the pictures, was clean and the bathroom tidy. Our room was oceanfront so the door to the patio was open with the sound of the ocean and breeze coming in day and night. Service- was hit and miss with sometimes getting someone that was very attentive and other times getting someone that was totally disinterested. Food and beverage- If you like to drink til you drop make sure you have plenty of dough to do it at the hotel, drinks are expensive. $6 for a can of local beer Medalla, mixed drinks 8 and up. There are several small places along Ashford Ave that offer cheaper food and beverages. Tiajuana's was a favorite of mine good food and good service with a reasonable price. Also, Danny's Pizzaria has good breakfast, lunch and dinner. I will definitely visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Marriott over MLK weekend in 1/09”
Reviews.Author: elon94
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marriott for 3nights/4days over MLK weekend in Jan 09. My wife and I enjoyed the hotel; we felt it was better suited for families than for a couples get away; however, we still had a great time. The weather was great, water was warm and people (both at hotel in surrounding neighborhoods) were very friendly and helpful. My wife is fluent in Spanish so that added a different dynamic to the trip. The rooms were very nice, not very big but nice. We had a partial ocean view and spent a lot of time on our balcony. We mainly ate at restaurants around the Marriott and were very pleased. The staff at the Marriott was very helpful in recommending restaurants to visit. We will definitely plan another trip to PR and will stay at either the Marriott Stellaris or La Concha (Marriott property nearby).

Reviews.Title: “BAR NONE- Best Location and best overall hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: cuponoodle
Reviews.Content: Our vacation was PERFECT. I brought my boyfriend here for his birthday; both of us have never been to Puerto Rico and didn't know anything about the island. We were both pleasantly surprised with how great of a time we had. We arrived at the Marriot and we knew that this was the hotel for us. We entered the Marriot to be welcomed with a bar in the middle of the lobby. The bar was great, with lots of seating and TV screens for us to catch up on the NBA finals. We stayed at the Marriot Stellaris from 5/26/09 unti 6/01/09. We upgraded to the oceanview front which was well worth it. TRUST ME. We woke up to see the beautiful ocean and beach every morning, and sometimes went to sleep sitting on the balcony on the chairs that they provide. Make sure you explore the city and eat the delicious Puerto Rican food. I must say, it was some of the best food that my boyfriend and I have ever had. We highly recommend Latin Star (which is open 24hrs) make sure you order the crab fried rice, Ummo's (Argentinian Steakhouse), Marmelade (fancier dining), Raices (great food!), and Mojito's (authentic Mexican food..make sure you try their Mojito's!). We joined two tours while we were there: El Yunque Rainforest hike, and the Bio Bay tour. We signed up for both tours with the hotel. Very convenient! We had a great time doing the rainforest hike, since we were allowed to swim at the bottom of a waterfall. The water was cold, but what an experience! The Bio Bay kayaking tour is a MUST GO! I must say that it can be difficult for first timer's, and people that are not in great shape. But if you want to see something that you will not see anywhere else, go on the Bio Bay tour. You won't regret it! Overall, we had a wonderful time in San Juan! It is a very romantic island, with beautiful beaches, friendly locals, delicious food, fun activities, and lively nightlife. We would go to San Juan again in a heartbeat....and if we do, we're staying at the Marriot Stellaris. =)

Reviews.Title: “Our Wonderful Puerto Rican X-Perience”
Reviews.Author: Xquizit
Reviews.Content: The San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino is a very nice Marriott resort. My good girlfriend and I spend 5 days at this resort and would recommend it to anyone. We went to Puerto Rico to celebrate her birthday. We stayed in the "new" wing, I highly recommend it. Our room was on the 5th floor and overlooked the pool and ocean. We keep our balcony door open and went to sleep with the ocean slapping again the sand and the breeze of the evenings. We also, had breakfast on our veranda every morning. I read the reviews prior to leaving and was a little concerned, but there is nothing to be concerned about. The hotel is well kept up and the location is perfect. Things I would give you a heads up on: 1) Cabs can get quite costly, so I recommend the local bus (it's safe) 2) Restaurants (Tujuanas, Cherry Blossom Japanese our favorite was the Puerto Rican Cafe) 3) Our room had a slight moldy smell, just bring febreeze and it goes away 9the room is clean and newly renovated) 4) Go to a local event we went to the Puerto Rican Heineken Jazz Festival Come enjoy and have a great time. Puerto Ricans like to have fin and are very hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mhb09elizabethCity
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. My husband and I just returned home yesterday. We spent 4 days at this resort and would return tomorrow. After reading many, many reviews about different hotels, i decided this would be the best and I was not wrong. Our room was an ocean front room (room 312). The room was beautiful, but the view was awesome. We were never disturbed either by staff or loud guest. While it is true the drinks are pricey, they are in line with every other hotel we have stayed in. We did not eat at any of the resturants at the hotel because we wanted to experience the local resturants. However, we did review the menus and did not find the prices here any higher then the resturants we visited. The salsa band was very entertaining in the lobby as were the guests dancing. The casino was small compared to Vegas casinos, but still had alot of games. One thing I will say is that the people there LOVE to dress up when they go out. I don't mean put on dress pants and nice shirts. I mean DRESS UP!! We're talking formal and club wear. We were definately under dressed, but it really didn't matter. We ate at Miro's across the street and it was wonderful. Also across the street is a Taco/sandwich shop. This was very good as well. Our favorite resturant was the Parrott Club in Old San Juan. Wonderful food and service. Another resturant were we ate in Old San Juan was Cafe Berlin. The food was wonderful, but the service was awful!! We always felt completely safe walking downt he street day or night. Including walking all the way to Old San Juan. (don't recommend this) The ride from the airport took about 10 minutes and costs about $18. I could go on and on about our experiance. It was wonderful and the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: robbiempstl
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The staff was VERY helpful. It was also right in the middle of a great neighborhood and a short bus or taxi ride to Old San Juan. Some people have complained about the beach, but I thought it was great. I would reccommend going to El Yunque rainforest and doing some snorkeling and doing a BioBay tour in Fajardo about 45-60 minutes from San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “lotta hotel for a lotta money”
Reviews.Author: philgaunt
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, beach and pool. $20 taxi from airport and $15 to the cruise ship. Lots of places to eat in the neighborhood. Staff very freindly. Only complaint was the check in process. Silver Elite member, but we had to wait a while for our room. We had taken a red eye and had to settle in by the pool. Great pool with a slide. Lobby turns in to party central at night. Make sure you are on as high a level as possible to avoid the noise. Hate the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel...Had a great time in PR”
Reviews.Author: GAStorageDude
Reviews.Content: Had to get away from the office grind and decided to use Marriott points in PR. We stayed from Tue May 19th - Tue May 26th. Like the other posts, the Marriott is not a tropical type hotel with an open air lobby. It looks like a traditional Marriott property. First room was on the 4th floor in a corner room and did not really have a view. I would ask for a high floor room. A/C could not really keep up as half of the room was windows. Morning sun hit the room and I think that added to the cooling issue. The air vent doesn't blow towards the bed, so I think they should add another vent in the room. The lowest temp is 65 and the room never really felt like it was reaching that temp. It had a "just cleaned the carpet" smell that we noticed right away. Called maintenance on the TV as the remote was not working. Supervisor came up with another one and it didn't work. Maintenance team (2 guys) came up and worked on it. Ultimately replaced the TV from another room. Spent 1st night in the room and then decided to ask for another room. The front desk staff was very helpful. They had another room on the 18th floor (smaller room than the corner room and they told us) that faced the ocean and let me and my wife look at it first. We decided to take the room and had the hotel bell staff help us with moving to the new room. We tried to tip the bellman, but he didn't want the tip as he felt the hotel had the responsibility to make sure we were happy. Very impressed with his help. The larger room looked good on paper, but it didn't work for us. Give it a try and see how you like it. As with the other reports, the drink prices are high ($8.50). We found a little grocery store down the street on Ashford Ave(out the hotel and turn left - a few blocks) that had gin/tonic/limes. Also agree the breakfast buffet was over priced ($20 pp) for the selections you had. We went to Danny's International 2 blocks away (out the hotel and turn left - a couple of blocks on the left). Interesting item was the potato used for breakfast was french fries. Starbucks across the street had bagels and breads for breakfast. The hotel also has a coffee shop in the lobby if you don't want to walk across the street. Plenty of choices for food on Ashford Ave. We hit the Chinese food place just to the right of the hotel on Ashford. We also found a Pizza Uno and Fudruckers burger place on Ashford (go out the hotel and turn left - 4 blocks). Tijuanas was good. Don't be in a hurry for any place you go. Service is a little slower all over. Felt safe with many police officers up and down the street. The PR government officials understand the value of tourism dollars and don't want anything to happen. Decided to rent a car from Hertz for 3 days. Self parking at the hotel is $16 per day. I would make a reservation on-line and then pick up the car from the Hertz location 3 blocks down on Ashford. The Hertz location in the hotel lobby will charge you an extra 10% because they are in the lobby. We did return the car to the Hertz location in the lobby because they won't charge you the 10% for returning the car. We drove to the caves/radio telescope. It takes about 1.5 hours to get there and you will hit some toll roads on the way. We also drove to the rain forest and across the island to Ponce(tolls too). Ask the hotel for directions if you decide to drive. Be aware drivers in PR make up their own rules for driving. They stop anywhere they want and have never heard of a signal. They also drive slow in the fast lane. Cabs can take you everywhere. Everything is flat rate or the rate the driver wants to charge you. Hard to tell if you are getting over charged. Ask the driver what the rate is before you get in. Took a cab to old San Juan. Rode the free trolley that goes by the forts. Went down to Pier #2 and took the ferry to the Bacardi factory (.50 cents each way). When you get off the boat, turn right and you will see some cabs and other vans that will take you for $3 each way. You can't really walk to the factory. The tour gives you 2 free drinks and then takes you to the visitors center. They don't take you actually inside the plant to see the process. Old San Juan and the Bacardi tour took about the whole day so plan your time. The casino's were good to us. Wife hit 3 jackpots (2 at the Marriott and 1 at the La Concha, A Renaissance Resort down the street - Out the hotel and turn right - 4 blocks). The Marriott has a live band in the evening, so the casino was more crowded than I liked. Had several graduation/proms going on from Thur - Sat, which added more people in the lobby. I had more fun at the La Concha casino because it wasn't as crowded and I could play the tables or slots without much waiting. Both serve free drinks and they were good drinks. I used this site to read other reviews before we arrived, so I wanted to contribute to the folks deciding to stay at this hotel. I would recommend the Marriott Stellaris and you will have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on Condado Beach”
Reviews.Author: DelcoMom
Reviews.Content: My family vacationed in San Juan in April and the Marriott was a nice property. We had never been to Puerto Rico, so we decided to go with a hotel brand we were familiar with and used Marriott points for our room. The hotel is located in the city of San Juan, so it was different for us from other resorts that tend to be in more secluded areas. Overall, the area is quite safe for a city and there were quite a few nice restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. I would highly recommend Ajili Mojili, an upscale place serving local PR fare. We found the concierge very helpful and pleasant in making dining recommendations. The rooms were nice, nothing too overwhelming. We were booked into a city view room, but we actually had an angle view of the beach, with the city the other way. The city was very pretty at night. The pool at the hotel was quite small for the number of rooms, and busy due to the holiday (Easter week). The beach was not crowded as the red flag was flying every day we were there. If you want to do beach, I would not recommend a hotel on Condado. This side of the island is the rough surf side. As with all Marriott's, they have a "no save" chair policy at the pool, and as with all Marriott's, they do not enforce it. So by 8:00am, there were lots of chairs with a towel thrown on them to save. This made it difficult to find two chairs together on the lower pool deck. But if the chairs remained empty, we would move from upper to lower deck, and just take a chair. No one ever said a word to us. The pool has a waterslide which is open from 11:00am-3:00pm. Very popular with kids and grown ups alike. There is also a swim up bar, and pool waitservice, although there was not enough staff for the busy holiday, and it was often difficult to get their attention and get assistance. It was easier to go to the bar and get it yourself. The hotel has several restaurants onsite. We only ate at La Vista, a casual dining place that had a nice breakfast. Prices are resort fare. No surprises there. The hotel has a huge lobby bar, which has live music almost every night. They also have happy hour drink prices every afternoon, which was nice for a resort property. The casino is not huge, but adequate, if the is your thing. It was closed for several days when we were there, due to the Easter holiday. This is PR law, not hotel choice. The island itself is very nice. We rented a car for several days (Hertz is in the lobby) and toured around by ourselves. The roads in San Juan are well marked and very much like any other large city. The drivers are crazy! So make sure you are prepared for their recklessness. I would recommend El Junque rainforest, but I would also tell you to go the other direction and see Arecibo Observatory as well as Camuy Cave park. Both are fascinating places and well worth the hour drive. Word of advice, go early! Camuy Cave Park is extremely popular and sells out. Get there by 10:00a to ensure you get in. We did the other "regular" tourist things, like the Bacardi factory and Old San Juan. Both were crowded due to multiple cruise ships being in port. If you drive into Old San Juan, be prepared to spend some time looking for parking. There are several large lots, but they fill up by early afternoon. Overall, we had a very nice time in San Juan. The Marriott was as we expected; nothing more or less. I wish it had a spa, but other than that, it was just what we needed for a holiday get away.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice...”
Reviews.Author: 24fan
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I (she 40s, me 50s) stayed at the Marriott from May 11 â€“ May 18, 2009. I really give this place a thumbs up. Here are some specifics: Ride from airport less than 15 minutes. $20 w/tip. Greeted nicely on arrival by Robert who took our bags and directed us to check in. Midred checks us inâ€¦very friendly and very patient explaining everything. We upgraded from a double city view to a high floor (15) ocean view king and we get a corner room with two balconies ($75 extra per nite but IMO worth it). Room is very clean and spacious, great views. Robert is at the door with our luggage within five minutes. Room has nice bathroom amenities, bathrobes (we didnâ€™t use them) fridge, safe, desk area and sitting area and really comfy bed & did I mention the view? One balcony is direct ocean view the other a side view of the ocean to our right and then a view back to the city. Here are some other likes & a few dislikes: Like: Fast and always available elevators. Nice pool area, nice beach, lots of chairs in both locations, no need to do the chair dance. Beach and pool areas are spotless. Lots of towels and we always ask for four and never a problem (it has been at other places we stayed). Everyone, and I mean everyone greeted us with a smile or hello day or night. Always asked if we needed anything or needed help. Lobby bar staff very friendly. Casino staff friendly as well. Location is perfect for the Condado. Restaurants a short walk to the left or right as exiting the hotel. Local or Mexican style food (we liked Tijuanaâ€™sâ€”small but lively). Canâ€™t recall all the places but lots to choose from and we liked them all, just some more expensive than others. Also some of the names we all are familiar with are nearby as well. Chiliâ€™s, Uno Pizzeria etc. Walgreenâ€™s just a block away to the right. Liquor stores a short walk either left or right (shorter to the left). Beer was $9.95 a six packâ€”still cheaper than drinking at the hotel bar. Starbucks directly across the street. A few touristy stores in walking distance. A relatively short cab ride to Old San Juan. We paid a variety of prices for cabs to and from OSJâ€¦$12 - $15. Not sure why because it is supposed to be zone to zone pricing. Definitely visit OSJ and at least one of the forts. Didnâ€™t like: Hotel prices are steep (IMO). Two beers at the lobby bar = $14. USA today in the gift shop = $3.50. Now the bars around the hotel werenâ€™t a lot cheaper but they were cheaper @ $4 - $5 for a beer. Casinoâ€¦slots seemed tight and, while yes there are free drinks, service is slow, and drinks are small. Beach bar---there is a small one and they advertise Happy Hour 4 -6â€¦however we paid the same price at Happy Hour ($6.50 - $8.00) as we would any other time. Whatâ€™s happy about that? Overall, however, I would definitely recommend the Marriot Stellaris and would return. This is a nicely located hotel for everything from morning coffee to evening dinner and drinks. Lively lobby activity many evenings (weekends especially) and just a really clean, safe place to stay with a very friendly staff. Be prepared to shell out a few bucks but, hey, you are on vacationâ€¦live it up!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: LoraJae
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April for two nights before we sailed out of San Juan on a cruise. We really enjoyed our stay here. We booked an ocean front room which is exactly what we got. We had a corner room, which gave us two balconies. We were a bit too low to enjoy the second balcony, but we made good use out of the one facing the ocean. The room was a nice size. Clean and comfortable. The chair was a bit too close to the bed though. There was no musty beach smell in the room. The location is great. We walked around the area to eat and shop. When taking a cab, they had easy access on and off the highway. The beach and pool were both very nice. It was not too crowded and we were able to get chairs. The casino was okay. Nothing to write home about. A lady of the night was "hitting" on my husband. We spotted her getting off the elevator with another man later on. We would definitely stay here again if we ever go back to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy!”
Reviews.Author: 2tripsters
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night, thank goodness, since the entire hotel needs to be redone because it's dark, musty, and outdated. It's not really a resort either, it's a hotel. The pool was small, the work out room was in the dark basement and the buffet was the same price as the buffet at the Ritz Carlton but not nearly as good! The worst part was that I had an AWFUL allergic reaction to the mold in our room, which literally kept me up all night! If you have asthma and allergies this is not the hotel to stay in! Wish we had gone back to the Ritz Carlton San Juan where we had stayed before our cruise because it was clean, mold free and in a much nicer and safer area! The only positive was that the staff was very friendly. It's worth the price to stay at the Ritz Carlton because it's so much nicer, clean, mold free and in a safer area!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Stay pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: Cruzangirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early in the morning expecting to have our luggage held until the normal check in time. To our surprise a room was available and our luggage was taken immediately to our room. The bell staff is excellent and the front desk is also very friendly. Our room was a corner room overlooking the pool and ocean. The balcony was extra large. The room is very nicely appointed, clean and comfortable. The beds are excellent and provide a great night's sleep. We did not eat dinner at the hotel, as it was our anniversary. We dined at Il Perugina in Old San Juan and it was terrific. We had breakfast at the Marriott prior to checkout and it was fine. Nothing special and definitely resort prices. The Marriott and the Intercontinental are our resorts of choice when in Puerto Rico. We also have enjoyed the El Convento on previous stays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suny5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Room was lovely, was on a high floor overlooking the ocean. As with all Marriotts, bed was very comfortable. The balcony was our favourite part, spent most of our time in the room out on it. Breakfast was included in our package. I find it convenient to have breakfast in the hotel, but I wouldn't pay for it separately. Standard buffet, chef made eggs as requested. Had room service one evening, thought it was very good for room service. Ate most nights at the restaurants around the hotel, loved Tijuana across the street. Walgreens was just down the street, great for picking up water, snacks and sunscreen. Found the service to be very average from front desk and conceirge, I don't know if they just weren't listening, but they often got things wrong. While these things are niggly, I place more emphasis on the standard of accommodation and facilities Loved the beach, the waves were so much fun. Security into the hotel was reassuring. Beach was quite quiet during the week and a bit busier for the weekend. Sunloungers were comfortable and parasols were always available when we needed one. Overall had a great stay and would return if we could get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “A "hotel"? ... yes. A "resort"? ... no.”
Reviews.Author: nooner319
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long stay at the Marriott San Juan "Resort" & Stellaris Casino. We selected the Marriott in San Juan because we have always had such wonderful experiences with Marriott, especially enjoying their PHENOMENAL resort in Curacao. In San Juan, we were disappointed! Except for the attentive doormen and bell staff, service is POOR. The hotel was merely that.... it was not a resort and was more in line with a business class hotel. If you are not blessed with sunshine to allow you to take advantage of the pool and the beach, there is pretty much nothing else to do around the hotel except spend time in the casino or at the pricey bar. There are no organized activities (as we found at other resorts) and in the evening, if you want to sit in the lobby lounge to listen to music, you are forced to a two drink minimum per person. While this could include soda or coffee, the prices would be enough to keep you away. When I asked what the "resort fee" covered, the rather rude desk attendee said it covered the "free" wireless internet access available throughout the hotel (although you can make use of the business center on the lower level and unless you travel on vacation with a laptop, who would need that?) and the umbrellas at the beach (which is not private). When I asked if there was anything else, she had no response. The best part of the hotel was, of course, the classic Marriott bed and clean room. We were lucky to get a cabana room which offered great views of the pool and ocean. The cleaning staff was especially attentive and we returned to our room each day to find comfort and cleanliness. While the restaurants are pricey, we found that at Tuscany, neither the service nor the food seemed to justify the cost. We frequently dine at fine restaurants and don't mind paying up for good food, but this was not worth it. We found better options right along Ashford Avenue. The best sushi can be found right next door. Yees has terrific sushi, as well as a separate area where you can sit around the hibachi table. Heads up, though... if you sit down in the sushi bar, bring a sweater because it is intentionally kept cooler (raw fish, you know). The owner is attentive and the food is delicious. Bottom line is that while I will continue to patronize Marriotts at various locations, I will definitely NOT be returning to this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: bkpr
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a good experience at the Marriott. We had a cabana room, which we were told cannot be reserved in advance. They can be requested once you arrive if you've already reserved a pool or ocean view room (not city view). We liked the cabana view much, much better than the pool or ocean view rooms. It looked directly out over the pool to the ocean. The pool view rooms in the tower face sideways and you really get a city view. Just a matter of preference, I guess. My biggest complaint of the hotel is that the lobby area is not open-air. This is the only beach hotel that we've ever stayed that had a closed, highly air-conditioned lobby area. Other beach hotels we've stayed had open-air lobby areas which felt tropical and gives you an island feel. Since this one is closed, and highly air-conditioned (I was cold in t-shirt and shorts), the entrance feels more like a business hotel. You walk directly into a large bar area with T.V's on the wall. Feels like a combo sports bar and business hotel at the same time, if that makes any sense. Since I was looking for a hotel with an island feel, I was very disappointed at the overall feel of the hotel. The view from my cabana room helped to make up for it (not completely, but it helped). We considered switching hotels so we could get something that felt more island-like or something with more character in old san juan. In the end, the Marriott had enough to offer (i.e. good location and reasonable price) to keep us there, so we did not switch hotels. A definite plus was the service. Each employee we encountered was very nice and helpful. We did not have a bad experience with any employee. Everyone was great - from the bell hop to the front desk employees, to the concierge, casino workers, restaurant workers, etc. All were fantastic. I don't think there's a perfect place to stay in San Juan which would give you good atmosphere, good location and good price. So, this is a very good option.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while visiting San Juan”
Reviews.Author: CentralTXtravelers
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a very pleasant experience at the San Juan Marriott Resort and Stellaris Casino. The hotel grounds are beautiful and the staff was very friendly. The bathroom was a little small in our room. but otherwise was OK. The hotel provided our room with complimentary travel size Bath & Body Works body wash, shampoo, conditioner and lotion (Aromatherapy - Orange Ginger) which smelled nice and was a nice change from the generic stuff you get at most hotels. Our room package included breakfasts at La Vista and the buffet was very good . We particularly liked the fact that it didn't offer the exact same buffet options every day. We didn't manage to eat at the Tuscany Restaurant, but during our stay, the hotel offered a 3-course meal at Tuscany for $20 per person. There are lots of restaurant options in the Condado area and within walking distance to the hotel. We liked Buenos Ayres (an Argentinian restaurant) and Danny's International. The location of the San Juan Marriott is excellent and the Condadao area is very safe. It is a $16 cab ride to the airport (SJU) and a $12 cab ride to Old San Juan. On one visit to Old San Juan, we shared a cab with another couple (costing us $3 each) and we took the bus back to the hotel for 75 cents each. Please note that the bus does not take dollar bills, only coins, so you need to have the bus fare in he exact amount of tcoins only. We only have 2 relatively minor complaints about the San Juan Marriott. First, we booked the Romance Package for our stay, which included complimentary breakfast at La Vista, a bottle of champagne and a 55-min. couples massage at the spa. The hotel needs to do a better job of educating its front desk personnel about this package. When we checked in, the guy checking us in was not familiar with this package and just thought we got the complimentary breakfast. I had to tell him what was included (and then he verified with his superiors). When we were checking out, we were charged for the couples massage at the spa. Again, I had to tell the girl at the front desk that the massage was included in our package and she, after verifying with her superiors, took the charge off our bill. I'm sure the Marriott offers several different vacation packages, but if any personnel should know the specifics about these packages, it should be the front desk workers. Second, the spa is poorly organized/managed. When we arrived for our couples massage, we were told that they were running behind because a facial machine broke down, and we would be delayed by 20-25 minutes. The girl then suggested we could sit in the dry spa if we would like. She gave each of us keys to our lockers, which had our robes in it, but did not give us spa sandals/slippers until we asked. We had to walk around in the changing area and out to the front desk to get slippers. When we were done with the dry spa, the front desk girl put us in a room to sit. We waited an additional 40 MINUTES until we were eventually given our massages. Other than the last 5 minutes we were in the waiting area, no one from the spa bothered to check on us or see if we wanted some tea or water. No one ever personally apologized to us for the delay, but to make amends, the spa sent us a bottle of wine, cheese, crackers and fruit to our room to make amends for the delays. Had they not done that, we probably would have asked the hotel to refund some of our money for the massages. The massages, though, were very good. There were several families staying at this hotel and it had a nice size wading pool for the little kids and a water slide. If you are looking for a family friendly hotel, this would fit the bill. We would love to visit Puerto Rico again, perhaps with the kids this time, and would stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing, and the ocean view is worth it”
Reviews.Author: DarwinsGarden
Reviews.Content: Well, I just returned from a weeklong stay. It was beautiful, the grounds, the room, the view. All of the staff members were extremley helpful ( especially Carlos at the pool bar and Orlando on the beach). The hotel has a couple of good restaurants, but they are pricey. We only ate at La Vista for breakfast. We were not traveling with children but, there were many things for families with children such as a huge kiddie pool, and water slide. The beach is very nice. The current is quite stong however, and small children probably couldn't go into the water without parents. It's a 14$ cab ride into Old San Juan, but if you split that with another couple, it's only $3.50 per person...not bad. There are many good restaurants within walking distance. Also they will set up tours and activities for you, such as snorkeling, kyaking, and rainforest adventures.I would return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MaryNewYork
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Marriott Stellaris. We are already planning our next trip! The hotel was very nice - clean, good location, very friendly and helpful staff. One tip - they ask everyone who doesn't already have an ocean view if they want to upgrade upon check in. They told us we had a 'city view'. We opted not to upgrade since a view was not a must for us. We were pleasantly surprised when we got to our room that we had a great partial view of the ocean (see photo). If you are interested in the ocean view, ask if you have a partial view before you upgrade. We found this more than adequate. We did not eat any meals at the hotel. Some of the local restaurants we went to were Ummo (expensive), Miro (right across the street. Nice), and Tijuana. Tijuana was the best of the three. Another tip - take the city bus into Old San Juan instead of a taxi. It is only 75 cents - be sure you have exact change! At the hotel, they told us the bus number was B21, which is correct. You can also take C53, however, and we saw more of that bus around. We took both and were fine. If you gamble in the casio, make sure you sign up for a players card and redeem any points you earn at the end of your trip. We are not big gamblers, but got enough points to knock about $19 off our bill. Also, if they have availability, they will give you a complimentary one hour late check out. It came in very handy for us based on the time of our flight. All in all, a great trip! I would go back in a second!!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lilbitfinicky
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the cleanliness and comfort of the room. The beachfront location was nice. The staff was pleasant. After a very dissapointed stay at the LaConcha, the Marriott was a breath of fresh air!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Marriott - not cheap, but enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: sweetcmg
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Marriott Resort on Condado Beach in San Juan for the last two days of our honeymoon vacation. We decided to have a vacation extension since we had to fly through SJU to go home anyways and I thought my husband would really like the city of San Juan. This is my third trip to San Juan, but one of those being on a short cruise stop. The Marriott is about a 20 min drive or taxi from Luis Munoz airport. As of this time period, a taxi ride to this hotel from the airport cost $15 each way, plus $1 per piece of luggage you have. Our flight from St. Lucia arrived very early in San Juan - at 9:30 in the morning. After going through immigration and customs and getting a taxi, we arrived at the hotel around 10:15. We had scheduled an independent tour through Kayak Puerto Rico that would be picking us up at 12:00. So we were hoping deep down that a room would be available, but knowing it was probably a very small chance. Sure enough, we were told that a room was not available yet as check-out time was 11am. However, that we were the first people for our room type so we would be the first ones in line to get a room. They gave us a restaurant pager and said we could feel free to check out the hotel and they would let us know when a room became available. The bell station held all of our luggage for us during this time. We took turns checking out the casino and walking around and grabbed some food from the downstairs coffee bar. Well unfortunately (but since check-in wasn't until 3pm, we can't fault them in any way), our room was not ready in time before we were to be picked up for our tour. We simply returned the pager and they said they would call us when the room became available. We had to laugh that they called saying our room was available about 15 minutes after we left. We appreciated them trying to get us a room early though. Our tour kept us out until after 10pm so we never were able to get in our room until late that evening. We booked a king oceanfront room - we splurged a little since we were on the last 2 nights of our honeymoon and all! We got a room on one of the corners of the 7th floor and what a beautiful view this was! This was a very busy hotel over a weekend and the beach was packed. We went to the beach once on Sunday afternoon but didn't spend any real time there. I think we enjoyed the view from our balcony more and could see all of the activity from there. It seems that a lot of local island families come to San Juan for the weekend because the hotel seemed full of locals (tourists too, but many locals on Sat and Sun). Our room was small, but adequate. It was clean and what I would expect from a Marriott resort hotel. This hotel does add on a "resort fee" and for this fee you receive 2 bottles of water per day, free WiFi, coffee/tea in your room, some casino match play coupons and live entertainment downstairs in the evenings. Not much, but the WiFi and the water was a nice touch. We prepaid on Expedia for everything in advance. The front desk and concierge service as well as the bell station were nothing but friendly and accommodating for our entire stay. We got some recommendations for dinner and they pointed us to the Walgreens at the corner so we could buy some snacks and water without paying hotel prices. A high recommendation for Kayak Puerto Rico - we took the combination Rainforest & Bio Bay tour. They need a minimum of 4 people to do this tour, but what an amazing tour! I believe you can find them here on TripAdvisor as well. We were lucky to have seen the Bio Bay without any real moon, so it was nice and dark that evening and I will say first-hand that it is very cool to see. El Yunque is a worthwhile trip for all - a definite must do. If you are willing to drop a good amount of money on a Marriot resort hotel, this is a good place to do it. I felt the value was there and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a large group.”
Reviews.Author: TimCC
Reviews.Content: We were there for a bachlor party for two nights and three days. I found the hotel to be very clean and has a friendly staff. The rooms were "Just okay" but very clean. The best part of the hotel is the Beach. Friendly staff, not crowded and 30 feet from the Beach Bar. Food at the resort is kinda pricecy, I highly recommand eating outside the hotel. The seafood grill place accross the street is pretty good. Try the seafood soup. The only downside of the hotel is the casino, its bacially same as a casino you find out most cruise ships. But there is a plus with the casino, they serve Food. Get the breakffast sandwhich they offer you. chicken or Ham and cheese. Overall, I recommand this hotel with a group, it not a good place if you're on a romantic getaway. Go to Ritz or El San Juan for that. 1 more thing, Last call for room service is midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and people, property gets a thumbs down.”
Reviews.Author: Freja3
Reviews.Content: Just back from long weekend in San Juan. Used Marriott reward points so had to pick. Read reviews and struggled with Stellaris or La Concha. Chose Stellaris due to the several recent reports of construction in the early am. Stellaris was disappointing. Interior rooms what you d expect for a Marriott and beds as usual, very comfy. Older property and as my husband pointed out, depressing. The beach is medicore at best with allot of wave activity and very windy so no swimming, only wave boarding and hard to relax on beach. Lobby is just as if not louder than La concha at night. Big night club, so just be prepared. The people are lovely, and the service is top notch. Tuscany restuarant was fantastic, big Surprise! Tony is great. Hope this helps. In retrospect, wish we had chosen the La Concha. Common areas at least are MUCH nicer. If you go to San Juan, recommend restaurants - Budtia and Marmelade.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel; location mediocre”
Reviews.Author: PaulaJM
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Marriott Stellaris in San Juan. The hotel itself is beautiful and immaculate.The staff was very helpful and friendly. The food was expensive, but the meal at Tuscany's was good. We ate breakfast at the Starbuck's across the street. The drinks poolside are very expensive and to us seemed watered down. The beach was very rough and cold as was the pool, despite 90 degree temps. However, it was overall a relaxing weekend. We paid for an upgrade to an oceanfront room which was worth it. We got our breakfast and sat on the balcony and watched the waves. The surrounding area is not terribly nice; we never felt unsafe, but it was rundown and several surrounding buildings were unoccupied and had a "bombed out" appearance. Of note, a fellow tourist had a major medical problem poolside and I work in the healthcare field. I was the only one able to help this man; the staff was not sure what to do. They called an ambulance which took 45 minutes! The hospital was only two blocks away, so this was concerning. The parameds did not seem that sharp and I had to ask them to check several things. However, the security folks were grateful for my help and sent me and my husband a beautfiul wine/fruit/cheese basket to say thank you for the help. I thought this was a very nice and much appreciated gesture. We did manage to lose $50 in the casino, but if you don't play, you can't win!! Overall, a very nice hotel for a quick getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Beach - interesting location”
Reviews.Author: cbbma70
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 4 night stay at the Marriot - Condado. We had good service the whole time we were there. I thought the beach was one of the nicest I have been to. If you are from the East Coast, you will be fine with the waves! Although the last day we were there it was a little too rough but people were in. I know alot of people commented on the pool - The pool is in the shade in the morning but by afternoon it is fully in the sun and warm. The area is a little strange. There are buildings falling down and vacant all around but then there is the Salvatore Ferragamo store and other high end boutiques in the same block. My hopes are that this area will continue to be rebuilt because it is beautiful and the beach is almost exclusively for the Marriott. We also visited the El San Juan (Isla Verde) and that was not the situation, it was a very public beach. We had breakfast included in our rate and it was a very extensive breakfast. We ventured out to Ummo's Argentian steak out (2 blocks away) and ate there twice - it was very good. We also ate at Tijuana's (right near Ummo's) - that was OK - nothing great. 2 blocks down from the Marriott are about 6-7 restaurants including a pizza place, mexican, steak, italian, carribean, sushi - you can find almost anything. We had a great time. We also took a cab to Old San Juan - about 10 minutes away. There is a bus as well - which would be alot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great recommendations from Concierge...no need for resort fee.”
Reviews.Author: staceyberman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for 7 nights. After reading many reviews, we decided to decline the resort fee and found that this saved us $42.00 per day. We were still able to get a chair and umbrella ont he beach for $12.00 and didnt need the other features the fee offered. The beach was nice. Despite the surrounding buildings that need work, the beach was clean. The water was a bit rough but still nice to sit and relax. The pool had too many trees that blocked the sun so the beach was always our first choice. We normally do all inclusive trips, so this trip required some preliminary research to find the best restaurants during out stay. One fabulous restaurant is right across the street called Miros. There were no write ups about it, but the shrimp could not have been fresher and the service was wonderful. We also ate at La perla in the Rennaisance hotel(in our opinion, it was a waste of time). We ate at Pikayo one night which is located in the museum. that was probabaly our best meal. The surroundings were fabulous, the service was impeccable and the food was amazing. One restaurant to stay away from is La Toscany in the Marriott hotel. the cafe at the Renaissance was also amazing. you could sit outside and people watch and enjoy a great meal. Overall, our trip was very relaxing and the people at the Marriott were very nice. dont rush down there so early as the check in is 4pm and they are pretty strict about that. check out is 11am and they were nice enough to give us to 12:30. Not much to do otherwise since you have to leave the room so early.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hlmhrt
Reviews.Content: My family recently spent 1 night at the Marriott prior to departing on a week long cruise. The hotel rooms exceeded my expectations. The rooms were large, and looked like they had been recently redone. The balcony was excellent, with enough room to sit and watch the beach and pool. The bathrooms was large and very clean.
