The restaurant had a nice buffet for dinner and breakfast. The only thing I was disappointed in was the pool area. It seemed a little small to me and the water wasn't heated. In April, even though the air was warm, at 4pm the pool water felt cold and we really didn't enjoy the pool at all. I would definitely recommend this hotel was a weekend, but the pool area might be a little small for a week long stay.

Reviews.Title: “great beach, practical location - overpriced, unless it's a reward stay”
Reviews.Author: garystuff
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay for 7 days. I used Marriott points, so I did not pay for the room, otherwise this would have been very expensive. I went with my wife and two childred (age 9 & 11). We are very practical people, so we ended up doing things "our way" without eating at any hotel facility which were all overpriced. Between the beach, pool, Old San Juan and Fort, El Yunque and the Rio Camuy Caves - there was enough to keep us busy for the entire week. Things we liked: - the room was as you would expect from Marriott - clean, functional, had a balcony which we made use of for breakfast in the room - nothing out of the ordinary - the beach was excellent, and always had enough beach chairs, and usually an umbrella. the waves were strong enough to be fun for an adult/teen, and the kids could wander just far enough to enjoy or play in the sand. - pool was nice: had a water slide, kid pool 2-ft deep, larger pool ~5-feet deep and hot tub - like the location for amenities. Starbucks across the street and Walgreens and Dunkin Donuts down the block. I woke up to get a simple breakfast across the street and brought it back to the room for the family (avg breakfast for all four of us was about $15) This is compared to the hotel breakfast buffet $20/person - Lots of resturants within walking distance ranging in cuisine and expense - Charlies Car rental across the street - we ended up just renting by the day and returning at night, so we did not incur hotel parking charges. - loved having a mini-fridge in the room, room safe and two waters/day Things were not crazy about: - if we had to pay for this hotel, it is way to expensive for everything. But at least there are alternatives for all meals off-site - concierge was functional, but had to work at getting help from them. would have like if they could offer more advice proactively. - check-in took 30 minutes as they searched for a room for us at 5pm. They offered me a larger room for an additional $70/nite, but I declined - $20pp for breakfast??? That's overkill since my b-fast at home is very modest. For a family of 4, that is too expensive - Taxes and resort fee can really add to your cost -watch it! - Casino and dancing is VERY LOUD in the lobby. We were on the 14th floor, so thankfully it didn't bother us, but it was loud downstairs. - LOTS of police...that's a mixed blessing. We had no problems though - deserted buildings on either side of the hotel made the view marred. Condado is not such a pretty area anymore. I heard Isla Verde is prettier. I would go again if it was on Marriott Points, but not if I had to pay >$175 (regular room rate is typically +$250). Less frugal people may not mind the expense, but we managed to have an excellent 7-day vacation under $1000.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place to relax and recharge yourself!!”
Reviews.Author: ron393
Reviews.Content: We had been here with the kids for a short stay from a cruise. We wanted to go back for 8 days just my wife and I for our 28th anniversary. What a great time we had. We ae not "beach people", but the pool and the casino kept us entertained One of the nicest features at this Hotel is it superior level of customer service and attention to detail. My wife and I were always made to feel welcome wherever we went. We took game lessons at the casino and they really wanted us to understand how the games are played and they took the time to make it fun! The bus is only .75 cents and takes you right into old San Juan and then you can hop the trolly and circle around and in between the entire area. Another very affordable thing to do is rent a car for the day across the street from Charlie car rentals a car was $39.99 for the day unlimited mileage and its very easy to go to the Rain Forrest and the other little towns along the way. The location is great for walking to local restaurants for appetizers and mojitos! The Hotel restaurants are a bit pricy but they do have some 3 course price fixed specials which we tried ,and the food as well as the service were excellent. our room had ocean view and I strongly recommend that you get one if your there for more than a day or two. Safety in the area is fine, we never felt nervous at any time while we were there. I really want to commend the management team at this hotel , everyone is pleasant and friendly and happy to be doing what they do and it shows!!! You'll have a wonderful time at this hotel I know we did.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: traveloverNj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights pre cruise, and it worked out perfectly. More of a business type hotel than a resort. The service at this hotel is top notch, front desk and concierge were extremely helpful and friendly. We needed some area restaurant suggestions and they sent up copies of restaurant menus to our room which I thought was great! we had dinner one night in Tuscany, delicious food and great service! Rooms and beds are extremely comfortable, bathrooms are huge, nicely laid out. We had a nice side ocean view room of the pool in the main bldg. The beach is nice, very clean, but ocean is rough for swimming. I'm not a big fan of the lobby , kind of dark. Overall, pricey, but a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations but nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Flippy92
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually stay at Marriott hotels and resorts. This time we were both disappointed. It is a nice hotel, the location is good, the view and pool are great. But not what I would expect for the price. After paying over $340/night, you still have to pay taxes (normal), about 15% of "hotel fees" (!), $16/night for parking and $13 burgers (you are better off walking to "Tijuana" restaurant - awesome Margaritas!). If you want the view, just add $25/night and if you don't want to see the pool add another $25. Might as well advertise $450/night and stop asking us to pay for the smallest things. Even Internet isn't free (time to catch up, we are not in 1999 anymore). Overall good trip, very nice staff and good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean...”
Reviews.Author: vtbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable, clean, and the staff were friendly. I did not have any issues with staff as others have reported. The rooms were nice, well kept and clean. My room had a mini fridge which was nice. The ocean view was beautiful. The surrounding area has many dining options. Try Tijuana's for a great Mexican dinner. Across the street from Tijuana's is an Argentinian grill which was fabulous! It's about a 15 minute taxi ride to Old San Juan - if you make it there, Marmalade is a MUST!! The beach is well maintained and the hotel provides lounge chairs. Umbrellas can be rented for $12/day. The pools were nice. My main complaint is that there is only one hot tub! It seemed that people had to line up to get in! There are a lot of kids around, so if you are looking for a kid-free vaca, look elsewhere. The waitstaff poolside were always wandering around and offering drinks. Drinks are overpriced at $6.50 for a beer (Coors Light even!), so go for the extra $3.50 and enjoy a Mojito or Miami Vice! The hotel has a really nice gym in comparison to other hotels that I have stayed at. They have six or so treadmills, bikes, elipical runners and an array of weights. I was surprised! The hotel has a Hertz onsite. We were able to reserve a car on Saturday for a Sunday rental. Driving around is pretty easy and a great way to see the island. Some collegues tried excursions set-up by the hotel and seemed to have had a good time. The lobby is loud as others have described.

Reviews.Title: “Actually not bad...but...”
Reviews.Author: Bchtravler
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Marriott in San Juan, I found the hotel staff to be friendly, kind and helpful. But..@! The main bar is in the lobby of the hotel, there all the warmth and kindness stops. I found the service to be horrable, the staff ignores you, waited 10 min to see if the waitress would come to the table, she was a no show, too busy chatting with the bartenders, then went up to the bar, and they ignored me, I could not believe it. And no I was not rude, they just flat out ignored me, even after I spoke up ( and no I did not say anything rude or mean..though it was on my mind) go figure a Tourist hotel who does not like tourists! And in these hard times, the bar makes money.. way to go Marriott Oh yeah.. the wifi does work in alot of rooms, mine included and for $40 for three days,ugh... going to the lobby ( although after I complained, they did remove the charge from the bill..that was nice) to use the wifi is a hassle.. ever have a SKYPE call inthe lobby.. not good Room was nice beach clean,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamily1364
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for 6 days and 5 nights. It was a great hotel for our young family. The kiddie pool was no more than 2 ft deep and had a zero entry on one side - perfect for our two year old who was tentative of the water, at first. The staff was very helpful in suggesting family friendly restaurants. The beach has plenty of sand but the water is too rough for swimming. There are great restaurants within walking distance and Old San Juan is just about 30 minutes on the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Guest Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: pjm833
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week stay at the San Juan Marriott Resort and Stellaris Casino. We actually had a destination wedding at the hotel and invited about 20 people to the wedding. Everyone stayed at the Marriott and everyone had a fantastic time. Everyone except for my husband and I were upgraded from city view to pool/ocean or ocean view rooms. The location was awesome, we were within walking distance of local restaurants, shops, and right on the beach. Included in the resort fee are lounge chairs and umbrellas which are carried out to the beach for you. The hotel restaurants were great, the breakfast buffet was delicious, but a little over priced. We had our reception dinner at Tuscany and it was absolutely delicious! The best part of of our stay was the customer service. Anything and everything you needed was provided or delivered to you right away. They even sent up a seamstress to do quick sewing for my mother during the early evening! We will definitely stay here again when we travel back to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, clean, and great location on Condado”
Reviews.Author: KrysyGT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights pre-cruise for our Honeymoon. The hotel was nothing short of elegant. Not overly done, but just right for the Caribbean. Staff was pleasant and the welcome cocktail was more than refreshing as we stood on line to check in. Rooms are bright and airy with our 1/2 ocean 1/2 city view room. Gigantic bathroom is every girls DREAM. I could have locked myself in there for the week and been happy... ok maybe an exaggeration, but it was fantastic! Room service was a tad overpriced, but it was our honeymoon, we had to! Pool was a lot smaller than pictures lead you to believe. Beach was beautiful but the water was too rough for swimming. Local area was great to walk around and explore. Some fantastic authentic restaurants in the neighborhood!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: 52marv
Reviews.Content: On March 20, 2009, my family stayed one night at the Marriott before our cruise. Our group included me and my husband, my 11 and 8 year old kids, my 81 year old father and my 73 year old mother. Last year pre-cruise, we stayed on the concierge floor at the Radisson Ambassador Plaza Hotel & Casino San Juan. The Radisson was nice, but the Marriot is better. The Marriot has a better lobby, better pool, better staff, better restaurant and a better location in Condado right on the beach. We got a good, nonrefundable AAA rate by booking online, saving about $20.00 per room. My parents got a good senior citizen rate that was refundable. My only quibble is the resort fee. I know itâ€™s for beach and pool access, etc.; but Iâ€™m not a fan of resort fees. They should be included in the price upfront so you know what youâ€™re getting. We booked connecting ocean front rooms on the 6th floor that also overlooked the pool. My parents were on the 4th floor directly below us. They also had a nice view, but the ocean view was obscured by the palm trees. If a true ocean view is important to you, stay on the 6th floor or above. The rooms were very nice, with an updated dÃ©cor, nice bathroom and plenty of space. The pool area was attractive and there was a small waterslide that the kids enjoyed. We ate an adequate buffet breakfast in the restaurant. The concierge was also adequate. The Condado area is nice for a pre-cruise stay; but keep in mind that San Juan is a major metropolitan area that just happens to be on the beach. In a way itâ€™s very similar to Chicagoâ€™s location on Lake Michigan. Many of the reviews here seem disappointed with the Marriot because the reviewer was looking for a tropical island experience. I love San Juan and I enjoy staying in the Condado area, pre-cruise, but it is a city location, it is not a tropical island experience. It is more like staying in New York City, except thereâ€™s a beach out front. If you are not looking for a city vacation, then the Marriot will not be right for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: Grotheur
Reviews.Content: We nearly always have a great experience at a Marriott and this was no exception. The doormen are very friendly and create a very good first impression of the hotel. Check in was a breeze and we were given a very large, upper floor corner room that had both an ocean-front balcony and a double-length ocean view balcony that faced that sunrise. The bed was large and comfortable and, having two small children, we appreciated the mini refrigerator and large flat-screen television. I have to say that the entire resort staff was both professional and friendly and we were always greeted with a smile. When we blew out the room hairdryer, not only did they quickly replace it, they called later to make sure that the new one was delivered and working. The beach is pretty but the water is too rough to swim. The pools are great, however, and our children loved the huge "kiddie" pool that is never more than about 3 feet deep. My only complaint is that neither pools are heated so evening swims were uncomfortably chilly. The resort location is great and the immediate neighborhood is safe and clean. There are a lot of good restaurant options (try Danny's for breakfast) within walking distance so we never ate at the hotel. Also, there is a bus stop right in front where you can catch the B21 to Old San Juan for 75 cents per adult (kids ride free). We got a great deal on a minivan from Charlie's Rental Car that is located right across the street and self-parking at the hotel is $16.00 per day. Overall, we really enjoyed staying at this resort and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: carolusb
Reviews.Content: Don't listeen to the bad reviews, I liked it so much when I went with my Mom and sister years ago that I am going back to this resort this summer. It's very nice, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “In need of some customer service training and a reality check on roll away fees.”
Reviews.Author: Younger64
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (13 year old, 11 year old) stayed at this Marriott in Condado San Juan for 3 days post cruise. I guess because the service level on the cruise was so great, in general we were a bit let down by this hotel. We upgraded from a standard AAA $284 ocean front double room to a 'junior' suite for $ 100 per night (plus 23% fees and taxes) when we checked in. We also upgraded for the use of the concierge lounge for an additional ($50 +23%). Both upgrades were worthwhile. The 'junior' suite was very large, with a large ocean front balcony and separate bedroom, and combination living area and dining room table. The kids did have to share a sofa bed though.. the hotel wanted 40 a night for a roll away bed(seemed obscene!) and then told us that there wasn't enough room in our massive suite for a roll away due to fire regulation. Seemed like a crock to us. The concerge lounge is well worth $50+23% per night for a family of 4. It includes a contential breakfast, evening appetizers and desert, as well as complementary non-alcoholic beverages including an expresso / cappucino machine. One other big customer service issue we has was related to laundry. When we arrived on the morning of our first day we immediately sent out a few shirts. Housekeeping came and picked up the shirts from me immediately. At the end of the follwing day we had not recieving the laundry back, so I called the front desk to enquire. The checked with the laundry manager and phoned me back to tell me that 'you just dropped off the laundry today', and proceeded to argue with me - like I wouldn't remember what day I dropped it off! I thought it was pretty standard understanding that you do not argue with guests - especially when money is not involved. If they had even just appologized I would have been happy, but calling me a liar just pissed me off. We didn't make a capital case out of it since we could make do until the next day without the shirts - but it left a bad taste in our mouths. Reminded us of some nightmare customer service issues we have had in Mexico in the past.... The upside of this hotel is there is a nice pool area, and beach chairs are included. Although the hotel restaurants are over priced, we found lots of good alternatives outside of the hotel using Frommer's recommendation. The surf on the beach is very rough, so the beach would be tough we younger children. Gym was very nice and included, and was use of the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, expected so much more from a Marriot.”
Reviews.Author: rb121175
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here two weeks on business, not really worth it at all IMO. 1) Climate control is terrible. There is no in room climate control and all you get is freezing cold humid air blowing at you all night. My room was so damp for the two full weeks I was here. 2) No free internet! Who doesn't do free internet in this day and age? I can stay at the junkiest hotel back home and get free internet. They charge 15 bucks a day and the connection rate is awful, not to mention that the wireless hub must be the first one ever created because it drops signal every 2 mins. 3) The place is a zoo with loud music and screaming kids and people everywhere. There are so many people, I had to wait almost 15 mins for an elevator I could cram myself into with my bags. 4) The beach is ALWAYS red flagged for bad surf and it is never advised to go in. Yes it is always red flagged I asked. 5) Food is ok but not worth the cost. 6) San Juan is disgusting...nuff said If you really want to go to PR I would suggest a resort on the southern end of the island where the surf is better. If you truly want a tropical carribean feel I would try another island altogether. I was not impressed with this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Ms. Our Lobster is not from the caribbean....”
Reviews.Author: BellaPhia
Reviews.Content: Well let me start by saying....anywhere that is 85 degrees and sunny is better than NJ. My husband and I were so looking forward to going to PR for a few days, without the kids and the COLD...we decided on PR because my husband has never been. My last trip to PR was about 15 years ago and stayed in Dorado Beach at the Hyatt.....wonderful time. We chose Marriott because my husband is an Elite Member and it was free, except for the $75 room upgrade per night, which we were aware of , and the upper floor corner ocean view room is well worth it. The first people you encounter when you arrive are the doormen, and they are wonderful. Very friendly and willing to answet any questions you may have, UNLIKE the unhappy ladies behind the concierge desk. I almost felt as if I was annoying them or something by asking a few simple questions, its not like I was asking for the historical background of Ponce De Leon. It was very hard to get a "good morning" never mind a "Thank You".Now on to service....let me just say DO NOT waite until you are dying of thirst or starving for lunch to order something, regardless if you are at the pool or in one of the restaurants expect to waite at least 20 minutes for someone to take your order, and then another 20 minutes to receive it....blew my mind. Lastley, the reason behind my title.....our last night at the hotel we decided to have dinner at the hotel, Tuscany. I ordered a Bowtie pasta and LOBSTER dish, key word being LOBSTER, which cost about $35, and my husband chose the Lasagna. Our waiter, Ricardo, was terrible....we later found out it was only his second day, and it showed. We ordered no appetizers, just dinner and it took easily 45 minutes to an hour to get it, and the place was empty. While eating my dish, which was very good I realized that I was eating SHRIMP and NOT LOBSTER, and I giggled about it for a few minutes and thought I was going nuts. My husband proceeded to call over Ricardo and tell him that the food was very good, but that it was shrimp and not lobster, he look liked he could die. Not knowing what to do next, he calls over another waiter and tells him the problem, and this one tried to assure me that it IS lobster, but I stopped him mid sentence and said I swear on my childrens lives that there is no way that its lobster, he said let me go and talk to the chef. After a few minutes he reemerged from the kitchen and had a message for me from the Chef...."Ms our lobster is not from the Caribbean, we flew it in from somewhere else" and that when my husband spit his wine all over the place in laughter and I the poor waiter must have realized what an idiot he just made of himself he walked away in shame. After a few more minutes , he came back to the table and apologized and said he will take ot off the bill....I took that as "Yeah its SHRIMP". Now, I dont know wether they ran out of Lobster that night, as it was late, or if they try to swap out the lobster for the shrimp on unsuspecting diners......either way I lost total respect for the Chef of Tuscany. If you can deal with slow service, unfriendly attitudes by some, and out right deceit, than I say go for it. My husband and I have stayed at numerous Marriott Hotels all over the US and abroad, and this one by far was on the lower end of the scale.

Reviews.Title: “nice place noisy in lobby”
Reviews.Author: sis0876
Reviews.Content: I found the lobby to be very noisy with loud music at night you couldnt even talk to anyone over the music played. nice rooms comfortable beds good location nice pool and beach, dont eat at hotel it is very expensive. good restaurnts around that area to walk to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Flyerno.one
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. It was greatly improved over our first stay about three years ago. The room were redone, and have a modern look to them. The rooms are not large, nor is the bathroom, but it is comfortable. The hotel has a large pool area as well as a large beach. The casino was nice, and non smoking. The hotel resturants were good, but rather expensive. The location allowed you to walk to many good resurants and some nice shops. The bus to old San Juan was right next door to the hotel. (have 75 cents in change per person) we also took the bus to Isle Verde. There is a large Walgreens on the next corner from the hotel and you can buy just about anything there,( they have a food market attached to it.). The hotel staff was very helpful, and pleasant. We were very satisfied with our six day stay at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissappointed for the money...been to better in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: scat1234
Reviews.Content: Love Marriott, but this hotel is not what was expected...overpriced, plus they nickel-and-dime you once you get there. Deceptive amenities listed on website...for instance, it boasts wireless internet access, but neglects to tell you they charge $45 for three days of access! Don't return the pool towels? $20 each on your room bill. Want a beer in the lobby bar? That'll be $7.25 for a Bud. $25 per day to valet a car if you rent one. Service below average compared to other Marriotts. Room was okay, but not worth $335 a night when compared to other hotels I've stayed in on the same strip of beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great beach.”
Reviews.Author: ShesOutandAbout
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend with several friends in two different types of rooms. One ocean front room...very nice, and one city view room, but it had a great city and ocean view. Both rooms were very clean, very comfy and well stocked. The entire staff (front desk, bar, outside bars, restaurants, and housekeeping) was very friendly, helpful and always happy to assist. Even the Hertz desk, not related to the hotel, could not have been more helpful. Getting to Old San Juan was a short cab ride for $14 or by a bus at .75 per person. The bus can take a while, though. Getting to the Isla Verde area is also around $15+- by cab as well as the airport. Everything in San Juan seems to be 10-15 minutes away from this area. The beach is great and with a staff to take your food/drink orders all day. By the time the sun begins to disappear behind the building, most of the beach slows anyway. You can get a great deal of sun most of the day. I don't understand the complaining in the other reviews. The waves are big, but goodness, you are staring at the Atlantic ocean...what do you expect?!?!! Use your judgement, I had friends swimming in it during red flags, and some that did not. The pools are not cold and not bath water, either. I'm thinking some of these reviews expect bath water! The lobby does get loud in the evening and each night has a different theme. We hit different hotel bars/lounges each night we were there. Each are very different. This one was slow for us, but enjoyable as we started each night here. La Concha felt more like a Miami lounge...the staff there is just as friendly and helpful. We traveled to the El San Juan by cab. It is a younger, very hip, very place to be seen crowd. There is a club in one area or stay in the lobby for the salsa sounds. It was just as crowded in the lobby and the bar is just as tasty. Lots of people watching in all the places we visited each night. There is great food within walking distance from the Marriott. There are a few places directly across the street, too. We used the car rental stand next door to the Starbucks (directly across from the hotel) since Hertz did not have any cars left and also suggested it to us. It turned out to cost us less and returning it that night, they gave us access back to their lot so as to not pay for parking at the Marriott and turned in the keys the next morning at no extra costs. We drove to El Yunque and Fajardo for the bio-bay. One warning, the bio-bay is not open to all kayak companies each day. Call ahead to your kayak company of choice and schedule beforehand. We were lucky! All in all, this Marriott matched what one can expect from Marriott. Clean rooms, great service, friendly staff. This is in a great location to get to/from most all areas of San Juan. It is very easy to get back to if you leave in a rental car, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: firmanc
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Marriott and had a great time. The concierge was very helpful in finding our way around the area. I suggest the coffee merchant in the lobby for morning coffee and wonderful Puerto Rican pastries. Avoid Tuscanys as there are so many other wonderful restaurants close by. Our other choice was La Concha which also looked very nice but did not have as nice of beach. Surf by Marriott is WAY too rough for swimming and the pool was VERY cold, hot tub was tepid. Room was comfortable and clean, however, it had an odor and the last morning we were there we found that the bathroom counter was infested with microscopic sized spiders. We had to check all our stuff to make sure we didn't bring any home. All in all we had a great time. It was our first trip to Puerto Rico and it was awesome. If you are going on a whim make sure you research it and that you are going for the right reasons...great sightseeing, great food, great weather.....

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't disappointed. Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gizm0sm0m
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline and expected the very worst room they had. I was pleasantly surprised to be put in an 18th floor room with a partial ocean view. The room was comfortable, clean and quiet. Beds were amazing as were the staff at the hotel. I loved the pool area and the overall atmosphere in the public areas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Derohn
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in December to celebrate a friends 30th birthday. It wasnt my first time travelling to Puerto Rico, but it was for everyone I was with. We had a great time at the hotel. The location is great, and you can walk to alot of shops and restaurants in the Condado area. The bar at the pool was under construction while we were there, and that was the only downside. Overall nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: optique
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel. Loved it! First, the beds are the same, reliable, comfy beds that all Marriotts are famous for. The ocean is the same breathtaking turqoise blue as the water in the Bahamas. The hotel itself must have gotten a face lift recently because it is beautiful inside and out. Because Puerto Rico is a US territory, you can drink the water, they use American dollars, and most everyone speaks English. This hotel is situated on a convenient street that has two Walgreens (one in each direction, within easy walking distance), many restaurants to choose from, and a grocery store 2 blocks to the left as you exit the hotel. We never needed a cab or a rental car, as we decided just to lie around and take it easy, and stay in the immediate area. You can go whale-watching at the Rincon lighthouse, and to Old San Juan (just a short bus ride away), and to the rainforest if you want some more adventure. The staff is very professional and courteous. Amazingly so! And we felt very safe there. The best part... totally smoke-free! Even in the casino. And if you like high end shopping, they have Cartier, Louis Vuitton, etc within walking distance to the right as you exit the hotel. Things to be aware of: 1-Try not to stay on the lower floors during the weekend as the band is very loud, but it's fun to watch the locals dancing the salsa and meringue. 2-The ocean is too rough to swim in unless you have a boogie board. Hard to even wade in. Perfect for looking at. Splurge and get an ocean view room. 3- Yes the resort fee is hefty, but you can decline it if you don't want to check emails, or sit on a comfy lounge chair on the beach, or park a rental car. 4-This is a city on the ocean, so be careful when crossing in the middle of the street. They drive aggressively there. 5 There are some homeless people in the city, but they seem harmless. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel! Puerto Rico is alot cheaper than the other islands nearby, and is very convenient because of all the American amenities. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect escape from winter blues”
Reviews.Author: DonMemphis
Reviews.Content: Wonderful friendly staff and great location. We stayed for 7 days at this resort in a corner beach view room. The staff was extremely welcoming and friendly from check-in to check-out. We had a delicious dinner at the Italian restaurant and great drinks by the pool. Look forward to a return visit soon

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families - Can't beat the Beach and Pool”
Reviews.Author: mrdrsput
Reviews.Content: We arrived with our 3 kids (ages 12, 10, and 4) at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino on Monday afternoon, Feb 16 (President's Day), and stayed thru the following Sunday (leaving 6am for a morning flight out). The hotel was 15 minutes from the Airport, and was convenient, and located on a beautiful piece of the Condado Beach. We had 2 rooms (called ahead from the US to ensure we would have a connecting door to our kids room), with a city view. Would have been nice to have the Ocean or Pool view, but it was a packed week, and we used Marriott points for 1 of the 2 rooms. At $266 a night before taxes and fees, it was still pricy to pay for the 1 room, but we needed the space! ROOMS: Rooms were pretty spacious, and we had a pullout chair (converted into a single bed) that we moved into the kids room to have 3 sleeping beds in one room, and my wife and I with the King bed in the connecting room. The rooms were clean, and pretty "vanilla" (not much style to speak of), but we didnt spend a whole lot of time in the rooms. Very comfortable beds to sleep in, and even though our rooms were directly across from the elevators, we never heard the people get on and off the entire week (rooms are surprisingly well insulated against sound). STAFF: The staff was extremely pleasant the entire week, although we did see a shift on the weekend, as the staff seemed overwhelmed on Saturday (when the place was packed, and the music was blaring in the lobby, and the only time we had to fight for chairs by the pool). There is always room for chairs on the beach, but as others have mentioned, it is true that the hotel towers block the sun by the pool, so you may need to shift chairs if you are looking to tan by the pools. POOLS: There are 2 pools - 1 is a 2-foot kiddie pool which my youngest (4 years old) lived in the entire week - first time we were able to sit on the side and watch without having to be in the pool or fear the water was too deep. However, a lifeguard on duty would have been a nice addition! The second pool never got more than about 4.5 feet deep, and had a fun slide the kids enjoyed, and lots of open area and a "swim up bar" for drinks. The pools were unfortunately a little too cold for my taste (again, the shade from the towers kept it cooler), and I was surprised they were not heated - my one wish for the pool area that should get to the corporate office wish list BEACH: The "red flag" was out the entire week, but I believe it is ALWAYS out (must be a liability issue). One day, the waves were VERY calm, and my 2 oldest (12 and 10) were able to boogie board without a problem. One day, the waves were so rough the only ones in the water were surfers. Aside from that day, we were always able to go in at least to ride or jump waves - use your judgement. Very clean beach, combed by a tractor each morning. RESORT FEES: Biggest tip - tell them at check-in you want to "waive the resort fee". At $33 a day, we saved about $200 per room ($400 total for our vacation) by doing this. What do you get for the resort fee? You can check for yourself, but the only item we did NOT get free with our room anyway that appeared on the resort fee list was the $12 umbrella setup on the beach. The 4 days we had our chairs setup for us on the beach, I paid the man who brought out the chairs (which are free) and umbrella $15 cash, so layout the money for the umbrella, and avoid that fee! AREA: We did not find the Condado area "run down", but there was construction a few buildings down the street (probably more hotels). There is a Walgreens 2 streets down, and we stocked up on snacks and water (anything you can purchase in the hotel is half the price at Walgreens!). There were a few good restaurants (see next section), and my kids liked the Haagen Dazs across the street, and the Piu Bella gelato place a few doors down. FOOD: The hotel buffet breakfast was fantastic - while $20 per adult is a bit pricy, it was half-price for kids, and free for under 5 years old, so we thought it was worth it. We tried Danny's for breakfast, but found the service VERY slow, the food not so good, and it was still $40 (and you couldnt get the kinds of fresh fruit and made-to-order omelettes and pancakes and waffles they had at the Marriott). We walked across the street to Camille's to get lunch almost every day (great salads, wraps, and pizza) - check it out as an alternative to the overpriced lunches at the hotel ($14 for a Quesedilla or burger). There are LOTS of great dinner places in Old San Juan, but if you are looking to stay local, we ate at Miros across the street (it was OK), but had a great dinner at the Argentinian Steak House - Ummo - and took a 15 minute walk one night to Aijillo Mojillo for some authentic Puerto Rican comfort food - beautiful place, and gave us an excuse to walk the area). DAY TRIPS: We went to El Yunque on the only rainy day we had (figured the rainforest made sense on that day), and thought of taking the tour - but at $59 and $69 per person, didnt seem to make sense to pay over $300 for the whole family. Instead, we rented a car from the Hertz desk in the hotel, drove at our leisure (not leaving at 7:30am when the trip left), and stopped at the information center where they have maps of the trails and sights. Had a nice day in the rain, and got back in the late afternoon - total cost was $65 for the entire day rental. Another great way to save a bundle! CASINO: Nice little casino - I visited each night, and there was always a spot at the craps table, and if you waited a few minutes, you could get a seat at one of the two $5 Blackjack tables. Saturday night was the only night that got extremely crowded (and they upped the minimum at the craps table to $10), and if you like slots, they seemed to have hundreds of machines - almost half the casino was slot machines! All in all, a very relaxing week, and the hotel is well suited for families. We have been at fancier "resorts" in the Marriott chain, but as long as you set your expectations for a clean, decent room, nice pools and great beach, and only 15 minutes from the airport (to the east) and 15 minutes to Old San Juan (to the west), you should be very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for families with small children”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandFamilyGuy
Reviews.Content: I agonized over which hotel to stay at for our trip to San Juan and I made the right choice. We stayed in room 1221 which had a side view of the beach on the east - really very nice view considering we had booked with "city view" rate that does not guarantee a view. Staff was top notch, maid service excellent, great pool setup for kids - my son is 5 years old and they have a 2 ft deep pool as well as a 3 foot dep pool thathas a slide - very safe and fun for kids. They slide attendants are especially watchful of the kids. Right on the beach which is clean and safe. Condado area is perfect if you are looking to avoid driving - you can have a lot of fun here within walking distance to stores and restaurants - safe area too with nobody harrassing you as can be a problem on some islands. Good restaurants in area include Ummo - good for meat lovers. We ate at the hotel one night and the buffet was well worth the price - about 30 per person and my son had a kid meal which was reasonable. Old san juan can be reached by bus easily for 75 cents - be ready to wait a bit but good was fun for us. We went to el morro castle and also took the free trolley ride around town. A good restaurant in Old town is Raices - local dishes and good service. We took a tour to rain forest which was expensive - could be done easily if you rent a car and go there unescorted for less money but I really did not feel like driving so went for it. It's a good thing to do once but would pass on this when we come back. My only complaint about the trip is that it rained a whole day on our last day and we only got one day that was total sunshine - other days were cloudy for most of the day. I took a look at the La Concha while we were there and this hotel was impressive but a little on the snobbish side - if you are looking for place to stay in the Condado I would go with the Stellaris - THANK YOU

Reviews.Title: “Decent to Nice Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: thesleen
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this property for four nights. We got a fairly decent rate on priceline. We were accomodated for an early check in (by 1 PM) and were given an ocean front corner room. While the room itself was small, it was comfortable and clean with a great view. Housekeeping did a great job, and the rest of the staff was extremely helpful and cordial whenever asked. Also, we had a late flight but was able to check our luggage and freshen up at the hotel spa although we had already checked out. tLobby nice and clean. Pool area clean, but not nearly as large as the website led us to believe. My main complaint is the design of the hotel. You are constantly needing to change your seat to be in the sun. The hotel exterior is also dated. Never really had a problem getting a lounge by the pool or on the beach. Did not eat at the hotel but ate at several locations along Ashford Avenue. We attended a wedding at the El San Juan which was much "swankier" than the Marriott, especailly the Lobby and Pool Area. There is also way more of a scene at these hotels, so it depends what you are looking for. The Marriott is a short cab to Old San Juan (about $15). Overall a great stay, but would probably try another hotel that is geared toward younger couples, as opposed to business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: the2Dacys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before leaving for a cruise. The front desk Staff were very pleasant at check in. We had booked a king room, but due to our flight time we had arrived before 3:00 pm. We opted for a double room so we could go ahead and check in. The room was very clean and very nicely appointed. We had a nice view from our balcony of the beach and pool. We did not swim, but did lay out by the pool. We requested a late check out, but were given a 12:00 pm check out time and were told that our luggage could be stored. Due to the cruise traffic on that Sunday morning, this area was very congested and crowded. When we did go back to claim our luggage, it was much easier and they did get us a cab immediately. We did enjoy our stay and would recommend this hotel to others. It is rather pricey, but it is on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid1
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights and got a "five nights for the cost of four" which included buffet breakfast rate on the Marriott.com website. We have previously spent our time in the Isla Verde area (El San Juan, etc) but found the beach here to be just as enjoyable. The staff at this hotel, and I mean EVERYONE we encountered, were some of the friendliest and most helpful of any hotel we have ever stayed in, worldwide included. Excellent housekeeping in the rooms and throughout the facility. Buffet breakfast offered a wide variety of choices and service was continually outstanding. Lobby area gets busy at night with loud dance music; rooms above were totally quiet. Some have indicated they felt the prices for food are high in the hotel restaurant/snack bar..here's an example: a burger cost $13.00; fries were $4.00 more There are many eating opportunities along Ashford Avenue in both directions and within easy walking distance; Walgreen's is at the corner; Starbucks across the street. Internet service in the room was reliable and fast. Overall an excellent stay and would certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff really made our stay fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: BuenaSucia6
Reviews.Content: We had a girlfriends-only weekend for Super Bowl Weekend. My girlfriends and I are from Miami so our standards for swanky beach resorts are pretty high. I booked a room for my girlfriend and I, but had to take a later flight than her because I couldn't get out of work early. No problem-- my girlfriend was able to check-in early and the front desk guy (super cute) was able to upgrade us to a cabana room with direct access to the pool! As far as the real estate at the pool (not heated) is concerned, yeah you have to get up early to stake your claim on a prime layout spot. However, we had no trouble getting a very nice spot on the relatively large and clean stretch of beach. We did have to move our spot over once or twice because the hotel towers got in the way of the sun, but the beach staff were eager to help you move your lounge chairs wherever you needed. The hotel's location was a pain; it's not really close to any real nightlife. We spent a lot of money taking cabs to other hotels/locations (El San Juan, La Concha, Old San Juan, La Placita, etc.) that had cool lounges and bars with people our age (early 30s). BUT the concierge people were great in recommending places for anything we requested (nightlife, restaurants, etc.). One in particular, Glendaly I think was her name (please give that girl a raise) was absolutely genius in planning out our weekend. She knew exactly what scene we were looking for and recommended places on certain days that were spot on. I was actually good enough to use the fitness center while staying there. It was very well equipped and I was able to get in some very full workouts. Although it would have been nice to have some scenery to look out at while sweating off my mojitos from our nightly romps. I also tried getting some work done using wireless internet access. First off, I was under the impression when I booked the room that the hotel provided free wi-fi. Nope I had to pay $15 for access each day. And I kept losing my signal. It got to the point where I got annoyed and wondered when in the heck I became so dependent on the internet anyway. All in all, this is a great hotel if you have a family (awesome kiddie pool) and aren't into the whole trendy modern chic decor of some other nearby hotels. The nightlife there is for an older, more classic crowd than what we're used to (40s), but the staff is more than willing to guide you in the right direction for whatever your little tropical heart desires.... Oh and if you're into spooky stories....ask a local about the history of the hotel. WARNING: not for the faint at heart.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: talcott1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to our cruise on January 24th. Check in was very efficient and our room was ready and waiting for us when we arrived at 1:00 pm. We were upgraded to an ocean view room. The beach is a little small but not overcrowded during our stay. The pool is nice and loungers were always available. There was no one at the pool bar when we were there and the drinks are fairly expensive. I paid $15 for a Mojito and a diet coke which consisted mainly of ice. Apart from that issue we found the service good. When I asked for some milk for tea the next morning, someone was up to our room within minutes with a small pitcher for my husband. The location is good, we ate dinner a block to the right at Ummo's Restaurant, which serves excellent Argentinian beef. The next morning we had breakfast at Danny's, also a block to the right. There is a Starbuck's across the street (although they ran out of regular tea bags) and a Walmart to the left of the hotel. We took the local bus to OSJ and back again for 75 cents per person, but the driver wanted coin only. I had a dollar bill and two quarters and he would not take the bill. Our room was a corner room and nicely laid out, clean and spacious, with a wonderful comfy bed, typical of most Marriott's. We would stay here again but probably book on points as the hotel is still overpriced even through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Crowded”
Reviews.Author: lookingforculture
Reviews.Content: The room was fantastic, fabulous bed and a great balcony. Unfortunately, the beach and pool areas were overcrowded. We were unable to find a chair by the pool....you must get up early and grab your seats. And chairs are jammed together on the beach. Also, if you love the sun...you will have to keep moving around as it moves behind the buildings and there are large areas in the shade.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sharpenu
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself looked dirty from the outside, although it was better than the buildings in the area. The area it was in is filled with abandoned buildings, and there are numerous homeless people sleeping in doorways in the area. One of the locals told us not to worry about crime in the neighborhood, because the locals only shot and stabbed each other, and left tourists alone. Take that to mean what you will. We were in a corner room, so I will include pictures of the view from our room. Our room was large and clean, as was the remainder of the interior of the hotel. The pool area was nice, and well maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful. The cleanliness of the interior, and the staff are why I give the resort two stars instead of one. Now for the real problems: The bill for my stay was over $980 for two nights (the room was $370 per night for an ocean view, plus $15 to use the internet, and a 23% tax on the hotel bill) After reading the reviews here, I expected a pleasant stay. Instead, I found a hotel that did not have a functioning fire alarm system (the back up batteries were dead, and the system had a supervisory fault- I didn't even have to go looking for it, the panel is next to the elevators) and whose electricity went out for most of our second night. This electrical problem was only our hotel, as the surrounding buildings still had lights on. The power cycled on and off about every 20 minutes from 3:24 a.m. until about 5:00 a.m., and when it did, the fire alarm sounded for a few seconds (no doubt due to the dead batteries). We didn't sleep well at all because of this. When we checked out, the staff offered to discount our room $50, which still meant we paid over $450 per night, which is pretty steep for the quality of this hotel. Either quality need to improve, or price needs to fall, as this hotel is nowhere near being worth that kind of money.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mrtaco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a nice 5 day getaway. The location is excellent, right in Candado with several restaurants very close (a lot cheaper than eating in the hotel btw). The location was also central to other attractions: old san juan, fajardo's bioluminescent bay (try biobaypr.com), isla verde and el yunke. You can gamble inside or walk 5 min down the beach to La Concha or cab it to the Ritz's casinos. Excellent restaurants include: Pamela's and Perla. We had a small issue while we were there and were pleasantly surprised that management took the issue seriously. The entire staff there is very personable and friendly. The only negative I could think of is perhaps the size of the pool (it was very clean) - I think I had a unrealistic expectation of it being enormous :) I also am not a fan of pillow top beds, but my wife found it very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: karenkay1970
Reviews.Content: A great hotel! Being a Platinum guest, I was disapointed to pay an additional $75.00 per night for an ocean front room. Why would I pick a beach front hotel if I wanted to look over the local Taco shack? At the concierge desk Yarmaletta was very helpful, as was Robert at the tour desk. Both very knowledegable and spoke to us whenever we passed. We 'taxied' to the hotel and had many local restaurants within a five to six block walk in either direction. For those die-hards, there is a Starbucks across the steet and a Dunkin Donuts 2 blocks away. Also, several of those tacky little souvenir shops too! While touring, our bus went to many other hotels to pick up fellow tourists, and we found ours to be the only place with multiple restaurants within walking distance. The extra room charge aside, I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone look for an ocean get away!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkelena
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 wonderful days at the Marriott San Juan Stellaris Resort and Casino. We had a glorious time! The hotel is beautiful- we had a corner room on the 10th floor- the smaller terrace faced the ocean- the other large terrace faced the ocean and the city was to our right. The beds were very comfortable. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated It was a pleasure to wake up to the palm trees and water! The staff was some of the friendliest I have ever met. Live music in the lobby every night except Monday and Tuesday. The casino is terrific too. La Vista had a great buffet breakfast. We had a delicious dinner at Tuscany. Treat yourself- go there!

Reviews.Title: “Jan 16, 2009 - Bad start, Wonderful Ending to a 4 night visit”
Reviews.Author: travelgeek3
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research and reading many reviews we booked 4 nights using priceline. We arrived on a Friday night after midnight. We had a guaranteed king/2 double cityview with balcony. We are marriott members and requested a late check-in and room on a high floor prior to check-in. Entering at 1:30AM, the band was playing, people were dancing and, not being able to hear the receptionist, we yelled to her that we wanted a room on a higher floor and wanted to waive the resort fee. She said that the place was totally full and that our room was 301 and it was the only room left. Little did we know this is the WORST room in the entire hotel. Pehaps it's becuase we purchased the room through priceline or perhaps it's becuase we were the last people to check-in, i dono, but we got hosed. The band played till 3am and we were basically sleeping above the band, and could even hear the patrons clapping and laughing. I live in NYC and am used to loud streets and drunk people at night outside my bedroom, but I couldn't sleep a wink with this noise! I called the reception and the night staff person said he had no other room and that he couldn't guarantee anything but he'd request a room change. My husband was ready to fly back home at this point, and I was ready to forgo my money that I paid upfront through priceline and head to another hotel. Not being able to sleep, I was up at 6:30am to open the curtains and see a cement wall and tons of cigarettes that were dropped onto the rooftop that was our "cityview". There was NO balcony. After having to ask for a remote for the TV and a hairdryer (both missing from the room as well a missing chair) I was went to reception at 8:30am. Being nice, I requested a room change. The very nice receptionist offered me to look at another room which was only a few foors up, and with a really crappy cityview. After pondering, I thankfully asked if there was any way to pay for an upgrade. For $25 a night extra we got the most wonderful ocean view room. From then on, we were happy and our vacation finally became fun and worthwhile! Despite having to pay $25 for the room, I was very happy with it! It's too bad they didn't offer any type of reimbursement for our sleepless night, but I wasn't ready to start fighting...i paid up the extra $75 and bit my tounge and figured this is how it is...gone are the days of the customer always being right! So, our room on the 17th Floor was awsome. The pool and hot-tub were wonderful. The location is superb and I would definetely stay here again, if they can guarantee me a tower oceanview room like we had, it was wonderful!!!!!!! I must also add that the staff were great! They were VERY friendly and VERY helpful. It was a pleasure speaking with them and accepting their recommendations. PS - if the manager happens to read this and wants to offer us a credit (would be nice!) we were the suckers that had Room301 Jan 16. If you are the next person to enjoy 301 - tag, you're it!

Reviews.Title: “One Word - Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: JLECT
Reviews.Content: My family recently returned from our 7 day/6 Night stay at the San Juan Marriott & Stellaris Casino Resort in Condado Puerto Rico. This was the 3rd time my wife and I had stayed here, but the first time we brought our children, ages 9 and 5. We just wanted to share with you our thoughts and feelings regarding our trip. Hands down this was the best vacation our family has taken. EVERYTHING about the resort and the staff was tremendous. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel right at home. Even though we arrived before official check-in, a room was ready for us by the time we had finished lunch pool-side at the La Isla Beach Bar. Our waitress Maria was great, friendly and warm. She recommended the Fish and Chips, and my wife loved them! The staff at La Vista Restaurant was tremendous. In particular, Luis Escobar, Sonny and Angel were attentive and friendly, which made spending the inflated resort pricing a bit easier to tolerate. While not big fans in general of buffets, the breakfast buffet here is EXCELLENT. Omelets, waffles, pancakes and eggs made to order, along with all the breakfast meats, breads, fruit you could ask for. The Activities staff was first class as well. While I don't have all the names, Rita, Rose, Edgardo, Richard and Noelia stood out during the week. They were great with the kids, and made the various organized activities enjoyable for our children. While the whole activity staff was great, I do need to specifically call out Rita. At one point, while my wife and I were pool-side, we suddenly saw that Rita was coming down the slide. Rita had been the slide attendant at the top of the slide, watching and regulating everybody as they went down. Now, she herself was on the way down. For a split second I found this amusing, but then I quickly understood why she was coming down..a young child had just gone down the slide, and was in distress. She had panicked when she hit the water and was having trouble swimming. Rita did not hesitate, she was down the slide, fully clothed, shoes and all, in order to literally save that small child. It was amazing! The pool bar staff, Luis D, Carlos, Maria and the rest was also great! Our room was cleaned on schedule everyday. My wife commented that this was the best cleaned room we have had on any of our vacations. There was never a problem when we asked for extra towels or other items. The concierge and front desk staff was helpful and friendly. By the 4th day of the vacation, our children were saying that this trip was better than our Disney Vacation a couple of years ago. The only suggestion I would make concerns the Game Room. The game room needs a serious overhaul. It's in a dingy small room, with only a few video games, and if there are more than 4 people, it is difficult to walk around. Nothing about it makes you want to spend any time, and in turn money in it. We went in, and left pretty quickly. A pool/ping pong table and other items would go a long way here. Otherwise everything about this trip was beyond great. They even took my money at the casino with a smile! Couple items of note: The Hertz desk on site at the Marriott can't actually make a reservation for you. You need to call the 800#. Avoid the restaurant nearby named Buenos Aires. If you want Argentinian BBQ, then go to nearby UMMO! It was excellent! When going into Old San Juan you have to eat at Parrot Club. Avoid the quesadillas pool side: SO NOT worth the $14 charge. Do eat the Fish & Chips, Marriott Burger & Wings. For the kids, the chicken fingers were excellent. For a frozen treat for the kids, the chocolate smoothie was in their words AWESOME!. Thank you to the whole staff of the San Juan Marriott for starting our New Year off with a perfect vacation!

Reviews.Title: “An Attitude Adjustment needed”
Reviews.Author: Cooking-teacher
Reviews.Content: Some of the front desk people at the Marriott -- and the consierge staff need a bit more training. As a Marriott silver member who made the reservation using points and paying to upgrade I did not appreciate making to feel like a cheapskate when I checked in. The front desk clerk had an attitude that could be cut with a knife. When she finally agreed to give us a king sized bed it was the smallest room on the floor judging by the floor map posted on our door. Really an unfortunate experience way to arrive in what is a most pleasant hotel. The rest of the staff were friendly and professional. The hotel's location on the beach cannot be beat. There are lovely tennis courts right there with a very modest fee to use. The neighborhood has lots of lovely places to eat. The small Italian cafe across the street was a jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spot for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: binti
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place for a long weekend get-away from the cold! Our corner room with two balconies was lovely, bright, and clean. We found the staff friendly and very accomodating. The pool area was very nice, and the beach chair service was excellent. Overall, I would highly recommend for a long weekend or a cruise overnight. Many positives outweigh the negatives, but there were a couple of things I think they could improve. Umbrellas are needed at the pool area. The pool and beach waiters for drinks and food was sparce. Of course you can walk up to the bar, but it's crowded, and staff chatting amongst themselves not very responsive. We also encountered discrepancies with drink prices over the course of our stay, and the drink prices are typical resort, quite high. We were shooed away from the beach bar our first night at 7:00pm. There is no other area to have a drink outdoors other than the pool. Minor compared to the overall quality of stay, but worth noting for future travelers who enjoy upscale pool and beach accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with some need to change”
Reviews.Author: shellyf
Reviews.Content: The Good The place is in an excellent location right in the heart of Condado. Many stores and restaurants are nearby. It is very well maintained and the staff is truly helpful and polite. Rooms are cleaned quickly and the 4 elevators are very fast. They have a live Latin band in the lobby from Wednesdays through Saturday eves and locals as well as guests dance the night away to great sounds. The pool is big and the beach is just steps away. Thereâ€™s an outdoor shower at the entrance/exit to the beach, which allows for quickly washing the sand off of you. Towels are plentiful. The gym is well outfitted with about 5 treadmills, several elliptical & other machines, stair masters and free weights. The later you go, the easier to get your equipment. The hotel has a coffee bar in the lobby, which serves cold cereal, bagels and cream cheese, various sandwiches and pastries and yogurt all for about half the price of the in-house Vista restaurant. If you donâ€™t want the big breakfast, this is the place to go. The Bad The hotel rips you off to the tune of a $33 per day â€œResort Fee.â€� This is what you get for your $33: in room coffee (who wants to make your own when on vacation?), 1 hour per day free use of the internet in the Business Center, (thanks, but most people have their own computer), complimentary beach chairs and umbrellas, (I refused the resort fee and got my beach stuff every day. Just tip the guy and youâ€™re in.), Free local calls. (Most people have their own cell phones), 2 free small bottles of water in the room. (We bought a case of 12 oz water bottles at the Walgreenâ€™s across the street for 3 bucks), one $5 coupon per day for 2 days of match play at the casino tables but you must bet $5. (I just dallied at the machines). You can refuse the resort fee at check-in. I did without any hassle to my vacation. To accentuate the rip off, the fee does NOT include free Marriott Internet service in your room using your own computer. They charge $14.95 per 12 hours for that! Not to worry. Just click on the network button in your control panel and youâ€™ll find other choices than the Marriott. Try the Nitro connection; it was excellent. I used my computer every day, whenever I wanted and never paid a penny. Right across the street is Miro restaurant, an excellent fish place that was so good we ate there twice. About 2 blocks to the left, as you exit the hotel is Ummo, an Argentinean steak place I found in these pages. It is excellent and fairly priced. I tried the skirt steak and it was tender and flavorful. Others in my party had the 1 lb. Porterhouse and said it was good too. We took a cab ($12 set fee) to Old San Juan. It is a charming place with many restaurants and shopping. We had dinner at The Parrot Club; fair prices and very good food. (Tip: ask the bell staff at the hotel how much is cab fare to wherever you are going. Once you know, confirm it with the cabbie to avoid being overcharged when you donâ€™t make your deal beforehand.) Big Splurge: Pikayo Restaurant, about a 5 minute cab ride. Located in the Puerto Rican Museum of Modern Art, this beautiful restaurant is the best on the island. It offers a continental menu with some Puerto Rican specialties (the rice & beans were the best I've had) at New York prices. Service is superb as is the food. Tip: when they offer you specialties, ask how much? Most of the entres are $25-42 but specialties can run $80!!! The cheapest rental car place is right across the street in a little kiosk. Its called Charlieâ€™s Rental Car. You can rent for a day or more for excellent prices. Get their website by googling them. There's a Starbucks across the street but i found a Dunkin' Donuts place about 3 blocks down to the right. There's also a Haagen Daz place across the street and we saved money each eve by not buying dessert at a restaurant and coming to this place for their great ice cream. All in all it was a good vacation but Marriott needs to offer free internet service in the rooms and cut out the resort fee. They allow free internet in their mainland hotels and don't charge a resort fee; why not in their Puerto Rico property???

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, but some issues”
Reviews.Author: srtram
Reviews.Content: Overall the Marriott is a very nice, clean hotel. It's in a great location, and the beach and pool areas are very nice. In addition, the Tuscany Restaurant is very good. The room was average, but had a nice ocean view. There were some problems with our stay, though. The bathroom door wouldn't stay closed, but they did come and fix this soon after it was reported. Information wasn't communicated as well as possible, though. On New Year's Eve, people staying at the hotel needed to obtain bracelets to allow them back into the hotel at night without paying a door fee. We only found out about this by overhearing people in the elevator, as there was no information posted anywhere in the hotel about it. In addition, we heard that an inauguration in Old San Juan was closing streets there. When we asked the concierges about it, they had no idea. We went into the city that day and had to leave by 2 because the streets were closing. The concierges should have known about this. Finally, the night before we were checking out we requested a late check out. They said it would be no problem, but to call whenever we woke up to confirm. When we called the next morning, they said a late check out was not available. If they had told us this was a possibility, we would have woken up earlier to get some more beach time in. These aren't major issues, but were disappointing nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Time of our lives”
Reviews.Author: shaggydoug17
Reviews.Content: I went to this resort about 6 months ago with 10 of my best friends from high school and it was honestly the best experience ever. The hotel is absolutely stunning. The rooms were great and the pillows were honestly some of the best I have ever slept on. Also, we had a balcony overlooking the ocean and that was definitely worth the extra $20/night. The beach also is a ton of fun. Lots of waves and plenty of sun to keep everyone happy. The casino is not huge, but it is definitely a ton of fun and I recommend it to everyone. Also, definitely go into Old San Juan and go to some bars. Our favorite was Marias and the locals at the bars were great and fun to talk to.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Helene W
Reviews.Content: My husband, 6 year old daughter and I stayed here for 6 nights at the end of December 2008. After some initial annoyances, we could not get into our room until 4:00 pm even though we had requested an early check-in for a 1:00 arrival and the hotel sought to charge us an exhorbitant daily rate for a roll away bed for our daughter (which they did agree to waive since we had no notification of these charges) we had a lovely stay. We booked a city view room at got a corner room with a king size bed (ending in 23) with 2 terraces, one overlooking the city and the other overlooking the ocean. The room was clean, bright and sunny and the housekeeping staff was excellent coming early in the morning and coming back promptly if you we were not ready for them. One night my daughter got sick in our bed around midnight and housekeeping was up in 3 minutes to completely replace our bedding (blankets and all) quickly and efficiently. The pool area is nice with a large wading pool for children about 4 years old and younger with a fountain in the middle and the deeper pool with a water slide. The water slide was open 11-4 most days which was ample time for my daughter to go down at least 25 times a day. The pool was not heated and I was very happy my daughter was occupied so I did not have to stand in the freezing water. The hot tub was nice seating about 8-10 people. Like many resorts with tall high-rises all of the chairs in the pool area are in the shade for at least half of the day. There was at least one activity every day for the kids by the towel stand (hula hoop contest or painting ceramics) which was a nice free activity around lunch. My daughter especially liked the cookie decorating around 2 pm. The beach was very nice. The water was very warm with a nice blue green carribean color. Although the red flag was up at the hotel every day we were there, we were able to wade in a few feet and not be bothered by the waves. The sand on the beach was clean and because of the ample shade you did not have to rent umbrellas (chairs were provided by the hotel for free). The hotel had pails and shovels for the kids to borrow along with some board games. We only had breakfast in the hotel once and it was your typical large Marriot buffet, it was nice to sit outside in a screened in dining area and look out at the ocean. We usually had breakfast at Danny's down the block who made excellent pancakes and eggs for breakfast and pizza for lunch and dinner. We also enjoyed the Chinese/Japanese restaurant in the hotel which has upscale Chinese food, a sushi bar and hibatchi tables. There is plenty of fast food within walking distance, Starbucks, Haagen Daz and a gelato store (Pia Bella) directly across the street and Dunkin Donuts, Baskin Robbins, Subway and Wendys within 3 blocks. There is a significant homeless problem in the area and it was not unusal to see a half a dozen homeless people sitting on the streets with cups out in front of stores. None of them were intrusive or menacing. We rented a car one day to drive to El Yunke (the rain forest) and found out that the guided tours there were not offered on Monday or Tuesday but at the information center we were given excellent maps and truly enjoyed driving up to the tower and water falls. It is truly magnificent. On the way back we stopped at a large indoor outlet mall that included stores like Polo, Guess, Nautica and Gap. Overall we had an excellent time and would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend get-away”
Reviews.Author: LoveLabsCt
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were very clean and the grounds exceptionally clean. The staff all seemed very attentive. The concierge seemed a bit overwhelmed at times with the number of requests though. Perhaps additional staff (more than 2) would help this. The beds were extremely comfortable as well. We were there for a long weekend, so while the restaurant food was pricey, it was good and service excellent. If I were there longer, I might have ventured out more. The only two complaints I had were the elevators (long waits at certain times of the day) and the fact that the whirlpool was not montiored for small children coming into it (sign there clearly states 12 and over). Small children would come in with their floatation tubes and toys - not what I would call relaxful. Some staff even waved at the children on the way by? Other than those two minor points, the beach was beautiful and the hotel perfect for a a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: snorkeltime
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for our 20th anniversary in October 2008 for 5 days. Overall we really enjoyed our stay. 1) I had ordered a wine and cheese basket for our arrival - this was brought up soon after we got to our room. Very nice selection of cheeses and crackers plus a bottle of good wine. The price even with the surcharges seemed less to me than we could have bought all the items ourselves. Very nice indeed! 2) The room was clean with a nice balcony and beautiful view. We did have to wait a while for the elevators but oh well. Housekeeping was plentiful and very attentive to our needs. 3) The beach was nice - lounge chairs were set out for us immediately without us asking. Servers were plentiful. The surf itself was pretty rough but we found that it was more manageable a short walk down the beach toward the Rennassaince. Still to rough to snorkel though. Our only compalint was the crowded pools and broken hot tub.4) We don't really gamble but had some fun playing in the casino and everyone was very helpful. 5) The area where the hotel is seems to be making a comeback. Still some seedy spots mixed with really nice areas. We walked around alot and felt safe with just two of us. We did however make sure to avoid dark walkways and stay on the main strip at night.. Old San Juan was a short cab ride away and where we spent most of our time. We felt completely safe day and night in old San Juan exploring many nooks and crannies. Overall a wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for Business”
Reviews.Author: RJMGreenwich
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for only one night on business trip. I have stayed at a few hotels in the Ashford Street area and this is by far the best. The outside of the hotel looks older and worn, but once inside looks good. Lobby is updated and nice bar at night. Rooms too look recently updated with flat panel TVs, new bedding, good work space and large enough bathroom. I was very comfortable and enjoyed working a bit in the room with a nice view of the pool and ocean. Service is good and food was fine. Hotel is well located near good places to eat and walk around. I highly recommend this hotel for a business trip or stop on vacation (if Puerto Rico is your destination).

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: gruvtrtl2
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre-cruise at the Marriott. We always have a great experience and this is our favorite hotel in San Juan. We booked through Priceline. We had a really nice room that overlooked the pool and had an ocean view. It's too bad it rained the whole time we were here. The location is great, the beach is nice, the staff always go above and beyond, the rooms and public areas are always clean and nicely maintained. You just can't beat the Marriott in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Get Room On High Floor”
Reviews.Author: RyryE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned from a four-night stay at the San Juan Marriott and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The property is in great shape and is nicer than most Marriott properties that I have been at in the continental United States. The room was not huge, but there was plenty of room with the king bed, chair and small table. Also, the hotel had ample closet and storage space for a long vacation. The only thing that kept me from making this a '5-star' review was some of the noise that we experienced. When we checked in, we were offered a room on the 17th floor with two double beds or one on the fifth with a king bed. We chose the lower and were at first very satisfied (we don't care too much about the view). The problem came on Friday and Saturday night when there was live music from the lobby bar. Even though we were on the fifth floor, it carried clearly up to our room. On Saturday night, the band was scheduled to play until 3 a.m., and the noise was loud enough that it kept us awake. This would not be enough to dissuade me from staying here again, but I would definitely for a room on a higher floor. We spent hours on the beach in front of the hotel each day, although we did not go into the water too much. The temperature of the water was great (in the 80s during December), but it was rougher than we expected. The waves were no different than what you see on a typical Mid-Atlantic beach in New Jersey, Delaware or Maryland, but it was not what we though it would be when compared to many other destinations in the Caribbean. The hotel has staff available to bring out beach chairs (comfortable), but you have to rent umbrellas for $12/day. We ended up not paying the rental fee because in December, the hotel and neighboring buildings provide a considerable amount of shade. We did not use the pool other than to stick our feet in, but there were great lounge chairs, and the area was nice. One of the things that we did not care for about the resort was that we felt a bit nickel-and-dimed. A good example would be the umbrellas, but for the price that we paid for the room, I would have thought that some more would be included. We also requested a two-hour late checkout on our final day. I was told that even as a Marriott Rewards member, I would have to pay a charge of $25 of the daily rate to spend two additional hours. I've never encountered anything like this at other Marriott properties I've stayed at. We did not eat at the restaurants, nor did we have many drinks from the hotel bars. Everything was very expensive and did not seem worth the money at the hotel. The property is in a great location where you can walk short distances to many restaurants and cafes. There is also a Walgreens (out the front of the hotel and a block to the right) that we visited to buy some food for quick and easy breakfasts. While we spent most of our time at the resort, we went into Old San Juan for a day. The city has a great bus system that has a stop directly in front of the hotel (out the front door and about 200 feet to the right). I believe it was buses C53 and B21 that went to Old San Juan.
