While the buses do not run as frequently as in major U.S. cities, we did not have a terrible wait to and from Old San Juan. The bus was not overcrowded and seemed very safe and clean... and free! All, in all, this was a very good property and certainly is up to Marriott standards. We would stay here again and would recommend it to others, too.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EKHMobileYachts
Reviews.Content: My family and I were so impressed with this hotel; it was everything you would imagine a Caribbean resort would be. The hotel was clean and just gorgeous; the view magnificent; the staff was so efficient; everyone was so pleasant and always eager to help. My ten year old daughter was taught one new word in Spanish everyday by one of the fabulous employees who greeted us morning, noon and night. We own our own business and we pride ourselves on customer service, this way of thinking has excelled our business into a very profitable venture. I was so pleased to see and feel the hotels desire to provide excellent customer service at every turn they are the most customer conscious resort I have ever stayed in. We have traveled quite a bit, but this was our first trip to Puerto Rico. The way we were treated at the hotel and how beautiful everything was has encouraged us to return quickly. We are already planning to head back to the exact hotel and location within the next three months. Thank you Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino for an outstanding vacation! Michelle H

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: drTX2
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two children aged 5 and 6 stayed here for 2 nights before catching a cruise. We thought it was a nice place, probably the nicest in San Juan and liked the location. The taxis in San Juan are fairly safe and easy to work with, they are called Taxi Touristico and have set prices. It was about a 20 min drive from the airport and cost us about $15 to get there. Check in was easy and our room was ready. They offered us a different room in the newer tower for $25 more but we saw our booked room and liked the view and found both to be about the same so we stayed with the original room. The rooms are clean, well-decorated and we had a wonderful view of the ocean from the 19th floor. I am really picky about the bathroom and found that the bathroom was really spotless! Nice toiletries from Bath and Body Works, granite countertops and white tubs without any mold or mildew, and very spacious. The room also had an iron and an umbrella which comes in handy in a place like San Juan. We loved the soft beds and pillows. The maid service was also good and had our room cleaned in a timely manner. We used the pools and jacuzzi which had just been fixed. The pools are a little shady and cool but that was our only option since the waves are rough on the beach. It is a very nice beach to take a walk but would not recommend for swimming with young families. Also the waterslide at the pool is only open at certain times. We heard that Luquillo beach near the rainforest is nice but could not make it there due to the short duration of our trip. We did use the gym at the hotel which was very clean and up to date. They have nice cool towels to wipe down with after your workout and have water and teas to drink. The only downside is you can only use the treadmill for 30 min before it starts to shut down. I think they are programmed this way. We did not have any problems with noise from the lobby or hallways at night. We did not use the casino much as this was not our interest. The weather was gorgeous and we preferred to be out. We did not eat at the hotel because it was overpriced and there are so many options just outside this hotel. Starbucks and Hagen-Daas is right across the street as well as a sandwich shop and a taco chain. Down the street on the right there is Tiajuana's which is a Mexican chain and Danny's International which is a nice italian restaurant with awesome pizza. There are lots more restaurants if you keep walking but we did not need to. Danny's also served up a good breakfast. On the left is Walgreen's which sells everything you might ever need. We brought some cereals from home and just went and bought milk from Walgreen's and put it in the fridge in our room so that we didn't have to run out in case the kids wanted breakfast or a snack. There is also a grocery store in walking distance on the right of the hotel. The bus stop is just outside the hotel and buses are free until Jan. You take C10, B21 or C53 to Old San Juan. From there you catch the green tourist bus or the open trolley bus (still free) and can go through Old San Juan and even to the two forts. Lots of restaurants in Old San Juan and shopping. Near the Sheraton at the pier there are lots of tents with street vendors if you like that type of market. We went to El Morro Fort which is worth seeing. Costs $3 per adult to enter and you can walk through it in about 30 min. It was no problem for the kids to walk through it. Check out from the hotel is at noon. They let us extend to 1 pm which was fine for us because we went to the pier after check out. It cost about $12 and was about 10 min away. We called for the Bellman to take our luggage on the way out but he never showed up so we just walked down with our luggage and saved ourselves $5! The only other problem we had was a charge on our bill for use of Games on the TV which we had to call the front desk to remove THREE times and they finally did on check out. It was not a big problem, just an annoyance because each time we called they said they would take care of it and never did. They do charge you a "resort fee" of $12 per day but that is just one of the things you have to pay if you stay at this place. Overall, we had a fun couple of days in San Juan and would stay at the Marriott again if we went back. It was relaxing and convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy029
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch hotel, very clean, service is extremely nice, great security excellent all around stay. The staff could not be nicer, and the facilities are great. There are plenty of restaurants in the area so no need to always eat in. HOWEVER, the one big complaint is the filthy condition of the Condado in San Juan which is the area where the hotel is located. The town of San Juan adds a $5 per person per day occupancy fee over and above the already 23% tax per day on the room!! This fee is suppose to be to pay for upkeep etc. of the area. Well, someone is not doing their job. The streets are littered with debris, the sidewalks are broken, and if you are not constantly looking down, you may break a leg or trip. It is so dirty, I was appalled. Where is the oversight for this area, and the mayor of the town, that I understand was just re-elected, is a very poor manager. This area should be impecable, this is your bread and butter. What a disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: alina987
Reviews.Content: The Mariott on Condado beach was relatively on par with our expectations. Great rooms, a bit tired lobby, nice beach area, and very shallow pools. Beachside restaurant managed to undercook our burger. There is a starbucks accross the street, and an excellent Catallan seafood restaurant Miro. Overall, its a nice hotel if you want to feel like you have never left the US and have come here with kids. The beach area by the Mariott is probably the best on all of Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get any better!!”
Reviews.Author: kgee19
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. So many resturants and eateries outside of the hotel. There is a 24hr Walgreens down the block from the hotel. The hotel is located on Ashford Ave. and it is safe to walk around outside. The bus stop is just down the block from the hotel. Thhe buses were free when I went during the end of november. The hotel was very clean and all the staff members were nice and helpful. Our room was always well cleaned. We had a nice balcony with a ocean view. The bed was so comfortable. The pool was nice and clean, hot tub was fun too!! They had a mini water slide. The beach was clean but the waves were to rough.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: ryjess
Reviews.Content: I want to tell anybody who is a little weary about booking this hotel not to be. This place was beautiful. It's was very clean, food was good, and the service was great. We stayed here for an entire week and never had a problem. Two of the employees here were extremely helpful gave us advice and info before we even asked. Alex the doorman and security and Carlos the bartender. I also want to mention that I have had massages before but I thought what the heck I'll try one here at the marriot and I couldn't have been more satisfied Lourdes has magic hands I almost had a hard time going back to normal life. There were 6 of us in my group 2 children and and 4 adults and we all hand a great time. We were never uncomfortablr no matter where we went. We took the public transportation most of the time and its free. The b21 bus comes about once and hour right outside the hotel. We also took a catamiran trip from Farjado to snorkel and sail for the day it was without a doubt the best trip I have ever taken. The compant was eastwind excursions. Try it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DesWed
Reviews.Content: I just became a Trip Advisor member as of today, this being the reason my review is a little late. My fiancÃ© and I stayed at this resort in August, and I just had to post a review to let everyone know how great it was! From the moment we walked through the doors, we were greeted by every staff member we passed! Everyone was so friendly, and willing to help you with anything! The pool was nice, but we spent all of our time at the beach, which was gorgeous! Be careful venturing out too far in the water as the current is very strong. The staff waits on you out on the sand, bringing tropical drinks, beer buckets, lunch, etc. The hotel is kept very clean, and everything is very modern. The cleaning crew was great; we always had a clean room, clean bathroom, and plenty of clean towels every day. The hotel is in a great location as well, we were able to walk to lots of great shops and delicious restaurants. I would recommend going outside the resort for food, try Ajili Mojili...great Puerto Rican food and very nice! We rented a car for about $40 and dove to El Yunque rainforest, and then drove a short distance from there to the bioluminescent bay to kayak...both are a must in Puerto Rico! San Juan is beautiful, and I would recommend anyone going to stay at the Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FemaleFirefighter
Reviews.Content: This was a trip to celebrate my retirement and 3 other friends came along we all loved this Hotel. It's why I always try to stay at Marriotts. Yhe Hotel was right on the beach, very nice clean beach I could have stayed right there the whole trip. The resturant food was great, and the rooms were clean, roomy, and very comfortable. I will tell all my friends about this Hotel and I will celebrate my Birthday there next year.

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Yeadonite
Reviews.Content: My friend and I got the hotel via Priceline, not that much cheaper than if we booked it ourselves. We were treated like first class guest. We had a beautiful room that was CLEANED everyday (hotel management room 906). Never once do you have to open a door the staff will run to get it. When your taxi doesnt appear in 1 minute the bell men will make sure it comes. We had a 9 PM flight and asked what we should do we got a one hour later checkout and we also were told to enjoy the pool and shower in the Spa. IF Cyndi Lauper could stay there why can't I? I also liked the casino since it had 1 cent slots.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place !!!”
Reviews.Author: TSTBlondie
Reviews.Content: Again, I never leave reviews for anything - I did however use TripAdvisor to help plan this trip, so thought it was time to return the favor to all other TripAdvisor users !!! That said, I LOVED the Marriott - this place was spectacular !!! My corner room had 2 HUGE balconies - one overlooking the city, the other the ocean !!! The staff were just superb - everywhere I went, they were all saying hello and asking if there was anything I needed - for a moment, I almost thought I was a celebrity !!! :) I did order room service and it arrived in a short amount of time and was great, considering it was only soup and sandwich !!! Great location right on the beach and close to alot of restaurants. They were fixing the whirlpool while I was there which I was a little upset about, but who cares - its hot anyways, right !!! :) We utilized the Hertz rental car facility located in the lobby of the hotel - superb staff and a GREAT deal on a Toyota Camry !!! I highly recommend driving to the rainforest - its only about 30-45 minutes from the hotel and is well worth the drive. If my travels send me back to San Juan, I will DEF be choosing the Marriott Stellaris again !!! Thanks Marriott for a phenomenal adventure during my first visit to San Juan !!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PR-JAM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott hotel after checking out of a nearby one that was filthy. I loved it the minute I pulled up to the front door. The service was great. The hotel was spotless with a large pool area along with wet bars and a convenient walkway onto the beach that included an attendant and a security guard for whatever the guests may need. The staff was especially friendly and the hotel's lounge had live entertainment 5 nights a week. As for location it is right in the heart of the action of Condado beach surrounded by great restaurants and clubs. During my stay I decided that I would lodge at this hotel every time that I visit Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort”
Reviews.Author: shells7
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonder vacation in San Juan, Puerto Rico. The Marriott was outstanding!! Excellent service, very clean rooms, the grounds, and the people. The staff was very friendly. I think that they work round the clock to make everyone happy and very comfortable. The food was wonderful. I look forward to returning to Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: tolland27
Reviews.Content: This is a well-maintained property that caters to families, couples and business people. Our king-size bed was comfortable with high-end Marriott bedding -- lots of those special pillows that you can now purchase commercially. Our room was slightly smaller than others -- possibly because of the big bed but was not a problem for the two of us. We paid more for ocean-view and it was well-worth it because we spent a good deal of time on the balcony. The room was well-appointed with pretty art and a large flat screen television. Bathroom was clean although a bit small. Our ac worked but it took time to get the moisture out of the room. I don't fault the system -- this is the Caribbean and I have stayed in other hotels where the ac needs time to get rid of the humidity. My wife and I used the beach where an attendant set up chairs and an umbrella as well as the pool. The pool has a supervised water slide -- great for kids. This was off-season so I cannot comment on the usage. Bar personnel did patrol both the pool and the beach. Staff on this property was helpful and friendly. The hot tub was under repair -- boarded over, so it was difficult to tell if and when it will return to use. Food was hotel-priced but there is a coffee bar in the lobby for light breakfast takeout and a Starbucks and Duncan Donuts across the street. There are take-out alternatives and fast food as well as some very good restaurants along Ashford Avenue. Every three months (we were told), the road is closed down for Friday, Saturday and Sunday evenings for a huge block party. Restaurants brings out tables, and bands -- salsa, jazz, even a mariachi -- play. Quite the scene and a lot of fun. Other amenities: The front lobby has a high noise level as it includes a very large bar and music/dance area. The casino is right off the lobby and was very busy while we were there. There were lots of gambling alternatives -- slots and tables and lessons are offered by the hotel. We also booked a tour to the El Yunque rainforest with a knowledgeable guide. I thought it was good value -- $53 for a 4-5 tour. I have stayed in Miramar, Isla Verde as well as Condado, mostly on business. While Isla Verde has some very nice hotels and is closer to the airport, I found the Candado presented some alternatives to hotel eating that happened to be very good. In all I would certainly recommend this hotel for families, couples, and parents with teens.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Mediocre Beach”
Reviews.Author: DeckergbIV
Reviews.Content: 1. Staff. The staff was great especially Wesley he greeted us when we arrived and really made us feel welcomed. He also gave us some really helpful tips to help get the most out of our great trip to San Juan. 2. Cleanliness. This might just be the cleanest and well maintained hotels that I have stayed in for quite sometime I was really impressed. 3. Location. Located right in the middle of Condado, In just a short walk you have quite a few places to eat, grab a drink and even a Walgreens. On the weekends the street in front of the hotel shuts down and there are people everywhere with live music, bands and djs elegant and casual its great. Oh and bus stop is right in front of the hotel it was free for us due to elections but in any case its only 50cent a fraction of a cab and really almost as fast to Old San Juan. 4. Beach. Well its clean the waters warm and the sand is soft but its a real treacherous place to swim with hard shore pounding waves and lots of body boarders. The beach lounge chairs are comfortable. If you don't like the sand the pool is relaxing and it even has a slide. 5. Overall It gets 4 stars because the beach is not the best if your looking for the beach go to Isla Verde its much better but if you want to be near old San Juan but still enjoy the ocean this is a great place right in the middle of it all. FYI: If you are looking to rent a car walk up Ashford Ave a little past the La Concha Hotel to 1050 Ashford Ave Condado, Puerto Rico 00907 call [--]. Amazing service the counter manager really helped us out and gave us a great price about 1/2 of what you would pay at the hotel and took care of our parking ticket too.

Reviews.Title: “We will back...”
Reviews.Author: Gr8Nancy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived Oct 10 and stayed through Oct 18. Except for a little too much rain we had a great time. The employees at this Marriott are outstanding, expecially the bell stand - Jose Reyes in particular. Everyone was pleasant with smiles and a helpful attitude at all times. There are some nice restaurants in the area, especially to the left ot the hotel. Danny's Restaurant and Tijuana's were two of our favorites. We plan to come back to the Mariott since our stay was so relaxing. We highly recommend a visit to the forts in Old San Juan and to the Bacardi Rum Factory.

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: Twinsmom153
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Mariott. The price was very reasonable as it was low season, being Oct. The weather was a bit rainy but it was warm and we managed. My husband and children loved the riding the waves. If you don't like that though you may find the water too rough for you. It's not the calm waters of the Caribbean you may be expecting. The kids liked the water slide. The breakfast buffet was just ok, but we loved the dinner buffet. The lobby wasn't impressive at all. You sort of walk right into a bar with a ton of seating. Between that and the roping for the front desk it's awkward to get to the elevators. Service was good overall, and the beds were very comfortable. The location was ok, but the buildings nearby looked really shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip to San Juan”
Reviews.Author: we5hills
Reviews.Content: I checked Trip Advisor before I chose this hotel. My family decided to go October 1, 2008 as a family/birthday vacation. Most of the reviews were good. Someone on tripadvisor had suggested taking a Catamaran cruise using Eastwind Excursions. I checked out Eastwind online, called and made reservations for 4 people. This was by far one of the best things we did. My kids are 9 and 11 and loved snorkeling for the first time. We also got to see and swim in one of the top 10 best beaches in the world. It was breathtaking. I highly recommend this excursion. The hotel was another story. The hotel is very nice and the room was clean, staff was somewhat friendly. The lady at the information desk (how to get to Old San Juan) was very matter of fact and probably wasn't having a good day. The hot tub was not working and that was very disappointing. We were there for 5 days and it was out of service the entire time. I will say the kid's pool was nice and the slide was great for the kids. It was nice being on the beach, the tide was rough but it was very convenient to be steps away from the beach. The price of food and drinks were overpriced. $13.00 for a hamburger and $10 for an alcohlic drink, $4.00 for a USA Today newspaper. We ate across the street for breakfast and grabbed lunch at area restaurants. We loved Puerto Rico and will be back, but not back to the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: frito58
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 days pre-cruise and 1 day post. We were treated as if we had booked the penthouseand stayed a month. The staff was the nicest I have ever encounterd in all my years of traveling. The pool area is beautiful and the beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept on. Got a great deal on priceline and on our post stay we arrived at 9:30 am and they promptly checked us in and had a room availalabe. I would love to go back and stay a week its a great location with lots of places to eat within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: lgellert
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had the luxury of tagging along with my mother as she went to Puerto Rico for a business trip. We expected to be treated like another member of the business group, but instead were pleasantly surprised when instead we were treated like honeymooners. We were upgraded to a wonderful corner room where we had views of the beach and the city. The restaurants on site are not the best, but the staff offers great recommendations for eating out in Old San Juan and there are some great smaller less touristy spots right around the hotel. The beach was wonderful with plenty of chairs and umbrellas, but unfortunately the pool area fills up a little quickly and was dominated by the younger generations. The lack of a deep end made it difficult to really get a relaxing swim, especially when the ocean was too rough for anything more than playing and body surfing. We definitely spent our fare share of time in the casinos and enjoyed a wonderful message on location. All in all we had a wonderful time thanks to the great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok - No Wine and Cheese”
Reviews.Author: babie22559
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino in San Juan on Aug 30-31. We had no trouble checking in. The hotel charges a parking fee â€“ be aware just in case you rent a car. I had read reviews about folks being served rum punch upon check in. There did not appear to be any punch being served, so I asked about it. The front desk clerk was very polite. She indicated since the lobby wasnâ€™t very busy, punch was not being served. Instead, she said she would have wine and cheese sent to our room. Naturally, I was delighted. After several hours and two phone calls to the front desk, we never received the wine and cheese. I thought it was a sure thing too, especially since we use Marriott ALL THE TIME for our hotels. Too bad; I was really looking forward to it. Overall, the hotel is very nice and the pool area was clean. There is a lot of shade, but thatâ€™s not a problem for my husband and I, as we burn easily. The casino was fun. The blackjack was at $5 minimums during our visit. The craps pit opened in the evenings, but the minimum was $10; too high for us as we both like to play. If you want a pre-made pina colada, itâ€™s not hard to get in the casino. I asked for a rum and coke and it took forever. My husband received three pre-made pina coladas in the time it took me to receive one rum and coke (and we were both tipping). Service was too slow. Although we had a nice time, I donâ€™t think I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a huge disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: Ochavo
Reviews.Content: Considering the amount of money they charge per night you should not be subjected to constant harassment on the beach by vendors. One vendor kept trying to sell us her buttered rolls; a coconut ice-cream vendor camped out on a lounge chair under an umbrella and there were none available for us,; a sleazy masseuse kept trying to offer free massages to young woman laying around on the beach, he even massaged and felt one up next to us; the Marriott waiter was to busy hitting on the female customers sunning on the beach and the rest of staff didnâ€™t care about what was going on, most of them busy on their cell phones; also many locals kept sneaking onto the beach resort from between buildings and camping out; no one at Marriot did anything about this. In the entrance, doorman were to busy clowning around and chatting to hold any doors open, we watched a family with kids and baggage struggle when they arrived while the doorman clowned around just four feet from them. Behind the front desk a man and woman from Marriott kissed each other! What the heck??? When the elevator opened Marriot people would shove their way in before customers could even get out! Marriott people clowning around in the hallway and throwing things almost knocked me down. The pool was overcrowded (vendors were there to), and some rooms by the pool had about twelve people in it. We left the place in shock. Having stayed at other Marriot Resorts and Ritz-Carltons we were in shock. On the plane back to the states other couples that had stayed there also were complaining about the resort. It became the joke of the return flight!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay...Wonderful Hotel...Would go Back”
Reviews.Author: Socaltrvlr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in August and this Marriott exceeded all of our expectations. First off, we upgraded to an ocean view room and the view was amazing. Our balcony was great. The rooms were extremely clean (we are very picky) and the beds were amazingly comfortable. The lobby was grand and the bar had a good vibe every night. Staff was super friendly. The coffee shop was great. We had dinner at the Italian restaurant on our first night and the food/wine was excellent. A little pricey but well worth it. That was the only meal we had at the hotel. The spanish tapas place across the street, Miro's was absolutely incredible food. Plus the bar outside was nice at night and food served late. The argentine steakhouse Umo's down the street was also great! Wonderful parrillada (mixed bbq). The beach at this hotel was great! No rocks or rough water. Super nice...we never hit the pool because the beach was so nice. Tour desk had good tours of puerto rico. We would stay here again in a hearbeat. We've traveled all over and this was our best experience with a hotel yet. Great location...always have the option to travel to Old San Juan for more night life but coming home every night to the Marriott was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Marriot Stellaris Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: marisolNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I am puerto rican born and raised in new jersey, and everytime I have gone to visit puerto rico, it has been to visit family in the interior parts of the island....never before have I had to opportunity to explore what the San Juan area had to offer...We picked the Marriot Stellaris Hotel on Condado Beach, not knowing what to expect....but it came highly recommended by some friends and so we booked it for one week....My husband, myself and my 6 year old daughter....not one complaint about the hotel...the staff was very friendly and welcoming, the room was clean and we chose an oceanfront room with a fantastic view on a high floor....the resort has a pretty pool steps away from the beach. The Lobby has a large bar in the center, with tables nearby for evening cocktails, entertainment supplied by a live band on most nights....the casino is small but just enough to keep entertained for a few hours if need be....the restaraunts on site left a alot to be desired but we found great food within walking distance from the hotel....the entertainment in the main lobby entrance area was packed with locals and visitors mingling and I met many people there, very friendly, by the pool who I still keep in touch with...it's an open friendly atmosphere and I would definitely return, my daughter loved it, my husband and I enjoyed the romantic evening on our own private balcony... things I did not like about the stellaris: on site restaraunts are very weak....pool area is clean but can become very busy and cramped... the beach is not the nicest, it's ok, the sand is tannish brown and compact, solid, not soft or light, the waves were pretty rough so we preferred to stay by the pool with our 6 year old...oh and if you want to see old san juan, you must get a taxi, it is NOT walking distance...so the Marriot Stellaris location isn't the best but it was good enough for a few days

Reviews.Title: “gimmeoldsanjuan”
Reviews.Author: barnetjbDHA
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the holiday atmosphere at the Marriot and felt it was a real five star experience. I would have preferred to stay in Old San Juan to soak up the history and not at a beach hotel in Condado Beach area. It is a rather run down part of town with the attendent empty storefronts and beach bums. I did not know this until we went. The hotel is grand though it has a really big bar area right in the lobby which I found rather difficult to understand in a "family-friendly" resort. Maybe the cocktail hour is all day there. I know the Casino certainly is a 24 hour operation with people in there at all hours drinking and having a good time. Maybe a little more "family friendly" would have been better for us. On the whole, though, a really great hotel with a decent seafront beach and view.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dragonminder
Reviews.Content: The San Juan Marriott is a beautiful resort hotel in the Condado section of San Juan. It has a stunning bi-level pool and direct access to a broad public beach. Our room was large, clean, and comfortable, and had a widescreen LCD TV -- as well as a wonderful broad shower head with dozens of tiny holes for a wide spread . We had a full view of the pool area and a partial view of the ocean. The hotel staff were all extremely courteous and helpful, and we kept them hopping with many requests, such as for additional towels and glasses. There were 2 minor problems with the room: a burned-out light bulb in one of the lamps -- replaced within 5 minutes after we called to complain -- and a noisy air conditioner vent. We considered moving to another room, but by the second day we were used to the noise and didn't notice it anymore. The hotel has 2 restaurants: La Vista, a casual cafe; and Tuscany, a high-end Italian restaurant. There are several excellent restaurants within an easy walk of the Marriott, and numerous dining choices in OSJ. Food in San Juan tends to be expensive, but it's almost always cheaper to dine outside of the hotel. For a quick, inexpensive breakfast, there's a coffee bar in the hotel lobby, and a Starbucks directly across the street. The bus to Old San Juan stops at the end of the block that the Marriott is on, and takes about 20 minutes to reach Old SJ. The usual bus fare is 75 cents, but all buses were free when we were there. Buses stop running at 10 PM, and a taxi back from OSJ to the Marriott costs about $15. All in all, I would recommend the SJ Marriott - Stellaris to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: giggabutt
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed a wonderful stay here at the Marriott in San Juan. I was a bit unsure with regards to a few negative reviews but this hotel is definately where we'll be spending our future vacations in PR. We, my husband and 2 year old son, stayed in room 1711 which had a spectacular view of the ocean. However, I will definately stay on the lower levels secondary to having a very active toddler on board. The pool was great which our son enjoyed very much. The beach was a bit rough though. Don't recommend for young children but the pool with the slide made up for it big time. The room and bathroom was clean and modest. The restaurants a bit pricey but thankfully we had enough to splurge. We ate our dinners mostly at the uno chigago grill and the latin star (for a good and economical) breakfast. The staff was very friendly and approachable. Considering that the hotel is along a large strip, there were many options as far as shopping and dining which was so convenient. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the Marriott in San Juan and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Our Second Stay in Less Than a Year, An Absolutely Fabulous Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: NY1PR2007
Reviews.Content: We stood at this wonderful hotel in October last year and we knew that this will be another wonderful stay! We checked into the Marriott the evening of Saturday August 16 after staying at another hotel in the Condado Area the day before but due to an unforseen situation that was taking place at that other hotel we decided that the best thing to due was for us to come back and stay at the San Juan Marriott Resort an Stellaris Casino. I took a walk to the Marriott and as soon as I enter the Hotel I knew I was in heaven again. I went directly to the check in counter and asked for high floor,ocean view room with two beds. I was told that they did not have either an ocean view or pool view room with double beds but that they will be able to give me a City view room with two beds on a high floor. Since it was more important to me to have a room with two beds because I was traveling with my 12 year old daughter and my Girlfriend I opted to accept the City View Room. I was given room 1025 which had a very nice view of the Condado Area right in front of the hotel entrance facing the main Ahsford Avenue. It was really nice watching the people jogging along Ashford Avenue every morning while seating on the terrace while drinking coffee and reading the newspaper which it was delivered free everyday to our room. Last year in October we stood in room 1107 facing the pool and the ocean and even though we did not have the same view this time I will like to comment about how clean these rooms are always kept. We were out of our rooms usually by 9:00am to go to the pool. The pool was never crowded the 9 days we were there. We always found chairs either facing the sun or in the shadow under the many palm trees surrounding the pool. There are two pools, one is a kiddie pool and the other on is the regular pool which I think the deepest part is 5 feet. There is a water slide that opens at 11:00am and the kids have a ball with it. I spent most of the time in the sun while my girlfriend and daughter spent much of the time in the water but it was wonderful seen kids and adults come down the slide. It is really a very relaxing atmosphere at the hotel's pool. Sometimes I will seat by the swim up bar to have a drink. The mojitos as well as the pina coladas were excellent and very refreshing specially when the temperature was always between 90-95 degrees every day we were there. One time when we were driving to the town of Ponce the temperature hit 102 degrees in the car's outside temperature gauge. Trust me this was not a malfuntion.It was actually that hot in Ponce that day. Now going back to the rooms. When we went up back to our rooms which it was around 12 or 1pm we always found that the rooms had been cleaned with plenty of fresh clean towels. The cleaning staff at the Marriott take pride when cleaning the rooms. Whenever you need anything they will bring it to you with a smile.There was only one incident where the room had not been clean and as soon as I placed a call to the front desk they sent someone up to clean it right awat after we left the room. The beds!!! Oh my God!! I have to say that these are the most comfotable beds I have ever slept in. I said it on my previous review written last year and I have to say it again. I have no idea what these beds have that makes them so special but when you get in them you just don't seem to want to get of them. The whole staff at this hotel are the friendliest that I have ever come across at any other hotel I have ever been to. They make you feel at home. They are always smiling and ask you from time to time if everything is fine with your stay. Eveytime we came back to the hotel with my car they always open all the doors and greeted us with a smile. At the hotel we usually had breakfast at la vista restaurant. It is true as many other reviwers stated that It can be expensive if you have children because even though there is a buffett they charge $11.95 for a child even if he/she has just 1 panckake. Since my 12 year old is not a breakfast person what we did was to go to Walgreens which is just half a block to the right of the hotel and we purchased milk , juice water and cereal and we took it to our room since most of the rooms have a small fridge and in the mornings my daughter will have cereal in the room while we were getting ready to go downstairs to have breakfast at La Vista Restaurant. For Dinner we went out of the hotel and tried different restaurants which are within a walking distance along Ashford Avenue. One of our favorites is "Ropa Vieja". It is a Cuban/Puerto Rican restaurant and their mojitos are excellent and their Mofongo stuff with Srimp is delicious. Just make a right outside the hotel and walk for about 10 minutes passing La Concha Hotel and the Vanderbilt Hotel which it is being remodeled. We tried "Casa De Angel" which it is also a Puerto Rican Food Restaurant and the food was not as good as we expected. I ordered fried Red Snapper which the waiter told me it was one of their best dishes an whn I got it it was burnt beyond recognition. My daughter ordered "Pernil" (roast pork shoulder)with rice and beans and the pork I could tell it was reheated. My girfriend ordered Baked Halibut and this fish was so salty and hard that she was drinking water all the way back to the hotel. In my opinion stay away from this restaurant. We also tried Ajili Mojili. Well Known in the island. This is also a typical Puerto Rican Restaurant. The food was just ok but not for the price that they charge. I just wan to make clear that I am a penny pincher. I do not mine spending money regardless how much it cost as long as the food is delicious but the food at this restaurant was just ok and not for the hype that it generates. To go to this restaurant just make a right outside the Marriott and walk for about 15 minutes and it will be on your left next to Chillis across the street from Rop Vieja.. Now at the old San Juan we wen to eat at the "Parrot Club". 363 Fortaleza Street.Now this has to be the best restaurant we ate while in Puerto Rico. The food was delicious!!!. It its located almost at the end of Fortaleza Street. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED" Second Best Restaurant we ate at was called "Toro Salao" (Salty Bull).Also in the old San Juan . It is located at the end of Fortaleza Street but the street that goes across. 367 Tetuan Street. The food was also delicious but their Mojitos were the best one I tried in all Puerto Rico. We also traveled outside the San Juan Metroplitan area to eat some of the Puerto Rican delicacies that you do not find near hotel in the tourist section. We drove to a town call Guavate to eat lechon asado (Roast Pork)and pasteles. This town is known for the many kioskos (little wooden tents/stores ) off the road where they start cooking the whole pork early hours in the morning and many other things like guineos and arroz con gandules freshly made every day. To go there you will have to drive to route 52 as if you were going to the town of Ponce but you will have to get of at exit 32 to Guavate. If you go there please go to lechonera Los Pinos. According to the locals that we asked they said that that is the best place to eat Lechon Asado (Roast Pork) and trust me they were RIGHT. That is the best lechon asado I have ever had. We had a wonderful time in Puerto Rico and most all we love the Marriott Hotel. Every time we come here we feel as if we were home. The whole staff treat us like familiy and I will not hesitate to come back here again. I know that no hotel can please everyone but if you read the many positive reviews about this wonderful hotel you know why so many people love this hotel. Personally I feel very strongly that besides staying at a hotel that it is beautiful and well kept the most important thing is how the staff treats you and makes you feel and this San Juan Marriott Resort and Stellaris Casino exceeds my expectations when it comes to treating their guest and make them feel special. To the whole Staff at the Marriott Resort and Casino , Thank You So Much for Being So Nice To Us. Hope To See You Again Very Soon, Carlos Reyes and Family Queens, New York.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing weekend at the Stellaris”
Reviews.Author: mollotchka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel as part of a package deal with airfare. We shared the room with another couple. It was definitely a nice place. The beds were incredibly comfortable for a hotel. The rooms were clean, and even though we had a "city view" our room looked out over a quiet corner of the pool- not bad at all. The hotel had dancing at night in the bar. It was REALLY LOUD (although amazingly, we could not hear it in our room)- too loud to enjoy and dance at, which is too bad because we love salsa dancing. Just like everyone said, the food was super expensive and the drinks too- our first day we had our $13.00 hamburgers with $9.00 pina coladas, and that was enough. The good news is that the area is full of lots of restaurants and there's a Walgreen's down the street. We also found a liquor store and stocked up our own room and backpacks for the beach. The mojito mix was surprisingly decent, and the bottle of Bacardi was a whopping $5!!! The beach was lovely. There were plenty of waves, and a boogie board rental place on the beach next door. (Also, the lady sold DELICIOUS empanaditas for a snack) If you're looking for lapping little waves it isn't the beach for you, but the waves were fun for us to play in. The taxi trip downtown to Old San Juan (15 minutes in traffic) was a different price each time we rode. It ranged from $14 to $20, which we thought was a little pricey- and weird that the price fluctuated. No one goes out or eats there until very late on weekends- don't expect any nightlife until about 12 midnight. Best just find yourself a nice tapas bar and enjoy some sangria or a cafecito while you wait. We never found a restaurant that we didn't like. We took the bioluminescence tour on the east side of the island. It was a long bus ride, but well worth the trip. We heard the rainforest tour was great too, but we didn't have time. For the price, however, I might consider an all inclusive. Puerto Rico is not a cheap vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: toasty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days, then went to the island of Vieques (highly recommend) and then came back for one night. Our first three nights were spectacular as we were given an executive suite in the cabana wing due to my husband's Marriott rewards status. The room was tastefully decorated, the bathroom huge, the balcony had a great view. We liked the beach, though it wasn't a kid friendly as I hoped. The pool was decent, but I liked the one at the Intercontinental better as we staryed there our last time in PR. We didn't like that the kids water slide was only upon until 4PM. When we came to the hotel for our second stay we got a high ocean view room (1717) in the tower. The wrap around views were spectacular! That night however, the people in the room next to us decided to party all night, so we called security at 1AM and they came and quieted them down. We also called the front desk to ge the number of a local pizza joint we'd used earlier in the week and twice they gave us the number to the wrong restaurant, when we called the front deck the third time they didn't bother to pick up. The next morning we called for late check out and no one picked up the phone again. An hour later someone did pick up and part of our Marriott rewards benefit is "priority late checkout" where you pick the time and due to our late flight and having kids with us, we wanted to check out at 1PM. The desk said no one gets to check out past noon, only an hour later than normal, so this was an inconvenience. Overall, the rooms and hotel are nice. We liked the location, the nightlife, but the front desk staff was unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriot. A great family experiencet”
Reviews.Author: sheilbrunn
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a five day visit 8/17 - 8/22. Traveling with my wife and 3 children (ages 10 twins and 14) we booked 2 oceanfront rooms (well worth the cost). Our flight arrived from Baltimore at 11:45 AM and we were in one of our rooms by 12:45 PM. It was outstanding. Service was terrific. Please note as a frequent Marriott guest their level 6 hotels are generally geared for the business trade. Not as fancy as a Ritz, etc., but at a fraction of the cost. Great place for kids. The beach was terrific. We wanted waves and we got them. Not the place if you are expecting miles of beach. Plenty of beach chairs available both on the beach and at the pool. Plenty of kids activities. Probably not a great choice for retirees. A great combination of a resort in a urban setting. Puerto Rico is not the destination for the budget visitor. However, we found the food to be excellent (especially for the Carribean). Not cheap so be prepared. Service was exceptional and everybody was amazingly friendly. The Casino was great and very casual. Most important lesson (after the first excursion) was to use mass transportation. We saw the forts, went shopping and visited the Baccardi factory on our own. We will be going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: NVOUS845
Reviews.Content: I must say that I this was an absolute breath of fresh air! It pains me to even tell you why I'm writing a review because I don't want this one thing to deter you from staying and I should not. We checked in at about 3pm on August 15 after traveling from New York since 4:30AM. We were hungry and wanted to enjoy a nice Caribbean lunch in the hotel restaurant "LA VISTA". We were seated outside on the terrace as requested and ordered two delicious mojitos right away. Followed by this we got Ceviche as an appetizer and proceeded to order our main courses from a slim menu. I got the Cuban sandwich and my fiancÃ©e ordered a grilled Caribbean mango chicken sandwich. $70 later plus tip, I have to tell you how disappointing this food was. I really had higher expectations of a Marriott resort restaurant. The bread was not fresh and the sandwiches looked and tasted like they came out of a school cafeteria! We got engaged on the Beach outside the hotel the next day and went to dinner down the street at an Argentinean restaurant. I'm sure we would have, as we planned, eaten in the Marriott Tuscany restaurant for dinner that night. But we didnâ€™t. Nor did we order breakfast to the room the next morning to eat on the balcony while watching waves crash as we planned due to our lunch experience on day one. The hotel, staff, casino, bar, club scene, pools, and especially the beaches were all stellar! We loved this hotel! It was a fairy tale engagement vacation and I would highly recommend going there. The staff was always smiling, always attentive, and so very helpful. The food was well below the bar that I would expect of a Marriott Hotel / Resort. We would have probably eaten at the hotel several more times, but lucky for us, the street just outside the hotel is packed full of great restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “High Expectations Not Met”
Reviews.Author: billyl01
Reviews.Content: I had very high expectations of this hotel due to its high ranking on tripadvisor, four diamond ranking, and the fact that it is a Marriott corporate run hotel rather than a franchise. My high expectations were not met for the following reasons. The day I was to fly out, I spoke with Anthony in at your service (hotel operator) to inquire if the wireless in guest room internet charge was included in the $29 a day resort fee that is charged on top of the room rate and tax. Anthony told me this internet charge was included. I arrived at the hotel around 2AM, and there was a band playing music in a dance club type atmosphere in the middle of what is supposed to be the hotel lobby, which was made up of a bunch of tables and chairs with a bar in the middle. I couldn't hear a thing because of the volume of the music, and there were no front desk employees at the front desk. After a few minutes, I tracked a hotel employee down, and was eventually checked into my room. Upon arriving at my guest room for the first time, I was greeted by a small amount of trash right in front of my guest room door in the hallway. After entering the guest room, I was happy to see that the room was clean and in good shape. The room I stayed in was recently renovated and had a very nice formal caribbean decor. The balcony was large for a standard guest room, and was extremely private, which blocked off a portion of our ocean front view, but the privacy was nice. After getting settled, I went to go on the internet, and the computer showed that I would be charged an additional $14.95 a day for internet access, so I called at your service again, and was told that I would not be charged the additional fee, because it was included in my resort fee. The next day we were out of the room the whole day until 6 or 7PM, and when we arrived at the room it was still dirty, because housekeeping had not come by to clean the room yet. I called at your service, and was told that housekeeping could only bring me towels at this time of the evening, and instead of arguing with this person, I asked to speak to a manager. I was put in contact with Miguel, who is a housekeeping manager. Miguel initially did not know why my room was not cleaned, but eventually told me that the maid got sick and went home early. Shortly after that conversation, my room was cleaned. On my way to the casino that night, I stopped by the front desk to speak to a manager to try to get some assurance that I would not have many more problems, because we were ready to switch to another hotel at that point. I spoke to a woman, who claimed to be a manager, and when I told her about the problems we had on our first day and that we were thinking about changing hotels instead of apologizing or addressing the problems, she offered to book us in another hotel. After I told her that I would think about whether we would stay or not, she gave me a "I'm sorry". I then proceeded to the casino in the hotel, and was previously told by a person at the front desk that no shorts or short sleeves were allowed to be worn in the casino at night, so I was in jeans and a button down shirt. After about an hour, I could not tolerate how hot I was in the casino, because the air conditioning is kept very low, so I left the casino and never returned during the entire trip. I believe it was the second night of our trip, and we went to La Vista, which I was told was the casual dinner restaurant of the hotel, and the food was very slow to come out even though there were only a hand full of people in the entire restaurant. I asked the waitress for the check, and she must have forgot, because we had to eventually get up and wait for her by the server's area to pay the check and leave. On our second to last night, we did not receive maid service again, but this time it was just turndown service we did not receive, so our bed was made and the room was clean, but we had no clean towels or shampoo that night and the next morning. Sure enough on our last day, we look at the bill and there were multiple internet charges on top of the resort fees. This time my girlfriend went down to the front desk to get the internet charges taken off the bill. Upon her return to the room, she told me she successfully had them take off the internet charges and that we were being treated to a complimentary breakfast by Marco, who was briefed on the details of our stay. I had a chance to meet and speak to Marco before we checked out, and he was very apologetic and was a pleasure to speak with. I have to say that when the maids cleaned our room they did an excellent job and were very nice when we encountered them. During our stay we spent a good amount of time eating and having drinks at the Marriott Renaissance, which is only a couple of blocks away. The Renaissance was booked up the night that the front desk manager offered to transfer me to another hotel, so we ended up staying at the Marriott. Anyway, we very much enjoyed our time at the Renaissance. The Renaissance is a much more chic and beautiful hotel. It has an art deco decor with lots of water features, colored lighting, and comfy white beds and couches all over the lobby and pool area. The Renaissance restaurants are excellent as well, and are not your typical Marriott restaurants. The service we experienced at the Renaissance when dining there was excellent. Although, we had a good time in Puerto Rico overall despite some problems, we would probably not go back to Puerto Rico again; However, if we did go back we would definitely try the Renaissance and stay away from the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: gimmecandynow
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 9:00am, and even though check-in is not until 4:00pm, they gave us our room, which was like getting a free day. The room had a large flat screen TV, very comfy bedding, and a very large and updated bathroom. We stayed on the 9th floor and never heard a sound at night or in the morning when we were trying to sleep, which was great since I'm used to hearing doors banging, partiers, and children running the halls even in 5 star hotels. Also noteworthy is that at the time of our stay, the resort allowed guests to decline the 12% daily resort fee. I appreciated this since, like most resort fees, it adds no services that aren't already included in the price of the room. The hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants and shops, and the concierge is happy to give you a list. After eating lunch the first day at the poolbar, we were glad to have the option of going out to eat. Unfortunately, the poolbar food was not good and overpriced, even for a resort poolbar. The beach was well maintained and large, and there is an attendant there to help you with chairs and umbrellas. They chared $12 to rent an umbrella, but there were plenty of shady palm trees to sit under as well. From the beach, you could see that the areas around the hotel were very run down, which detracted from the scene if looking toward the hotel. Overall, we had a very good experience with the Marriott and the staff was extremely friendly, hard working, and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Okay Location”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_Anne
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, especially the pool area. IWe had a great view of the ocean from our balcony. t's right on Condado beach, which is a major tourist area, so it gets a little crowded.

Reviews.Title: “My Fabulous Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TXsoccermom14
Reviews.Content: I had heard mixed reviews about the resort. We had a fantastic time, it was our first family vacation and our first time in the Caribbean. The hotel and staff were fantastic. We were always greeted with a smile. Other guests were just as friendly, chatting with others on the beach, in the pool & hot tub, even the elevator. The security made me feel safe with my son & niece running around. Its a great location, the beach is amazing. La Vista Restaurant on site is a great family restaurant and they have themed buffets each night. Tuscany was also great, but with kids the wait for our food was too long. There is a Walgreens, Wendy's & a Subway down the street for those trying to stick to a budget for meals also . The concierge set us up for the El Yunque rainforest tour. If you can swing it, it was fabulous, the tour guide was as entertaining as the tour itself. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: SPAnne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot San Juan Resort and Stellaris Casino for 5 days, and we really had a great experience there! OVERALL: The room was a good size and it was worth every penny to pay a little extra for the pool/ocean view... it was great to sit out on the balcony with a cold drink and look out at the pool area and (beyond the pool area) the gorgeous clear blue ocean! The room stayed kind of damp/humid all week, but I think some of that may be inevitable given the Caribbean climate! The location was good too. Nice beach, especially if you like playing in the waves (not super calm water, but that was a good thing for us!). Money-Saving Tip for Drinkers: The drinks at the pool area were definitely overpriced, so we decided to buy our own little bottle of rum and some juice, etc mixers at one of the many little grocery/liquer stores within walking distance. (For about $20 worth of "stocking the bar" in our room, we were able to get the amount of drinks that would have cost $200 at the bar over the course of the week!). If you are interested in touring the Bacardi Rum factory, don't book your trip through the tour company in the hotel.... they will likely charge you around $50 per person, and in reality you can get there and have that entire experience for less than $30 total. Overall this was a good afternoon, but we were so glad we hadn't spent $100 to have the tour company take us there! We did book a trip to hike in El Yunque through the tour desk at the hotel, and that turned out to be a very good choice! We never would have been able to pick out the most scenic spot to go hiking had we chosen to rent a car, drive there ourselves, etc... plus it was nice to not have to worry about transportation (it's about 45 mins away). We ate at the Tuscany restaurant in the hotel one night, and the food was very good. We also managed to find lots of great little restaurants to try within walking distance, and it was fun to just wander around until we saw a place that looked like a good one to try! Overall, we had a wonderful stay at the Marriot San Juan! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: sl96
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 2 night stay at the Marriott. We didn't take advantage of too many of the facilities but everything we saw was nice and well maintained. We were upgraded to a corner room; one balcony faced the ocean and the other faced the "bay" (just yucky buildings). I am so glad for the upgrade because that view of the ocean was the most relaxing part of the stay. The room itself was large and nice with an updated bathroom and decent closets. The pools were lovely and even the larger one was shallow so its perfect for kids. We came without our kids but there was a daily activity list for children which made this place seem very kid friendly (scavenger hunts; water volleyball etc.). We tried to walk on the beach in the evening, but the security guard didn't let us get on because they were locking up the entry. I realized that it was for security issues, but it would be nice if you can stay on the beach to watch the sun set. Service was great overall. The guest services personnel were accomodating and nice. Valet always came quickly. I've stayed at other 4 and 5 star resorts where waited for valet for 15 minutes to an hour and that was with a call requesting the car before we came down. The casino was fine. Obviously small by most standards but they had a little bit of everything. Slots of all ranges (1 cent to $1 or more), blackjack tables, craps, roulette etc. The salsa dancing in the lobby at night was unbelievably loud, but once you walk away from that area, it was bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot San Juan was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kates70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night pre-cruise. Our stay was very nice. The room was in a very quiet location and the beds were extremely comfortable. We upgraded to the executive level and I would highly recommend this. The evening snacks were good, but the continental breakfast was excellent. My only complaint is that the bathrooms were a bit too small. We have stayed in 4 hotels in San Juan, and by far, this was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: NJBrooklynborn
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a week at the Stellaris in San Juan. I can completely understand the reason for all the great reviews- this is a wonderful hotel. The rooms are lovely with really comfortable beds, marble bathrooms with a makeup mirror, flat screen tv and very nice balconies. There are two pools, one large one for kids and an even larger one with a swim up bar and a slide. The beach is wonderful- just rough enough to be fun. The staff at this hotel is exceptional. Everyone is warm and friendly making you feel right at home immediately. The La Vista restaurant is terrific for breakfast. We had lunch and tropical drinks every day at the pool, served to us graciously by Rafael. And the daily afternoon pool volleyball games kept my 10 year old son and 16 year old nephew engaged for hours. In all, this hotel was everything I'd hoped it would be, and even better than expected. One note- the lobby of this hotel is not impressive. Don't be discouraged upon arrival. Everything else about this hotel surpasses that first impression. Restaurant recommendations- Ajili Mojili right down the street from the hotel. La Mallorquina (old world charm) and the Parrot Club (trendy and colorful) in Old San Juan. All three have great food.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: PieroG
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day stay at the Marriot. Used to live in PR but no family left in the island so decided to stay at an hotel rather than an empty house. The Marriot exceeded all my expectations. The service is excellent. Puerto Ricans are a very friendly people in general and this shows, always asking if everything was ok and always greeting you with a friendly smile. I had a corner room (#1609) overlooking the ocean and pool/Old San Juan. The corner rooms have a wrap around terrace in which easily you could entertain over 10 people. they have chairs and a table so you can watch the spectacular sunsets from your terrace while enjoying a drink or simply relaxing. The business lounge at the 21st floor is very nice also, they have appetizers from 5-730pm (Sunday-Thursday) which can easily serve as a meal. In the morning they also have breakfast which I found more than adequate. There's an automatic coffee machine also which makes excellent espresso. The beach: perfect also. Included in the price is a "resort fee" which allows you to use the hotel beach chairs and umbrellas. So you only have to tell the attendant at the beach where you want your chair and umbrella and thats it, no $$ involved. Most of the time I was there the beach was half empty but on weekends you find more locals that stay at the hotel and can be more crowded but never too crowded. There are a few hotels nearby that you may be considering also. The closest one is "La Concha", it's the building with the big white building that looks like a clam schell (concha) in my pics. It's 2 blocks from the Marriot and was recently renovated, the lobby looks great, very chic, but the beach area is small and it's right next to a park so not very private and looked more crowded. Others in the area are the Condado Beach, but has a very very tiny beach. The Caribe Hilton has nice public facilities and nice beach but far from everything if you want to walk. The Ashford Ave. is like the Rodeo Drive of San Juan, with Cartier, Louis Vuitton, etc stores all around it. Very safe also. The bed was very comfortable, the AC worked fine and the room was always clean. Same with the bathroom. Ate at the restaurant once and was good, there are so many good restaurants around the hotel that it's hard to choose. At night there is a live band playing in a stage in the Lobby floor, it was packed with locals dancing every single night. There's also a bar at the Lobby and of course the casino, not a casino person so no opinion on it. In summary, as someone that used to live there, I would reccomend this hotel above all others in the island for it's location, it's beach, it's views (get a corner room if you can) and overall service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-cruise Stop”
Reviews.Author: Vator90
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights pre-cruise in June '08. The view of the ocean and the sunrises were outstanding. The hotel was great. We made extensive use of the pool and beach areas. While the gate to the beach closes at dark, we understand it was for security reasons. The resturaunt staff was great with our family. The food was very good. The bellmen did a fabulous job every time we encountered them. From our arrival to our departure they were helpful and knowledgeable. The front desk staff was friendly, courteous, and professional. All in all, the staff was very professional and made you feel welcome. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super customer service”
Reviews.Author: kristin9519
Reviews.Content: This hotel was worth every single penny. We had a standard room and I was impressed. I've stayed at hotels that claim to be 4 stars and are not. They need to be five stars not only for the cleanliness of the rooms, hotel, and housekeeping but for their wonderful customer service. I didn't not run into one bad hotel staff, everybody was friendly and ready to serve you hand and foot. The hotel location is awesome too, Its right on the beach and located on a strip of good restaurants and torrist shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall - I wish I had known the beach shuts down at 7:00pm”
Reviews.Author: TravelnRob
Reviews.Content: The wife and I spent 4 nights here in June 2008. Overall we had a great trip. We ate at the hotel several times and had a good experience each time. The only thing I wish I had known is that they close the beach and beach bar down at 7:00. I usually enjoy the time around sunset on the beach when in the Caribbean. This is definitely not the place to go for wild night life. The hotel site says it is close to Old San Juan. I'm not sure I would advertise a 50 minute walk as close. There is a bus stop between the hotel and Walgreens that will take you there for 75 cents. A couple of things to know about the bus. On the way there you are dropped off at a stop on the sidewalk. On the way back you need to catch the bus from the terminal about a block to the west from the stop. (The bus is labeled route 21b). On the way back get off at the stop in front of the Bueno Aries resteraunt (which is directly behind Walgreens). Don't ask me how I know.... The casino is small by US standards but it is entirely smoke free. Maybe we will catch up some day.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Scully1998
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days/4 nights. After researching a lot of properties, I chose this one. I am a very picky person so I am always worried about spending a lot of money and not getting what I paid for. This hotel met all of my expectations. Great staff.. everyone said hello and was helpful. We stayed in an oceanfront room on the 15th floor, which was breathtaking (be sure to make sure you are in the main tower and not in the cabana.. especially if you pay for the oceanfront room). The room was very clean, nicely decorated, and had a very private balcony. The bathroom was nice.. but a little small. They offered two pools. One was only 2 ft in depth, and they other was about 4ft. They had a neat water slide that provided entertainment for both kids and adults. I even saw some senior citizens using it.. which I thought was great! They have two pool bars and have happy hours specials. Make sure to get your two-for-one drinks during happy hour. The casino and the live bands were a nice touch. We enjoyed drinks while listening to the music. Some suggestions: 1. You can opt-out of the resort fee. We saved about $27 per day by opting out. The only thing we missed was the internet access.. which was great for me b/c I wouldn't be addicted to checking my e-mail for 5 days. Just ask the person checking you in to opt out. You will still get your towle service at the pool. 2. If you want to rent a car, rent one through Hertz. They have a counter right in the lobby. We were able to drop the car off in the hotel's parking garage after hours when we were done with the car. It was convienient. 3. We chose a room rate that included access to the executive lounge. We had breakfast in the lounge, appetizers, and desserts for three of our days and the food was great. Just be advised that the lounge operates Sunday night through Friday, so if you are coming for the weekend.. don't bother. 4. There are great restarants right around the hotel. We had a decent breakfast as well as great pizza (and I am orignially from NY!) at Danny's International restaurant (one block exiting the hotel to the left), a nice dinner (authentic Puerto Rican food) at Ajili Mojili which was about a 15 minute walk to the right of the hotel. We also grabbed lunch from Camille's Cafe and had a nice seafood dinner at Miro, which are directly across the street from the hotel. Just be careful of walking into a sidewalk restaurant. We got sucked into one, and wound up paying $35 for lunch! At least the food was decent. Just check the menu prices. 5. If you visit the Rain Forest, don't pay all the money for a guided tour. Once the guy in the visitor center explained the trails to us, it was very easy to follow. The hike down to the bog waterfall is not for your 80 year old grandma, but worth the effort once you get down there. I was upset that I didn't have my swimsuit on. I definitely wanted to jump in with everyone else after our hike down there. 6. Try to book excursions on your own instead of going through the hotel. You will save about $20 doing it on your own. We enjoyed the snorkeling catamaran cruise through the East Wind company. They even picked us up at our hotel. That was about 5 hours in length.. with and open bar available for the entire duration. We also went on the bioluminescent kayaking trip. We went at 6:30, which turned out to be great. We could see through the lagoon on the way out and it was dark by the time we got to the area that contained the bioluminescence. The trip back wasn't as fun b/c it was dark and people we crashing into each other. 7. We took the bus into Old San Juan. Although we only paid $0.75 each.. we had no idea where we were once the driver dropped us off. So bring a map. We were very lost and had no idea how to get back. We wound up taking a cab back to the hotel ($14).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysUp4Travel
Reviews.Content: The service at the Marriott was fantastic! Check-in was smooth, good food at the restaurants on the grounds, plenty of info on local things-to-do, and the pool area is beautiful. There's also a live salsa band that performs on some nights. The hotel is conveniently located right on the beach for easy access. There are several shops and restaurants located within short walking distances from the hotel. It was a great stay at the Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for Family”
Reviews.Author: MurphyTXMom
Reviews.Content: Some hotels in San Juan aren't "Family" friendly. They tend to cater more to Singles or Honeymooners. The Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris is definitely "Family" friendly. I was there with my 3 & 6 year olds. They absouletely loved the resort. Their favorite part (and mommy's) was the huge Children's Pool. Usually when I travel, the hotel's Children's Pool is so small you find yourself fighting with other parents to get a spot for your kid. But, this Resort's Children Pool is huge! So Moms/Dads, no worries. The Children's pool is also divided off from the deeper pool, where of course, the older kids and adults hang out. If you're like me, I'm always worried the younger kids will be harmed when the older kids are in the same pool. Again, not a problem here. The resort also has sand buckets, shovels, boardgames etc. for the kids to borrow for free. They're located at the towel hut. They also have books mom and dad can borrow, if you want to lay back and read. It's true that the beach has dangerous waves for young children. But, my kids were content making sand castles and staying on the edge of the water when they wanted to get wet. There is a Starbucks and Hagen Dazz right across the street. And a Dunkin Donuts/Baskin Robbins 2 blocks away. My kids of course loved getting donuts for breakfast and Mom and Dad loved the affordable breakfast. There is also a Wendy's and Chili's not too far away. You can definitely walked there and back (not dangerous). The rooms are beautiful. We stayed in the tower (15th floor) and had the city view. It was just fine for a family. Anyone with kids knows that an Ocean View room is lost on kids. They don't want to see the beach, they want to play on the beach. So save yourselfs some $ and booked the city view rooms that are on the higher floors. Nice view of the city at night. Another nice perk, the local bus is down the block. So with .75cents you can get to downtown San Juan. My kids loved the adventure of riding the local bus. There were many tourist on the bus, so you'll fit right in and feel safe. If its raining out, take a look in your room closet, there's a huge umbrella you can borrow. There's also cozy robes and slippers (for adults) Mom and Dad can slip into later. If you're wondering what the Resort has for Adults? It has Plenty!!. The deeper pool with a Slide, the Swim up bar. The Salsa band each night. The great Bar and Casino and Restaurants. The staff there were so so nice and professional too. That of course is a big plus. You can't go wrong at the Marriott San Juan Resort and Stellaris Casino. We had a great time and hope to stay again during our next visit (hopefully next year).

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: GLBTCruiser9
Reviews.Content: This was the third time we stayed at the Marriott Stella Solaris. The renovated rooms and fabulous beds make for a wonderful stay. We enjoyed the sumptuous dinner and breakfast buffets. The only negative was the number of children and 'ball playing' allowed in the 'adult' pool and spa area. The security guard made repeated stops at the spa to ask the children to vacate the spa, but they would return shortly. The red flag has been up at the beach each time we have stayed and I wonder now if that is just hotel policy to warn or the waves and undertow.If a shallow pool and lack of swimable beach don't bother you, you'll be pleased with your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: lianimoscoso
Reviews.Content: The nightlife was awesome...live music right in the lobby!! the pool and beach access was beautiful! We had such a beautiful view of the beach and the city! The hotel is clean, and the staff very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chapovez
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay in San Juan. We couldn't have been more pleased with the Marriott. First of all, the location is fantastic. The Condado district is just 10 minutes from the airport, and 10 minutes from Old San Juan. Within a 4 block radius, there must be at least 25 restaurants to choose from. All types of cuisines, Sushi, Argentinean, Italian, Mexican, and Puerto Rican. There is also a small grocery store/liquor store and a Walgreenâ€™s within a block or two. The hotel itself was very comfortable. The room was large and comfortable. It looks like it had been recently renovated. Very comfortable bed, granite counters in the bathroom, small refrigerator, and a large plasma TV with about 30 US satellite TV stations. The in-room wireless internet was as fast as back home. The pool area was very nice, and well maintained. There was never a problem getting a chair by the pool. The beach was beautiful. It was very easy to get beach chairs and an umbrella. Even though the waves were a bit rough, there were plenty of people swimming in the ocean. The bars in the pool areas were great. Never a problem getting a drink, and made a wide variety of tropical cocktails. We ate at the La Vista restaurant for breakfast. They had an $18 breakfast buffet option, that was very good. Made to order omelets, Belgian waffles, fresh fruit, pastries, OJ, very good coffee. There were so many other dining options surrounding the hotel, why bother eating at the hotel for lunch or dinner. The casino was very good. It was open 24 hours a day. They had about 10 blackjack tables. Several at the $5 and $10 level. With good blackjack rules (dealer stands on soft 17). They also had a $5 craps table. Sign up for their playerâ€™s club when you get there. We earned about $75 in food comps, just by playing a couple of hours a day. All in all, a great place to stay. An great value at $250/night (including the daily resort fee) for an ocean front room through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Caribbean Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1923
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott San Juan in May of 2008. We were departing San Juan on a 7-night cruise, and chose to stay at this hotel before and after the trip. The hotel is located in the Condado Beach area with easy access to beaches and historical Old San Juan. The hotel has a wonderful two-tiered outdoor pool for swimming and lounging around. It also has it's own beach if you prefer swimming in the ocean. The hotel is very clean and kept up very well. The rooms are spacious with large bathrooms, and very comfortable beds. I would highly recommend this hotel to all travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: EvaTT
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical in spite of all the good reviews but to my surprise they were all true. The hotel is immaculate and there seems to always be somebody around painting, repairing, etc.. We were given a room high up as requested, and the view from the 14th floor was breathtaking, from the city, the beach and the ocean. The pool is very good although somewhat shady.
