However the beach is right there if you want a lot of sun. The customer service is excellent, even the maids smile and appear happy as they work. They pay a lot of attention to detail all the time, one of the employees called the elevator when he saw us walking in that direction. Also, the location is very good for several reasons, the bus stop to go to Old San Juan was really close (bus B21), there was a Walgreen's as you walk to the right of the hotel, a couple of blocks beyond a mini supermarket. If you like dancing it's ideal, they have different live bands from Weds until Sunday and their mojitos are delicious. There are several restaurants very close, the one right in front of the hotel is Miro, it is Catalan (from Spain) and even though the outside looked somewhat gaudy on Saturday night (with loud band and extra lights) had really good food, great service and pleasant seating inside. And if you walk to the left or to the right you will find several restaurants not very expensive. At the hotel we tried the restaurant La Isla, by the pool and their sandwiches were very decent. However we tried the restaurant La Vista (bottom of hotel) and were very disappointed. I had black beans soup that was very salty and my husband Cesar salad with grilled chicken, the salad very acidic and the chicken was lukewarm and tough, I would not recommend it. Also if you are interested in renting a car you can get one in the hotel (expensive) or call Target Rental, a local office and they will come to pick you up, to the hotel or the airport, very reasonable prices and great service. (We rented a compact for $30 a day) But check with your insurance company and make sure you are covered in Puerto Rico. We went to el Yunque, it was very easy to get to and very interesting. And Arecibo was really cool also. We will definitely be back to Puerto Rico, there is much to discover.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: TinkerII
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Memorial Day weekend stay at this Marriott and could not be happier. We arrived early on Saturday knowing that check in was not until 4 p.m. We completed all paperwork and left our bags with the bell captain. We were told that we could avail ourselves of the spa facilities (shower, bathrooms, etc) while we waited. Within 1/2 hr. we were notified that our room was ready and that we were even upgraded to a corner room with a double balcony. We had a bit of an issue with the a/c but this was fixed almost immediately. The location was perfect and convenient...the beach was great...and the people in the hotel could not have been nicer. Kudos to Frances, our diligent Concierge, who followed up on the a/c issue and room service and also to Sonia, our waitress in the La Isla Grill each day. All in all, we had a wonderful time and wished it could have been longer. We will return and most certainly recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: jos3girls
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every year for the last 10 years. The people are friendly. We have so much fun! We would never stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: TexasBrian08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott from Wednesday May 7 through Saturday May 10, 2008 and had a first floor pool view room which was perfect since we had a 2-year old that napped in the afternoons. We had no significant issues, room was great but we were not there to sit in our room. Bed was very comfortable. Overall the stay was above average and would suggest it to anyone. We were also there during the week when it was not so crowded but did start to get more crowded on Friday and Saturday morning. Pools and Beach. There are 2 pools and one is 2 to 2.5 feet deep which is perfect for small children that cannot swim yet. Yes, there are problems getting sun in the morning but the beach has plenty of sun in the morning. By the way, I have read all the reviews about the rough surf - it is a beach and there are waves, nothing more than any other beach I have been. The sand is great and clean, plenty of chairs. Food. We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants as pricey. We did eat the hot dogs ($6) and hamburgers ($12) from the hotel which were good for hotel pool food. There are plenty of places up and down the street from the hotel including the Gelato place for breakfast - $20 for 2 adults and kid. Danni's and the Itialian wine bar - great pizza and good wine prices. We got pizza from the Itialian place and wine from the grocery store (2 blocks down from hotel to the left) and sat by the pool o eat - best meal of the entire trip. We also bought snacks and beer (Medialia is the native Puerto Rico beer and quite good) at the grocer store. El Yunque Rainforest. About 3/4 mile hike on pavement to a very cool and refreshing waterfall. Definitely worth the 45 minute drive there. Old San Juan. We ate at the Parrot Club in Old San Juan. $100 and not much variety especially if you did not want seafood but very good food. Suggest the chicken tamale dish but not the tuna steak.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Not up to Par”
Reviews.Author: vacation123
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the Marriott. The service level was poor and it was not just because of the typical Caribbean service level. The staff does not know how to deal with guests and there is no communication between departments. The elevators in the hotel were not working properly and there were always lots of guests and housekeepers waiting for them. I had more than one housekeeper cut me off to get into an elevator without even waiting for it to empty out. I asked for a late check out the day before leaving and was given it for 1 p.m.. At noon on my check out date I had 2 different housekeepers knocking on the door within 15 minutes of each other trying to get in to turn around the room. When I called the front desk to get them to stop sending people they had no idea. My room was not ready upon check in and they gave me pager to let me know when it would be ready which never went off. I went to the front desk a 1/2 hour after check in time to see if it was ready and it had been for a while. They accussed me of being out of the pager range - which I wasn't - I was sitting at the pool the entire time. They also messed up my bill upon check in and then argued with me when I tried to be honest with them. As for the property itself - it is newly renovated. The rooms are nice and make sure you get a room with ocean and or pool view. A city view will be horrible. The ocean is very rough and there is a bad undertow which they warn you about. The pool area was nice. There is an Italian resturant which didn't look like it was any spectaular so I didn't eat in it. There are alot of kids there and also a lot of business meetings going on. I had to walk through a foyer with one going on to access the business center and was confronted by the person running the meeting. There is no other way to the business center but through that area. The hotel is in a good location. There is a Starbucks across the street and many restaurants all up and down Ashford Avenue. I felt safe walking alone to any of those places. There is a lot of construction in Condado Beach and in a few years it will be much better. They do lock the gates to beach access at 6 p.m. because it is a public beach. There are a lot of police out. Puerto Rico definetly has crime issues and there are alot of vacate buildings. I did find the people friendly and Old San Juan was great. Do recommend going to Puerto Rico but stay at anyone of the many other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarNGreg
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about this hotel!! The hotel staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. We stayed in a corner view room and it was absolutely perfect. The views were amazing. We did not eat there much because it's so extremely close to many amazing restaurants. The coffee was great as was the chinese food located in the Casino area. Every staff member that we came across was fantastic. The pool is beautiful. The pool bars are great. The beach is beautiful, although not the best place for ocean swimming. The casino is fun, the music in the lobby is great. The cab rate to downtown San Juan is under $20. The cabbies were also fantastic. Like I said, we can not say enough about this place. Not one negative experience. We made the perfect choice for our honeymoon and will Definitely be back, soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Getaway”
Reviews.Author: chellie882004
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed my little Birthday getaway. We really found the reviews on here to be on point. The hotel was decent we got a different room with a better view. You may need to know a little spanish to communicate with the maid and some waiters at the nearby restaurants and stores. The live band downstairs was a treat. The food is ridiculously high. Breakfast was like $15 dollars with no meat. So we went to the 24 hour Latin Cafe and it was very reasonable. Restaurants were decent nearby. The cab driver recommended Ajili Mojili which was awesome. Best tres leche cake ever. They had a veal dish that I never thought I would like sweet. Took a bus almost right outside the hotel. They don't seem to be as regular as we hoped. Got free drinks at the Bacardi Rum Distillery. I don't even drink much but enjoyed the ferry ride to get there from Old San Juan. We are definitely going back. Almost forgot to mention passion fruit juice is a regular thing I think the drinks they gave us while we waited to check in were delicioso. Rum punch or something.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok but clean ....”
Reviews.Author: KellyinKentucky
Reviews.Content: First - we booked through priceline for a Saturday night after a cruise for $175 per night ..... when we checked in asked to see if an upgrade was available - offered $25 extra per night for ocean/pool view room - so we upgraded. ........ we checked in at 11:00 - GREAT service there!!!! .......... room had a good view - we were in the tower building - would highly recommend requesting that section......... Room was nice, clean, AC worked GREAT! .... nice balcony area, also flat screen tv. Pool area was just ok, hard to find a place to sun due to all the palm trees ...... beach area also just ok - nobody came around taking drink or food orders, had to track people down to try to take $$ from us for these things :) ........ casino - small, but ok - not great selection of slots, etc ....... $10 taxi ride to Old San Juan - $15.50 taxi ride to airport ....... clean, decent place to stay after cruise - last time we stayed at the Ritz - 10 times better, but of course you pay the $$ too.......... we also ate dinner at the buffet restaurant - yucky!! don't recommend............. starbucks and ice cream shop right across the street ........ they do not have scales to weigh your luggage in the hotel, so be aware of that if traveling after a cruise where you've bought lots of things - we just had to guess on the weight of our bags :)

Reviews.Title: “We made the right choice”
Reviews.Author: NYC67
Reviews.Content: So pleased with our selection. The reviews here were really helpful. Were really convinced when we walked by el Convento. Don't get me wrong, Convento is very nice, but we spent an entire week in San Juan and Old San Juan is worth a day trip at most. If you're in San Juan for more than 2 days, stay at the Marriott. The beach is spectacular. If you've been to any eastern US beach, you'll love the ocean here. And the restaurants within walking distance of this hotel are specacular. The hotel staff and all the local merchants are top notch. Will be back some day and this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “I hate germs and bad service.... Neither was a issue...”
Reviews.Author: Shonda1870
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant about Priceline because whatever the reason I was unable to read the reviews for this hotel. However, I read the reviews on the hotel via trip advisor and they were average but this review will be the pure unadulterated truth. First of all Iâ€™m a germ phobic and simply must stay in a clean hotel. Ok we booked our trip and it was painless. We received an email staying that the snorkeling trip was cancelled due to weather. I became worried whatâ€™s going on with weather. Long story short the weather forecast was thunderstorms daily (So I called the hotel and was advised that it had rained daily but for the moist part the weather was great so I trusted this and proceeded with our trip. We paid for prepayment parking in the Ontario Park and Fly (Do not do this Priceline may not be aware bust they are a rip off Priceline charges you per day and then they billed us per hour uurrgghh) So we fly in the Puerto Rico without incident again Priceline may not be aware of this but Budget is horrible rude rude when we arrived Angel was arguing with a customer on the phone and making faces to us that the person was rambling. We were not happy to have to deal with him after a 9-Â½ flight but what the heck the customer was probably rambling and Angel was probably unprofessional. Yes Angel was very unprofessional Iâ€™m an insurance agent and understand the additional insurance and their job to sell it. Angel seemed to take it personal I declined the coverage, which is weird, but something quickly I dismissed not to my knowledge he continued to discuss my decision with my husband after I walked away. We were not pleased. We go to the Marriott in out stained seat, smoke filled rental car. The hotel was stunning; the room was ready but had two beds? I was told Priceline requests the double beds to maintain a lower price and we can change rooms no charge (great) Stephanie was awesome she also hinted to us about possible upgrades (we upgraded to first class on the flight and it was so so so very sad. I was not worth a 1.00 but we gave them 300.00 for the seats. Anyway, our room was upgraded to 609 for 25.00 GET THIS ROOM! You have 1 King size bed, and two balconies I mean large balconies one is pool view the second is ocean it made the trip it really did. The gym was great I used it twice my husband daily, the restaurant with the buffet was our favorite we found a small mom and pops restaurant in Kauai (Eggberts) with the world best pancakes this place is number two, clean plates and silverware and great great food. Iâ€™m afraid of buffets but enjoyed this one daily in 6 days for twp people we spent about 400.00 on three meals daily be prepared! The Hotel is the only one in the area not the El Condeor or the Ritz that is within walking distance of local stores and restaurant, star bucks is across the street J and the other hotels donâ€™t have shopping (Gucci, Louis Vutton, or just simply souvenirs and a beach none of them) Ok before I end TAKE the tour through the Rainforest via Priceline not the hotel itâ€™s just like the real thing the tour guide was a proud man proud of his peopleâ€™s history and the beautiful island he was so great! He made us think made us laugh and allowed us to really experience Puerto Rico. We had lunch in some small family restaurant in the Rain forest the food wad great the show was awesome (youâ€™ll see the show when you go ps what do you think about the dog on the roof) Thank you Marriott San Juan Thank you Priceline. Budget please get it together! Oh yeah were 33 years old saved don't drink, smoke or gamable and had a blast oh sorry so much but go see the Old San Juan Fort.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: nanniex2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The service was outstanding. I have been traveling often for the last 10 years and this was one of the best hotels I have stayed in. The taxi ride cost $18 from the airport and $18 more to get to the cruise ports. The best part of all, the rooms were clean, which you can't alway say for the hotels in San Juan. There are several small restaurants across the street. We ate at the Piu Bella for breakfast and it was very good and only cost $5. They also have the world's best gelato, made there. Walgreen's is one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, couldn't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: Readi-2-go
Reviews.Content: Date: April 2008 Reviewer: Chris - Missouri The Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino - You definitely get what you pay for here. From the minute you walk in the door with the marble floors, the bar right inside and live entertainment. We arrived at 9 PM on a Friday night and the party was already going! The entire staff was friendly, helpful and professional. The room itself was extremely nice. Big flat screen TV, nice bathroom with marble counters and plenty of room. The bed was sooooooo comfortable. I would like to have brought it home with me! My daughter had never gambled so we went to the casino. I was just getting ready to take her picture when security came over and said it wasn't allowed (oops!) We didn't know that. We were just trying to document her first try at the slot machine. We were on the 10th floor and had a "city view". Didn't realize we had a balcony, and when we did the vew was spectacular. The view to the left was the Atlantic Ocean and the view to the right was the city. Naturally we preferred the view of the ocean. There were 2 pools, one was geared more for kids, but adults had fun in it too and the other had a swim up bar. The pools were never overcrowded and neither was the beach. There were always lounges available when you wanted them and there was always someone from the hotel there who would carry them to where you wanted. The beach was extremely clean and uncrowded. We were there from a Friday until Tuesday and even over the weekend it wasn't packed. There were two restaurants in the hotel. We only ate at LaVista. Food was good. I tried the buffet one night just to say I did. I definitely could not eat my monies worth, but the food was extremely good. The bar area was a lot of fun. There was live music every night and the drinks were great. It was always busy there in the evening, but not to where you couldn't find a spot to sit or dance and have fun. I would not hesitate to come back to this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: LollyMoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights â€“ weekend getaway. Wish we could have stayed longer. â€¢ Before arrival called the concierge desk and talked to Nancy who was fantastic. Although she was not able to assist me, she took my contact information in case we were cut off and transferred me to the tour desk where I dealt with Robert â€“ another wonderful experience. Robert gave me a lot of great information and was extremely helpful. Moments later the phone rang and it was Nancy from concierge making sure I had gotten what I needed. This is before we even got there! â€¢ We arrived very early â€“ 11:00 a.m. not expecting our room to be ready. Juan, at the front desk, was able to upgrade us (for a small fee) to an ocean front room on the 12th floor. We went and had lunch and when we came back at 12:30, our room was ready. The bags were delivered within moments of our getting in to the room and the bellman who delivered them was beyond helpful, getting us ice, giving us local area information, etc. We explored the room, which included a small fridge which comes in very handy, full size iron and ironing board, large size umbrella, two wonderful robes and slippers, plenty of good hangers, lots of towels and one bottle of complimentary water (replaced daily). By the way, for the lady who wrote in a previous review that she had such trouble securing a connecting room â€“ they are available, as ours was a connecting room (1212). The room has a nice balcony with two chairs and a small table. We slept with the door open and the sound of surf putting us to sleep each night. All rooms are non-smoking, so you do have people outdoors smoking on their balcony, which can be annoying if the smell bothers you. The bathroom was really nice with plenty of counter space, four electrical outlets, a deep tub and rainshower-type shower head with good water pressure and plenty of hot water. A particular pet peeve of mine is a toilet that flushes so loud that it wakes up the rest of the floor in the middle of the night â€“ in this case, the toilet is nice and quiet â€“ Iâ€™m sure someone out there will appreciate my noting this particular fact! The bed was ultra comfortable as were the pillows â€“ so much so that I actually ordered a couple of pillows from their on-line store. Cleanliness was top-notch â€“ the room was spotless. We didnâ€™t use wi-fi, so canâ€™t address that issue. â€¢ Staff â€“ as I mentioned earlier, we had a wonderful experience with the staff. There was not one staff member that we encountered during our stay who was not friendly, helpful, and/or smiling. We received a courtesy call the evening of our arrival making sure that we had everything we needed. There are many bell staff opening doors, getting cabs (plenty of cabs readily available at the hotel and they have pre-negotiated rates to various oft-traveled locations, which is really nice). â€¢ Pool â€“ As previously mentioned, this hotel is family-friendly. If you object to kids, then keep this in mind. If, on the other hand, you are looking for a place that has activities designed for children, this is a great option. At the entrance to the pool there is a big activities board that lists all the goings-on for both kids and adults each day. At the towel desk, they also will loan out books and games for all ages. Beach chairs are plentiful, umbrellas do cost extra. Bar staff will wait on you while sitting at the pool and/or beach (the drinks are wonderful, but beware, they will sneak up on you). â€¢ Beach â€“ very rough, yes, but people were still swimming and there are many local young people who surf with boogie boards. The hotel keeps the beach clean. There is plenty of sun to be had on the beach for those who find the pool area too shaded. â€¢ Security â€“ plentiful, both inside the hotel, on the beach (Police on horseback, Police on scooters, Police on bicycles), and in the local area itself. We felt completely safe at all times. We stopped and chatted with one local lieutenant (tiente) who gave us some excellent tips about where to eat off the beaten path, etc. There are panhandlers, as in almost all cities, but they are not as aggressive as Iâ€™ve seen elsewhere and the police keep a pretty close eye on them. Primarily they are soliciting change from cars at intersections or outside of shops. â€¢ Misc: Hotel elevators were prompt and high-speed and all in good working order, meaning we never had to wait more than a few moments for an elevator. Lobby bar is definitely the happening spot for dancing at night, offering different themes/styles of music on different evenings. Casino is small, but nice. No smoking in the casino, unlike Vegas. There is a small grocery/liquor store two blocks from the hotel (turn left as you exit the property) and a 24-hour Walgreens (does not sell alcoholic beverages) across the street. There are many restaurants offering any type of food you can think of, within easy walking distance of the hotel. El Dorado, a few blocks away and on a back street, offers a lunch special for $5.50 from 11-3 (you have to ask for it) with everything from chicken to pork chops to seafood and plentiful portions. If you are traveling with young ladies in your group, be aware that there is a tremendous amount of construction going on, and the construction workers are the same as in any other city. They sometimes pay more attention to the sights, than what they are supposed to be constructing. There is very high-end shopping a few blocks to the right as you exit the hotel â€“ Gucci, Vuitton, Cartier, etc. We went on a catamaran trip with Eastwind Cats - snorkeling trip to Culebra - which was totally wonderful and worth every cent! â€¢ All in all, we loved it and will be back. We may stay at La Concha next time â€“ also a Marriott-owned Renaissance property â€“ once their construction is done, as it seems they have fewer children and are a touch more upscale (check out their lobby and pool area â€“ ultra sophisticated.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Marriott in April 2008”
Reviews.Author: yasi218
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our mini-vacation in San Juan, PR in Mid April, 2008. We chose Marriott because we trusted their chain all over the world for the professional service and clean rooms. Marriott San Juan is a perfect place to stay if you'd like a comfortable, clean room at a great, well-maintained place. Our room was on the 18th floor with beautiful ocean view. The hotel gets a little crowded at night due to live entertainment in the bar area, but we went out to Old Town San Juan every night and only can speak of one night we spent at Stellaris casino. To those who complain about the beach being closed: red flag meant there were waves and swimming was not recommended, you could sun bath as much as you wanted: I bet you would complain about the hotel even if it were raining. The beach is wonderful with comfortable lunges, literally two steps away from the hotel entrance. The beach itself is not the best as all the beaches around the island-you need to visit surrounding island if you want a great beach experience. The hotel has rather expensive Internet access of $15 per 24 hours and pricey breakfast for $25.00 which is not the best, but definitely better than surrounding restaurants. The Tuscany Italian Restaurant on the hotelâ€™s ground floor is one of the best places for Italian food. I would highly recommend this hotel to couple without kids and those who rent a car on the island because of hotelâ€™s location being pretty far away from all the historic sites and clubs and restaurant in the Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Marriott by the beach”
Reviews.Author: booncanlas
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel the first week of April 2008. Many restaurants within walking distance. Well maintained hotel and very clean. Room was clean, bed nice and comfortable. Hotel restaurant was good and had a great Puerto Rican dinner buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ChefTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked the Marriott San Juan, opting for a beach hotel over the boutique hotel in old San Juan. That turned out to be a big mistake, since the beaches were closed for our entire trip, due to high winds, making the pool area a total mob scene. Our rooms were very nice, with beautiful views of the ocean, extremely comfortable beds, and very nice bathrooms. The rooms were spotlessly clean, and we found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. The problem? The common areas. Obviously it's a casino, and that should have tipped us off, but there's absolutely no quiet spot to have a glass of wine or a relaxed after dinner drink. The big, loud bar, which dominates the main floor, has a slightly sleazy feel, as does the casino. Yes, we played the slots and had fun with it, but, aside from our rooms, there was just nowhere to escape.

Reviews.Title: “pretty resort/great location”
Reviews.Author: BethEmilio
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Juan this weekend and had a very pleasant stay at the Marriott. My husband and I traveled with our 2 sons, 8 and 11. We arrived last Sunday, and we were pleasantly surprised by being able to check in early...I thought we'd be wandering around the hotel until around 4 pm, but we were in our room by 12 noon! That was great, as we changed and hit the beach. Yes, the water is ROUGH, but so much fun...my kids had so much fun riding in the waves that my husband and I joined in! It was a blast...I guess it could be dangerous for smaller children. The pool wasThe lobby was nice and there was a lot of activity there every night. It was not crowded when we were there, but I bet it gets very tight, as the tables are cramped together. I went to the casino for just about an hour, it was fine, but small. We rented a car from Charlie's across the street for 3 days. It was great to be able to go back to Luquillo beach and even drove to Fajardo to Seven Seas beach. Both are gorgeous.! The restaurants in walking distance were all good. We were limited because of our kids, but we enjoyed Miro ( Spanish restaurant right across the street)..also, Piu Bella for breakfast and gelato was great. We liked Cafe de Angel, really good PR food, good prices.. Also, I would recommend Ummo, the argentinian grill down to the left. Had a great dinner there and it's a very stylish place. We went on a snorkeling trip with East Island Cats, recommended by the hotel and had a great trip. We took a "van" with a group of others to Fajardo to reach the catamaran. On the way there, our van got a flat...(really flat) we had to stop at a gas station...but they sent another van that was already at the marina to pick us up..they got there in 5 minutes, so it wasn't too bad. My kids thought it was quite the adventure. I was worried, but it worked out fine and I would recommend this trip. lots of fun!! I would recommend the Marriott, as a convenient location for walking to restaurants and having the Walgreens down the street. I think I would stay in Fajardo if I returned . it seems all the trips and the beaches are closer there than San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Fantastic! Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: lshewitt
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the door to the moment we checked-out, our vacation at the Marriott San Juan has been absolutely top of the line. The staff were incredible: friendly, professional, and courteous; from the bell hops to the front desk to the pool attendants. All made every interaction a pleasure. The hotel, itself was just amazing. I booked the pool/ocean view room, full expecting a view of something unpleasant with just a peek at the ocean. What we found was an incredible vista of 2 gorgeous pools surrounded by gently swaying palm trees with a turquoise ocean just beyond the palms. I was stunned. This was my view for much of my stay while we sat on our balcony. It made for wonderful breakfasts. The room, itself was immaculate, with well-appointed furnishings and an amazingly comfortable bed and wide-screen TV. Usually, I spend very little time in a hotel room while vacationing, but the pleasantness of the room and the view made the room a destination, itself. In fact, it's the most time I spent in a room on a vacation. And it was wonderful. The pool and beach areas were fantastically clean and well-kept, with enough lounge chairs for everyone, even on a crowded weekend day. The location of the hotel, right on the Beach, within central Condado makes it very convenient to some of the best restaurants, Old San Juan and El Yunque rain forest. I just have one small complaint. The internet access is not free and at $14.95 per day is pretty steep. Also, the bandwidth is not very good. Even within my room, I rarely had an excellent connection (mostly good or very good) which made using video and Skype problematic. We can't wait until we can return. My wife commented today that this is probably the best hotel that we've ever stayed and I absolutely agreed.

Reviews.Title: “loved the marriott”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandLee
Reviews.Content: I was planning a girls getaway , no kids, no husbands and was looking for that perfect fit. We all agree we found it at this Marriott. The location was perfect, walking distance to shops and restaurants. The hotel lobby bar had awesome local music and was always busy. Security was always around and that was a concern of ours before we went. I must mention though that the island seemed very safe. To walk to the restaurants and shops was not a problem. The staff was beyond accomodating and friendly. They would go out of their way to be helpful. The only negative points I need to mention are the beach-water is extremely rough. Red flag each and every day. Also, the beach is not all that big to be able to take a nice walk. The other negative (not for us since we enjoy the sand) is the pool-it is shaded till about noon. All of us agree we would come right back here for our next getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar!”
Reviews.Author: travelduck111
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the San Juan Marriott after our cruise. The location is absolutely perfect - right on the beach in a great area of San Juan. The rooms are nicely maintained with flat screen televisions and marble bathrooms. There is a nice size casino on premises as well as a lobby lounge with music and full bar. The pool is huge with a wading side and hottub. I especially liked the employees of the hotel. The security staff is all around and very friendly - not at all like the Miami Beach bouncers. The front desk person was also very nice but I could not talk her into a free upgrade. The only negatives I found at the hotel was the guy setting up beach chairs and umbrellas. I nicely asked him to set up an umbrella for my wife and he walked right past her and left the beach with the umbrella laying next to her. Also, the concerge with short black hair was on the phone when I approached the desk. I waited five minutes and she never even acknowleged my presence. Are you ready for some travel duck tips? 1. The hotel has two sections: a main tower and a cabana tower. In my opinion, you want to be in the main tower and insist on a room above the 10th floor. We had a city view room on the 11th floor and could still hear street noise below. Of course, the ocean view rooms are nicer but will come at a cost. I was very happy with the city view room which actually had a nice view of the city. Just don't spend the money for an upgrade and get a "pool view" room in the cabana tower or a floor lower than 10. The cabana rooms are set farther back from the beach and the lower floors appear to have palm trees blocking some of the rooms. 2. Who likes to spend $18 for a breakfast. If so, enjoy breakfast in the hotel. If you like to spend $3.95 for eggs, bacon, toast, and unlimited good coffee then walk across the street to your left to Piu Bello (the gelato place). When you get there, you can sit outside and enjoy the people passing by. The lunch menu also looked good. 3. For an amazing dinner option, walk 15 minutes to your right across the street and go to Ajili MÃ³jili. The restaurant is fabulous and don't be scared away by the fancy exterior. I found people dressed nicely and very casually in there. The meal was very reasonable - $70 for two people including appetizer, nice tip, 2 entrees, and one drink each. Speaking of appetizer, you must order the sampler platter (1/2 order for two people is more than enough). You can thank me later. 4. For lunch options, try Latin Star down the street. - also reasonably priced Puerto Rican food but a more casual setting. Avoid paying $3.25 for water at the hotel by stopping at Walgreens across the street to stock up. 5. Enjoy a drink at the lobby bar at night which gets quite lively with the locals. I was there and ending up sitting next to a local who was passed out at the bar in his swimsuit. He woke up and bought these four older ladies from New York some drinks. However, the older ladies refused the drinks and told the nice local to get lost. They went and talked with some guys from New Jersey. I ended up having one of the drinks with the nice local. Okay, why am I telling you this story? Back to the tips :) 6. The beach is beautiful but the surf is extremely rough. Don't let your little ducks go in the water very far. 7. A taxi to Old San Juan will cost $12. Don't be ripped off. Better yet, walk to the bus stop and catch the bus for $.75 (exact change needed). While at the bus stop, you will find a few other tourists from the hotel so you can split a cab as another option. 8. I found the streets very safe to walk at night with police everywhere. Of course, use common sense but walking to the above destinations should be perfectly fine. If you want any more TD tips, please feel free to ask!

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust this hotel - they ruined our vacation before we got there!”
Reviews.Author: Connecticut-Family12
Reviews.Content: My family was excited to stay at this hotel. We are a normal family from New England and don't consider ourselves at all to be the "high maintenance" traveler type. We were traveling with 2 adults and 3 children ages 3,9, and 12. We booked our flights and were ready to go. That is until we ran into the brick wall that is the Marriot reservation system. We literally spent 3 days speaking directly with Marriot staff regarding our VERY SIMPLE ROOM REQUEST - 2 adjoining rooms with 2 double beds in each room - which we needed because of our young children. We travel extensively and we have NEVER experienced anything like the treatment we received from the Marriot staff. The bottom line is that Marriot was going to charge us $6,000 for two rooms (which we were ready and willing to pay), but they could not guarantee that 1) the rooms were adjoining and 2) that each room had 2 double beds. In an era of computers, i could not believe that they could not grant our request. I spent HOURS upon HOURs speaking with Marriot staff and managers at the reservation desk an the front desk at the hotel itself - each time, the story was different. Finally, a reservation agent said we could have a suite with two double beds and a pull out couch, which would have worked well for us in lieu of the 2 double rooms. But i had not seen this configuration offered on the hotel website so, before i booked it, i asked "are you sure the hotel offers this suite configuration." The answer was a very firm "yes we do". A few minutes after we booked the reservation, the confirmation email arrived and stated that the reservation was for a suite with "one king bed and a pull out couch". My husband and i became so frustrated and distrustful of Marriot's service that we cancelled our plans to go to Puerto Rico - with our young children, we could not afford to arrive at the hotel with all of the unknowns we faced over the phone. If this was the "honeymoon" how as the "marriage" going to be. We will never stay at a Marriot again based on the gross incompetence that we dealt with while booking our stay. And we are still mystified that Marriot could not confirm a stay with two rooms with double beds in each room - it doesn't make any sense to us!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Condado Beach Area”
Reviews.Author: nwinnette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino for 2 nights prior to sailing on the Crown Princess. On a previous visit to San Juan we stayed at the Marriott Courtyard Miramar. There is no comparison. The Courtyard is downtown with few amenities and not too safe area after dark. The Resort Marriott is great. It offers activities around the great pool area and multiple restaurants. There is a swim-up bar at the pool, beachfront bar/cafe and a lobby bar. We were upgraded to an ocean view room upon arrival when we mentioned that it was our anniversary. The room was spacious with a flat screen tv, lounge chair w/ottoman, desk/chair, inroom safe, and one of the best hotel beds we've experienced. The bathroom is also spacious with very nice amenities--robes, slippers, upscale products. We did not bring our laptop, but there is a Business Center where you can use one of the multiple computers to check email and print boarding passes. The Condado Beach area is very nice and safe. There are many restaurants within walking distance, both upscale and casual and lots of shops. There's a Starbucks across the street and a Walgreen's drug store within a few blocks. There were all age groups staying at the hotel with activities for all. Our only complaint/comment would be the "resort fee" added to the daily room rate. For us it was $19.50 per day and included a daily bottle of water, lounge chair/umbrellas @ beach, room internet access, wireless in public area/pool, free local calls, $5 casino match play coupons. Not sure why this wasn't just include in the regular rate? It's not like we had a choice! That being said, we would still definitely stay there again when visiting San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: WENEEDAVACA
Reviews.Content: Very clean and friendly hotel in the middle of the upscale Condado district. Conveniently located near Old San Juan; you must visit El Morro. You can take a bus for just 75 cents each way [busses run inconsistently], or a cab if you prefer. Cheap rental car place called Charlie's across the street is recommended versus the onsite Hertz rental. We drove to the rain forest and Luquillo beach [very close to one another]. Highly recommend for a day trip. Near Hotel there is good selection of shopping and restaurants. If you can't be without your Starbucks, there is one across the street, and a big Walgreens just blocks away for anything you may have forgotten. However I thought the hotel coffee was superior to any Starbucks. Hotel has a casino, or you can go to others nearby. HOTEL staff was VERY polite and helpful at every turn. They really want to please you. The lobby gets quite loud at night because everything is in the lobby area. Food in Condado area is very expensive. Mini frig in room is good for keeping water bottles , juice, snacks, etc... Plenty of convenience store options nearby to stock up on these. Restaurant selection in the neighborhood is good, though we did not have any outstanding meals at any of them. La Concha down the street has good tapas, but again expensive. We had our 2 kids with us, because it was spring break. My younger one had fun, my pre-teen was a bit bored. Nothing really for teens to do at hotel. Pool is small for a hotel of this size -- no deep water for diving, and no swim lanes if that is important to you. 2 Shallow connected pools and water slide make it a good pool environment for families that have YOUNG kids [under 10]. Swim up bar is convenient for lunch. Beware on the weekends [especially holiday/school breaks]-- this place gets swamped with people, making it hard to get pool/beach chairs. They have a club membership for locals to join and use the facilities, and when we arrived Easter weekend, it was a ZOO! Ocean is very rough, so recommend taking day trips to calmer beaches like Luquillo or Isla Verde, particularly if you have kids and/or like longer beach walks. My kids had a blast at Luquillo, and they have lifeguards there as well as bathrooms, food, parking etc... NOTE: Most beaches in PR are public, and many including the hotel do not have lifeguards. There are some unsightly graffitied buildings adjacent to the hotel beach area, and lots of police around for some reason, so if a serene gorgeous tranquil beach is a high priority, this is not the beach for you. I recommend this hotel for people who will venture out, rent a car and take advantage of all the things that the island has to offer -- there is a lot to see and do! However if you are coming for an extended stay and want a place with lots of things to do on the premises and are NOT willing to venture out, then this hotel is limited in its amenities/activities. Also, there is a decent health club [enjoyed using it], complete with staff, and an adjoining spa [didn't use; heard it was okay]. You can keep up with your workout while on vacation. I noticed that many people are out jogging and walking for fitness on the Condado, probably due to its flat terrain. Seemed to be a popular place for business travelers to stay due to convenient location near business districts, and airport. It may seem that I didn't like the hotel, but I did. I just wish that it was less crowded when we arrived on the weekend; during the week it was noticeably less crowded making for a more enjoyable experience. Perhaps during a NON-school break week it would be more relaxing. The weather was beautiful and spring is great in PR, because it is warm without being overly hot. Summer in Puerto Rico can be extremely uncomfortable due to the very strong sun and high temps. No matter what time of year you travel to PR, bring lots of sunblock, and some aloe in case you get burned. Also, hat/visor and sunglasses are a MUST. Have fun and, Welcome to the island of enchantment!

Reviews.Title: “Location Leaves A Lot to be Desired”
Reviews.Author: Dana4U
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is since - although it is dated and shows the wear both inside and out. (The interior of the room has been updated - but not the building itself). Not sure if we picked a bad week to travel (the week after Easter Sunday), but the place was packed with kids. Not that we are anti-children, but we are anti-loud screaming and over crowded pools. The hotel is right between two properties that are completely run down and looks as if they have just been bombed out. Not at all what we were expecting from the photos on the Marriott web-site. You can only walk the beach in one direction due to rocks going the other way. There are only two restaurants in the hotel and one of them is only open for dinner. By comparison, we stayed at the Casa Magna Marriott in Cancun last year and were expecting the same type of resort this time. Boy were we wrong - the two are nothing alike and neither are the neighborhoods. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere to stay (maybe the Ritz) or choose another destination altogether!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: joanColumbus_OH
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the San Juan Marriott. We have 2 teenage girls and promised them a few days at the beach. We had full sun each day and came home very tan. We got an umbrella on the beach each day and tipped the chair guy - we did not get charged for the umbrella. Check-in: Our room was not ready when we arrived (3:30 p.m.), but they ended up upgrading us to an oceanview room, and that was worth the wait! It was fabulous to keep the door open & fall asleep to the waves every night. We also got $100 off the room for the delay. Get a room on one of the top floors! Disliked: If you want to sit by the pool, you will either be in the shade or need to move your location throughout the day. Full sun area was only on the beach during our stay. Staff: They were helpful to us on nearly every occasion. The only snag was the concierge area...the hotel was sold out during our stay so if you wanted their help for dinner, you would probably have to wait. The bellmen, front desk, housekeeping, etc. were very responsive. Food: We only ate at the La Vista once, upon arrival when our room wasn't ready. Pricy but decent. The rest of the time, we either went to Old San Juan for dinner or walked to the numerous places along Ashford Street, and enjoyed our meals every time. Tip: Stock up on beverages or grocery items across the street at Walgreen's...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Reviews are right on”
Reviews.Author: jadevai
Reviews.Content: Still here on March 28th. All the reviews I read on this website have been spot on. The rooms here are decorated nicely and seem to be "newly renovated". I would definitely give the rooms a 10. I am sitting here with my laptop writing, with the balcony door open and I can hear the ocean waves hitting the shore. I am here with my wife and 6 teenage kids. We have been sleeping with the balcony door open and the beds are so comfortable! We are on the third floor in the "tower" overlooking the beach. This is a PERFECT room and location. We have 314 and 315. There is a shorter adjacent building called the "cabanas", I don't know much about it, but I can tell you that this room and location is awesome. If you are coming here to relax on the beach it is perfect, if you are a pool person I might think twice. The pool is ok, but not one of the better ones. My family has no interest in hanging by the pool here. This is not a "trendy" or modern hotel either. It is a cross between a business hotel and a family hotel. The casino is right in the lobby and there is a nice bar there as well. The staff here is great. Everyone here is helpful and nice. Ashford avenue (the street the hotel is on) is a great street to walk up and down. There are great restaurants up and down. Last night we ate at a place 2 blocks down on the left side. I can't remember the name of it but it had a green awning and we ate under it. It was phenomenal! A little pricey, but expected. The service is slow around here, but I expected that. This isn't NYCity. All in all, I would definitely recomend this hotel and area; we are having a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxing stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: MadCity23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott for 7 days with our two young sons (9 & 6). We found the hotel safe, the beach clean and beautiful and the pool was great because there was no deep end so we could relax a little more than usual. The room was clean and the beds comfortable and the staff was incredibly courteous and friendly. The only drawback for us was the food--La Vista restaurant didn't exactly offer fresh or inspiring cuisine. But this is the only on-site option for lunch and to please the small-child palette. Admittedly my husband and I are "foodies" and would have been very adventurous if we'd been without the kids, but for poolside snacks we were stuck with La Vista. Our kids were perfectly happy with the cuisine there--although after a few days even they got sick of chicken nuggets and hot dogs. It was, without a doubt, incredibly expensive for what you got. At nearly $400 per night for the room and note even an included continental breakfast, this was a VERY expensive vacation. We got from this vacation exactly what we needed--an easy to reach, relaxing locale that didn't require too much work and negotiating food choices for the kids. I would stay at the Marriott again with kids. If we were going without them, however, we might stay elswhere on the island away from the big-box food chains. Another observation about food--the restaurants we went to were all incredibly expensive. It wasn't unusual (even away from the hotel) to spend $120 on lunch and more on dinner. And we didn't even go to what Frommer's deems "expensive"!

Reviews.Title: “Updated rooms but not much else”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBeachguy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at literally hundreds of Marriotts and the rooms in this one were very nicely updated with new furniture, new bathroom with granite, and a fresh makeover. The location is great and close to stores and great eateries and a Starbucks literally across the street! You can also tell this is an up and coming area with very high end shops six to eight blocks away and lots of new development. It's also on the beach which is nice, and actually larger than many other hotel beaches on the island. The casino is decent size although pretty tight. It only receives 3 stars because of the following: pool - it looks huge from the picture but one of the pools is a kiddie pool, leaving only one for hundreds of guests. food - a disaster. We ate a brunch at the place downstairs and the food was so terrible I didn't eat --- and I always eat. Plus it was pricey. staff - not helpful or friendly. Had a double billing on an internet charge and the front desk acted like it was my fault and even talked about me in Spanish with a coworker in front of me apparently not knowing or caring I understand Spanish. lobby - none to speak of except the bar and many tables/chairs set up for the dance floor which was very popular with locals. Interesting to watch, but not every night. kids - tons of them. If you want rest and relaxation, good luck. Maybe your timing will be better than ours but it was crawling with kids whose parents thought vacation meant letting my kids run around screaming and yelling at each other. Note --- the pool was a mini waterslide. Sitting in this are is hazardous to your health haha. Do yourself a favor and rent a car. See the island and go to the beaches. Beware of the cabs if you don't speak Spanish. Many tried to inflate the cost and di not use a meter. Make sure you know the cost from the hotel to "hot" spots like the mall or Old SanJuan and give them the money plus tip. Don't ask how much? You'll get a different answer for the same trip each time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: purplejenn11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3/8 - 3/12 at this Resort, using points. We had a great time. As many have said, the service was really top notch. All employees really went out of their way to be polite and to try to help. The room was comfortable. We spent our days at the beach. It was a bit windy, but I found that to be refreshing with the heat. It was $12 to rent an umbrella for the day and this was charged to your room (they didn't take cash). Chairs were abundant and the staff was helpful in setting them up. The ocean is very rough, but it was fun to battle the waves and to body surf. The conceirge lounge was excellent, especially the views. In all, I would really recommend this Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: innov8
Reviews.Content: My room looked out to the swimming pool and the beach. The view was breathtaking! Book room above 5th floor to avoid trees blocking views. Check-in at front desk was slow might due to busy weekend. Love the view, bed and bedding, bathtub, even the shampoo. With Starbucks across street, and fabulous restaurants within walking distance, I did not bother with room service or and hotel bar. Could not use the swimming pool (someone fell and died that evening), otherwise my stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Middle of Everything”
Reviews.Author: kellygirl67
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed at the San Juan Marriott for three nights (Mar. 6, 2008 through Mar. 9th) as a girl's winter getaway weekend. We arrived for check-in early (around 1:30pm) and were told that they had assigned us rooms but that they weren't ready yet, so they held our bags in a storage area near the front entrance and we were given a claim check to pick up our luggage when we got our room keys. Instead of sitting around the lobby (or pool) to wait for the rooms, we decided to take the tour of the Bacardi Factory ($35.00 to get there by taxi although the tour itself was free) and decided to stop for an early dinner on the way back. We took the ferry from the area near the Bacardi factory (taxi- $3 pp to get from the Bacardi Factory to the ferry and then $.50 for the ferry itself). We ate at La Mallorquina in OSJ and then caught a taxi back to the hotel ($15) so we didn't get back to the hotel till after 6pm at which time our rooms were ready. We got two pool/ocean view rooms w/ double beds on the 11th floor which were clean and very comfortable with a very nice balcony and view. I noticed that our bathroom door squeaked but I fixed it using some lip balm... Our A/C also made a strange clunking sound every time the blower cut off but we quickly got used to it. As other posters have mentioned, the lobby does get loud w/ the local musicians each night, but we couldn't hear it in our rooms at all.... We went downstairs for a drink in the lobby bar and to check out the casino our first night, and noticed that the locals outnumbered the hotel guests 2-1 in the lobby bar and casino (and even more so on Friday and Saturday night) but we weren't treated any differently by anyone (ie. bartenders or casino staff) because we were hotel guests. On Friday we ate breakfast across the street at Starbucks even though they do have a small 'market bakery' food area right in the hotel lobby where you can buy pastries, bagels coffee etc.. then went on an organized tour of El Yunque rainforest and Luquillo Beach. When we got back to the hotel at 5pm we went to the beach but were told exactly at 6pm that the beach was closing (not sure why they close the beach at 6pm each night?) so we moved to the pool area~which says it closes at 7pm although I always saw people in the pool area past 7pm (at least in the hot tub area). As other posters have mentioned, the pool area doesn't get sun until later on in the day and then only for a little while, but I took a quick dip and the water wasn't too cold for me. There were several kids in the pool too although I noticed that the water slide was dry (I hadn't noticed earlier in the day whether it had been working then or not). The air temp. was about 80 degrees every day and the only rain we had the entire trip was late on Saturday evening and it was very brief. After our quick stop at the pool we went to our rooms to change for dinner and ate dinner at the Hotel restaurant Tuscany's (Italian). Everyone enjoyed their meals and afterwards we went upstairs to have a drink in the lobby/bar and listened to the music for a while although it was a little disconcerting because the hotel had a "Mexican" theme night so they had both a Mexican Marichi group playing and then they alternated that music w/ the local latin salsa/merengue group. We were all tired from our tour so we went to bed around 11:30 pm although I'm sure the party in the lobby lasted until Saturday morning (the casino stays open till 4am). On Saturday we had breakfast in the hotel 'casual dining' restaurant La Vista and although I only had a bagel my friends had the breakfast buffet and said everything tasted pretty good. We went to the beach until noon (there were plenty of chairs and umbrellas available at that time and I always saw several piles of extra chairs so finding a chair was no problem and the hotel staff was very good about moving beach chairs around and setting up umbrellas for guests). I read another post that mentioned the umbrellas cost extra to rent and while we didn't get one ourselves I didn't notice others who did get them paying the staff so I'm not sure whether they're included as part of the resort fee they tack on (approx. $21.00 per night per room) or not? We went to our rooms to change (they had already been cleaned!) and took a taxi into OSJ to go shopping and have a late lunch/early dinner at the Parrot Club. Later on that night, we got a little hungry so we went to La Vista a little before 10pm (I believe they close at 10pm) and the waiter was very accomodating even though they were about to close up for the night, when we said we only wanted to have dessert and coffee. The desserts were all delicious!! On Sunday morning, we went to the beach for a few hours before check-out and then headed up to shower and check-out by noon. After checkout we had a drink in the lobby bar and left to catch a taxi to the airport at 1pm for our flight back home at 4:45pm. We were advised by our taxi driver that the airport got very busy on Sundays so we got there by 1:30pm and while it was busy the USDA Agricultural checkpoint and the TSA security checkpoint lines moved very quickly so we sat around waiting for our flight for about 2.5 hrs. All in all, a very nice trip... Each hotel staff person we encountered were all very friendly and attentive and we would definitely return to the hotel again as it was a perfect area in the middle of everything in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property.......Take a sweater!”
Reviews.Author: pallmalls
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a Marriott property that might be a fun vacation. I travel quite a bit and stay at Marriott very often, so once a year we decide to go somewhere warm. Last year we stayed in St. Thomas at the Frenchman's Reef Marriott, and decided to try Puerto Rico this year. The hotel was immaculate. We were greeted at the front desk and received an upgrade due to my Marriott status. We had an ocean view room which was very clean and enjoyed the king size bed and flat screen TV. The pool area was very large, but too many trees around the pool which blocked the sun. We had to move our lounge every hour or so to find the sunny spots. Also, San Juan is very windy, and I am not talking about soft tradewinds, these were very strong at times and blew our towels and shoes around the pool deck. We asked some of the locals and they confirmed that it was always that windy. If you are out of the sun and the wind picks up it can get very chilly. Pros 1. Very Clean Hotel 2. Very friendly staff 3. Tuscany Restaurant was amazing (Get the Osso Bucco) 4. Pool Bar made great drinks (Get the Rum Island Tea) 5. Other food choices right near the hotel (Go To Level 25 at the La Concha Resort) 6. Starbuck's across the street. 7. Executive Lounge at hotel was great for a light breakfast. Cons 1. Windy....Very Windy 2. No sun at pool 3. Beach was nice, but wind gave it a sandblast effect. 4. View down the beach was of old abandoned buildings. 5. Food at La Isla not so great.

Reviews.Title: “perfect getaway for couples!”
Reviews.Author: TimandMikki
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have two little kids. We needed a weekend getaway for just the two of us, badly! Let me just say the San Juan Marriott Stellaris Casino was perfect for us. I don't know where to start but first of all it is very clean. The beds were quite comfortable. The hotel is right on the beach, so you leave the door and you are there. There is a great outdoor pool with a swim up bar. Lots of chairs and palm tree shade. As for food, my wife and I chose not to rent a car (airport to hotel and vice versa transport is a breeze) so for food we walked everywhere. There are lots of great little Mom and Pop restaurants within a few blocks of the place. The food was great. We did not eat at the hotel, so I can not tell you about that food. For one night, we went to Old San Juan. We met another couple at the hotel bar and we checked it out together. We took a public bus on our way their and a cab on the way back. Both were really easy to do. Even intoxicated. I can't think of a bad thing to say about this place. My wife and I don't gamble, but we did notice the casino wasn't that great. But then again, we don't gamble so it didn't matter to us at all. I highly reccommend that you spend a few extra bucks and get an ocean view room. We did. It was really well worth it. We slept with the balcony doors wide open and could fall asleep to the sound of ocean waves.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Marriott, beware if you're looking for sun at the pool”
Reviews.Author: MattnKel402
Reviews.Content: My husband and I split our time between the Ritz and the Marriott on our trip to Puerto Rico. Besides the value, the Marriott impressed us more! We experienced great service, very nice rooms, and enjoyed the live music at night. The balcony was a great feature that we missed when we moved to the Ritz. We took advantage of the club level appetizers and desserts, and they were great. The restaurant recommendations and knowledgeable staff were better at the Marriott than the Ritz. My only complaint is one that the Marriott canâ€™t help, but you really need to pay attention to. Their building blocks most of the sun from the pool, most of the time. So at a given time of day, there are about 10 chairs in the sun. If youâ€™re staying on business, Iâ€™m sure the Marriott was great. We were there to relax in the sun and get away from holiday stress, and we really had trouble finding a sunny spot to layout. There were plenty of available chairs, just none in the sun. Might seem like something you can overlook, but it was actually very annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: lilmic1976
Reviews.Content: (This review was written by a frequent traveler with no kids.) Pros: 1. Clean, nice rooms, nice bathroom 2. Great staff 3. Nice beach- waves good for "jumping," boogie boarding, plenty of available lounge chairs on the beach 4. Clean pool 5. Condado area safe. Upscale shopping in walking distance 6. Nice restaurants in walking distance. 7. Short $13-16 cab ride to old san juan, airport and isla verde 8. KID friendly with small water slide 9. Tijuana is a restaurant with relatively cheap but good mexican food across the street- again kid friendly. Good for lunch 10. The drinks were really tasty at the pool bar Cons: 1. if you're looking for complete and utter relaxation without kids- this is not the place. it is very kid friendly. lots of kids- running around the pool, in the hot tub, etc 2. Most everyone was a business traveler. Lots of spouses/significant others/ friends mooching for a free hotel stay and again lots of kids. 3. The pictures of the pool on the website is deceptive. Half of the pool is really a kiddie pool-(shallow). The other half of the pool is pretty small. And kids mostly swim in the "adult" half because it has a small water slide. 4. Not really a romantic or relaxing place to stay because of the kids./families (BUT, everything is nice, clean. It's just small, so there will be kids splashing you and crying occasionally. It wasnt terrible, but the first thing i noticed was most everyone was staying with someone on a business trip)

Reviews.Title: “Solid Marriott”
Reviews.Author: WallyJr
Reviews.Content: We visited this property for a long weekend getaway and the fact that we were able to take advantage of very low airfare. We wanted a relaxing weekend of beach lounging, casino gaming, and Caribbean dining. This property delivered. While not in the newest section of beach properties (like Isla Verde), it had a great pool area and an adequate but small beach (with free chaise and umbrellas) that was fairly crowded over the weekend. We were upgraded to a Jr. Suite on the 20th floor which was very nice and quiet. The only complaint would be that the bathroom was pretty small. It was nice to view the city, beach and Old San Juan from our balconies. The casino is smallish but hosts most all table games and poker. I found the employees very friendly and bilingual. We enjoyed the local music performed at the lobby bar - it made you feel like you were in the Caribbean!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Iamuzak
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Marriott. We went with our 2 children (7&9). Here's the good and bad: We liked: 1. The kids loved the pool area, cascading water and waterslide. (Waterslide only open at certain times though.) 2. Beautiful beach location. 3. Nice, clean rooms with great housekeeping staff. 4. Friendly & accomodating front counter staff. 5. Fantastic Italian resturaunt in the hotel. The food at La Vista was not so good. IE: A couple of days the pancakes at the breakfast buffet were nearly fossilized. In another instance, at an outdoor BBQ, we had a chef grille 3 hamburgers for us. I had to take the burgers back 3 times because it was grossly undercooked: very bloody. Not typical food from a Marriott. Perhaps a bad week. Overall, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: annieb_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the San Juan Marriot and truly enjoyed our short vacation. The hotel is a quick, 15 minute, ride from the airport and Old San Juan is also a 15 minute taxi ride. . The resort is spotless, the staff is very friendly and helpful, the restaurants are very good for hotel restaurants and rooms are beautiful. The beach is very clean and there is staff to assist with beach umbrellas and chairs. What truly sets this hotel apart from other San Juan resorts is the employees. The hotel manager could not have been more accessible or helpful, the concierges worked tirelessly but always with a smile, the busy casino staff were terrific and the waiters at both Tuscany and Vista restaurants were great. Security staff was abundant and friendly. The only slight disappointment was the ocean was too rough for swimming during our stay--but the two pools are lovely and well maintained. Don't hesitate to stay at this hotel!!! The location is the best and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hopping Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from Puerto Rico. We had a great time. We usually stay at a Marriott Resort when we travel because we don't like surprises. This particular Marriott was very clean, the staff was very friendly and the location suited our needs. We wanted to be in an area where we could jog in the morning and walk to restaurants at night. It was also a short taxi ride to Old San Juan where there are many terrific restaurants. We ate at The Parrot Club, Marmalade and Sonne in Old San Juan. My husband said he had one of the best Filet Mignon's in his life at Sonne's. In Condado we ate at Ajili-mojili and Ropa Vieja. Ropa Vieja was very good but the staff had a bit of an attitude. This particular Marriott is not up to par with some at other locations(i.e. Aruba and Harbor Beach in Fort Lauderdale). One reason is that the pool area is small and very shady. The hotel just didn't have the same feel as some of the others. It wasn't as fancy maybe.. But the hotel lobby is jumping at night! There was great energy in the place and I loved watching the locals dance! The beach is nice but there is so much construction going on in the area that the view along shore is not the nicest. It's not terrible but there are a lot of cranes in the area. Just face your chair towards the ocean which is a beautiful blue and you'll be fine. The area is being built up tremendously. We had an ocean view room so we did not see the other buildings while sitting on our deck. It's very true about the rough water. A father and his son had to be pulled out of the water because the waves were forcing them up against the rocks. If you are looking for a clean room, with nice amenities in a central location then this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott Stellaris”
Reviews.Author: lvs2cruz
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night post cruise and thoroughly enjoyed the room with ocean view, helpful front desk and gorgeous pool and beach. We were on the 12th floor and had a wonderful double bed ocean view even though booked through Priceline. Great litle place for sandwiches and wraps down the street across from Walgreens. Taxi to the airport was $15 + tip. Beach waves were trecherous but sand was clean and well policed - no wandering vendors or hair braiding. Room was spotless and quiet. would definitley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: cam67_99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days prior to our cruise. We had read that upon arrival many people had to wait for their room, which we did also, however, sitting out at the beach bar, with the sound of the ocean and just relaxing after traveling all day was really not a bad wait! Our room had a balcony that overlooked the pool and beach. The views were great. Staff here was very professional and helpful. We received a great recommendation for dinner both nights. One of the nights we went into Old San Juan for dinner at a restaurant called Marmalade. If you get the chance, I would highly recommend having the hotel make a reservation for you. Overall this is a great place to stay and would highly recommend staying if you get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: upintheair-OMA
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review to confirm the previous positive comments. We stayed with Marriott points, had an excellent room with no problems except for a minor issue with the in-room safe which they sent someone up to fix. Location worked well for us with not only the option of a coffee bar in the lobby but the Starbucks across the street. One point to remember (as noted in previous reviews) is the lobby bar area which is a high volume party on weekends. Make sure your room is at least above the 4th floor or so (we were on the 15th) or you'll risk hearing it at night. All in all an excellent stay and we would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend highly”
Reviews.Author: sci
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week at the San Juan Marriott. We booked a room with a city view and upon arrival, got upgraded to a corner room, which is always more spacious and in this case, had two balconies to choose from. The room was beautiful and well maintained - great bedding! Every single person we encountered at this hotel (staff) couldn't have been more pleasant or accommodating. Housekeeping, security, concierge, bar, beach hands, towel keepers, casino workers - everyone is obviously so well trained in hospitality. We were impressed. The beach here is small and if you are one to lounge all day, you will have to position yourself way to the left of the hotel in the morning, so that when the sun hits the hotel around noon, you are not caught in the shade. Being on the Atlantic side, the sand is not the usual Caribbean white powder, rather a grainy yellow. Not that this is a problem, just a heads up. Same with the pool area - while lovely, it is shaded by the hotel and trees. The surf can be wild, and the undertow is something to take seriously. You will not find the calm and gentle waves of the Caribbean on this beach. That said, I think it is a positive. The restaurants in Condado are fabulous. We loved Tijuana's close by. The food is authentic and delicious with great service. The La Mama margarita makes it worth the visit and I'll leave it at that! We also found Budatai to be fantastic, very chic. The whole Condado area has changed a great deal since the last time we visited. The shopping is world class - Christian Dior, Cartier, Ferragamo and Miu Miu are a stone's throw away from the Marriott. Old San Juan is not too far, about a two mile walk, and the restaurants there are worth looking into. We went to Marmalade one night and have to say it is one of the finest restaurants we have ever come across. New York style dining, but reasonably priced - at least consistent with other dining in the area. For those that are concerned about safety in San Juan, I will say that we were both very impressed with the level of security. Clearly, this area is growing and the tourism department is going to ensure that visitors are comfortable, and that the area is secure and well maintained. All in all, I can't wait to return to San Juan. I'd return to the Marriott in a heartbeat. If you are a business traveler, don't give it a second thought. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “JAN 2008 TRIP”
Reviews.Author: tamlyn63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Stellaris Jan. 2-6, 2008. We had a room on the 9th floor overlooking the pool and out to the beach. We stayed here using Marriott points which included the breakfast buffet each day. The buffet was very good , with many choices. The rooms were large, clean and well appointed. The hotel staff were extremely personable, courteous, and helpful. We did not eat any lunches or dinners at the resort, but looking at a menu, the prices were comparable to most of the nearby restaurants (kind of pricey). The only downside I could find were the drink prices were high. I recommend if staying there and going to Old San Juan, take the bus from the stop right in front for $.75 pp. Up the street to the east is a nice restaurant called Via Appia's with good food (Italian) and reasonable prices. There's a grocery store a couple blocks away where you can get packaged liquor and snacks n stuff. I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASK1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a good position in San Juan. We stayed there post-cruise. This was not our first visit to San Juan - 7 months previously we stayed (again post-cruise) at the Intercontinental - but the price quoted this time was outrageous. The Marriott was more reasonable. We arrived at 10 am and were immediately allocated a room, which was ready (this shows the merit of being a Marriott card holder). It was a very nice room, large, on the 19th floor, sideways on (which is the best position). So we had a good view of the sea and also had the sun on our (very large) balcony from about 12 noon until sunset. Full sea view rooms are not the best as the hotel faces northwards and so the sun will never shine on these balconies. We had free wireless internet, in the room, with the "resort package", which worth the extra payment. The hotel and immediate area has plentiful, very good restaurants so eating was good. And the hotel's breakfast buffet is good value. The main downside to this hotel: the pool is in a position such that the sun does not shine on the pool area except for a very short period during the day. But, we had our balcony ...........! All in all we liked the hotel, had little to complain about and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mschorr
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a family trip to this hotel. Overall I was very happy with our experience. We traveled with our two children (13 and 11). We booked a suite with a king bed. Upon arrival, only a suite with two twin beds was available. We could have switched the following day but chose to stay with the original room. In addition, were able to have access to a hospitality suite on the top floor. Although this cost an additional $50/day, we felt it was well worth it. We went there every morning for breakfast which was mostly cereal, yogurt, bagels, etc. Coffee and juice of course. This was perfect versus having to go to a resort restaurant for breakfast. In the evenings they had light snacks and an honor bar. The staff in the hotel couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. The casino was pleasant and just enough for an evening activity. The gym was serviceable though 1 elliptical machine isn't enough. We had dinner in a few of the local restaurants near the hotel and they were quite good. The negatives were this property is located on a small beach with only about 1/2 mile of beach. Pretty tough to take a long walk on the beach when it's so small. There were no water sports like wave runners or sailboats like other carribean resorts. The water slide was a bit small for my older kids though they enjoyed it. I felt this was more like a hotel with a pool on the beach versus a resort. Clean, nice rooms, eager to please staff, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Marriott”
Reviews.Author: MA99
Reviews.Content: Stayed post cruise 12/30/07 - 1/01/08. We booked two oceanfront rooms. What a view!! Great amenities at this hotel - nice pool (although chilly - not too many people swimming with an air temp of 86) more people in the ocean. I have read on this board before that the waters are rough. Although the waves look like fun, they are very deceiving because of the undertow. My husband and son both got caught and my husband got pretty banged up. Try to stay as far away from the rocks as possible. On the day we were leaving, someone was rescued via police boat and helicopter. Again, take caution!! We didn't eat at the hotel. We did eat at a pizza place down the street and a breakfast/lunch/ice cream place right across the street - Pubello's (I think). Hotel prices were very high. My son ordered a cheeseburger/fries/soda for $ 15.50. Starbucks and Walgreens right across the street. New Year's Eve we went to a Japanese Restaurant one block down from hotel. Excellent and the kids enjoyed the cooking right at our table. Lots of security at this hotel which makes you feel good. The area right outside the hotel is not the best. Lots of police present on this main road and on ATV's on the beach as well. Went to Old San Juan and visited the forts and did some shopping via taxi - $ 19.00 for six of us.

Reviews.Title: “truly disappointed..Marriott bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: informedtraveler01
