Reviews.Content: My post cruise stay at the Marriott Stellaris over New Year's was quite a disappointment! My family arrived at 10 AM and by 3PM they still did not have our "suite" ready. Mika the front desk manager refused to give us our room # though all our friends and other hotel guests that arrived after us had their rooms. We understand that check-in is at 4PM, but, if rooms are made up at noon there should be no reason for a guest staying in a $1000 per night jr. suite to wait 6 hours for a room. When we arrived, we confirmed with MIka that we were waiting for our "brand new ocean suite." We had high expectations considering we paid $830 plus 21% per night.. $1000 for our suite times 3 nights $3000..of which our credit card was charged, a "non refundable rate!" At 3:45 Mika finally told us our room # but said we could not go up since the room was not ready, I decided to take a peek because something did not sound right..especially when Mika said the city view suites are nicer because the ocean is pitch black at night. I entered room 2003, the supposed jr. suite, while the housekeepers were still cleaning up. It was a total view of the city and there was 1 average size hotel room with a king bed and small sofa. I almost fainted when I looked into the room next door that didnt say jr. suite and was told it was a regular room...same size as my "jr. suite." The Marriott knowingly put my family in a room(with a sign outside that said jr. suite), the size of a hotel room with city views and tried to charge me for a suite! I immediately went down and spoke to the very nice "hotel manager" and he said they had "no suites" and he would get me a regular room. This new room was lovely, but, i had booked a suite and it seems Marriott has no trouble booking and charging for suites and putting guests in regular rooms. This new room had the mustiest smokiest smell,but, at this ppoint we were out of options since our credit card had already been charged...and it was New Years weekend. A night front desk manager, who did not know my story, said room 2003 "is not a suite" it is a regular priced corner room...and that the suites have 2 rooms. Additionally, the beach is shady and you have to keep on moving your chairs..not to mention the red flag is always up and they tell you the ocean is dangerous. The pool and "hot tub" are freezing and shady as well. For the prices the Marriott charges for their "resort," there should be turn down service, and chocolates on the pillow would be nice. I was told this was a a non smoking establishment, and I smelled smoke in various locations, not only in my room. Additionally, the lobby is one massive Bar with "blasting" music, hi-top tables and bar stools, The management has 'removed all couches" and does not cater to its guests... New Years Eve, the Marriott recommended we go to the Caribe Hilton since the Hilton was having a party. The Marriott had "sold" its hi-top tables with bar stools to the local residents. They roped off over 80% of the lobby. The hotel guests were delegated to a "back dark corner of the lobby." No hats, noisemakers, or lit space for the hotel guests! They made a make shift bar with some bottles of alcohol as well as a price list for drinks. ..because the gigantic real bar in the lobby was closed to hotel guests....not very festive for News Years Eve. Our children sat on luggage racks at the front of the "lit" lobby then we all went to bed before midnight. Not bad for a "hotel that charges $600 a night including taxes, " over Xmas week. This hotel is not for families, asthma sufferers or for people that want to relax at a resort. Hands up to you J.W.!

Reviews.Title: “hotel administration is horrible”
Reviews.Author: JABOTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: We took our extended family there for seven nights Christmas week. We checked into our 5 rooms and we had executive lounge privileges. One of the rooms was not the ocean front room they promised, but they said it could be changed the next day so we had no problem. When we changed the room the next day they insisted on taking away all five rooms executive lounge privileges even though we had paid for them. They claimed that we had only requested those privileges and that they hadn't been granted, even though the previous day they had seen that we had those privileges when we checked in. our travel agent called them and they hung up on her! It was unfortunate, to say the least. The day we left we had to be at the airport at 3 so we asked if we could keep one room until 2 pm and put all our luggage there and shower there. They refused. When they picked up our luggage from our rooms at noon they said they had no where to store the luggage until we left at 2 and we had to stay with our luggage!! I gave the bellhop $20 and then he found a place to keep the luggage. I know it was a busy time but the completely unprofessional and disrespectful way they treated us led me to give this hotel the thumbs down. As far as other issues, the beach is nice, but the surf very rough and kids do get swept in every year and die. The pool is ok. The rest of the staff was good. The Italian restaurant (Tuscany) was disappointing. The concierge staff was accomodating. Some of our rooms were unusually small, but others were fine. Oceanfront rooms have good views. However, overall you should stay away from this place until they change their management

Reviews.Title: “not the best beach”
Reviews.Author: LTB87
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nice and clean. the casino was small. it is right across the street from a nice bar. but the beach wasn't that great. it was pretty desolate, the only people on the beach are the marriott guests and since the hotels around the area are broken down and not as nice it isn't as well kept.....if you are looking for a nice beach with much going on...i wouldn't stay here

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Marriott in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: irishrabbit
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott San Juan Resort post-cruise December 15-17. We have stayed here previously for a week, but for the most part, have stayed here either pre or post cruise numerous times. This most recent stay we were in the cabana rooms overlooking the pool/ocean on the 3rd floor. The renovations on these rooms is wonderful. Our room was a pale yellow, with the curtains & matching bedspreads. The entire room was carpeted with a medium yellow/gold carpet. Furniture is a medium colored wood. The spacious bathroom had tile floor, & a gorgeous sink/counter top area, with plenty of room for our personal items. We especially liked the bath/shower, as the curtain rod was shaped half-moon, so when you are showering, the curtain didn't stick to you. This room was extremely comfortable for our needs. As always, this Marriott had extremely quick & efficient check in, plus the convenience of auto checkout, where you settle your account over the phone & don't have to stop at the front desk when leaving. The staff was very friendly & helpful, & the bellmen out front were always quick to open the door for us, and get us a taxi for where we were going. We highly recommend this Marriott for it's convenient location (easy for pre-post cruise, as its close to the pier), and for a quick trip into Old San Juan. The pool area is clean & there are plenty of chairs. The rooms are spacious, & freshly re-done. The staff is top notch, from the bellmen, front desk & room service staff.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott in Condado, San Juan, PR”
Reviews.Author: TravelOliver
Reviews.Content: For a second time I had the good luck of obtaining a room in the Marriott San Juan for a 2 week business trip I have every year for my job. As expected, the service was flawless, the rooms were spotless, and I was able to get a room with a view on the newly renovated tower on the 9th floor overlooking the pool and half the beach. Valet parking, although a little pricey at $18.00 a day, it is well worth it, parking yourself is usually stalled by a long line to leave the only exit at the multifloored parking lot. The restaurants in and around the hotel were excellent, you get all types from the high end restaurants to inexpensive authentic local cuisine. I was there on Halloween night and the staff were all dressed in pirate attire which made the night a little more whimsical. Overall, a great stay. I cannot find any complaints on this stay, I recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the heart of Condado at that price range. Only warning, the beach right in front of the hotel is not the safest. It claims a life every other year from tourists who do not read the safety signs posted all around the beach, for a real beach experience, just walk up towards Isla Verde, or get a cab/bus to take you to Luquillo or even farther east in condado the waters are less chopy with no undercurrents.

Reviews.Title: “Dec 07 stay in PR”
Reviews.Author: NYC_yuppie
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the San Juan Maarriott resort in Dec 07. I have to say that the hotel itself is great, the staff is very helpful and nice and the property is well kept. On the flipside being our first time in puerto rico ( me & my girlfriend NYC yuppies in mid 20s) there are a couple of things that are were new to me. Anyways, to summarize: The Good: * nice property, friendly staff * located prettly close to old San Juan (12 USD cab ride) The So - So: * the beach is not so nice. very small, has a couple of moldy in construction buildings around * the hotel is located in the Condado area of San Juan which is basically a residential area for rich old people there (hence no bars, etc, etc) What we did not like: * there are basically no restaurants / bars / terraces in the area that one can go to and have a well priced meal and hang out with a good crowd * the hotel has 3 restaurants - 2 are good but quite expensive. the third is bad (how can you mess up a burger and still charge 14 bucks for it???) * there is no miami type beach area (beach is very small with some residential buildings next to it) * if you are in your 20s or 30s and wanna have fun this is not a place for you (no bars - the hotel has one but it's only a 50 and above crowd there....) * it is very pricey there....if you think you are in the cheap part of the carribean....think again... hope this helps for any future takers. as a general comment on puerto rico that has nothing to do with marriott me & my girfriend were quite surprised that everybody seemed to have an attitude there - what i mean by that is the "you need to be thankful that i do this for you although this is my job" attitude (again the Marriott staff was very nice and no complaints there) but this is quite different from the other experiences we had in Mexico or Dominican Republic for example.

Reviews.Title: “Weathering the Storm”
Reviews.Author: SilentSeeker
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay here. Unfortunately the weather was horrid most of the time. Subtropical storm Olga kicked up as soon as I arrived and ruined two days of my stay, and made the next two only tolerable weather wise. It was finally nice when I left. Ha! The hotel is older, but newly renovated. Everything inside is nicely decorated, including some nice holiday arrangements. It was very clean in all areas. There are two restaurants, one casual (La Vista), one slightly more formal ( Tuscany's). The food was good, the service very nice. There was a good lunch buffet at La Vista with excellent dessert. They weren't too pricey either, for a hotel. But they weren't really local cuisine. I ate there mostly when convenient as the weather kept me in at times. There are also several small venues for coffee and sandwiches. There is also a Asian noodle bar in the casino which is pretty good. The casino is decent, there are a couple BlackJack tables, some 3 card poker and Texas Hold'em games that go on. Of course many slot machines are there as well. I didn't get to use the Spa services, but the Fitness center was pretty good, fairly well equipped with modern machines. The room I had was pretty small but very nice. It had a fantastic King sized bed, a nice 32 inch LG Flat screen, and all the typical amenities including Internet access. The balcony was nice and large. Everything was clean and daily cleaning service was prompt and well done. The pool was beautiful, but very shallow. It was more form than function. For some odd reason, the whirlpool was only for use up to 6pm, which is when I believe they turned off the heat. This seems silly, the best time to use the whirlpool is at night. The beach was right off the pool, but only marginal. Scenery wise there are several hotels around that look like they may collapse at any moment and there was construction next door. This hotel is in the city, don't expect a beautiful remote tropical beach. So with that said, the sand and water are nice, no seaweed or rocks, no jellyfish when I was around. The surf is DANGEROUS and UNGUARDED. The red flag was up the entire time. But if you are careful ( adult ) and a good swimmer in shape, the waves can be a blast. Condado is OK, but I would not really bother exploring it much given the Old San Juan is minutes away. Old San Juan is a fantastic old city with much to explore. Great shopping, restaurants, clubs, and history. It is great fun to just walk around it. I would recommend this hotel as a base, Puerto Rico has a ton to do, so I would just use this place as place to relax after exploring the island. Unfortunately for me, I could only do that a couple days. Liked: Service in all aspects, room ( bed, tv, balcony), beach access, pool, lunch buffet Disliked: Condado, beach aesthetics, whirlpool hours

Reviews.Title: “quality in all areas”
Reviews.Author: Marcs12
Reviews.Content: My review of this hotel will be positive in all areas, but I thought it was important to start with------------- MUST READ ADVICE: If you're staying at this hotel with children, you can't let them swim in the beach! No lifeguard on duty, large rocks close to the hotel perimeter and a very dangerous under-toe are all reasons to keep your children by the beautiful pool. We found out that there are numerous deaths at the beach each year, so its something you have to be strict with your children about. Beach: The beach is beautiful and throughout the week its very private. Nice waves all year round if you're into surfing or boogie boarding. High water temperatures and a sparkling blue color make it very pleasent. If you're not a strong swimmer you can still enjoy the beach because the waves don't crash directly on the sand...you have 10 feet of calm water to enjoy; (again, i just wouldn't trust any children to stay within the calm waters unless you're with them). As soon as you walk onto the sand the cabana boys set out your beach chairs wherever you want to lay out and once in a while waiters will come on to the beach at your service. Extremely relaxing place to lay out with great views in multiple directions. The beach bar is a great place to have a drink and even watch the games and the bar tender there is superb! Pool: The pool area has its own bar and even a slide. The sun doesn't hit the entire pool area, so you might have to move around a bit as the sun moves around the hotel, but there are more than enough chairs to find a good spot. With views of the ocean, there's just nothing not to like about the pool area. Lobby/Casino/dance floor: This is what seperates this hotel from any other in the Condado area. The casino is a decent size and its open 24 hrs. The lobby has a great bar which seemed like it was 24 hrs as well. Also, there is a great band that plays Latin music at night. Ther were always people on the dance floor, and during weekends you'll see some locals dancing at a near professional level. Lots of fun late into the night! Food: The hotel makes the best Pina Colada you will ever have. Make sure you try it with and without alcohol. You also won't find a better mojito. Seriously, the pina coladas and the mojitos in the hotel are a trip highlight!!! The pool bar, beach bar, and lobby bar all make these drinks the same way, so you can get them any time. The restaurants at the hotel are high quality as is the food on the room service menu, BUT, the prices are high and you can do better just outside of the hotel. I'll elaborate on this more in a bit, but I guess it makes sense to dine in the hotel for that one or two times a trip when you really don't feel like walking a few blocks. Rooms: The rumor is that the hotels upgrade your view for fairly cheap...You're shelling out nice money to go to the Caribbean; Go the extra mile and get the ocean view!!! I enjoyed sitting on the balcony for about an hour each day and you will too. The room itself was very high quality. Nice beds, nice flat screen TV, nice bathroom, nice decor...The room was perfect! Service: Top notch in all areas. I hate when people leave their one bad service experience in these boards...pay no attention, the staff knows exactly how to serve its guests! I was continually surprised at just how willing they were to pamper their guests. Surrounding area: The biggest pleasent surprise for me about my trip was Ashford ave. (the street the hotel is on). Walking directly outside of the hotel you have everything you could ever want. Bars, dozens of great restaurants, internet cafe, starbucks, food markets, fast food chains, puerto rican food stands, great clothing stores, gift shops, more casinos etc. etc. etc. Do yourself a favor and take a few walks in both directions on Ashford; its really a classy street! -There's a restaurant open 24 hrs called STAR a block or so down from the hotel (make a right out of the hotel). Full bar (with great margaritas) and tasty authentic Puerto Rican food with outdoor seating. Great for breakfast, lunch or a 2 AM snack! Walk 5 blocks down from there to find two great restaurants for dinner: WAIKIKI and ROPA VIEJA. Both have a good bar, good food and outdoor seating facing the ocean!!! There's a Japanese Hibachi place almost touching the hotel called Cherry Blossom. Its no better than other hibachi places you'd find, but its a nice place with good food and its so close to the hotel that you might as well go. We had a good dinner there. Everyone loves to give tips on where to eat on Ashford, but the truth is you really can't go wrong with anything there. Tours: I think its imperative to either do a tour of the rainforest or to do a boat tour of some of the near-by islands. We took the Caterman tour (booked it right in the hotel). They take you on a nice boat to a beautiful beach and they bring you to a great place to snorkel. Its really a nice day for 90$ a person including food and even drinks! It was worth the money. Next time we're going to do the rainforest tour; we heard good things. $$ saving tips: -Old San Juan- they do tours in old San Juan...Save the $40 per person...Just take a $12 cab ride in and explore the area yourself. You'd probably find this to be more enjoyable anyway (Its not a museum; its just an interesting little city and you don't need a tour gide to enjoy it!!!) -The rooms have a refrigerator...Do yourself a favor and load up on drinks, fruit, snacks, water, even alcohol at the nearby food markets, walgreens, or liquor stores. -Don't eat more than once in the hotel...better food cheaper within 2 blocks of the hotel. + eat lunch cheap at some of the little in-door food stands. -don't rent a car....its just not necessary...the airport is a $15 cab ride and everything else is in walking distance other than the rain forests, which you should do with a cheap tour anyway!!! It was hard to find a good review (no offense to others) when i was thinking about booking this trip. Looking back I can't believe i let some of the other reviews make me hesitate on booking the trip, because we had a blast and it was pretty reasonable. For this reason, I tried to put down exactly what I wish I had been able to find (an honest, realistic, and thorough review)...so i hope it was helpful..Enjoy your trip! any other ?'s, you can email me at marcs12@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: pbennetts
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel and I am PICKY PICKY PICKY! I use to manage a hotel so I notice don't accept so so service or accomodations. We had a 15th floor corner ocean room with a balcony facing the pool and one facing the ocean. The balconies wrapped around the ENTIRE room! Worth EVERY PENNY! The beds are very comfy! There is a fridge in the room with bottled water left every day. There was also an executive club offering breakfast, pop, juice, water, fruit, cheese and hor dourves with happy hour each day on the 21st floor with an amazing view of the city. This is not offered to every room so ask in advance. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Concierge goes the extra mile to assist you. The doormen and taxi driviers have no idea where you are going so have directions and name of where you are going in hand ahead of time. Everything you need is at your doorstep. Starbucks, restaurants, shopping, drugstores, Old San Juan, airport, and Charles Car rental will come to the hotel and pick you up. You don't need a car as taxis are quite affordable but if you want to explore the island or go to El Yunque a car is your best option. The beach is clean and has a boardwalk near you. The wait staff brings drinks right to the beach and even though they are a bit pricey, you get your monies worth! Very yummy and very potent! The gym has up to date equipment with great locker rooms and sauna. The massage was out of this world! We ate at La Vista for the Thanksgiving Buffet and again outstanding. I highly recommend a restaurant called Pamela's. I have been there in 2005 and now in 2007. One of the best restaurants I have been to with not the highest pricetag! Many awards on the wall. It is a short taxi ride there from the hotel. Also Carli's Concierto Cafe in Old San Juan has great service and live jazz perfomed by one of the origianl Beach Boys! There is live music in the lobby and dancing. Did a boat excursion with East Wind Tours that was amazing. You must see the secluded islands, breathtaking! Didn't gamble but the casino looked nice and full of people. The only suggestion I have for the hotel is to have room service 24 hours and offer appetizers and maybe extend the hours of the pool area to just be able to sit down in that area and enjoy the outdoors. They close it off at 11. Also the bellmen need a computer outside to locate where you are going to. I would also start the service at the pool at 11 as opposed to 12 for the menu and drinks. Other than that this hotel gets FIVE STARS in my opinion. It is very hard to get what this hotel offers in the Carribean. I have been to many and this is the first hotel that has delivered what they advertise! Good Job Marriot Stellaris! You should all be very proud!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Base to Experience Other Areas of PR”
Reviews.Author: travelhappyfamily
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review with a few notes: 1 - we were staying free on Marriott points. I'm an elite member of their rewards program. 2 - we travel a lot and have experienced all levels of hotels...from the cheapest to the best. 3 - we had two travel-friendly kids in tow. This hotel is a solid choice if you're looking for a good value at a chain hotel in Condado. We were upgraded to an oceanfront room (315) with a great view of the beach. The bathroom was nice-sized and the little balcony was perfect. The music/entertainment downstairs never disturbed us, and my kids enjoyed the bands. The pools are very nice - especially the kiddie pool if you have little ones....and they loved the water slide. The beach is always cleaned each morning, and there are a number of security attendants keeping an eye on it. Get a beach chair early and park yourself near the rocks...otherwise you'll get caught in the shadow of the hotel later in the afternoon. Staff is attentive and friendly - very good with our kids. The Condado neighborhood is up-and-coming - lots of construction going on around but we never heard it. Within several blocks you can find the Walgreens, Starbucks, DunkinDonuts, Wendy's, Subway if you need them. Take a taxi to Old San Juan - it's easy to get there and back. The forts are beautiful and it's fun to roam the streets (we felt very safe). My seven year old son is a history buff and loved OSJ. We ate at Aijili Mojili on Thanksgiving - I wasn't that impressed...but it is an easy walk from the Marriott. Rent a Jeep from Charlie's and go to El Yunque - it's amazing. Stop at Luquillo in the afternoon - so pretty! Overall, you can't wrong with the hotel - it's lacking in personality of Puerto Rico (generic hotel room) but is a convenient and friendly spot to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: RichDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice: -- The rooms were recently redone so they are in good shape and kept clean. -- The location is excellent . . . on the beach and a short walk to some shops (including the much mentioned Walgreens) and a lot of different restaurants for different budgets. -- We tried the breakfast buffet and dinner buffet once each and found them to be of good quality and variety. -- Plenty of parking for a fee. -- The pool area was nice. It was pretty empty most of the time we were there so you could always get a seat, as was the beach. -- It seems to be the nicest hotel in the area. However, Marriott Renaissance is opening a hotel called "La Concha" nearby that may be even nicer. Any complaints we have were not significant:: -- One day the housekeeper did not make up our room until 5:45 pm which was inconvenient and puzzling. -- The music in the lobby in the evening was too loud. Our first room was on the 4th floor and we could hear the music in the room. -- The pools are very shallow ... only 4 feet deep at the deepest. And while there is a hot tub that is supposed to be for "adults only" (according to a sign) that policy never seemed to be enforced and the hot tub was taken over by little kids most of the time we were at the pool. -- Our second room was on the 9th floor and had a nicer view for the same money as our first room on the 4th floor. Both were supposed to be "city view" but the second room had a partial view of the ocean whereas the first room had an icky view of the parking garage roof. The noise from the A/C units was too loud on the 4th floor balcony too but fine on the 9th floor balcony

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality at San Juan Marriott”
Reviews.Author: maryland_traveler27
Reviews.Content: I went to San Juan with a group of friends to celebrate several milestone birthdays. One of the members of our group really wanted to go to this property and called almost weekly until there were openings here. It was worth her hard work. The rooms were spotlessly clean and had the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful (which may be a bit unusual in San Juan according to friends). We were able to check in early and the concierge set us up with a lovely birthday dinner for our group. The property is beautiful and well-maintained. The beach at Condado does have strong currents and might be dangerous for children or those who are not strong swimmers. The rooms include a flat screen TV, a balcony with nice lounge chairs, hairdryer, iron and ironing board, bathrobes, a small refrigerator and sink. The showers include a nice line to hang out your wet bathing suits. The water pressure in the showers was not great, but was certainly adequate - who is in a rush to get through the shower on vacation anyway? My only complaint, and it is minor, is that the music in the bar / lounge / reception area during the evenings was so loud that my ears hurt. Otherwise, this was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned!”
Reviews.Author: jam1016
Reviews.Content: Be sure and put all locks on the door when in the room unless you want unexpected visitors. I had a man come in my room at 12:30 AM when I was sleeping - to "Shampoo the carpet"! When I screamed, he took off. Otherwise it was a nice vacation. We enjoyed the beach, historic sites, restaurants, etc. We would go again but not stay at the Marriott. The Hilton looked like a better choice if we ever return to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ERCUR
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Rooms were immaculate, just refurbished. Public areas as well were immaculate. Stayed on Pool/Ocean side. If you have rooms on upper floors you can see the ocean, but also see the parking lot next door and construction of other properties going it to the left of the building. Keep in mind that the low-rise rooms are closed and under renovation. This did not present a problem as there was virtually no noise due the renovations . Staff: The staff at this hotel go out of their way to make your stay comfortable with one exception. I saw at least half a dozen waitstaff walking around the pool area in the 4 days there - was never once asked if we wanted anything from the bar. Nancy, the concierge, is especially nice. Very knowledgeable about the city, restauraunts, etc... Beach: Beach area was nice but many cigarette butts in the sand. I think the Isla Verde beach is a bit better. If you want a nice beach without crowds, best to rent a car and go to Luquillo or somewhere outside of the city. Remember, Puerto Rico has 365 beaches, go see them!!! This hotel is not in a 'hotel strip' like Isla Verde. Marriott seemed to be the only major hotel in the area. There is a lot of construction in this area with couple of new high rise hotels/timeshares being built. In a year or two this area of the Condado will be 'hopping' . Dining: Lots of good places close by. Ajilli Mojilli, a traditional Puerto Rican restaurant is a 5 minute walk (try the mofungo with shrimp)! Didn't eat at hotel except for breakfast bar near lobby which was perfect for what we wanted. Very fresh bagels, croissants, etc... I would return to Marriott Stellaris Resort again for a long weekend. Seemed to be a nice all around place for families and singles as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: joanwSandsPoint
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over the weekend. The room was just redone so the linenes, furniture and bathroom were new. It is a very self contained property as the beach is small and right downstairs, pool , gambling. There are quite a few restaurants that are very good and walkable for the nightime. The hotel is 15 minutes from the airport. It was a great weekend and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DearJenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott from Sun, Sept 30 to Thurs, Oct 4. We took a cab from the airport to the hotel which was very simple....$14 to hotel. Check-in was easy and quick. We arrived after noon and they let us in the room early. Our room was in the tower on the 11th floor. The room was clean and elegant...2 beds, flat screen tv, balcony...we had a city view room but we could see the ocean perfectly from our balcony. We just couldn't see the pool. From our balcony, we could also see construction on a building below but we never heard noise. The balcony had two chairs and a small table. In the evening, the hotel turned down the beds and left us cookies/candy and a post card...this was really special. The beds each come with four pillow so I didn't need to request extra. Room had a mini-fridge, coffeemaker and hairdryer. Housekeeping did a great job daily and we didn't have to call them. The room was kept clean and neat. Hotel staff was one of the friendliest I have ever encountered. They seemed to go above and beyond to be friendly and accomodating. A newspaper was delivered to the room each morning. The lobby had music at night with a live band. We found the casino slots to be tight but we did see a few people winning. The pool complex and beach were beautiful. Both areas were very clean. Room service was delivered promptly and hot. It cost about the same as the buffet in the downstairs restaurant and I found the room service food of better quality. Overall, the Marriott was beautiful and I would return if I travel to San Juan again.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is great and i'm a picky guy!!!”
Reviews.Author: WNJS
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel - checked in at 11am and the room was ready, booked a double through travel agency and upgraded to jr suite. ocean and pool view with avaradge size balcony with great chairs. housekeeping was great room was always perfect with plenty of bottled water. executive lounge was great it will save $$$$ esp. breakfast and soft drinks. fruit was always available. the women running the lounge were the best and made are stay great. the concierge at the front desk was great. bellmen. were great. once you go to the pool or beach it doesn't feel like the city is right outside the door. food at the hotel is overpriced go to dannys for a taste of italy (walk out the front door of hotel and make a left and go to 1and a half blocks). big portions. if your room has a fridge go to wallgreens across the street and fill it up. i have been to 28 destinations including cancun (12 times), aruba, and puerto vallarta and i have to say - THIS HOTEL HAD THE BEST STAFF ANYWHERE!!!!!!! and i also have to say I AM THE PICKIEST TRAVELER, IF I DON'T LIKE SOMETHING I WONT HESITATE TO COMPLAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Still My favorite”
Reviews.Author: CLCB0911
Reviews.Content: Why I love the Mariott..I love the condado area..the hotel its renew have everything its new..mini-Refrigerators...the personnel for me its outstanding they are very friendly..... .there always something to do at this hotel.....I love the Pool....I dont like the beach but if you Liike lots of waves this beach its for you.... for me i was so happy to stay there again after 2yrs..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so great rooms”
Reviews.Author: pixiefly99
Reviews.Content: The location is great since it is so close to the airport. My friends went with us and paid for the same type of room we did. When we went to our room you wouldnt beleive how small it was and the view was terrrible. It was supposed to be ocean view but you had to lean way over the balcony to even get a glimpse of the ocean. Plus, we had a great view of the roof right below us and some hotel that was under construction. Our friends room had a great view of the ocean and it was so much larger. The bathroom they had was huge. In our bathroom you could have brushed your teeth, used the toilet and washed your hands all at the same time. Thats how small it was! So we had our room changed and they didnt charge us at all. It was a much nicer room thankfully and larger. I wouldnt stay here again because the price is not reflective of the room you get. I would stay down the street at another hotel that was much cheaper and still just as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice MidWinter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: AHFox
Reviews.Content: My husband, 7 yr old son, and I took advantage of our Marriott Platinum Rewards to stay here in February. We needed to escape the dreary NJ winter for a few days.. This hotel is convenient to the airport, probably a fifteen minute cab ride. The airport, by the way, is probably one of the best in the Caribbean - completely modern and updated. It could have easily been mistaken for a Florida airport. Cancun should take a lesson or two from San Juan. The hotel itself is fine - however, be advised that this is an urban location, in the Condado district, not on an isolated stretch of beach as some may imagine. The room is very small by Marriott standards, It was easily the smallest bathroom I have ever seen in a Marriott! We had an ocean front balcony, which provided a beautiful view. The concrete balcony had a step down, which was clearly noted by a sign on the sliding glass door. However, since there was no lighting for the balcony area, it was easily forgotten at night. I missed the step on my way out at night, and broke a toe, and scraped & bruised my legs. Something to keep in mind if you are traveling with children. The beach area was very wide, lounge chairs were readily available, no complaints. The ocean was fairly rough, but not enough to discourage my husband from a swim. My son loved the waterslide at the pool. There is also a swim up bar located in the section where the slide empties into the pool, which is convenient for keeping an eye on your children. The employees at this hotel were all outstanding. Extremely friendly, competent, and customer oriented. I found that all the people we encountered here spoke English far more fluently than many employees of hotels we've visited in Florida! Would we stay again? Perhaps, but I'd probably try to check availabilty at the Courtyard on Carolina beach, for a more isolated , less "city" type of location.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property”
Reviews.Author: Valkyrie01
Reviews.Content: Holding a conference in Puerto Rico during hurricane season can be a gamble, but booking your accommodations at the San Juan Marriott is a sure thing. You will be welcomed and hosted by a highly trained and personable staff, pampered by very comfortable rooms (especially those offering ocean views), and completely satisfied by dining selections at the on-site restaurants. While all beaches in Puerto Rico are considered public, the Marriott's lovely beach seemed reserved for its guests. If the beach isn't your choice, the extensive pool complex will certainly satisfy your aquatic needs. Within walking distance of the hotel are some very fine restaurants and shopping. Overall, a truly enjoyable venue.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elizabethDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights and had a wonderful time. When we checked in we upgraded for $25 a night to a corner room which had two large balconies. The view was amazing. The staff at the hotel are all kind and helpful. I can say this hotel has one of the nicest gyms I have ever seen at a hotel. The pool was a bit small, but since there were not a lot of people there was no problem getting a chair. For food: Pure and Natural- good, healthy, food and Tijuanas for mexican, and there is a small place down the street from the hotel where we ate breakfast for $5 everyday. I would NOT rent a car from Charlie Rental Car Company. The lady at the company told us we would only use a quarter tank of gas to get and from El Yunque so it was not worth it to return the tank full. She also told us that we would not pass any gas stations. When we returned the car the next day they told us we owed and extra $20 because we used 5/8 of gas. They were not helpful at all in resolving this. All in all a great place for couples to relax at the beach and pool for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Leebird6531
Reviews.Content: In August we stayed at the Marriott Stellaris in San Juan Puerto Rico. Our room was very nice and we enjoyed our balcony. We had a half city view-half ocean view room. Some of the nearby buildings were somewhat of an eyesore but the ocean view made up for it. One evening we actually ordered pizza and just ate out on our balcony while we enjoyed the view. The cruise ships were fun to watch come in and out of port. It was fun also to watch a thunderstorm come rolling in from sea. The water on the beach was not very enjoyable - too rough. But the hotel had lots of lounge chairs on the beach available and the pool was nice too. The restaurants were way over priced. The coffee/pastry bar in the lobby was poor. Always a line and everytime we ordered we were disapointed. They either were out of something simple like cream cheese for a bagel, or the pastries we purchased weren't good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort and location”
Reviews.Author: drich6066
Reviews.Content: Resort is in a great location (Condado)! I was in San Juan for both business/pleasure and found it convenient for both. The rooms are updated and very nice. Service is top notch - from the time you check in to the time you check out. I've stayed at quit a few other hotels and resorts in area and this by far is the best. Pool/Beach area are both very nice. I did not use the restaurants, but did have access to the Executive Lounge - breakfast was very nice. Condado is very safe to walk around - huge police presence (because considered upscale area, not because of crime). My 2 favorite places to eat - Pamela's (you can eat at tables on the beach, amazing food/service) and Zabo (great outside eating area, beautiful bar and inside eating area) - food was great (went 3 times). I usually spend more time in Old San Juan, but enjoyed Condado so much, only did 2 nights for dinner in Old San Juan. Al Dente - great italian food (try the gnocchi). I would recommend this resort to both singles and families.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with a family”
Reviews.Author: 5happy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with two kids 10 and 12 stayed at the marriot before a cruise and found the hotel to be wonderful. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were a nice size and clean. We loved the pool and beach. The beach was very clean and uncrowded, there was staff out there to help us with chairs and bring drinks. Atthe pool in the afternoon the staff brought fresh fruit around for everyone and put cupcakes out for the kids. Very nice unexpected touch. We would definately stay there again. If you walk out of the hotel and turn left about a block and a half down is a food store where you can purchase beer, soda, water, etc. and it is much less expensive. If you walk right there is a drug store where you can purchase water, snacks, sunscreen, etc. and again, much less expensive that the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbk1402
Reviews.Content: Overall, had a good stay. I was there from July 7 through the 21st. We had a beautiful corner room #1917 in the Tower which affords a great view of the beach and city. Looks like they were just renovated. Stay away from the cabana rooms though. They are not renovated and the difference between the two are night and day. We booked a midlevel room but because we were Marriott elite members, they upgraded us to an ocean view with the concierge lounge. Great beach front property. They even had a couple of sharks swim close by the beach. Nobody seemed to mind though which was realy strange to us. Also. did not want to leave out that the maid service was excellent! This hotel had one of the best concierge lounges we have ever seen. The food and the views are great and the service even better! Most days we ate there and saved on the food bills. It's worth it even if it cost you to get it. Nicole and Edwin were the best in there! Kudos to them for helping us with the many questions we had and the true service they gave! Seek them out! You can sit out on the balcony while your eating and see almost the entire island. A great view of the sunsets up there too. At the concierge desk at the check in counter, ask for Nancy. She was great in helping out with where to go and what to do. Also, knows alot of history about the island. Great job to her! The local area that it is in at first looks sketchy, but all of Puerto Rico looks like that. Be warned though, there is alot of crime on the Island with the illegal drug trade increasing and alot of gang activity. Hence, why you'll see alot of police all over the place. There are some nice resturants in the area. Stay away from the hotel ones. Very overpriced! Our favorite one was Pure and Natural next to Wendy's. A 5 minute walk from the hotel. An organic cafe that had amazing fresh fruit smoothies and great sanwiches among other fare too. Trips to take - We highly recommend the BioLuminesant Bay at night. This was one of the most amazing things we have ever done. Well worth it! Also went to the El Yunque Rainforest. We booked the trip through the hotel and took the low impact tour which was good. About $65.00 per person all included. Gus was our driver and he made it very enjoyable. He knows every zip code you can imagine too. 1st WARNING - Becareful though when booking a trip on East Island Tours which is through the hotel. We booked one going to Culebra which was supposed to be very beautiful. The day of our trip, we're bused almost 1 1/2 hours to the launch spot only to find out they changed the trip because they said the water was too rough. It did not look at all rough. They indicated that they would refund most of the trip which they did not do. Now we are fighting with our credit card company to see what they can do. We recommend that if it is cancelled, do not go because the couple of places they take you to are not worth the trip or money. Be warrned! 2nd WARNING - While the hotel is very nice, be warned of the fees they charge you. Our hotel room was $220 night. They charge a "resort fee" of 10% which nobody could explain to me what it was for. Finally, a manager told me it covered the "free" internet service (which we did not use), the phone service (which we did not use) and the chairs for the beach (we did use). The last night we were there, I spoke with the mgr and told him that we thought it was excessive to charge us a fee to use beach chairs for what we're charged for the room. He did refund the fee which over a two week period amounted to over $300. Plus, the tax is 11% too. They also sneek in a green tax which again was not explained very well and was taken off the bill. Check your bill out closely the night before you leave and resolve it then, not when you're leaving in the morning. Overall, the good weighed out the bad and we had a good time. But, if your looking for a real tropical vacation, San Juan is not the place. It is a nice place to visit once or twice, but most likely would not go back. The Bio luminescent Bay trip made the vacation worth while.

Reviews.Title: “Phune at 50”
Reviews.Author: phuneat50
Reviews.Content: I went to San Juan to celebrate my 50th birthday and had a blast. The hotel sent me up a complimentary wine/cheese/crackers tray. The Marriott has the best beach. I walked to the end of the beaches and the other hotel beaches sucked in comparison to our beach. The bed were FA-BU-LOUS and the hotel employees where great. The Rainforest Tour was great. I am going back again on my 100th birthday. My resort fee was paid when I booked the hotel and I got charged just $5.00 a day tax. Do that if you can. If you get a beach towel, PLEASE take it back because you will get charged for $20.00 per towel if you didn't take it back before 7:00pm. I was great just to get up in the morning to see the sun rise.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but best choice for the price in the area”
Reviews.Author: vinnyjake
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Juan on business and have stayed in a number of hotels. Lately, I tend to stay at the Marriott and did so when I took my wife recently. Although far from perfect, this is one of the best hotels in this price range in San Juan and I recommend it. The staff was friendly although service is fair at best. Our ocean view room was very good. The bed was very comfortable, the AC worked well and the room was very clean. Breakfast in the Executive lounge was fine. We arrived at 3:30 P.M. and our room was not yet ready. Although we only had to wait an hour, this is a bit irritating given we arrived late afternoon. This happens routinely in other San Juan hotels, but is more prevalent at the Marriott. For those using the pool, it is usually easy to find empty lounge chairs and the beach is never overly crowded. This is not the case at other area hotels so it is a plus for those using the facilities. Hard to find a better deal for the price in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler17
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Stellaris is a very good choice in San Juan. We stayed for 4 nights in late July and had an excellent time. After a quick ride from the airport we arrived at the Marriott and although we were hours early were promptly given a room. I upgraded to ocean view and wow, it was quite a view from up on the 14th floor, very impressive. Room was average size but very clean, tasteful and comfortable. Pool was nice with kind of a strange layout but I think the big attraction at the Marriott was the beach. Hotel provides umbrellas and chairs (don't forget to tip the kid setting them up-it looked like a tough job digging those holes in the sand all day!) so you can just relax and enjoy the beautiful water. As far as restaurants we had breakfast at the hotel, very good selection for the buffet but pricey ($40 for 2 people) and ate at the Japanese place (tasty). There are plenty of places nearby on Ashford Ave. so go out and explore. Ajili Mojili was a walk away and recommended for Puerto Rican food. Also, for dessert make sure to hit the gelato place across the street from the Marriott....so many choices of flavors! Overall we would definitely go back to the Marriott. The staff, without exception, was friendly and the hotel was a very cool scene on weekend nights with live entertainment and dancing. Casino was good sized, fun, and a pleasant way to spend the evening. This is one of the best choices in san Juan for a vacation getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort;But the Service was terrible”
Reviews.Author: NieNie03
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a relaxing time and a hassle free check in this is not the resort for you. I traveled to San Juan on July 27 thru July31st with friends. When we first drove up we were so excited to see this beautiful hotel, but during check in we were told many different things from a 10% resort fee plus a $200 deposit on a credit card and that you had to pay your whole bill up front. I have stayed at several Marriottâ€™s and never had to pay up front. The front desk clerk Ramon was very nice and tried his best to help but needed to get a manager. The manager Christian was not accommodating at all was very smug. I have been a customer service manager for over 10 years and know that there is always a way to please a customer especially when they are spending $225 a night. Needless to say the manager was not willing to accommodate us so we paid for one night and the next day went to the Condado Plaza and believe me the service was excellent and the rooms were hip and contemporary. In closing if you want a place where they don't value the customer this is your resort!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, AMAZING beds, great entertainment, mixed service”
Reviews.Author: LaBoricua87
Reviews.Content: I shall mention that I stayed in 2 occasions: Nov.2006 for 3 nights in a Cabana room (the pictures are from this first time) and July.2007 in a tower room (one night; don't have pictures of these sorry!). I'll make a bullet list of both experiences: ROOMS: *Cabana rooms offer outstanding views, a pretty large bathroom with tub/shower (not separate shower, which not everyone may like), and very comfortable beds. Even though I'm not a furniture freak and everything was fine, when I found out my boyfriend paid about $400/night for the room I almost hit him. Basically, I would expect a much more luxurious room for that price. Pretty much the $400 a night are for the views...and might be worth it, depending on your budget and what u look for "room-wise" *Tower rooms are ok, although I'm not sure if they are kind of small size-wise. I only spent the night with some friends, so didn't have much luggage + can't tell price per night sorry. One one fabulous thing I can comment on, though: that has been THE MOST COMFORTABLE BED AND PILLOWS i HAVE EVER SLEPT ON IN MY ENTIRE LIFE!! NO EXAGGERATION!! I don't know if I passed out right away and slept like a baby because I was buzzed with alcohol or because they were really just THAT incredible. U feel like u are sleeping on a cloud. I wanted to steal that bed and those pillows, darn it!!!!!! SERVICE: *Existent or not existent...that is the question. I had NO problems with the front desk and were helpful the times I approached them. Housekeeping were ok I guess. But at the pool, it can be REALLY bad or just average-good. We asked for a hot dog at the pool one day and waited over 45 mins. for it. Then, when we FINALLY located him, he said he "had forgotten" but at least we got a fresh new one in about 5 mins. and was free. But we were REALLY hungry 45 mins. ago. So however you look at it. FOOD: *The prices all over the resort are outrageous (and this comes from a Puerto Rican that grew up and lived in the island for 18 years!!). Buy stuff (INCLUDING food) outside the hotel period. Drinks at night may be ok to purchase here as prices don't vary much in clubs in Old San Juan. I wouldn't recommend eating in the hotel unless u are ready to spend some decent bucks and to eat JUST in the FINE restaurants. Don't even TRY to order food at the pool! That one time we asked the waiter for a hot dog, we also ordered "nachos"...the nachos ended up being chips dumped from a bag u could have bought at Walgreen's for 2 bucks and the sauce dumped from a Tostitos dipping sauce you could have gotten for $1.50 but of course, not inly it would have been cheaper f you would have walked some mere minutes to Walgreen's, but you would have gotten much more quantity, too *If you want some incredible Puerto Rican and Latin American food at bargain prices, goto *Latin Star* just a few minutes walk from the hotel (ask receptionist). Just to tell you that a plate of spaghettis Puerto Rican style; different taste from Italian!) is just $8.95 and not only I was full that dinner, but also was full with the leftovers the next day at lunch!! So much food served that u may have the option to then share with someone else. ALL the food in this rest. is incredible. I took ALL my American friends + my boyfriend on both occasions I visited the Marriott and they never got tired of it. They also thought the food was superb, as well as the service there! ENTERTAINMENT: *If you LOVE Latin music, u are in for a great treat: the lobby is incredible every single night of the week. Even when I'm just on vacation at home in Caguas I drive there on weekend or some week nights if I can just to go dancing and partying. Don't get me wrong, it is a laid-back, CLASSY "party scene". It's mostly adults ages 35+ at least, depending on the night. But u'll NEVER find 20-somethings around in big groups, if u know what I mean. *All the bands from every night are great and they play salsa, merengue, boleros, etc. *Another great entertainment enter is the lobby of the El San Juan Hotel. Just take a cab there on Sat. nights. Party until 5am++ INCREDIBLE. U'll see bunch of locals here too, as not only guests from that hotel go but residents of Puerto Rico gather on weekend nights just to have some fun and great dancing. The bands are even better here!! I guess that's all I remember. So in a nutshell, I don't know if I would actually stay OVERNIGHT again unless you looove the amazing view from the cabana rooms or the unbelievable bed from the tower rooms. The prices are out there for you to judge. But if you just want to experience Puerto Rico, I advise u to rent a room in a small budget hotel in the area, eat in local restaurants, and just head to the lobbies of these 2 great hotels at night to have a blast, Latin dancing all night!! =)

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: LSB_Phila_Pa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Aug 2-Aug 6, 2007. It was in downtown San Juan, yet a beachfront property. That is an excellent combination. We were in walking distance of most of the restaurants we ate at. The Buenos Ayres Bar and Grill had very tasty Argentinean steak! The Porta Bella italian restaurant was pricey, but you got alot of food for the money. I had the biggest salmon filet that I had ever seen. The lanscaping of all the palm trees in the pool area was very nice. The deepest part of the pool is around four feet. We had a corner oceanview balcony room. One balcony overlooked the pool area and the other balcony looked directly onto the ocean. It was worth the money to book that room. The flat screen tv in the room was a nice size. The bed was very comfortable. The concereiges were great when it came to recommending restaurants. The hotel restaurant was kinda pricey...breakfast costed around $40 (not including tip) for the breakfast buffet for the 2 of us. It was $15 for the taxi ride from the airport to the hotel, which was around a 10-15 minute ride when not in rush hour traffic. The beach was nice; the water was beautiful but is kinda rough. Plenty of people were having a ball jumping the waves or riding boogey boards on the waves. Its definitely more for that kind of stuff as opposed to swimming. The gym was kinda small but we did get in a decent workout with weights and cardio. The cardio machines have flat screen tvs attached to them. The only negative thing is that the walls seem kinda thin. One room next door had kids. Maybe the kids were kinda loud, but there were times when we could hear their conversations...not enough to wake us however. When we checked out I left my cell phone charger in the room by accident. I realized it after we got back home. It took a couple of phone calls to find out if they had it. They did and hotel did send it back via DHL at their expense. We would indeed go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandMom3girls
Reviews.Content: We traveled to this hotel at the end of July. We traveled with my family of five and my parents. When we booked, they would only allow 4 in a room, so one of my kids "stayed" in my parents room. As it turned out we had five in my room, and nobody cared. I requested a crib when I booked, again at check-in, but had to call down for one again in the evening. It was delivered promptly. They also charge taxes that I was unaware of-a daily resort fee and an occ. fee that was $5 a person per day. There was no shuttle from the airport, but getting a taxi was easy and not too expensive. With that said, the hotel was undergoing renovations, but it did not affect our stay at all. We had 2 oceanfront rooms for 6 nights. The rooms were recently renovated-so they were updated and clean! The staff was helpful and friendly. There were plenty of other kids and activities to keep mine busy. The pool pump broke one day for about 6 hours, but they compensated by serving free pina coladas and rum punches all day-we just went to the beach instead. The casino was small and crowded towards the weekend, but a few short blocks away was a larger casino in the Radisson. We also found some great restaurants within walking distance. A taxi ride to Old San Juan cost us about $12. We would definitely book this hotel again-location was good (no airplanes), staff was friendly, and the hotel had everything my family needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: minervenus
Reviews.Content: My two gal pals and I went to the Marriott Stellar Resort and Casino for a little weekend getaway, August 3- 5, 2007. Once we arrived in San Juan, we easily made our way to the taxi stand (where an attendant wrote down our destination, the number in our party (3), and the number of bags (3) to go in the trunk. The fee to get to the hotel (maybe fifteen minutes away) was $16.50 before tax. I was quite pleased with this considering the fact that we had looked into arranging private transportation from the airport, and the cheapest we saw was like $55.00 one way. When we got to the hotel, we were very pleased. There were doormen who helped us with our luggage and quickly opened the front door. Cold water with lemon slices was near the front door for us, and it cooled us off perfectly. Check-in was a breeze, and we were off to our ocean front room (pay extra for this - the view is unforgettable and the ocean front balcony is a wonderful treat). The room was quite lovely and very very clean. Several restaurants and shops are within walking distance (including a Wendy's and Subway...Starbucks and Haagen Daaz across the street from the hotel), but the hotel has several restaurants to keep you on the property as well. There are 5 restaurants if you count the Coffee Merchant (which also serves light meals), but the only place we ate at in the hotel was the La Isla Bar & Grill. For $12.00, each of us got a cheeseburger and a bag of chips, but the meal was real and delicious so we didn't mind paying. They also have other great grill type snacks. We journeyed into the casino and won a little money and also lost some. There were no big payouts for us like in Vegas, but it was still fun. The lobby lounge is a happening place in the evening with live entertainment and dancing. Above everything, I really loved the location and the view. You're close to stores (including luxury stores like Gucci and Cartier within walking distance), close to the bus line which for 75 cents will take you to historical Old San Juan and so many other interesting places, and you have that unforgettable view of the ocean. Because of this, I would definitely go back to this hotel in a minute. Next year, I hope to visit with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: superfig
Reviews.Content: The Mariott resort was very nice and their outside pool area and beach was very peaceful and relaxing. We didn't have any issues with cleanliness or noise. The only thing that was annoying were the elevators ...even though there were four of them, we waited quite some time for them. We stayed in one of the renovated rooms and were very pleased. Our balcony was on the side of the hotel, but we could still see the ocean from our balcony. I wouldn't have paid additional money per night to have a better view, but that's a personal choice. Because my boyfriend has Platinum status with Mariott, we were able to us the Preferred Guest Area on the top floor - if you are able to get access to this room, I would recommend doing it. They had a complimentary full breakfast (so we never had to go out) and at night they had coffee, deserts, and appetizers. The view from this Suite was quite beautiful. I wouldn't reccomend eating at any of the restaurants in the hotel...however, the Pool Bar/restaurant was good for lunch without having to leave the pool area. There are tons of great restaurants within blocks of the resort: my favorites was Dannys for Italian food, Tijuanas for Mexican (take a left out of the hotel for these 2) and for some excellent Puerto Rican/Cuban food we walked 8 blocks through Condado past the Designer boutiques to Ropa Viejo (take a right out of the hotel)...it was excellent! Cherry Blossom was the Japanese Sushi and Grill restaurant next door - it was good, but no different than the same restaurants in the States... By the way, Mojitos were excellent everywhere we went!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: laurajeann
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of reading on the internet and ultimately picked the San Juan Marriott Resort. The resort was beautiful and due to the reviews we chose an ocean front view because reportedly that tower had just been remodeled. the hotel itself was beautiful, and the room was very nice and well decorated. it was a little small (two double beds) but there was a nice balcony and view of the water. It was very easy to get from the hotel to the beach/pool. There were also plenty of activities if you chose including live entertainment nightly. The hotel is located on the Candado Beach area (spelling?) which someone had commented about seaweed and poor people begging on the beach. The only thing we saw was a small amount of dried seaweed in the morning, but the beach was cleaned nightly and there were plenty of chairs and umbrellas available. the pool was also well sized and plenty of chairs available there too. The staff was excellent in terms of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull hotel, best beach around”
Reviews.Author: NissaBaltimore
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and amazed at the quality of the hotel. The rooms were renovated and spotless. The lobby was pretty with great music and big crowds wed-sun night. The casino was larger than I expected too with all the table games. But the best feature would be the wide beach with lounge chairs and clean blue water. I don't know why there were any bad reviews about the beach. It was the Marriots was the best in San Juan, except for the construction in the immediate neighborhood. It's a pricey area and the hotels are being rebuilt. The staff was very friendly and it defintely had everyhting on site. The prices were high for drinks, spa, and food. The restaurants nearby seemed equally pricey, but the food was outstanding everywhere we went. Buenos Ayres 1 block away, 311 in old san juan and at the hotel Tuscan.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: shirleykr
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from 5 days at the San Juan Marriott. I cannot say enough about this fantastic hotel. We were treated like royalty the entire time we were there. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was very professional and friendly. Every part of the hotel was extremely clean as well as our room. We had an ocean view room with a balcony. The beds were very comfortable, the bathroom was large with marble counters,and my children enjoyed the plasma TV. Anything I requested, (wake-up calls, extra towels, extra pillows) were provided to me right away. We spent a lot of time at the 2 pools. My husband and I tanned while our 2 teenagers played vollyball in the pool.The pools are clean and refreshing, towels are provided,and the pools are open until 11:00 p.m. The ocean behind the hotel is great if you like big waves. I am not much of a swimmer, so I could not handle the big waves, however the rest of my family enjoyed the big waves washing over them. The staff put out beach chairs in the morning for the guests to use all day, hearing the waves crashing up onto the shore was very relaxing. There is a Wendys, Subway, Burger King, Baskin Robbins, Dunkin Donuts, and a Walgreens, all within a few minutes walking distance away. We went to El Morro one day, I suggest you take a cab if you want to go. We tried taking the bus, we had to transfer twice, ended up taking the wrong bus, and then missed our stop. The weather was beautiful, even though its hot, there is a constant breeze blowing that keeps you comfortable. We like to go to a different place each year for vacation, however if we ever visit San Juan again, we will, without a doubt, stay at this hotel again, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: worthington
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the San Juan Marriott for two nights after returning from a cruise to extend our vacation a few days (before going back to work & reality). We were in the first group to leave the ship, so we arrived at the hotel at 9:30am! The staff couldn't have been friendlier. They directed us to the health club to change into our bathing suits, and we sunned at the beach & had a delicious lunch in the hotel until our room was available at about 2:30pm. We especially enjoyed the following: our very large and comfortable tower room, uncrowded beach, health club facilities, and good restaurants within walking distance. I recommend the hotel for a great pre- or post-cruise stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sista_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful with a spacious lobby. It is convenient to many places in San Juan and is not far from Old San Juan. Parking is valet or regular but you have to pay for it. The room was kind of small for a queen bed and the htoel was doing construction so I couldn't go out on my balcony. The beach was gorgeous, safe and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “3 Pleasant Days”
Reviews.Author: crackofdawn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in July, 07. Had a ocean facing room (as all are on the older, shorter 9-story building). 3rd floor room so we had some palm tree shade in the morning making the balcony a bit more enjoyable. If you want and unshaded ocean view, probably need to be on floors 6-9 or on the North, East, or South face of the towers (west face overlooks city view in the Tower section.) The older building is plagued with two very slow elevators so be prepared for some extended delays or to using the stairs (our choice). We had a rental car for 1-day ($14 do it yourself parking at Marriott) and cab fare back to the airport for 2 with 4 suitcases was about $20 or so. The lobby can get really noisy as it is a large bar with live entertainment on some nights (Sat night was really full, loud, and lively) -- with a 2 drink min. as well. The casino crowd adds to the activity. The casino is on the south side of the lobby area and is quite a bit larger than it was 5 years ago. We skipped the pricey meals at the Marriott and did the following: for lunch we went to either Subway, Wendy's or BK all of which are within 5 blocks either way on Ashford. Returning to our balcony with a bottle of wine from the nearby grocery store (3 blocks south of the Marriott). Usually skipped breakfast. For dinner: number one recommendation is Pamela's in Ocean Park (about 2-3 miles south of the Marriott on Ashford). This is one great restaurant. It is small and is part of a boutique hotel on the beach. They have superb service and excellent menu choices (creative Nuevo-Latino offerings). 8 tables are set up in the sand, under the stars with candlelight and they have maybe 10 -12 tables inside. Since Ocean Park is a gated community, you enter the guard station on Santa Anna and drive to the water where you'll find Pamela's. We also ate at Yerba Buena which is on the west side of Ashford and 1 block south of the Marriott. Enjoyable PR food, excellent service and innovative drinks. A 3rd night we ventured north of the Marriott on Ashford to AJILI-MÃ“JILI. Would not go there again. Though it was very busy, we found the service very slow compared to the other restaurants, a miserable 1-page wine list (no kidding!) and unimaginative menu choices. Should have gotten a cab and returned to Pamela's!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: bigzipz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple just returned from a week at the Marriott Resort in San Juan. Our friends booked hotel and flight thru a travel agent, we booked directly with the Marriott website and used award points for the airfare. The wife and I had no trouble at check in, getting exactly what we'd expected. The friends were delayed getting their room, being told it would be just a few minutes. Two hours later, they were given an upgraded room with executive club privledges with an apololgy. When they went to the room, it was already occupied. they were moved and a little while later, another couple was given the same room. After the initial logistical problems were worked out, the remainder of the stay was uneventful. Pros: The staff at the Marriott is amazing. All - the front desk, the housekeeping, bar and beach attendants - were very courteous, helpful and there to do anything possible to make the stay enjoyable. The Conceirge staff is spotty, with the experienced folks (few) very knowledgable and helpful and the younger folks (many) helpful but not having the experience to really have any value-add. The grounds are spotless and people are always working relentlessly to keep them so. The beach is beautiful and the soft sandy bottom extends out farther than you can stand. The rooms were spacious and clean, very quiet and the A/C worked great! The Tuscany Restaurant on the ground level is one of the best Italian restaurants in San Juan - be sure to ask to be seated at a table served by Alfredo. Great health club! Leave your laptop at home, you get one hour per day of PC/Internet time in the business center per day. Cabs are cheap, figure on $12 to go just about anywhere. Cons: Food and drinks are abundant but not cheap. Average drink price is $8-10 and plan to spend ~$150 per couple on dinner with a fair bottle ($45) of wine and around $45 per couple on lunch with a beverage each. The hotel is located in town and there's a lot of construction going on around it. Some of the buildings look like they're ready to fall down and they do detract from the experience. It does look like they're trying hard to refurbish the area. Overall, it was a great vacation. We probably won't do it again but only because we'll continue to explore the islands for new and different experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pale-girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week of July 4th. Our son loved the pool and the beach and we spent lots of time going back and forth between the two. Our room looked out over the beach and pool. The room was clean and a little bigger than some of the other rooms because we were on the very end. We did not eat in any of the hotel restaurants though. We ventured out to eat instead. It seemed like there was a lot of police presence around the hotel and surrounding areas, which made us wonder if it was preventative or if there had been problems. The hotel itself was great and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not our scene”
Reviews.Author: kjscap
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended our Puerto Rico trip with three nights at this property. We had a rough time at check-in. We arrived a bit after four, which is check-in time and waited in a very long line to be told there were no rooms ready for us at that time. We were given a restaurant type pager and told to wait. We ended up wandering around a bit and having a drink at the pool bar. I really feel that Marriott should have done something for us, like comped a drink while we waited or something. We also went to speak to the concierage. Her name was Glendaly, I believe, and she was wonderful. After nearly two hours I went to inquire about getting a room and she helped us to finally get checked in. Our room was oceanfront in the remodeled tower and was fine. We were on the 6th floor and could definitely hear the lobby music until two am every night. It may be better to go higher. The elevators take FOREVER though. After check in we walked down the street and ate at an open air trattoria. The streets were very crowded and seemed safe enough to us, even after 10 pm. There was a prom at the hotel that night, and of course that was a bit annoying. The pool is small. It looks big on the hotel website, but it is tiny and totally over run with kids. There are apparently no rules prohibiting float toys so I was run over by a shamu thing that took up half the pool several times. Also, there are a lot of chairs, but many are in the shade and are lined up four rows deep. So unless you want to lay out packed like a sardine you do have to get down before noon to get a good spot. I really was not a fan of the environment down there. Tons of kids and kind of trashy people. The beach was nice. We took cabs to San Juan after being told NOT to take the bus since it has no real set schedule. The cabs were reasonable. The casino is jam packed with old locals at night. It was actually hard to move in there or get to play. We won a little bit. The lobby is packed at night. I have never seen a hotel bar so crowded. All in all I would look elsewhere if I had it to do over. The rooms were fine for our purpose, but it really seemed like more of a city hotel than a resort property, and the kids and type of people that seemed to be staying there made me uncomfortable. I would look at the Hilton maybe since it was closer to old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wm6257
Reviews.Content: stay in the corner room- the best -worth the upgrade the food is very good here ask the staff were to go they will tell you all you need to know very windy on beach waves a little rough water clear and warm no shells or seaweed pool o.k small no swimup bar have to get out for drink!! staff freindly an helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Nice job, Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: Bebe22
Reviews.Content: Overall a terrific stay. Had a Cabana room on 6th floor. Fantastic views. Avoid lower floors if possible - views are obstructed by palm trees. Room decor was nothing special, but clean and new. Pool area is well kept too. Kids loved the pool slide. Plenty of lounges for everyone - no need to reserve a lounge at 8:00am. Only real complaint was the hotel food. Lousey, expensive, and no Puerto Rican specialites. Plenty of neighborhood restaurants at reasonable prices, with local cuisine. Try Mariachi's - best mofongo in town. Beach was wonderful (you must like rough waters tough!). Every day was a red flag day. Hotel staff was superb, and most tips were turned down. We had a small medical emergency, and the hotel EMTs were at our side within seconds (at no charge). Would not hesitate to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Hrlandry
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott 4 nights during a girls trip. We booked the cheapest room possible hoping for an upgrade since I am an elite member, but they don't give out upgrades unless you are platinum. My recommendation to everyone is book cheap and then spend $50 to get upgraded to an oceanview room with concierge access. This hotel had one of the best executive lounges I've seen. The food is great, the service is great, and the views are amazing. You can sit out on the balcony and see what seems to be the whole island. The bedrooms were of adequate size with nice balconies. The bathrooms were large as well. Elevators were quick The pools were very nice and we never had a problem getting a chair. We even went down the slide which was fun. The beach is beautiful. It was very clean and the water the perfect temp. They have "cabana boys" that will carry your beach loungers out to where you want them and also put up umbrellas. All included in your stay with the hotel. And you can order drinks while laying on the beach. My only complaint about the pool is that there is no gated access to get to the pool and all of the local kids would come in and kind of take over the pool. That got to be pretty annoying when we were just trying to relax at the swim-up bar and kept getting splashed. The area that it is in at first looks sketchy, but all of Puerto Rico looks like that. They have great boutiques and restaurants. Our favorite was Pure Natural next to Wendy's, an organic cafe that had amazing fresh fruit smoothies and wonderful sandwhiches. Overall we had a wonderful time. I highly recommend the rainforest waterfalls and the Bio Bays (this was one of the most amazing things I have ever done). I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: vikster1
Reviews.Content: Everything was a wonderful experience. Very kid oriented. Kids kids and more kids. The pool slide was awesome, fun for children and adults. Many activities for the children...face painting,bingo, scavenger hunts and more. The pool/bar staff was super friendly. Check in was no problem. The oceanfront rooms are nicely decorated in pale yellows. New bedding and carpets. Nothing bad to say except maybe that we saw a shark in the water in the evening. Water was clear and blue. Oh and the regular "lady" who sat at the lobby bar everynight waiting for a date or something. Beautiful scenery and coqui frogs chipping. Felt vert safe walking Ashford ave even at night.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the San Juan Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: baileysmommy
