Reviews.Content: I rated this "above average" hotel a rating of "EXCELLENT" on the overall experience. My husband and I, along with several of our friends had a wonderful stay in San Juan. While I went to great extents to research exactly where we would stay, I had my fingers crossed and I prayed that my selection was a good one. I was pleasantly surpised to see that most of the reviews I had read on Trip Advisor were accurate. The renovated corner rooms in the tower section of the hotel are absolutely beautiful. You have two balconies, once which is ocean front and the other is either ocean or pool view. Beware of the cabana rooms as most of those are not renovated and the difference between the two (renovated and non-renovated) are like staying at the Waldorf Astoria versus Motel 6. Great pool...you even get some "eye candy" (pool boys) passing around fruit while you take in some rays. Excellent beach front property overall. The location of the hotel, in Condado, is ideal; close to high-end shopping (Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Cartier to name a few) are walking distance. There are also a few non-national brand boutiques that have a great selection of fashion. There is no need for a rental car, taxis are readily accesible. Old San Juan is great and is only a 12-15 minute drive from the hotel. A lot of national brand shopping mixed with other quaint boutiques. Plan to spend a day or two in Old San Juan to get everything in. El Yunque (the rainforest) is also a MUST. The drive is long, so booking through the hotel is a safe way to go - $64 (includes transportation and tour of the forest). The Barcardi tour, in my opinion, was very boring. The taxi ride from the hotel was $35 plus $5 for each additional person, $36 wait time (if you want the taxi to wait while you take the 1 hour tour) and the same price for your return. Needless to say, you are paying for the "free" tour in the taxi fare. However, the two free drinks and the Barcardi store are a nice compliment to the otherwise boring experience. Night life at the hotel is always jumping, but be sure to venture out to Club Babylon and some other local spots to get a true feel of Puerto Rico. Lastly, the hotel food is somewhat expensive (to be expected). So take time to venture out to some of the local restaurants in Old San Juan. There are too many to name, but just ask a few of the friendly locals or hotel staff. They were very helpful to us in finding great spots to go for a nice meal. I would definitely visit again and stay at the San Juan Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “One Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: wallyj
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 1 week stay at the San Juan Marriott. Our room was very good and my wife loved the plush pillows. The staff was great from check-in to check-out. The entertainment every night was super (everyone was up and dancing till all hours). Some complaints that we read prior go leaving just wasn't there. The beach was clean and yes the neighboring buildings are being worked on so don't look at them, keep your eyes on the ocean and you will have a great time as well. We took a tour through the hotel for the rain forest. Our guide (Gus) was great and well worth the expense. We bought a bottle of rum at the walgreens to cut down on the cost of drinking at the bars all night (saved a bunch). We went to Old San Juan several nights (we recommend the Barrachina - dance show and dinner good and reasonable).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: fsupilam
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at the Marriott. We had a corner room #1509 and it was the best hotel room I have ever stayed in. The room was surrounded with full length balconies on each side of the room and the views were spectacular. If you already paying for oceanfront room, you might as well pay $20 extra a night. The beach was beautiful. The water drops off pretty quick, but I never felt like I was about to be swept away. The pool is a little cramped, but we had a blast there as well. Getting a drink at the pool or beach was easy. Food was good at the pool as well. The only other food we ate at the hotel was from the Executive Lounge breakfast. The food was good for what we needed and the savings from not having to buy breakfast at the restaurant made up for the extra $20/night we paid for the corner room which included lounge access. Entertainment at the hotel bar was very good in the evenings. The three nights we were there we ate in Old San Juan which is a $12 cab ride. The Parrot Club was fantastic. I reccomend the Churassaco Steak....best peice of meat I have ever tasted. We also ate at Ponza, but that was no worth it. Our last night we ate and Dragon Fly and the food was amazing there as well. I would skip there sushi and just order the main dishes. The mongolian beef and was awesome. The atmosphere at Dragon Fly may not be for everyone. It's best to eat earlier as the places really get packed after 9. I never flet unsafe when I was in San Juan, and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Condado”
Reviews.Author: grlclubn
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at this hotel, as previous reviews I was lucky to get a tower room on the 18th floor with views of both the city and the ocean. the room was very confortable and clean. This hotel is in a great location to everything. When construction is complete in this area it will be Awesome!!!!! the only complaint that I have is my room was never swept on the days that I was there. I spent 5 days/4 nites. The entertainment at nite was Excellent. This is my second time at this hotel, and I will be back. The people in Puerto Rico are very nice and to add to the fact that everyone was bilingual. also take advantage of the conceirge service, they are very knowledgeable about what to do and see in the city. They even made arrangements for me to go horsebacking and .Atv in the rain forest.

Reviews.Title: “Serivce Awful. Internet Down 1/2 of the Time”
Reviews.Author: ATLTravelsALot
Reviews.Content: This place may have been renovated, but service levels are awful. Booded 2 oceanfront corner pool/ocean rooms @ 280 per night + 10% resort fee. Internet was down most of the time and wireless-only service is non-reliable and fails constantly. All guests in the hotel who had computers were complaining. Hotel staff clueless as to what to do. They would transfer me to a toll-free 800 number that went to India only to be put on hold for 20 mins before I was told an storm in Atlanta had caused "global" outages for the "StayOnline" (ironic name, right?) service. My comapny headquaters are in Atlanta and when I called the office, we were up and no major thuderstorms in the area. The hotel was just using this as an excuse. No major hotel, and especially one that caters to convention/business travelors should have such poor technical services in a newly renovated room. Drinks in the executive lounge are $8.50+ for serve-yourself bar. Security at the hotel is terrible. Anyone from the street can access the elevators and there were two security situations that had to be addressed on my floor during my 5-night stay. Sign-in within the executive club is also very unsecure and receptionists regularly would repeat guests name and room number when they walked in.....not a good idea in today's environment! In addiition, sign-in book is left laying out for all guest coming in to see. Hotel operators are responsible for handling calls to all areas of the hotel (ex. no "front desk" button on the ohones) and they often will disconnect or put you on hold forever before coming back to explain that no one is available. This Marriott has a great location but service it terrible. Rooms are nice now, but AC is either too cold/too hot 24 hrs a day. This hotel has had a facelift but nothing major. Business people will be majorly disappointed and families will be turned off by the price. All will be disappointed at the level of general service and staff competence. SJU needs a true 5-star property with consistent, reliable services. I have stayed at this Marriott many times over the years and sadly nothing has changed other than a badly needed room renovation. Guests paying these prices expect to receive more. Having to beg someone to setup an umbrella on the beach was also frustrating. Unfortnately, this is about the norm in SJU. Oh well, I tried it....again. Management has major issues to overcome at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: sal2009
Reviews.Content: We loved the Marriott... We got the Marriott on priceline for $115/night. When we arrived, the desk staff were extremely helpful. Having read the reviews on tripadvisor, we asked for an upgrade to a corner room...They told us oceanfront room would be $50 more/night and the corner room even more. We sighed b/c we really didn't want to spend that much and agreed only to the extra $50/night for the ocean front room. When the front desk attendant came back she said she had a nice surprise for us and gave us the corner room anyway (for $50/night) on the 18th floor. The view was gorgeous. The room has flatscreen tv, two balconies (one ocean front, one overlooking the pool), new king size bed, etc. Very nice. Also, the upgrade came with access to the executive lounge on the top floor which included free breakfast, evening snacks (which actually served as our dinner on more than one occasion), and dessert. The food was also very good up there and we almost ate enough to pay for the extra $50 upgrade. The pool is somewhat geared towards families....we are two gay guys in our late 20s/early 30s so we ventured toward the beach. They will carry your lounge chairs and umbrella to where you want. One guy from the hotel came to the beach and gave us fruit (for free) while we were sunning ourselves and there were usually people around to take our drink orders. Otherwise, we just went out up to the pool/beach bar and got our own. I must have been at a different beach than some people who reviewed this hotel b/c i found the beach very nice, the waves calm (minimal waves....they always have this red flag warning you of the surf, but it is really nothing....everyone was swimming, including little two and three year olds..no big deal). There was no seaweed whatsoever on the beach either. There are some buildings near by which look burned by fires, some of which have construction work being done.....it's not gorgeous....but it is pretty good for a major city. The casino is small but enjoyable. Lost a bit of money...but that's to be expected at a casino and anyone who thinks otherwise is an idiot. I think you would like this hotel. The staff is super friendly, the hotel is nice, and there is a decent amount of stuff to do at san juan. I would come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: jjessy1vip
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel most of the time just because it was sooo nice...not to sure about the areas around..but if you want a nice place to stay, great pool, beautiful beach, and casino...this is it... will like to go back some day

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience at this resort - left after the first night!!”
Reviews.Author: cfed
Reviews.Content: What an awful experience we had at the San Juan Marriott!! My party (husband, my mother and my sister) and I travelled to this hotel during Memorial Day weekend and it DEFINITELY was NOT what we expected!! It was something reminiscent of Spring Break, from the EXTREMELY scantilly clothed guests (which I would get into more detail about but think it wil be best to hold back) to the loud, obnoxious drunk people in the pool, this was not what we envisioned our vacation to be. Now, my husband, sister and I are all in our 20's, laid back and like to have fun, but this was over the top. THE GOOD: To begin, check in was a breeze, and they accomodated our early check in request. The rooms have nice decor - flat screen tvs, comfy bed, they did do a nice job with the renovations. The bathrooms are nicely appointed as well - beautiful marlbe vanity with lots of space to store toiletries, etc. Even though we didnt have an oceanfront room and when you immediately looked out onto the balcony you got an ugly view of this monstrous building under construction, all we had to do was look to our left and the ocean was right there, so that was a nice perk, as well. THE BAD: The surf at this resort is SOO strong and rough you really couldnt be in the water and relax; you constantly had to watch for the next wave to come and take you under. All of the staff encouraged the guests to stay out of the water. Now, when you are in the Carribean, you want to be able to swim in the beautiful, crystal clear ocean water, and we couldnt do that here.Needless to say, we were hugely dissappointed when we discovered this, and after we saw the size of the small pool. Food/drink service on the beach was PAINFULLY slow...I understand the Carribean (been to Aruba, Bermuda and Mexico ) and that your mindset should be to relax, you are on island time thing, but we waited almost an hour for 4 drinks!! We had lunch there at LA VISTA, I believe. Food was decent, but pretty pricey. The restaurant is located right next to the pool/beach so it does have some nice scenery. Our first (and only) time we had dinner at the resort was the BBQ buffet they had beachside...it seemed like a nice idea, but after we paid 24 dollars a person for alot of unappetizing food we realized what a bad move that was. THE UGLY: We were there less than 24 hours and I had to call the front desk 3 times!!!! At 11 pm (yes, that is a bit early, but we had been traveling since 4 am) the room next to ours was outrageously loud and having a party, with a screaming baby in the room, nonetheless. They definitely need to do something about the noise levels in the guestrooms - it seemed as if you could hear everything coming from the rooms next to you and there were no sound barriers at all. The noise was unbearable and we couldnt sleep and after dealing with it for a couple of hours, we succombed to calling the front desk to complain. A few minutes later, through our peephole, we counted 10 adults leave that room. I will say that security did come up after to confirm they broke up the party. 6AM: We were woken up to about 7 girls yelling outside our door. They sounded pretty wasted. As I was calling the front desk to complain (AGAIN,) the door to the room next to ours opened and a gentleman excertingly told the girls to "Shut up." The girls felt the need to respond to him with expletives I wont use, but once he went back into his room. we thought (erroneously) that this escapade was over. Boy, were we wrong. About 10 minutes later these girls returned AGAIN and this time when the guy next room over opened his doors to yell at them again, it turned into a shouting match and the girls threatening to hit him (unprovoked), etc. We watched this unravel through our trusty peephole, for to be honest, we were afraid of what might happen if we opened the door. I called the front desk for the 3rd time and told them they had a pretty serious situation on their hands on the 10th floor and they better get up here. The thing that bothered me the most about this situation was that we never, not ONCE, heard back from the front desk about this situation. They never called or came to our room to see if things had been solved.We barely got a sorry out of them for everything we had experienced our first and ONLY night here. I called up to my mothers room on the 12th floor (who had noise issues the night before, as well, but nothing compared to ours) and we would return to the InterContinental (Katherine at the beach bar rocks!!) in a heartbeat. Overall, we were extremely disappointed with our brief stay at the Marriott. My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Aruba resort for our honeymoon and we were extremely pleased with our stay there, so its not as if we have never stayed at a Marriott before.

Reviews.Title: “Awful area”
Reviews.Author: GAAtltravel
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the other reviews it doesn't seem possible we were at the same place - except I know where I stayed. Room check in was delayed by hours past the 4:00 check in. We were given a $50. credit for the delay. Elevators were very slow. Concierge level ammenities were great, food available - times open and the view from the patio at sunset . Room appeared to be updated. It was clean and comfortable. Spa is 3 tiny rooms located right next to the work out floor of the gym. The loud music all but defeated any attempt to relax. Gym is in the basement, equipment is fine. Enough security in the hotel and by the beach to stop any non guests from coming on the grounds. The hotel while decent enough is in a terrible area. When you leave the hotel to walk anywhere you are greeted with homeless people laying on the sidewalk begging for money. There is quite a bit of grafitti on most buildings. The builldings on both sides of the Marriott are bombed out. There was no work being done on either of those building either. Most of the neighborhood seemed more like Beiruit than a tropical paradise. The walk on the beach in either direction was no better. There appeared to be a homeless tent city a few doors down to the left of the Marriott on the beach. Up against one of the dilapadated buildings were sheets proped up as to povide some shelter for those living on the beach. In both directions the buildings viewed from the beach were either vacant and/or in very bad shape. I am not overstating the location of this hotel. Took a trip to Rain forest , it was a fun hike and a good day. We took a taxi into Old San Juan and had dinner at the Parrot Club. Wonderful outdoor patio in the back. Very good food. However, again there were people just handing around the street corners that just seemed unsavory. I feel safer in many other cities ( including NYC) than I did there. I have visited many other islands and this is not one I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Trip”
Reviews.Author: teacher34
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I just returned from Puerto Rico last night. I decided to stay in the city our last night there. We were pleasantly surprised with this Marriott. The hotel was wonderful. We were greeted by a very friendly hostess. Our room was on the 19th floor and it was beautfully appointed in yellows. We had a partial ocean view and a view of the pool. It was spectacular. Our beds were very comfy, room spacious. We had dinner at the restuarant called La Vista. I had a suberb salmon, my daughter had tuna, and loved it, the other daughter Mahi Mahi and loved it also. Yes, it was pricey, but I expect no less in a resort. Our waiter provided great service. The casino was fun and non smoking! I actually won money there! The lobby is very large and spacious. Everything very clean and shiny. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice urban oasis”
Reviews.Author: costarica99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort for 5 nights mostly for business. Overall, the hotel was excellent, especially considering that I stayed there during the busy Memorial Day weekend. Pros: Rooms: Very good. Stayed in the tower. Be sure to ask for an upgraded room in the tower. Room had flat screen TV, bathrobe, comp bottle of water each day. Ocean or City View options were available. Food: Had a nice pool side lunch. Pool service was prompt. Very nice coffee bar handy for breakfast take-out to the beach. Staff: Very courteous! Concierge was very helpful. Complaints were handled promptly. Parking: I suggest valet parking. It didn't cost much more than the garage and the staff was prompt. Location: Very convenient. Starbucks, Walgreens across the street. Old San Juan, where most of the action is, is about 3 miles (see below) Very close to the airport. Beach access is excellent. Beach: Beach service was great, with attendant ready to set up your umbrella and chair. Of course, bring a few dollars to tip the guy. Ocean is fun, but can be a little rough for the kids. Ocean water is what you might expect, refreshing, but you are swimming next to a major, urban location! Restaurants: In the neighborhood, there is an adequate, pricey, sushi place next door. Old San Juan: Definately go to Dragonfly, Agua Viva and Parrot Club. For a great local sushi option, don't miss Jinyas, it's a drive, but worth it! Health Club: Top notch. In the basement of the old wing, this place has all of the equipment you'll need. They also provide one comp bottle of water to guests who work out. Safety: I noticed plenty of staff around, both at the pool and beach areas. While there does appear to be a high crime rate, like many urban areas, the hotel and surrounding areas felt safe to me. Jogging: Suggest an early wake-up and do the three mile (each way) jog to Old San Juan. Other: At the concierge desk, there are handy maps to most of the tourist locations with easy to follow directions from the hotel. Cons: Rooms: Be sure to stay away from the ice machine/staff entrance elevator. It tended to be noisy. A squeaky staff door was repaired promptly after I complained. Broadband: Since I was there for business, I had to use the wireless service. In the room, this service was HORRIBLE. I complained but there was absolutely nothing they could do to speed it up. There is a business center with faster service. Location: Taxis are not cheap. It was about a $12 cab ride to Old San Juan. Pool: While there are plenty of beach chairs, the pool is awkward. A huge wading pool and rather small regular pool. Probably great for kids, but not so nice for most folks. Restaurants: Avoid the gelato place down the street. It just didn't taste very fresh!! Rates: Be sure to have them explain their resort fee. This is not a problem, but it is almost automatically included on your bill. Check in: Could have been much faster. The hotel promotes express check in, but I couldn't find it. Casino: Well, maybe because I lost money. It just wasn't a pleasant place to spend the evening. Elevators: Slow, but I did stay over the busy holiday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: KevinandMichelle10
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff was incredibly friendly and welcoming. They really made it seem a pleasure to serve us. We had an oceanfront view room that was beautiful. The beds were very comfy and falling asleep to the sound of the ocean was nice. The pool was great, the hot tub was nice(although it wasn't hot the first couple nights). The beach is great. They bring out chairs and umbrellas for you. The ocean is like bathwater, although you have to be careful with the waves. The drinks and food are very pricey so we ate at a place called Dannys(left out of the Marriot and down a block on the corner) and their food is very good and very inexpensive. We were a little disappointed that the swimup bar and the beach bar closed so early. The beach bar is only open until 7. The concierge was very helpful and saved us a lot of money by suggesting renting a car instead of taking a tour to the rainforest. I really can't understate how the friendliness of the staff made our stay enjoyable. As far as eating, we ate at the Cherry Blossom right next door, which is a Japanese restaurant where they cook the food right in front of you. It's very good but expensive. We also ate at Yerbe Buena(right across from Dannys) which has very good food. We ate at Dannys every day for their breakfast. Their fried egg sandwhich on a hoagie is phenomenal. There's also a place called The Burger Joint which has one of the best hamburgers we've ever had. Take a right out of the Marriot and it's only a few blocks down on your left. We got a little tired of Puerto Rican food so this place was great. The Rainforest was nice. I recommend going to the top trail with the tower. The view is spectacular. Note, when you get to the top of the first part, look for the sign that says Wildlife Viewing Area and take that trail to the tower. The other road doesn't lead to much of a view. We also went to Old San Juan and it was a lot of fun. There's a really beautiful walk that goes right by the ocean around the city. We went on the Bacardi tour which we both thought was a waste of time. It's basically two hours between travel and everything else to get two free drinks each. The rest is a big commercial for Bacardi. The location of the Marriot is great. Starbucks is right across the street and there's a Walgreens a block down for anything else you might need. If you want to find beer or wine, take a right out of the Marriot and there's a store on the left side down a few blocks which had the cheapest and widest selection. We heard a lot about how it's dangerous in Puerto Rico but we never had any problems or felt unsafe. The people there are extremely friendly and offer great advice(such as, 30 SPF suntan lotion isn't going to cut it.) Between the weather, food, staff, room, and view we had a great time and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Puerto Rico!”
Reviews.Author: a2diaz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 days 3 nights for a pre-crusie vacation. We absolutely loved it!! We stayed on the 16th floor with an ocean view room that was gorgeous. It was newly renovated and based on the receptionist at the check in window we were the 4th guest to stay in the room. The hotel was very clean and the cleaning crew was very respectful to the items we left in plain view on the dresser. Food: we ate at The Vista every morning for free due to upgrading our room from city view to ocean view....totally worth it!!! However, if we had not had the free breakfast we probably wouldn't have ate at the hotel. It was very expensive and the selection got old after a few days. However, we did try a good chicken sandwich offered by the pool bar. Drinks: The drinks served by the bar at the pool are pretty pricey and not very strong. However, if you go into the bar in the lobby they seem to taste stronger. Nightlife: We really enjoyed the fact that we did not need to leave the hotel to have a good time. While we were there they had a Brazilian night with professional dancers, a live band, salsa night and a DJ. We sat at the bar a few nights to enjoy the entertainment. Location: The area seems to be unsafe at first, but after you familiarize yourself with it it doesn't seem too bad. There is a lot of construction going on and there is not much scenary as you walk along Ashford Ave. There are a lot of conveniences along the street including Starbucks, Walgreens, Haagen Daz, and various other local restaurants. It's also a 15 minute bus ride from Old San Juan and maybe 15 minutes from the airport. The Beach: The water is beautiful...the waves are strong some days, but we were lucky to have one day when the waves were perfect....the water is clean, blue and very warm. The view isn't the greatest because of the construction going on but it was still beautiful. Pool: the pool is small and when there are a lot of kids around it doesn't seem big enough. Luckily 2 out of the 3 days we were there, we had the pool almost to ourselves! I would totally recommend this hotel for a few days stay....it was a nice way to rest and relax prior to going on our cruise. I would definitely stay at the Marriott again.....we actually wish we were still there!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Content: The first of three hotels we stayed at and it was georgous. We paid $120.00 on priceline and for 25.00 a night more got upgraded to an ocean front room! The salsa music at night is awsome and the bar makes great mojiti's. Condado is lovely. Try Pamela's for dinner, you won't be dissappointed. The pool is lovely too! Viva Puerto Rico!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cynderemy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. We had a cabana room overlooking the pool and beach. The room was clean and the beds were very comfy. We didn't eat at the hotel - there are a lot of restaurants within walking distance that are much more affordable and have a better selection. The location of the hotel was convenient. About a 15 minute bus ride into Old San Juan for 75 cents. We took a taxi back since the bus doesn't run after 9pm - the taxi ride was $12 plus tip. Around the hotel you will find decent restaurants and a few shops. It looks as if Condado is under a large renovation. One of the restaurant owners said that Condado has lost its flare. If you are looking for a full scale resort within an easy commute to Old San Juan, the Marriott will do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: queenbuc
Reviews.Content: Just came back from an all girls trip to Puerto Rico. We originally booked the Caribe Hilton with the expectations of a nice hotel. The lobby was beautiful but after seeing the room we quickly exited stage left. Definitely not worth the money!! So we headed over to the Marriott. It was beautiful. The lobby was nice. The bell men were cute and the rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Our first room had some leakage problems and we were promptly relocated (with help) and given a $100 credit. We didnâ€™t eat at the hotel at all, too pricey for us. There is a great restaurant down the street with really good Puerto Rican food that is open 24 hours. I canâ€™t remember the name of it but it is right next to Walgreenâ€™s on the Ashford Ave. side. The portions are large so we either shared or took the leftovers back to the hotel. We inquired about a microwave and a few minutes later a guy was knocking on the door with a microwave to put in the room, free of charge!! After realizing all the taxi rides were going to cost a small fortune, we chose the bus. Only $.75 each way! The bus goes everywhere from Old San Juan to Isle Verde and even the airport. Old San Juan is nice and perfect for tourists. We found a little shack by the port that served the best Marlin pastelillos, the manager, Andres is really nice. We also caught the ferry over to the Bacardi plant for free drinks!!! The souvenir shops definitely werenâ€™t as cheap as the Bahamas. The clubs were okay. Too many young people though. Senior Frogs has a great atmosphere but leaves something to be desired in the food department. We decided we wanted to get away from the tourist spots and wanted to rent a car. The Hertz desk at the hotel wanted $40 a day!!! So I went down to the business center which is open 24 hours a day and booked a small compact car using Hotwire for $12.95 a day. The total for the day was less than $20. The only bad thing is the $14 parking fee at the hotel is ridiculous!!! We rode the bus to the airport, picked up the car, and hit the highway. There are small tolls as you drive up the highway, the most expensive one was $1.50. We drove up to the El Yunque rainforest, which was only a 45 minute drive. The tours from area hotels range from $40-$50. So we were expecting an entrance fee of some sort. Well to our surprise it was completely FREE. We walked the trail to the La Mina waterfall. We didnâ€™t go to the peak this time, we heard it was beautiful. Either way, you canâ€™t beat this FREE excursion. All in all we had a great trip to Puerto Rico. I would stay at the Marriott again, however, I would rather rent a condo off the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cruiser1963
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on Apr 20, 2007 prior to a cruise. The tower rooms are very nice, spacious and in pleasing colors. I was surprise at how large the room was. Everything had just been refurbished in the room. The hotel dining was nice, but a little expensive. Great beach and quiet and clean pool. I would stay here again without any problem. Staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hospitality in San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino”
Reviews.Author: TravelMaster123
Reviews.Content: This is an arrogant HOTEL This hotel needs to go to HOSPITALITY SCHOOL specially the CASINO. After playing $500.00 they were not kind enough to extend the courtesy to stamp my parking ticket. They stated having no proof of me being in the Casino playing at all. I cashed in my winnnigs which did not amout to $5.00. Then went to the Courtesy Desk (better to be called INSULT DESK) They told me that I needed to be a Casino Member or to have a Membership Card. I returned to the window where I cashed my prize. The clerk called a supervisor and was willing to badge for me stating that he just cashed a prize for me. The supervisor and the Courtesy Clerk both denied stamping my parking ticket. Also their ATM machines do not display the amount that you will be charged to get your money. It was incredible that I had to take a leap of faith accepting the unknown charges. Otherwise on a different day I went to the Ambassador Casino, I asked about all these parking issues. They say OH NO PROBLEM HERE play and when you are done we stamp your parking ticket. I played about equal amount and was happy with their services. Overall happier crew.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach behind it”
Reviews.Author: Dittosparkle
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked this place a week in advance and we didn't know what to expect. If you are looking to relax at the beach, chill out near the hotel and not mind taking a cab to Old San Juan or Isla Verde to party, this is probably a good place. There isn't much hustle and bustle around the hotel... but there are plenty of restaurants, and bars within walking distance. My friend and I are actually happier that we stayed in this area vs Old San Juan (eventhough we went there twice) because of the convenience of the beach and the centralized location. If you can get this hotel at a decent rate, I definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but front desk needs help”
Reviews.Author: happywhilewaiting
Reviews.Content: The lobby area of the hotel is very nice. They have live music and dancing in the evening. The casino is nice, but totally non-smoking. For most this is a plus, but for someone who smokes and goes to casinos regularly it was a bummer. The check in process took forever. We waited almost 30 minutes for someone to helps us. Then we had to wait until 430p for a room. They did hold our bags for us. The room was very clean and the amenities were up to date. For the amount of money you pay for a night I don't think it was worth it. However, in the Conado area is the best. The beach was nice and clean. They had chairs and umbrellas for guest. The good thing is they aren't set up already. You have to ask one of the workers for one and they set everything up for you. No chair saving or fighting over the loungers. There was plenty for everyone. We ate in the restaurant twice. It was good, but not great. However, the prices are ridiculous. The lunch buffet was $19.00 a person. Overall, I would say it was a nice hotel. But, still I think it was a little pricey. There's no way I would go to San Juan or this hotel for a week. In my opinion you could go to much nicer resorts and islands for the same money. By the way, this was my 2nd time to San Juan and the Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Bobbie007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Juan Marriott and had a great time. Our room did not have the best view but we did not stay in the room that much. Food: I had lunch and brunch at the hotel restaurant. The service was a bit slow (though polite) but the food was good. If you go for brunch, try to get there early so that you can avoid the line at the omelet/ waffle station. Rooms: There are two buildings â€“ one with the room renovated and ones in which the rooms are not. I did not see the rooms in the older building but I heard that they are bigger though with less of that new feel. I was in the newly renovated building. I had a double which I shared with one other person. The size was adequate for two people. The bed was comfortable â€“ firm but no too firm. Very clean, nice and pretty linens. There was a lovely flat screen (or plasma) TV. Good to have â€“ did not look at it that much. The rooms with an ocean view have a nice little patio which is good for relaxing or picture taking. If you are sensitive to noise then opt for higher floor â€“ one guest was able to hear the band playing. Hotel Staff: They were quick and attentive when you called from the room to get additional such as extra lines and shower gels. Beach: The beach it self was great. You can order lunch (or drinks) and have it brought over to you. The water was a bit rough when we were there but I still took a dip. The water is generally clean and clear Drinks: Alcohol â€“ excellent!!!!!!!! The non alcoholic drinks were good as well. The Casino: I played there. Good enough for my needs though there might be better ones on the island. Entertainment: There was nightly entertainment in the lobby of the hotel while we were there. The band was pretty good. Location: There are a number of restaurants and shops with in walking distance. Not too far from Airport, Isla Verde and Old San Juan (may be 20 â€“ 25 minutes depending). All in all a great stay

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: travelgrrlnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Juan Marriott for 3 nights during a birthday trip for a friend. I love this hotel. My king room was 1109 in the tower. I highly recommend upgrading to the "09" rooms. During my stay it was an additional $50 a night and well worth it. These "09's" are corner rooms on the ocean side. Each side of the corner has a long terrace. The view of the ocean and the city is spectacular. The decor and linens are all appropriate for the setting. The robes are comfortable. The bath products are average quality, but they provide a nice quantity. They are also very generous with the pool towels which is nice in a beach location. In general, the wireless in the room worked. However, there were times I found it to be very slow. It was $11.99/day. The in-room safely easily accomodates laptops and is easy to use. There is a small refridgerator and coffeepot (it is in the cabinet under the tv.) They also have big flatscreen tvs that swivel. The beach area is the best part of the hotel. The area is well maintained. There seemed to be plenty of chairs and umbrellas (get an umbrella early---you will want it and they run out.) The pool areas are oddly small and the chairs seem really close together. The pool itself is set up in such a way that there really isn't a lot of swimming areas. I say...stick with the beach. The service on the beach is sporadic...so if you are going to want food or drink...plan ahead and flag the guy down when you see him. The food and drink from the pool bar area was all good and the prices were fair. The property does have a lot of activities for kids. There were a lot of families with small children in the pool area and running around on the beach. If you are looking for some place really quiet or adults only...this might not be the location for you. The hotel lobby is basically a giant bar with live, festive music. There are plenty of tables and it is a good place to meet up with your group before dinner, etc. The gym in the hotel is great. There are a lot of new machines, plenty of free weights and a nice mat area. They provide towels, bottled water, etc. There is also a nice locker room with showers, etc. NOTE: If your check out is earlier than your flight you can easily store you luggage with the valet and spend more time on the beach or at the pool. The locker rooms in the gym are set up so you can easily shower, change your clothes and get ready for your flight. They encourage you to do this and there is no extra charge for using the gym facilities even after you have checked out. A couple of people from my group rented cars and getting the cars from valet during the peak periods was pretty exhausting. Old San Juan was only about 15 minutes away and a $15 fare. The airport was about 20 minutes away and an $18 fare. Cabs seemed to be plentiful and not expensive. Unless you are going somewhere far away I would recommend not renting a car and just taking cabs. This hotel is very comfortable. the location is great. It is a perfect distance between Old San Juan and the airport. The El San Juan is also an easy drive and there are plenty of water activities (jet skiining, etc.) in front of that hotel. The casino was fun. The rooms are big. It isn't an over-the-top luxury hotel, but it was a wonderful getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort, lots to do nearby”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvlBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights (could not stay the weekend, it was too expensive) and loved it. It took a while to check in but we walked around and began to unwind and get into the relaxed Caribbean mode. Once we were able to check in the room was beautiful with a nice view of the pool and beach. Yes there were trees obstructing our view, but they were palm trees and they provided shade and privacy while at the pool. Lobby was loud but they were playing local music- I am not sure why people are complaining about it. Casino is small but it was fine for an occasional gambler. The gym is good size for a hotel. Our room (a corner room) was huge, good for 4 people. It had 2 double beds but it could have fit queen beds. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The bathroom was long, wallpaper was peeling but it was clean. There was a small fridge though it never got too cold but was fine for water and drinks. There is a lot nearby as far as shops and restaurants. We only went to the brunch at the hotel, overpriced but the food was fine. One street over is a great Mexican restaurant and down the street is a sub shop that had excellent food. The area is safe, though it is advised not to be on the beach after dark. We took a bus to Old San Juan for 75 cents. Taxis to/from airport are less than $20 depending on people or luggage. There are tours from the hotel, we did the rain forest with the waterfall- just beautiful. The pool was nice and there were plenty of chairs around. The beach was ok, waves were strong and it was a city beach (obviously) so it was not as pristine as in other parts of PR. Nobody bothered us while we were on the beach, which was nice. The staff at this hotel were superb. Everyone was so nice and gracious. Our maid did a great job and would make decorations with the towels and face clothes. The people at the door were so helpful with directions and recommendations. It was these little things that made us really enjoy the hotel. Overall we liked it here, would recommend it for those who want to be close to San Juan and the city. Not a great hotel if you want to be in a quiet resort-like setting.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed The Stay...”
Reviews.Author: SJhulawahine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights for a work conference and prior to a cruise. The hotel itself was great, we had no problems with anything and the location was pretty central to our needs. Room : we were lucky enough to get a corner room which felt very spacious. We had 2 sets of sliding doors and a small balcony. One side faced the beautiful waters and the other faced a building construction. Needless to say we kept the curtains closed on that side! The room was spacious with a king bed, a desk & chair, a lounge chair, flatscreen TV and a safe. The bathroom was great - it had all the amenities we needed. Hotel : overall was very nice. The casino was a bit small but we only walked thru it, didn't play since we heard from others how tight the machines were. There is a bar right in the lobby so it's a nice place to people watch. It also has a small sundries store and concierge desk. We walked out to the pool which were very nice. Although there is a sign that says reserving chairs is only limited to half an hour, we never stayed long enough to see if it's enforced. The beach is okay. It can get crowded by noon so it's best to go out before that to get a chaise lounge and a good spot on the beach. The waves are pretty rough. While we were there, we saw a lot of locals body boarding and a lot of tourists getting knocked down by the waves (not badly though!). The workers there were very friendly. And everytime I called for housekeeping, they came right away to clean our room. Restaurant : we only ate at one. It was the noodle bar tucked in the corner of the casino. We were craving noodles and it definitely hit the spot...although be expected to pay a lot more than at your usual local joint! Location : is okay. If you're walking along the beach and look back, it may not look like "paradise" with a lot of run-down buildings and construction going on. But on the street, it seems better. There is a Starbucks right across the street (Haggen Daaz is coming soon!) and Walgreens right at the corner. If you're coming out of the hotel and turn left, there is a little strip mall area across the street. Try eat at the restaurant that sells gelato. I had a chicken sandwich there which was very good. Various : this Marriott is only about 15 mins away from Old San Juan. Instead of taking a taxi there, we took the city bus (I believe it's B21, but double check with the front desk) which turned out much cheaper. Each way was $0.75 compared to the $14-$16 we'd have to pay for a taxi! It may take a few minutes longer but it's a great way to see the city. :) Along the lines of taxi's, the rate for 2 of us plus 2 luggage from San Juan airport to the Marriott hotel was $16. I would definitely consider this hotel again if we ever get a chance to go back. Hope you enjoy your stay also!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: yvonne4avon
Reviews.Content: The room was your basic Marriott room, and definately not worth $350 a night!! Location was ok if you're ok with gangs going up and down the streets in front of the hotel. We did not feel safe at all. The food at La Vista was good, but again not worth the cost. Except for the doorman and Efrain, the waiter, it seemed everyone had a "chip on their shoulder". Bad attitudes from the staff. Tried to meet with the hotel manager to discuss an incident, but, he never responded. We couldn't wait to leave! We'll never go back!

Reviews.Title: “Some positives, some negatives”
Reviews.Author: Elkay65
Reviews.Content: We checked in after a two night stay at the Westin Rio Mar. We booked our trip late, so we had to take what we could get. I knew going in it was going to be like two different vacations for us. I've also posted a review for the Westin. My first impression of the Marriott was not good. When I walked in the doors, the smell of stale smoke (probably wafting from the casino) hit me in the face. Our room was OK, nothing special, ocean front. I felt it was a little run down. The balcony was great to watch the ocean and the surfers, but it was not inviting. It was cement and nothing cozy about it. The beach was nice and was the main attraction for my boys, ages 5 and 7. They would still be in the surf if we didn't have a real life to get back to. My biggest gripe about the beach is that it was filthy. I don't understand why people think the beach is just one big ashtray!!!!!!! It is filthy and disgusting. And people leave lots of other garbage also. We were there for 6 nights (had to add 2 nights on due to weather back here in NY) and I only saw the beach comber tractor out there a total of 2 times. That was in the morning, but not even early enough because people were already out there on lounge chairs and he had to drive around those people. Here's a thought : Get that thing out there earlier and clean that beach every day. It really got to me, can you tell? OK, walking down the beach: well -- when you stand back and look back at the hotel, you definitely do not get that caribbean island feel. There are what looks like bombed out buildings on either side of the hotel. My advice is to keep your back to the hotel and stare at the ocean. We took a lot of walks down the beach and there are local people there that hang out but that wasn't a problem. There is a -- how shall I say -- a same sex hotel down to the right of the hotel. Luckily my boys were focused on the ocean and I didn't have to field any questions. Men playing volleyball on the beach in speedos --- an image burned in my brain. I'll leave it at that. (not that there's anything wrong with that) After being at the Westin and feeling a little isolated, it was nice to be able to walk out of the hotel and go to Walgreens and get stuff we needed. Or try some local food, which I was determined to do. We ate at a restaurant called Ikakos, within walking distance. We had a very good experience there. The conch fritters were awesome, the conch cocktail amazing. The mofongo with seafood --- WOWEE! It was so good we got take out from there the next night too. I had conch in half an avocado also which was good. Also had it a few day s later and noticed it was a bit different. The first time was on a weekend, so maybe they have different chefs for during the week. The concierge -- Oh brother! I kept getting this one girl, let's just say her name started with a G and ended with a Y. She was very bad at her job. The last straw was when she told that yes, the caves are open today. We drove an hour and a half and guess what? The caves were closed. Sometimes they close for wet weather. However , this was a sunny Tuesday. The problem then? They are closed Sun through Tuesday!!!!!! Shouldn't the concierge of a busy hotel know that?????? After our 3 hour drive and a very upset crying 7 year old, I marched straight to the manager. She was polite. We wound up with free breakfast the next morning. There were other things with her also, too long to write. I wanted a small fishing excursion, something light for the boys. She pretended to look for something and said she would get back to me. Never did. I found this guy on my own who took just the 4 of us on the lagoon and we saw all the iguanas we wanted and then fished for tarpon. I don't think I can post his web address, but contact me and I will be glad to give it to you. i highly recommend him. the kids loved it and wanted to go back the next day! After 4 nights here I did long for the resort atmosphere of the Westin, but we booked the extra two nights here b/c we did not feel like moving again. They were able to accommodate us and sent up wine and cheese, which was nice. We never visited the casino nor did we care to. This hotel seems to be popular for cruise ship people to spend a night or two on the way to their cruise or after. I saw a lot of older couples. But there was a fair amount of children also. The safety issue? It wasn't an issue. As a matter of fact, there was a woman who could not find her 14 year old son while they were waiting for their room. She was a mess and security was all over it. Turns out he had moved from the lounge chair she told him to stay in, crossed to the other side of the pool and put a towel over his head. I think she aged a few years but my point is security took it very serious and they were the people who eventually found him under the towel. I probably would not stay at this hotel again. Checked out the Ritz while we were there and think maybe we'll try that.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVED the Marriott Stellaris!”
Reviews.Author: ckrobynToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Stellaris one night pre-cruise on February 24, 2007. My only complaint is that we were not able to stay longer! The hotel was fabulous. The newly renovated rooms were wonderful and the staff courteous and helpful. We had a room in the tower building with a pool view and a partial ocean view and it was great. The renovated rooms include the new Marriott bedding, marble bathrooms as well as flat panel TV's. The pool area is gorgeous and my 10 year old daughter loved the waterslide. The hotel is located on the Condado and there is a Walgreens right across the street as well as several fast food restaurants nearby (Wendy's and Subway). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to San Juan. We are booked again for February 2008, this time for 3 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for a ghetto resort”
Reviews.Author: veek61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Juan Marriott Resort and Stellaris Casino for one night on our way to the Dominican Republic for spring break. We arrived at 2pm and left the next morning at noon. There is no shuttle service to the hotel, which is probably 20 minutes from the airport. Exiting in the SJ airport, there appears to be a single cab company - or single tourism company that manages the cabs. They are in a little kiosk as soon as you exit the airport and they write up your itinerary (for the cab driver) and tell you the fare. Then you line up and get in a cab when it is your turn. Cab fare to the hotel for 4 of us with 4 suitcases and a golf bag was $18.50USD. The hotel has a tall tower, maybe 20 floors, and then a 4-5 floor high wing (the "cabana" rooms). We requested a low floor in the tower because we had heard that the tower rooms had been renovated already but the cabana rooms had not. We were put in a tower room on the 18th floor, overlooking the pool and the ocean. The room was nicely decorated and clean, and had a new flat screen tv. The beach in this area has tan/brown sand. The water is bright blue/green. The pool at the resort is very nice and has a little water slide and swim up bar. They are obviously trying very hard to be a resort. The problem is that the area surrounding the hotel beachfront is all either graffitied and run-down, or under construction. Maybe eventually it will get cleaned up but we were really not enticed to walk along the beach, for example. This does not stop them from having resort prices. Our room was about $400 for the night (+/- tax) for a single room with two double beds. Hamburgers at the pool grill were $12, a bottle of corona was $5. The Vista restaurant in the hotel offered a lunch buffet for $22 per person and a breakfast buffet for $17. We did not do either and didn't even check the dinner prices. Out on the street side of the hotel you are within easy walking distance of a starbucks, walgreens, dunkin donuts, wendy's, and subway - in addition to several little local joints. We would only stay here again if we were on our way to somewhere else and this was a stopover for one night. This is not somewhere I'd want to go for my entire vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A+ in every area!”
Reviews.Author: GEVG
Reviews.Content: All staff at this hotel are hard working and very helpful. That says a lot. We had an ocean front room (10th floor) nicely decorated & very clean. Beds/pillows/towels/bath products good quality. LaVista restaurant on site great food/good service. Friday night seafood buffet worth the $30. Pool/beach area beautiful. Pool towels and chairs plentiful and in good shape. Location of this hotel near many resturants and bus stop. Walgreens just up the street is open 24hours. Safe and refrigerator in room very handy. Casino comps could be better, lost money but had a great time. Consider trying the Radisson up the street, small but fun (they serve sandwiches and soup at the machines)! We were at the Marriott 10 nights and can't say enough about how nice this place is. I think the only downfall is the $14.00/day parking fee if you rent a car. Consider only renting on the days you need to use a car. Hertz is just a few doors is cheaper than the Hertz counter at the hotel. Taxi service available 24 hours. Go to this hotel so you can enjoy the beach and hear the waiter say, Pina Coladas, Strawberry Daquiris, Margaritas, bottled water........

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Nice People”
Reviews.Author: amykins0711
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my marriott points. Hotel rooms were nice and clean and updated new recentley. We had a city view room and upgraded to a pool/ocean view. The front desk told us it would be $25 extra a night. A couple mornings I heard a little bit of construction, nothing much around 8am. I told the front desk and they deducted the extra $25 per night no problem. The waves are pretty big on this side of the island, and you should get to the pool to get the good seats in the sun if you- half the pool is in shade. The beach you could see construction and workers and an ugly bldg. next door- but the chairs are a plenty and they carry them out for you! The best thing to do is go to the beach until around 1 or 2 and then go to the pool for lunch and the rest of the afternoon. Sandwiches aren't bad there and you can get them for $7-10, depending on type. The drinks sure add up- so walgreens is right down the block to stock up. The casino is pretty good- all the staff is nice. The lobby is fun on the wknd. I suggest the Japanese restaurant and the mexican restaurant both right outside the marriott entrance. Also the El San Juan hote is fun lobby and casino and an awesome restaurant called the palms. Also a night club- kind of techno music though. Overall Service was great at the marriott - people very nice- nice room, comfy bed. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Capma
Reviews.Content: Location is close to the airport and safe. Very tourist area and Starbucks across the street and Walgreens is down the street. Has a nice pool and great beach. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Not too many restaurants close by but Old San Juan is a short taxi or bus trip away. The room we were in was newly renovated so it was nice. Casino is very small and limited but allows some play. I would stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as luxurious as you might expect”
Reviews.Author: junior8114
Reviews.Content: my wife and i paid over $300/night to stay in this hotel. we had to swipe our key card no less than 15 times to get it to work in the door. we could hear the people in the next room like they were in ours (laughing, tv, etc.). not very clean. the shower was an adventure. water was over my ankles in the tub by the time i was done. coffee bar food was terrible, with even worse service. i don't like being swarmed by 3-4 bellhops looking for dollars every time i get back to the hotel. really not worth the money you pay to stay here. beach is nice...but you really can't screw up beautiful carribean waters.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel...highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Teddy1995
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Marriott San Juan Resort and Stellaris Casino and our only regret is that we didn't plan for a longer stay. The hotel was recently remodeled and is very much top of the line, especially for the Caribbean. The hotel is located in the Condado area. There is a lot of activity on the streets daily and especially on the weekends. You'll feel comfortable leaving the hotel and walking or jogging. Lots of joggers. Lot of conveniences including a Walgreens one block up the street as well as a bus stop that will get you to Old San Juan and Plaza of the Americas. Staff- The staff was EXCELLENT. From the bell hops to the front desk staff to housekeeping everyone was accommodating and more importantly, knowledgeable. Rooms-We stayed in room 407. It was very nice and very updated. Balcony room facing pool with nice view of the Atlantic. Double beds were comfy. Granite counter tops, small fridge, flat panel t.v., marble/travertine in bathroom as well as granite top sink cabinet, complimentary use of robe and slippers, nice room decor.

Reviews.Title: “B++ : quibbles here and there”
Reviews.Author: fellow-in-chelsea
Reviews.Content: >> In the interest of disclosure: Moderate-price traveler. 10 night stay. Pool & Ocean view, non-renovated, non-smoking room. Instant review made during day six of 11 day stay. Gastronome and oenophile. >> Overall good-to-great review. Hotel is WELL-LOCATED in Condado district of San Juan. View from balcony of our room was spectacular. Surf was audible all day and night -- which i find pleasant. Hotel's decor is not swank but not homely either. Situated on the beach with a Walgreens, bodega, bus stop and several reataruants within a minute's walk. 2 pools. Beach chair and umbrellas available. During my stay about 65%-plus of the persons at the Hotel appeared to be families with children. A few straight couples. Almost no GAY/LESBIAN persons (sadly) seemed to be present. Beds are comfortable. Linens are soft. Staff is friendly and accommodating. For example: myself and companion often used the "Privacy Please" sign and the maids would ask when or if we would like the room tidied. Concierge is helpful. >> The quibbles: Rooms could use renovation, in particular the carpet. CD player in room would have been nice as would have been a better television (I did not use the television). In-hotel restaurants are fair at best. The Italian restaurant, is particularly mediocre given its $20+ entrees. Stick with the more casual dining option (La Vista). Wine choices both by the bottle and by the glass at the hotel are horrendous. Condado and Old San Juan are to my taste clearly not gastronomic or oenophile destinations. No vegetable other than root vegetables (plantains, cassava, yucca) could be found in the "local" restaurant offerings. Migas (dinner), while exhibiting a beautiful modern decor (and stunning marble or alabaster bar lit from below), presented sculptural but uninspiring food -- salt seemed to tb the preferred flavoring. Migas does have a varied wine list that is superb as compared against Zabo, Aguaviva, and Buena Yerba. My worst food experience to the date of this entry was lunch at Buenos Ayres on Condado ave/st(?): I sent back the soggy fried calamari; the coconut shrimp was encased in coconut such that no shrimp could be tasted; the house salad was all boston lettuce and unripe tomatoes. Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: gruvtrtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott in San Juan pre-cruise Feb 07 on a Saturday night. The total charge was $145.90 through Priceline. The cab from the airport was $16.50 and took about 10-15 minutes. We arrived around 1pm and, our room wasnâ€™t ready yet. The front desk directed us to the spa to change into our bathing suits and kept our luggage for us. The Marriott is beautiful and the service is top notch. The staff is always smiling and helpful. They have two pools. One has a swim up pool bar and a water slide. The other one seems to be shallower for children with fountains. There is a hot tub. There were kidâ€™s activities, a tattoo stand, a painter and a band by the pool. The beach is wide and there were plenty of chairs and some umbrellas. They give you towels to use as well. The sand is golden brown. The water is Caribbean blue but wasnâ€™t very clear: the waves were strong and the red flag was out. Waiters were serving drinks on the beach. There is a 10% resort fee for the Marriott which covers the following: wireless access in public areas, room and pool; one hour free internet at Business Center; free local calls and free 800 calls; one bottle of water per day; beach chairs and umbrellas; live music daily; $5 casino match play coupon. There is a Hertz rental counter, a tour desk and a self-laundry at the hotel. There are several bars and restaurants. The Marriott lobby is large and open with a bar at the center. On Saturday night there was a nice band playing Latin music. The bar was crowded and there were a lot of people dancing. To the right of the lobby is the casino. There werenâ€™t many slots and the ones they had were cramped at night. They have a few tables in the center of the casino. The workout room had plenty of equipment. They have a small aerobics space with classes available. A sign offered yoga for $5 per class for hotel guests. The spa had showers and lockers. We stayed in a city view room on the 11th floor with a king bed. It has the bed with the duvet, mattress cover and several pillows. There is a flat screen TV that has connections for your computer, camera and music. The room has wireless internet for $10 per day. There is a work desk and a large chair and ottoman. The closet is large and a robe and slippers came with the room. There is also a fridge. Our balcony has a city view. You can see the mountains off in the distance. It seems like every room has a balcony, although some of the views are better than others and some rooms are oceanfront. The bathroom is huge with a rain shower. There is a safe in the room. The hotel is an easy walk from shops and restaurants on Ashford. The Radisson is a few blocks down the street. We had lunch at the Latin Star. The restaurant has a roofed terrace that is great for people watching. The food was authentic Puerto Rican and it was delicious. We started out with an order of fried plantains that were cooked to perfection. Our lunch bill came to $46. The service was excellent. There is a Starbucks across the street and a Walgreens about a block away from the Marriott. For super we ate at Zoba, in an old house down the street toward the Radisson. The ambiance was great, but the service was very slow. The food was so-so and one of our supper entrÃ©es was cold. The final tally for supper was $71. Given the price, slow service and cold meal, I donâ€™t think I would eat here again. Check out the next morning was a breeze and we easily got a taxi to the pier for $19. We had a wonderful stay and highly recommend this hotel. It exceeded our expectations in every way, particularly the service.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good But Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: MimiCSeattle
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a week-long conference at this Marriott and from previous reviews knew to ask for one of the remodeled rooms. I really recommend this because my colleagues' rooms were terribly shabby, but the new ones are very nicely appointed, if a bit on the small side. I also had a corner room which had a gorgeous view of the pool, beach and city (at an additional cost of course). I enjoyed my stay until day four when construction started around 8:00am in a room near mine. The noise was like a small jack hammer that could not be escaped, even with earplugs. I politely asked to move rooms but was told there were a lot of people coming in that day and to check back later in the day. The situation was handled very poorly and I am following up for partial credit on the room because they never moved me and construction started early the next morning. Besides this pretty major glitch, the rest of the experience was nice: pretty public areas, great pool and beach. One thing that you should note when reserving is that the price of the hotel does not include a $25 tax + $22 resort fee. We were part of a group so it was not clear whether this was to be expected but that seems like a significant addition on top of an already high room rate if you're not expecting it. The hotel is a $12. cab ride away from Old San Juan, which is postcard beautiful and has some really great restuarants. We enjoyed several including Baru which had great food (sit outside) and Amadeus, which had a great ambiance with live Spanish music and a great menu that includes excellent seafood. I also suggest starting off your night at the upstairs bar at El Convento (beautiful little hotel) and a post-dinner walk on Paseo de la Princesa. PR is beautiful and the people were extremely warm. It's impossible not to fall in love with this city. I will certainly return but hopefully to a much quieter room. One last note: our group was taken to the phosfourescent lagoon in Fajardo. Kayaking through a channel in a mangrove and coming into the lagoon's shimmering waters under a starry sky is an experience I'll never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Year After Year”
Reviews.Author: NYCJOHN
Reviews.Content: I have been spending a week at San Juan Marriot each year for 10 years now and consider it a great place. The location is great. The Condado area is a great combination of beach resort and real city. Very short walk to excellent restaurants and good shopping. The hotel is right on the beach. The rooms are good, service is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 day stay for business.”
Reviews.Author: ztraveler-6
Reviews.Content: I had a quick business trip and the hotel was perfect. They had wireless high speed internet access in the hotel so I could work from my room. Best of all, I could sit out on the balconey with a beer and do my emails while listening to the waves crash. The staff were very friendly and helpful. And they actually new which meeting room to direct me to. I wish I had more time there becuase the pool looked like fun.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Wendell B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends prior to a cruise and had a good time. They did a great job re-building the old Dupont and added a new casion and parking garage. The room was good with a comfortable bed and aswome shower pressure. This was a great assist in waking up mornings. The food in the restaurant was very good. Enjoyed the buffet. even had a few hand-rolled cigars which are made and sold on site. Very large pool with waterfall and private access to the Condado beach. Large pool bar with pool attendants. A useful laundry for washing. I'm not much of gambler but did loose a bit in the casino, but had fun doing it. Pretty good location on the Condado strip but away from Old San Juan, will need to have car. Rebuilding going on in the neighbourhood as things are improving. Some very good local restaruants nearby. Overall a very good time here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: momilyn
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased that we choose the Marriott for our 5 night stay! I can not say enough of how kind and friendly the workers were. Our room was on the 11th floor in the tower, so our room was one of the newly renovated rooms and it was lovely. We loved the fact that we felt like we were at a resort and then all you had to do was walk out the front lobby and you're on a street with plenty of awesome restaurants and shops! A Starbucks across the street, a gelato/sandwich shop, and great pizza places. We caught the bus practically in front of the Marriott for 75 cents and we were in magnificent Old San Juan in 15 minutes. Again, all the people in Puerto Rico were extremely friendly! I would highly recommend eating lunch or dinner at the Parrot Club in Old San Juan - delicious! My husband and I can't wait to go back and experience more of Puerto Rico and we would defintely stay at the Marriott again!

Reviews.Title: “A Place for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: lisa222
Reviews.Content: I am staying at this property for business for a week. There is no construction noise, at least after 5 pm. No signs of construction in the lobby, casino, or pools. In fact, my well-worn room overlooking the beach+pools (a cabana room on the 7th floor) could use a bit of restorative construction! Nothing is truly bad about the room, just a bit tired. For $345, I have had more exciting rooms! Beautiful pools, though. Pro's: --great area--many, many resto's within walking distance. --short cab ride to Old San Juan --nice beach --nice linens (bathrobe, 7 pillows on the bed, good duvet) --great air con --quiet (at least Cabana rooms are very quiet) Con's: --no discernable up-grades for Marriott frequent stay members --housekeeping goofs (no coffee with the coffee pot) --no screen on doorwall to balcony, so can't leave door open (due to insects) --most guests are cruisers--old+loud

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lv2travlChantilly
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the San Juan Marriott. We loved (let me emphasize) LOVED!!!!! our room. I booked the corner room on the 10th floor directly through the hotel. Yes, it was pricier than all of the internet sites, but I have found through the years (and I travel a lot), if I book through the hotel, I get the best rooms. This one was no exception. Two huge balconies, one oceanfront and one overlooking the beautiful pool area. The ocean was very clear and beautiful, which surprised me being right in town. It was different every day...very calm one day and incredibly strong waves the next. It is a beautiful stretch of beach to walk on. The hotel staff, every one of them, were incredibly friendly and helpful. We ate at their Italian themed restaurant which was wonderful and got our breakfast every day for practically nothing at the lobby floor coffee shop and their coffee was 10 times better than anything I have ever gotten here! The location of the hotel is perfect but you need to take a taxi to get to Old San Juan. We rented a car and got around very easily. There are a few big parking garages in Old San Juan and we also drove out to the rain forest. The hotel and surrounding area are undergoing construction, but I hope to hasten the comeback of this beautiful island. I am looking forward to going back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: jimgray99
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 5th floor in an oceanfront room. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was small but very clean and well decorated. Room safe, plasma TV and refrigerator in the room. A cab to the old town was about $15 but I recommend the bus. The bus stop is just a 1/2 block down Ahsford street to the right. Dinner in the Tuscany resturant in the hotel was the best meal of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mccoyote
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous!! We asked for a room on a high floor and got lucky with a corner room that had a partial ocean view and a view of the city!! It was great. The pool is really fun with the slide and the beach is nice. The waves are strong though; if you like boogie boarding, this is the place. (You can rent a boogie board from a lady on the beach for 10$ a day.) Service at the hotel was great and the casino was nice and the gym is AWESOME!!!! The restaurants around there are ok: you got your fast-food classics and some ok places for lunch. Old San Juan is the best for a nice dinner. My boyfriend and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Thanksgiving Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lydmik
Reviews.Content: What a great Thanksgiving Vacation at the Marriott in San Juan. The staff was great!! I asked the Concierge Enid where there places to eat for breakfast. She stated "Here of course", and provided my family of 4 complimentary breakfast for the entire stay. The pluses: - The resorts Tower is being refurbished so the place was not crowded. - The kids love the slide at the pool and the beach which was cleaned everyday. - Great staff. All recommendations for restaurants were right on! One of our favorites was the Restauran Buenos Ayres which is a block 1/2 away on Condado and the Parrot Club in Old San Juan. - The room was always clean - Walgreens is a block away for getting drinks and snacks The minuses: - Agree with last posting about the beds. They were too soft and the pillows were too small. - Prices for drinks are high but go in with the attitude that this is a resort and your on vacation ($7.00 for rum runners; $4.00 for lemonade) I'd highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A really good time to be had....”
Reviews.Author: taln
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week's stay. Business trip - but have some great things to say about the resort. First things: The beach area is actually very pretty - as well as the pool area. The restaurants were great also. The room service was actually fantastic! I stayed on the 7th floor on the Cabana side of the hotel. Great view of the pool and beach area! My only complaints are this: - the bed was a bit too mushy for my taste - the rooms were showing some wear and tear - the drinks were expensive However, some other good points are: - Great lobby bar, great live bands and great food. The staff was very accomodating and helpful too! The resort was very clean. My room was always spotless. Great towl art too. Not to mention, leave the cleaning crew a tip from time to time and they are very appreciative. - Great bellman service, etc. - Good workout facilities and great massage rooms/massages. If you are staying here, you will have a good time. The hotel is 60% under renovation in the main building. The good news is that there are less people to fight for spots on the beach or pool, and the even better news is that there is no construction noise. :-) Have fun! ps - some grrreat restaurants to try in old san juan are: dragonfly and Tantra. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “had a blast”
Reviews.Author: voodoovixsin
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here on our honeymoon in may, and i do have to say we had the best time! the service was excellent and the hotel wasnt too busy. however....a lot of people from the island came to the bar area(women) looking for travelers to mooch off of, we noticed, and i was bugged constantly about lending out cigarettes and they were rude. my hubby and i had platinum membership, so we were able to get access to the penthouse for free meals and drinks 24/7, so that helped, and had an ocean view and a city view since we were a corner room on the 16th floor. we couldnt even hear the construction. i would recommend this hotel, but be prepared to spend some money! food and drinks and cabs are expensive!

Reviews.Title: “We had a terrific time - hotel, staff are very”
Reviews.Author: Creek28
Reviews.Content: We played hurricane roulette and won in mid-August, 2006! This hotel in Condado near Old San Juan was a terrific base for our first visit to Puerto Rico. The staff was wonderful to my wife, two young teenage children and me. The beach and pool were delightful. The tours which we booked in the hotel lobby to el Yunque rainforest and the Camuy Caves were a lot of fun. The temperature was hot but the breezes around the el Morro fort, La Fortereza (a nice surprise), etc made it very tolerable. It was humid in el Yunque but we had a blast. We recommend the Parrot Club in San Juan for dinner. In response to several postings in this forum, we found all the people of Puerto Rico that we met to be very nice, helpful and friendly. The hotel, airfare and airport transportation arrangements that we made through Travelocity were at fair prices and all worked very well. In short, we recommend this hotel and our trip to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rcp412
Reviews.Content: I was plesantly surprised by the San Juan Marriott. My family and I went here for vacation in April 2005, and I have to say when I was reading the reviews before our trip, I had my doubts. However, my family loved it here! The staff is extremely friendly and courteous, probably the frendliest I've ever dealt with. The standard rooms were average sized but beautifully decorated. The room service breakfast is absolutly delicious along with the Italian restaurant on-site. We loved the spacious balcony overlooking the ocean. The pools were great, but can get a little crouded. Pool area is beautiful! One of the only things that was slightly dissaponting was the beach. The beach itself was very nice, but the loud construction got in the way of a peaceful beach day. Some of the reviews say that the ocean is rough but we found that absolutly false. It was very calm and warm. I would without a doubt stay at the Marriott again!

Reviews.Title: “OK but area needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Quest I
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Lots of restaurants in the area. Cab rides to old san juan are around 15 bucks each way. If you stayed at an Isla Verde hotel, be prepared to spend around 25 bucks each way. The main problems were: 1. Way overpriced (around 320 a night) 2.
