Construction nearby (although I didn't hear much noise). 3. conditions on the beach. No life guard. Great in front of hotel but, on each side there were old abandoned buildings. This hotel is one of the newest on Condado Beach only because a huge fire in the 80's gutted the place. We stayed by the pool view, ocean in the distant. Very cool. I would not stay in this hotel if your view is the street. Any room from the 6th floor up is great. Pool was nice. The water temp was great. the waves are extremely strong with a nasty undertow. No life guards make it dangerous for children under 12. They rent boogie boards for 6 bucks a day. Was fun. Overal It was a really good place to stay for a family but, definitely not honeymoon material

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Singh-NJ
Reviews.Content: Visited Puerto Rico for the first time and stayed here after reading a number of reviews on TripAdvisor, Yahoo and Expedia. What I liked: - Lobby, location, pool, casino, restaurants What could have been better: - Room, Bathroom, location There is a bus stop to Old San Juan but it is unpredictable and the bus service is very slow. The area has alot of restaurants, parks, and shopping but also has alot of construction. If your going to San Juan, I would definately recommend staying at a resort, a good one. Going to Old San Juan is a day trip, a few good sites, nice too walk around if its not hot, not much to shop for.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful under Construction!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is under construction. Dust and debri everywhere. Call and ask frist before you book. Ask for a room as far away from the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week's stay at the Marriott and couldn't have had a nicer vacation and relaxing time. From the moment we arrived to our departure, the staff and environment was excellent! We traveled with our two teenage daughters and had adjoining rooms which made a nice suite effect. The pools and hot tub are well maintained; the restaurants serve delicious food! There is even a place to do your laundry by yourself rather than using the hotel service (saves $$). Starbucks is right across the street as is a delicious gelato/food restaurant. Within walking distance are drug stores, food marts, all types of restaurants (Italian, Japanese, American etc.) We had an absolutely wonderful time at the Marriott and are anxious to visit again next year! No other hotel other than the Marriott!!!

Reviews.Title: “It Was O.K.”
Reviews.Author: NoJokeDee
Reviews.Content: I spent my birthday at the San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino in Condado, PR. We stayed for 4 nights in a poolside/oceanview, nonsmoking room on the 10th floor. Overall, it was a beautiful hotel, but there were some problems. First of all, check-in was a nightmare. I was not told before I arrived that there was an additional deposit if you use a debit card instead of a credit card. I went to prepay for my room, but the front desk clerk stated I would have to pay an additional $250 dollars that I did not have. I asked for the manager, and he acted as is he didn't know anything. Eventually, my friend and I paid cash for the room for the first night just to get settled in. The next day was also a bit frustrating because of the deposit requirement. The day manager was willing to work with us; however, she called my room at about 7:00 o'clock in the morning to ask about my credit card, which I thought was VERY rude. Second, there was a small drip coming from the ceiling in the bathroom. The first engineer came and wiped off the ceiling, and told the manager it was condensation. The second engineer said the same thing. Eventually, there were about four different maintenance engineers sent to my room before it was resolved. Third, the water in the bathroom never actually got hot. It was just warm, and I really don't like to take warm showers and baths. They also ran out of washcloths by my second night. NEVERTHELESS, I voiced my concerns to the manager upon checkout and requested to be compensated for the inconveniences. He refunded the cash price I paid for the first night including the resort tax and fees. Overall, I can say this was a pretty nice hotel. I was not excited by the location because it was in a neighborhood that is currently being renovated. There are several other large hotels being torn down, built up or rebuilt, and the construction took away from my view. But the rooms in the Marriott were clean. The rest of the staff was friendly, and the beds were very soft. The pool area was beautiful. It included a waterslide, and the beach was nice; however, the gates to the beach close at about 6:00 pm, and you have to go out to the street if you want access to the beach in the evening. On the weekends, there are live bands that play in the lobby, and they serve food and drinks; but there is also a two-drink minimum and the food is just O.K. The casino was O.K., but I did not see one person really win anything. All guests have 24-hour access to the business center, which includes a daily 1-hour free pass to use the internet and printer. Guests also receive a complementary bottle of water daily, and free access to the fitness center. I was able to borrow an umbrella the day it rained, and the guys working at the Concierge and Rental Car booths were very nice. My suggestions when it comes to staying here: Take the bus when possible. Request a higher floor because of the house band, but not too high because of the construction. Have an open mind, be flexible and donâ€™t let the small stuff ruin your vacation. Bring a lot of money because things got a bit pricey at times, and study some basic words in Spanish because there are still a lot of people who donâ€™t speak English. Also, buy water, toiletries and additional film at the Walgreens down the street, and make sure you spend at least one day sightseeing in Old San Juan. If I ever go back to San Juan, I will most likely stay at another property in Isla Verde instead of Condado because of the nightlife. We spent at least $30 dollars a day on taxis going back and forth between Isla Verde or Caroline and Condado. Although there were some decent nightclubs and restaurants near the Marriott in Condado, most of the popular ones were located in the other areas. The San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino in Condado is a good hotel for families who just want to relax and who donâ€™t plan to venture out to the other areas too often.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: fredandkell
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 3:00 on a Monday and headed to checkin. We were paying for 2 nights of the vacation ourselves and redeeming 2 nights through Marriott rewards points. Our redemption points were only for a cityview room, but the clerk allowed us to stay in the same room all four nights (the 2 nights we paid for were in a club-level ocean front corner room). We were thrilled by that - we had not wanted to change rooms, and that was a significant upgrade. Our room wasn't ready until 4:00 but they gave us a pager and we hung out in the lobby. The rooms do need upgrading, but hey, that's what they're doing for the next few months, so we knew what to expect. The corner room was large and had two magnificant balconies. The bed was very comfy. The beach was awesome. I don't know why someone said the beach was "small" - they're crazy!! It is HUGE! Very deep beach, with Hawaii-like sand (very soft and thick granular) and Gulf of Mexico water (even though you're on the Atlantic side, the water is green/blue and very clear). The waves were nice - big enough to give you a thrill, but no nasty undertow. I did hear the water gets pretty rough on this side of the island in the winter. The lounge chairs and umbrellas were a nice touch. The pool was nice; one pool is only 2 feet deep for the kiddies, but I found the beach to be the main attraction anyway. We ate at La Vista - not horribly expensive, typical $12 resort burgers. A decent meal. I recommend walking out of the hotel and going left to eat. (There wasn't much to the right except a Wendy's.) As mentioned in other reviews, Yerba Buena was FANTASTIC! A must-eat! The casino - ho hum. Just not really that exciting. There was only one craps table and it was the deadest, most devoid of life thing we've ever seen. The dealers didn't seem to really know the rules either. We had fun playing roulette, but most people there play slots or blackjack. Low-limit tables were nice ($2 roulette). The casino is expanding another 2,000 square feet to add penny and nickel slots. People complaining about the casino being smoky - have you ever been in a casino that WASN'T smoky?!?! We had been excited to stay in a hotel with a casino, being gamblers, but we didn't spend much time in this one. Also they do not give free drinks to the players! On that note, the club level lounge doesn't have free booze either. I was surprised by this - I thought this was the point of club level!? They have this "honor bar" system where you can get booze between 5:30 and 7:30 and you write down your name and what you bought and it gets charged to your bill. Drinks were pricey ($6.75 for a local beer). And wouldn't you know it, someone wrote down our name and charged alcohol to our room that we didn't drink and we had to get them to take it off the bill. (You are supposed to sign in every time you use club level. I think someone got our name off the signin sheet and wrote it on the alcohol sheet. Moral of that story - don't bother signing in). The desserts and breakfast in club level were very nice, though. This is a hotel where you definitely want to stay so that you can see the ocean. The other side ain't nothing to look at. I would not stay in the cabana rooms - the tower is the only way to go (after it's done in 2007!). The cabana rooms looked to be much lower quality than the tower rooms and have limited views of the water, even if you are on the ocean side. Overall we were very pleased by the hotel and would stay here again, especially after the renovation. It was a very relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Get Away...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from the Marriott. It was a nice quick get away for 6 full days. We got to the hotel 12:00 noon, we had requested early check in, that was the best, our room was waiting for us on the 18th floor looking out to the ocean. The room was nice nothing spectacular, clean and the beds & pillows were so comfortable. The pool was very small but we are beach people, who wants to go away and sit on concret. Richard at the beach was amazing, he would have me all set with 2 chairs, 2 tables and an umbrella everyday at 8:00 am, that was the best not having to worry about finding a chair.The staff was excellent very, very friendly. The Tuscany resteraunt was fabulous, we went twice excellent, I would recommend it. The buffet was average, so we never ate there. Lunch we grabbed a salad or a sandwich and ate it at one of the tables. We went into Old San Juan for some shopping and dinner a few times, I wasen't impressed at all. The stores close at 6:00 pm so you have to go in the afternoon and we didn't want to leave the beach, but we did. The shopping was just ok, jewlery stores, coach outlet, got some good buys...Then just your tee shirt and trinket shops...I wouldn't run back to Old San Juan so fast. Everyone made it sound like it was the best but I found it to be no big deal. The resteraunts there were great thought, we ate at Aqua Viva, had a watermellon sangria that was to die from, excellent food...I found the location of the hotel to be excellent, we walked every night to get a galate across the street and ate dinner's at the local places right on the street by the hotel. Wallgreens is 1 block fron the hotel which came in handy for soda, water and snacks. Overall, it was a nice get away for 6 day's, would I go back?? Im not sure, there are many other places to visit....I hope my review helps....

Reviews.Title: “Very average, with airplane noise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was average. Certainly not worth $200 USD per night. Tiny beach. At the pool, all day long you hear every single airplane taking off and landing since hotel is only 2 miles away. Room was clean. DVD player was a nice touch. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “How you look depends on where you go”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It all depends on what you want and expect from a beach vacation. If you are hoping to "get away from the things of man", this is not the place or destination for you.But if you are happy to take the elevator to the beach, head to San Juan! The hotel is in the center of the city near lots of other hotels and restauarants and was buzzing the whole week we were there (leading up to the Memorial Day weekend). The staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable, and went out of their way to be helpful. The beach is nice, with big waves and smooth white sand, but the pool at the hotel was a real let down. It was a small wading pool that could get very crowded and noisey at peak times (especially when the 20 somethings were drinking heavily and playing volley ball). We found that the hotel was mostlyfrequented by younger couples in their 20's and 30's, singles, business travlers, and some young families (we had two 19 year olds with us.) Our room directly overlooked the ocean so that was a nice treat. Make sure to ask where to go when heading out to the restaurants. Danny's International for breakfast was good, but the breakfast buffet at the hotel was a good value too. Other restuarants were recommended by friends and travlers but they didn't turn out to be as good as the hotel's recommendations. The cataraman snorkling trip was really fun, but the bus ride to get to the boatyard took 2 hours going and 1.5 hours returning! Old San Juan has great restuarants, our favorite was Baru (romantic and excellent food). Shopping there is a big disappointment, unless you are looking for fine jewelry. I think Old San Juan has a lot more character, but I am not sure how the beaches fare over there. I liked Puerto Rico but would defintely chose another destination for an island and hotel if I was heading back to the beach anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: JenJos
Reviews.Content: Weekend trip to the Marriott was great. I was a little worried after reading the reviews but was pleasantly surprised. We stayed on the 18th floor so we were not disturbed by the band in the lobby. The sound of the waves at night was very relaxing. Room service was great and not too expensive with nice sized portions. Restaurants in walking distance with Miro being our favorite. The staff was pleasant and accomodating. We arrived early but had a room within an hour. The beach seemed nice but the water was rough. Hope this helps any wouldbe travelers.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: Sayra
Reviews.Content: This was my first time going to Puerto Rico I love the hotel it was great the room was wonderful I stayed in a ocean view room category.it was great just to sit there in the night and hear the waves coming in. The room service was good and the price was reasonable. Everyone in the hotel was nice especially at the beach and the pool. The beach was great however the waves were kind of strong, but the that can be your work out for the day.The beds were extremely comfortable. Housekeeping was absolutely exceptional. I would definitely go again and stay at this hotel.The hotel is centrally located 20 minutes away from the airport and 15 minutes away from Old San Juan. I would recommend this hotel for everyone families, singles, couples.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: DG0217
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel for a vacation. You get the distinct feeling that you are at an average, borderline run-down, Marriott in central New Jersey, it doesn't feel like a resort at all. This hotel needs work in every respect. The rooms need to be renovated ASAP. They are dank and haven't converted to Marriott's new fancy bed policy (knock-off of heavenly bed at Westin). A Courtyard has nicer rooms. The shower head was at my shoulder, like 2 feet below a regular shower head. I have never seen anything like that! But, we were there for the beach and sun. However, when we got outside, we were disappointed. The pool is small and shallow. One half of the pool is a little deeper, but there is a volleyball net there, which takes up the entire pool with the net and crazy kids playing, so forget that! You need to hang out in the 2 foot side of the pool. They never opened the swim up bar during our 4 day stay. The beach was short and the water was too rough to hang out. There were big waves and lots of locals with full surf boards and boogie boards, so beware you might get hit when they come crashing down. The waves weren't huge, but you couldn't relax out there, you needed to be alert so you could dive under the waves, or get knocked down. They did have a lot of chairs on the beach and attentive waiters though. They charge way too much money for what they deliver + resort fee. Positives: close to the airport and old san juan. However, I don't think Old San Juan is as quaint as everyone claims. It has like 2 cobblestone streets and everyone acts like it's Europe. It is about 30% gentrified. There are some nice, trendy NY-style restaurants littered between shops that sell random trinkets not from Puerto Rico, We saw lots of shops selling stuff from India, China, and Africa. I recommend Marmalade and Dragon Fly, good food, fun, and fancy drinks. I also recommend going to another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Old rooms, nice views!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianMag
Reviews.Content: I paid $110 a night for this room on priceline. We had a tower room and garden room. I would never paid the normal $300ish price for these run down rooms. I felt more dirty when I got out of the shower then when I got in!!! There was mold everywhere. The beds were nice, as well as the pool and the ocean. Other then that this hotel really needs its 6 month reno. I feel a little ripped off paying $110 for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for Cabana rooms and political climate”
Reviews.Author: GoGirl2006
Reviews.Content: I try to stay at Marriott brand hotels because I believe they provide the best customer service for the price you pay. Unlike Starwood brand hotel, I have consistently received 5-star service no matter what brand I stay in. For Starwood, I have only found this type of service in their W brand hotels. So, although I found the service at the Marriott to be exceptional as usual, there were a few problems that I faced with my room. First, I purchased an oceanview/pool room on the Internet. Since this and a â€œcity viewâ€� were the only options I was offered, I assumed this provided the view of the ocean I wanted. Wrong. I discovered when I arrived that there also was an â€œoceanfront room,â€� but since it wasnâ€™t available, it wasnâ€™t given as an option on the Internet. Since they were completely booked, it took a couple of days before they could move me to a room that provided a view of the ocean. So remember, oceanfront, not oceanview. Now a word about those rooms. I was place in the â€œCabanaâ€� section, which is where the hotel plans to place people when they begin their renovations in June. These rooms provide a direct, beautiful view of the ocean IF you are on the 6th floor or higher ( I was first place on the 4th floor and then moved to the 7th.) Anything lower than 6th provides you with a view of the palm trees that rise from built-in planters sprinkled throughout the pool area. (I included photos) Whoever designed the pool area should have realized the trees would grow. My view from the 4th floor was like looking at the ocean through a tropical forest. And believe me, I saw more forest than ocean. I'm speaking of the "cabana" section only. I don't know what the view is from the towers. So be warned, excellent customer service from everyone â€“ maid, bellman, parking attendants, manager, concierge â€“ I canâ€™t congratulate them enough, but â€œoceanview Cabana sectionâ€� actually means â€œforest viewâ€� unless you are on the sixth floor or higher. Itâ€™s worth a phone call to ask. Also, Puerto Rico is in the mist of a fiscal crisis. The government runs out of money on Monday, May 1st unless the Puerto Rico Congress approves a loan to carry them through the two months remaining in the fiscal year. No money means all government employees will be furloughed. On Friday, April 28 about 50,000 people protested in Old San Juan, which is where the government offices are. Because of this, cab drivers were not taking anyone into Old San Juan. I believe buses were going to the area, but Iâ€™m not sure. So, you may want to check to see what the current political situation before you go. Trust me, itâ€™s not limited to the Old San Juan area. On the morning I left, at approximately 6:30 a.m. someone parked a truck loaded with HUGE speakers and started broadcasting â€œloudâ€� music and political slogans. When I say â€œloud,â€� Iâ€™m not talking about young men driving down the street loud, Iâ€™m taking CIA/FBI blasting â€œloudâ€� that they use to disorient criminals. So check. For food try Latin Star, which is right next to the Walgreens. Great food and great prices (about $10 bucks). I went for a walk and found La Patisserie de France, a great french bakery with a latin twist. Breakfast of eggs, ham, toast, butter and jelly, french toast, potatoes and the best coffee in the world for about $5 bucks. They have different breakfast specials each morning. 1500 block of Ashford. And for a little more money (average $17 entrees), try the shredded steak at Roja Vieja Grill, also on Ashford.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott-Better than O.K.”
Reviews.Author: survivor3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott 4/14-4/20 and I was a bit nervous from reading all the reviews.As always some things are great and some just o.k.Yes the rooms are a bit old,but clean.The bathroom small ,not tiny and we found the water pressure in the shower just great.Hotel service was very friendly and very helpful.We were on the 8th floor and heard no noise in the room from the lobby.We had a room overlooking the pool and ocean,beautiful.The ocean was great,of course you want waves,they are fun if you want calm go to the pool.chairs at the pool are taken very early and there is no shade.The beach has umbrellas if you get there early enough.We had no problem getting any type of service at the pool.beach or casino.The weekends at the casino are way too busy and the lobby is very crowded but the music is great. Tuscany was very good.We ate at La Vusta for lunch once and that was enough,just fair.Got to Danny's for breakfast and lunch(pizza was good).Yuerba Buena, just down the street was great.I would stay at this hotel agin and when the rooms are renivated I am sure it will be even better!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time!”
Reviews.Author: Cherber
Reviews.Content: I just came back from this Marriott and had no problems what so ever. We stayed from 4/9 to 4/15. We had a pool/ocean view and the room was clean, there was no smells or mildew as the others have reported maybe because we were in the cabana club side of the hotel. Yes, the room was a little out dated but you are not in your room all day and night. The service was great we needed extra towels, we called and within fifteen minutes they were at the door. Yes, the internet was down and I did call to find out how long and they told me a couple of hours. Ok, no problem went to the beach. When we came back to our room there was a bottle of wine and plate of fresh fruit and a note saying "Sorry for the inconvenience". Nice touch... As for the beach, you have to remember you are on the Atlantic Ocean side of Puerto Rico not the Caribbean Sea side. Yes the waves were a little ruff but we spend our summers down at the Jersey Shore so this was nothing to us. My husband and sons spent hours in the water just riding the waves and to them this was heaven. We had no problem getting service on the beach, pool, casino or in the hotel lobby. They also have entertainment in the hotel lobby on certain nights. Very entertaining to watch. The hotel did have a reception night, Wednesday, where you got to meet some of the staff and ask any questions about the renovations. They served free drinks and hot appetizers. We found everyone to be very nice and helpful. They keep the hotel very clean. Every morning I watched them clean the lounge chairs and tables at the pool. There are many shops and restaurants right outside of the hotel. We found the food in the hotel to be very good. In fact we had sirloin steaks and filet mignon one night that you could cut with a butter knife that is how tender they were. Yes, they are a little bit pricey but anywhere in the caribbean islands the prices are high. Just like everyone says go to WALGREENS. We bought snacks,water,coke,etc..... We also went to the Bicardi Factory and Old San Juan. Just watch out for the taxi drivers, they drive crazy. Also the cost to these sites should only be around $12.00 and to the airport only around $15.00 and these prices were for 7 of us. Go and enjoy yourself you will have a great time. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stress over other reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was nervous after priceline gave me this hotel when I read the other reviews, particularly about service, rooms and friendliness. I found it just the opposite. from the moment I walked in the lobby, hotel staff were friendly and smiling. I had a great room caddy corner to the ocean and although it faced a building under construction, the view of the ocean made up for everything. Breakfast on site was great and you can eat outside facing the ocean. Although it rained a lot, I spent time mostly on beach when sun was out. The gym was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back, definitely not worth the price, but not bad. Probably the best hotel in Condado, but that isn't saying that much. As with most Marriott's, this place looks like it hasn't been upgraded since it was built. Nice pool, beach was very dirty, food was okay. I wouldn't pay $300 again. Jack

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bones57
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 6 day stay at the Marriott. The service was very good. The hotel will be undergoing renovations starting in June. These are needed, however, it is just age showing. The beach was beautiful and so was the view from our room. The restaurants in the area (called Condado) were from very good to excellent. They are: 1. Arencello = on Ashford Ave. 1 block from hotel. A new reatuarant, with nouvelle italian cuisine. It was fantastic. It is owned by a young group and are extremely attentive. The chefs came out and explained the meals. 2. Jose Jose - traditional restaurant- Right off ashford. Excellent food and service. Very Expensive. Food is excellent. Upscale. Need to dress neatly. 3. Yerba Buena - On ashford ave. - traditional Cuban. Outside and inside service. Food was very good. 4. Ajili Mojili - Tradtional Puerto Rican. - The Mojitos ( local dish with plainatins stuffed with seafood, meat or chicken are excellent.) About 1/2 mile from hotel on Ashford. 5. Breakfast at Danny's International - 1/2 price of the hotel. Right down the street. Old San Juan was awesome - Great prices on jewelry and local items. Many nice stores there. Overall a good experience. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rooms old and run down”
Reviews.Author: Boders
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before departing for our cruise. Overall, I found the hotel to be nice, but our room was very old and run down (nice bed though). The rooms (and hallways) are in desperate need of refurbishing. It all seemed a bit worn. With that said, our view of the ocean was spectacular. Loved sleeping with the doorwall open listening to the waves crashing in all night. Enjoyed the breakfast buffet. Can't speak to the price as it was part of our package. Didn't eat at any of the restaurants (although we know people who did and said they were over-priced and not very good). Instead, head to Old San Juan -- there are great restaurants there! We had dinner at Baru, absolutely amazing! I would stay here again, but not more than one night. If they refurbish the rooms, this hotel would be MUCH nicer overall.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from the Marriott. I went with my husband and two young children ages 2 and 4. We had a blast. Our rate was $335 per night from the Marriott website (this included breakfast at La Vista restraunt - a great buffet) First off the service was top notch. I have stayed at top notch hotels much more expensive than this and the service here was much better. They lost one of our bags at the airport and it was waiting in our room when we arrived back from dinner that night. Due to the wine we walked right past it and fell asleep only to notice it the next morning with a message of its arrival (also unnoticed the previous night) on the phone. My son fell and scraped his knee so I called for a band aid. They sent a guy to our room with a big old medical bag to assess the situation and "treat" the injury with an antibiotic spray and band aid. Our requests for extra towels were met promptly. Out by the pool the staff would remind us of the kids activities that were about to start in case we lost track of time. On the beach we were looking around at the sea of chairs late one morning and a staff came up and asked if we needed help setting up our chairs (they are heavy and it was hot and kids, etc.) So he basically did the whole set up for us including digging a big hole with a shovel for the huge umbrella we also needed. He did not hesitate to run back and get us two more beach towels and run our drink order in to the beach bar. Someone else promtly brought the drinks over to us. All the waitstaff seemed to be experienced in anticipating needs. At the brreakfast even though it was a buffet, our waiter would offer to get a waffle or omlet or whatever for us if there was a bit of a line. Coffee and juice were served almost mmediately when you sat down. Great buffet by the way. They had all the healthy stuff (huge cut up fruit bar, hot cereal, homemade yogurt bagels w/ lox and the trimmings, cold cereal) and all the less healthy stuff (omlet bar, waffels, pancakes, french toast, bacon, potatos, etc.) with a huge bread/muffin spread to boot. The concierge made great recommendations for restraunts (try the Parrot Club and Ropa Vieja for dinner) and made the reservations. Tuscany restraunt was ok but not fabulous. My dish was salty. The Lobby and all common areas were well appointed with marble and brass and spotlessly maintained. The rooms however were your standard Marriott rooms and showed a little wear around the edges. The bathroom was clean but you could tell it was definately not new, which can be a bit unsettling for some discriminating travellers like myself. However the bed was great and bed linens looked new. Overall, the staff seemed happy that we were there and eager to help, but not in a just-trying-to-get-a-tip way. Also, even though the forcast was for partly cloudy with a chance of rain the weather was a perfect 85 and sunny all 5 days we were there! My kids loved the pool and the slide and spent the whole day there. The pool was well maintained but a little on the cold side for me. I also liked the live music poolside on the weekend. WE never went inside the casino so cant comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok, try to get a refurbished room”
Reviews.Author: dottie dog
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel, both times around a cruise departing from San Juan. The hotel has a few refurbished rooms which are very nice. They are planning a refurbishment of all rooms over the next year I believe. The hotel is ok. The restaurant is good (nice buffet breakfast) The area is also fine for walking and there are restaurants and coffee nearby. The pool is lovely and the service is good. The photos are from view from our balcony of the beach. This area has lots of surf so it may be better for sunbathing vs. swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xkevin
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the San Juan Marriot. Don't be fooled by some of the other reviews, the overall condition of the hotel is excellent. The exterior might be considered 'weathered' but compared to other hotels in the area it is in the best condition. The interior of the hotel is very nice and elegant. Ignore the comments by others, the staff is very helpful. The bell hops are willing to help with directions and food recommendations. They will also arrange taxi service when requested. We asked for a rollaway at check-in and were told we would get it right away. We got a phone call to the room about an hour later asking if it arrived, which it hadn't. We then left for the beach and on our return it was in the room. The housekeepers are also very accomodating. We had the privacy sign on our door for most of the day. Around 2-3PM we received a call asking if we wanted service for that day. We requested more towels which were at our door within 5 minutes of the call. Walking through the hotel, employees would greet us 99% of the time. The condition of the room was excellent, very clean with minimal to no odor (compared to other hotels I've stayed at). As far as noise is concerned, the only sounds we ever heard from other rooms was when the housekeepers were vaccuuming and hit the wall. For me, the only 'negative' was the fridge wasn't that cold and there was no external sink. Neither were deal breakers although a second sink outside of the bathroom does come in the clutch when available. The Casino area is a little small compared to AC and Vegas but it suites the property quite well. There is plenty of room to walk around and not bump into people. There's a fair amount of table games available. The most crowded is the $5 Blackjack tables. Other than that, you won't have much of a problem sitting down a game. Waitresses are readily available at night and are more than willing get you whatever you want. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bad customer service, i was told that my rate will be $480.00 for 2 nights, when i did check out, they charge me 480 per night. very dusty room, my son get sick for 2 weeks. food no good, staff not friendly at all not worth a penny,

Reviews.Title: “Had a geat time”
Reviews.Author: VineyardConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day 30th anniversary celebration - our room made the trip worthwhile - we had room 809 - which had huge balconies overlooking the ocean and the pool - everyone at the Marriott was wonderful (except the outdoors bartenders who were smug) - we had a great formal dinner at Tuscany and a sandwich and cesar salad at the villa restaurant - the salad was great and more than enough - Please refuse the resort fee taxed on to your hotel bill - it is 10% and you will not need it - go to Cafe Angel on the main road down the street from hotel - they have great PR fare at great prices - Louis just retire there and he is a great host - have the fried cheesecake for two - it is fabulous! My husband and I rented a car (in the hotel lobby) for $40 - reserve the day before and get to the desk early the next day - we drove to Rincon - two hours away but worth the trip - it was easy to follow the directions but remember the turns for the trip back - had a great time visiting beautiful surfing beaches and saw humpback whales at the lighthouse - ate a pub meal at calypso bar and talked to many Long Island surfers - many were FDNY! It was a fun time - the best meal however (for me) was the eggplant and spinach wrap at the hotel's coffee bar - take it to the pool for a great lunch -

Reviews.Title: “Great for a long weekend (note resort fee)”
Reviews.Author: trvlmnky
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for a long weekend. I thought the service was terrific - they did everything you wanted them to do (placed beach chairs, gave recommendations, made reservations, brought room service, check in/out) and did it efficiently! The food in the hotel was actually quite delicious - as were the drinks. Very nice beach with beach and poolside drink/food service. My only complaint is a hidden (in their check-in materials, apparently) resort fee. Not appropriate when you are already paying that price for a not-top hotel - and why else are you there except for the resort? You should be aware of that and figure it into your budget OR try and negotiate with them when you book the room.

Reviews.Title: “Cattle Herders”
Reviews.Author: TresSirenas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a quick trip to San Juan for the Rolling Stones Concert... which was fantastic, however our hotel choice was the pits, outragous in price $330 base rate, after a movie, a quick phone call, and 2 glasses of wine and taxes $466!!! One night, The Ritz it was not, Check in, hands full, no one to open the door, the lobby, where the bar tables practically meet you at the door were covered with reserved signs, there was a private party later there that night, in the very small Lobby!, not at all elegent like The Ritz, Caribe Hilton, or El COnvento where we often stay. Long lines at the check in, luggage everywhere, apparantly the cruise passangers are fond of this place, at check in our guaranteed king size bed was not available, 2 doubles, not at that price, eventually they did change our room, large bed, very small balcony, view of the very crowded pool, no chairs available and the packed beach, chairs side by side. Upon returning to the hotel after the concert (asked if the hotel could recommend transportation, they could not) we found the lobby full, all those who had attended the private party, and tons of locals dancing to salsa, standing room only, no seats for the guests, upon grabbing a table after a couple left, 20 minutes went by, we asked waiters to stop, got the "just a minute" they never returned, my husband went to the bar and asked for a drink in Spanish, he was told to sit and wait for the waiter, exasberated, I went to the bar and in English requested 2 glasses of wine and was served, 30 minutes after starting out, I timed it, we then went in the Casino where they had a noodle bar, ordered appetizer's, and when we tried to order dinner were told it would be at least an hour! Apparently the Noodle bar was servicing another dining area turning out frozen chicken fingers and french fries, exhausted and starved we returned to our rooms, skipped breakfast the next moring, breakfast was not included, room service prices started at $15 per person, based on our prior nights experience we decided not worth it, we checked out and headed to our favoirite Spanish bakery in Ocean Park. Typically you would expect a Marriot to offer above average service, clearly this was not the case, this sold out hotel herded their guests like cows while accommodating a local clientel as well, compounding the overcrowded facility and overwhelmed staff, look elsewhere like Caribe Hilton, Interconttinental, RItz, Condado is a fun area, the new hotels they are building look beautiful, the MArriot should look into beefing up or I expect will be loosing many customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cnrfalanga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 5 day stay at the San Juan Marriott. This hotel had a great location. It was located right on the beach, which was absolutely beautiful. The water can be a bit rough there, but most people swam in it anyway (us included). The front of the hotel faces a great strip filled with resturaunts (everything from burger king to local puerto rican food spots to lovely sea food resturaunts), gift shops, a bank, and a Walgreens pharmacy - that really came in handy for buying items we forgot as well as water and snacks for the room. I was a little suprised at the size of the room, which was a bit small, but it didnt really matter, because you are only really in the room to sleep, and the bed was very comfortable! Definately use the hotel concierge, who were so nice and helpful!! We weren't really planning on going on any of the day trips but then endeded up going on 2- an all day snorkeling trip which was beautiful and a really great value, and the 3 hour city tour of old san juan. There is really just too much stuff to mention, but I would definately recommend this hotel!! Have Fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Our Quick Stopover”
Reviews.Author: ccrosner
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent last Saturday night at the Marriott Stellaris and were not disappointed. We used Marriott points to stay for free and were given an oceanview (from the side) room instead of the city view we were supposed to get. The hotel was seven minutes and $17.50 from the airport and we were able to check in at 1 p.m. on a very busy day for them (cruise ship turnover day during Northeast schools' vacation week). Check in took only five minutes. The room was just like most Marriotts. Could use newer carpet but the rest was fine. Bathroom was updated but only had one sink (but a big vanity). Nice balcony with a view. The resort bustles with activity which we enjoyed for one night (it's not the type of place we would want to spend our vacation but that's just our preference). Pool area was crowded but fun--loved having live music with a Latin flair, poolside lunch service was quick, expensive and server was very friendly. Tough finding chaise lounges but that was to be expected. Kids enjoyed the pool slide and swimming in the ocean--great waves! Wish we'd had another night to enjoy the hotel and Old San Juan. Was surprised how much I enjoyed all of it after a lazy week on St. Croix. Would definitely go back to the Marriott and San Juan. One note: be sure to give yourself PLENTY of time to check into the airport--all lines are long!--thank goodness we get to speed through them due to husband's gold status on American. Should have arrived at least 1 1/2 hours early.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichiganSue
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Marriott one evening as we arrived on day before our cruise departure. Our room class was pool/ocean and we have a full ocean view visible beyond the pool. Room was spacious and clean and we enjoyed the ocean view from our balcony. So often we have been disappointed in room views but in this case we were very happy with our view. Common areas of the hotel were nicely appointed and the pool area was nice and well maintained. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice get-away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before I left for my stay, I was always looking at this hotel's review. I have to say that most of them were accurate. I especially found the advise on the trip to the Bacardi Factory. Follow the previous advise. Do not pay for the hotel package trip to the factory, you can do it on your own, by taking the B21 bus to down town San Juan ( stop right outside the Marriot), get off at the last stop down and walk down the hill- turn right to Pier #2 and take the Ferry over for .50 cents. Oh! the bus is .75 cents. make sure and have exact change (No bills). When you get off the ferry, take a right towards a blue building, there will be taxi drivers there that will take you to the Bacardi factory for 3.00....much less than the hotel tour. Coming back, you have to pick up the B21 bus at the terminal to Condado. The hotel stay was great. Very busy and crowded on the weekends, with the locals, who love to dance, so this was entertaining. The staff was pleasant and the concierge was always helpful. Everything is as stated in previous posts. Starbucks across the street with free Wi-Fi. Walgreenâ€™s right down the street for Misc. stuff like juices and water...Too expensive at the hotel. Be warned that if you will not be using the pool towels, and free water, you do not have to accept the 10% resort fee. The hotel tries to cater for business folks, so the fee is not mandatory, if you are not using all of their services. What else...the food was expensive so if you are on a budget, their are some reasonable American places, Burger King, Uno's etc. We slept most of the time, and got up late, so these were savers for us for dinner. Then we had a nice dinner at Ajili MÃ³jili, but it was way overprice and the food was noting to write home about. Old San Juan was very nice to visit and walk around and window shop,,,, the prices were not very attractive, since they cater for people visiting on the cruise ships. However, there were plenty of restaurants down town. The cab is $12.00 per trip. We visited the La Plaza American mall...very huge...$12.00 one way in a cab..you can take the same B21 bus, but it take an hour on the bus, as oppose to $12.00 in the cab ( depends on your fancy and time constraints). All in all good get-away for a four day weekend for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TravelNJ08
Reviews.Content: I am Marriott platinum member too and I had exactly the opposite experience with this Marriott (as compared to the person who wrote the review before me). We stayed at this hotel from Jan 21-27th. Our check in took less than 5 minutes, room was average size and very clean. No issues with the water pressure or room service. Our room was cleaned everyday by 10am and the hotel staff was very friendly. House keeping usually came back in late evening for the turndown service. Lobby does get VERY crowded on the weekends and that is mainly because they have a live band and even getting out of the lobby can be a chore. You will see lots of people dancing and it was fun to watch. I donâ€™t think that hotel really should be listed as CAT 6 but it was not bad at all. They have 2 swimming pools and the swim up bar is only opened on the weekends; they never have people available to open the slide on time and they close is before time. The beach was nice and clean and the hotel staff was always available to find chairs for us. Be ready to pay a lot of $$ for drinks and food both inside and outside the hotel. The hotel has a great location and there are tons of good places to eat. Two places that we highly recommend are Yerba Buena (Sp?), Miros (make a left at the Walgreens light and walk 2 blocks) . Walgreens was a life saver for water, snacks, beach stuff etc. There is a starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Wendys, Subway just a little walking distance away. We did not rent a car because parking is a big problem and the hotel will charge you 14 bucks per day to park. There is a Hertz counter in the hotel itself and we rented a car for a day to visit the rainforest. If you are taking the rainforest tour, make sure that take you to the La Mina falls (most tours donâ€™t coz it is a 30 min easy hike). The hike is well worth it coz it the most refreshing dip you will have. We took a snorkeling tour, the bus comes and picks you up right from the hotel and it was great way spend the day. We went to Old San Juan a couple of times and always took the bus for 75 cents. We did the Bacardi and the Fort tours ourselves and in my opinion taking the tour would not be worth it. For the Bacardi tour, take the bus to Old San Juan and walk over to the Ferry terminal, take the ferry for 50 cents and take a $3 cab ride from the other side to the distillery. Your room will have a copy of Que Pasa magazine and it is very helpful. It has a great detail about the walking Tour of Old San Juan and also had a rating for the restaurants in the hotel area. I recommend reading the walking tour if you plan to visit the forts yourself. Overall, people were very friendly and always pointed us in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Be Warned”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior1020
Reviews.Content: I'm a platinum member with Marriott and I was APPALLED by the condition of this hotel and the poor service we encountered. Check in took over an hour, the room was tiny and in disrepair, the staff would actually roll their eyes when we made simple requests, & the service was incredibly slow: we waited over an hour and a half for room service, and one day our room wasn't serviced until almost 5pm. The bed was very uncomfortable and the room was not clean. The balcanies are nice. The pool and beach are very nice but be warned, the pool, hot tub and beach have limited hours 8am-7pm and the staff tends to open late and close early. The slide is only open from 11-4, and the swim up bar is only open on the weekends. The club level smelled like a mixture of mold, rotten food and bug spray, it was nauseating. The mojitos in the lobby were great but be warned the drinks are pricey in the lobby and out at the poolside and beachside bars...average about $9 a piece. A nice service the hotel did offer, trip planners our vacation planner was great. As for the casino when we stopped in the place was full of locals that obviously make their careers gambeling and don't like outsiders, it was very uncomfortable. We managed to salvage our vacation in spite of the hotel; San Juan is a great place to visit! I would love to go back and I can assure you if we do, we won't be heading back to the Stellaris.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at the Marriott. Having read the reviews, we expected the resort fee and the high prices at the restaurants. It didn't stop us - the food was great, the service was terrific, and the property was incredible. We loved the beach and the convenient location. The cab ride, while a tad pricey, was worth EVERY penny! No traffic - no parking - no aggravation! We ate a yummy and well priced dinner at Angel's Cafe a couple of blocks west of the resort. I'm a Starbuck's fan and there's one right across the street - yay! The room had gorgeous city views and was spotlessly cleaned every day. This was our first time at a Marriott - it won't be our last. We will certainly return to the Stellaris Marriott! Thanks to everyone there for an enjoyable vacation!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here counltess times over the past seven years and have never been disappointed. If you're looking for comfort but also local flavor, this is the place. Have stayed at the Ritz Carlton and it is wonderful, but with all the people from New Jersey and Long Island, I could have been in Florida or, well, anywhere. I like those people but I like loud, dancing, well dressed, fun Puerto Ricans also and you'll find them here dancing the night away in the lobby on weekends. It is a wonderul scene. Beautiful casino too. The beach is right there, not too far from the pool or your room and it is gorgeous. Again, it is not the Ritz Carlton, so don't rely on the concierge for much or expect pampering, but the staff is very friendly and nice. Rooms are comfortable, but, BEWARE, get one on a high floor or in the short building behind the pool to avoid hearing the music from the lobby. I've always requested a high floor and have had no trouble getting one. The food is very good for the buffet breakfast and lunch and also right there with the pool and beach. For dinner I like to go out..... it is San Juan and there are so many good restaurants. Go to the Marriott, have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hot Tropic
Reviews.Content: Well were do I start. I checked weather channel before I got there and it showed showers all week that I was there, It was sunny and 87 degrees everyday!! the hotel is great, right in the middle of everything. the beach like I read from everyone was great very clean and the staff for the beach was great. Walgreens was my second home, they have everything you need. Starbucks is about 15 steps off the hotel property and was good to hang out on the rooftop. the rooms like everyone said was small but the air conditioner was great. You have to visit El Morro, and the Castle of San Monticristol. Together only costs 7 dollars. DONT EAT AT THE SIZZLER!!! Restaurants are all over the areas, Cherry Blossom next door was over priced for nothing. FYI they are going to charge you 50 bucks a night for accidental damage charge that will be refunded to you at check out, BUT it wont get credited back to you for about a week. You have to go to Isla Verda ESJ Hotel to do the water sports. They say Isla Verda is a beautiful area....ITS NOT. I always stay at the Ritz Carlton everywhere I go, but it was booked when I was there. I will stay at the marriott again if I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, watch your bill”
Reviews.Author: msa99
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a very good location. The staff was nice, and the bar near the beach has a happy hour. The beach was pretty good, but it is public -- and the hotel can only keep it so-so clean. The best part of the hotel is the location. There are several nice places to eat within walking distance (Yerba Buena, Ropa Vieja, Ajili Mojili to name a few). Meals at the hotel were strictly expense accout. There is a Starbucks and Walgreens nearby as well which proved handy. The downsides of this hotel for me were the cab ride to Old San Juan which was $10-15 bucks each way which I thought was a lot. There is a public bus which I saw frequently except when I tried to take it. Another thing that dissapointed me was that the hotel pool was only 4 ft deep - and we weren't traveling with kids. One other thing to be aware of is that the hotel charges a resort fee of $13 per day, which was a lot for us because we spent very little time at the resort. We purchased our trip through Orbitz, and had no idea of the fee until check out. Had we known, we may have stayed elsewhere. Kind of cheesy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: richlin71
Reviews.Content: We stayed from last Sat-Wed and had a great time. Checked in in about 5 mins, got a nice 9th floor ocean/pool room with balcony. This is definitely one of the nicer resorts to stay at. The room was big and comfy. You get 1 free hour of internet at the business center; there is also free wifi at the cafe across the street and at Starbucks (not free). The gym downstairs is great (after 10p you can't use the lockerroom/sauna). Minor complaints: when I tried to shower at 3am there was no hot water; the swim-up bar was closed; no food/drink service at the pool (you have to get it yourself). as stated by several others, the prices in the hotel are high (iced coffee is $3.50). better to go to starbucks. The best meal of the trip was at Zabo (also the most expensive). All the other places were just "ok": Yerba Buena (bad mojitos), Waikiki (nice ambiance). The safe in the room was very welcome, though we felt very safe the entire time. The casino was fun and we didn't have any problem finding space at the $5 blackjack tables.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - we wouldn't hesitate to return to the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews about the hotel, we were very pleasantly surprised. We paid about $190 for a pool/ocean view, which was well worth it. At the time we were booking, they wanted $175 for city view -- paying the extra $15 is a no-brainer. Our friends shelled out $275 for oceanfront, which was not worth the extra money over pool/ocean view. The pool and beach areas are lovely, and we found the hotel's beachfront bar, poolside restaurant, workout facilities, and casino to be nice. One thing to be aware of is the Saturday rush, as many hotel guests are arriving after a cruise or departing before a cruise. Although we arrived at 10:00, they could not get us a room until that afternoon at 4:00. If you are not a pre- or post-cruiser and have some flexibility, you'd be better off arriving on Friday or Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Past it's prime”
Reviews.Author: jmcnyc33
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for 3 nights - was a great weekend in San Juan. The hotel needs a total update. The lobby is grand - but you basically walk into a bar area that gets packed with locals on the weekends. The room is very basic - needs better cleaning (glass had stains and shower could have been cleaner). The furniture was old and scratched. We ate twice at the hotel, once was by the pool were I had the worst chicken sandwich of my life. It was only the next day that I saw the birds walking all over the buffet. The breakfast buffet was good and service excellent, however we as we sat at a outside table we noticed the ground was littered with old sugar packets, matches and such. The beach in front of the hotel was great - the best part of the visit. The location was close to the sights, however we had difficulty finding good local restaurants that were within walking distance. We didn't really use the pool area as it was a small pool and not very deep (1 1/2 ft and about 4 ft). The deeper end and the hot tub were always full of kids and not very comfortable. Overall is was a good experience, but I would expect to pay Marriott Courtyard rates versus what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Great Staff, Right on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: blip
Reviews.Content: I'll begin by saying that I was travelling on Gov't business, so not only was I not paying, but I also got a very good deal on the room. I paid a little extra out of pocket for a pool/ocean view, which I must say was definitely worth it. Instead of looking out over a congested and unremarkable street, we looked out at the ocean. Great sight to wake up to. If I was to pay full price (~$250), I think I would be satisfied, although there are certainly other smaller hotels that would be cheaper and nice (we passed the consulado and the convento hotels, and both looked great). There were a couple of small problems. Mainly, the balcony was having some renovations done, so we couldn't use it for a day or so. The staff gave us a food credit, and a bottle of wine, so we were happy. The staff here is extremely friendly and helpful. They know they are working in a classy resort, and they treat their guests like guests. Probably the best part of the hotel is the pool/beach area. Two nice pools (though kinda shallow), a hot tub, and a gorgeous beach with chairs and umbrellas. The ocean was a bit rough, but we swam every day. Coming from the northeast, it was no rougher than I'm used to, and much warmer. Overall, San Juan is OK. After a couple of days, you feel like you've seen most of what it has. I highly recommend getting out of the city. Go to some smaller towns or beaches, and check out the rainforest. Bring plenty of water and snacks, and hike up as far as you can. Truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan is one amazing place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Juan. Went Dec 17-20. Here's my two cents. San Juan isn't exotic; it's a U.S. territory after all. It's like Miami--i.e.Coach, Radio Shack, BK, Wendy's--but ten times better. Beautiful mountain views. Amazing sculptures and sites hidden downtown. The rain forests are cool, but you won't see exotic animals or flowers really. Yogi, the hotel guide though is awesome. Do NOT pay the hotel for the Bacardi tour. $35/pp. Instead pay 75 cents for the bus (went up 50 cents)to Downtown San Juan (last stop from the hotel). Walk to Pier #2 ( like a 2 min walk from the bus stop). Take the ferry for 50 cents. Once you're off the ferry, walk to the right and you will see a white building. There are van drivers there who will take you to the factory for $3/pp. With all the money you save, you can buy some Bacardi Rum. The tour is lame, but they have this $50 bottle of Bacardi you can only buy at the factory and no where else in the world. As far as food goes, avoid the Latin Star with your life (it's a few blocks past Walgreen's). Definitely eat at Buena ? I don't speak Spanish, but however you say "Green Grass". That place is two blocks up when you walk out of the hotel to the left. AMAZING food! The hotel was nice. Very fancy lobby. Live salsa music at night. We checked in quickly and only had to wait 15 minutes upon check out. Our rooms was cleaned by 9am. Must have been because we were on the 17th floor. The staff was super friendly. Always opened car doors and the hotel door and offered suggestions. They even upgraded our room for free. We had an amazing room (#1717). It was a little small, but man the view was killer. We had TWO balconies--one facing downtown, with a huge construction crane working on a new hotel, blech!, and a view of the ocean. The view of the ocean was breathtaking. Our room also included an awesome FREE breakfast buffet at the Vista (reg price $17/pp.) If you book through the Marriot site directly, it seems most rooms come with this standard. Read the fine print to be sure. Ours just said free breakfast which we assumed was going to be some crappy bagels. Needless to say, we were pleasantly surprised. We ate belgium waffles, made to order omelets, pancakes, sausages, muffins, smoked salmon, mangoes, pineapple, etc. And we just tipped $5 every day. It was great. The casino was a little small, but still fun. Every day before dinner, we went in to play roulette for 10 minutes for dinner money and every night we won $75-175. It was awesome. So every dinner was free. I will say the wait staff at the casino s---, I had to wait forever for my Bacardi and Diet Coke every single time. My last thought, do not leave without eating the fried food downtown from the street vendors. It rocks and for $1.25 it can't be beat. The natives downtown are really friendly too and you can have plenty of friendly conversations.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas week at the San Juan Marriott”
Reviews.Author: K_Metz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a week vacation at the San Juan Marriott. Overall, the Marriott met our expectations, which were of a clean establishment with friendly service. We started out in a city view room on a high floor which had an extremely soft bed and non-functioning A/C. After one night in that room, we realized that it was not going to work for us through the whole trip, and they transferred us to a pool view room at no extra charge. It probably wouldn't have been possible later in the week because the resort got much more crowded, but it was good that they were able to accomodate us. The new room was a standard room, nothing extremely fancy, but sufficient. The A/C in this room worked and we still had a soft mattress which was improved by a bedboard. Startdard amenities in the room, although the reports of clogged showeer drains in other reports was true for us as well. We spent most of our time either on the beack or in the casino. The beach was relatively clean, and the only negative was that it got _extremely_ crowded towards the end of our stay and if you did not get out there before 10am, you would have trouble finding a chaise lounge. It seemed like a lot of people staked their claim early with towels on a chair and then went back to bed, which was a bit annoying. But, after a bit of searching, the staff always were able to find a chair for us. Incidentally, there is a hotel next door under construction, and if you came late, you got lunked down right in front of it, which made relaxing a bit more challenging. The casino is relatively small, with probably 10-20 tables for cards, and a couple of roulette and craps tables each and a bunch of slots. The dealers were generally fun and friendly, which made our hours at the blackjack tables (the $5 tables were usually pretty crowded but you could get in eventually) entertaining. The best thing about the resort was the staff. They were extremely friendly and eager to accomodate us at every turn. The rooms could stand some updating, but we were satisfied overall. Location wise, not too bad, safe area, and lots of restaurants nearby, although they tended to be a bit pricey. Starbucks across the street and Walgreens down the block. A few local markets in the area also. Old San Juan is a bus (or $12 taxi each way) ride away. We were only there for a day, but it was a nice strolling part of town and very rustic and vibrant. We were paying the Marriott Friends & family Rate so it was about half of the standard rate. I thin kthat if we were paying the full rate (which was pricey, about $395/night when we were there), it might have been a different story.

Reviews.Title: “A sad commentary”
Reviews.Author: Foplaw
Reviews.Content: [A disclaimer - the following relates to a stay at this property between Christmas and New Year's - probably the worst time of year for stays at hotels.] Having said that, where to start? Perhaps the fact that the folks at thishotel are so used to making people wait to check in that they issue pagers. Once in the rooms (I have seen 2)one finds that they are badly in need of renovation (which process has started on the 3rd floor only). The mattresses are VERY soft, the furntiure is old and outdated and the bathrooms are...dingy. Take a shower and the water is up to your knees because the drains are stopped (making one wonder whether (a) the maids clean the tubs or (b) if they do, they just don't care enought to tell maintenance that the tubs are stopped up. But then there is housekeeping - they made it to my room at 5:30 p.m. (after I called 3 times). Then there is maintenance - the decision was made to paint the elevators doors (between Christmas & New Years?) so the entire hotel smells of oil-based paint. The "casino" is a joke - there are 3 $5 black jack tables which always so crowded that if you wanted to play, you couldn't. Then there 8 empty tables for Hold 'em and Carribbean Poker (which no one plays, a routlette table and a craps table. And there you have the 'Grand Casino.' An amazingly poor level of service - at a place that with a little thought and some renovation could be (and used to be) a great property.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DNFNyc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights in an Ocean view room. The room was a little small but very clean and the bed was clean and comfortable. The view from the balcony was amazing...worth every extra penny to stay in an ocean view room. The staff at the hotel, without exception, were friendly, polite and helpful and great music in the lobby at night. Also, the Marriot has the best stretch of beach in Condado. If you stay in Condado, you should stay here. I can't comment on the food at the hotel (who would eat there???) but if you stay here you must have dinner at Zabo down the street. This was one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. The food, atmosphere and service were all wonderful. Stay away from the much-hyped Ajhili Mojili - horrible service, overpriced and underwhelming food. Like Dennys, but with Puerto Rican food for $30 a plate.

Reviews.Title: “For the undiscerning tourist”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first words upon entering the room were, "Ghet-to," and my wife's were, "I stayed at better Motel 8s." My parents had mold growing in the AC vent in their room!!! Also, the AC did NOT work even though we had fan action and a gismo that purportedly gave us control over the tempature; poor shower drainage, and unbelievably poor room coffee. But the sheets/pillows were quality in a clean room. The food comes a distant second to that of the British, and it is horribly overpriced (btw,look for extra fees when ordering room service). Nonetheless, the papaya, cantalope, and oatmeal were superburb (included in the brunch special). Thankfully, there's a Starbucks across the street, and the "Puerto Rican coffee" in the casino is top notch (and free!). All staff were exceptionally nice and professional with warm smiles.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, noisy, resort fee $$$$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 11/24 till 11/30. Our room was a corner room on the 18th floor, overlooking the Atlanic. On weekday morning, it's very noisy, due to the construction going on. And, maids kept opening our door without knocking first. They never replenished enough shower gel, and we had to ask for them over and over. The worst part was they charge almost $10 per night for resort fee. This fee was never written anywhere before our arrival. We feel this is a rip off as it is non optional, whether you use their beach chair, umbrella, pool, water, etc. So, be aware!

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, fun atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple nights to extend our honeymoon just a little longer than our 7-day Sea Dream Yacht Club cruise. The place was just packed, and everyone was having a good time, both during the day at the pool, and at night in the lobby, where latin music was cranked up to 11. The rooms were great, view was nice (yes, there's construction next door, but I've always enjoyed watching a construction site since I was a kid). Staff was very nice and they seemed genuinely appreciative that we chose San Juan for a portion of our honeymoon. Our poolside drink waiter said, "Happy hour special is two-for-one beers, from 4-7pm, but with me, you get the special all day!" Whether or not everyone gets the special all day, he made us feel special. The area is great for walking - we ate very well. Start walking toward Old Town and hail the bus - we got it to stop for us between stops, but YMMV. You can pay $8 for a taxi, or $0.25 apiece for the bus. Your choice. Favorite nearby restaurants: If there's just one thing you do while you're in Puerto Rico, get breakfast at La Bombonera in Old Town San Juan. It's a bakery with a diner-style seating area and counter. It's so yummy, inexpensive, and genuine, it makes me want to come back just for that. Get the weekend buffet at Ajili Mojili, or an elegant dinner for two there. There was a mexican/puerto rican restaurant next door to Ropa Vieja Restauarant that we absolutely loved. We sat and watched the surf on the rocks as we ate. The Marriott looks like it would be great for families, and although there were lots of kids around the pool area, we as a newlywed couple didn't seem to mind so much. There was lots for kids to do, but the place wasn't decorated like a Disney ride, either.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Marriot in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother and daughter stayed in two rooms on the 9th floor for 10 days. We had a FABULOUS experience. The staff was wonderful - the service was excellent and the overall hotel was great. The rooms are basic, but neat, clean and well equipped. The hotel has all the amenities one would expect at a resort. The hotel is in a great location and is in walking distance of restaurants, Walgreens, Starbucks, etc. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: sabrefencer
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Marriott November 10-14th 2005. We had a great time in San Juan. The hotel is very clean and the staff are so kind and helpful. We arrived Thursday night and took a cab from the hotel (flat rate of $12 plus tip) and it only took 10 min to get there. We got a room with an ocean view, which was great. The bad thing is that they are renovating most rooms so there are workers outside your room. We only saw the workers once during our stay. They have a good casino but I thought it was kinda small. They have a live band on the weekends and they play great salsa music! The restaurants are good too!! La Vista has great food (an awesome dessert bar for $8) and Tuscany has good seafood. La Vista has a breakfast buffet which was pricey ($17.95) but they had a good selection of food. There are bunches of restaurants right by the restaurant so most of the time we ate outside the hotel. If you turn right or left on Ashford (the hotel street), there are good places to eat and reasonable prices. The beach is a couple steps from the pool area and it was great. There are 2 pools- one for kids and another regular one with a slide. The pool area is kept clean. We went on one tour- $77 for the catamaran/snorkeling excursion. That was amazing!!! It is for one full day but definitely worth the price. Transportation and a great lunch with drinks are provided. You can book tours with the tour desk by the gift shop inside the hotel. Overall our experience was great and the weather was perfect. Take the bus to Old San Juan (25 cents, catch the B21 bus about 1 block from the hotel on Ashford) and walk around- good shopping and great places to eat. The staff at the Marriott are very accommodating and friendly- they made our stay very enjoyable. I donâ€™t know if itâ€™s really a 4-star hotel but it has a good vibe to it. There are tons of families that go to this resortâ€¦ and you should know that there is an 11% tax added on each night you stay. You donâ€™t see that in the hotel rate, so just be aware of thatâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, but....”
Reviews.Author: cnfsmom
Reviews.Content: Just returned with my three kids and we had a great time. The hotel is in a great location. It is a short distance from the airport, and within walking distance of restaurants with local flair as well as Pizza Hut, Fudruckers, Wendy's, Burger King, Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, etc. Having a Walgreens across the street is also key for snacks and drinks. The pool area is really pretty and the kids loved it. There were plenty of lounge chairs, however, a limited number had access to direct sunlight for long periods of time. The beach is great too. The sand is free of rocks and shells and the water had very little seaweed. There were also plenty of beach chairs available. The outdoor beach side bar had a great view of the ocean. The drinks and food were a little expensive ($8.50 for a Margarita/$11 for a chicken ceasar salad)but so convenient. The food and drinks were pretty expensive everywhere in the hotel. Keep in mind that during the off season, the swim-up bar is only open on weekends - we wished it was open everyday! Now for the downside, the Marriott is undergoing an extensive renovation that will last for another year (per a hotel employee). Right now they are re-doing the outside so you see and hear the constuction as you sit by the pool or by the beach. They plan to renovate the rooms within the next year too. This is a step in the right direction, because the room was a basic hotel room, with basic amenities. The best part of the room was the water pressure in the shower and the powerful hairdryer - both rareties. They also plan to expand the casino. There is also a lot of construction in the area surrounding the hotel which was not always pleasant to look at. I would definitely consider going back - especially after the construction is completed. We all had a really nice relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, reliable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruben900
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights in early November 2005. It was our 4th stay here. We keep returning because it's consistently a very nice place to stay. Great location in the Condado, safe, convenient, close to good restaurants. I've not seen any true 5-star hotels in San Juan proper, but this is close to the best they have. They are still renovating/cleaning the exterior, but I was assured the interior renovation is completed. The casino is very nice and the lobby is quite a hot-spot for the locals, especially on the weekends. The pool and beach are great and well-maintained. The hotel's prices are quite high for food/sundries/minibar, but there's a Starbucks and Walgreen's drug store nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pch71
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband at Marriot Stellaris on the first weekend of october and we have had a good time. We booked thru Priceline and i got a very good price and like other reviewer stated before, they treated us very well and they gave us a room on the 9th floor with pool and ocean view. The room was ok, nothing spectacular but clean and nice,and the view was beautiful. The only problem that i had with the room is that we asked for non smoking room and we were given a smoking one. Nice lady from housekeeping sprayed the room and gave us some sort of machine air freshener that seemed to aleviate the problem a little, but not completely. We did not spend a great deal of time on the room and i could have asked for another room, I did not want to go thru the hassle of moving again and walking all over the place. However, next time i will ask for another room because my husband was not happy about the smell. Besides that, we had a great time and it was nice to have internet access.Pool was nice, lobby area is nice but food and drinks at the lobby way overpriced. I can not comment on th restaurants or pool bar since i did not use them.Check in and out was quick and the staff was polite and nice. And last but not least,great sense of security. I will go back again..Happy travels to all of you and remember to keep a good attitude and dont let the little things to ruin your vacation. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Exellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: mjburgos
Reviews.Content: My and a buddy stayed at this hotel from 9/26 - 10/17. Overall, it was an excellent experience. I am a native of the island, but haven't been back in many years, and this was the 1st time that instead of staying with family, I stayed at a hotel, and enjoyed the island with minimal family visits. I am fluent in Spanish; my friend does not speak Spanish at all. We booked an Ocean Front room, and at first were disappointed that, unlike many other tripadvisor.com guest, our resort fee wasn't waived. Our room was pleasant, and we have an excellent chamber maid named Marcia, who not only was very good, but gave us a beautiful flower arrangement a few days before we checked out. The beds were nice. Mine was a little on the soft side, but I got used to it and enjoyed it. High speed internet access fluctuates throughout the day (probably based on usage of others), but it was a minor inconvenience. Our room included breakfast, and by the end of the 1st week we knew all the restaurant staff by name. They were great, and made breakfast a lot of fun for us. We dined at Tuscany once, and it wasn't bad at all, however for $140 I expected a little better, but that might be the New Yorker in me talking. The room service menu was unusually boring, but luckily we only did that once, because of a lack of energy to go out one night. We rented a car for this trip because of meetings we had in Ponce and other points far away. Parking at the hotel was easy, and on weekends we found ourselves on the higher floors but that was no big deal. The cabbies congregate on the B level and have some benches set up; stop and listen in one day as they pontificate on all matters of life and death.
