Negotiate your cab fare before leaving the hotel, or any other point on the island. All the cabs have meters, and not a single time did we see one turned on. The concierge staff was knowledgeable and friendly, except one, and I wish I could remember her name. She was more focused on finishing her conversation with a coworker than helping me. But I turned to another staffer there and got what I needed, and made a complaint, which seemed to be addressed immediately. Getting to Old San Juan from this hotel is super easy--walk down the block to the right, take the B21 bus for 25 cents, and you are there in a few minutes....that is, after waiting forever for the bus to come. A cab will cost $10-$12, so the wait and price are worth it. If you are a coffee lover, have a great cup of cafe con leche at la Bombonera on Calle San Francisco (have it with a piece of flan while you're at it). I have been going there since a child. I also highly recommend the Parrott Club in Old San Juan for dinner (on La Fortuleza, near several other chic dinner spots). The spa and exercise room staff were really great. Very friendly and very open to sharing places to go and see. Daniery was my masseuse and also did a pedicure for me. She is very nice. Practice some Spanish first before you see her. My feet never looked so good. My room came with a balcony which was closed due to renovation. I got 5,000 Marriott points for each night there because of this, which was worth it. A quick trip on the elevator downstairs gave me all the fresh air I needed. Nightlight at the hotel was fun. For example, Wed - Sun had live bands, and they were all excellent. I didn't stay to dance there, but would have 1 or 2 drinks and the energy and music put me in the right mood to go out and look for trouble and the local clubs. Weekends really fill up there at night, especially in the casino. Doormen were polite and quick to get us taxis (for nights we planned on drinking). If you are traveling with kids, there are plenty of kid-friendly restaurants. Sizzler is a long walk or short cab ride away. Chilli's isnt a long walk at all. Pizza Hut seemed a little greasy, but was only a block from the hotel, as was Wendy's. Venture a little further down Ave Ashford and you will find Fudruckers and Pizza Uno....I avoided most of these, as I can eat all that garbage here in NYC. I wanted good, local food. Walk over to Ajili Mojili for a great dinner, very puerto rican. My advice--just walk up and down Ave Ashford your first day there, get to know the area, and grab a paper copy of all the locally owned restaurant menus. In summary, I highly recommend this hotel. The staff were very friendly, very helpful, and quick to our service. My buddy had no trouble speaking only English to the staff. We both have to return on business in January to the Condado area--we are definitely staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Staff Ever!”
Reviews.Author: splatkat
Reviews.Content: I was a bit cautious of staying at this resort because I'm not a huge fan of Marriott and my taste in hotels tend more toward the luxury and higher end places I'm used to staying at for work (Ritz-Carltons, Four Seasons, the nicer Westins). But I have nothing but rave reviews for this place after my stay. If for no other reason, I recommend this hotel for the GREAT beds and the friendliest hotel staff on earth. We used Priceline to get our rooms and got a really great rate, but unlike other hotels where I've use Priceline, the hotel staff treated us as if we were any other full paying guests. They gave us a rollaway bed for free and put us on the 19th floor with an ocean front view. The room had standard Marriott decor and was fairly large, though we did have a bit of a squeeze with the rollaway. The beds were super comfortable... as good or better than the Westin Heavenly Bed. The bathroom was a decent size, but might be a problem if you had 4 adults in one room. The balcony was nice, with a great view of the city and the ocean. But the best thing about this place was the staff. Never have I encountered a hotel where everyone was pleasant, friendly, and eager to help guests with any concern or request. From the moment we checked in until we left, we felt welcomed and that the staff was happy we were there. I can't rave enough about how fantastic they were.

Reviews.Title: “One of the top San Juan Hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am one of those that drives myself crazy reading all the reviews of a place and then go nuts trying to find a place without a bad review. I've learned to really take those bad reviews with a grain of salt. The hotel isn't as glamorous as say the Wyndham, but that doesn't mean it's sub-par. The rooms are due for an updating, but not in a 1950's sort of way. The beds, bathroom, tv are all high quality. There is a massive construction project on the west side of the building that isn't so much fun to look at, but that will be done in a few months. This is all eclipsed by the good points of the hotel. The beach is fantastic (many hotels in San Juan have sub-par beaches) - the two level pool has a swim up bar, a fun slide, plenty of chairs and wireless internet all over (included in your "resort fee" - which I do consider just bad business, but everyone is doing it.) The casino is adequate, the slots aren't up to most mainland standards and the placement of everything is a bit tight, but the service is friendly and the tables draw a mixture of tourists and locals. There is always a party in the lobby. Bands that go all night, huge crowds on the weekends and over priced drinks to make you feel right at home. I haven't even gotten to the two best things about the hotel - the staff and the location. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and no reasonable request wasn't given their full attention, you were made to feel at home. The best part though was the location. The streets of Condado are lined with fabulous restaurants and shops. Pizza Huts, Burger King, Subway, Citibank, Starbucks and Walgreens are all with in a block or two. The local restaurants are top notch and plentiful. Access to Old San Juan is either a 10 min bus (if your lucky enough to catch one) or cab ride. The police seem to be everywhere and I didn't feel unsafe at any point and we walked all over, every night. Overall, if you stay here, you will walk away happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: apinkpivot1
Reviews.Content: I had become extremely skeptical of this hotel after all the reviews I had read. Being that I had planned everything, I was nervous everyone would hate it and then blame me for ruining thier vacation. Turns out, it was great and everyone LOVED it! Everyone (the staff) was extremely nice and accomodating with everything considering how many times a day I called downstairs. I have stayed at the Wyndham El San Juan and the Intercontinental in Isla Verde, and this hotel is just as nice..maybe not as extravagent, but good enough! Our room had the most amazing view and was quite spacious. I have no complaints about anything. Latin Star was a good cheap place for breakfast, but we ate the hotel breakfast mostly, granted it was expensive but it was really good! Greenhouse has really good grilled chicken plus it is open 24 hours. Walgreens down the blocked proved to be a life saver just about everyday. Overall I had a fantastic time!!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff here went above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Coble78
Reviews.Content: Just to give you some background, my husband is 29 and I am 27, we travel about 3 times a year, we have no children, we are from NY and we are from Ny. We came here because it was my brother's 30th bday and we wanted to surprise him. The hotel is very nice, it was under construction when we arrived but you could only see that if you were by the pool area and looked towards the cabana rooms. The staff at the front desk were so accommodating, we actually booked our trip at 4:30pm the previous afternoon and they still gave us the room that we asked for. The room was nice, the AC was excellent to the point where you wanted to turn it off bc it got to be too cold. We stayed in room 1218 which was a partial oceanview room, the view was okay only bc they are building a new hotel next to the marriott so you saw that also. The bed was outstanding along with the pillows, my husband never wants to stay in bed when we go on vacation and I actually had to make him get up one morning bc he was so in love with the bed. The was a safe in the room that we didn't know about, it was under the t.v. The tub stopper kept closing so after you take a shower the water would pool in the tub unless you kept checking the stopper. I liked the elevator bc you could go to the pool and not have to walk through the lobby. One thing that ticks me off about hot tubs and guests is that the signs always say no one under 16 but it never fails someone is always in there with their kids, this was the first hotel that we stayed at where they actually made the kids get out of the hot tub. If you order drinks by the pool, it's faster to get them yourself, the waitstaff could step it up a bit. We didn't eat in the hotel, so I can't comment on the food. There was this place called Gellato's across the street where we got breakfast and beverages for $13 where an egg omelet was $13 by itself in the hotel restaurant. There is a walgreens, pizza hut, chilli's and wendy's nearby. If you want some spanish food go to los penos it's on ponce de leon street going twds carolina. You need a car to get there or you can take a cab but the food is good and cheep and it's open 24 hours a day. If you like beer try Medalla Light, it is a Puerto rican beer, I am not a big beer drinker but I feel in love, it's so good that I'm in NY trying to find out why no one imports to the USA. If you rent a car park on the street, it's cheaper than the hotel parking, but just be careful we got a ticket parking on a the side block by wendys but parking on Ashford was cool and free. Make sure you visit Old San Juan and the mall both easy to get to. In summary the hotel is cool, Condado is cool but in my opinion PR is not some where that you go for more than 4 days and it's not a first class island so keep that in mind and you'll have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Island Oasis....”
Reviews.Author: WharfRatCT
Reviews.Content: After returning from an 8-day Carnival Cruise, we stayed on rewards credits a this property. From the moment we walked into the main lobby I was overwhemled (which I did not expect after returning from a cruise) with the level of elegence the grand room offered as we walked in the front doors...and the nice thing, it didn't just end there!! From the details in the structure, and the elegent furnishings including lighting fixtures, and lets not forget the wall hangings....but the large celling to floor windows to the left and along the back side of the floor offered the most impressive view of the private beach and the beautiful tranquil blue green water! As other postings mention, yes your greated to a big bar surrounded by tables, and a dance floor and stage...but it was part of the "resort"...the live entertainment was really great, and the latin dancing was something to watch! Also the casino is located on this level, and yes small, but it was there and available...seemed to bring in some locals later evenings (negitive). Our check-in was very "customer service"...we arrived at 10AM and they took our bags, and gave property arm bands, and we quickly had full access to the pool and private beach, which was why we were there...to relax and just enjoy the beach. They told us when to return for our room, and when we did our room was ready as told it would be. The room was average...with a large bathroom, and glass sliders to a deck which was nice. Our view was the side of the building with a little waterview, and a large construction site...nothing too great. Food / Resturant: We ate lunch at the resturant at the outside tables. Found th food to be good, but a limited menu for a "resort" and the service to be extremelly slow. We also ate at the tiki bar which we had great service. And we had brunch at the resturant which was top notch!! I agree, long lines and servers not quick to help move the line, but the food was great! We ventured off the property twice, once durning the day just to see what was near by and to take in San Juan. We walked the strip and found myself a bit disappointed...poor area, not many places you really want to see on the strip...couldn't wait to get back to the resort. Also ventured off for dinner one evening...went on the strip to a Cuban resturant...nobody spoke much english, but they were very accomidating and helpful...food was good. But went right back to the resort...safty was an issue we felt...and the hotel had the live music, dancing, and a casino with armed guards all over the property so you were safe. On Saturday's they have art & craft (jewerly) vendors which were really nice! We didn't use the pool area so can't comment. The beach was great!! No problem getting a chair, or coctails served on the beach. It was so beautiful though i can't say enough. However the beach wasn't completly private and found the locals trying to enter from the sides which made it a little sketchy later in the day. I would go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: daisie152
Reviews.Content: HOTEL: We arrived at the San Juan Marriott and entered the lobby by 11:30 a.m. on September 1, 2005. I did not find the lobby to be grand or impressive at all. You enter the hotel looking at a bar with a bunch of tables surrounding it. To the right is the casino and to the left is the check in counter. I don't know why but I found this quite ODD! We were immediately able to check into our upgraded room. We were upgraded to a suite that was located on the second floor overlooking the pool, ocean and a little side road. Our room was nice and big!!! The pool was ok. The water was alittle cloudy. They had two pools. One for little kids and one for bigger kids. We mostly sat in the kiddie (no more then three feet deep) pool just to cool off. The slide was fun though!! The patio was quite nice too. The beach was really nice!! The ocean is alittle rough but we had a great time riding the waves. The area surrounding the hotel was very peculiar and seedy!!!!! There was a huge security presense. Some of the buildings were in dire need of a face lift. A lot of buildings were boarded up and some of them were just in really bad shape. FOOD: We ate at the marriott once. We had breakfast at their outdoor restaurant. It was good. We ate at the surrounding restaurants that were located off site. The prices were moderate and the food was good. ACTIVITIES: We took the East Wind Catamaran to Culebra Island. DO this trip. It was fantastic and Flamenco Beach is Beautiful!!! Old San Juan - Had a great time walking around the city. The city has a lot of character and is very picturesque. El Yunque - If you have seen a rain forest before I would skip this one. It was nice but its not worth the time or money to see it. Bioluminescent tour - Now this one....the idea is awesome. It is cool to see and experience this. Getting to and from the bay is a nightmare!!!!!!!!!!! It's pitch black dark. We had motor boats and other kayakers running head on into us. I think there needs to be a mandate for the number of people who are allowed into the bay at once. LITTLE TID BITS: Please be aware that Marriott charges an extra $17 per night resort fee on top of the room rate. This adds up after a few nights. I wish we knew this. The wait staff at all the restuarants try to up sell the menu and try to get you to order extra stuff. Know what you want and try not to be persuaded. If you do go to El Yunque...think about renting a car and going to El Yunque early afternoon and then do the Bioluminescent tour that same night. This saved us the cost of a dinner. approx. $70. There is no set cab fare to go anywhere.....what ever they feel like charging as the wind changes is what they charge. Long story short just be aware that the cab fares are not consistent and do add up. If you have access to the lobby on the Executive level DO take advantage of this. The spread they put out each day (excluding weekends) was impressive. Um...I think thats it. I hope this helps you and gives you some extra information you may not have known. Overall, I did think the Marriott was a fine hotel and when I return I will consider staying there again. I'm thinking I may want to go live on Culebra Island though. Best regards and happy vacationing to all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Marriot for a long Labor Day weekend. We read the reviews, were warned about the construction, etc. and found that the hotel turned out to be very nice; we had a pool/beach view. Actually the entire trip was a blast!! The hotel staff gave us great advice on where to "hang-out" and how to use the public transportation system. Overall, I don't know what people expect from a hotel- I personally don't care for hotels and would prefer to spend as little time possible in one. However, you can't go wrong at this hotel. As for the food and casino, we didn't spend much time there and focused our activities around seeing the sights, getting out and experiencing the culture, food and night life. This hotel was clean, beds were comfortbale and the staff was friendly. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went for Labor Day Weekend with my friend. They gave up an upgrade to an ocean front room. I would recomend it to all, great for familes and singles. Very close to everything... Love It!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than some reviews posted here make it out to be...”
Reviews.Author: Joshb2j
Reviews.Content: I had read several reviews on this website that discussed the poor state of things in this hotel--thus, expectations were low. However, I was pleasantly suprised with the hotel. ROOM. We had a nice pool/oceanview room. The view was great. Yes, there was some construction going on across the way on some other buildings, but I didn't see anything on our hotel. The balcony was very large and nice. The room itself was as nice as any Marriott I have stayed in at Chicago/Miracle Mile or Cleveland or Philly. The bathroom wasn't the nicest I have ever seen, but it served its purpose. DINING. Do not waste your money eating at this hotel. I didn't even consider spending $20 or more per person for breakfast. Walk out the front door, take a left, and go eat at Danny's International for $5-8 per person, and it was just fine. Drinks in the lobby bar are overpriced and awful. ALso, there is a 2 drink minimum when you order there. The food available at the bar was pitiful and the pork rinds and nuts they give you are awful. I ordered a Mojito and sent it back because it was the worst I ever had--the bartender tried to make it with 7-Up instead of sugar water....pathetic. There are a ton of decent restaraunts within easy walking distance, so go there. We turned left out of the hotel and went to some Mexican restaraunt (I know, I know) and had some good late night beer and appetizers for about 1/2 of what 4 drinks cost at the hotel lobby bar. Ikako's was one restaraunt that I thought was great and the staff was very nice and friendly. Plus, if you eat there late in the afternoon, they will make the drinks nice and strong for you. EXERCISE ROOM/POOL. Both were nice enough. CASINO. Small, but enough to lose some money at if you need to. THe biggest thing that aggravated me was that there was a resort fee that was no where disclosed. The fee is 10% which adds up. I wasn't too happy about that, and I complained. We'll see what Marriott has to say. All in all, I was pleased and I would stay here again. We were only here one night, but it was fine. Old San Juan is cool, although touristy, and we walked around until we found some small "dive" bars that didn't look too touristy. There were plenty of other restaraunts in Old San Juan that looked tempting as well. Also, one tip I did read here that rang true: everyone in PR speaks English, so better to speak English than waste your time with your high school spanglish.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling hot, hot, hot”
Reviews.Author: hbyerly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 1411 on a "marriott rewards" stay the last week in August. The hotel wasn't very full, and they upgraded us without charge to an ocean view on check-in. The room was typical Marriott - clean, decent furnishings, mattresses with foam toppers, the ubiquitous green/beige carpeting. The a/c disconnects when the balcony door (gorgeous view) is opened, so you have to be careful to close it tightly to keep the room cool. A/C was barely adequate, despite having the engineer check it twice. It cooled to about 73F, but because it is centralized it did nothing for the humidity. We kept it going the entire stay and clothes still came out of drawers damp. The hotel has lots of amenities - the pool is lovely, with a good mix of sun and shade. There is a nice workout room (no charge for guests) with a variety of equipment, and the spa offers a small menu of massages. The hotel advertises wireless internet, but it was not available in our room (though I saw people using it in the lobby). There is an extra charge for Internet access, about $10/day, slightly less by the week. There's also a self-serve laundry facility, which is important because everything is so damp. There's a very small casino off the lobby, and the lobby bar had live music most evenings. The beach is fantastic - a wide swath of sand with clean water, but though the surf was fun for body surfing it was too rough for snorkeling or just floating around. They keep the "red flag" (dangerous water conditions) up year-round as there is no lifeguard on the beach. They do have waiters on the beach who circulate fairly often. The on-site restaurants were good - the Vista has a buffet going pretty much all the time, and you can also order from the menu. Lunch/dinner is about $45 for two people, which we thought was reasonable given the variety and location. The Tuscany is more high-end (i.e. the waiters are better dressed), and the food was mixed, with some things quite good and others less so. There are couple of restaurants within walking distance - the hotel is on a "strip" of major hotels that are mixed in with smaller guesthouses and restaurants. I've read other reviews comparing the area to South Beach, but I think that's a very poor comparison. There's a Walgreens a half block away (turn right out the front door), which is good for water and snacks. The location is Condado, just a few minutes east of old San Juan. It's about a 10 minute taxi ride, and they charge $12-14 depending on what part of the city you're heading toward. The staff is extremely nice, with the exception of the gift shop and tour staff, who seem to think that guests were an inconvenience. Bottom line - this was our first visit to PR, and we enjoyed the Marriott very much. I probably wouldn't come again at this time of year - it rarely got below 90, and with the high humidity it was uncomfortable to be outside for too long. For our next visit I'll try a guesthouse in a less urban area, I would not pay the "rack rate" of close to $300/night (I used points) for this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at this resort 3 years ago and had a very nice time. I was very happy with the service, food and grounds. The room was very nice and clean but a bit small. There is a swim up bar which was wonderful and the evening entertainment is great. We had a wonderful time and would definitely recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time !”
Reviews.Author: MommySD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for a week and it was wonderful! We got an oceanfront view for a cityview price and they did not charge us a resort fee. The hotel was very nice as was the staff...We loved our room it was clean and the view was breath taking..Our kids loved the pool and the slide..It got very packed on the weekend but we always found chairs...The beach was clean and there was always someone around if you needed chairs or umbrellas or a drink..We ate at the Latin Star almost every morning for breakfast it's right down the block next to Walgreen's...The girls in there were very sweet and the food was delicious...We tried the Angel cafe which wasn't good at all...Our best meal was at the Waikiki it was down a few blocks across the street from Chili's...It was too die for...resonable prices and if we found it sooner we would have ate dinner there every night...The Marriott did have some constuction going on but we didn't even notice it until about the 4th day because we saw the scoffolding while getting out of the cab..I would stay here again and would recommend it everyone...My sister in law stayed at the El San Juan in Isla Verde while it was beautiful she said it was very stuffy and wasn't kid friendly..Hope this helps...

Reviews.Title: “what a pleasurable stay”
Reviews.Author: alt9171964
Reviews.Content: stayed at the marriot san juan resort and casino, excellent hotel, clean, and the staff was very helpful. stayed there 3 days prior to a cruise and will return again. the best part was the nightly salsa band and dancing, in the hotel lobby. the room was clean, bed comfy and beachfront clean and quiet. will return again

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: mfnyc
Reviews.Content: We were in San Juan for 5 days for a quick family vacation. We were very pleased with the Marriott. We chose this hotel because we wanted to be walking distance from restaurants, near the airport, and we had some Marriott rewards points for a free night. We did not spend much time at the pool. It was crowded most of the daytime and there were lots of families (which doesn't bother us because we travel with our kids). The kiddie pool is large in comparison to the regular pool. The regular pool has a volleyball net running across it, fountains and a slide. We spent most of our time on the beach and it was great. Very peaceful. The red flag was up the entire time, although the water didn't seem all that rough until the last day or 2 when it became more choppy and there were some rain showers. The beach was sandy, no rocks or shells to speak of. We spent our last day at the pool. By then the hotel had emptied out and the weather was iffy. It was very pleasant without the crowds. It's also nice at the pool in the evenings. I can't speak for wait-service at the pool or beach since we didn't order any drinks, but in general we found the staff to be pleasant and helpful. The bellhops were particularly friendly, and offer water bottles (free) when returning from jogging. We ate breakfast at the buffet our first day. There weren't lines at the omelet station but the omelet cook did move quite slowly compared to the same at other Marriotts. One night we ate at Tuscany's. They had a $20 prix fix special between 6 and 7. This was great value although the choices are limited and some of the portions small depending on the choice. The food and atmosphere are very nice. We aslo ate at some nearby places, that for the most part were OK. Breakfast at Danny's Int'l (exit hotel to the left and walk a few blocks) was very good and very inexpensive. There's also an Italian place across from Danny's (I think called Via Appia Deli), that had decent pizza and salads. The Mexican place near the Italian was pleasant in ambience but the food was nothing special (the margarita's were good). The room was average in size and clean. We booked a city view with the AAA rate directly through Marriott and got a good deal. We were upgraded to beach/pool view and were not charged the resort fee. One of our nights was free with Marriott points. So all in all we had a good experience at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay, not impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott for a long weekend. This was a last minute weekend trip for my husband and me, so we did minimal research. Do yourself a favor and research your destination, especially if you have limited time. This is not a place to stay if you do not have kids. Despite kids and teenagers (and for that matter, some of their parents) screaming, running all over the pool area and not obeying the rules of the pool, the pool area was beautiful and was a relief because it was so hot and humid! Staff at the pool area were very friendly. I would not say that staff as a whole (at the pool) were very attentive. You have to speak up if you want a refill because no one is going to ask you if you want one. We arrived early and the woman (very friendly) who checked us in gave us a beeper to let us know when our room was ready. Well, the beeper never beeped so we went back to the desk at 4 o'clock, which is the check-in time, and our room was ready. The man who gave us our room key not friendly at all. Brian at the lobby bar was very nice, as was Gerry, who kept the lobby area very neat and clean. The bartenders that were at the lobby bar on Friday night were terrible. It was difficult to get a drink and difficult to get the check. We had breakfast at one of the restaurants on Saturday and we were completely rushed through the meal. Don't get the breakfast buffet on the weekend. The line is so long at the omelet station that the rest of your food will be cold by the time your eggs are cooked. The hotel needs serious updating (which is in the process of occurring). Our room was comfortable and clean, however, one day housekeeping did not clean our room until after I spoke with the housekeeping supervisor (at 5:00 p.m.). Don't bother with the hotel gift shop, people who work there are less than welcoming. Don't expect most of the staff in general to be overwhelmingly friendly to make you feel welcome or that you are glad that you booked the hotel. If you plan on staying for a romantic weekend, think about staying elsewhere. Also, plan on going off of the Condado if you really want to have a good time. The best meal we had was at El Convento in Old San Juan. If we do return to San Juan, we will stay at at more upscale hotel like El Convento and take day trips off the Condado. Also, the entire Condado area is in flux. There are massive construction projects underway on Ashford Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “A Fair Review of SJM”
Reviews.Author: JDERV
Reviews.Content: OK, lots of negative messages regarding the San Juan Marriott on this board. Having stayed at this hotel approx. 20 times during the past 5 years, I feel I have some balanced perspective. My most recent stay was in April 05. The hotel facility was previously a different hotel (Diplomat) which was destroyed by a fire in the mid 80's. Marriott bought the building and renovated in the late 90's. Many of the ongoing renovations are replacement activities from the original hotel (such as old windows and doors). Prior to initiating major renovations, particularly to the rooms, both the website and the hotel advise all guests. I agree that during the past few years the service has been spotty. Sometimes good/sometimes bad but honestly more often good. I have never found any part of the facility (hotel, gym, casino) to be "run down". In fact there is constant cleaning occuring in the common areas of the hotel.there The rooms are of varying size but I have never stayed in what I'd consider a small room. In the tower section of the hotel it is better to stay on floors 14 and higher because there is some noise from the lobby music - also the cabana wing is less noisy. The beds are very comfortable (soft mattress) and the housekeeping and overall upkeep has always been excellent during my stays. The pool area is quite attractive with nice landscaping, chairs, umbrellas and wait service for drinks. People who are complaining about excessive children most likely were visitng during school holiday time. I have not experienced an overwhelming number of out of control children at the pool. The beach area is public beach (city of San Juan) and not owned by the Marriott - however the hotel does provide chairs and umbrellas. The water is clean, particularly for an urban setting however there is a serious under-tow/rip-tide possibility at this beach - BE CAREFUL when swimming. The restaurants and room service are expensive - in fact I think more expensive than comparable restaurants in SJ. However in the immediate area of the Marriott (within 1/2 mile walking) are many restaurants from mid-range chains (Uno) to fine dining (Ramiros). There are also 2 Japanese restaurants within close distance (1 next to the hotel). I have never felt unsafe walking in the Condado area of San Juan - even late at night. I have found that in the past year, the SJ Marriott rates are almost always on the high-end (rarely less than $225 per night for city view room). In the past there were more frequent weekend specials and I've stayed for as little as $140 per night. For the current rates charged, there are other hotels in the city (Ritz Carlton or Intercontinental) which might provide a better experience for the money. Bottom line - if you're spending more than $225-250 and seek a true luxury experience then spend a little more and stay at the Ritz Carlton. If you want a relaxing stay in a clean, comfortable hotel with many options for dining outside the hotel AND you can get a rate of $225 or less, then I'd recommend the SJ Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and horrible”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaNYC
Reviews.Content: Keep looking -- this hotel is a dump. The rooms and common areas are run down, the beach is filthy with graffiti on the neighboring (look condemed) buildings -- not the view you want when you fly to the Carribbean. Cement chunks have fallen off of the hotel so the facade is horrible. Lunch was slow and cost over $50 for for two people for chicken cutlet, rice and a drink. If you are accustomed to nice, clean hotels this is NOT the place. Like I said, keep looking for something better for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Must Read if going to San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Monie_W
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I went to San Juan in April. The Marriot is an okay hotel. It looks alot better in the pictures. It is not a luxuary hotel. There is a wing that has recently been renovated, we did not stay in that wing. Our room was a little above the quality of a Motel 6. However, we heard that the side that had been renovated was nice. The beach was beautiful and made the stay worth it. We stayed on the Marriot beach for one day and then we went to other beaches. YOU MUST GO TO CULEBRA ISLAND. Culebra Island was one of the most beautiful beaches I have ever seen in my life. The ferry to go over is $2.50. When you get off the ferry, take the bus to flamingo beach (2.00). YOU HAVE TO TAKE THIS TRIP. Anyway, the Marriot is okay. There is a nightclub across the street that was popular and plenty of walking distance to many resturants. Pureto Rico is a great island to visit, but you are cheating yourself, if you only stay in San Juan. By the way, almost everyone speaks or understands English, so do not make a fool of yourself, by trying to speak the spanish you learned in high school or college. Dining at the Marriot was NOT impressive. Make sure you tell Juan and Edwardo, Monica from Philadelphia said Hi and that I am going to open a can of whip ---!

Reviews.Title: “Coonstruction! - Travel Agent's review”
Reviews.Author: aos200
Reviews.Content: I am pretty amazed after reading the positive reviews on this website and visiting the Marriott firsthand. Did no one see what we saw? I must say that I will never book anyone in the Marriott, San Juan especially but probably not the Condado area as well. Here's why. First off, be forewarned that construction in the San Juan area (including Old San Juan and Candado) is rampant and EVERYWHERE - as are the problems that come along with it in any city, namely; traffic, noise, congestion. If this statement alone is enough to make you question San Juan as a place you'd like to vacation peacefully - trust your instincts and book a hotel at an alternate location in PR outside of the San Juan city area (Dorado, Isla Verde or farther) or choose an alternate island in the carribbean. As for the Marriott itself, and I am AMAZED no one has really made a point of this, THE HOTEL ITSELF IS UNDERGOING A 4 PHASE RECONSTRUCTION ON THE WEST END AND ON THE PROPERTY IMMIDIATELY EAST A HOTEL IS BEING BUILT THROUGH 2006. This means that unless you want a view of a construction site, your only bet is the middle-back of the hotel that overlooks the pool. Now if your room assigned does not have a working balcony as a result of the work being done, you are entitled to 5000 marriott points per night or a $100 food and beverage credit per night (sign upon checkin). This means that if you stay on the West side of the hotel where they are painting and renovating the outside and therefore your balcony is locked for safety and out of use, you are entitled. Unfortunately, if your balcony is functional (as was ours, although it overlooked a construction pit and 2- 100 foot cranes to the East. I am sadly not kidding), we did not apply for the credit. Of other notes, our room was 2-3* quality, so be forewarned the high stars given on tripadvisor are indeed misleading. While I understand the level of sophistication is generally not as high in the Carribbean as it is elsewhere, the reality is our room was not the usual Marriott quality (ie. clean, comfortable). A 4* hotel does not have mold growing around the caulf of the tub, our bedding looked shabby, the bathroom needed a desperate regrout, and our balcony had cheap plastic furniture that looked about 10 years old. I could deal w that - after all, how long are you really in a room? But After speaking to the manager and explaining we were not informed of the construction when booking the hotel (which is right next to the beach - you MUST be able to hear it when outside during the day), I was still not offered ANY type of compensation or apology because I was 'upgraded' to a room with a balcony. An insult, to say the least, being our balcony overlooked a pit and construction cranes. I responded by informing the manager the hotel booking policy of not informing guests of the construction, and then not compensating those they deem 'unaffected' is not good business and I would not recommend such a property to my clients. To which I was told to my amazement 'that's fine, do not book your clients here'. Which leads me to ask - if this is the way the hotel manager treats an agent, how would he treat a poor client ? This is not to imply that the manager's attitude prevails in terms of the rest of the Marriott employees - that would be unfair. But when I go away on vacation, I expect a few basic things - namely, clean sheets, a clean bathroom, and a quiet place to relax and read a book or nap. Unfortunately after an hour at the Marriott, it seemed clear to me none of these things would happen without an excruciating effort that would defeat the point of my vacations. So I cut my losses and I checked out. As for the pool, we never swam but it looked very nice. The beach we never made it to so I cannot comment. The casino was a typical hotel casino (a bit smaller than I expected). The lounge bar was very active however the music was too loud (and I like music!) to hear the person next to you. Be forewarned there is a 'resort fee' or $10 a day and also a daily parking fee of $18 per day if you decide to stay here. As far as the Condado 'strip', we were told of the many nice restaurants on the outside of the hotel but we walked the strip and found nothing other than local 2* joints. Not that that is ever necessarilly a bad thing - but just as I expect the cons of a city (ie. noise, traffic, etc), I expect the pros as well (more sophisticated areas, better dining, etc). I am a 26 year old girl and I would not have felt safe walking alone had my boyfriend not been there to be honest. (There is a little, shady strip club across the street and 5 doors down from the Marriott). All in all, I must say that I recommend no one stay at this hotel or Condado in general. The city of Old San Juan is not very big and there is no real benefit to staying near it - the traffic is horrendous, there is construction everywhere, I assume there is rampant poverty as we saw a ton of shanty areas and 'for sale' signs, and even strolling down the streets you will be continuously bombarded by people in their cars and on their scooters playing excessively loud music. (I live in Manhattan and don't need to leave the motherland to enjoy that). If you do go, you can see El Morro and el castillo and enjoy lunch or dinner and some shopping around all of Old San Juan in half a day. As far as nightlife, we were only in old San Juan for a night, but didn't see many options other than 5 or so nice restaurants. (So if nightlife is your thing, this is not your place - go to South Beach, Cancun, stay at Atlantis, etc). Most resorts outside of San Juan do not charge their guests parking and by the time you add up taxi fees and tour transportation charges (for example, if you travel to el yunque (the rainforest), it is $50 per person for the bus tour, a cab from the airport to Candado is $15 each way). Therefore, my strong suggestion is to rent a car and just get out of San Juan - stay elsewhere on the Island. We ended up at the Hyatt Dorado which was lovely - I will post a review for that. Hope this helps give you a more detailed view of the Marriott/Condado area.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott has changed a lot since the last time I went there..”
Reviews.Author: LisaNewYork
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the San Juan Marriott 5 years ago and enjoyed my stay. However, this time around was totally different. The hotel staff itself is very friendly. They open doors and are very courteous. That's never a problem. But the hotel is run down and definitely needs repairs which we knew before we decided to stay there. I believe the repairs are being made the first week of June. The pool area is small. There were tons of kids the week I stayed here and very unruly as well. They did not adhere to the rules of the pool area. They were jumping and diving into the pool which was prohibited; they were climbing up the water slide after the lifeguard was off duty and they were throwing volleyballs at each other. The hotel staff did absolutely nothing to reprimand them. The swim up bar shuts down at 4:00 p.m. - after that, you have to get out of the pool and walk to the outdoor bar if you want a drink. It's very loud and noisy. If you want a quiet place to relax and enjoy the beach and pool, DO NOT stay here. On weekends, the beach can get very crowded. If you're not out very early, your chance of getting beach chairs and an umbrella are very slim. I also witnessed nudity on the beach which I don't think is appropriate for a family hotel. Also, we made 2 reservations with the concierge for dinner, which were NOT made. We had to confirm with them and it's a good thing we did, otherwise we would not have had reservations. If you want good Puerto Rican food - eat at Ajili Mojili - they have great Mofongo. Ropa Vieja is also very good. Another excellent restaurant is Ramiro's. This place is an upscale Spanish restaurant and is walking distance from the hotel. I would make reservations. The rooms for the most part are decent size and are clean. I recommend staying on a higher floor because of the nightlife downstairs in the hotel lobby. They have singing, dancing, bands etc which was nice. The trip to Camuy Caves is nice but is definitely NOT worth the $90 the Marriott charges you compared to other hotels that charge $74. If you're planning to go to El Yunque, my suggestion is to rent a car and go yourself. The tour guide will not do half the things the rain forest offers. My overall opinion of this hotel would be just okay, maybe average. The next time I go back, I may think of staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend San Juan Marriott”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night/5 day visit to the San Juan Marriott. The hotel accomondations were wonderful. The Marriott is central to many restaurants, shopping and other hotels. Old San Juan is just a short (5 min), 25 cent bus ride! The beach was beautiful and the beach side service was excellant. The evening salsa band is also a must to experience. One of the hotel's conseire's RUTH was very informative and provided excellant recommenations for fine dining. The pool is also good with its very own slide! I especially want to highly recommend, the Mar Y Tierra Bar and Grill. Newly opened, this restaurant provided extrodinary service, atmosphere and the food was aboslutely delicious. If you are looking for great food at excellant prices this is the place for you. If you stop by, tell Casey (the owner) hello from Maryland.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation - But Not Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip 4 months in advance after reading reviews. I originally wanted to stay at the InterContinental but couldn't find a great rate and like the location of the Marriott better. We got a rate of $179/night because the reservations center made an error. That in itself was a hassle. But onto the vacation... I was meeting a friend there from Boston and she arrived first, checking into a smoking, ocean-front room. The only reason we stayed was because it DID NOT smell like smoke - we are both non-smokers but loved the view. Unfortunately, the hotel said they did not have any other ocean front rooms available in non-smoking so we would have been stuck in city-view if it had smelled. We had a housekeeping issue the first night as well, finding hair in the bed and in the shower that was not ours, and immediately called the front desk. The hotel did show great customer service in giving us a $100 credit at the Italian restaurant on site. (More on that later) But at check-out, it showed a small charge from the restaurant that we had been told had been covered...was resolved, but an added hassle. Other than the hair, the room was fine, the beds were comfortable and it was clean. Tuscany, the italian restaurant, is AMAZING. Not only is the service fabulous, but the food is wonderful. We had pasta with lobster, ossa bucco, grilled salmon, seared tuna and loved our meals....Definitely go there if you are in town whether you stay at the restaurant or not. The rest of the trip was fine...the pool was crowded as it was a holiday weekend and there were lots of kids but that didn't bother us. The only issue at the pool is finding a sunny place to be for the day. The hotel placed palm trees all over the pool area and they block the sun depending on where you sit. The beach is all open and they have lounge chairs and umbrellas although if you like long walks on the beach, this is not the place for you. I enjoy walking the beach to exercise and there's not too far to walk. There is a great band at night in the lobby and a casino in the hotel(a few $5 and $10 tables for blackjack). Plus you can walk to a bunch of restaurants and bars on Ashford Ave. We went into San Juan twice and it's a $10 cab ride and great to walk around and try some restaurants! Maria's is a local place for frozen drinks, The Parrot Club and sister restaurants are fun and if shopping is your thing, there is a Coach Factory store there! The only other major issue was the concierge. They are not the most helpful and don't make too many good recommendations. I suggest researching the area on your own before you go. If I go back, I'll try to stay at the IC unless the price is much better at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice on the inside, but looks a little shabby outside”
Reviews.Author: reed13ja
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights after a cruise. The hotel is large and nice, and the service is very friendly. The only problems we had were with the outside of the building and the neighboring buildings. Be careful when booking here in the summer of 2005. They are doing construction and painting on the balconies and outside walls of the hotel - which it badly needs. But this could add up to a lot of noise! The hotel is also surrounded by construction of other buildings on both sides, and the whole area of the beach is a little shabby. Speaking of the beach, if you are bringing kids, be careful! The water is VERY rough and has a strong undertoe. Few parents would let their children swim, and if they did the kids stayed in the water for no more than five minutes. I still have sand in my ears from the huge waves knocking me down! In fact, local kids came to the beach in front of our hotel to surf. On the other hand, the pool is great for kids and there are activities planned daily. The hotel resteraunts are so-so, a little overpriced in my opinion. The area has a few nice local places as well as chain resteraunts. KFC delivers to the hotel if you really miss home-cooking! The hotel is close to Old San Jaun which is a great trip. Also, there is a tour desk that plans reasonably priced tours to local attractions. They offer trips to the rainforest, the Bacardi distillery, Old San Jaun, and moonlight kayaking. The hotel does have a nice casino, but it is a little small! Don't expect anything like Vegas. I would have given this hotel an above average rating, but the price was a little too high. Next time I will try another beach in Puerto Rico, one that is more conducive to laying out and swimming in the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “20th Anniversary Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our vacation in Puerto Rico. We spent 6 wonderful days at the San Juan Marriott & Stellaris Casino. We usually stay at 3 star hotels but will probably not do so again. There is a big difference and the staff at the Marriott was on a mission to prove it. At every turn they were opening doors, asking if we needed help, or bending over backwards to make sure that our 20th anniversary stay was a memorable one. It most certainly was. I want to specifically call out Carl at La Vista. We were lucky enough to get him as our server/waiter on our first morning for breakfast. We asked for him every day after that. He was friendly and hustled to make sure that we had everything that we needed. If you don't want to be talked to and just want someone to "get my breakfast" then just say so. But, if you want someone who's engaging and personable then Carl's your man! We had a room on the cabana/ocean side. The views were incredible. We woke up to the sound of ocean waves crashing every morning. The pool had a water slide that my Daughter and I spent countless hours on. We were with our 6 year old Daughter so we couldn't really hang at the bar or casino but it looked like it was a happening place. When we'd return every night the bar was packed and they always had a great Latin band. The dance floor was always full. We read some reviews before we left that mentioned that you should make sure that you asked for floors above the 4th. I would echo that. We were on the 8th and didn't really hear anything. In closing I would say that we didn't have one bad experience at the Marriott and would highly recommend this hotel as well as Puerto Rico for a vacation spot but only if you want to have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “#3 in San Juan is questionable”
Reviews.Author: pbjandthou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the SJ Marriott for 2 nights in early May as a pre-cruise stop. It was fine for 2 nights, but I personally would not want to stay here for a week long visit. It's a shame that I can only give this hotel an average rating, because as others have written, the service was outstanding. Unfortunately, the condition of the beach side and pool side exteriors of the hotel and renovations that need to be made to the rooms and balconies reduce the "excellent" rating that I would like to give it. Also, although it is not the hotel's fault, the condition of the beach front walls and buildings on each side of the Marriott are in desperate need of help. This area on the beach isn't condusive to beach walks and romance. The pool area is lovely, but the pools themselves belong to the kids, especially on weekends. We enjoy Latin music and loved the bands that played in the lobby area while we were there. We ate at the hotel one morning. The menu is limited and the breakfast buffet is "encouraged". I understand why since the buffet runs between $13-$16 and ordering ala carte coffee, water, and granola cost $12. Needless to say we ate at a small cafe down the street the next morning. I think that in a year or two, after they clean things up a bit it'll be a great spot, but on our next visit to San Juan I think we'll be going to Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Mother and daughter experiencing our roots”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was at the Marriott Stellaris in the Condado in San Juan. My daughter and I had never been to Puerto Rico for pleasure. We are of Puerto Rican decent but only visited when someone in the family passed away. Well I must say that the boogey man that everyone seem to warn us about never gave us a problem. My daughter is 19 yrs and let me tell she had her share of telephone numbers. But we felt safe at all times. We went out at all times of the day and never once felt the we could be in danger. Everyone was polite, pleasant and very helpful in the hotel and out about town. We took a taxi to old San Juan and saw sooo many gorgeous sites that we can't wait to see again. The food was excellent except in some places you have to wait a while for it. We also rented a car and we recommed it highly to travel the Island. We drove all the way to Arecibo, and experience the beautiful beaches.. The hotel was awesome there was live music every night with quite a crowd for dancing. and security to the hotel was wonderful. So for two women traveling for the first time alone it was a wonderful experience our spanish is ok... but everyone spoke English or spanglish so it worked out perfect...

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: summer2006
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 just got back from staying at the San Juan Marriott. We were not entirely pleased with the hotel. The staff was excellent and very helpful. Out of the 2 restaurants the Tuscany was very good. La Vista had a buffet breakfast, lunch and dinner. If you are into buffets this is the way to go. The kids loved it but a waste of money. I dont care for buffets and I thought the menu was very boring...all I wanted was a toss salad and couldnt get one! The pool area was very nice, however, get your chairs early because they go fast and by 11am there is none to be found. The pool swim-up bar was closed, no activites for the kids, they had a volley ball net, but no balls and by the middle of the week the net was gone. The 90 ft slide was the best feature, you have to try it, I even did, it was great! However, they open up a 11am close by 4, while alot of the families are just getting back from day trips by that time, a real bummer for my kids. The beach area was very clean and nice, the water is a little rough(undertoe) but that depends if the wind is blowing or not. The lounge area at nite was very quite, on the weekends the locals come and dance, the place was mobbed. The casino was good, didnt hit on the slots but played 21/2 hours at roulette table with $25, I should have walked away when I was well ahead! Overall, it was just OK, I would not stay there again. Restaurants...Miros...2blocks down(walking distance) was excellent, service was great.The Cherry Blossom next door is your typical bonzai restaurant, good for the kids. We went to the Caribe Hilton to Mortons, great steak, but expensive. This hotel looked great, we took a walk around, tons of stuff for the kids. We rented a car and went to Liguillo beach by Farajedo, about an hr. drive from San Juan, absolutely beautiful, plan on doing a day there. Seven Seas beach was nothing to brag about. We did East Coast Cattermaran/snorkel great time, the crew was great, they made 2 stops to snorkel, one shallow water which was great for my 7 year old, they have aslide off the back of the boat. They gave us a great lunch and all we could drink. The 2nd stop was in deeper waters, the water current was too stong for me and my 7 yr old. All in all, great experience. We did the new/old San Juan bus tour/ one of the forts, nice trip, the kids were bored until we got to the fort, only 45 minutes to shop, was not enough time. I would suggest to do a 1/2 day in old San Juan or more. Dont go on Sunday evening, the shops close by 5 or 6. All in all the trip was great, next time I would definately not stay in San Juan. OBTW...the Intercontinental, ESL, Hilton looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott San Juan, Not great but still pretty good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back yesterday from the Marriott San Juan. It was not great but it was pretty good and we had a wondeful time. I had read reviews on this board before leaving and was not sure what to expect. In the end I was plesantly surprised. First let me say that I have stayed in a variety of hotels from really cheap to some of the best including Four Seasons and Ritz. I mostly stay in Marriotts on business and amassed some points to use for this particular stay. I do not expect Marriotts to be 5 star establishiments. They are not competing with super high end luxury hotels so if that's what your used to.. forget it. The service is not as solicituous and the small details and overall experience of a Four Seasons is not what you're going to get. Having said that,h it was still nice. The hotel is in pretty good condition with the common areas very clean and well kept. The hotel has begun their renovation and crews were in the process of painting the exterior. Our room (city view) was fine. Clean, reasonable size but was a little dated. We were on the 5th floor. Word of warning: if you are in the main tower and go to bed early, you want to be high ie.. 8th floor plus. The night club in the lobby gets VERY loud and we could here the base thumping as late as 3am on saturday night! Pool is very nice, lots of young kids, but better that than crawling with spring breakers. Also, the whole pool area is in full sun by about 11am unless you are under a palm tree.Service was very good at the pool with people regularly circling to see if you wanted a $7.50 frozen drink or a $12 burger. Hey, it was expensive but it's a resort! The only truly bad service we had was a surley attendant at the beach who didn't have his story straight about whether to charge us $12 for an umbrella or not. If you are being charged the "resort fee" of 10% per night then the umbrellas are free. We were not being charged the fee as we were using points so we had to pay for the umbrella. Oh well, the 12 bucks was less than 10%. As far as I could tell, the 10% resort fee does not seem to cover anything else of importance so better you pay for the umbrella. The beach itself is clean, big, not crowded and the water is beautiful. Their is some surf but not too bad. My wife and I both had massages. She said hers was great. Mine was o.k. At $100 a pop they are pretty pricey. The spa was very clean although the lockers were not fuctional. But the massage rooms and atmosphere were nice. Again, it's not the Four Seasons. The area of Condado is great. It is kind of like south beach Miami but not as upscale. Nice stores and o.k. restaurants. I would recommend Tijuanna for great mexican food and the Mariachi band. Yeuba Buena was not bad. Danny's has very good pizza and breakfast. Everything is pretty expensive, figure, $70 bucks for two people for an average meal with a couple of drinks. We also hit the Burger King down the street for Breakfast. It was cheap and quick. We ate one nite at La Mallorcina. Recommended by the concierge. Not very good, don't go. Pricey, small portions of average food. Also check out Piu Bello Gelato. Great deserts and Ice Cream at a reasonable price. The only outside activity we did was a Catamaran/Snorkel trip aboard the SpreadEagle II. Don't let the name fool you. This was a very professional crew who did a great job. We actually sailed (most of these boats just moter to save time). We went to two beautiful beaches on the same island for great snorkeling and actually fed fish by hand with bread left over from lunch. You get all you can drink Pina Coladas and Rum Punch as well as soda and water. Lunch is a sandwich buffet which didn't sound all that big of a deal but turned out to be very good. Lots of fixings, everything laid out fresh along with fruit and salad. All of this for $77 per person. I can't say enough about the crew. They were fun, professional, courteous, and worked very hard to make sure everyone had a geat time. Overall our vacation was great. Puerto Rico is more like a carribean island than a 51st U.S. state. Many people speak little or no English and the standard of living is low with some areas we drove through looking very 3rd world. Way to much on this board is made of the hotel's surrounding area being "scary" "unclean" or "full of Graffiti". The Condado area is clean, seems very safe and the graffiti was limited to buildings that are in the process of being demolished to make way for more luxury property. Overall we found it a very convienient area to be in with much within walking distance and only a 10 min cab ride to the airport. Hope this helps!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of updates but great location”
Reviews.Author: BrookefromBrookline
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. You can take the local bus for 25 cents down to Old San Juan or you can walk around the condado area where there are shops and restaurants. Our friends, who are locals, said that the area is perfect for getting around. True, the area is a run down, but they are constructing new hotels along the beach...in a year, it might look really good. Now the hotel itself is very run down. My husband and I got a massage, which was nice, but the spa itself was a huge dissapointment. There were no lockers available (they were available, but the locks on the lockers were broken...that is what they told us) and when I went to rinse off after my massage, the showers were crawling with mildew on the walls and ceiling. My husband told me that the mens locker room was equally as bad if not worse because the toilets were filthy. Not very clean in my opinion. The pool area is nice. There were a lot of kids, but it was easy to find a chair. The shade was great, as the heat is a killer. I think there is bar staff that comes around to take drink orders, but I only saw one person. It appeared that the hotel was very short staffed overall. We got a corner ocean room, it was nice, but I think we could been just as satisfied with an ocean view room. We had access to the concierge level during the day and they were nice there. It was worth getting breakfast there as breakfast in the hotel is really expensive. You might as well save your money for better restaurants outside of the hotel. The maid service is poor. We came back from being out all day to find our room not made up, it was annoying considering we were tired and wanted to take a shower, instead we had to wait for the maid service to clean our room. The hotel could be a great place and hopefully with the renovations, they will upgrade its look inside and out. If you are looking for location in terms of being near the city and near the beach, this is your place. But search for the cheapest deal (rooms are way too overprices), no one should pay a ton of money to stay here. Stay at the Ritz if you want luxury and want to pay a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Kids, Babies and Security Guards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the SJ Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino and had a really fun time and I only have a few comments - NOT complaints. The hotel is about to get a facelift and they make that very clear with posters up throughout the Hotel so it surprises me when anyone seems surprised to find the hotel looking "tired" . . . duhhh The staff was very friendly and hard working - sometimes a little too hard as the security guards seem to be doing. I'm quite sure the Marriott needs the security although I never felt anything but safe in and around the hotel and for that matter all over San Juan so I'm hesitant to even mention this however I really think the people in charge of security need to find another way to patrol since the security staff are always in your face so to speak and I confess that after a few days I really began to feel as if I was a suspect for something I was about to do but hadn't yet. After four days I finally got carded by one of these bozos at the beach entrance/exit meaning I was asked to show my room key. I wouldn't have minded as much if it had been in the first day or two but after four days I really didn't appreciate it. Suppose that day only my wife had the key, would they have arrested me on the spot ? I also didn't appreciate being asked for a photo id when I wanted to use my credit card at the restaurant which up until that point I'd been charging to the room not to mention charging a few grand for the room. No one needed a photo id then . . . And then there were the babies ... ohhh those babies. If you don't mind constant squealing and screaming and crying and yelling . . . you won't mind this aspect but there it is I've said. It's wall to wall babies so be pepared. And its LOUD ! Aside from those two items I thought it was a lot of fun. The area is wonderful, the beach is wonderful and there's construction everywhere in San Juan so if you see graffitti on some shell of a building that's about to come down and be replaced by some new beautiful construction - so what? Big deal I say. I had a great time ... but next time I'll stay at the Wyndham since it appears to have fewer babies squealing . . . and a discreet security staff.

Reviews.Title: “so bad you feel like you're on punk'd”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Marriott was anything but positive. At certain points we felt like we were being punk'd! It started with check in when we were told they didn't have any non-smoking rooms available (mind you, I'd spoken to reservations the day before to double check that we'd be in a non-smoking double.) Finally, they stuck us in this room overlooking a rusty roof and a starbucks. the air conditioner was broken and kept making this noise that sounded like a lock being picked. click.click.click. our room was muggy.we called downstairs: us: 'hi, can someone please come up and check out the AC?' desk: (loud sigh like we are really inconveniencing him) fine us: thanks! desk: [hangs up] 2 guys came up and toodled around with the AC for about 2 minutes. then they said, 'nothing we can do.' i said, 'you mean this is as cool as it gets?' and they said, 'yes.' this turned out to be untrue- the rooms did get cooler. a lot cooler. the bartenders were AWFUL. mean. they glared at u. they helped the men first even if u were next on line. no one wants to help you at this hotel. it's very serve yourself. drag your own lounge chair down to the beach (i saw OLD WOMEN pulling their own chairs while hotel staff watched on) also expect to pay $12 for a beach umbrella. yep. $12. * the hotel needs updating. the lobby is dark and dingy. depressing. OH AND HAPPY HOUR STARTS AT 7PM. very late. drinks are $$$$$$$$. the happy hour is not much of a deal - at all. * front desk- surly. lazy etc. * AVOID MARRIOTT CONDADO

Reviews.Title: “It was ok....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got home from the Marriott in San Juan. We only stayed a few days as we were coming home from a cruise and just wanted a short stay in San Juan. I don't know if I would have liked to stay there a week, but for a few days it was perfect. The room was fine, no complaints. This was not an adult resort....there were a ton of kids there, so it's not the most romantic vacation spot. I think we were hitting spring break so maybe it's not always so crowded with kids. There are two pools, both large, however they were both crowded with kids. The pools are nice and large, but are blocked by the hotel during much of the morning, so until noonish, they are in the shade. In the afternoon, the pools do get more sun. The resort is located in a great spot, there is a Starbucks right across the street and Dunkin Donuts, Pizza Hut, Walgreens only a few blocks away. The staff was nice, service was good. Oh and we had a GREAT dinner at the restaurant "Tuscany" in the hotel. All in all a good experience, would go back. The hotel is going through renovations starting in May 05 through Sept. 05.

Reviews.Title: “Absolulty Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino this past April and found it to be absolutly fabulous. The hotel staff were incredable. There must have been 300-400 of them on duty at all times. They were everywhere to help you in every way; all extremely friendly. The hotel was spotless and I mean spottless. Marble lobby, gorgous rooms and everything was shinning. The pool area was phonominal with a massive pool and a luxerious hot tub. *** Hotel Location *** This hotel is in the best possible locations. It is right in the main strip of Ashford Ave. with all the shops and restarants in walking distance. Other hotels in San Juan I considered staying at (Wyndham, Hilton, Ritz Carlton) are somewhat more seculded and not within walking distance from shops and restarants. Being able to walk to restatants in the area was a major plus for my family. I've stayed at numerous 5 star hotels and this hotel deffinatly gives them competition.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: njcOctober
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and people. Just came back from 5 nights at hotel. The entire staff was friendly and professional. Absolutely no complaints about the room, resort, area, etc. All elements of this hotel were excellent. It was windy so the waves at the beach were a bit rough but you were still able to go into the ocean. If the pool is more of your area then you'll enjoy the 2 pools and hot tub. Drinks are a bit pricey but that's not unique to this specific hotel. Weekends have local salsa bands playing with dancing. Very nice and relaxing, safe hotel (not stuffy or overdone). Security presence keep areas safe so you can enjoy your vacation. Starbucks, Walgreens and restaurants all within a short walking distance (2 blocks or less). Hotel restaurants are very good. The surrounding area is very clean, safe and upscale but not snooty. Casino is fun/open 24hrs day and is not intrusive to the hotel. Adults and children alike feel welcomed at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: BostonIndian
Reviews.Content: One word - TOURISTY We prefer off the beaten path kind of vacations - far from the maddening crowds. If that's what you are looking for... this is not the place. This time however, I had Marriott points to burn, we were done with our 3 nights in Fajardo (for El Yunque), Vieques (for the Biobay) and Hatillo (for the Caverns at Camuy and the Radio Telescope at Arecibo), so I was itching to do the 'stereotypical toursity thing' :) The place is very well managed. The rooms are immaculate, clean and well stocked. The views from the hotel are amazing. There was a latin band playing in the lobby and we tried practising our Salsa and Merengue with the locals and the rest. The casino is small but gets crowded. The beach is conveniently located right behind the hotel. They do check your claim for re-entry into the hotel premises (flashed our room card to the bouncers/guards) The pool is beautiful. The shallow pool is too shallow for adult swimming, and the second pool gets crowded with kids during the afternoons. Nevertheless it's a wonderful place to just hang out, get a tan, catch up on reading, and peoplewatch. The restaurants are good too. They had two buffets - one being the 'healthy choice' and the other being everything. Parking is $14 for a 24 hour period. There's a bus (21B, i think), that runs past the bus stop right outside the hotel for 25c and takes you right into Old San Juan. We however pooled in $2 per person and took a 6 person cab in. It's slightly faster since it doesn't make stops. The airport is about 15 minutes away. If you rent a car and opt to return a full tank, make sure you gas up before you hit the highway that takes you into the airport. We expected to see a gas station right before the rental return, but did not find any. We then opted to get out of the terminal to fill up and return only to get late to check in our luggage (which meant I had to give up my expensive Swiss Army knife that would not have made it through security as carry on luggage :( I digress... The staff at the hotel is helpful and professional. All in all a really well managed place with a ton of amenities - in the room and out (on the hotel premises) However, at $275 a pop, I'll wait a few hundred years and accumulate enough points for another stay in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed with the San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino”
Reviews.Author: HazMat71
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five day stay at the San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino and was very pleased with all aspects of the resort. The staff was wonderful and the concierge service was invaluable. One suggestion is to pay the extra money or if you are a Rewards member get access to the Executive Level Lounge. Very nice and had food and drink most of the day into the evening. We had a deluxe corner oceanfront room which had a king size bed (extremely comfortable) and we requested a roll away which was delivered promptly. The pool is great for kids and spending your whole trip there would not be disappointing. The pool water was comfortable. You did have to move from time to time to chase the sun but this was not a very big issue since tanning is no problem. As a matter of fact be careful of the sun and sun block is highly recomended. The beach is beautiful and the access was great. The undertoe can be dangerous but don't hold your kids back. Just watch them and restrict some of the distance they enter the water. The water is warm and blue. Contruction is all around but was not very noticable and in no way distracted from the resort atmosphere. The locals were very friendly and helpful. Expect pretty slow service in the local restaurants but venture out and taste the local fare. It is delicious. If you have kids get the pizza at Danny's which was delicious and carry out was convenient and cheaper than the hotel which serves a 7-11 type pizza. Go to Walgreen's and buy your bottled water for your stay and liquor/beer in town. Go on the snorkeling trip, visit the rain forest (our tourguide Ed La Joy was excellent! request him if possible) and visit the forts and shop downtown. Cigar Afficionados must go to Don Collins Cigar Shop downtown for some locally grown tobacco cigars which were great after a heavy local meal. The casino is fun and paid for most of the trip. I felt safe in every aspect of our stay. Security is everywhere and we heard of no issues. Downsides- The rooms are a bit dated and wear and tear is present. It is time for some renovation which I understand is coming. The hotel needs to improve their game room to accomodate more kids. Bottom Line- My family is eagerly awaiting the opportunity to return. We saw several other hotels in the area which were as beautiful some even more so but for a family will return to the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fmw1035
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four nite stay @ Marriot. Every thing was great. The pool area was clean and the water not cold at all. The slide is so much fun. Fri Sat Sun their was a steel band poolside. The were activities scheduled for the kids- arts & crafts, cake decorating.. There was bingo for adults. and a scheduled pool game for teens. The pool always has a volleyball or basket ball game going on. If you want to just swim there was not much room for that. The beach was public and clean. Staff was always there to help get a chair or drink for you. Yes there is a lot of construction around hotel, but the only sound I heard sitting @ beach was crashing waves and a faint sound of the steel band. The water is rough but my teenage sons had a great time body surfing. The lobby was so lively. It was great. If you are looking for quiet relaxing time the lobby was not the place to go. We had breakfeast @ the hotel. It was a buffet and was very good. On Sat when the hotel was busy, they had two seperate buffet areas set up and used the tables near the bar to accomodate everyone. I was immpressed how they accomodated the amount of people that were there for breakfast. Lunch poolside was also good. Service was good and food was good. Dinner we had out everynite. We went to Yuerba's for carribean food. The food was very good, but the service was beyond slow. We waited twoo hours after ordering our dinner.( I know it was a busy weekend, but that was slow even for Island time). The rooms were great. We had two ocenfront rooms. It was fantastic to sit on the balcony and listen to the ocean. The rooms were very clean. One day they left fresh fruit and other nites left chocolate. The staff was very friendly. Security is always around. The only thing that was annoying was following the sun. The buildings block the sun as it moves. You are constantly moving your chair to either stay in the shade or to keep in the sun. Althoughj we don't snorkel we went on an all day snorkling trip on the advice of the tour desk. She was so right!! You sail out about 45 minutes to the most beautiful beahc ever. You can snorkel, or go off the slide on the back of the boat, or swim or just relax on the boat. They serve a coldcut lunch and pina colada's , soda and rum punch. They had a glass bottom on one side of the boat, so even though we didn't snorkl;e we got to see some great tropical fish.. There is a lot of construction going on and graffitti around. This had absolutley no effect on this trip at all.. The Marriot really is a class act!!

Reviews.Title: “San Juan- Imagine having Vegas,SouthBeach, & Acapulco all in one place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Viqko
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Juan 2 days ago (March 23) and stayed at the Marriot in Condado and I am missing it terribly!!! The people there are so friendly it is unreal. If they were that nice in the states they would be taken advantage of in about 2.3 seconds to say the least. My friends and I made friends with some locals the first day we arrived and hung out with them every day we were there. They showed us their puerto rico which was the best experience.
