We partied all night and afterwards went to the beach to watch the sun come up almost every day. Oooh and I also learned a new drink receipe called Lemoncillo. The spelling may not be right but its water, bacardi 151, and crystal light. You do not taste the 151 and its sooooo good but it can sneak up on you if your not careful. Here is a a quick guide to the nightlife: Thursdays: Babylon/Moorings Friday's: Babylon / 360 / Element / Senor Frogs/ Outside bar next to Condado Plaza/Moorings Saturday's: Babylon/ Ochos de Blanco/ Moorings Sunday's: Lupi's / Lazer Monday: stay in not much to do besides have a nice dinner and drink Tuesday's: Senor Frogs Great Place to Eat: City Grill in Old San Juan ( 311 Recinto Sur Street) It's fairly new but the food is amazing it just melts in your mouth. Plus our waiters ( Luis & George ) were friendly, cute, funny and spoke english. I had the tequila steak which I am still drooling over. Island You HAVE TO VISIT: CULEBRA....to get to culebra you have to drive or take a taxi to Fajardo which is about an hour drive from San Juan and take a ferry there which cost $2.25. Reserve a hotel b4 you arrive unless you are camping out on Playa Flamenco. The white sand and crystal blue water along with the views are gorgeous. Old San Juan: Everyone just strolls the boardwalk and streets at night on the weekends. There is so much to do that Next time I go I will definately stay longer than 7 days and brush up on my Spanish because not many people speak english once you leave the hotel. Viva La Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “San Juan and the Marriott Stellaris great for whole family!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from San Juan's Marriott Stellaris Hotel and Casino. We had a great stay! The kids loved the pool and, when ready, were able to change direction toward the beach, which was just steps away (watch the little ones in the undertoe!). Most kids just want to swim so the Marriott was a great choice. A great slide at the pool and a midday, staff-run kid activity poolside as well (cookie decorating, arts and crafts). Head down the street (to the left of hotel) to Danny's for a cheap and wonderful breakfast alternative to the hotel. Go a little farther down the street to a convenient store to replenish your mini-bar cheaply! San Juan is a big city so expect big-city activity (traffic on Saturday night, a beggar here and there, and fast-food chains). I thought the streets where impeccably clean. And yes, there are some hotels under construction in the area. But none of that disturbed our stay in the least. Do your best to seek out the local food. While not for waistwatchers, the local cuisine is delicious. Pamela's at the Numero Uno guest house was a superior upscale dining experience that was also grade-school-age kid friendly. Ajili Mojili was also excellent for getting a superbly prepared Puerto Rican meal. Parrot Club somewhat disappointing (couldn't talk over music).

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: uphishy2me
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed for seven days, March 12-19 and had a great time. Stayed at the suite, 3rd floor and could not hear the legendary "noise" on salsa nights. Ocean front view was amazing. Friday and Saturday great live Salsa bands, locals and guests alike mingle and dance. Casino was not my thing, but did visit once, seemed like a busy place. Staff was very friendly and helpfull. Christian Nieves the front desk supervisor was much more than bargained for, attentive and just plain wonderfull. Took the bus to Old San Juan and had a blast just walking around and window shopping. Don't miss the Butterfly People on Cruz Street. Butterflies from all over the world on display, available for purchase too. Saw the Camuy caves, don't miss it, but rent your own car and drive. Will save a lot of time. The weather was just right, breezy, in the upper 80's...can't go wrong. Hotel beach was relaxing..chairs will be carried to any spot you like by staff...can't swim deep if you are not a good swimmer. Powerfull undertone, huge waves but lots of fun if you stay close to shore. The pool was OK, small to my liking but clear and clean water. Finding a spot in the sun can be tricky. Water never too cold, just right. Breakfast was ok, rest of the time we ate out. Tijuanas, and Italian place next door was great. Miro's not worth the $$ in my opinion. For evenings, right across the street is nice hangout, or all along Ashfor Ave., places to sit outside and have a coctail or cold beer. For clubbing you can go to Babylon at the Wyndham (Thursday nights really, really young crowd), for more mature atmosphere check out the Water Club wet bar on roof (amazing view) and plush white leather couches, and the club on first floor. A relaxed local pool bar is across the street from Mariott to the right, called the Video Bar, had a really good time. The only thing I can complain about is the annoying habit of housekeeping walking in without knocking at diff. times of day, but.... will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you don't want to sleep or be in your room”
Reviews.Author: jppalooza
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from March 4-9. Let me preface this review stating that we are very frequent travelers (me staying in a hotel around 30 nights/year and my husband about 150 nights/year) and have stayed at a variety of hotels, including 4 and 5 star resorts in Hawaii, Scottsdale, Venice and Puerto Vallarta. We chose the Marriott because 1) it had good reviews 2)it was on the beach and 3) we had Marriott Rewards that could get us 2 nights free stay at this particular hotel. This hotel was not worth it. The room was very small. I called to get another room, they said the hotel was "booked" for the entire length of our stay. The room next door must have had it's plumbing in our walls because every morning we woke up to a loud (let's put that airplane flying over your house looud) percolator type of noise in our room. Again, hotel was booked, so no way to change rooms. If you must stay here, specifically request not room 622, or any room on the 6th floor or lower if you stay there on Fri, Sat or Sun and you want a quiet room before 3am. Hotel overall clean, but not extravagently clean. Service was poor, no one really cared that we were guests at their hotel. Pools were OK, slide was fun. Hot tub is not hot, but pleasantly warm. They will carry beach chairs to the beach for you (for free and chairs are free) but the umbrellas others rented were $12/day. Ocean was nice. Food and drinks are expensive as are normal at hotels. We ate a La Vista basically every day for breakfast which is a typical hotel "cafeteria". Needs an update to be a 4 or 5 star resort. Had a massage, and it was OK, but the "spa" is not really a "spa" it is cheap massage tables in rooms in the basement of the hotel with the fitness center. Fitness center very nice....use this. Nice location of the hotel on the beach and plenty of things in walking distance and has a bus stop in front to get to Old San Juan which I recommend. Casino OK. Overall, stay elsewhere unless you like to be outside on the beach like we do.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable learning experience...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back fron Puerto Rico on March 6 and I had a wonderful time. I stayed for 6 nights and went with my husband. Being from New York City the graffiti didnt bother me that much. The graffiti was on other property anyway. Ther is construction all over San Juan but if you think about it there is alot of construction in Times Square too, so I didnt let it bother me. The water slide was extremely fun and I was one of the few adults who kept trying it! For those complaining of the cold pool there is a perfectly good hot tub spa area almost like a jacuzzi and is very relaxing. I used it myself when the sun went down. The beach was very enjoyable and the hotel provides you with the towels and beach chairs. I got a very good tan. The waves were pretty strong for children but they were good for me it was very fun! As for the learning part of my vacation... We went to the tour desk of the hotel and bought two tours. One to El Yunque rainforest and one to go snorkeling in Ikakos island. The rainforest tour guide "YOGI" was extremely informative (ask 4 him he looks a little nuts but is very smart and sweet!) I learned about the endangered puerto rican parrot (there were lots of fake nests all over the forest to try to help them reproduce no luck yet:( Also I learned about all kinds of plants and the different uses that the Taino indians gave to them. The ride up to the rainforest was nice too. You get to see all the locals going about there business and up the mountains you get to see bulls, horses, cows and plenty of roosters. Snorkeling was a blast! I saw a beautiful white fish on the shore (I was to chicken to go deep) My husband did though and he was very impressed with the variety of fish he saw. The best part of that was the whales that we saw on our way over there it was astonishing(also very rare to see). El Morro in Old San Juan was very enjoyable to me I learned alot about the history of my country. It's like a museum. The area surroundng the hotel is very busy but I like that. I went to some expensive restuarants like Ajili Mojili (a short walk east of the hotel) the food was o.k. Then I went to a very cheap restuarant called the Godfather and the food was excellent! The hotel was great so whether youre gonna be in the hotel all day or on and about all day I think the Marriott is a very good and safe choice. Even if the hotel is not of your liking I'm sure you'll find something interesting to do in Puerto Rico. Like the night club Babylon which is very popular if thats your thing. For the younger crowd there is Club Luxor. Also, for shopaholics like me there is Plaza Las Americas which was heaven. It's one of the largest malls in all the carribean. It was fantastic. I didnt give the hotel a perfect rating because I'm sure that it's not the best but it's pretty close. Whatever you do dont let anything get you down be open and enjoy. That's what youre going on vacation for right? P.S Be sure to try some typical fried foods of Puerto Rico like Alcapurrias or Relleno de Papa if u dont mind gaing a couple extra pounds!!! ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed on Feb 11 the night before our cruise. We had 4 rooms between us. Service was great. Rooms very nice I had an ocean view while others in my party had partial ocean view, both very nice. Tuscanywas wonderful. We had a private room off the of pool for my group of 13. Breakfast buffet is a must it was worth the 20.00 for the variety and freshness of the fruit breads and everything. Activities for children good. They have an activies board set up in the morning listing what's available throughout the day. I found they very Kid friendly Staff very kind and helpful Close to everything. I even won in the casino A MUST STAY!!!!!! *********************************

Reviews.Title: “Above average Marriot.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days after Christmas. Kids loved pool and beach. Crowded so get to beach and pool early to reserve seats. Breakfast was solid. Staff friendly and service above average. Request a high floor to avoid lobby noise. All in all a very good experience

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from Puerto Rico and stayed at the San Juan Marriot Resort. We took a red-eye flight from NY and arrived at the hotel around 2:30 am. Upon checking in we were disappointed to discover that the hotel did not have the room we had initially paid for through our travel agent (who is a close personal friend...so I know she booked it properly). We had paid for an ocean/pool view room with a king bed, and instead got a ocean/pool room with two full beds. Of course we were unhappy so upon speaking with the hotel management we were offered a city view room (which is NOT much to look at) with a King size bed or the option to stay where we were. Not much of a choice! I felt that the hotel was not overly accomodating and did not even offer any sort of compesation for the inconvience. I instead insisted we be compensated and so they eventually offered us a free breakfast on the hotel which was not much to write home about! After much deliberation we were guaranteed the correct room the next morning, but it wasnt without me being somewhat pushy to get what we were entitled to. However, after our room switch the next morning the rest of our stay was quite enjoyable. We were placed on the 15th floor and the view was INCREDIBLE. Every night I sat out on the balcony from our room and just enjoyed listening to the waves crash and the clean night breeze. As for the hotel staff, I overall felt that they were not completely accomodating, but were helpful when questions needed to be answered (be aware that they do sometimes give falsified information IE: bus times and schedules). While there we ate at a few local restaurants and ventured over to the Wyndham hotel to check our the casino there (which is quite a step up from the Marriot). We did eat at Tuscany (in the Marriot) which was good food and good service (lots of seafood). I will definitely return to Puerto Rico in years to come...whether I stay at the Marriot is another question. I wouldn't shy away from staying there (esp with the private beach and nice pool), but would just be aware of the things I mentioned. If you stay there have a great time! Hope this helps! PS...As a plus I will say that everything was VERY clean.....

Reviews.Title: “Not great 2/25/05”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the hotel today. The hotel Lobby is unbearable at night. The live bands they have are soo loud you cannot hear yourself think. There is not one place you can go to escape the pounding of the music. Not even small seating areas scattered about. The outside of the building where the beach is located is all under construction. There is graffiti on the adjacent buildings. The buildings that surround the Marriot are all under heavy construction. While on the beach you can watch the crane move heavy pieces of metal around. The staff is okay if you do not ask for anything too complicated. Most of the time they just smile and say yes no matter what you are asking. The staff is generally nice and are trying to please. The food prices are ok, and the food is just ok. There is not a lot for kids to do. At night there is actualy nothing for them to do. It's probably a two star property. If you look close at the details they are just ok. IE: Cracked marble pieces, shower stall with rusted hadnles to the shower, moldings by elevators that are broken, carpet with stains, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Overall A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: escapade4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for 2 nights pre-cruise. The room was nice (but not amazing) with a spectacular view of the beach. The hotel was a lot of fun. The casino was great, and the salsa in the hotel lobby was very entertaining. Overall the service was very good too. My one complaint is with the service in the restaurant. It was really terrible! We sat one day for nearly 10 minutes before someone greeted us. They should do something to improve service there. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: dreamcycle
Reviews.Content: Went in january. Hotel was nice. Outside to the left and rifght there not a lot, except some local stores, there is a Starbucks, Walgrens etc., a lot of graffitti all over the place. We liked Tijuannas Mexican restaurant to the left of the hotel down a block and there is a pizza place next to it that was good. The rain forest and the fort werent much as far as I was concerned and old juan didnt see anything good about that trip either, the cruise ships dock there and its run down, of age I guess, but again a lot of graffitti all over !

Reviews.Title: “Good place for kids”
Reviews.Author: GolfWidow
Reviews.Content: My husband and 9 year old daughter just got back from a trip to the San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino. It was a nice hotel but if we went back I think we would stay somewhere else. (The InterContinental San Juan Resort & Casino, or the Wyndham El San Juan Hotel & Casino â€“ they seemed like much nicer hotels for the same $$). The hotel was nice and clean and the staff was couteous and helpful. However the hotel is right in the middle of town, on a very busy street. It did not have a real resort feel to it. However, it was very nice to be able to walk a block to Pizza Hut and Walgreens. We stayed on the first floor overlooking the pool area which I liked a lot since we could get to and from the pool very quickly. I read a number of comments on here before we went about the cold pool and how much of the area was shaded by the hotel. This is true but the sun does shift and there is still plenty of places to sit in the sun the entire day â€“ you just sometimes had to move a little. I was a little disappointed that the chairs did not have cushions and there were no umbrellas for shade when lying out (being a very fair skinned girl I like to have an umbrella to use in the sun). Although the pool was cold it was refreshing and definitely something you could get used to. The best part of the pool was the slide â€“ my daughter LOVED it and spend hours going down it each day. I think because of the slide there were a LOT of children at this hotel. We liked that since daughter met a group of little girls to play with and had a blast running around with them each day. However, if it were just my husband and myself I think I would have thought the pool area to be a little loud and hectic and not very relaxing due to the noise of children playing and running around - but as a parent â€“ it was perfect! The beach was nice but every day there was a red flag up and we were unable to swim in the water. But one day we did go jet skiing at a place on the beach in front of the Wyndham El San Juan and we got to swing there â€“the water was beautiful and the jet skiing was a lot of fun and I would recommend it. In general the hotel was nice and for a family vacation it was perfect becaue there were some many other families there.

Reviews.Title: “loved the marriott”
Reviews.Author: MATYJO112880
Reviews.Content: my best friend and i stayed @ the marriott last summer and i have 2 say that the room was great. the service was wonderful, the beach was very nice, but the casino was OFF THE HOOK. lol. if you are going to relax, and don't want 2 do the party scene, then this is the place for you. but if you are looking for something more "wild", then you should stay else where. you should definetely eat outside of the hotel. step out of your shell and into the town. Cafe Angels is right down the block and the food is incredible. it's inexpensive and the staff is more than friendly.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, ocean view. Pleased with the rate. On site Restaurant a bit pricey but location great for walking to local restaurants. Close to San Juan by public bus. Good area for sight seeing. Beautiful pool. Nice beach, very strong undertoe even on a windless clear day. Overall, pretty happy with hotel and facilities. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No regrets, but will stay elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: mpierce06
Reviews.Content: We were married sisters on a short vacation, stayed 5 nights. Room was nice, clean, and interesting view (16th floor) of both ocean and city. Yes, there is a lot of construction - but it's everywhere, not just around the Marriott. We enjoyed the 15 minutes/25-cent bus ride to Old San Juan, and you can board just one block from the hotel. The hotel seemed more appropriate for business travelers, and is definitely not where you want to be for a "beach" vacation - I would go out of town (Luquillo beach was beautiful) for that. Since we wanted to sightsee, we found the location to be fine, but there were several boutique hotels in the same area, for 1/3 the price, and including breakfast. The beach is public and easily accessed from anwhere along Ashford Ave, and you can rent a beach chair for $2. We chose Marriott since this was our first time to Puerto Rico, but now I know I can get good value for much less cost. You are paying for lobby entertainment, access to casino, and on-site restaurants. We only ate at the hotel once, for breakfast. There are great restaurants within walking distance - our favorite was the Waikiki, about 5 blocks west.

Reviews.Title: “Off The Chain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year for 5 days. It was a great experience. The hotel is awesome. The location is great. And I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. If you are looking for a great vacation get away, you will love this oasis. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice but area less than desirable”
Reviews.Author: sunstarsun
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night since our flight was delayed. $295/night is excessive for this hotel. The lobby was pretty as was the pool area. The beach is wide enough to spread out however, if you like to walk along the beach, there are many eyesores to be seen. The strip of beach the hotel is on is really dumpy. Buildings are being razed, construction is going on and there are some areas I would not walk by alone. A little seedy to say the least. The hotel staff was very friendly. The room was nice but smelled of smoke. Food was good, beers are $5 each was ridiculous. There are restaurants along the main road which is nice. I would only recommend this hotel/area for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently chose San Juan as a 4-day vacation spot to escape the freezing temperatures on the East Coast. We wanted the warmest weather with the shortest travel time, so we chose San Juan and stayed at the Marriott. That said, we were not disappointed, but we were not thrilled either. Everything was nice, but nothing was exceptional. However, we were so glad to be in such beautiful weather, it makes it hard to complain. The pool was nice, but yes, much of it is in the shade. The beach was nice, and they have an attendant who will strategically place your lounge chair so that you are in the sun (if you want to be). We ate at the poolside restaurant for breakfast and lunch. The food was good, not outstanding. A bit pricey, but that's what we expect when we go to a resort. The service was at times pretty bad (slow, brought wrong food, forgot items, etc.), but that doesn't bother us a whole lot because we're not in a hurry to get anywhere--we're just relaxing. One concierge was very helpful in suggesting local restaurants within walking distance (another concierge "in training" was pretty clueless). We tried a seafood restaurant called Miro--it was very good--better than the hotel restaurants. We liked the casino and the band, but older people may find the band too loud. My husband likes to gamble, and he thought the casino was great. Also--our room was nice, but nothing exceptional. We've definitely stayed in nicer resorts, but we did enjoy our stay at the Marriott--we just weren't blown away. I think we got what we were expecting, based on previous reviews. When the weather is so glorious, it's hard not to enjoy yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott lived up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: Snowbirds2
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Marriott for our January trip. Thanks to the previous travelers for your tips like the 25 cent bus ride to Old San Juan. Some complained about the building shadows on parts of the beach, but it was nice to enjoy the beach surf without worrying about being burned to a crisp! We were on the 7th floor and could faintly hear the Salsa music in the lobby area so no big deal. Instead of the $90 for hotel bus trip to Yunque Rainforest for two, we got a rental car from OCharleys for one day for $28 and drove there ourselves. OCharleys is about 10 blocks toward Old San Juan on Ashford St near Chilis. I would not suggest driving to other tourist attractions in San Juan city as streets are poorly marked and traffic is horrendous. I would also suggest taking a small back pack for water bottles, rain gear, etc. Most wives do not like their purses to be used as a carry all! If you want something cheaper for a hotel but yet clean and safe- try the Holiday Inn Express nearby. They also offer a free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the San Juan Marriott”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Dec 17-19 for a precruise stay. We absolutely loved it! We paid $175 per night which included a full breakfast buffet for two each morning. The buffet was VERY good, but then again typical of Marriott breakfast buffets with the addition of excellent local tropical fruits. We had our breakfast each morning outside right next to the beach. . .had a wonderful view of the ocean. Our room was clean without any musty, moldy smell whatsoever. We were put in a cityview room (the hotel was completely booked so no upgrade) but on the eighteenth floor. When we stepped out onto our balcony we had a beautiful view of the ocean and beach! The balcony was fairly large with two lounge chairs and a table. It was glorious to have our coffee out on the balcony before heading down to the buffet. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful with tips on where to eat, where to buy bottled water etc. and how to get to Old San Juan inexpensively. We took the public transportation bus for 25 cents each. The bus stop was a half a block from the hotel and we were told that it ran every 30 minutes. We never waited more than 10 minutes. The bus took us down to a central bus terminal and then we hopped on a free trolley that took us around Old San Juan. We rode this a while to get our bearings. . .then got out and walked around. We walked on the Princessa (a beautiful pedestrian walkway that goes along the wall of the city). We also walked to El Morro (fort) which had beautiful views. The beach was very nice and clean. The ocean was very warm. . .I agree with a previous poster that it seemed to be warmer than the pool. My daughter (and husband) loved the water slide. They do have a beautiful hot tub which also had a waterfall flowing into it. . .of warm water. . .felt wonderful. They also had many poolside activities for kids and adults. Many people have commented on the noise in the lobby. I didn't find it excessive at all. It was great latin music which could only be heard in the lobby area itself. They also had a wonderful steel drum band by the pool. We had a great time recognizing traditional Christmas carols with a caribbean flair! In the Condado area, there were many restaurants and shops within walking distance, both local restaurants and chains such as Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Chilis, etc. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “just okay place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the casino on 12/31/04 and stayed till 1/5/05 the hotel and area were just okay. From another post I read I do agree about the pool being unheated and the sun was being blocked by the main hotel. The swim up bar had little to offer in atmosphere. If you sat in the pool at the bar you were staring at a blank wall that seperated you from the much higher people sitting on the other outside of the pool bar. The beach is only about 4 blocks long before you come to rocks at each end to block any further walking and the beach area is full of empty buildings either being torn down or should be (with grafitti and broken windows included). During our stay no problem with lounge chairs though. There are a few nice stores and restraunts but not as much as we thought would be. This is a good spot if you basically plop on a beach or pool, not a big partier and only want a couple of tables for gambling. There is no water activities to be seen. The pool area closes at 6pm and the disco had no live music on sun. or mon. nites. No tv's in lobby lounge and the ones located in the casino bar were working but you couldn't sit at that bar sometimes after 12am but it was still open as a service bar (tells me they want your gambling $$ only) We checked out the Wyndham Condado and was much more impressed with the pool and casino there which the security guard informed us was open 24 -7 (sorry not the pool BAR though). If you really want a party spot with clubs, 2 lobby bars, and well known restraunts with great pool area check out the San Juan hotel and casino in Isla Verde it's only about 15 minutes by cab from Cando but definatley appeared to be a better area from what we could tell about the night we visted. Another spot from Condado by a 45-60 minute cab ride (car much cheaper) is the Wyndham El Conquistador it is closer to the rain forrest , has it's own island for the guests and is a beautiful resort also Much closer to bio bay area. Again if all you want is to see old san juan and not do much else the Mariott is just okay and especially just for one or two nights after a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: newenglander
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! The views from your balcony are just spectacular. At night, you can see the lights from the cruise ships sailing along the ocean. The hotel has different bands play at night by the pool. You can sit on your balcony and listen as well as dance. The pool area is great. They have a water slide which was perfect for the kids. They also offer kids activities on the upper deck at different times during the day. Eva ran them all and my kids absolutly loved it. The beach was nice. The undertoe in the ocean is extremly strong, so not good for younger children. The sun is also strong, so you burn very easily out there. The noise from the lobby cannot be heard from your rooms at all. The hotel rooms are average, but again the view cannot be passed up. Turn down service was very slow, and maidservice was so-so. On one of the days we took a trip to Old San Juan. There is a bus stop one block from the hotel. It's only 25c. The bus does only come about every 50 min or so, though. We had dinner at Tiujana's twice. That restaurant is the best! The prices are also very reasonable. Great mexican food; burritos, tacos, enchaladas, margaritas. The waters and waitresses are extremly friendly and nice and all speak wonderful english. For lunch, we chose not to eat at the poolside cafe. Way too expenisve for a dumb burger. There are a Burger King, Wendy's, Subway, etc two blocks from the hotel. For breakfast we ate at Dunkin Donuts a couple blocks away from the hotel. We also went to a local market and bought some food which we kept in our room, while buying water at the Walgreens. We ate at Senor Frogs in Old San Juan one night because they were advertising everywhere, tourists had t-shirts on from there, and locals told us how great it was. We hated it. It was very much a local hangout. They had beer drinking competions and the food was simply burgers and frys. They also give you balloon hats to wear. The streets are not bad at all, and we did not experience any beggers along the streets anywhere, nor did we witness any animal cruelty. All locals are pretty nice, and most speek enough English to understand. I personally think San Juan is a gorgeous place to vacation and would definitly will come back to the San Juan Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel for only one night (December 3, 2004) prior to a cruise, but we hope to go back again. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially when my sister-in-law reported her purse missing (it was recovered intact from the taxi where she had left it). Though we had booked city view, we were upgraded to ocean/pool view in a very secure wing. The rooms were clean, attractive, and comfortable (very good beds). With the high cost of accommodations in San Juan, the $175.00 per night we paid, which included a full buffet breakfast, was a good value. I booked directly with Marriott. We could have gotten a lower nonrefundable rate of $144.00 without breakfast, but decided against it. There is a friendly bar in the center of the lobby and a coffee shop (though there's also a Starbucks right across the street). The restaurant on the premises, Tuscany, is superb! We felt that the dinner we had was reasonably priced for food of such high quality. In fact, the pasta with lobster dish two of us chose was better than anything we had on our cruise--though the cruise line is well known for its cuisine. The casino is small and we didn't spend much time in it--we don't like smoky places. The grounds, pool, and beach are nice, and the Condado location is safe and convenient. The day we arrived, they had a special pre-Christmas festival, which the hotel participated in with a local church. It was a nice way to meet the locals. On the day of our cruise, the bell captain secured our luggage for us after checkout so that we could do some sightseeing before embarkation. I can see why the Marriott Resort is rated so highly, and concur with most of the other reviews I've read!

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter1973
Reviews.Content: We'll definitely return to the Mariott, not for a luxurious vacation, but as a great place to crash for a long weekend. The hotel was booked solid the week between Christmas and New Year's Eve. It was rare for a seat to open up at the casino tables and the beach was so crowded that the lounge chairs were, at times, no farther than two feet apart from each other. The fitness center (smallish, with about 9 operating cardio machines) was also very busy and the lines at the breakfast buffet were slow. Also, there's a lot of construction going on in the Condado area. The adjacent lot of the Mariott beachfront had an operating crane, which compromises the view. That said, the service was friendly (leaving fresh fruit and wine at turndown service), the food at the Tuscany was excellent and reasonably priced. I look forward to returning when it's less crowded. These relatively minor quips didn't keep me from having a great week. One more point: An earlier review suggested that there aren't shops and restaurants in walking distance. This is not true at all.

Reviews.Title: “Are we all talking about the same place?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the last reviews I felt like we weren't even talking about the same hotel. We spent 3 wonderful days here in early Dec. The service was great. Everyone was friendly. Our room was very nice. On the 20th floor with a beautiful view. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The food was good. Not gormet but I didn't go expecting that. We had no problems with finding pool chairs even after 8:00am and we found the beach to be nicer than expected. As far as the "Disco" in the lobby, yes there are Latin bands that play. We found them to be very good. A fact proved by the "Locals" that came to hear them play. Last time I checked "Locals" were allowed to frequent the same places that guests in their country do. Its also very unusual to hear live bands play without paying a cover charge. The two drink minimum, which in our case was not enforced, was merely to compensate for no cover charge. Since the drinks were not priced any more expensive than a drink in any bar, pub, or restaurant in the states, we thought that was very fair. There are many other restaurants and bars within walking distance if you wanted to go some where else. That makes Condado a great area to stay in. In fact we had friends staying at the Ritz Carlton who paid double what we paid and did not like their room very much. Just goes to show different strokes for different folks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lgbga
Reviews.Content: We spent two wonderful nights at the San Juan Marriott Resort in Condado. The service was excellent and the food very good. We would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Lobby Disco”
Reviews.Author: EasilyAmused
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Marriott over Thanksgiving, before finallly giving up and moving over to the Ritz. The overall experience wasn't awful but it definitely wasn't what we were looking for. Granted the hotel was at capacity over the holiday weekend, but despite the signs all over the pool area stating that lounge chairs could not be reserved, if you didn't get to the pool by 8AM there was nothing left but shady spots (which is more than half the pool area.) The children's pool is fantastic, but larger than the adult pool which wasn't all that inviting, what with a tattered volley ball net strung across the width of the pool. Service was friendly and efficient; better than we had expected. But I found it really annoying that at 4PM daily, small signs were placed on every table in the lobby announcing a two drink minimum per person. Every evening the lobby became a bustling discotheque. The noise was deafening. There really wasn't anywhere to go and have a drink at night other than the "lobby disco", an obvious cash cow for the hotel which attracts many more locals than hotel guests. The disco seemed to go until about 4 in the morning. Food was average. Nothing to write home about, but not terribly expensive. We mainly ate breakfast there and the service was very good. Poolside lunch was subpar; mainly airport quality sandwiches and burgers. The beach was littered with cigarette butts and fast food debris and not all that inviting. Rooms were a bit tired and generally bland. Beggars can't be choosers over a holiday weekend so we made the best of it until we could move over to the Ritz Carlton. If you're looking to party all night, this might be the place for you. But for a relaxing weekend get away it's not so hot.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriot”
Reviews.Author: Ron41
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Marriot. We loved the Hotel. It was in a great location as there were many stores and restaurants in walking distance. The beach was very nice and the service excellent. We had no complaints and we can't wait to go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Marriott”
Reviews.Author: DonnaE
Reviews.Content: Not great by Marriott's standards but probably the best in the Condado area. Hotel is old but rooms have been upgraded. Pool area is fantastic! Lively reception and casino. Nice Hertz desk on site and friendly staff. Once you see the hallways and rooms you'll wonder why you paid so much, but take a look around at the other Condado properties that are still in business and you'll realize you made the best choice. San Juan is not a premier destination and the Condado area seems to be declining. The new up and coming area is Isla Verde (Ritz, Interncontinental etc) by the airport. If you are determined to stay in Condado, this is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy? I call it lively ...”
Reviews.Author: groovedigger
Reviews.Content: Great experience if you want to be in the Condado area. You have to take a taxi to Old San Juan, but for the Condado zone it is very central, right on the beach. Exactly what you would expect from Marriott, friendly staff (they even upgraded me to a corner suite at no extra charge!), clean facilities, well-appointed rooms. Yes, the lobby is a big party scene every night with loud salsa music and crowds of revellers, but San Juan is a party place, folks! People do not go to bed at 10pm there ... remember you're not in Kansas anymore! If you're looking for a quiet isolated retreat or are simply too uptight about loud music, go to another part of the island. The casino is definitely nothing out of Las Vegas, but it has a decent selection of slot machines and blackjack tables, and usually a couple of roulette wheels operating. It is open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Puerto rico and had booked this hotel after reading all the good reviews, but were very very dissapointed. We got there and first of all the lobby was SO SMOKY AND LOUD, not child friendly at all. The people at the front desk were very rude. We checked in the room and the tub wasnt draining and the room totally aggravated my husband's allergy. They moved us to another room without offering any upgrades and asked us to pay when we asked for one, VERY RUDE! We were looking for an upscale place with friendly people around but this place certainly was a big dissapointed. We packed out bags and left for the Wyndham in Condado and it was beautiful. We always stay at Wyndham and its the best, i dont know we decided to try this place, NEVER AGAIN. If you are a family stay at the Wyndham in Condado, its beautiful with three pools, 2 jaccuzzi's and hammocks. If your are single or without kids, stay at El Wyndham in San Juan. (we went there for our honeymoon) It has the best club in Sanjuanb and is wonderful. NEVER STAY AT THIS MARRIOT!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel nice staff,clean, great location, fun parties in hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i went to the marriott hotel in san juan october 29 -november 2 2004. All the staff is really helpful and take time out to help you,I had lost my camera and was very upset crying in the lobby and a staff member came up to me and asked me if i needed help and i told him what happened and all the places i was that night ,the staff member took out his cell phone and called 411 to get me all the numbers for me so i could call up.The pool area was very nice clean as well as the beach.The location of the hotel is perfect it in right in center of town .The food at the hotel was expensive so ii suggest going up the block there many places you can eat. I had nothing negative to say about this hotel and i suggest to go there

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!! Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: 2Koi4u
Reviews.Content: We'd stayed one night here after a 7 day cruise. The staff was friendly and helpful. Check in time was 4pm and they let us check in at 11:00 am. They also accomodated our late check out request of 1:30 pm with no problem. The bed was so comfortable it felt like a cloud, and the breakfast buffet was excellent. The pool areas were clean, and the casino was very upscale, though getting a drink was not easy. But after flagging down a waitress they responded quick. My only complaint was the band in the lobby. Loud does not begin to describe it! You could not talk to anyone in the lobby bar, and it was distracting at the blackjack tables near the casino door. Honestly, there were lots of people dancing, but they must have had cotton in their ears or were deaf already....But I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel and I must say some of the reviews that I had read were way off. This hotel is right in the middle of everything. There were several restaurants within walking distance. The room we stayed in was oceanfront on the 18th floor with a great view. One complaint I read was that the lobby was loud. Yes there was music being played every night but you could not hear it from any other place in the hotel. The casino was clean and hardly packed even on the weekends. Cabs were always available if needed but we decided to take the bus to Old San Juan which only cost 25 cents(cab was 15 dollars). I must say the staff was excellent. We also had a great experience with one of the guest services rep(adriana). She was extremely helpful and knowledgeable and gave great ideas for things to do since this was the first time we were in Puerto Rico. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Beach and City Interests”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three nights at the Marriott Resort in the Condado section of San Juan. We were specifically looking for direct beach access and good proximity to old San Juan for dining and shopping We got all of this plus good places to eat in Condado (within walking distance of the hotel). The staff from the doormen, concerige to the maids were friendly and helpful. Our view could not be better and we slept with the baclony door open so we could hear the waves at night. There is a nightly salsa band in the lobby of the hotel and on the weekends there is lots of dancing. If this not your scene, request a room higher up or overlooking the pool/beach in a seperate wing so you will not be disturbed. Our room was clean, and other than a little "tired" wear on the paint on the balcony and in the bathroom, it was in acceptable condition. This is a beachfront property and in my experience there is always something about the rooms of hotels like this that no matter what, it will always have a slightly "beachy" wear to it (which is really no big deal.). Oh and did I mention the bed yet? It was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in (this includes the Westin chain's "heavenly bed" experience). It is true that some of the Condado strip is undergoing redevelopment from previous hurricane damage. There are two hotels on this particular strip of beach which are essentially being gutted but don't let this ruin your stay Other than the construction eye soar it should not disturb your stay. We were originally going to stay at the Ritz and they were full that weekend. And boy were we glad. The Ritz, while on Isle Verde and the water, also overlooks the main runway for the airport. While I am sure it is posh, I can't imagine being so close to the airport, particularly the main runway for take-off/landing (I spotted the Ritz and its signage from the window seat of my flight getting ready to take-off). Old San Juan is a $12 cab ride (flat fee to most places) and the airport is $15 one-way by taxi. If you want both beach and city activities the Marriott is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was sent to PR on business October 12-18, 2004, and took my husband along so that we could have a couple extra days of mini-vacation. Initially, I booked the Hampton Inn in Isla Verde, but my boss advised me to stay in Condado, as he thought the location would be more convenient -- not only for business (in Hato Rey), but for sightseeing, as well. I am SO glad I followed his advice! The Condado area is very safe and there are police and private security patrols everywhere you look. This gorgeous Marriott is right on the sand, centrally located in Condado, and a short taxi ride to Old San Juan (fare $12 one way). The hotel is beautiful, the staff is of the highest professional calibre (plus being very warm and friendly), and our stay couldn't have been better. Room Service was really quick (10-15 minutes!) with both morning coffee and midnight sandwiches. When you dial zero on the room phone (there are two), they answer the phone saying "Good morning, Mrs.___, how may I be of service?" (when was the last time you heard that in a hotel?) Housekeeping was efficient and the room was spotless. The climate was humid, but the effect of the air conditioning was somewhat stymied by our insistence on keeping the sliding door to the balcony open at all times --- we couldn't resist the view of the pools/ocean from our 4th-floor "Cabana" room. My only negative comments would be that the live music (each night) was a little too loud in the downstairs area -- it was great music, but the noise-level made conversation in the whole foyer/bar/desk area close to impossible. Oh yes, and the Casino was adequate, but nowhere near Las Vegas standards. My husband went snorkeling off Fajardo one day on a 62-foot catamaran. The hotel tour desk booked the trip ($65 all inclusive) -- and he had a terrific time! Another day, we taxied out to the Bacardi Distillery ($25 one way) and took the tour, which includes two free drinks (try the Mojito). Both the Bacardi gift shop and the airport duty-free shop sell Bacardi rum at extremely reasonable prices and pack it securely to travel. If you stay at this Marriott, you will love it. Try "Tijuana's" Bar and Grill, also... it's down the street about a block and serves excellent Mexican food (I'm from LA and I know Mexican food! LOL). Puerto Rico es la Isla del encanto and I can hardly wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “If I had to describe the Marriot in 1 word, 'Awesome'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After deciding that I was going to go to Puerto Rico on a short notice vacation, I had asked a few people where to stay. My best friend who is Puerto Rican recommended the Marriot. He had been there about 2 months before us. We had also had gotten some feedback from others that stayed at other Hotels. My friend has very good taste so I took his word for this Hotel. After reading some reviews on trip advisor I started to wonder about his taste in Hotels, there were so many negative reviews that I began to wonder. We decided to go anyway and to our suprise the Hotel was everything he said it was. The rooms were clean and smelled like a hotel in the tropics should smell, like ocean air. And just like any other fancy hotel in the world if you use the room "wet-bar" you will be over charged, this is why they are there. Granted the Hotels restaurants were not cheap(priced accordingly) but if we had wanted to eat cheap food we could have gone to any of the many "fast-food" restaurants within walking distance. Which brings me to the next negative thing I had read, car rentals and parking. Renting a car was a great investment. If you were 4 people and had wanted to go on a "guided" tour it was easily $55-$95 per person. We had rented a brand new Toyota Corolla for $60 a day and can stay as long as we want any where we went. It is very hard to park in most towns but with patience we found great spots everywhere we went, and we went all over the Island. Now for the parking lot in the hotel. They charged us $12 for parking and you can go in and out within 24hours as much as you wanted to. To some this may sound like too much for guests in the hotel but after doing the math it is still cheaper. The best part was the absolutely perfect ocean water. After all the places me and my family had been too (which adds up to alot of places) we thought the ocean in Puerto Rico was possibly the best. I highly recommend one of the many Catamaran cruises with snorkeling and swimming, talk about being on a deserted desert Island in paradise (why did we come home???). ANd we were there during huricane season (it rained for about 1 hour the day we arrived, we had stayed 6 nights) all the other days were perfect 86-88 degrees and sunny. The food was also awesome, from traditional Puerto Rican food on the side of the road to one of the many gourmet restaurants in Old San Juan. Not to mention the service was exceptional. All in all we had a wonderful time and will definately be back to the Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The San Juan Marriott was an excellent vacation spot. I researched numerous hotels in the San Juan area before making my decision and I made the precise choice. The hotel its self was visually appealing. The room was clean, accommodating, and decorated. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean and fully functional. The staff was extremely helpful; from the bellhop to the concierge. I requested room service on occasion and was impressed with the speed. In the main lobby is a bar with a great bartender. I enjoyed the hotel restaurant as well. I bit pricy but the food was good. The casino was lively and a happening place to be. The pool area was nice and the beach was beautiful. Hotel security was at the entrance from the beach to keep non guests from entering the hotel. There is a Starbucks Coffee directly in front of the hotel and a Walgreens a short walk away. Ajili Mojili is a restaurant a couple of blocks away and with the Puerto Rican flavor. I have nothing derogatory to say about my stay at the Marriott. I feel confident to recommend this one to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stately Hotel with Terrific Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Stellaris for three nights prior to taking a cruise. The hotel has an understated elegance and contains some of the charm from San Juan of years ago. They have also done a fine job with updating the property. Very nice pool, nice stretch of beach, grounds were emaculate and overall it was a wonderful property. But the property itself is matched by the terrific staff. From the front desk staff to the concierge to the pool staff to the casino and everyone else, the service was top-notch. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a six night stay at this hotel. It was wonderfull! I travel A LOT for business and have stayed and many a good hotel. I rate Marriot at Condado beach as one of the best for the service they provide to their guests. Only on a cruise ship have I met such an attentive staff. They went out of their way to please you. The receptionist, the operator, concierge, valet parking, restaurants. Incredible. We can not wait to return. We came back home happy and relaxed feeling like we've been away for weeks thanks to the fact that at this hotel they let me feel totally at ease and without having to worry about anyting. A MUST DO. We will be back for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Good resort, just don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Tomtopes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott post cruise over the July 4th weekend and it was our second stay there. We loved the beach and its proximity to the airport and the service was good. We arrived at 9am and was given a corner suite even though the hotel was full. The rooms are just ok, (the air conditioner was pitiful, but made up for its lack of power with tremendous noise) but realistically, for a beach resort in San Juan, it is on the quality side. The biggest draw for us to the Marriott is the beach, being in the middle of Condado beach area is impressive. Just don't expect over the top service or immaculate rooms. The resort is just too big and always too full of guests for the staff to give personal or attentive service. The lobby is always hopping with locals enjoying their music and dances. During the July 4th weekend, a band was performing non stop salsa while locals were clearly enjoying themselves on the dancefloor. This is not a quiet and intimate hotel as the music level was so loud that we had to shout to speak with the front desk. Service at the coffee bar in the lobby was so slow that it was quicker to go across the street (careful not to be run over by maniac drivers on Ashford) to Starbucks. The pool area is a little crowded as they fit many sun loungers into a small space, but the beach is wide open. All around the hotel by the beachfront, the once derelict hotels to the West are being refurnished and the construction noise can be a distraction, but overall, the Marriott is a quality property in that stretch of Condado.

Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: kyamin
Reviews.Content: we stayed two nights at the Marriott,it was not good. When we arrived on Sunday night the lobby was outragiously loud and mobbed. Many people were waiting for thier rooms, and complaining. Our room was ready and we checked in quickly. The room was in need of an overhaul. the bathroom had drops of water falling from where i couldn't tell. The pool was smaller than pictured and crowded. Half of the pool is a baby pool and the other half was taken up with a volley ball game. Not inviting. the beach is ok but not enough shade. I would not recommend. /we moved on to the Ritz Carlton and it was terrific, and cheaper rates. The food is better and more reasonable at the marriott.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed from 6/19-6/28 room was humid and never cool enough for my taste. staff was very fast and nice about finding us another room but both rooms they suggested were either just as hot or with a crummier view. hotel food was expensive and there are plenty of restaurants close by that are good and cheaper. Dannys, a block to your left as you leave the hotel has a great breakfast, Buno Ayres restaurant was not worth the money. Tony Romas Ribs is a good walk but good. Walgreens, a block to your right as you exit has everything. Hotel pool was small, the beach was good, very windy at times. Loquillo Beach was like a salt water pool. El Yunque was great, take the La Mina trail. Old San Juan had all the shopping, not much near the hotel. Hotel was convenient to many things though. Lobby was almost always entertaining, with bands and dancing but there were signs that you could not sit at the tables after 4pm unless you had a 2 drink minimum (at $7 each)

Reviews.Title: “Worst then terrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to be treated bad, VERY BAD!! Then you may like it here. I have to say. I was one of 38 people that flew over from the stated fo a wedding. Several people stayed at at the Marriotts in Isle Verde and Condodo, I am telling you about the Condodo location, I stayed in Puerto Rico for 10 days and the Marriott ruined one night of that for myself and others, I had a bad experience in the casino with manager on April 27, 2004. This is a ruff version. You see when 5 of us walked up to the lobby bar to order drinks, they sent us to the casino to get service, So we did, We then waited at that casino bar to get service. Guess What ??No service. The manager told us if we wanted to get service then we would have to play slots.OK!! So we did. 45min. passed NO Service, I asked the manager why we couldn't get some drinks. You'll love this. The manager told me that we were play the wrong slot to get service, Then he walked away. I went to the front desk to put a complaint in with the manager of the hotel, but he never showed. I told the girl at the front desk I will be writting Tripadvisor with a poor score for this hotel. So 3 of us left the hotel to go back to ours (THE WINDCHIMES GREAT!!!!) The 2 that were left behind were still playing in the casino$$$ and when they went back to there room they were met by security and they were told because I!!!! was reporting them to Tripadvisor they would have to leave. They then called the bride and groom woke them up to see if they could stay with them I guess everything work it's self out by 3:00am. But I cant tell you how unprofessional, the Marriott's staff was and is. Then Puerto Ricans DEPEND!!!on the $$$$$ from the people who come to there Island, and I can tell 38 people bring in a whole lot of money for them. So I guess the I can tell you I WILL NEVER! EVER! stay at a Marriott !! Even though I did not stay here, I should have been treated as a in house guest would have, with respect and kindness and no less. So if you stay here and have a bad experience , I told you so!!

Reviews.Title: “A family hotel not for a romantic retreat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife from Apr 30 - May 3rd. Hotel is in a great location in front of the beach and close to several nice restaurants unlike hotels in the Isla Verde or further down the road in the Condado area like the Hilton for example. The main pool is amost always unavailable due to family activities. The smaller pool (2 feet deep) is croweded with kids. The pool bar is closed. The beach in the Condado area is very windy. Serivce is good. Hotel is full of life in the evening with live music and Casino. All in all, the hotel is above average. If you're travelling with kids, then this is the hotel for ya. However, for couples, find a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best beach in condado”
Reviews.Author: xindy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 1 week April 22nd-29th. Very Nice hotel. It grew on us. The beach was better than the one at Wydm. Condado Plaza. Yes, the waves are rough, but if you rent a car and head west to Luquillo Beach...you'll have a great time. Just get there early ;-). This hotel has a great centralized location. Old San Juan is close by and has great nuevo latino restaurants, make sure you check them out! El Yunque Rainforest is the place for a hike to a gorgeous natural waterfall. Take the trail called Las Minas....you 'll never forget it. Enjoy Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in San Juan, one of two with beach access. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Pool is great, beach is clean and secured. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “A great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned last night after spending six nights at this hotel. The staff was polite, attentive and responsive tom our needs. The location is minutes from Old San Juan and a 20 minute drive to the airport. It is in walking distance of a Walgreen's (for all your basic needs), several local eateries and also basic local shops. My family enjoyed the facilities completely, the tennis courts, pool and the beach. It is a public beach, not maintained by the hotel. All beaches on the island are public beaches. The lobby throbs (rocks) with excitement each evening. The poolside area is also filled with music on the week-ends. The restaurants are overated but worth a try........there are alot of other choices so don't limit yourself to the hotel menus. Try Da Luigi in Santurce. Visit the Art Museum and take a trip to the rain forest. Anyone who looks for things to criticize will be able to do so. The hotel is clean and has a full menu of activities for the kids. We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best vacations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the San Juan Marriot. Have traveled many places. This hotel, staff, food, is one to write home about. We intend to return in Oct or Nov. for a longer stay. Can't or will not believe the negative reviews. This hotel is the best in the area. Forget the Old San Juan area hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoxieFan
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in mid-March 2004. We were on the 19th floor with a half-ocean, half-city view. The room was always clean, but was small, with a comfortable bed and furnishings. Yes, the lobby rocks on weekend nights, and we stopped briefly to watch the dancing, though no one can talk above the music. However, we could not hear the lobby or casino sounds on our floor or in our room. Food in the Vista restaurant was very good; we did not try Anthony's. The lobby coffee shop makes excellent sandwiches and has great pasteries--at a fair price. There are many excellent restaurants within a block or two, a Walgreen's yards away for necessities, and a bus stop outside the hotel for the 15-minute (25 cents) ride to the old city. Every staff person we encountered was gracious, many asking whether there was anything we needed. The pool area was busy, but we always found lounge chairs somewhere. The large fountain pool, one of two pools, helps mask the people sounds, making poolside snoozes easy. Forget the hotel promo that you can swim laps in the pool; you can't. We stayed during very windy weather, so beach swimming was impossible. My only complaint is the amount of litter on the beach during the day; I blame careless guests. The beach is cleaned nightly. As other reviewers note, the Condado area has several derelict hotels, the lasting result of a devastating hurricane a few years ago. But elegant shops and a wide variety of restaurants on tree-lined Condado streets make up for a few blighted and under-construction areas. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: lildee17
Reviews.Content: My friends and I spent a week at the Marriott in San Juan and we loved it!! We enjoyed the beach and the hotel itself and had tons of fun! It was near everthing and the best part was it was between Old San Juan and Isla Verde (which are two great places to visit). I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott San Juan Resort & Stellaris Casino
HotelInfo.Address: 1309 Ashford Ave, San Juan 00907, Puerto Rico
